reviews.review: An extraordinary building. A very rich cathedral that underwent a lot of repairs after the bombarding in the second world war and the restoration work is extraordinary.
grandeur. I like this place too much, It is very beautiful, luxury, You can pray here and you can enjoy the city from the tower-2 in 1

Charming Jewelbox Basilica. Built in the late 1800's, St Stephen's is an intermediate-sized cathedral loaded with charm and beautiful finishings that do create a wonderful sense of spirituality. A donation of one euro pp is requested for entrance, and a visit is certainly worth that price.
Stunning building with fantastic views of the City. This was a fantastic place to visit. Extremely pretty and with amazing views of the city. A must whilst in Budapest.
Seeing is beleiving. What a place free to see inside only charge for the tower but have an advisory donation for church so please give before you go in the place is emense

Magnificent huge basilica. This is a very interesting basilica located in the Pest city area very near to the Opera House. it's very huge with a seating capacity of around 8000 persons. Inside the basilica, by the chapel one can find the mummified fore arm of St Stephen who was the first king of Hungary. It's very rich in architecture, marble and stained glass. This basilica can be seen from many areas of Budapest due its very tall cupola. To enter the basilica one has to make a donation of HUF 200. If one is not afraid of going up some 300 steps to the very top, you can admire the surroundings and take marvelous pictures from the top. I recommend a visit of this basilica.

Great views from the top. Entry to the cathedral is by modest donation but you can go up to an outside gallery at the base of the the dome for another couple of pounds - either walk up the winding stairs or use the lifts which take you virtually to the top.While not quite in the class of some Italian basilicas, views over the city and beyond to the Buda hills are wonderful - made better by low-rise planning policies which mean St Stephen's is one of the tallest buildings. Also no long queues when we were there in late September, so worth a visit.

Free without donation!. Absolutely beautiful. Worth a quiet, reflective walk through and perhaps attending a service, if you're religious. The architecture and design is unlike anything you've seen- so Eastern and so sumptious
Beautiful. No cost to enter. Just a donation. Not sure if there is a price to go to the top. Beautiful church. Very busy with multi-cultured tour groups.

Contains relic of St Stephen. This is a huge church, befitting a Basilica. It's visible from all over Budapest. It's lit up at night & it's awesome. Be prepared for lots of people. The mummified fore arm of St Stephen is in a separate chapel. It's not really easy to see it inside the ornate reliquary, but I managed to get close enough that I was successful.

Amazing and beautiful church. Very opulent and rich. Beautiful. If in Budapest this is a must see. Our only complaint was that there were visitors who did not treat their visit with the respect that a church should have.

Beautiful church with great panorama. It's one of two main churches in Budapest, really worth seeing inside. But the main attraction is the panorama view from the dome. We spent there about half an hour, recognizing the surrounding area details. There are also interesting buildings you wouldn't be able to notice from the ground level!

impressive basilica you shouldn't miss. apparently it seats 9,000 people. That gives you can idea re. the size. If you're ambitious you can climb to the top (well over 300 steps) and you have to pay. The entrance to the basilica is not free; a donation of 200 florint pp is expected and a priest is sitting right by the entrance to watch what you're doing. Wonderful paintings, stained glass, marble and you name it abound. It's a neo-Romanesque structure that dates back to 1868. Quite a few steps to get up to the entrance. Impressive doors. Guided tours are available. Watch for announcements re. evening organ recitals.
stunning building. an absolutely stunning cathedral that shows Hungarian architecture is unrivaled. I could have spent a full day here.

Organ concert and mini cruise with dinner on the Danube. We booked 2 seats for the evening organ concert and the dinner cruise in June. Awesome! The musicians were outstanding and the whole organisation including transfer to the boat was faultless. Very good value for a relaxing evening.

worth the climb for the views.. the outside is impressive the inside even more so but long queues to see the mummified hand.The best part was the walk up the 300 odd stair to the viewing platform which gave great views across the city.
Climb the Basilica . Excellent views from the top of the Basilica. Highly recommend climbing to the top for the view. Visit the church if you have time.

Impressive and in a beautiful setting. A beautiful place to visit, both the outside and inside. The interior is stunning. I understand you can also climb to the top but there was a service on so I was not able to to that. Still wonderful to see though, but try to time it when there isn't a service! It is also in a large square which allows you to get views of the Basilica from many angles.
Our last day in Central Europe. Unbelievably beautiful! One has to tour this in person to experience it's beauty. I cannot put into words how majestic St Stephens is.
Gorgeous churxh. We came here our first stop in Budapest. It is a gorgeous church and definitely a place to quickly stop and see
A fine building. A fine building that has been well-kept and cared for. Some lovely interior decoration. We did not venture up to the top, as I have not a good head for heights.

Wonderful interiors, scenic views from the top. Just another wonderful church in Budapest! On the outside it looks good, but, as is the case with churches, the interiors are stunning. It is also free to get in. As a bonus, for only 500 Ft, you can take the stairs (and it's a loooong way) or the elevator to the top and admire some scenic views of the city.
Must go to the top. A wonderful church in Budapest. Added bonus, you can go to the top of the dome and see all of Budapest.
Grand structure. This is definitely a testimonial to the faith of the Hungarian people.The structure is impressive and the interiors fantastic, definitely a must if you visit the city.

Very nice church. The Basilica is so central to the city and it's history that you kind of have to visit it. Bit many steps to get to the top, but would still recommend it compared to the elevator - when you hav walked up the view seems more gratifying, like you have earned it. And since "no" building is allowed to be higher, you get a great view.

Go to an Organ Concert. Amazing building with impressive acoustics. Highly recommend the organ concert. You can also climb up to the top of the church to get some great views of the city. Church entrance was free (though they have a donation box) and you had to pay for the elevator to the top.

Richly decorated church in beautiful square--famous relict not my taste. St. Stephen's Basilica is an impressive sight, set beautifully in a cobblestone square with several cafes and restaurants and ice cream carts. Admittance is free, even though a small fee is strongly recommended. However, it will cost you 500 florints to go up to the tower. The inside is richly decorated with gold and red marble. The biggest attraction however may be the famous relic stored here, the mummified hand of allegedly St. Stephen himself. Signs all over the basilica point to a side chapel on the left side, and a gold, glass paneled box where the hand rests. For a few florints, the visitor can illuminate the shrine and better see the relic. A panel explains the long history of the possession of the relic and how it finally came to the basilica. We weren't about to put money in, but right in front of us a class of small schoolchildren on a field trip lit up the shrine and we couldn't help to look. Naturally, we were respectful but for us, it was very difficult to understand the attraction of the shriveled hand. I wouldn't go just to see the hand, but the church is beautiful.
St. Stephen's Basilica. Very nice place. After visiting the church, you can enjoy with an outside area too. The city view is great from Basilica' roof
Gorgeous cathedral. Beautiful and peaceful, the amount of light inside was surprising. This is free, but most of the visitors paid the donation fee (fair) to get inside.
Lots of steep stairs but certainly worth it. The view from the top o9f the dome is fantastic, breathtaking. It is worth climbing the flights of steep steps.

Gorgeous architecture . The building is gorgeous. Went at around 6pm shortly before closing time and it was really hard to see what's going on inside. Would've liked to see some of those paintings and decorum but ended up consulting the pictures in my guide book instead! The surrounding area has some of the most amazing and reasonably priced restaurants so be sure to stop by!

Very impressive Cathedral. This very impressive building, has a gorgeous stained glass dome, and stunning stained glass windows. You can feel the atmosphere, very spiritual, no matter what your beliefs. There is a mini cathedral structure down the left hand side of the main building which lights up to reveal the hand of St Stephen upon a small payment! A bit macabre!

Stunning church. Beautiful inside and out, this very large church was amazing, but there was a wedding taking place and we had to first pay to enter. We were barred from walking down the central nave, which was a real bummer. So, our one complaint is that if we are not allowed access to the main area, signage should be put up warning visitors which don't want to pay if they can't see the best part. The church itself is of course blameless, but the management should be more fair.
St Stephen's Basilica. Beautiful church. Lots and lots of stairs to get to the top.. But once you get there, the view is defiantly worth it!
Magnificent church. An absolute must see. Impressive, richly decorated, but still a place of serenity. Even though there are many tourists.
Masterpiece!. Fascinating inside and outside. So much history and amazing architecture, beautiful ornaments, and simply gorgeous. You have the square outside and all the cozy cafes and restaurants.

Do not miss the Basilica!. I first visited the Basilica 7 years ago when moving to Budapest, then 5 years ago, when I also went to the panorama tower... each time friends or family come over, I make sure they do not miss this spot. For the regular traveler, this is must see, to complete the experience in the field with a masterpiece of architecture, an amazing collection of fine wall paintings, decorations, and many othe details that make this Cathedral unique. Put it near Esztergom, Notre Dame (althou this is huge, ...) St Stephen's Dome .... you will understand why it completes your experience. A, for the evening travelers, it can also offer a soul-pampering organ recital, just to make the whole experience even richer....
Amazing Building. There is a nice concert in the evening. The price is reasonable. The building is really amazing. Easy to find, just next to the trendy cafe, and bars.

A Spiritual and architectural Experience!. Of course much might have been written about the St.Stephen's Basilica - a must visit monument for all faiths not just for its awesome architecture but also for the phenomenal sense of peace and spiritual vibrations inside. We attended and organ concert in the cathedral and it was mind blowing. the acoustics of the massive organ in the church just filled one's being with the goodness of life and power of the universe. Besides a stirring soprano who finished with Ave Maria, the other pieces on the organ from Albinoni, Bach and Franck were brilliantly played. Just made our visit to the Basilica so very special.

spectacular Basilica. These cathedral is gorgeous inside and out. Go to see it during the day so you can wander around, and then go back sat night for the organ recitals. Be sure to sit at the back for the recitals, or the music will be blurred by the space

Well worth the visit. This basilica may not be as big as the one in Esztergom, but it is a must-see if you are staying within the city. The interior chapel requires a minimum donation of 200 Forint; this option offers beautiful views with a spiritual setting. If you are already doing other hikes up high grounds like the Buda Castle or Citadella, you do not need to pay 600 Forint for the panaroma views up around the dome.
Beautiful Church. One of the most cared for cathedrals we have been to around Europe. It is very ornate and contains the right hand of St. Stephen. Worth a visit.
Lovely building. Great building to go and see and one of many in Budapest.Lots of bars and restaurants in the locality and busy day and night.

Another beautiful church.. If you travel Europe you will see many beautiful churches. This is one of those. Frankly after a while they kind of all look alike to me but if you are into churches this is also a beautiful one. Maybe someone with more knowledge of architecture or history of the Catholic church may have gotten more out of it but it was pretty. I actually thought the outside was one of its better features.

Absolutely beautiful. This is without a doubt the most beautiful church I have ever been in. You can enter (make a donation as you come in) to look around the sanctuary without taking a tour. A must see in Budapest.

Church. Worth popping inside for a quick look but most of the interior was roped off and inaccessible. I suggest leaving a 'donation' upon exit rather than entry so you can give according to your personal experience.

Stunning church . I visited since Saint Stephen's twice. The first time I visited as a tourist and was impressed with the design and the art work. I enjoyed walking around but decided to return for Sunday mass. Sitting close to the altar with the lights turned on high was stunning. The mass was beautiful and it was nice to share the time with the local residents. Even though I've seen a lot of churches on this trip I still enjoyed this masterpiece

Don't miss the king's desiccated hand!. The exterior of the basilica is pretty photogenic, similar to many of the grand churches in Europe's major cities. The interior was similarly neat.A chapel within the basilica has a gold/bejeweled box containing the desiccated 1000-year-old hand of a former Hungarian king. You can actually see the mummified hand! A rare treat. Make sure to find your way into that chapel.

St Stephen's Basilica. The building is amazing, a must see but be warned that you have to climb a lot of steep (and questionable) steps to the top! The panoramic views at the top are beautiful which you can see for about 500HUF which is around two pounds.You have to pay a small donation recommended 200HUF to enter the church area which is amazing (luckily the guy in front of us paid for our entry as he had no small change)!

Beautiful - also has panoramic view - tallest building in pest in metes. make sure you also buy the panoramic view ticked so you can go up by elavator or ALOT of stairsthe panoramic view is beautiful - 360 view of the city and also buda side and buda hillsthis building is 96 meters and no building is higher than it in budapest (not including buildings on hills)

Inspiring. Although entry is free the man at the door was insistent that everyone paid the recommended donation of HUF200 - and no change given! That said - it is definitely worth the small price. A magnificent building both inside and out.
Must see. Must see the panorama on the towet. Church is normal. For money you can go up to tower. Use elevator.

Organ Recital. Check for evening recitals at this beautiful flood lit Basilica. We were fortunate to experience an amazing organist, vocalist and brilliant flautist. Certainly and experience that is value for money.

Awsome piece of art, great concert. Centrally located, the Basilica is an outstanding piece of art.
You may take a guided tour or just wander around.
If there is any concert planned I definitely advice to attend. Check on their website .
The acustics is perfect and the whole experience is impressive.
We bought the tickets a few hours in advance which was a good idea.
Spectacular!!. No cost to get in and it's pretty amazing inside and out. Don't miss this one if you're in Budapest for sure.
Beautiful!. Very beautiful architecture in a nice area with restaurants and shops. We loved the area which was very near our hotel..

Beautiful. This is simply a beautiful church and an absolute must see on any visit to Budapest. The Basilica also has and interesting exhibit that you should seek to discover while you are there. Join the free Conquer Budapest walking tour and you will get a clear run down on the history of the Basilica.

The consummate Basilica. Grand inside and out, daytime and night. The day we visited, there were Roma outside demonstrating, in Hungarian, against incoming refugee's. Poetic! We only were in this Church 30 minutes, could have taken 2 hours!
Cheap way to see the city skyline. I think it was 500 HUF each to go to the dome viewing platform - a lot of stairs, but worth it for the view if you can manage the stairs.

Piece of art. The basilica from outside is a gorgeous piece of art. Good spot for photosThe surrounding area is a very good for walking and is usually full of tourists.You ca spend 1 or 2 hrs in a cafe or a restaurant near the place. There are also fHorse cars that can take you for a quick entertaining rideA must to see in Hungary
Fantastic. Beautiful building from the outside absolutely breathtaking inside....you won't be disappointed it's a must visit that is not to be missed
One Great Basilica. We were in Budapest in October and visited this attraction. It is a great basilica and full of history and well worth the visit.....don't miss it.
Beautiful stain glass windows!. A lovely places to visit. It wasn't too busy either. Donation only but it was advised €2 at the door. Very peaceful and quiet.

Budapest - Hungary - St Stephen's Basilica - Wonderfully attractive Cathedral. The St Stephen's Basilica is a beautiful Roman Catholic cathedral built in honour of the first king of Hungary, Stephen, and completed in 1905, having taken over half a century to construct. It is a Neo-Classical style with the large central dome supported by two large bell towers to the front elevation overlooking an expansive square. It really is a beautiful building set within the heart of the Pest side of the cit. The bell towers and dome are visible from Castle Hill on the Buda side of the River Danube. It is very much high on the list of buildings and sights to see in this wonderful city. Get inside if you can as the decoration and interior is superb.

Fairytale architecture. Much busier and more commercialised than before. One of the lovely galleries overlooking the river is now a restaurant whereas you could walk in it and take photos previously. Charge for going onto the upper level near the chuch end, but if you go to the far end it's free to go up to the top of the tower. Excellent view from there of the parliament building and along the river.
Impressive. Classic Basilica. Name after the first King in Hungary. A neo -classical style building.One can see the mummified hand of the King inside the Basilica.

Fantastic spiritual church. This is a breathtakingly beautiful church to visit. Very inexpensive to gain entrance only 200 forints, I had only a 500 forints note and the attendant apologised for having no change which was absolutely no problem. The interior is very very beautiful and there is an ambience of peace and spirituality which my friends and I found inspiring. My friends went up to the top of the bascila and enjoyed the view of the city. Absolutely recommend this attraction.
Warm and elite. Classical basilica with beautiful architecture the view from the dome is breathtaking and the interior of the basilica is really elegant

A nice Roman Catholic church. It was named after Hungary's first King and built with a neo-classical style. Our tour guide told us that the King's right hand is housed inside the reliquary. It is also one of the two tallest buildings in Budapest (the other one is the Parliament).
nice place to hangout near the river. plenty of small cafes just bask in the sun and soak in the atmospherecloseby shopping for laces paprkia and souveniors

Beautiful Architecture & Interesting History. St Stephen's Basilica is an impressive church with beautiful architecture. Lots of history to see - quite a quick trip, doesnt take long to walk around unless you want to read a lot.
We were demanded to make a donation, not keen on being forced to do so - as happy to donate, but feel it should be a choice.

What an imposing building.. The 1905 St Stephen’s Basilica shares the tallest building title in Budapest with the Parliament building. The cathedral, as they all are, is gorgeous inside and sensational from the outside. The chapel to the left of the main alter is the “Holy Right”, which contains the treasured (and mummified) right hand of King St Stephen.The Basilica is lite at night nice from the road but best seen from the Citadel across the river.

Beautiful inside and out. Amazing from the outside and even more beautiful and poignant inside. Donation only to enter and well worth the look. Can spend a while inside or just whizz round and get a flavour of the venue.

The finest. Among all the churches we visited, this is the finest in Budapest. It is named in honour of Stephen, the first King of Hungary, whose supposed mummified right hand is housed in the reliquary. The beautiful interior is decorated by famous artists . There is a guided tour of the basilica for a fee. Organ concerts featuring classical music is held regularly. The green dome of the church is 96 m high, as high as the Parliament. Walk up 364 steps or take the elevator to go up to the observation deck forbeautiful panoramic fiews of Budapest.

Fantastic view and beautiful church.. The Panoramic Tower is worth more than the measly price of admission and offers an elevator to those opposed to walking a dozen or so flights of stairs. A clear day would definitely enhance the experience, but worth it nonetheless. Inside the Basilica itself is an ornate golden Dome including various Biblical images that take your breath away. St. Stephen's lived up to its reputation as one of the must visits in Budapest!

Worth a couple of visits. The Basilica is absolutely lovely and worth spending time in. We went back again on a clear blue sky day to climb the tower - great views! And then again one evening for an organ concert - which was absolutely beautiful and magic being inside the church at night.

Beautiful outside and inside. St. Stephen's Basilica is beautiful outside and inside. It is a very impressive building. It has nice frescoes inside. It is one of the places to be sure to see in Budapest. There is a voluntary entrance fee with no required amount but a suggested amount.

Beautiful !. We usually don't like to spend our vacation visiting churches or museums but we heard that you have to visit this church because it's one of a kind! Fortunately we weren't disappointed at all!! The design of this church is so beautiful! Trust me you won't regret spending your time inside! Just don't leave Budapest without visiting it!

Simply awesome. Budapest is a very beautiful city, one of the most beautiful that I have ever seen. Along with the exotic parliament, the basilica is the highest building on the Pest side of the Danube. The basilica is really exotic, with beautiful murals and a huge statue of St Steven. It is important to go to the terrace of the basilica to be rewarded by an exotic panoramic view of Budapest. The treasury is small but good. In the evenings, if you check out for the dates, there would be organ concerts, which are a must see and must hear.
Fun vacation . This is one spot not to be missed not only is it beautiful but the view of the city from the top is breathtaking one of the best values in the city
Beautiful church. A quick visit here. We sat in the pews and just looked around and about us. It was quite busy although no long line.

Take the elevator!. St. Stephen's is similar to many cathedrals found throughout Europe but definitely still worth the effort to stop by and visit. I took the elevator to the top...cool to see the dome from the top side...and walked around the parapet to view the whole city, the bell towers of the cathedral and the square below.

ghastly tasteless kitch. You can marvel at the architectural acheivement of some churches (and at the man-centuries spent in building them) but few plumb the depths of interior decoration attained here.

Lovely . Beautiful building. The detail is just amazing inside and out. You don't have to pay to go inside but it is suggested that you give a donation. I think the suggested donation was 300HUF which is less than £1 so well worth it! I'm afraid of heights but managed to go up to the top and the views were stunning! There is a lift to go up and down

Huge Neoclassical church. This is probably one of the biggest churches in Hungary. Beautifully decorated both inside and out. The dome is very impressive. At night it is splendidly lit up and creates a wonderful atmosphere to the plaza where locals and tourists mingle.
Legen - wait for it - dary!. This church was so beautiful and impressive. It is definitely worth it to pay the small price to go into the tower and see the view over the city.

Wonderful. I was very impressed with this basilica! We first approached it from the square on the front side and quickly looked inside. It contains a lot of interesting architectural details that are worth taking the time to notice. Once you see the front you should walk around it to see the back which is even more impressive. A true must-see in Budapest!
Attend an Evening Concert. The cathedral is beautiful and ornate. The highlight for us was being there at night with the lights and hearing a fabulous string concert.

Beautiful. With excerpt view both inside and out, combined with brilliant architecture and panoramic sights, this is a must see when in the city.The admission is merely a small donation, allowing access to the beautiful interior and the 500ft to go to the panoramic views from the dome is a tiny price to pay.I would highly recommend a visit.
Beautiful building. We were fortunate to visit when there was choir singing and the building was fully lit inside. It was beautiful. Worth a visit
Beautiful place. This basilica is not only beautiful, but offers also quiet place for temptation and relaxation. View from the top is great too.

Think you've seen enough European churches? Don't miss this one.. End of our seven week European tour and 'churched out' but so pleased we saw this one! Rain didn't stop us making the most of our last day in Budapest to visit St Stephens. It's simply magnificent and well worth the effort.
Beautiful building. This building is beautiful, didn't go inside but saw it in passing. Would like to go inside if I was to visit Budapest again.
Swindon visits Hungary.. Went to the Basilica and thetho' not religious, but love old buildings. The Basilica and square are so beautiful. Visited many times.
Peaceful oasis in busy city. Beautiful building fantastic frescoes, take a few steps out of the busy streets of Budapest to soak up some calmness.

must see. Detfinitly one of flag place to see. The baroc inside is extremly specious and making so much impresion. The enter to the place is volountary (suggested 200FT) to the box, so You can put even nothing. 5-10 minut seeing.
Lovely sacred space. This basilica is hands-down one of the most beautiful churches in Europe! everything about it (outside and inside) is just lovely. It is a must-see!
Awesome and historical. A beautiful Basilica both architecturally and spiritually. One of the very beautiful basilicas of Europe. A must see in Budapest
Mr . What a fantastic building just amazing as they all were can't write anymore don't know what to say just go and visit

Beautiful St Stephens Cathedral . Visited St Stephens today, what a wonderfully rich ornate interior. Whilst not the largest of cathedral's is is extremely pretty. The stain glass windows in the Chapel with St Stephens relic are magnificent. Well worth visiting.

Amazing. My wife and I visited the Basilica and climbed the 302 steps to the top of the dome and viewpoint, simply breath taking, well worth the energy to get there. Inside the basilica is simply stunning and would rival any within Rome (which we have also visited)

Nice church . It's a good meeting point and we went inside. Was very crowded and busy at 5pm. The inside was nice and didn't get to go to the top as it was closed. Good attraction to see but Mathias church was better

Main church of Budapest. This should be another "must-see" tourist site in Budapest. The huge neo-Romanesque structure built around 1868 could well accommodate 9,000 people at the same time. Entrance was free but advised to make donation as far as possible. Nice to view both from outside and inside. Highly recommend to others during their visit in Budapest.
Must not miss this stop. This is a place you must go and visit. the architecture is really amazing inside. We had lunch right outside of the Basilica.
Must see. Wonderful building, both inside and out.Not to be missed.Designed by Jozef Hild in Classical syle . 19th century.
Stunning!. We attended for an evening concert, and I would recommend doing the same if you have the opportunity. The acoustics were fantastic and our surroundings spectacular.

Beautiful . Lovely to visit , for a small donation fee at the entrance to the building.
The ceilings in particular are magnificent. There is also a famous relic of a saints hand on display in a glass case in a room to the rear of the building.
Particularly an option for a rainy day!
Short Visit. It's one of those huge churches but not much to see though it towers over the city. Most free walking tours start front it's courtyard.
Striking church. Certainly deserves to be one of the must-sees in Budapest. It's size is striking, the interior and the dome are quite impressive.

Beautiful. Loved walking through here! This is a Roman Catholic church, named after the first king of Hungary. It's also the largest in Budapest. I learned that some refer to it as Budapest Cathedral. Built in the 1850s, it has the beauty of that imperial era. You can go up in the tower for a small fee, although I did not.
What a beautiful building . History history history what a interesting church to see. Such incredible architecture and awe inspiring to behold

Wonderful both day and night. St Stephen (Szent Istvan) Basillica is the most attractive one among all very beautiful religious monuments in Budapest. It looks simply breathtaking day and night, outside and inside. Climbing top of the cathedral (well not exactly "climbing", taking the elevator and just climb few steps :)) absolutely must do. The view is stunning, you can take lots and lots of beautiful photos and also it's a great opportunity to see gorgeous architecture of buildings. When you're walking in a street it's hard to see top of the buildings and they generally have some cool garnishments on their tops. Also there are frequent classical music concerts in Basilica. I went Mozart's Requiem. Ambiance inside of building, acoustic, lights, heavenly sound of organ made my night unforgettable. I totally recommend if you're into classical music.
A magnificent European Church.. An interesting church with unusual interior colours and decorations. Certainly work a visit. Surrounding area has nice Cafes for refreshments.

Stunning. I have seen a fair few Basilicas whilst visiting Europe and this one is up there on my favourites. The main Basilica is free however there is the option to make a suggested donation which most people do. There are elements of the Basilica that do require payment to view but these are all reasonable and you can choose which ones you want to see. You can take photos but not with flash and they take the silence requirement seriously. The architecture is wonderful as is the art work. It also has the slightly morbid addition of the mummified had on St. Stephen.
Exquisite. If you only go into one religious facility in Budapest, make it this one. Approaching from the west, the facility is a stunning piece of urban architecture. Inside, it doesn't disappoint.

Do the Panorama Tour. An amazing building with great views from the top. 300 steps up but also a lift to get up too. Amazing panoramic views and inside the church itself is so serene, lots to see and learn in this beautiful building.

Must see. Fantastic views from the top. Worth paying to go to the top. I recommend taking the stairs to get a real feel for the place instead of the lift however if you aren't good with heights maybe take the lift!
Beautiful. A beautiful building with a magnificent interior. on the day we visited there was a weeding which added to the spectacle

Well worth visiting. A very large church with impressive decorations and stain glass windows. It is possible to climb to the dome of the church/cathedral. The chapel within the church to the left of the main altar contains the mummified hand of king St Stephen. The church is situated in one of the better neighbourhoods of Pest and popular with locals.

Must go on top. The Basilica is one of the most beautiful buildings in Budapest. The inside is breathtaking but don't forget to go to the top of the dome. It costs about 2-3 euros and takes a few minutes to get up there by walking up but it's worth it for the view of Budapest from a different angle.

Concerts in the Basilica are wonderful. We had planned to visit the basilica but near the ticket counter they were selling tickets to an organ concert that night. What a wonderful way to not only visit the basilica but also listen to a concert. It was a great evening - I would highly recommend it! The basilica is gorgeous and hearing the massive organ played extremely well with a solo singer was really special.
nice place and visit. its very nice place in center Budapest, history seen, near is very nice resaurants and bars, when is realy life in the big city
Must See in Budapest. The basilica is very impressive and worth a visit. The neighborhood is also very nice and probably the best place to find a restaurant of your choice.

Impressive. I beliebe this church was finished in the early 1900.This a a kathlic church pretty much as good as they come entreance 100 fl... great value for money.When we entered there an orgel concert going on. The experience was impressive...
No entrance fee. 200 HUF donation requested though. . Huge dome with intricate details. Not as opulent vs other cathedrals but worth a visit to learn about its history.

Beautiful . Well worth a visit and the walk up the 302 steps is worth the view! Take your cameras! Free to enter basilica and a few euros to go to the top. There is a lift if you cannot manage the walk.

second visit. One of the best churches to visit in Budapest again not to be missed, do not forget to see the fossilised hand , need a coin to drop in box to see hand properly as this lights it up, also take the lift to see the views from the dome above

you wont skip it anyway.... because it on the way whereever you go in BP!they have some classical music nights here! i would recommend that, even if you are not into classical music, cos it is def put you in a different state of mind when you are there.(did you know that in the Evita movie Eva Peron got married here and Madonna danced through the whole building? - 60%of the movie was shot in Budapest.)
Beautifully tranquil. One of many St Stephen's basilicas available to see in Eastern Europe. Awe inspiring. A focal point in Budapest
Soars high in the centre of Pest. Another gleaming white stone building which is worth walking around and well lit at night.Did not enter but all told just as spectacular inside.

Walk up the l-o-o-ong spiral stairs for stunning panoramas. Impressive landmark inside and aloft. The climb of 300-plus stairs is well worth it, with 360-degree vistas you just can't see back home.
Go early (10 a.m.) to beat the crush.
Prediction: You'll take, and pose for, plenty o' pictures.
Breathtaking view from the tower. We bought tickets for the tower, which allow you to see Budapest from the top. Such a beautiful view and definitely worth it.

Beautiful.. We visited here as it's a top cultural attraction, glad we did. It was so beautiful inside unfortunately not much was in English so wasn't able to learn much, however I will read up at home so I understand the history fully. Worth a visit.

A feast for the eyes. A must visit in Budapest
The most beautiful dome & ceilings
If you appreciate architecture or not you will be in awe of the basilica

Visiting inside out. It was beautiful seeing it from outside and inside as well. It's cheap to get inside and worth the price. Beautiful paintings. It's also very pretty outside, especially at night.
There's a fair change close by

Good views. If you visit, I'd recommend going up to the top of the building for photo opportunities, it will really is nice on a sunny day.
The inside is very picturesque with some fantastic ceiling art.

Been to many; this one stands out. The most beautiful basilica we have been to!
Worth going inside and looking up; the architecture is simply stunning. Blew us away
Wonderful.. It only cost 200Ft to visit this beautiful church. Not as large as some inside, but still quite beautiful. The inside of the dome is just glorious.

Beautiful Basilica. I was impressed with the condition of the Basilica and how well all of it was maintained, although it had been through WWII & Communism. Even though I am not Catholic, I find churches to be comforting and beautiful.

Most beautiful church. If you are into Catholic Churches than this is a must see. Women must cover their shoulders to get in. We were finishing two weeks of touring and seeing too many churches yet this one was special.

Beautiful Basilica. This is a must see site. The history behind St. Stephen was awesome. Once again, those loving to see churches, it was so wonderful. We were able to view the mummified hand of St. Stephen. Our guide, Gabriella, was so knowledgeable with the history of the Basilica, and of Hungary.
Much like many others we have seen. After many cities they all look alike. You enjoy the first six or seven then you get over them and wonder through without enjoying their beauty.
Beautiful Basilica. The Basilica is beautiful. Very central and virtually unmissable. One of the best spots in an amazing city!
Even more impressive inside. You can't miss this basilica. Definitely take the time to go inside it is AMAZING. The painting and details are exceptional.
Classical cathedral. Everything that you expect from an European cathedral in a major city. The view from the roof is great.

Concert in St. Stephen's Basilica. The concerts in St Stephens are wonderful and a real bargain- much less than a similar concert would be in Vienna
.

Inspiring. We knew we wanted to see St. Stephan's and this was actually the first site in Budapest that we saw. We were walking to the river and it was the first landmark viewed. It is both beautiful and inspiring. Of course it is a public landmark and a tourist mecca but it also serves the populous. On Saturday night we saw a wedding party and an interesting custom where the people attending the wedding were led but a violinist to the church from some remote location, kind of cool. It is hard to explain the interior, so go and look for the "hand" exhibit. St Stephan's is a must in Budapest.

St. Stephen's Basilica Budapest. We went on a tour to the St. Stephen's Basilica and experienced one of the most fantastic views of the city from the top deck. From the Basilica we could see the statue of Gabriel the Archangel at Heroes' Square.
One of our favorite spots in the city. The Basilica is stunning from both the inside and the outside. Go up for an amazing 360 degrees view of the city on top of it. Do not miss!

Very richly decorated cathedral. At first sight very impressive basilica and very well kept. You can feel the Hungarian proud and their very religious feelings, specially in the chapel where the remains of the right hand of St. Stephen, former king of Hungary, are kept.

Amazing place- must visit the top of the Basilica. The basillica is beautiful. Two unique features is this is where the hand of St. Stephen (the first king of Hungary) is kept in a mummified state. For a bit of change you can pay to see it lighted up in a case. If that isn't your thing, then you can take an elevator and then climb a set of stairs (the stairs are open- you can see through them) to the top of on of the Basilica tours where you get a great view of the city and amazing photos. I'm scared of heights but the climb was worth it.
Beautiful. The beauty of this place is awe inspiring. An atmosphere of peace and quiet is maintained despite all the tourists. Worth going up on the roof.
Beautiful site and lovely views of the city . Definitely worth a visit. If you get the chance take in a concert! The acoustics are great. Go up to the tower for the best views of Budapest

I loved it. We have a lot of churches in Europe and maybe it is because I have been away for a long time in the US, but I really liked this one. It is huge inside, the ceilings are wonderfully painted. The only thing I did not like is that people did not respect the place. A mass was taking place, so it is nice enough that we are able to enter and visit while they are doing it, so people should be quiet. But they were not. But this is education I guess.

Gorgeous church. Worth a drop in if you are in the square or walking to Parliament from old town. Unfortunately St Stephen's hand was closed for a private event so we missed it but the beautiful interior of the church was a good subsitute.

Beautiful, impressive, and disturbing. Very impressive cathedral as are ALL cathedrals and churches in this part of the world. If only the christian church had spent the money on good works and poverty alleviation, we would have a different world today. I will shut up now!

Grand Church. I will preface this review by saying we saw A LOT of churches during our trip to Central Europe. This church was impressive, but not the best we saw while on our trip. The size and scale of the basilica was grand—lots of great ornamentation and beautiful paintings. We were a little creeped out by the Holy Right Hand of St. Stephen, King of Hungary...but I suppose it's a must-see when visiting.

Incredibly Ornate. There are more than 20 different colors of granite used in the interior of this church. Beautiful Hungarian embroidery on the altar cloths. Painted ceilings and gilded arches are just a few of the splendors inside.

Cathedral of Budapest. If you are religious or not you have to see the basilica of Budapest. It is magnificient, impressive and has a special athmosphere. The best when you can catch a wedding there... they do it in English too... but you have to be lucky ;-). From the dome you have a special view to the city
Quite impressive. Did not expect anything but were very impressed with the awesome interior. Beautifully psinted interior dome and grest looking alter

One of the highlights of Budapest. The interior of the basilica is much more beautiful than what I was expecting. It is definitely worth 30 minutes or more to look around the interior. I didn't go up the tower, but i doubt that the view from the church would be anything spectacular.

Nothing uniquely special. We made a special trip to see St.Stephen's Basilica. It is fine, but not worth going out of your way to see it. After seeing many churches around Europe, this one does not stand out as anything unique.

What a great way to enjoy the 360 panoramic view of Budapest. A few hundred steps up the tower and a 360 degree vie of the whole of Budapest takes your breath away. The basilica is in the heart of the city so easily accessible, with loads of places to drink and eat around it. Absolutely beautiful inside and upstairs - great experience and a bargain to visit too. A ticket to go up is only 500 forint, which is quite frankly less than a pint!

A little disappointed. Maybe because it was so highly recommended or because it is so tremendously huge.....this was not my favorite church in Hungary. Worth seeing, but not as much as some other beautiful places in this city.

So Serene, so beautiful.. This was a wonderful experience. The architecture, the majesty and the serenity was mind blowing. To top it all we had a wonderful surprise when a choir started to sing too. Totally unexpected but beautuful

Impressive. A Roman Catholic Basilica, and the most important church in Hungary. Imposing outside, stunning inside. Shares with the Parliament the title for tallest buildings in the city. Home to many musical performances too. For a small fee you can head to the cupola for a panoramic lookout. Bajcsy-Zsilinszky út Metro stop is quite close.

“Devine & beautiful.”. One of the must see attractions in Pest, and well worth a visit to see the huge and ornate interior.This is very lovely church. with marbled columns and the colors are very pleasing with the gold surroundings.Do not miss it!

Stunning Inside and Out. What a powerful church just so ornate and we were lucky to hear an organ concert while there ...went to the top as well what a view of the city ...loved everything about this church :)

what a view!. The 500 florints and the 302 steps are well worth the view from up the dome! It's impressive how everything seems so close yet so distant. In a good sunny day, you can see the water tower in Margaret Island. Worth the visit! and after, you can take a refreshing drink from Veryberry, which is just down the main road.

Beautiful building, brilliant view!. A lovely, and breathtaking building, and after being scalped to get into the synagogue it was very reasonable to just ask a donation. Very busy (and people not reading the silence please signs) which ruined the atmosphere a little. We paid to climb to the top, which was worth it. Panoramic views in all directions. Lost a star as some more information would have been nice...a little more on the history etc, but otherwise definitely worth a visit.
Must go to the top. We went up to the top, the view was excellent, it was a sunny day, you can apreciatte the city, the colours, the buda area, you should go up.
A must see. This basilica is quite beautiful. Both the interior and the exterior are stunning. It is a wonderful place to sit and admire the magnificent surroundings

Fantastic experience in a seeing a very well restored neo Renaissance and Baroque Catholic Church. . This is a magnificently restored Catholic Church in the heart of the old Pest side of Budapest. It was damaged, badly, in WW II, but the artisans and restorative teams did a superb job restoring it. I highly recommend that anyone visiting Budapest should definitely get to see this church!

Fantastic. Attended Sunday mass in this magnificent basilica. A very impressive church that sits in the square of central Budapest. Would equate the splendour of this building with some of the great churches in Rome. Well worth a visit.

One the city's landmarks. This Basilica is centrally located off the major shopping avenue and some nearby somehow upscale and good restaurants.
It is very impressive night and day
Worth while payng a visti, during the afternoon mass.
Pafinately pay a visit on the super ice cream spot located opposite the main entrance, and is one of the best in town

It's a Basilica. It's okay, no York Minster. Good view from the top. You get to see St Stephen's hand in the reliquary, this lights up for a small fee (about 1 euro). Not my kind of thing, but there is a Pokestop and gym in there.

A stunning basilica not dissimilar to St Pauls in London. OK, so not as large or as grand yet very similar to St Paul's in London.There is a square in front of the basilica which makes the frontage appear all the grander as you approach it.The twin towers on each corner of the frontage are very impressive.The cupola is beautiful with exquisite internal frescos.A peaceful place and certainly worth a visit.

Go to a concert there!!!!. Beautiful setting and wonderful acoustics as well. Go!!! Other members of our group went to Listz concert hall for a performance and said it was also terrific. We did a tour there the next day and the setting was beautiful.

Amazing historical moniment. No matter if you are religious or not this chiurch will connect you with history, wishes people had when they prayed in this church. It is one of the most beautiful historical places I have ever visited. It is situated in the heart of the city so it is also always convenient to visit. One of my favourite olaces in Budapest
Breathtaking. This is a gorgeous historical church in city center. It was worth climbing the steps to the top; views were stunning as were the bell tower chimes.

Amazing view. The church is situated in the middle of the city center. There is a lot of restaurants of cafes in the neighbourhood. We took the stairs to upstairs. Once you reach the top what a view. You can walk around the tower. If you are not up for the challenge to take the stairs you can always take the elevator.
Return to Budapest. Very interesting building in the middle of the city. Take the lifts to the roof and gaze across the city

Largest Church in Hungary. Hungary is about 60% Roman Catholic as is this church. But it doesn't matter what denomination you are, it is beautiful inside and truly worth a visit. No fee to visit and you can take pictures if there is not a service going on. We actually attended a concelebrated Latin Mass at 10:00 am the Sunday we were there. There are no English Masses. Even with all the pomp and circumstance, it was only an hour. The choir and organ will bring you to tears. Absolutely beautiful.

The panorama view was great!. The church is big, glimmering and grand like many churches are, so nothing new in that sense. On a Sunday afternoon there was a lot of people, so if you are looking for a spiritual experience, it might be difficult here. I am not religious, but I enjoyed the architecture and the art. There is an entrance fee, which is disguised as a donation. No one really checks which coin you drop in to the box, but you are expected to pay 200 forint or 2 euros. The best part of my visit was walking upstairs to the panorama view on top of the dome. It costs a little extra, but it was definitely worth it!
Views of Budapest. The panorama tower has average views of Budapest. For better ones it is best to go to palace in Buda.

Extraordinary scale and grandeur. The Basilica dominates the surrounding urban environment. It is huge but very much part of its context. Entry is free though, quite fairly in my mind, a small donation is sought from visitors. The interior is dramatic, brilliantly colourful, hugely scaled and quite breath-taking though my convent raised wife loathed it like she loathes so many churches for its ostentatious decoration. As for the withered arm, it offers a sense of the nature of medieval pilgrimage.

Attended an organ recital here that was one of the highlights of the trip. We arrived when the Basilica was closing for an Organ Concert and since my husband is a Classical music fan, we decided to attend. The interior is beautiful and with the addition of the tremendous pipe organ and violoncello playing Mozart and other pieces, it was a spectacular experience. .Some parts of the Basilica were closed off, so we did not get to see the withered hand of St. Istvan, but it was nice to sit and relax and hear such beautiful music. The concert was not that expensive, possibly since it was just the organ and one woman playing the violoncello, so well worth the price.
Very impressive. Beautiful inside, but the entry fee was quite expensive in my opinion, would love to see this at Christmas time .
Impressive structure. Did not visit inside , but this is a must see building in Budapest . It's an impressive structure and beautifully lit at night .
Quick visit to St. Stephen's Basilica. Wandering around Budapest and happen to come across the Basilica. Took a quick look inside, it is gorgeous. Did not time it right for s mass

Beautiful Church with great views from the top. Definitely worth a visit. The inside is beautiful. I paid the fee and walked to the top (about 300 steps). You can also take the elevator most of the way up. Nice views of both sides of the river.
Spectacular Interior. The exterior of this Basilica is impressive but the interior is absolutely spectacular!! The interior of the dome is amazing. The Basilica has beautiful stained glass.

a must see in Pest. Big and beautiful as a Basilica is supposed to be.
Take the elevator to get up and watch the city above from all angles.
Solemn experience. The magnificent beauty of this church. I just want to sit quiet and let go of all worry and anxiety.
Beautiful Building. The Basilica is a magnificent building which is worth seeing both in the daylight and also in the evening when lit up
Hotel room view!. Great architectural structure! Beautifully lift at nights and well worth the visit if you're ever in Budapest.

Beautiful late 19th century interior; great view from dome platform. The church was very crowded, but quite impressive, massively decorated in historicizing style. It is worth it to go to the small chapel at the back of the church to see the shrine for the relic of St Stephen's hand. The mummified hand is within an old reliquary, which in turn is within a newer reliquary - very interesting to see. - but don't expect to have a good view of the hand itself. Pay the small fee to climb to the viewing platform at the base of the dome - there is also an elevator, but we walked. There are numerous stairs, and be aware that some of the staircases are very narrow and steep with two-way traffic. In addition to views of the city from the terrace, you also can see the interior of the dome, which is really interesting. All in all, a must-see site in Budapest!
Grandeur !!. If you are a history buff then this place will blow your mind. Second biggest church in Hungary and absolutely beautiful inside.Must visit if you are in Budapest.

One of the truly great churches of Europe. Churches are my first destination (along with museums) when I arrive in a city. Of the many dozens I've seen, this ranks near the very top, although not many professional art historians or architects would agree with this assessment. It was built in the 1890s and is in the now-unfashionable historicist style. I don't care: it is simply gorgeous. You won't believe how impressive this church is until you actually approach it from the outside -- it is beautiful. The sculptural and mural programs inside and out are very fine, and there is lovely stained glass. It all works together to leave you truly immersed in beauty. They expect a donation to enter the church: Pay it. This church is a must-see.
A Must Do. . Beautiful in its own right but the climb to the top of the done allows fantastic 360 degree views of the whole city.

Beautiful building both inside and out. The frontage is gorgeous to look at but when you get inside the artwork/architecture just knocks you out. To get to the viewing platform around the cupola be prepared to queue unless you get there early.
Amazing. A wonderful experience. I am still slightly uneasy about paying to visit a church. The interior is fantastic, far too much to explain in detail but wonderful. I would revisit.

Yap, nice. Beautiful and romantic. ..somehow
Situated in the city centre,ish, this is a place where you should be at some point in your visit to Budapest
Another beautiful buillding. There is so much culture and history in this city. The churches are just a part of it. Take the hop on hop off bus tour and hear about the city and see the sites
Hungarian Organ Concert . We enjoyed a great night out in St Stephen's Basilica, at a Hungarian Organ Concert ... 🎼 great sounds. ... The Basilica has to be seen .... impressive and magnificent. ⛪️

go up the tower. The building itself was iteresting, but just another church, there wasn't anything remarkable about it. I did pay the small charge to go up the tower and pleased that I had. Looking over the rooftops and spotting the sites was interesting and a good way of seeing the brightly tiled roofs from above.

The most beautiful Basilica. We visited the Basillica during the day and we were amazed at this beautiful building. On 18 September we attended a concert during the evening and the lighting and music were beautiful.
Beautiful!. When traveling around Europe, I love to visit Churches and St. Stephen's did not disappoint. The ornateness of the church blew me away and definitely must stop by if you're in the area.

Beautiful Cathedral! - but check the schedule first!. This cathedral is very beautiful. However, be sure to check the hours first before you visit. It is quite busy with services, weddings, and other events. If you want access to the entire church it is best to come after 1:00PM Sundays and most week days till 5:00PM. Saturdays can be problematic due to weddings. Even if you happen to make your visit when it is busy or a service is on-going, you will still be able to get a view of the interior from the entrance. The interior is quite rich with art. The architecture is very dramatic. There is a small free museum near the entrance detailing the history of the church and construction.

Don't miss the roof. I'm always sad when I can see Tourists walking through the Basilica without going up to the roof. There is an ELEVATOR, so you needn't climb the stairs, and the few Euros fee for the ticket is absolutely worthwhile. Don't miss the panorama from the roof, and the roof itself is interesting architecturally, too. Take along a tourist map upstairs to identify easily the sights.

Grand, ornate building superb views. The interior is incredibly ornate with lots of gold and blood-red marble columns, but make time for a trip to the roof around the dome (by starts or lift) and you will be treated to spectacular views across the mysterious and romantic city of Budapest.

Stunning!. This Basilica is amazing. Probably one of the best Neo-Classical buildings in Budapest. Every corner has been restored to probably its original grander. T'he organ is stunning and I have booked for the Organ Concert tomorrow night. They have an Organ Concert Series each year, which also can be booked with a drink or dinner cruise after the concert.

Interesting. I highly recommend paying extra for the audio guide. The guide explained pertinent parts of the church and we would have been lost without it. The church was very interesting and I would have loved to hear the organ played. It was gigantic. Did not have time to take the separate catacombs tour.
Beautiful Basilica. St. Stephen's Basilica is a very beautiful and impressive building both Inside and out, well worthy of a visit.

Make sure you get to the top. This is one of my favorite sites in Budapest. I like to climb up the stairs, and see how does the church dome looks inside out. It is quite an experience. However, the view is the most stunning. It is in my opinion the best view in Budapest, because you see the river, and the Buda hills, and the Pest side. What is also interesting, and worth noting, is that you can see what are peculiarities of Budapest architecture - houses build around the square courtyards, with open staircases. You can see those regular squares of the houses from above.To sum up - if you can bear small elevator ride, and then claiming the stairs, this is must see in Budapest.
Go to the top for a great view. Don't just look around the cathedral. make sure you pay the fee to take the lift to the top and enjoy the 360 degree views of Budapest.

Aamzing basilica - a must see.... Aamzing basilica - a must see... No need to book. A 22franc donation when you go in so its really cheap. Beware of mass times as you get pushed to the back and cant walk around but its worth it....

Highlight of Trip - Magical. Magical experience not to be missed. Organ performance included opera and a flutist while viewing the spectacular beauty of the basilica. It does not get better than this. Although I bought a ticket in advance, you could a purchase a ticket the same day by stopping by the basilica. Other performances were advertised at the entrance to the basilica so stop by even if at the last minute to purchase a ticket.. You will be very glad you did. Nearby are excellent restaurants (reviewed separately) so have dinner and then a concert. It will be a highlight of your trip. Enjoy!

Very beautiful spot in Budapest!. St.Stephen's Basilica is one of the main attractions to visit while in Budapest! Don't miss the view from the dome (it takes some stairs but the view is totally rewarding)!

Stunning. Such a beautiful building. We climbed to the top of the dome (lots of steps!!) and it was worth the climb for the amazing views from the top. The basilica is free to visit, you can leave a donation, and the tower and treasury are extra, but not very expensive and the tower is definitely worth it
Definitely not to be missed. A huge tribute to St. Stephen. Go up in the elevator yo take in the spectacular views, and take your time walking through the church.

Must see in Budapest. Very impressive from a church and architecture perspective (both in and out). As huge as it looks from outside (mostly because of height), the inside isn't that big. Note that on weekends, there are line-ups to go in when the church is empty. There are also many weddings on weekends so be warned that you may not be able to go in during the wedding.

Kind king remembered through a church!. First king of Hungary has a church dedicated to him. He was cannonized to be sure! But to have his statue in the main altar was amazing and different! Very beautiful church inside.
Beautiful. Very impressive and worth visiting. One of the most beautiful churches in Budapest. The church itself is located in a beautiful surrounding, which is also worth visiting.

Must see. Absolutely incredible architecture.We visited on a Sunday morning and the service continues with visitors able to walk around the outside or join in if they wish. I was really surprised and pleased with the inclusiveness and sat with everyone. The service is in Hungarian (I think) so I didn't understand a word but was very beautiful and peaceful.

Such a nice Basilica! . We were there during a wine fair in front of the Basilica. We had a super view on the basilica. A lot if good restaurant around. It is aleaya nice to hear the sound of the bells whiledrinking a glass of wine!
Stunning.. We were fortunate enough to listen to Mozart's Requiem in the stunning surroundings of this beautiful place of worship. The acoustics are wonderful.

Breathtaking. The largest church in Europe is breathtaking, small donation to enter is worth it. Very pretty and ornate inside. Even outside is beautiful and worth seeing at night when it is all lit up.
Wow. Beautiful . Simply beautiful. Free entry into this stunning church with high ceilings and beautiful domes. Stained glass everywhere. It is possible to do a guided tour. Very large and peaceful.
Wow!. Even if youre not a religious person, the grandeur and sheer magnifence of this buildingvwill take your breath away. A must-visit place in Budapest.

Beautiful; in the city center near Deak. Near the end of Vaci ut and the Deak metro station, dodge the young folks selling Big Bus tours and head down the walking path, the Basilica is easy to spot.
Often there are seasonal events in the square in front, on weekends music played at Deak.
Walk around, take pictures, sit on the steps and people watch

Sensational feel. Lovely square ,cafes outside, easily found ,great use of space.
Sit on the stairs if there is sunshine.Church is wonderful great pieces of art ,great acoustics.

See the Largest magnificent church of Budapest. The St.Stephan basilica is walkable from most part of Budapest and is at the pest side.It is one of the largest Roman Catholics.Admission is free and if you are willing put 200huf during your entry to the box kept there. Check out when all you can see the holy right hand. It will not be displayed all time. When illuminated, the interior of church beauty multiplies. During prayer times visitors are resticted to the back benches. Very nice atmosphere and you will really love the peace in air. There is also paid Panoramic view from cupola,enjoy if you have time
Beautiful Basilic!. This is a great place to visit, full of history. There's rests from Kings and Soccer players inside of it as well.

Loved it :). Loved the Basilica. It's beautiful to see the details and the grandness inside. It has something unusual(at least for me), go inside and find out. It has no entry fee, you can give a donation of any amount.

See the hand. The basilica is very pretty and worth the visit, but the hand really made the trip worthwhile. The church's prize relic is on display for all to see...the severed right hand of its patron saint.

Breathtakingly beautiful church. Not to be missed.. We went in to find a service in progress. The church is stunning. The organ is exceptional and the choir sang like angels. So, we are going to one of their Monday evening organ recitals tomorrow.

Nice free visit, but not much information. Is a nice Catholic church The construction is recent whit clasical stile you can visit it quite fast as it not huge inside and a lot of it is restricted to turist.I missed some information about the art inside, but well... Is not a museum. On fridays there is organ live music, quite nice. And in the main square in front of it there are plenty of places to have a drink.

Must go up for a spectacular view . Beautiful basilica not to miss. We witnessed a wedding that was so romantic and grand. Pay a small fees as contribution. We paid less then €2 each to go up to the top where you can see the stunning view of incl Parliament Building and its surrounding, Dunube, and Buda area. Lift is available. I love the fact that you can see the clock tower close up.

Great views. This was a great experience. We hiked up all of the stairs to the top where you can step outside onto a 360 degree balcony that overlooks Budapest. The view was wonderful. The hike up the stairs would be challenging for the elderly or those with smaller children, but there is an elevator that bypasses most of the stairs.

Love the bells. We stayed need the basilica on our stay to Budapest and I loved hearing the bells. The streets or utca's leading up to the Basilica are beautiful. I was underwhelmed by the internal basilica but it is a matter of taste and if you are in the area it is worth a visit.A modest donation is suggested of equivalent if one euro.

Gorgeous architecture. There are thousands of people who look at this Basillica daily and yet I found myself in a peaceful place to rest and rejuvenate in the church. It is filled with religious symbolism that is stunning in its detail. The ceiling I could look at for a long time and still find new things to see each time I come back. People are looking at the architecture, people are praying, people are resting all in this one place. It is a place of peace and contemplation.

Great view from the top!. Located very centrally, if you pay 1000FT (around £3) you can go to the top where you will witness amazing views from across the city. I would highly recommend, however, there are 302 steps between the ground and the top so be prepared for a work out!! There is a lift available from the bottom, to half way and then to the top.

One good option to see the entire city from above. You can go up by elevetor or by walk for 500 HUF and see the city in 360°. That's amazing, and of course the basilica is also beautiful, but there is another entrance fee.

Interesting Church. This basilica is named after the first King of Hungary. It is not named after the martyr Stephen who was stoned to death with Paul of Tarsus watching the proceedings. This Stephen united 7 nomad tribes that had taken up residence in the general area of Budapest or at least Hungary (there is a statue to the Seven Leaders of the tribes in Heroes Square). He was also responsible for bringing the Catholic Church to Hungary. For this he was eventually Sainted (as I understand it, this sainting happened very quickly (kinda like Catholic fast tracking) without the usual waiting period.) The entire basilica is dedicated to Stephen. The only place you find a picture or image of Jesus is on a side alcove. I found this strange. The church itself is very pretty and I think it is worth a visit. For me 15 minutes and I moved on. So visit but have a plan for your day because you may have more time on your hands than you thought.

Something to see!. We really enjoyed our visit to Budapest, and this, of course, is one of the things you cannot miss. It is beautiful and was perhaps even more so at this Christmas time of year. It was really for us, too, that in the are in front of the church was a small Christmas bazaar with everything from food and hot drinks to gifts. we found the people friendly and welcoming.

Beautiful! Must-see place even if you are not not religious. Very nice building in the heart of Budapest, beautiful inside, surrounded with good restaurants and cafés. Wheelchair accessible. Amazing views from the dome.
One of the most beautiful Basilicas in the world. One should go to the top and watch Budapest from the highest point of the Basilica. The visit to the dome is not free

Beautiful basilica in the city of Budapest. I've been blessed to see the interior of this magnificent edifice. It is so beautiful, both in and out. The interior's decoration is so elaborate, every square foot of the basilica's ceiling is adorned with painting, gold foils and intricate designs. The basilica also houses the relic of the right hand of St. Stephen, the first king of Hungary.
Beautiful. We climbed to the top and the views were fantastic. The church is beautiful. All the side altars have beautiful paintings and sculptures. Worth the visit.

Stunning inside and out. Well worth a visit, this building is stunning inside and out. Worth getting the lift up to look at the views over Budapest. A very nice bar is on the corner just opposite the front of the building.

Beautiful Church with Beautiful views of the city from top!. We visited this church on our first day in Budapest. Situated in a touristic area and close to many restaurants and cafes, this church is grand and beautiful. You can pay and climb the stairs up to view the city from the top. We spent approximately an hour looking around and taking pictures and enjoying the views and the weather. Definitely worth a visit.
Beautiful church. Very beautiful church; there is a small fee to get into the church. Didn't take the tour...just respectfully looked around.
St. Stephens. This Basilica was on our list of places to visit. It has outstanding architecture and is simply awesome.

Lovely View from the Top. Our kids love to climb to the top of churches when we visit so we always spend a bit more to do so. This climb is not too difficult and has plenty of places to take a breath if you cannot make the whole climb without a pause or two. The view are lovely at the top and worth the effort to get there.
Lovely Concert. We only visited for one of the 8.00pm concerts so didn't get the opportunity to tour the place but the 70 min concert was excellent

Good but a slight con. Although cheap compared to some other religious sights in Budapest the "donation" is actually compulsory and you're watched like a hawk as you put your money on the "donation" box. On top of that you have to pay extra to go up the lift to the dome, although after buying tickets nobody once checked to see if we'd paid or not. I didn't mind the extra cost for the dome as the views are really nice and make for great photo opportunities. What I did have a problem with though is paying extra to shine a light on the box that contains the mummified hand - one of the main reasons I, and I suspect many others visit. I don't remember seeing or hearing about this extra cost at all until I actually got to the box. On top of that the box is so intricately designed that there's barely enough glass to see the inside of the box anyway, plus it's at least a meter or so away behind a barrier. Really annoying and a bit of a con if I'm honest. I'd rather the entrance "donation" actually be slightly more expensive and the venue be open as honest but hey, it's the church were talking about here, it's all money!Go up to the dome though, I recommend it! Great views.

Stunning architecture . We visited the Basilica as we had admired it from outside and were intrigued as to how it would look inside. As we entered we were amazed at its beauty. It is absolutely breathtaking to see and preserved to perfection mere 200 HUF admission, which is approx 60 pence, this stunning cathedral is a must when you in Budapest.
Amazing view. You can pay only 1,60 € per person and you can go to the top of cathedral on foot or by elevator. Spectacular and panoramic view of Budapest!

Peaceful and Stunning. The most peaceful, beautifully balanced, lovely church I've seen anywhere in Europe (10 countries and counting) - including Italy. This cathedral is spectacular, showy in all the expected places, but somehow serene in a way that most, especially ones popular with tourists, never manage to be. Loved it! It's a must-see on any trip to Pest.

Wow!!. When you leave St. Stefans Basilika, it's with a feeling of leaving unimaginable wealth.
It's decorated with gold and marble all over, and extremely impressive.
Go to the tower and enjoy the view of the city.
Get inside and prepare to be breath-taken.

Tower View. I've only managed to see the tower, but it was enough to make me fall in love with it.It was around 6 pm when we got up. We tought we can skip the stairs by elevator but it turned out we still had a lot to go. When we got there and saw the view, we forgot about the exhaustion. The sun was going down so we get the most amazing view over the city.
Stunning building. The basilica is a stunning building even though it had 3 different architects working on it as it took so long to build. Well worth a visit

One of the main attractions in the inner city. A huge basilica you have to visit during your stay in Budapest. This is one of the main attractions especially during the main Catholic holy days. Called after the founder of the Hungarian state, István, this amazing builiding rose from the end of the 19th century and was finished after decades. It reminds us the St. Peter's basilica in Rome. The right hand of the state's founder is kept here. The altar is impressive and the cupola is almost 100 meters high above the ground. At least once you have to climb up and admire the city. There are a number of glass windows made by Miksa Roth that are very beautiful. There are a number of wings where you can pray separately from the crowd. The square in front of the building is lively and you find many coffee shops here, California Coffee Company, Starbucks, etc.
Beautiful. We were walking along the Vaci street and turned to see the square around the St. Stephen's basilica and we liked the Basilica very much. Could not enter it.
I lit a candle and prayed . I felt something mystic as a Muslim. I lit several candles for loved ones back home and prayed my own spiritual way as a Muslim you can pray in any monotheistic site.
Amazing building. This is such a beautiful building, with a quiet peaceful feeling inside. A must to visit in Budapest
For an organ concert is worth a visit.. The acoustics is very good, therefore if you could present at an organ performance, is quite enjoyable.
Magnificent. Very impressive building. Inside the magnificent decoration of the ceiling. Ambitious and grandiose.

Enjoy the view. The Basilica is a beauty itself, but you can top the experience if you go to the top and walk outside to the dome, it's a great view. If you wanna have a coffee after your visit, you can go to high note skybar, which has an amazing view to the dome, so you can enjoy the sight a little longer :).
Beautiful and Grand. We were privilege to visit while Mass was on Sunday morning. The energy in the church was magical. We walk up to the top tower for some spectacular view.

Not so special. The outside square is worth a visit, but the church is nor worth the entry fee. It is late 19th century with nothing particularly notable architecturally. Within they have a relic that is supposed to be the right hand of St. Stephen. We refer to it as "the mummified monkey paw"
Magnificent!. To stand in front of this Basilica is a dream come true. Make sure you read all the history on this Basilica and St Stephen.

Visit to St. Stephens Basilica tower. We didn't spend a lot of time visiting the church as it was really crowded. But we went to the top of the cathedral to see the view which was amazing. Unlike many other churches in Europe, the tower at St. Stephens has an elevator, so anyone can go up and enjoy the view. We could see the Buda hills, Great Synagogue, Buda castle etc from the top of the tower. It was totally worth the trip up.

2016 Summer Vacation. St. Stephen's Basilica is a Roman Catholic basilica named in honour of Stephen, the first King of Hungary. It's wothwhile to go up the 360+ steps to the dome for a wonderful 360 degrees view of budapest... or you can take the elevator :)

Don't miss the dome!. The building is rather impressive, but not one of a kind. For me the main attraction was the dome. Ticket to the dome costs just 400 HUF (less than 1.5 USD) and you have to either take the elevator or can walk the stairs. Once you get to the top, you can walk just outside the dome. Chances are that you'll be probably standing the highest in Budapest (at least the Pest side)The Basilica and the Parliament building are equally 96 m tall, (it has some symbolic aspects too) and they are by law the tallest buildings in Budapest. As a result, the view over the city is spectacular! No high-rises blocking your view. Really it becomes best at around sunset. Enjoy!
Organ concert! . A real eye opening experience as the organ concert was an acoustic treat! Worth paying the fee and walk up to the top for a work out!
A Beautiful Cathedral. Aces is somewhat limited, but one can go in the side entrance and get pictures of part of the sacristy from there. Beautiful adornments.
bugarias gem. To be honest, if you have been to Rome in Italy then this Basilica may seem bland. However the basiclica sits in a beautiful location that is worth seeing.
St Stephens Church. A stunning building, Very attractive inside and outside. On the Pest side.Concerts are held inside in the summer months. Very central location....
St. Stephen's Basilica. A must see. At times there are people peforming music in the church so need to check on the time. You can also relax and have a drink outside.
