Stunning!. Majestic structure and Beautiful inside. As it appears in one's sight between rows of buildings, it draws you to the square before it and then to itself. The doors have all the saints carved on them and are absolutely stunning. The paintings on the walls and the ceilings draw your eyes to them, repeatedly. The view from the top was spectacular and well worth the climb / lift ride up. The cherry on the icing was the concert we attended - to hear Ave Maria in such a stunning venue was something else! Don't think any photographs can do the place justice, mainly because it is so beautiful but it is also the feeling of peace and of being one with one's maker that cannot be described or captured. Irrespective of one's faith or lack thereof, it makes for a deeply spiritual experience.Loved the city and especially St Stephen's Basilica!

Worth the climb to the top!. The largest church in Budapest is worth a visit. The main entrance is dominated by the inscription " I am the Way, the Truth and the Life" but as it is in Latin I think most visitors will miss the importance and impact of this quote. Even on a sunny 30 C day it was worth paying 500 HUF to climb the basilica and get a great view of Budapest and admire all the buildings with their different roofs. The entrance to the church is free but a donation gets a smile of appreciation.
Inside suprises. This cathedral is quite typical. Very rich interior, like similar in Rome. This is the church you musy go in Budapest, if your time is limited.

Master piece of architecture. As the other main attractions in Budapest, it is worth seeing it during daytime and at night. We just take a look from outside. In the evening it is awesome. The magnificent cathedral near the Opera Building and a nice plaza is a "must see" place in Budapest.
Definitely go to the rooftop!. The building is impressive, the inside interior is also beautiful as well, yet for me there are other interior
Looks great. Another lovely cathedral with lots of gold leaf but great to see. It still is pressie even though I've seen many cathedrals
Love. Impossible to describe the grand nature of this basilica.. The architecture is awe inspiring and the art is spectacular.

Beautiful. Very beautiful structure and paintings. The view at the top of the tower was great, good for photo shots. We attended a string concert in the evening and it was just perfect. The night view in the basilica was beautiful, the saint's statue looks really holy. Must visit.

Walk around the church.. The inside is spectacular and it's well worth a visit to view it. All that's needed is a 200FT (less then £1) donation to gain admission. There are lots of guided tour groups inside and it's easy to tag onto an English speaking one if you really want but it's probably more relaxing just wandering around.

Must attend to a concert. Amazing architecture with amazing acoustic design
Don't miss the chance to attend to a concert
Magical

Wonderful Bazilika!. Worth paying a visit!!
If you're lucky you can even see a wedding.
Great location, wonderful basilic.

Beauty and grace. The basilica of St Stephens is a must view for anyone who loves religious architecture.
There is a small entry fee (200 florints) which is well worth paying. Inside the grandeur and beauty of the dome makes takes your breath away.
It is best to go early to avoid the crowds. Sit and soak uP the atmosphere.
Great pice of arhitecture !. The magnificent cathedral near the Opera Building and a nice plaza is a "must see" place in Budapest.

Great from outside and nice panoramic view of the city . It's wonderful from outside more than from inside.
The view that offers of the city is amazing and I'd suggest to take the elevator if you are not suoerfit.

Make it to the top . This basilica is stunning on the inside and surprisingly not too crowded. You also can pay 500 forint to use the elevator to make it to the top of the dome which is totally worth it. Not only are the views amazing but the elevator and short set of stairs make the climb super easy compared to other cathedrals (we did it with two newborns). Highly recommend it at sunrise or sunset. Enjoy.

Great acoustics. Had the great privilege to attend an organ , flute and soprano concert in this beautiful church, Definitely visit this iconic Basilica and check the activities calendar by the entrance,

Worth 15 minutes inside. As the other main attractions in Budapest, it is worth seeing it during daytime and at night. Also, it is huge, and worth take a stop to see it inside. We couldn't match the dates, but it is said sometimes there are small professional concerts inside.
Gorgeous. Magnificent building both exterior and interior. There are all the time lots of tourists.Voluntary admission fee.
Beautiful cathedral and observation tower . Definitely worth it to go up the the top of the dome, great view of the city. The inside is pretty crowded, but extremely beautiful

Stunning. The scale of this cathedral is amazing, the decorations are beautiful - everything is set to impress. 'Spectacular' doesn't cover how lovely it all is. The paintings, statues, the magnificent pipe organ, the external shell of the cathedral - all have been lovingly maintained. Entry is a donation of 200 Ft and you can take photos inside. There is a display of the mummification of St Steven's hand which is a holy relic from nearly 1000 years ago. Easy to get to as it's 500m from the nearest Metro.

Impressive building and serene atmosphere inside. First stop on walk around Budapest. Amazing place with lots to look at. Unfortunately for some reason the staff ushered everyone out only saying closing, closing repeatedly. Plan to go back to see the rest if there is time

Beautiful Cathedral that gives St Pauls a run for its money! . I really loved this church, beautiful and HUGE. Beautiful paintings, sculptures and alters. My favourite was Saint Rita (mainly as this was my nanas name!) You can catch a lift and get panoramic views of the city. You must add this onto your list of places to visit!

Must Visit Basilica. This beautiful and imposing Church is right in the City Center and it holds artful mosaics and beautiful altar places. One can also climb/or take a lift to the top of the Tower and have scenic views of the City. A place to ponder, feel peaceful and meditate ..

Ornate and breathtaking . There was so much to see (and photograph) on the basilica! I loved every inch. It's amazing that such a building was created to glorify God. Make a point to see this on your trip!

Tower=so so. Hmmm ive climbed up many towers from my travels and id say i was not too impressed with this. You will obviously still have the view but really not that worthwhile. The church was also just ok but I wouldnt also skip this if youre in Budapest.

Very disappointed . I really wanted to view this Basilica up close and enjoy all the beauty of the church, however they had most of the church roped off and you could not get a good view of the altar or anything else. There were no tours offered and no audio tours. It is a shame that the church isn't made accessible to the general public and they couldReally turn this into a great tourist attraction if they organized it better and offered tours.
Beautiful Basilic. Nice cathedral . It's a must in Budapest, magnificent Catholic monument. You will feel the importance of the religion in Hungary.

Excellent Attraction. This is an actual ancient building - not one reconstructed from rubble after the war. It is quite interesting and very beautiful from the inside as well as outside. Well worth visiting

Beautiful Basilica. This is a beautiful building both from the outside and from the inside. It is nice to see but personally, it reminds me of many famous European churches. If you are in the neighborhood - it is nice to take a look and enjoy the atmosphere in the surrounding area.

Beautiful . A stunning building inside and out. There are plenty of bars and restaurants in the square outside of the basilica.
It was only a donation of €1 to go inside, which was definitely worth it. We were all blown away by the beauty of this building.

Stunning . The Basilica is quite unique and beautiful. The inside is intricately decorated and has many beautiful paintings and sculptures. There is also an opportunity to go up to the outside round tower and see a 360 view of the city. Definitely a great place to go and see some great architecture.

Architectural triumph. What an excellent site to visit as a tourist and as a person of any religious belief. Excellent place for a social get together . Notable feature was absence of any trouble in the area and the absence of any police.The chiming of the church bells reminded us the presence of an institution upholding the goodness round us.

Breathtaking . Luckily there is a large square in front of it so you can really appreciate the size and beauty of it (personally that's what I miss about St Paul's in London). Definitely worth going inside to see the artwork and the historical artifacts. Also go up to the roof, the view worths it.

Interesting. I think that st.stephens church is one interesting attraction that it will be good to visit. As you can see in the picture that i uploaded, its very big church. Stephen was the first king of hungary

Amazing in Its beauty. This magnificent building is truly breathtaking. Looked upward fir most of the time. The ceilings are truly amazing. There certainly was a peace about the place, something I found lacking in other European Church buildings. The Church knew how to spend money!! Awesome. Free to wander.
Well worth a visit. Very good place to view. St Stephens hand on view may seem a bit strange to some, but certainly different. Lovely building and the story of the construction is fascinating.

Go in the morning for the panorama view. If you've travelled widely in Europe and seen many cathedrals, especially those in Italy, this will probably not impress you that much. Prepare forint coins, as you're "encouraged" to donate 200 forint at the entrance, and you need to give 200 to the attendant to see the mummified hand of St Stephan, the first king of Hungary (it's in a chamber at the far left of the church as you enter). That's probably the most interesting part of the church. Pay another 500 ft to go up to the top of the basilica for the panoramic view. Skip the stairs and take the lift (small so you have to queue a bit). The best view is towards the river and the castle area, which is to the west, so go on the morning to take the best pictures. I was there in the afternoon with the sun shining from the castle so it was impossible to take good pictures.
Very beautiful. A famous and must go sightseeing place.Great spot to take nice photos !We enjoyed it and would highly recommend it .Nice and interesting neighborhood with a lot of food!

Forced donation instead of regular entrance fee. The Basilica is a representative piece of 19th church classicism and as such worth a visit. Except for the tower visit (really nice view, but brace yourself for many stairs), the entrance is free. However, this is because the owners prefer to have someone stand at the entrance door forcing visitors to "donate", instead of selling regular tickets (and handle the income transparently). Feel free to insist on getting a ticket if you do not support procedures that are not transparent. Also note that for candles, the price is 200 HUF or 1 Euro (=315 HUF), meaning the price in forints is 2/3 of the price in euro.
Amazing inside. The basilica is beautiful from outside, but you must go inside and have a look at the inside too. It was just amazing! My favorite place in Budapest!
Glass. Wow factor. Stunning place to visit. Reasonable price and staff OK. Stunning views from top. Worth a visit if in town. Will go baback again next time. So much to take in.
Steps from my amazing hotel Aria Budapest. Beautiful and the central point of the Pest side of Budapest. Enjoyed people watching outside each day.

Great Views.. The views from this area are just great, the Basilica is beautiful and old (as are most in Europe) the area surrounding the Basilica is called tower hill. The views from tower hill are breath taking.

Amazing albeit frightening view from the top!. The inside is pretty much on par with what you expect while visiting a European basilica. Buying a pass to the the top offers 360 views that are pretty amazing albeit a little frightening while narrow passages at the top in and amongst other tourists using the same passage ways.
Nice!. There is a lot of history here and some funny facts too, the entrance isn't that expensive so it's totally worth it!

Worth a visit. How refreshing to be able to look round without having to pay to go into a church as you do in English cities. Beautiful building, especially ceilings. Not sure about the main attraction of the mummified hand!

Worth a visit. They have organ concerts at night that are very good and we recommend. They have two organs the main one is amazing.
The chrch in itself is also worth the visit.

Try the panorama look out in the cupola.... ...and forget the Budapest Eye! You are higher above Pest and the price is better. :)
One of the most famous buildings to visit in Budapest. A classical basilica, a must see attraction.
We LOVED this Basilica 10-Stars!. An amazing Basilica you must visit. It's absolutely beautiful! Purchase an elevator ticket to the top for the most scenic views of Budapest.

Must see. This is a must see!
Very nice, and a bit different than more western European churches. on the downside i think to much of it was unaccessable due to ropebarriers, -hard to get a close look then... Allso, the smaller rooms was a bit crowded, so some kind of crowdcontrol would have been nice.
Worth to visit. Amazing view, but To visit the tower and treasure there is a fee and you have to pay 500 ft but it worth it very well!
Go to the top. The third largest basilica in Hungary. Very beautiful church, but you get the most if you pay 500 HUF to go up to the top. Take the stairs - it's more fun :)
Worth a visit. It is definitely worth a visit, but do not expect this to be like some other, much older cathedrals you may have seen in Europe.
Leisure. Beautiful Catholic Church in city centre if Budapest. Must take the lift to the top observatory for only HUF 500. Beautiful 360 views of the city from the top.
Great view from the city. Incredibly beautiful inside, with a surprisingly and mystical object which is kept inside. Plus nice view of the city by going up

A magnificent place. The interior has to be seen to believed. It rates amongst the most ornate. Although not very large by some of the other cathedrals, it is certainly magnificent. There is the seperate chapel for the relic, St Stephens hand which is simplistic in comparison.a

Free to enter. You can walk in for free but a donation is recommended. You can get to the top for a fee and get some amazing views of the city. The church is located in a very nice square with lots of restaurants and bar. The church itself is massive and beautiful.

Organ concert. Lovely basilica. Not as lavished as you would encounter in the western parts of europe, yet very big and ornamented. The organ concert was amazing, containing known pieces from Bach, Mozart and the likes. Music just pours into your body from every direction. Highly recommended. Be sure to check online when exactly concerts are performed.

Beautiful church on the Pest side . Beautiful church very well restored.
It was a pleasure to see the well painted walls and improve dome

Overwhelming!. This basilica is just stunning inside and out! As someone else wrote it is "breathtakingly beautiful". That might well be an understatement.It is surrounded by a charming square with many cafes, restaurants and bars just made for people -watching and chilling.Easily accessible - close to metro!Access is FREE - with only a minimal donation requested.We thoroughly enjoyed our visit without a tour guide, although some may want one.One of the Best of Budapest -- An ABSOLUTE must see!

Beautiful and well worth a visit. A beautiful building with fantastic architecture. Don't miss going inside, the interior is even more impressive and entry is free (although a donation is suggested). A must see when visiting Budapest.

Amazing views. This was the first thing I visited upon arriving in Budapest, my Hungarian friend bringing me straight here. I can see why. The view from the top of the tower is incredible, giving you a good view of Pest and the Buda hills (you won't see the Danube but there are plenty of other places in the city to see it!). A reasonable price at 500 forint each, there are about 300 ish steps to climb but I believe you can take two lifts up - we walked all the way up, and then took one lift halfway down. The steps on the second part are a bit rickety so if you're s bit afraid of heights you might want to take the lifts!We visited as the sun was starting to set, casting a lovely glow over the city! It wasn't too busy either. Would recommend!

Another Cathedral but then there are so many in Europe. Huge and well worth the effort to see. Like most churches, cathedrals, synagogue's or basilica's they are very humbling places of worship, but we never get bored with them wherever we may be.
A beautiful basilica with a charming square. I could have actually stayed there for a whole week with it's beautiful exterior and charming square with restaurants and bars. You'll love it!
Stunning and worth a visit.. It was breathtakingly beautiful and the visit wasfree.. a donation is suggested but not mandatory. It is close to all the metros and several buses and trams

Magnificent Basilica....perfect setting for a wedding.. My cousin was fortunate to arrange his wedding in St. Stephen's Basilica last weekend.It was a stunning place...with huge domed roof adorned in gold & glorious stained glass windows. Spotlessly maintained, this is a must when visiting Budapest. Needless to say, the wedding was lovely. I will go back next time I am in Budapest.
Beautiful church. It's a nice spot to visit and take some pictures. We didn't pay to go in but the architecture is amazing plus there's a lot of interesting shops and cafes close by.
Amazing!. Make sure to look on the inside and on top of the church! It has a gorgeous view. 500 HUF on top, 200 HUF to get inside.
Very nice to see. A very nice building, we just ate around the corner from this. Didn't go in or anything but it's lovely to see and in a lovely square with lots of restaurants.

Nice views across the city and a mummified hand. What more could you ask for in a basilica visit? It is worth the small price to pay to take the lift up to see the views (but there are still a number of flights of stairs to climb when you get up there still!) Beautiful church.
Impressive. It is very impressive, located in the heart of the city, it offers you rich interior. You can even climb one of the towers and there is a nice view

An imposing basilica. It is one of the symbols of Budapest , the beautiful and fascinating. To visit the tower and treasure is a fee (500 Ft). Is well worth visiting the tower, panorama view is very beautiful, a good opportunity for photos. I visited on August 20th (St. Stephen's holiday).
Classic. We thought going to the Basilica a must and really found it interesting. Plenty to see in this historic building.
Beautiful Basilica. This is such a beautiful building so peaceful, free entry donations accepted. There is a lovely square around it which has cafes etc..

Visit . If u arrive Budapest u should visit the basilica don't miss it its very nice to see the history specially the church's there and go see the panorama it has amazing view knowing that they charge u for 500ft for using the elevator

The main religious attraction in town. This cathedral was surprisingly impressive and even recalled the glories of the Vatican. The entrance fee is an apparently voluntary 200 Forints and this is easily worth it. The "Chapel of the Hand" houses a mummified hand of an early Hungarian king.
Stunning church. We did a tour of the Basilica as part of a Viking cruise. It is a beautiful church well worth visiting!

Stunning and Huge Church. This is a lovely looking building (even in a city of lovely buildings). Finding the best place to photograph it is not easy, as it looks great from many angles, but once you find the big square in front of the main entrance, you have your money shot.
Another lovely building. Lovely building you can visit the tower and loads of nice restaurants and shops around same area worth a visit

Wonderful sacred space.. I am always impressed when a cathedral manages an air of sanctity and prayer when catering for thousands of tourists and this does. The frescos and decorations are wonderful and there is space to sit and be still, light candles and say prayers as well as photograph and marvel. I am also impressed when donations are invited rather than charges imposed. A fabulous place.

Can't praise it any higher, divine. Exceptional building with magnificent architecture and outstanding features. Words cannot describe the inherent beauty of this beautiful building. Entry was by donations (100ft each) but if you can afford it, even if you put in more, you won't feel jipped.
Amazing. Really nice outside and inside!! Don't miss the visit to the tower!!!!! You will be able to have really beatiful views.

Simpy amazing. If you are going to Budapest you need to plan a visit to this Basilica. It is so impressive from outside and inside (it reminds me a little bit of St. Peter´s Basilica in Vatican). You can also climb up and have a great view of the city (I think it is around 500 forints which is nothing). There are some nice restaurants near by when you finish with your visit to St. Stephen's Basilica (highly recommend Wasabi - Japanese restaurant).
Beautiful church. We attended a classical concert here in the evening. The organ music was amazing due to the excellent acoustics - they have them regularly I recommend this.
Buda side. This is at the end of Chain bridge on the Buda side a lovely walk around was fab, lovely view of the city the tram ride up is great

Beautiful Basilica. A must stop visit while in Budapest We were fortunate to have a guide with us to give us a history lesson on the life of St Stephen and also of the building of the structure. The interior is beautiful, not over the top with gilt etc as other churches are but so serene in its special details
PANORAMA VIEW . when you pay around 1 or 2 dollars, you may go up to panorama view point, which is amazing but you need to take stairs for like 10 mins !

must see in Bp.. it is the 2nd largest basilica in Europe and it is a beautiful sight inside and out... you can sit on the stairs or witness a wedding or just stare at it from any of the cafes around it
360 view. Located in the centre of Budapest, with an astonishing arhitecture and the posibility to see the city from above.
Nice. Really nice cathedral.One of the most beautiful in Europe.This heritige was preseved in very good condition.The front squere are full with charming terases where you can have a decent lunch.
centre. This Basilica is located in centre of Budapest where are many traders sales a goods and offered mulled wine or other things

My Recent Stay. I walked around late one night and found this beautiful basilica. It was built in the mid to late 1800's and houses the mummified hand of St. Stephen. It is lit up well at night and is situated at the base of a square where people gather. Great architecture....bring your camera.

beautiful. magnificent,awe inspiring place,felt very humble and small.Beautiful architecture,well cared for.Whether you are religious or not you can understand the faith and belief in God that inspired its construction

Awesome 19th Century Basalica with historical facts and amazing architecture. This lovely 19th Century Basalica is one of the must visit attractions in Budapest and is situated in the Pest side town centre. This is a free to enter attraction, but access is restricted. You can see the main parts of the cathedral though. The museum is paid access and is nice to visit.

Roaming around Budapest on a Sunday. Well worth visiting. We were there on a Sunday and once mass starts, you are not permitted to enter the church. That was fine, it was great to walk around the area and take in all the sites.

Stunning. This magnificent Basilica is free to enter with a small suggested donation. The inside is so beautiful you sit in awe at the beauty of the interior. We attended an Organ concert at 5:00 pm on the Monday which I highly recommend.

Great View. The inside of the Basilica is free to enter so I would definitely recommend this as the inside is incredible Then you can also pay to go to the top of the Basilica and walk around it giving almost a panoramic view of the city, there's a lot of steps so be prepared you can get a lift once you have reached the top of the 1st section that takes you straight to the top. If you go to Budapest you have to go to the Basilica - there's lots of great restaurants around it as well!

Nice views from the top of the basilica.. You'll see some nice views from the top of the basilica. You'll see most of pest side. It could be a bit crowded to get on top in the morning but it is worth of a view.

Spectacular. One of the most important landmarks and sights in Budapest. A very impressive structure (somewhat obscured by surrounding modern buildings). Like anything else in Budapest, this must be visited again during night. Inside is spectacular. Panorama is a must during your visit. Pay 500 Forint and climb approximately 300 steps to get breathtaking views of Buda and Pest. Also visited the Treasury (400 Ft) which is accessed only by a lift. A small room with a lot of history packed in it. Plenty of photo opportunities outside and inside and again during night.Very friendly surroundings, with places to sit down, restaurants and ice-cream shops, could easily spend a few hours. An absolute must visit if you are in Budapest.

Beautiful Cathedral!. We visited during a Sunday morning service, which was in Hungarian, but the organ music was beautiful. This church is very large and the high dome contained beautiful mosaics. Otherwise, it was attractive but slightly dark inside even with the lights on. For those who have an interest, there is the mummified right hand of St Stephen on display in a side chapel. I would recommend a visit for anyone with an interest in churches and architecture.
The Basilica is beautiful.. If you have the time, would recommend going inside the Basilica. The windows, paintings, and statues are beautiful.
Nice place. The family and I visited the Bascilica and our experience was good. Outside it is busy with plenty of restaurants around.
Glorious St. Stephens . Beautiful to visit, landmark building in Budapest. Nice cafes in the areas around and a hop on / hop on bus stop right outside.
Main church. Does not compare to the basilica's of Italy or the rest of Europe. The area is a bit "iffy",especially the surrounding streets.
Beautiful . There was a DiVino wine festival it was great.We bought wine glasses that were not refundable and picked to taste different varieties of Hungarian wine.
I would just sit here and watch the beauty. This is one of the best Basilica I had visited in Europe. It is free to enter to the main side however u need to pay for going up. Great paintings :)

Stunning. Came on a Sunday & saw the concert and did the full tour - well worth the cliimb - beautiful x Walk then towards the river but watch out for so called social workers after donations. Only downside to the visit

A uniquely beautiful Catholic church. From the several colors of red marble, to the sculpture of St. Stephen in the alter where one expects Jesus to be, to the tasteful (rather modest for a Catholic Church) use of gold and decoration, the Basilica is uniquely beautiful. It also has on display the severed hand of the Saint. Visit the Basilica. In my opinion it is second only to the Gaudi designed Sagrada Familia in Barcelona.
Stunning. Only ask for a small donation and is worth it for the beautiful views inside. Saint Stephen's hand relic was also a very interesting sight.

Beautiful church and right hand relic. A 200Huff donation is recommended to enter. Beautiful church. There is a small Chapel (free) which contains St. Stephen's right hand. There are frequent concerts there.
Beautiful. Well worth a visit when visiting Budapest very busy with tourists but queues wasn't too long the guide was helpful

Absolutely a beauty. This church is a must visit as you will be amazed by the external and internal architecture. Amazing and beautiful. You would need to drop HUF200 in a donation box before entering the church.

Beautiful views and architecture. I'd really recommend visiting St Stephen's as it's a great way to get a panoramic view of the city. If you wish to go inside the church you are asked to make a small donation but it's worth it as inside is beautiful. We opted to pay to climb to the roof (I think it was around 400 HUF) and you can either climb the stairs or get a lift up to the top. The stairs are quite narrow and I think there's around 300 of them so I'd recommend getting the lift. But be aware that there are about 20 stairs after the lift as well so there's no way of fully avoiding the stairs. The views from the top of the dome are beautiful and it's a great way to get a view of Budapest as well as enjoy some peace and quiet.

Beautiful church. I don't personally love churches but this was a very beautiful and highly decorative one. If you are a fan of churches then this is definitely one to see. However you did have to make a "voluntary" donation to get in but it wasn't a lot.

Visit the viewing platform is a must!. I could not recommend visiting St Stephen's Bascillica more highly. The church is stunning and the view from the viewing platform is perhaps the best on the Pest side of the city. Probably the cheapest notable tourist attraction in Budapest.

Breathtaking!!! ⛪️. We were just staying around the corner from this beautiful Church and were very fortunate to go when there was a service taking place. I would say that the church is one of the best we have seen even when we had visited Rome!! We climbed up to the top which was worth it for the magnificent views!!

Beautiful Basilica. Well worth the visit. Donation is suggested, buy not required to tour the Basilica. A nominal fee is required if one opts to tour the Basilica's dome. I suggest taking the elevator. Check the schedule for evening organ concerts.

Beautiful from the outside. Nice inside, but pushed to donate more money,. An iconic building in Budapest - it truly is a beautiful landmark. I've visited a lot of cathedrals, and wasn't as impressed as I thought i would be inside. You can visit the relic of St Stephen (his hand) if you like that sort of thing. I felt the priest was a bit pushy with visitors on their way out - requesting that they donate more money!
superb church. as with all holy places a great serene place to visit and get away from the hustle and bustle . Architecture is stunning

Beautiful and Historical. Absolutely Beautiful! Spectacular marble and design. The light when it hits just right close to sunset is magnificent. Free to the public. Close to the Parliament so it makes for a good start to a day of sightseeing. Local cafes and restaurants plus some local shopping.

Gorgeous Cathedral!. St Stephens Cathedral is a stunning Cathedral and a must see when in Budapest!
The inside is very decorative and everywhere you look it is beautiful!
I recommend you pay to climb to the top of the dome,the views are amazing,there is a lift also if you cannot climb!
Well worth doing!!

Amazing Basilica. Amazing basilica that you have to visit , you should pay before you enter the church but actually you have to visit as it worth it. The basilica is wonderful inside every wall is an amazing picture of art . A great place should be visited in Budapest
Beautiful piece of architecture. Not as grand as the one in Rome but still huge and very beautiful. If you get a chance do visit from inside. Worth visiting

Very nice place. A must see in Budapest. However it's not for the faint of heart. A lot of stairs to climb and the view from the top is breathtaking. I also found some abstract art instalations that I enjoyed.

Lovely building, very pretty.. We want here after a long and gruelling walk around Budapest. Even in the haze of exhaustion, it stuck out as the highlight of the day. The inside of the building is very ornate. On top of all that, it is free to get in, with a recommended donation of 200 HUF.

Good way to spend an hour. For those that like looking around iconic buildings this is a must see during a visit to Budapest. Great place to walk round and admire the architecture and also well worth a walk up the 300-odd steps to see the fantastic panoramic view across the city.

Nothing special. Huge but uninteresting Cathedral from the very end of the XIXth century. Classicist inside with a lot of historicism, no specific articrafts but the so called Holy Right, the legendary piece of the hand of the first Hu king (St. Stephan, the statefounder).

Great views! . My partner, some friends and I visited this place during a rainy day however that did not disrupt the views we got. I would recommend a visit here, however there are a lot of stairs so if the lifts are out be prepared to walk up quite a few flights of stairs. Well worth it though.

Stunningly beautiful interior. Visited on the first night of our trip to Budapest. Free to enter, a massive bonus unlike many other cathedrals. The quality of the interior decoration is second to none and highly recommended.

Breathtaking structure. A beautiful and very impressive church in the centre, with regular organ retical concerts held. Climb to the top for a breathtaking view, then wander around the square and little cafes for lunch and refreshments. A perfect day.
Lovely sight. Bring your cameras. Admission is a recommended donation, and well worth it. Take your time in this cathedral. Flash photos are not allowed.

One of my favourite places in Budapest.. Walked to this church on our first day in Budapest. Wandered in and decided to go up the tower.... we paid only a small amount for the privilege and prepared ourselves for hundreds of steps up to the top. We were delighted when we discovered a lift! Views from the top were something special.
Mesmerizing. We were there during a Christmas light show and it was just amazing. We took a lot of pictures and videos.

The balance of church and state. The two tallest buildings in Budapest are this basilica and the Parliament. There are wonderful views from the balcony around the towers. It is not goos for people with a fear of heights. The church is easily visited on any stroll along the Danube.

Beautiful is the only word for it.. Even if you are a little weary of looking at churches in Europe , St. Stephen's Basilica in Budapest is really beautiful. Built from a light coloured stone and facing a large square and pedestrian street leading to the river, the basilica is a special landmark. The square is surrounded by cafes and restaurants and the who,e area is both vibrant and restful.

Great ecclesiastical architecture building. One of the tallest buildings in Budapest, together with ParliamentFrom the dome, panoramic views of Budapest.In addition, there is possibility of going to one of organ concerts, to enjoy its good acousticsBeautiful image of the building illuminated at night.
Beautiful view. Great for travellers who are generally fit and healthy; who are keen to climb up more than 300 steps. But the view is great up in the tower.
Beautiful building. Full of history and stunning to look round, the gold guild work is beautiful and if you are lucky enough to go when a service is on the acoustics are amazing.

Beautiful Basilica. Beautiful Basilica and one of the highest buildings in Budapest (96 meters high - when in doubt always guess 96 in Budapest...). It's technically free, but the suggested donation is almost mandatory... Worth the price anyway.

Beautiful, but shallow. Having seen a few other historically significant European cathedrals, St. Stephen's is not something to write home about. While very pretty and ornately decorated, the inside lacks the character to keep you interested. There are very few statues and significant artifacts. You can see everything in 5 minutes.
Nice. Big church right in the middle of the historical center of the city. It is possible to get inside every day, free of charge. It is a special building, it is worth seeing.

A quick and easy stop. We visited a lot of churches on our European trip and this was one of the more memorable ones. They asked a small donation to get in, but worth it to help preserve a beautiful structure like this. There were plenty of people inside, but no lines to wait in and no crowds to fight. Once you're inside, you can wander around and take pictures, keeping in mind it's still a functioning church. The downside for us was that some portions were closed off due to private ceremonies. Even so, there were plenty of architecture and art to appreciate inside. This makes for an easy venue to visit during a walking tour of Budapest.

Outstaining and impressive. From the outside, you need to walk around all the various facades to get the full cultural experience. Your camera will not stop taking snaps. It is worth to purchase a ticket to go inside and be further WOW'd. You are able to take photographs in the interior and dress code just smart and appropriate. Climb the tower if you feel you can but be prepared for a wait as very popular. Check opening times on web site as times when closed or not open to the public due to services etc.
best moment of my life. I got married in this beautiful BasilicThe architecture is stunning.I have such great memories of this place
So beautiful . The most beautiful basilica I've seen. Such serene feeling when inside and the viewing tower on a good day gives the most fantastic 360 view of beautiful Budapest.A must visit!
God what a place. They ask a 200 HUF access fee, but give it you will not regret it! It's so beautiful and so peacefull, you cannot mis this!

Beautiful church!!. Just looking at this church from the outside is incredible. Make a donation to see the inside which is magnificent. There was a line to go up into the bell tower? We did not do that but sure it was worth the wait. Budapest is just beautiful on both sides of the river
St. Stephen's . Always love to visit cathedrals. Beautiful interior. Love the stained glass. Don't miss the visit to the catacombs. Going up was not worth it.

Heavenly church!. Absolutely beautiful (tied with Parliament as my #1 vote for Best Attraction in Budapest). We attended a Sunday morning Mass (in Hungarian) there. As usual, I find this is a great way to learn how to pronounce words in a foreign language. We did not have time to climb the tower for the view but would hope to do that in the future.

Beautiful grandeur. As churches go this one is pretty amazing. The architecture is awe inspiring and serene. The grandiose details take your breath away. Definitely recommended as a stop in the tour of Budapest.

Lovely . The basilica is strikingly beautiful, with a domed roof and elegant columns inside. The altar is simpler than you'd expect from such an ornate church but the inner domed roof is drop dead gorgeous. I would gladly go back again.
Great Place. Stunning area, very clean, great views over the entire city and surrounding area on a clear day .Looking forward to our next trip to this city.

Beautiful! Pay to go to the top!!!. The Basilica is just an awesome experience. The area that it is located in is very cute and safe. The inside of the church was nice to look at yes, but going to the top of the dome for beautiful views of Budapest was the best part! Free or suggested donation to go inside, but make sure you buy the dome ticket before you get to the elevator. They do not sell tickets at the top. The top dome was not crowded at all and had a great view of the city.
Well worth a visit if you enjoy looking round churches and cathedrals.. Lovely building, well worth a visit if you enjoy looking at churches and cathedrals, or any building, for the architecture.

Don't miss the view from the dome. St. Stephen's Basilica is a must see for anyone visiting Budapest. The architecture is awe-inspiring and the view from the top is the best in the city. Incredible views of the Parlament, the Buda Castle, the river, Pest etc. It's easily accessible by public transportation (go to the Arany Janos utca stop with the blue metro or take the yellow line to Bajcsy-Zsilinszky u.). With lots of restaurants and gift shops nearby, the area is almost too touristy but with Budapest being a living, breathing city, there is no shortage of locals going about their daily business either. The walk up to the dome might be challenging to some, but my 10 yr old had no problems whatsoever. I believe there is an elevator as well, at least to a portion of the way up. Once up there, there's plenty of space to stop and take photos and the "railing" is a solid, thick stone wall, so most will feel safe even that high up. The treasury is interesting but if you're short on time, this is the part to skip. The interior is gorgeous of course and if you're lucky you might even witness a wedding like we did.Entrance to the basilica is free but you need to purchase a ticket to go up the dome and a separate ticket to see the treasury.
Stunning. Definitely worth a visit. It is free to enter and it is beautiful. Externally & internally building is stunning.

A Sunday must !. I'm a bit of a church obsessive when abroad and knew this was one not to be missed!Although probably the most busiest of days to choose I'd definitely say visit on a Sunday I was so lucky to hear the church in service and it was lovely . I'm not religious in anyway I just love the beauty of the buildings and the work detail inside.This church is at number one for me it's undescribable ... it's one for your own eyes.

Beautiful, but crowded.. Don't go for the photography, unless you go early in the morning. A beautiful structure in a beautiful part of the city, surrounded by life. Go for dinner at one of the nearby restaurants.The building was unfortunately adorned with large banners, and as a photographer, I have to say it was disappointing. I don't expect all architecture to cater to photographers, but the major attractions should consider it.I went by St Stephens EVERY DAY. Why? Because it really is beautiful, well maintained, and good for the soul. And it looks different at all times of the day.I sat nearby one evening and had a beer in the square and just watched the people go by - it was very soothing, and I recommend it. Did not do a tour,

Very beautifull. if you time it properly you can even attend church. The Basilica is a beautifull church with a explendid design.The acustics are so good that they have a few concerts for classic and organ music.Appart from the church you should relax and enjoy the space. Sit at a cafe, walk to the river, take your time and enjoy. It is really nice at night.
What a nice Basilca. We went at this Basilca for our Sunday 10am mass ... lovely mass a jewel of a basilca ... A nice square in fron that leed you to the danube river

Inspiring. This Basilica is elegant but not overwhelming. There is a richness in the materials that have been used in building it that lends to the worshipful feeling of the sanctuary and chapel. A definite must.
Beautiful Basilica. This is a must do place to visit. Stunning inside with lots to see. A lovely example of a church. Gets quite busy so an early morning visit is best
A beautiful building. A beautiful building in the center of the city. Well worth a visit for the luxurious interior alone.

Go to the top. When we visited there was a wedding going on. so we had to peek in from the side, and we did not get to see St. Stephens mummified hand....which was slightly disappointing. How ever for a small fee, you can climb to the top of the dome, about 350 steps. This was well worth doing, the views are spectacular. Our travel motto, go to the top, it is worth it
St Stephens Basilica. Great place and fantastic views. Love the Organ recital one evening too. Very central.. Good to use the hop on hop off bus too as en route.

A magnificent place for mass.. First if all I want to say this was the most visually impressive place of worship that I have ever seen. The paintings and the domes and the marble and the gold, were overwhelmingly beautiful. The mass started at 6pm on Sunday night and there were many people from all over the world there. You could hear though many Hungarian voices joining in on the prayers. It was a wonderful experience even though I only understood about three words.

Interesting church but dimly lit inside. This cathedral is named after Hungary's first Christian King (St. Istvan). It is dimly lit so feels a bit gloomy at times. Interestingly, the high altar has a statue of King/St. Istvan rather than Jesus or Mary. There is a beautiful dome and don't miss the stained glass windows in the Szent Jobb Kapolna (a side chapel) - they are simply gorgeous and very colorful. Remember this church was built around 1896 so it is not old.
Beautiful. A magnificent landmark that I would highly recommend, a humbling experience, would definitely visit again.

Impressive. One of the most polished cathedral in Europe adorned with gold and marble. Went during church service the first time so we had to go back to a second look when it was more accessible. The climb on top is well worth it. Nice terraces and restaurants all around

The Hand of St Stephen is over-rated -- but Basilica is worth a visit. The hand is located in a vault down a corridor to the left of the alter. Impossible really to see anything unless you are 7 feet tall ... or taller. The Basilica itself is more interesting. My husband and son paid to climb up for the view. It and Parliament, both at 96 meters, are the tallest structures in Budapest.

Very impressive. We've been there on August 15th, this summer.
One of the greatest and most impressive places in the world/
A.K.

We just had to have a second visit. Having visited the impressive Basilica during the day, we heard about an evening concert due to take place there later in the week. We felt we just had to return so we bought tickets, Fabulous classical music with unbelievable accoustics, it was a very moving experience. If you get the chance don't miss it!

Exquisite. This beautiful cathedral is located in the heart of the city. During the day you can attend concerts or else just visit the cathedral for only 200 forints (64 cent). Although I didn't get the opportunity, my friend went to the top of this cathedral for about €2 and he told us 'no camera could capture the beauty of this view'. If you're in Budapest you must go see this!
WOW. WOW is just the word to describe the St. Stephen's Basilica.No matter from where you see it (it can be noticed from many streets), just walk by and enjoy the view.
Fabulous. Very beautiful and peaceful. Worth paying to go up the tower as wonderful view. Essential seeing in Budapest.
Stunning inside. Very ornate.. Massive space and tall ceiling. Lots of gold. Worth the climb for the view. Saw,the hand of Saint Stephen, A relic from 1086.

Really nice cathedral on a lovely squere - closed in the evening. It's so big that you have to go at the end of square to take a photo. I didn't went inside because it was closed in the evening and I regret it now. Exterior is really stunning. Main frontal part (looking from the square) reminds on Pantheon in Athena, like all neo-classical buildings. I noticed that the pillars are made in all 3 main classical styles. You can see Ionic, Doric and Corinthian capitels (top pillar tips) if you pay attention. And, of course, there is a dome, which is piece of art for itself. It's one of the tallest buildings in Budapest, so if you are lost in the city centre, just look for the towers and you will probably know where you are.

Fantastic Views from the top . This is a must if visiting Budapest - the building is beautiful from the outside. We paid approx £1.40 to go to the top - you can take stairs or get a lift. There are fantastic 360 degree views looking out all over the city. You can walk all the way around and the views are truly stunning!

Amazing inside . So much amazing views inside and historic things to see, you just put a donation in the box, you can light a candle for someone if you like, we did you just have to put another donation in the box.

Impressive Cathedral. St. Stephen's Cathedral is an impressive building. When standing close to it, it's hard to believe that it was done by human hands, and it is not even the largest building you can find in the city. Yet it is a symbol of greatness, bearing the name of the most iconic king of Hungary.
Serene. A very calm, serene place, where you can click lot of pictures including your selfies. The ringing bells are so soothing.
If you like churches. You can't miss this if you like visiting churches. It's got St. Stephen's hand and marvelous sculptures adorning the church. Better if it's guided tour.

Best view from Pest. Budapest being separated by the Danube, Pest being the more dynamic yet lower altitude side of the city, the Basilica offers a fabulous 360 degree view from this part of the city. Not to be missed on any account.

Organ concerts on Thursdays!. The basilica has one of the most impressive interiors I have ever seen, with red marble and gold, it is a must see. But the best happens on Thursdays, when you can catch a concert. It is amazing, don't miss if you're in town.

Beautiful. Budapest has some of the most beautiful buildings and this is defiantly one of them.
Right in the city centre, easy to find. The basilica is truly breathe taking.

Lovely interior. The cathedral is well worth a visit. The interior is extremely nice. You can also go up the tower which doesn't cost much, you get views of the square below & the rooftops of the surrounding area.

Go and See. This is another beautiful place to visit while your in Budapest.
The building itself is lovely and is very beautiful to visit.
The holy right hand. We stopped by the basilica on our walking tour. There was a full orchestra playing right outside the basilica. It was absolutely awesome!!!

Awesome cathedral. This cathedral is majestic as it stands out of the surrounding buildings. It is really impressive by its size and its architecture. The entrance is free but you must pay to go up of it. One of many highlights in Budapest!

Must see ! Beautiful interior . Only got to see for a few minutes as it was closing for a wedding. Beautiful interior! Didn't have time to wait in que for the tower but looked amazing! Donation of HUF 200 to enter €0.60, tower is separate ! So pretty outside too
worth a visit. very impressive buiding inside and out,night and day and for views off the dome. Also has regular music concerts

Szent Jobb (Mummified right hand of St. Stephen). It may look a little plain (exterior) as compared to Matthias Church on Castle hill, but the interior is equally impressive!
Szent Jobb - mummified right hand of St Stephen (1st King of Hungary) is a must view sacred relic.
Beautiful Church. Beautiful Church, a must visit when you're in Budapest. The building is well maintained, you will ne amazing with the interior as well.
Nice. Very nice structure. There is a small entrance fee. Make sure you ask for a student discount. There is a small souvenir shop inside. Enjoyable.

Worth a look. We walked from our ship- bit of a walk through town but good to get out and get the exercise . Lots of lovely buildings on the way. No charge to get in but a donation is received gratefully. Beautiful basilica. Some people get tired of looking at churches but I can't get enough of these beautiful European churches😊
Majestic.. Beautiful Basilica, best to go when the crowds have died down. Very majestic and don't miss the rose ice creams around the corner.

A beautiful church. The inside of the basilica is stunning. Lots of paintings to admire. Around the back is the right-hand relic from a saint in the past. There is an interesting art nouveau drinking fountain near by.

A must visit if you have the time.. This is a very beautiful church and well-worth a visit. The square in front of the church is expansive, but it is worth walking around the building to get pictures from all sides.

St Stephens Cupola great views of Budapest. A wedding was taking place so only went up the tower /cupola for the views. Quite a steep climb so take the lifts, There may be a wait as these lifts only take 4-6 persons.

Beautiful landmark . I recommend checking it out just before sunset time. During the day and after dark it's a different experience and both worth being there for. The area around is very active. Also going late night after shops are closed is a nice relaxing time to enjoy it without the crowd.

Unenthusiastic. This church didn't do much for me. Too ornate. The dark red marble didn't help. I'm not telling you not to go, but I've been happier in other churches. Note that it's free to enter, but the donation box and guy at the door give you the impression that you have to pay. Put a small coin in the box and no one's the wiser.
Gorgeous building. The decor inside of the basilica was amazing and the building itself is very impressive. We also went to see the relic of St Stephen's hand.
A must see attr attraction. This is the place where you must stop. Go inside and on the top to. You will get a lovely view. Also must have a coffe at the bottom of it. It's a lovely square .

Beautiful. This is a stunning piece of architecture and well worth a visit if you like that kind of thing. The interior is very opulent with loads of gold everywhere and you just be Shhh at all times!

A Grand Basilica. An absolutley fantastic building in the heart of Budapest. Beautiful interior with columns, stained glass windows, paintings and the altar. Certainly an eye-opener and will leave you with a sore neck from looking up at the grandeur of the place!

Loved it!. An absolutely stunning building with a very interesting history. My family and I visited during the summer and so was fairly busy, but we managed to wonder around inside and climbed to the top very easily! You do have to pay (though not very much) to go to the top of the dome but is well worth it! The views are incredible, but be prepared for a lot of steps!! (There is also a lift)

Beautiful architecture and stunning interior. A must on any sight seeing tour of Budapest, a city full of great buildings and sightsBeautiful architecture and stunning interior (voluntary contribution of about 200 HUF)

Beautiful! . This is one if the iconic places in the downtown of Budapest and one of the people gathering especially in the evenings. I'm not quite sure if it's accessible but the facade is glamorous and the great space in front of it is inviting to hang out.
Surprisingly beautiful. Beautiful outside, surprising inside. The most exagerated decorated church I've seen besides the Vatican. Really worth getting in.

Wondeful interior and great view from the top of the tower.. Absolute must - entry to the Basilica is a voluntary contribution of about 200 Florint per person which is very reasonable. Highly recommend you pay additional amount to go up the tower as great views over the city of Budapest. You can take a lift up half way and then a second lift to the top or use the stairs (the whole way or half way). Great history so make sure you have a guide book to inform you - we did a bike tour on another day and the guide informed us all about the building and it's history.

Check the photos inside. Thousands of tourists take photos everyday of this basilica, a fraction visits inside. Although I think that the inside of Mathias church is nicer, this basilica deserves a visit as well. Besides the church itself, there is an interesting tiny photo exhibition near the entrance showing how it used to be and it is very different, more like a Greek temple.It took over 50 years to build the basilica and it is just the same height as the parliament (96m) to show that the Church was as important as the state.
Loved it! The inside is marvellous!. I went there twice because the first time I was a bit in a rush and each time I loved it. The inside is magnificent.
For the Arty. If you are in to churches and like the century old buildings you would find time well spent to visit
Great church. This is in the middle of the city and you will just come up to it when you walk the city. Don't forget to get in.
Very big. I din t enter because it was a long waiting line but i saw it from outsideIt s beautiful and very bigWorth it to go and see it. 100 m next to a metro exit (blue line)
what a marvelous church. love the architecture of the church. make sure you come back at night to take some night pictures. and visit Fisherman's Bastion as well
Great. Really nice to just walk through. If you pay 500ft you can take an elevator up to the very top of the basilica so there's a great view over the city
Beautiful architecture with a cheap entrance fee. The Basilika is beautifully constructed and worth the visit for sure. Entrance is only 200 ft. A great experience on a day of sightseeing.

A competitor. The right side of the Danube needed a Cathedral to compete with Matthias Cathedral, so this is it: St. Stephen's Basilica. This building should be visited on the outside by night and in the inside by day.

Big. This basilica makes an impression at first sight since it is quite huge. We only took the tour for the panoramic view in the tower. It took two elevators to get all the way up and the view was spectacular. Very imposing and impressive structure.

Exqusite!. St. Stephens square is gorgeos with the cathedral front and center. There is a tiled courtyard in front making it a beautiful sight from outside. Then once inside, the cathedral is phenomenal-it is so beautiful! The medieval art is breathtaking as are the naves. Once out of the basilica down the cobbled stone street are various 5 star restaurants and eateries and equisite architecture.

Imposing structure. Great panorama.. St. Stephens Basilica is a huge imposing church only a five minute walk from the Parliament. Visiting the panorama tower is definitely worth the price (500 ft adult/ 400ft student). You can go up by stairs or elevator.

Great Pomp in the heart of the City. Worth even two visits, if you miss the cupola gallery opening times. So check that out when planning. You will enjoy a meorable 360 degrees full panorama of the City from up there. Colourful marble all-around inside and the great golden pomp of the church can be seen everywhere. (Beautiful 100 years old betlehem, kind of nativity set, during Christmas time and even a cosy market with all the requsites of a Central-European Xmas-fair.)
Awesome. This is really a BIG church!! Nice and "imposing" in its external from! To visit it is a "must " It could contain till 8000 people!

Wonderful Interior. This is a huge, gorgeous Neoclassical church, definitely worth a quick stop at the very least. My friends and I were definitely wowed. The multiple grand domes and many different kids of marble inside made for a strikingly different experience than other churches in the city. A couple unique things in the basilica: St. Stephen, not Jesus, is in the dome over the altar (they had to get special permission from the Vatican to do this), and in a back chapel is the famous relic of St. Stephen's hand.
Outstanding architecture. Wander through the beautifully decorated historical basilica and appreciate the fabulous frescos and ceiling murals

Beautiful views . This church is definitely worth a visit- beautiful inside with great view at the top for a small fee. There is a lift or stairs to the top and the same for coming down. I went in the early evening just before sunset and was really worth it.

A little piece of Rome in Budapest. Stepping into St Stephens for the first time and it really was like I was back in one of Rome's grand basilica's. In a way it reminds me of the Basilica di Santa Maria Maggiore. in Rome. Very beautiful & absolutely worth a visit, (even if just a quick visit) if you are in Budapest. Stunning from the outside as well on a glorious sunny day. Centrally located (pest side) and easy to get to.
Amazing views. We spent a very enjoyable morning wandering around the basilica. The views of Budapest were magnificent from each level.
Beautiful Cathedral and square nearby. Cathedral is well worth visiting and there may even be a band playing music in the square outside at weekends!
Excellent. We visited in the afternoon. It provides very nice Panasonic view of Budapest city, Denube river, Parlament hall and other buildings. Recommend.

Spectacular. The basilica is hard to miss as the spire seems to appear as you round almost all corners in the city. It was the first place we visited in Budapest as it was about 5 mins walk from our hotel and it's certainly a great introduction to the city. The outside is wonderful and the pedestrian free streets around the basilica make it even better. Once inside, even if you're non religious, it seems a calm and serene place to be. If you've not been to Buda or been to the top of any other buildings then the bell tower is a must for the view of the city. It's a long walk up (parts of it can be managed by lift) and for height phobics not the place to be – the last part of the climb inside the tower on metal exposed stairs seemed particularly scary!! The view is great rather than spectacular but does give a wonderful overview of the city.

Gob smacking. I had only seen the outside but today went inside. Boy this place is magnificent . Again, I've been to many a church/basilica and this is probably top ten. St Stephens hand out the back is unusual , but the whole place is special.

Simply Astonishing!. The St. Stephen's Basilica has a rich history of many stories, most of which had taken place during the war. You get a sense of calmness while you're inside. It has beautiful statues inside carved to the ultimate detail. You can also pay 600 HUF (2 euro) and take the lift or stairs ( i prefer the lift) to get to the top of the tower to get a mesmerising panoramic view of the city!

St; Stephens Basilica. This is an absolutely beautiful church and well worth a visit. it is enormous insideand very ornate and in pristine condition, a great tribute to the people who maintain this great piece of history. The area around the Basilica is also lovely, with many restaurants and bars. We had a lovely lunch around the corner in a small Italian restaurant.

Dont miss a concert. We booked an evening concert - it was great . light beutiful callasicel music (perfect for non exsperts ) - the acustis are wonderful and the overall excprience in the lit up church is memorble

Incredible views for low cost.. For less than £2, St Stephen's Basilica offers some of the most amazing views of the city through the panorama tower.It's a long climb up - 302 steps - but the views at the end is so worth it. You can see across to Gellert Hill, Parliament and Margaret Island, whilst also getting a unique glimpse around the centre of the town itself and the brilliant architecture on display across the city.For the cost, it's a can't miss opportunity.

Stunning. Wonderful place to visit. Interesting, beautiful and cool on a burning hot 39 degree day. As soon as you step in you escape from the frenetic hustle and bustle outside. It felt very calming.Acoustics amazing, choir was good.
Magnificient. We visited St. Stephen's Basillica. It is Magnificient. Highly recommended for first time visitors to Budaoest.
Beautiful. Worth seeing. Beautiful architecture and it is heart of the city. All hop on hop off buses will stop here you need to buy a ticket to visit inside.

Good tourist attraction. Like any other basilica, it was a good view but boring for me as I don't really enjoy static things. But with the Parliament building and the freedom statue it is a good attraction for history lovers.
300 plus steps and a great view. Well worth the climb to to top for a great 360 view of surrounding area, very reasonable price in comparison to other similar towers

Great view. Impressive church with an option to walk all the way up to the bell tower and see the sights which were amazing. We also spotted the High Note Skybar from here which should be your next stop after climbing the tower (which is exhausting to do in mid-summer)

Beautiful. I thought that this was going to be just another church, it was but was more than that too. It's huge and inside is beautiful with decoration and art work. Lots of visitors and a bit too much noise for a reverent place. 200HUF (€0.67) donation recommended to enter.
Must See in Budapest. Centrally located with great views of the city. You will need to climb a large set of spiral stairs, so be prepared for it.

To the top! . This is a beautiful cathedral that needs to be seen! On Mondays they host a 45 minute organ concert which is worth doing. You can also climb to the top of the dome which is worth the 400-500ft to see amazing 360 degree views of the city! Enjoy!

Another site to see.. Fountain outside is a place to see the romantic holiday makers and locals, dancing to slow music.
In the day time you can just sit peacefully and sample the buzz of Budapest. Near shops and food outlets.

lovely - walk to the top for the views.. Beautiful Basilica although only about 165 years old. deceptive. Beautiful interior, and the view from the top if you do the walk - about 300+ steps up a tight spiral stair-case. - There is a charge. There is a lift for part of it if you can't do the steps.
Beautiful church. This building is absolutely stunning. I arrived just as a wedding was finishing so I was able to see the beautiful interior in its entirety with the beautiful colourings.

Center of the land. The church is in a very central position both topographically and emotionally, as the Sacred Hand of Szent Istvan is conserved here. You feel that people deeply believe in this central role of their patron saint.

Unreal. . Not only is it so huge but it is absolutely spectacular!!!! The interior is so rich and beautiful and we were lucky enough to be there during Sunday mass. Colors, detail, and architecture not to be missed so stunning.

Really beautiful. Breathtakingly beautiful on the inside. We turned up when a service was on and it was completely awe-inspiring, and I like churches so have been in many, but nothing so grand. Ornate and has a great sense of history. Even if I went back I would visit again. A must do, especially as it is convenient for Deak Ferenc Ter station, and lots of casual eating places.
A beautiful church. Visited this basilica on the hop on hop off bus. The architecture, art and decoration are stunning. Worth a visit.
Impressive. St. Stephens is centrally located and just gorgeous. We were killing time before a business meeting nearby. Beautiful inside and out, and well worth visiting.
Sightseeing. Well worth a visit. Beautiful art, decoration and architecture. A very quiet peaceful church in a busy city!
Stunning Church. We walked up the square to see St. Stephen's Basilica. We chose not to go in, there was a wedding going on (it was Saturday afternoon) - what a lovely building.

Impressive cathedral. This is our second visit to St. Stephens in the last year, this time for church services. If you have never experienced a church service in a language other than your own in a magnificent church it is something to try. You get to hear the acoustics (even though nowadays they are enhanced by a speaker system) and the feel of how it attended by the faithful.When services are not going on, you can take the steps to the top and lookout over Budapest
Sightseeing. This was included as a part of our Viking River Cruise. Our tour guide was excellent and at the finish of the tour we stayed to go inside the church.
Great visit. It's a nice place to be visited. Makes sense and it's very close to the Opera and the center of the city. I will suggest to take 15 minutes to have a nice view.

If you have mobility issues. St. Steven's Basilica is very special to us. My husband and I attended a New Year's Eve dance at St. Steven of Hungary Parish in NYC in 1962. So it was important for us to visit this beautiful Cathedral . However, the many steps were overwhelming at first. But thanks to the perseverance of my friend, we discovered that there are lifts for wheelchairs. People do not always speak English in Budapest, so it may take a bit of an effort. But it is worth it. We actually went through the Catacombs and up another lift to the Church. The Basilica was magnificent. It is hard to take it all in. We even got to see the Relic hand of St. Steven which was returned to the Church on August 19, 1945. We did not climb the 360 steps to the top.

Absolutely Beautiful. I've been to so many basilicas and cathedrals, it has almost become, "oh, not another one...". However, I must say, this particular one is worth venturing into. Maybe because religious activity was frowned upon under Communism, so there is a recency and symbolism to it, but I found it worthwhile. It's pretty. Step inside and go see it while you're walking through the square.

Wow- A church that is actually free to enter. I usually do not visit churches, because I feel that after breaking the backs of dirt poor people for centuries to build these amazing structures, it is immoral of them to continue charging for people to come in and see them. What a money racket that has gone on for centuries. This place is an exception though. You can actually go in and tour the building for free. I would love to go here and listen to an organ concert sometime. I think it would sound pretty good in the hall there.

Beautiful. This large Cathedral is beautiful inside and out. Inside some of it is roped off so we could only see part of it at a distance. We attended a concert inside the Cathedral and when the main lights went on we could see everything much better.

Beautiful Church and nice view from the top. Very beautiful church and cozy. You can get to see as well St. Stephen's hand that is there mummified (quite awkward but anyway)and if you take the stairs up there is a magnificent view of the city. There is an elevator as well

A beautiful place to visit. This is a wonderful place to visit whether you're religious or not.The paintings and architecture are amazing and could probably not be replicated today. If you decide to take in the fantastic views from the top of the cathedral be prepared for a lengthy wait if you go at a busy time. You pay a nominal amount at a kiosk and then walk along to a tiny lift which takes you to a large upper level. From here you walk around to another even smaller lift to take you to the next level. You then walk up some metal stairs leading to the outside, where you can walk around the upper part of the building. The trip took around 40 mins from queueing to go up and then back down again.I would not recommend this for anyone with mobility issues.
Good. Good atmosphere with organ events can make you thrill but you should definitely visit it while you are in Budapest!!!!!

one of the biggest church in Europe. Spectacular, monumental and beutiful church in the center of Budapest. Come on and discover Budapest and Basilica. Near Basilica there are some nice place, restaurant, wine house. Tere is often get wedding in church, this is amazing.

Gorgeous!!. I'm not an artistic person and thus would not like to futher explain.We came here after dinner at Lugas Etterem directly behind the church.As it's free to view, I highly recommended it.There's a CITIBANK atm at the left side of the square.And further down straight from this Church, you'll find lots of bars and then the famous Chain Bridge.

Free to enter church!. The Basilica of St Stephen is a beautiful building similar in design to St Pauls in London. It's worth visiting, it's free to enter and is located in a great area of Pest not far from the shopping district. A donation of 200HUFs is recommended and it's worth it. Access is from some steps and there's a charge to go up the tower. Photography isn't restricted but taking photos during services is disrespectful.

Very beautiful interior deco. The ouside is not that impressive but the inside is fabulous. There's a box for donation but it is free to enter. Small tickets for the dome and small exhibition under the entrance hall. The exhibition can only be accessed by lift. If not interested in clothes, artifacts of a religious nature, no need to go. The dome is accessible by stair (very high climb) and by lift. Didn't use the lift, so not sure how it is. It's a good view on top. And there's toilet as well.

Very impressive cathedral. Visit the church is free, but has a donation box at the entrance.If you want to go up to the tower and watch the city view you have to pay a low price.The church is very large and impressive.

Fantastic interiors. St Stephen's basilica is probably most opulently decorated inside church I've been to. It undeniably will be in my top 3 places to visit in Budapest. Square in front of the basilica and adjacent streets have wide variety of places to eat.
Stunning interior. Fantastic architecture but even with all the tourists a very calm, spiritual place. The dome interior is just incredible. The outlook over the square is magnificent.
Beautiful Building. Interesting building with lovely interior and exterior. There are services conducted during the day and evening and there was

Incredible Building - Fab Views. The Basilica is amazing inside and out. Stepping into the building took my breath away - it's so ornate, there are statues and paintings everywhere you look and it is all tipped in gold - stunning. The only thing you can do is stand and look, there is so much to see.We took the trip up to the outside of the dome and walked all the way around - the views from up there are amazing. It costs next to nothing to do this - there is a lift but be aware there are plenty of steps too.Inside is very quiet and calming, don't miss this if you visit Budapest.

Not to be missed but please have respect!. There was a service going on here when we walked in and I found it very disrespectful that people were still talking and taking photos while the service was going on. We lit a candle and sat and listened to the service. Beautiful place to visit.
A fantastic building. Very beautiful building. What a fantastic building I am worried that I may over use the phrase must seeButIt is a must see.

E Mather. Beautiful Bascilica with domed roof. Beautiful art work and the construction of the dome very unique, especially as it's housed under a wooden exterior roof. Well worth going to the roof area, cost extra to see the views over Budapest. One of the best places to see in the city.
Amazing View. The church itself was amazing but the view at the top was well worth the climb. You can see all of Budapest from the church, who need the London Eye!
Unexpected Concert!!. The day we visited the Basilica there was a concert inside. Was very unexpected, but amazing. The beauty of the church was more than I can put into words.

Beautiful building. Wonderful architecture and the most beautiful stained Windows. There's a type of stillness in there and very calming. I always cover my knees with a rolled up skirt I keep in my bag (over the shorts) and shoulders covered with a nylon scarf also in bag as its respect. I was surprised to see some ladies ignore the moral and were not pulled up on it. Nonetheless, the view from the top roof was amazing we could see the whole city. Definitely a place to make for in Budapest.

Impressive. I am not a fan of churches or Basilica's for that matter, but this building is stunning. I would also recommend you climb to the top. There is a lift, but if you are claustrophobic then walk up!
Beautiful. We were lucky enough to arrive as a wedding procession started down the aisle. The organ playing full blast sounded marvellous.

Great Architecture . Big and great architecture building. St. Stephen was the biggest church I've even been. It's free to go in and there are some walking tours you can join. It's better to read the church history before you go in. Just be quite as some are praying. The organ concert at night was beautiful. Worth a visit.
City center. This was named after the first Christian King of Hungary. Beautiful church and place in the city. Our Granddaughters history, my Mother's birthplace. City full of history for my Family .

Beautiful. The Basilica was 3 minutes walking distance from our hotel so we saw it most days. Every time we approached it we forgot how massive it is. There are lots of bars and restaurants around it so it was perfect to sit and look at (which I didn't realise how lovely it would be). If you're not in that area make a trip to see it, it would be worth it.
Must see in Pest. St Stephen's is one of the most beautiful basilicas in Europe on the inside and outside. It is a must see if you are in Budapest.
Beautiful. This church is very beautiful and largest and tallest church in Budapest. It is roman catholic basilica and a tourist attraction.
Absolutely beautiful on the inside . This church was absolutely beautiful on the inside. There are a lot of churches in the area but this is must-see.

Beautiful and a great view of the City. The Basilica is beautiful. Filled with stain glass, statues, artwork and places of holy reverence. They ask for donations at several prayer areas. I prayed at the statue of Mary and I lit two candles in honor of my parents. You can place a donation to have the lights turn on at the housing of St. Stephan's hand. They offer many concerts, which we plan to see later. We also walked to the top of observation area. You can go by elevator or steps. I counted over 150 steps in one of two sections. Once at the top, you can walk around the dome to get a lovely 360 degree view of the city! It was worth the climb!

So beautiful!. Such a beautiful church, one of the coolest i've visited! And if you've never seen a 1000 year old hand before, then this is your chance! The holy right hand is from some famous king who died 1038... Other than that, just a nice thing to spend 15-30 minutes in on a hot day in Budapest.
Gorgeous building. If you are into architecture or history it is well worth a visit. There is a lot to see. It can get busy during high season.

Absolute walking tours. What a beautiful Basilica. We attended mass there during our visit, it was unforgettable. The Basilica is exquisite , we saw the relics of St Stephen's hand......the magnificent ceiling and statue of St Stephen are mind blowing!

Serenity. The ambience is divine,the building, artistic and architectural design is next to none.There was a mass service going on but the church still had the back of the church opened to tourist who kept trouping in & out but still slightly trying to obey the "Please Silent " sign .We took pictures and none stopped us.I will highly recommend this church for a visit in budapest.
