Lovely Wedding Venue . We happened to be passing as a wedding ceremony was ending. It was lovely to see the newly married couple, and what a wedding venue!!!

St Stphens Basilica. It is one the most beautiful buildings in Budapest inside out! We visited the building during Christmas holidays and we had the chance to impress its festive version. The christmas market there was also the best in the city and the decoration unique!

Great. Amazing cathedral with gorgeous interior. In the back chamber is a hand of a Saint Stephen (Istvan in Hungarian).For a small fee you can get up to the roof (via stairs or elevator) and enjoy the great view of the city. There are two elevators, first one takes you to the middle gallery and second to the top.Highly recommended.

The saint's hand is inside - make sure you go all the way back. It's a gorgeous church, but the saint's hand is the winner. Go all the way in the back to find it. I heard you can go to the top but we didn't do it.
Lovely Place. Lovely place to visit. Had to pay to enter but well worth it. Lovely inside and out. Views over the city from this area with cafes, bars and shops near by.

Worth the price of admission!. This is an amazing cathedral. For the price of admission, you get to go upstairs along the gallery also. St. Stephen's has an amazing interior. It is not a place for reflection as there are too many other tourists and tour groups going through, but it is a lovely place.

Nice basilica, not the biggest or most ornate. As basilicas go, this does not fall into the largest or most ornate category but it is nevertheless beautiful. Easy to access, well signposted from the Chain Bridge, no admission charge but donations accepted. Not much by way of description available for free. Relic of the hand may be seen in chapel to the back of the altar. There is a charge for lighting to see hand more clearly.

Concerts there are really amazing !!!!. This site is a must in Budapest but if you can attend a concert do it. I attented a organ concert with soprano, tenor, violin, trompet, and it was really fabulous and very affordable, it was not expensive at all.

Try to attend a music or organ recital. St Stephen's Basilica is Budapest's largest Church but not large as Basilicas often are. Going up to the dome gives a marvelous view of the city. There is a lift for most of the way.The interior is richly decorated but to really appreciate the interior one needs to enjoy a concert or organ recital and listen to the perfect acoustics. In Summer there is an organ performance most evenings at 17:00.

Amazing!. We passed by on accident and because of the somewhat free acces (they ask for a little donation at the entrance of about €1) went right in. When we entered our breath was taken away by the beautiful colors and architecture. The building itself on the outside is tremendous but inside it's even more beautiful.
stunning building. The scale of this building is impressive as are the views from the dome terrace.Try to get to a concert or organ recital for complete experience of the facility.

Church with entrance fee.. The most dominant church in Pest is huge building dedicated to St. Istvan, St. Stephen. It is monumental outside and more interesting inside. You need a lot of time to look at pictures, decorations, altars and cupola with nice light from above. But you need to pay to go inside. Fee is not huge - but it is inconvenient..
Beautiful Basilica. Although very impressive, it is not clear that it is free to enter the building. You are invite to donate for the church, which we did.

Stunning City Views. St Stephen's Bascilica offers amazing views of the city. It's a steady climb to the viewing gallery and depending on which side you go to there is a lift taking you on the final part of the ascent (or descent). It's a small fee to go up. The inside of the Bascilica is also stunning with beautiful stained glass windows and marble work throughout. For higher views of the city take a walk up to the Statue of Liberty above the Cave Church near the Gellert Spa.

Had a change to see a concert. When we come here, they have Student Music Concert. It's free. So we can enjoy it. But the negative side of this concert, we don't have chance to see the altar closely and there are many people at that time. So, it's not very comfortable for taking a tour inside the Basilica. Take a lift, pay 500HUF/person and enjoy the panorama tour on the top of the Basilica. It's the best for me.

Don't miss the view. This big cathedral is in classical style, the interior is spectacular - if you like this style. Interesting fact, that during the construction the dome collapsed.What is absolutely recommended is the view from the top, it is incredibly cheap (the church itself is free to visit). You can take elevator if needed or take the stairs if the queue is long. As this building is much taller than the average in Budapest you will see the city from top, but close enough to catch the details.
Another amazing building. Just an amazing building to see from both a distance and to get close to. Time pressure meant we didn't go in, but if you do have time it would be a place to explore.

A great concert venue. We were fortunate to be in Budapest at a time when concerts were on in the Basilica. The music performed was all Hungarian, and despite the desperately uncomfortable pews, was a joyous night. Not rot be missed.
gorgeous cathedral. Last year we visited St. Stephen's and they charged to get in This year, it was free. Church is really beautiful. Well worth the visit.

What a surprise!. The building is lovely from the outside but I was not expecting much inside but was surprised to see rich decor, painting and statues. It was like being in rome ! Well worth the visit

Beautiful building. The lifts to the top are in 2 stages. The first holds 6 people and the next holds only 4, so if it is a busy time, the queues are very long. Go down by the stairs. Church is pretty. Surprisingly there isn't a gift shop. Just a small area with limited, old touristy stuff

Incredibly inspiring. St. Stephen’s Basilica, the largest church in Budapest, is dedicated to Hungary’s first king, St. Stephen. About 8,500 people can get inside this beautiful Neoclassical cathedral at the same time. Szent István-bazilika—Hungarian for Saint Stephen Bazilika—is the largest Catholic church in Budapest, and was the sixth largest church building in Hungary before 1920. WWII saw the destruction of many phenomenal cathedrals, and this basilica is now the third largest church building in present-day Hungary. It is named to honor Stephen, the first King of Hungary (975–1038AD). It is one of the two tallest buildings in Budapest at 315 feet. It is 180 feet wide and 287 feet long. After 54 years of construction, it was completed in 1905, a time comparable to the Wright Brothers’ first flight. The architectural style is Neoclassical and the façade is complemented by two large bell towers. The largest bell weights over nine tons. Climb up 264 stairs for a commanding view of Budapest.
lovely historical building. worth a visit, lovely building good location, and central. Historical and filled with history. Probably spend a couple of hours, so just plan 2 hours at max.

View from on top is incredible.. Well worth a visit. The view from the top is incredible. Can either take the 302 steps or 2 lifts. Once up there, you can see the whole of Budapest. Close to the National Parliament and there is a clear view over the Danube to Buda. Cost 500 huf to go to the top of the basilica so cheap also. Check it out for 1/2 hour to an hour when sightseeing.
In Awe. Very nice church with a relic of the Saint's hand. Be sure to look up and notice the artwork on the ceiling.
Super nice!. Super nice! Even had achance to see it with a wedding in front. Great atmosphere - would go back here any time, also on the viewing platform.

Beautiful Basilica. We stayed very close to the basilica on our visit and found ourselves looking at it just about Everytime we went out. We saved our visits or our last day. Very majestic inside. They didn't want visitors in the pews but we were able to sit on some chairs to look up and admire the artwork.

Fantastic place to visit!. Located close to the heart of the city center close to a grand square you find the majestic Basilica. You can pay a small entrance fee (student reduction available) and access the viewpoint which circles the dome on the top. It offers an amazing view and different perspective over Budapest compared to the view from the castle which is on the other side of the river. You can also pay to access a room filled with old artefacts and jewellery which is beautiful. This is definitely something you need to visit if you decide to visit Budapest.

A Gilded Wonderland. If you like incredible gilding, high domed ceilings painted with angels, cherubs, saints and biblical figures, then this is for you. It's a beautiful building - really worth seeing. And one of the few main sights in Budapest that is free (besides a 200FT suggested donation).

Beautiful building. We visited on Monday, the building is stunning both inside and outside. It's an impressive building and the architecture is beautiful.Inside is ornate and decorative - definitely worth visiting.
Well worth the time for a visit. This church is even nicer in my opinion than St. Peter's in Rome. Also there is an organ concert on Friday evenings. Worth it.
Beautiful beyond words. I have traveled all over Europe and this is one of the most beautiful Basilica/Churches I have visited. It is a must see on your next visit to Budapest.

A great Tourist Attraction. It is one of the main Tourist Attractions .A Roman Catholic Basilica named in honour of Saint Stephen,the first King of Hungry whose right hand is kept as a relic in the church.It has two large bell towers which has the largest bell in hungry.

Great Basilica!. It is absolutely beautiful and majestic in the inside, as the outside. One thing I would totally suggest is to get to the top of the basilica to enjoy the view (there is a 500huf only ticket for that)! I consider visiting it is a must in Budapest.
St. Stephen's Basilica. Go up to the dome balcony and see all the city from there.Inside the basilica, don't miss the sounds of the majestic organ.

Be careful about the weddings. Especially on weekends whole day is wedding ceremony one after the other. Therefore, you are allowed to see only very few of the interior.If you prefer to go roof top, either you climb by stairs or by two lifts and few stairs.The view from top is worth climbing. Try to go early in order to be more free at the roof

Great building with naff staff. Very impressive building with free admission (are you listening Saint Pauls London) But unfortunately let down by the gordy and naff requirement to put coins into a slot to illuminate the Holy Relic. It spoils the experience and smacks of the bad old communist days!
Beautiful church!. The church is beautiful inside and out. It can get a little bit crowded tho. The church also locates at a very interesting location where you can easily stop for a bite or coffee.

Main Cathedral of Budapest. The main Cathedral of Budapest is situated in Pesta, very close to Donau. Is an impresive building in baroque style with lots of interesting points. I recommend a visit to the Treasure and to the Tower.

Very nice. Beautiful cathedral right in the centre of Budapest, surrounded by nice coffe places, restaurants, bars And ice cream parlours. You can go right up to the top of the building where the view is excellent!

A Huge Church. Another one of Budapest's monuments, a little more than 100 or 150 years old. Architecturally it did not impress me: too heavy, too pompous. The Saint (St. Stephen) above the main altar looks every bit the man he possibly was: a military leader who did not accept dissent. We actually went there for one of the organ concerts, organ, string and vocal music in various combinations. Very enjoyable and relaxing after a day of touring the city.
what a view. I could not get enough of this view. So lovely be day; so romantic and amazing at night. Do your best to make a reservation at the restaurant under the arches overlooking the Danube.
Beautiful Monument. Start point of the Red Bus Hop on Hop off Beautiful and picturesqueHad a nice time in Budapest and you cannot miss this

Pay the extra and see the view . The inside of the basilica is exquisite but, for us, the real highlight was paying just 500HUF (less than £2 for us Brits) to take the lift or stairs to the viewing platform at the top. The views over Budapest are incredible. A must-see.

Awesome. A must view while in Budapest, this church is big, well maintained, and has impressive architecture. We did not go on the tour but regret it quite a bit. The vision to build something like this is unbelievable.
Incredible architecture. Went here as part of the free walking tours you can take in Budapest. Really quite a beautiful building, difficult to miss

Beautiful. From the outside, the view is incredible. However, an even better view is from the top of the Basilica, its so little money and you get a view of the whole of Budapest. I would recommend this to anyone!

Impressive. We went with a tour guide and found the history of St. Stephen's to be most interesting. The chapel was very unique largely due to the various religious controls over the centuries. The village was very quaint, all in all a wonderful attraction. Side note - make sure to carry small change for the WC.

Wonderful building inside and out. I'm not religious but I took a look inside to marvel at the architecture and to see the hand of St Stephen after hearing the story on a previous tour.
Recommend taking the views of the city from the tower, it provides great vies of Budapest. They have lifts to save on walking!

Sunday Mass. I visited the Basilica on Sunday morning and arrived just in time for mass so stayed (12 noon service). It was a great experience with organ music and a great tenor singing the psalms and hymns, the sermon was also translated into an English summary which was helpful. Afterwards I went up the tower (cost 500HUF), amazing views of the city. A lovely way to spend the morning.
Another beautiful building in gorgeous budapest . This is another lovely building in budapest that must be seen.Easily found just by wandering around budapest.

definitely must go. Right in the center of Budapest, near to a bunch of good coffees and restaurants and free entrance. Really amazing church with so much gold and details that will make you astound for a few minutes. And a tip: be aware about the time to see the sacred hand, 'cause it's not open all day long for visitors.

Don´t forget to visit. Nothing to add, just come and see Basilica. It is in city center. They were closing due to some concert but we went through to see. If you want to see check internet if they don´t plan to close it for some event.

Beautiful . The cathedral is stunning. The interior is beautiful and on a Sunday if lucky you can catch sunday mass. You can buy a ticket to go to either/both the treasury and the viewing gallery. We went to the viewing gallery by lift ( not wheelchair friendly as there are still steps) and the view was stunning. A 360 degree view of budapest. Definitely a must!

Stunning! . Absolutely stunning building. A must do if you're in Budapest! If it's a nice day I'd definitely recommend going to one of the cafes close by and have a drink and enjoy the view and take it all in.

Lovely building and interior. Amazing views as you approach it from the square. Inside there is plenty of history and religious artefacts. There are concerts in the evenings which are advertised at the entrance. You can go up to the dome but this costs extra.

Beautiful place. Beautiful church, inside and out, definitely worth a visit. Beautiful altars and a stunning ceiling. It is very much a tourist attraction rather than a place of worship, ie. groups with guides & staff very loud even though signs ask for silence.

Beautiful . Definitely worth visiting. It's a great architectural gem and with a great history. The view from the tower is one of the best of the city.
Visit the relic of St. Stephen in left side chapel next to the altar.
Great for families.

Beautiful, a must visit. Check the opening times before going, beautiful basilica near the Danube.
Inside there's the sacred hand of Saint Stephan.

Very serene. You don't need to spend a lot of time here, but to go in and have a quick peek is definitely a must. Very ornate and beautiful, and definitely recommend going down the left hand side to see the 1000 year old hand of St Stephen!

Organ Recital at night - Caution !. Incredibly, they chose to not use the HUGE PIPE ORGAN for their regularly scheduled 8.00 pm performance. No, they performed with baritone and flute on a powerful (but still inadequate) electronic organ near the altar with hidden speakers. There are no pipes in the front of the basilica. I've heard excellent recitals in much smaller churches all over Budapest and Prague which simply eclipsed the performance quality of this 8.00 pm (un-advertised) debacle.Awful and most forgettable. GO FIGURE?

Interesting. We visited here as part of a short city break to Budapest. Excellent views from the Dome which can be accessed via about 300 steps, though there is a lift for at least part of he trip. Cost is modest. Building itself is predictably stunning, though perhaps not as old as one would imagine. We were a little under-whelmed by the mummified hand on display. Well worth a visit and easily accessible on front from the Chain Bridge part of the City.

Stunning Interior. Absolutely stunning! We were lucky enough to see a wedding here aswell! A must see when in Budapest! We opted to walk around it ourselves and only had to give a €1 donation upon entering.
Sacred Hand. Fantastic Basilica, WOW! Not to be missed, be sure to go down the left hand side to the back of the Basilica into the back room!
very ornate. visit a couple of times on both occasions there was a private service going on which limited access but even so it was possible to appreciate the beauty of the church.
Must do. Historic... grand.... can buy a cheap ticket to go top of the roof for excellent Budapest views.... start of the hop on hop off bus tours

Beautiful organ concert. We went for an organ concert and it was beautiful. If you are a fan of the organ (I'm actually not - but it brings back beautiful memories all the same), then this is a great way to experience the beautiful interior of the Basilica.

Very interesting site especially on Sundays. We visited on Sunday afternoon, saw the Missa ceremony from the tourist seats and bought tickets for a concert in the evening there. The echostics is great in this church and we enjoyed it very much!

Concert Venue. Attended concert here and it is a good venue. We also had visited earlier in the day. Beautiful building. The square at the front and the street which leads to the river are lovely to sit, have a drink or just people watch.

Climb up!. Very beautiful cathedral. Getting inside is free, and you need to pay to see the treasury or climb up (either by the stairs or the elevator). The view from the top is beautiful, really worth it. I didn't see the treasury. Inside the cathedral, on the right side, is a small chapel with the momified fist of St-Stephen. Getting inside the chapel is free, but you need to pay to light up the box with the fist inside so you can see it. Or just wait a few minutes until someone pays, everyone in the chapel can see it then.
Beautiful.... And the views from the top are amazing. A must see if your in Budapest. Please be aware you need to cover up, no bare shoulders and legs.
Beautifull Basilica!!. It is magnificent!! As a basilica, as a pray templum magnificent!! I have also heard an excellent Concert!!

BEAUTIFUL. Beautiful church best viewed by coming down Oktober 6 Street and turning onto Zrinyl Street so that you can see the plaza in front of it and the main entrance. Interior of the church is very ornate (lots of gold and marble), especially the main altar, dome and statues. The more modernist stained glass was not my favorite. For those interested there is a relic believed to be the hand of St Stephen.

Go to the top!. Entry to St Stephens is a mere 200 HUF donation. We found this more fascinating and 'real' to visit than the pricy Matyas Church with its 1500 HUF entry fee. Take time to appreciate the art and architecture and to absorb the spirit of the basilica. Then for 500 HUF take the elevator into the dome for amazing views across Budapest and inside the dome itself. We would have missed this experience had not other Trip Advisor contributors suggested this. Go to the top!

Well preserved monument reminding you of the Vatican. Hungary is full of beautiful buildings preserved over centuries and St. Stephen's Basilica is one of the important ones. Sitting in the open ground in front of it, one keeps admiring its beauty and holiness.

Majestic and beautiful . A nice little place near the parliament with a statue of the famous Imre Nagy placed on a bridge. It is allowed to go on the bridge to take a picture, but I advise to visit this place early in the morning because of the tourist mass.
well worth a visit. Lovely interior, very peaceful with lots of interesting things to see and withing easy walking distance of the city centre.
Lovely. A beautiful building both inside and out. You don't have to be religious to be able to appreciate the work that went into creating this building. Well worth a visit.

What great builders we had.. Had a great time exploring this building. Plenty to see. Great paintings and architecture.St Stephens right hand is housed here.You can go up in escalator or stairs to the top to see the great views.

Don't miss the view from the spire. The best part of St Stephen's is the view from the top of the spire, so if you can handle stairs, do it. This is the place with the mummifed forearm, which is in a back chapel and not easily seen. The church itself is lovely from inside and from the large, open square outside.
St. Stephen's Basilica. We visited the church on the second day of our stay in Budapest. The church was very impressive and worth visiting.
Breathtaking!. What a beautiful cathedral! We took so may photos and were lucky to visit at a time when baptisms were being performed.
spectactular building. Fabulous building with lots of history, stained glass and gold statues etc. wonderful atmosphere with quiet serenity
One to visit. We selected this Basilica from the local map. It turned out to be great. An inspiring building. There also happened to be an international music concert on at the time. Awesome.

Beautiful and solemn typical of Budapest. One of Budapest's landmarks that shouldn't be missed, most famous for the hand of St Stephen relic. My favourite part personally was the quiet corner where the sculptures of Saint Thérèse and Saint Rita are, so serene and beautiful.

Beautiful Basilica in Budapest. This Basilica was built in honor of St Stephen who was responsible for converting the people of Hungary to Catholicism. It is a beautiful structure inside and out. Only reason it's not rated higher is that IMHO there are other churches in Europe that are even more beautiful (e.g. Scare Coeur and Notre Dame in Paris)
Simply awesome. So much to admire and once you have picked up your jaw from the floor there is more. In the centre of Peste - loads of 'to do' stuff in the vicinity. A must do.

Church of happiness . Positive energy throughout of the whole Basilica. You may listen to the 45 minute organ concert or climb to the top of the church to have a panoramic view. Also nice to sit on the stairs in front of the main entrance and enjoy listening to the beautiful bells or watching people and great ambiance around.
Amazing building. It is very big and impressive building in the center of "pest". Inside of the basilica is also perfect. I am sorry that I don't have time to go to top of it.
Peaceful and beautiful. one of the more beautiful churches i have seen. The exterior of the building is great as well - must go place in budapest
Good. The entrance fee wasn't too high. This appeared to be a popular attraction, which made it quite busy. The place is nice inside and definitely worth a few photos.

A good place to have an hour for rest... . Nice restaurants and coffee shops all around the basilica and the view, and the space is wonderful....that is a good spot to sit and relax after walking all around the city, you can always find there gods coffee or drink to freshen up...
Budapest. Just beautiful inside and out! Historical statues, heroes and saints. St. Stephen was their king, who brought christianity and became a saint.

Great views . Go up top for some great views of the city, museum was a waste of time i thought, but for all it costs to visit, take the lift up to top if you cant manage the stairs. Church itself us beautiful.

Amazing view!. We went to the Basilica on a rainy day and still had a fantastic time, although it may be better to have gone on a rainy day. There is a donation to go into the church and this is incredible. The inside is beautiful and very peaceful. You can also get a ticket to go up to the top for the views, there are stairs to go up or a lift if needed. The views are fantastic, even in the rain.

Once You Step In.... I have been inside twice so far. First time, I have went upstairs to the dome! By paying an entry you can have one of the best (if not the best) view for yourself of Budapest. As the dome's height is fairly significant compare to the surrounding buildings, you can basically see all main sites of Budapest from the Heart of Budapest. Fantastic, believe me - however, you will only know if you go to other view-points to:-).My other visit was by "accident" on a unique Priest inauguration. The atmosphere of the Basilica was fully charged with peace, bliss and light. Amazing experience. With the stunningly renovated interior of it. Such details and reachness of beauty in it. Lastly, I have never been a fan of temples or churches when on vacation, but believe me, it is unique. Can't compare to any other famous Italian or English or other similar sites I have visited before. Go, but stop expecting anything otherwise you may miss what I have lived trough there. Just go and be (there).

Fabulous views. Another of many beautiful buildings in Budapest; the walk up the 324 steps to the viewing platform was well worth the trip, as this was our first activity in the city and afforded great views across the city to help us get our bearings.

Beautiful, quiet space. This basilica is stunningly beautiful church which is named after the first King of Hungary (there is a quite a bit named after him). Inside the artwork, stained glass and masonry are awesome, the only downside was that we happened to visit when a wedding was being held so could only access a small part of the church at close hand. It was a bit annoying as we paid the full price 200HUF and could only see a very small part.

Amazing.. Let's just get one thing out first; I don't have a religious bone in my body, but I do have a strange fascination with places of worship and this basilica just keeps giving. It's a stunning building inside and out. Just excellent.
An enchanting square. Beautiful basilica in a lively square with restaurants, cafes and people watching. A short stroll gets you to the Danube.

St. Stephens Basilica is a must see stop in Budapest, Hungary. St Stephens is a beautiful Catholic church named after the first King of Hungary. It is said that his "incorruptible" right hand is housed inside. It is one of the 2 tallest buildings in Budapest at 96 meters. We are a family of 5 with kids 16, 18 and 20. We bought tickets on one of the hop on/off buses. This is a great way to get an overview of the city with some history of each of the stops and then decide what you want to spend time touring. St. Stephens is on the route. We did not go to the top of this dome. It is definitely worth visiting. They allow pictures and I believe they charged 1 euro for admission. It has a lift to take you to the top of the dome, which is rare - I'm sure there was a fee for the lift.
A very beautiful Vasilica. The St. Stephen's Basilica is a very beautiful place, inside and out.one of the prettiest places we saw.
Worth visit . Beautiful. You can go for free inside. Or pay for going to treasury room or view upstairs. We only went inside. Very beautiful.

Well worth a look around. A beautiful building inside and out. We had a quick peruse which was a really nice hour spent. You might want to obtain a guide if you are into Eastern European art history or want to understand more about the stories behind the frescoes / sculptures and building of the basilica.
Bazika 96 m high, you can get on and have a nice vieuw on the city. Every thuesday of July there is a very nice concert at 8pm. Bach, Haendel, Albioni, Liszt, Massenet,Mozart...

Speechless, breath-taking, awesome. I've visited a lot of great churches and cathedrals, but this one is on top of my list. The altar is so huge that it could be a church on its own... After you are finished admiring the inside, under no circumstances skip the climb to the top as the view is really something special. I spent there 30+ minutes and could have stayed more... You can go there first and than plan the rest of the day as you can see the whole city like it's sitting in the palm of your hand.
Interesting Cathedral. We has a lovely time exploring the Basilica. The descriptions in English made it easy to navigate. The displays were well maintained and well thought out.
Beautiful Church. My wife and I attended a mass and it was a beautiful experience. The church is breathtaking. The sculptures, paintings and architecture are spectacular.

Marvelous!. This spectacular piece of architecture from inside-out that grabs one's attention almost instantly. During our visit there was a beautiful wedding ceremony taking place which made the whole experience surreal.

Beautiful. Nearly didn't visit this church but glad we did. One of the most beautiful churches I've visited & very big. No entrance fee but there is a box for donations. If you want to go up to the top of the dome it's 500 HUF & if you are up to the task of 360 steps it's worth it. There is a lift that takes you back down.
amazing. Incredible church, I was surprise that they don't charge to go in such a other churches around europe, amazing structure and history
Walk in. Whoa this is some chapel. Really stunning inside, there was a choir in singing when we where there, great. The views from the top was something else, definitely visit here.
Beautiful. This Basilica was beautiful inside and out. They offer organ concerts quite often, and are quiet reasonable.

Spectacular. Excellent Basilica, huge inside. They ask for a 200 forint donation (roughly 50p) which is money well spent. You are able to see St Stephens hand. The church is spectacular. For additional money you can go in a lift to the top of the church fur views of the city.
Beautiful. Very impressive example of Hungarian religious art. The church is beautiful, peaceful and awe inspiring.

Breath taking. Not usually church \ cathedral type people but St. Stephens basilica is just beautiful. Nice way to spend a couple of moments out from the rain with a small donation as entry. Worth a look
Wow. If you are in Budapest you must visit the basilica. Is so beautiful. One of the most beautiful church I ever visited

Lovely church with stunning views from top.. Church was beautiful; ancient relic in one of the smaller chapels was interesting. Got lift to top as too lazy to walk up in 36o heat and well worth the £3 each! great views of the city. Definitely visit.

Wonderful Experience!. Part of a walking tour we took through Viking River Cruise. The tour guide was excellent and the cathedral impressive. There is a nice gift shop with post cards and books explaining all those aspects of the cathedral you may forget once you return home! All languages available.
Nice chirch. It's a nice church and one of the major attractions and must-sees in Budapest. It is located on a nice square as well, so it is worth the trip.

Lost my sunglasses in the basilica but still a nice place.. Lost my expensive sunglasses in the basilica and nobody brought it to the basilica stuff, but still a nice place. It's huge, beautiful inside and outside. A must see place in Budapest.

Amazing place. I think this is one of the most beautiful building I ever seen. The details are incredible. And all around many many terrace and restaurant. With great food and drink. Inside the basilica is incredible. You have to see that.
Nice place . Very nice place,but you have to pay to get inside.. There is near metro station.. And you don't have to walk a lot to get there...

Beautiful church. This church was completed in the early 1900's. The marble and inlaid gold surrounding the various altars are beautiful.
This is a site not to be missed while visiting Budapest.

The Mummified Hand Takes It. Sure, the church has all of the gold decoration, crucifix, blah blah blah. But I'm telling you the real draw - go around the outside to the left to the Chapel of the Holy Right Hand. In there, in a glass case, is the hand (maybe) of King St. Stephen himself - miraculously found mummified with his decomposed body even though NO ONE EVER MUMMIFIED IT!

Nice basilica . From the outside this is a very impressive building with a nice dome. This building has a very interesting history worth taking a little in. For a small donation you can enter the basilica which is very worth it. The building has one of the most impressive interiors I have seen well worth seeing and this also gets you a glimpse of the right hand of Saint Stephen. It is possible to visit the top of the basilica for another price but I did not feel like climbing up there.

Ornate and Grand. Amongst the most ornate and decorated Basilica I visited in this part of the world. It is truly impressive and worth spending time to admire the stunning details.It has concerts and one could also go up the towers for a fee and admire the stunning views.
Spectacular!. Just one of the many stunning pieces of architecture to be found in beautiful Budapest. Well worth a visit.

Beautiful Basilica. Well kept and really beautiful in side. Highly recommend a visit especially if you want to escape the heat of the budapest sun. the Saint's relic (a hand) was interesting to see too.
Baroque Church. Beautiful church inside. No need to pay the 2000 FT to see the treasury as we did, however. Thought we'd see St. Stephen's crown there, but that resides in Parliament.
Fantastic. If you like to see a free spot in Budapest make sure see this place,beautiful architecture ,and nice spiritual environment
Concert in the cathedral!!!!. We decided to buy tickets to the Tuesday evening concert and was not disappointed.... The musicians were fabulous and the acoustics in the Basilica are incredible!!!
Beautiful Basilica. Go inside you won't be disappointed. One of the most beautiful basilicas we have been in. You can also go upstairs for a great view over the city.

Wonderful view. For a small entry fee you can go up the main basilica for an impressive view of the city centre from a safe viewing area. Lifts are available for most of the climb, though I walked most of it. I cannot comment on the interior of the church because I did not have time to study it.
Beautiful!. Donations accepted no admission fee. Beautiful Basilica with gorgeous marble everywhere. Worth a visit if you are waking in the area. No lines.

Beautiful . Firstly, there's a ticket to buy for the top of the dome, 500 huf per adult. It's a heck of a climb up spiral staircases. There's a lift to use. My wife moaned about the climb but the lovely wrought iron staircases at the top are lovely. Secondly, it's a 200 huf donation to enter the basilica which is beautiful inside. The 'hand' is not really worth seeing. It's so shrivelled up you can really see anything. Don't miss the English history just to the left as you leave the interior.
A must to visit . You should see there and visit inside, worth the moneyYou will see the st Stephen's arm relic there. The square in front of is nice to have a coffee
Must visit!. Must go there once in a lifetime! Nicer them St. Peters in Rome. The square before the church is full of w good restaurants!
A true House of God. If you have been to a large cathedral before then expect to see a magnificent building many times larger and more opulent.

Special Basilica with great view. Although not one of the most impressive basilicas i've seen it is still a beautiful one. Spending the extra cost to go up to the dome (302 stairs climb) really makes it special. The view from above is breathtaking.

A must. What a lovely building inside, go upstairs if you can, same stair case is used for going up as well as coming down and is typical of a church staircase = spiralled the view is worth it at the top. The square outside is lovely and in a central part of Budapest. Best of all have a crafted ice cream in the square, mmmmm. I can still taste it . Finally light a candle for a loved one inside the basilica and look up at the dome inside, just beautiful. Enjoy

Very impressive Basilica with weekly concerts.. This is situated in a pedestrian area on Pest so is easy and safe to walk around. A very impressive and imposting building that houses weekly concerts on a Monday Night - great acoustic. Well worth a visit. In the summer months there are also street theatre performers and 'pop up' concerts that add to the experience and charm.

Beautiful Church. This is a lovely church. Having been to all of the papal basilicas in Rome, this isn't quite as grand, but it is still lovely inside and certainly, for the small donation that they ask, worth a visit if you are here. It will take 15 minutes to go inside and have a look.
Beautiful view. The church is beautiful as usual but I suggest you to go up to the cupola. You will see the citycenter from here differently.
Breathtaking. It never ceases to amaze me how craftsmen were able to accomplish feats of engineering such as this, not to mention the visually stunning artwork inside. Love
beautiful painted ceilings and wonderful organ. Really beautiful painted dome and stained glass windows. Huge organ, with some beautiful music being played during our visit.

Organ concert at the Basilica. We attended one of the Monday 5pm organ concerts at the Basilica. It was a very nice concert, about 45 minutes long, with a number of easily-appreciated and famous organ/religious works. We suppose that the organist avoids lesser-known works so people won't be disappointed. Just in case you don't know, you will sit facing the front of the church and the organ and soloist will be behind you. Since we were close to the front, we actually could see the organist a bit. You will not be able to wander around the church afterward (they were getting ready for mass and hurried everyone out), so you should go see the church earlier in the day.It was nice to appreciate the Basilica while listening to fantastic music.

An amazing place to rest. The beauty of this place is really difficult to describe. From top to bottom it is just amazing. I only wish there were more places to sit and soak in the wonders (the pews are roped off -- presumably to discourage people from sitting down and spending too much time there).

Fabulous view of the city!. It costs about five Euros to climb to the top of the Basilica and it's totally worth it to get such a fabulous view of the city. Inside the Basilica, they (allegedly) have St. Stephen's hand sealed up in a case. Maybe skip that part - grooooosssss!

Gorgeous church is delightful square. This church sits in a central square next to small streets lined with eateries from up scale to pizza and gelato. On any given day you can see many people sitting on the church steps and strolling through the square. The interior of the church is dark and quiet with tasteful monumental art work and sculpture. Over the altar is a statue of Szent Istvan rather than Jesus because Istvan was the fist Hungarian king to convert to Christianity. We were lucky on our visit that the small chapel at the back of the church was open. This chapel contains the relic of st Istvan and several beautiful stained glass windows of Hungarian kings and saints. Well worth a visit
Beautiful. Very interesting with incredible decoration. The relic of the right hand of St. Stevens is displayed in an ornate gold case. A very beautiful place.
niceee. loved walking here in the daylight and in the evning when everything lights up- so cool. europea style at its best.

Huge cathedral wih fine architecture.. Named in honour of Stephen first king of Hungary, St.Stephen's Basilica lies close to the Danube on the Pest side of the river. It is a little gloomily lit in side but is well worth a visit. It is also close to lots of bars and shops and would make a good place to go on a rainy day - not that we had that problem!

Huge and brilliant. This basilica is a must see when travelling to Budapest. It has its own unique architecture and its immense and very beautiful. The colours on the ceilings or the holy chapel, this church is really splendid

Beautiful inside and nice view from top. We visited during a 6 o'clock mass and found the interior to be beautiful. The suggested donation for entry is 200 HUF (less than a dollar). We also paid (extra) to ride the elevator to the viewpoint near the top. You have a 360 degree view of the entire city from here. I strongly recommend a visit.
Size isnt everything. One has to see it [and you can hardly not see it] but size is not everything when one compares it to other large churches in Europe, Turkey etc.
Sunday Mass at St. Stephen's Basilica. We went on a Sunday afternoon and we were lucky to witness a real Sunday church mass inside the largest church in Budapest.
A must see. I was very impressed by this attraction, it exceeded my expectations. The entrance is free but if you want to visit the tower you need to pay a tax.

Beautiful. The outside of the basilica is astonishing and is a must see from the big square that is in front of it.
But the inside is also absolutely beautiful.
Don't hesitate to go up to the tower. The fee totally worth the view on top of it!

Budapest anniversary visit. You cannot fail to be impressed with the architecture and history of this buiding. This will be on most visitors 'must see' lists and you will not be dissapointed, check times when visiting because service, Mass times etc. will affect your visit.

Another church you ought to visit. Free entry to this standard tourist attraction, so you ought to visit. There is an embarrassing opulence of gold. The request for silence is disrespected by visitors. Apart from that, it is just another church and the only reason for going seems to be to say that you went here. Unless you are religious or interested in church architecture.The hop on hop off buses start conveniently just behind the church.

Superbly maintained Basilica. Beautiful and on a smaller scale "The Sistine Chapel". No entry fees, donations welcome but for £1 pp you should go to the top of the dome to get a bird's eye view of the City Centre. Highly recommended
Inspiring. You have to step insiode this Basilica, like most others it is breath taking. I went several times...
Beautiful view, lots of steps. We enjoyed walking the castle inside and out. If you have a problem with steps take the tram! Beautiful views. Cute little cafe off to the side of museum entrance.
Concert at St Stephen's Basilica. Pipe Organ concert at the Basilica was well worth it. The church was rather cold as we were there on the 3rd of January, when the outside temperature was - 10 deg C.

Basilica Indeed. A late afternoon visit with a public concert being played in front of the Basilica using chimes as instruments. There is a donation box inside the entrance and it is recommended 200 HUF (AU$1) per person be offered. Silence is requested.
A visit to Budapest must include a visit to the Basilica.

Great Basilica. We went to the actual spot by an accidentLater when we were faced the structure we were awestruck by its sheer height and beautiful architectureWe ventured inside only to be surprised at the host of people that were already inside but all were too silent It immediately focuses the minds to concentrate on the prayersWe watched each and every orbit with curiosity and saw many roomsThe main area is awesome We spent almost an hour there

Unusual church. This church started off in the Greek style but was finished by a different architect. The hybrid result is interesting and unique. Perhaps you are tired of churches by this point but this is one worth a quick visit and is easily reached from the shopping street.

Your enjoyment will depend on how many European churches you've already seen, nonetheless it is impressive. I wasn't very impressed by the outside view of this building but was pleasantly surprised once inside. The place is crawling with tourists which dampens the experience a little. I have learned that churches had a lot of money even as late as the 19th century. Take the time to marvel at he architecture, design and all that expensive marble!

Beautiful building and nice plaza. This is a beautiful basilica, with an arquitecture worth of admiring. You can walk inside and take part in a religious service or only stay as an observer.After visiting the basilica, I recommend to try the ice cream at Gelarto Rosa, which is in front, and specializes in serving ice cream in form of roses.

Worth a peek inside. The inside of the basilica was very opulent. Entrance was by donation but if you want to go up the dome you have to pay a few euro. There is an elevator up as well that is slightly more expensive.

All that Glitters. Suggested donation to enter but not compulsory. However, really well worth donating for the upkeep of such a wonderful Basilica. Don't just take the usual photos of the outside. You can spend a long time inside but however long you look around there is never enough time. Although there is so much for a tourist has to see and do in Budapest please allow more time than you think you need to absorb the beauty of this holy place. It is a little dark inside but I felt that this added to the atmosphere.

Szent Istvan Bazilika. Located in the heart of Pest, the Bazilika is a "must do" if you're visiting Budapest. Its architecture is impressive, the interior is very beautiful. Don't forget to visit the tower so you can check the city from one of its highest spots.
Great architecture. One of the most historical buildings in Budapest. The architecture is fantastic and the entrance is free for all.
Nice views. Nice views of the whole town from the top, church as such is not so impressive but views make the visit a worth one

Worth the Cost of Going Up to the Top. We saw St Stephen's during mass (attended on a Sunday) and then saw the Holy Right Hand. We then came back the next day to go to the top and while it takes some effort, the view is incredible!

Visit the Panorama Tower. St. Stephen's is a beautiful church. The interior is breathtaking. Also take the time to climb the 300+ steps (or take the lift) of the Panorama Tower for some fantastic 360 degree views of Budapest. Only a few extra dollars to enter the tower. My wife and I enjoyed it thoroughly!

A must see when in Budapest. An impressive and lovely church which although pretty modern in the scheme of things is a must see when in Budapest. It has an interior that is definitely worth seeing and has a lot of info regarding its history and importance to Budapest. It is worth paying to go up to the dome terrace as the view is 360 degree of Pest and a great view of the Buda Hill.

Could be transported to Rome and fit right in. Though St. Matthias Church (beautiful in its own right) in Buda was more highly rated in some travel guides, this magnificent cathedral was among the most beautiful sights in all of Hungary.

A Monument to faith. King Stephen brought Christianity to Hungary 1000 years ago. He is much revered by Hungarians, He is the Patron Saint of the country. The Basilica is named in his honour, and houses the relic of his right hand. Apart from the celebration of Mass, wonderful concerts can be enjoyed in this magnificent surrounding.
Impressive. Another must see for Budapest! You will probably walk by this on the way to something else, so no need to carve out a separate trip just for this. Very nice.

Beautiful inside and outside. Well worth going inside as it is free (recommend one euro donation) very ornate and large inside with beautiful dome. Would recommend paying the 500 forint to go to the top as the view is stunning from the top. Would recommend going in the morning we went at 10am and it was quite quiet up the top so it was quite relaxed and a good experience.
Truly beautiful building . Lovely,beautiful building only a small donation asked for and many concerts held in the evening Central location,worth a visit

Not the best church. The church is full of sculptures - not very good ones. It is fully renovated, gold all around, but it is not a real nice basilica. The plus is, if you take the elevator to the top, you will have a wonderful view over the city.

Amazing church!. The feeling you get nearing the Church by foot is ecstatic. Even better in the inside. While in Budapest, just dont forgett to be there at least for a while. Many intresting restaurants, cafes outside.
Beautiful Cathedral; lovely architecture. Saint Stephen's Basilica is a beautiful church and worth a visit. There is a charge to go up to the cupola, which we did not do.

Beautiful. . The inside is magnificent, the architecture is grand and the sites are so beautiful. I lit a candle for a recently passed away friend, which provided me with some closure. A must see if you're in the city. Only a donation to get in.

St Stephen’s Basilica and Co-Cathedral of the Archbishopric. Started in 1875 and not finished (due to WWII) until 2003 this Basiclca is totally worth the small donation suggested to enter and take photos of the amazing architecture. For a donation of just one 200 Forints coin ($0.70 USD) you can tour the interior of this beautiful Basilica. Don't worry there are elevators to reach the towers, look over that left side of the Nave. The natural light is perfect for photos and the niches of treasures are not chaged as other sites, So her is a secret. Go outside and stand by the basement elevator on the left. Usually a worker will let you go down to the tombs for 1,000 Forints ($3.50 USD)
Impressive church, Marvelous view. It is recommended to climb the stairs, if possible. Much more quicker then the elevator. The view is fantastic , gives an 360° panorama.

Pompous and ugly. Nothing special, there are plenty of ugly churches all around Europe. Excess in decoration, marble and gold, and awful sculptures, and stained glass, and pompous architecture. Looks like it was designed for a palace of some first generation rich merchants (trading in marble, so they got a lot and cheap). Skip it, or limit your time inside, but walk around the neighborhood.

Beautiful Church. Very very beautiful interiors. They use 7 kg of gold during renovation of this church. It is really beautiful church. You can find the right hand is housed in the reliquary. It was the sixth largest church building in Hungary before 1920.

Nice church, worth a visit. Much of the church was blocked off for weddings the day we were there. Actually, that was very cool that we got to see the Hungarian wedding procession, which was a bit different than in the U.S. It's not in the top five churches I've seen, or probably top ten, but still a very nice one worth visiting and there was no entrance fee.

Beautiful inside and out!. A must see on a trip to Budapest! Rich in culture, and just amazing. The inside is just phenomenal and takes your breath away. Going with a tour guide who was well informed helped our group greatly!
Interesting building. And there are a number of really good restaurants in the streets surrounding it. Looks good a night when it is all lit up

Nothing special. You can donate on entrance, but they're not so keen on it, but it's 200 HUF only anyway. Basilica inside- nothing special. Most churches around European cities are bigger and more beautiful;-)
nice view from the top. I would walk up the steps for the view. Make sure to hold the rail because it is very slippery. Inside is nice as well
Great place to visit. Beautiful Basilica. You can hang out outside the plaza with a cup of coffee and people watch or you can walk and visit the different souvenir shops.
Amazing church. The basilica is located in the heart of Pest. The building has big walls, and the internal archs and dome are imponent. Everything is spectacular.
Jewel of Budapest. This was my favorite site to visit in Budapest and one of my favorite Eastern Europe churches. Make sure you also take the hike up the tower to get a good view out over the city.

Beautifully ornate . The interior of the church is stunning. Shame about the rude man on the entrance door who blocked the doors until you put a donation in the box. Unacceptable behaviour. The viewing panorama is stunning on a clear day. Highly recommend. There are 320 steps up though or you can take an elevator in 2 stages but there are still about 20 steps to climb doing this way.

Nice retreat on a hot day. We visited on a beautiful summer day and after all the walking, plus the climb up the stairs, it was wonderful to sit and reflect in this pretty cathedral. There is also a nice little gift shop inside the church. We purchased some postcards of the hard to get photos.

Stately Church. Large and ornately decorated. Busy but it did not feel crowded. Admission was by donation, but did see people being stopped who did not contribute the suggested amount.Well worth a visit.

Amazing Basilica. This Basilica is worth a visit the interior is amazing and it only costs a small donation on entry, you can take pictures inside no problem, the area around the Basilica is also very nice and clean I can see why this is at the top of the attractions list now.

One of the most stunning buildings you will ever see. The outside of the building is beautiful, but is nothing compared to the inside: the 200 Forint entry contribution (about 50 pence) is money very well spent. Stunning stained glass, mosaic work and stonework. Don't miss the small chapel at the back.

St Stephen, the first king of Hungary.. St Stephen was crowned in the year 1000. he chose the western form of Christianity rather than the eastern Orthodox. His right hand or Holy Dexter called the 'Szent Jobb' is preserved in a reliquary which can be viewed in the Basilica. While his body decayed his right hand was found preserved when his coffin was opened. He died in 1038 and was made a saint in 1083.The Basilica of St Stephen has a statue of him behind the main altar. The third largest church in Hungary was completed in 1905 after 54 years of building. It is reminiscent of St Peter's in Rome with its marble colums, gold decorations and imposing dome which is as tall as the Parliament building, 96 metres. 1896 being the year when the Millenium celebrations took place to celebrate the entry of the Hungarians lead by Arpad and his seven chieftains a thousand years previously.The large forecourt of the Basilica is also very beautiful. It helps to see the building from a distance to appreciate its beauty. For people in wheelchairs there is a glass lift on the left hand side of the Basilica with a communication button to call an attendant who will take you down in the lift, guide you past the many marked repositories for people's ashes, to the lift which arrives at a level entry into the church. This lift also takes people up to an observation platform for views of the city.
worth a view. This is the second rated Basilica of Hungary the first being Ezstergom. I've been to both and prefer this and its free to get in.
Nice. Awesome place to stop, take a break from a long day of walking in the city. It was a great place for a memorable family photo...
Church. Beautiful church in popular eating area close to metro and free/ donation well worth a visit as it will not take long and good place on a wet day.
Budapest vacation. One of the most interesting places of worship we visited. You can also take a lift to the top and have an amazing view of Budapest.

Great views of Pest and beautiful interior. Not often mentioned in guide books but definitely worth seeing. We were amazed with how well the building has been maintained and its height when at the top.
A view of the city. Take the elevator (or 300 stairs) for a panoramic view of Budapest. The square around the church is a lovely place to relax and take photos.
Perhaps more impressive inside. We didn't pay to go inside as the exterior didn't wow us. It may be very beautiful on the inside however.

Beautiful. The inside is gorgeous and it's free entry. You can donate as much or as little you want.
It's located in the heart of the city and is very clean and well kept.

Beautiful Basilica. A must see on any trip to Budapest. Breathtaking interior. Free entry with a coin donation. Make sure you see the relic of the fist of St. Stephen.
For an extra fee you can go up to the cupola for a lovely view.

A beautiful cathedral to the patriarch of Hungary.. St. Stephen's Basilica is am amazing cathedral. The architecture and mosaic and stained glass makes it a beautiful tribute to the first king of Hungary. St. Stephen is revered in Hungarian history. He helped usher in Christianity into the nation and helped settle and unify the people. The acoustics are amazing and concerts are held there frequently. The location is perfect for a day's tourist activity.Supposedly the right hand of St. Stephen is in a special chapel in the cathedral. There is great history and folklore with the hand of not only St. Stephen, but also the body parts of many great men of history!One of the highlights is to take the elevator to the dome level of the cathedral. You can walk around the dome and have a nearly birds-eye view of Budapest. Walking inside the dome it is amazing to study the architecture of how a dome is constructed. Definitely worth the hour or so that it takes to tour this facility. Enjoy the surrounding area as well.

Beautfful Cathedral. It's beautiful on the outside, the architecture, is something to see. However, it's the inside you want to see. It is detailed and amazing to stand inside and walk around and look at.

Another Church. Beautiful church, déjà vu !
You have to pay to get in, but it is worth it. And if you want to go above, to the tower, you pay again.

Lovely . A beautiful church. It really needs an audio guide to help visitors understand its significance in the Hungarian history.. W St Stephen having been King also. Look out for his right hand, safely stored in the little Chapel at the back in a glass display. Also if you compare the photos at the back with the altar you'll, note St Stephen has been placed as the key figure in the alter not St Mary and Child as originally proposed. Worth a visit. Coin donation for entry.

Beautiful Basilica. This Basilica is a must see in Budapest. But what you can't miss is the elevator to the top of the dome. The views are spectacular and you will have several photo opportunities. There is a reliquary with the mummified hand that might be too upsetting for little children.
Beautiful church. We didn't go in, but from the outside the Church is stunning. Set in a little square with coffee shops. A good place to watch life go by.
Accidental find. Enjoyed a visit to this lovely by accident whilst walking around Budapest historical churchGorgeous architecture for a place of prayerVery peaceful visit

Wahoo. Astonishing monument. Interior is just wonderful and can easily be compared to Roma basilica. Do not hesitate to climb the steps to see the bells and enjoy the superb panorama. To be visited absolutely and even better when there is a concert inside. Sound is amazing.
don't miss the view from the top. The Basilica is quite impressive inside, but the best thing of it was the view from the top. Breathtaking!

Another icon for Budapest!. Budapest has a great architecture and St Stephen Basilica is an icon that very well represents the style and art of the town; very big and breath taking, you feel like you are in a temple of God!

Lovely and Grand Church in the city!. We have visited quite a number of churches in our Europe trip so far and this was one of churches that left us with deep impression. (earlier the day, we were at Mattias Church where you could walk from there to here)The church building was massive, grand and lovely, magnificent and gorgeous. Perhaps its architectural theme is a combination between gothic and renaissance style. When we were there, there were a huge turnout of visitors and a wedding couple who were taking their marriage portfolios. Lovely!Upon entering the church (we were advised by our guide to offer a small token of donation though its free admission), we were greatly impressed with the interior layout and structure and what we saw. Very nice and awesome lightings and colourful window glasses, statues, paintings, exhibits and got so much to see as each had a story or biblical background to tell, shamed that we did not have the luxury of time to see everything, Some of the items were actually made in golden and that reflected well from their colour shine. For Catholics, I will think they will like and enjoy this place as they can find "closeness" to the saints and God.Well, you can also visit the top of the church building (dome) and chargeable where you could have a good view on the city. Photography is allowed inside the church but with no flash and whispering is a must since it is opened to public for prayer.Just right outside the church is known as St Stephen's Square, a place where cafes, restaurants, souvenir shops are located and you can grab some gifts to take home or relax over a cup of coffee before heading to your next destination.Highly recommended.

Worth a visit, great views and interesting history. St. István's Basilica is Budapest's largest church and is found on the Pest side. Apparently it is the tallest building in Budapest, same height as the Hungarian Parliament Building. It has an interesting story with several architects, a dome collapse and even a World War II military period. We used the Rick Steves’ guide to do the self-tour. It has two towers with several bells. The views of the city are very impressive. The “relic” of St. István’s hand is housed in the Basilica. The display case lights up when someone puts coins in. We had fortunate timing in seeing a few curious tourists pay to turn it on and were able to catch a quick glimpse.

Free and beautiful. Entry to the basilica itself is free. It is as magnificent inside as it is outside. For a small fee, you can climb up to the dome (or take the elevator) and see panoramic views of the city. This was definitely one of the highlights of my trip.
Stunning. Fantastic interior, lucky enough to be present whilst wedding taking place. Also attended evening concert which was lovely

Make sure you go up to the dome. The inside of the Cathedral was beautiful - a classic piece of architecture. (free but with requested donation in cash) But the real show-stopper was the 302 stair climb (yes, they have an elevator) up to the dome. This brings you up to the outside of the dome where you get the most spectacular panoramic views of the city. You can walk all the way around and get wonderful shots of the castle, parliament, fisherman's bastion, and the other city sights. A great way to gain your bearings around the city as well and a wonderful surprise. It's about 500 forints I believe to go up (about $2 when I went) and well worth it. Very inexpensive for the views you get.

A little wonderland. The St Stephen's Basilica was absolutely my favourite building in Bp. It has lots of styles in an amazing mixture. I mean the Church is eclectic styled and it's always a pleasure to go inside... The basilica is impressive outside but breathtaking inside. I recommend all of you guys to visit it. I wish i could have my wedding there. :-) Thank you St Stephen, thank you Hungary, thank you Budapest!

Yet another Church - but a nice one. St. Stephens Basilica is located in the heart of Budapest. Entry is free, however, they of course suggest donations of any amount. The building is huge with interesting architecture both inside and out. It is a must see when in Budapest

Breathaking at night. The basilica is worth visiting because of its architecture and history. It is impressive at night when you happen to pass see this church all lit up with its imposing towers in front of the church square. It never fails.to remind you that this attraction is just one of the many others that await you when you visit the city.
"standard" Basilica. not too big, a design which you see in all larger cities. No special items to visit. Well-maintained, fine location but not special

beautiful church. Take the time to visit, does not take long. Lots of places to eat in the area so make; we made it part of the day where we also did the Opera House and Parliament. Each about 10 minutes walk apart.
Beautiful. Fantastic architecture, a must-do if you are near the basilica! They ask for a donation upon entry, and you're not meant to wear shoulderless tops

Another stunning structure in a city so full of history and culture!. Budapest has some of the most beautiful structures in Europe, St Stephens Basilica is just amazing.
In a bustling square, great architecture and the inner sanctum has details of the rich architectural history.
Free entry which pleased me though we made donations inside.. Beautiful inside some area's roped off which is to be expected I suppose. Very busy lots of visitors. Stunning ceilings really beautiful.

Simply amazing. Amazing church interior and breathtaking view to all of Budapest. Definitely a must-see by anyone.
P.S. Use the elevator to get to the top panorama tower, as the stairs can be rather tiring.

History!. Nice place for pictures. Very busy place. Lot of restaurants and lounges around. Quite popular place for meetings and datings. Must try ROSE ice cream! It is a small kiosk on right side and the way they make it is just amazing! Gelato. But u must try. And be prepared there is a long cue for this ice cream!!!!
Spectacular. We had a beautiful view of the basilica from the Aria Hotel, but the inside is not to be missed. Absolutely gorgeous.

Very impressive. This is supposed to the the second largest in Europe after St Peters in Rome. Nothing compares to St Peters but this would make a very good second. It is lovely inside and very well worth a visit.
The fantastic basilica. I have entered countless basilicas in Europe; definitely St Stephen's basilica ranks as one of the most beautiful.
Wow. A great place with fantastic views from the top. Well worth the walk up of over 400 steps. With a panoramic view of buda and pest it is a great visit and very well priced

Huge and impressive. The basilica is just impressively huge. It gives you this feeling of smallness... I highly recommend going upstairs to take a look outside the dome so you can have a great view of the city, and take the stairs for some extra exercise!

Wiewpoint on the top. The Basilica is beautiful always!
... and you have to climp on the top! From the top of the Basilica's tower you can see the whole city. It is amazing!
nice.. Very nice. Impressive. Worth a visit day and night. Very nice area for coffee or dining around basilica.

Beautiful building and amazing views from the top. A easy to find church in the centre. Make sure you get the lift to the top to get some of the best views of the city. The basilica is a great piece of architecture and well worth the visit

Beautiful church!. We came twice, once to see the church and the right fist of St. Stephen. The second time we climbed the tower and stayed for an organ concert. The church is amazingly beautiful and ornate with such an interesting history on its construction. The climb up to the dome was not bad (compared with St Peter's Basilics) and the view is just amazing! On the second trip we happened to get there about an hour before their weekly Monday organ concert and were suckered into buying tickets. And boy was that a fortuitous event! The great acoustics in that church made the concert a wonderful experience that we will always remember!

Worth the walk up to the top. Don't take the lift, make the effort to walk up the wonderful spiral staircase to the viewing platform from where you can see the layout of the city. The inside is so ornate and wonderfully maintained. We even attended an organ recital there one night which took my breathe away. So not the sort of thing we would normally be interested in... but it was mad not to have the chance to listen to someone play that magnificent instrument in such a brilliantly acoustic venue.

Dazzling Basilica. Touch more modern on the inside than expected, but easy to get to and an absolute must see. In particular, take a walk around the buildings exterior and appreciate the architecture.
Amazing . This us a must see, take the tour inside and you will be amazed by the craftsman ship and the art work. The architecture is unbelievable.

Weird and enchanting. This is the biggest basilica in Budapest. Dedicated to Hungary 's first king Stephan. His right hand which mummified miraculously is showcased here. The famous Hungarian football player Pushka is also buried here. So people around here say the miraculous right hand and left foot arend buried here. This church has many styles of architecture. Baroque, neo classical, renaissance etc. Must not miss a stop at the basilica if you are in Budapest.
Stunning. I spent a happy afternoon just walking around and being mesmerised by this stunningly beautiful basilica. It really is worth a visit, just don't rush.

Nice. It is a really wonderful building even if not the best in the world! It offers peace and relaxation and the area in front of the building has cafes and lots of other shops. We walked around and also enjoyed just 'watching', people and places.. Quite interesting.

Lovely building. The donation is mandatory and as I only had small notes I decided to not go inside. The building is well worth a look from the outside though if you're in the area. When I was there, there was a couple getting their wedding pictures done which made better shots than your average tourist standing in the way!

the biggest church in hungary. its very pretty and a great landmark that you can see from pretty much anywhere in budapest, also helpful to distinguish whether you are in buda - or pest! It only takes around 15 minutes to view the inside and it's free.

Enjoyed a concert in this gorgeous building. My husband and I decided to tour the Basilica while enjoying the Duna String Orchestra and not to toot my own horn but it was a wise decision. We were able to enjoy the magnificent outdoor architecture during the day, walking around the building and while enjoying a cappuccino across the street). The building is truly grand and the area around it is bustling with cafes and restaurants.
A landmark. The square in front of it is the center. Many restaurants, shops and a Starbucks all there. Entrance is free but they ask for a donation.

Magical. I have been there three times now, each time I come to Budapest. Preferred it in off season I have to say as it was a bit crowded with tourists today. Do yourself a favour and find yourself a quiet spot to sit and just drink it up. Fantastic building to sit and look. You will get neck ache looking at the ceiling! Back in winter we came to an organ recital and soprano singing. It gave us goosepimples as the sound reverberated around the holy space. We had thought to go to a concert again but the price has gone up to high seasons prices so we didnt.
Really big church. Except of building size there is really nothing interesting to be seen here. But entrance is free and it is in the city centre so why not to visit?
Nice Building and Area. Situated on a lively area beautiful to walk at night and stop in one of the nearby wine bars for a glass of wine with a view
Beautiful and Classic. Beautiful classic church inside and lovely sculptures and artwork. Worth the hype to delve in some culture. Lovely piazza nearby and amazing rose ice creams too!

Historic,beautiful, peaceful and educational, what more could you want?. We walked around this church for much longer than we had originally anticipated but it was so lovely. you get more access than in a normal historic church viewing, so being able to climb up to the balconies and appreciate the paintings and architecture was great. well worth a visit.
History, art, spirituality, & architecture abound. This is worth a visit, if you are not overwhelmed with too many cathedrals. It is famous, after all.

Beautifully proportioned and decorated Church. Not old in European terms but a beautifully maintained Baroque Basilica.Every part glistens with gold leaf and detailed decoration. The altar area is impressive focusing and holding your attention your attention.Interesting if someone gruesome the finger of St Stephen is kept in a casket at the rear.

Basilica. Beautiful place to walk and take pictures. You will find few cafes and restaurants around it. They are very good and I really recommend Bestia restaurant.
This place is a must see.

Fabulous evening at St. Stephans. We went to the organ concert at 8 PM organized by Koncert Hungary. The Basilica is spectacular and the music was superb. Largely an organ concert with addition of voice or flute on 6/9 number. Opened with Vivaldi, finished with Toccata and Fugue in D Minor by Bach. What's not to love? Followed it up with dinner cruise through same organization. The evening was five star; The Basilica (which I am rating) is wonderful but I save my five stars for the best (St. Peter's in Rome, Notre Dame in Paris, Westminster Abbey in London).
Mast see. A must see attraction to Budapest!! Take a time to see St. Stephen's and have a coffee at the square!

Church top to bottom. Have visited churches all over Europe and this was most accessible. We climbed the bell tower and down to visit the treasury, most impressive collection of religious artifacts. Beautiful
Beautiful cathedral. Lovely, pretty standard cathedral. Very much worth going to one of the many music concerts held here, which typically include the massive organ

Beautiful Cathedral in Pest. This basilica is very striking and even more so at night when it's dark. Beautiful interior design. No admission but a charitable donation is solicited. When we visited, the main church was not accessible even though you can have a good look at it - as there was a wedding taking place. There are side chapels.
Amazing! . So beautiful inside, only a donation to get in. We paid 500 HUF each to climb to the top and the views are so incredible it would be worth it just for that. Must see!

Stunning. St Stephen's Basilica is a stunning cathedral, impressive both inside and out. The artisanship and craftsmanship that was necessary to build this is amazing. We attended several concerts here, including pipe organ, chamber orchestra, instrumental soloists and vocal soloists...all of extremely high calibre musicianship. Thoroughly enjoyable and incredibly well priced. The views from the tower over Budapest is amazing and worth the extremely cheap price of 500Huf...fantastic photo opportunities. An amazing landmark. Highly recommend it, and the concerts within.

Gorgeous. The basilica was really amazing - a lot of the religious sites in Budapest look fairly similar after a while, but the Basilica is the grandest and the biggest. They do ask that people dress modestly for going inside, so wrap up in a scarf or plan ahead. The donation is pretty modest, though you do have to pay a little more for going up to the top - it's worth it for the view, however!
Beautiful but understaded. A treasure dominating the Pest skyline but inside badly lit and dingy a pity it is not better presented but still worth a visit.

Enduring heart of a culture!. Go along and appreciate the splendour of it all. It's old world and magnificent. Spend sometime quietly sitting and absorbing the history and impact it's had....and still has on the people of this lovely city.

Beautiful place. I walked towards the basilica from my hotel. i took a right onto the road infront of the basilica and there it was , a lovely ancient structure that you can not get your eyes off. you can easily spend a few hours in and around the basilica. Have a beer/coffee at the restaurants next to it and enjoy the view.
Amazingly beautiful!. Must see, one of the many treasures in Budapest. See for yourself!The entrance is free, just a donation is asked. It's easy to find, at walking distance from the Chainbridge.
Amazing architecture and decor.. Besides roaming around on the ground floor,also take the elevators to the dome to get 360 degrees views of the city-wonderful
St Stephens Basilica. this imposing church dominating a square in downtown Pest was magnificent Inside the various altars were beautiful and the roof was spectacular a truly magnificent church

Beautiful basilica. Stopping here is a must if you are visiting Budapest, there are many things to see but St. Stephen's is beautiful, well maintained and holds so much of the Hungarian history. Centrally located, easy to get to and right in the centre!

The area is pretty nice. 500ft to go up for panorama . You can buy the ticket at the bottom of stairs to go up the panorama. Use either elevator or stairs (300+) stairs. They don't check the ticket when you get on the elevator but when you arrive upstairs they do. So make sure to have them. 500 for an adult, 400 for a student. Visiting church itself is basically a "donation" of 200 ft. If you go deep down the church, they have St jobbs hand displayed in a room. It's not magnificent church but sure it's beautiful. I've seen too many churches in Europe.
Very impressive!. A masterpiece of architecture! A definitely must see. It’s worth climbing the stairs and admiring the city from above.

Beautiful church, stunning interior. Even if you are not into visiting religious buildings when you travel, this is a place that you just have to see. St. Stephen's Basilica is located in the city centre and it looks spectacular. It is named after the first King of Hungary. The entrance to Basilica is free of charge and you can enjoy it's stunning interior with stained glass, golden details and beautiful murals. When I walked inside there was a wedding ceremony and the organs were playing; it was so wonderful.
Stunning building. The building is magnificent both on the outside and the inside. The view from the top is well worth the climb (there are lifts to help).

Organ Concert . The church is beautiful sitting in amongst a very busy area of eating places with an open walk area in front. The interior is beautiful also and we had the opportunity to get tickets to an evening concert. The sound is phenomenal!
