Ornate, magnificent building. The stain glass windows and ornate dome are superb. This Basilica dedicated to St Stephen who was the first baptised king of Hungary contains his embalmed right hand.
Beautiful church!. You cannot go past this church - stunningly beautiful and for a small fee you can go up to the top of the dome which gives you an amazing view of the city.
Gorgeous. You can simply take a walk inside or you can decide to go up and enjoy a panoramic view. Entrance to the Basilica itself is free, although a small donation is expected.

low cost, impressive place. We were looking to escape the heat for a little while with the young ones. I was surprised to find the admission was actually done by donation and not by ticket. Beautiful interior.
Beautiful church. It is located in the city center and you cannot miss it. It is beautifull both inside and outside with some impressive architecture and murals.
A great experience. Try to get there for an organ concert. Beautiful! They are every Monday at 5pm. There is a fee but worth it and you can have a drink in the square afterwards.
Stunning place of worship. If you visit one church in Budapest, let it be this one. Awesome stained glass windows and breath-taking dome. Absolutely beautiful, well worth a visit.
Amazing. Very beautiful temple. If you visit, you have go to the top to take pictures. Very nice and was free.

Spiritual. This is an active place of worship for the local people of Budapest, admission is 200 HUF if you are entering to view the church and free if you are attending to pray.The building is beautiful, you are asked to be quiet and speak in hushed tones as to not interrupt people prayer. This is definitely worth a visit whilst in Budapest
Nice church.. Lovely church in the middle of Budapest, virtually unmissable due to it's location. Very picturesque.

Well worth visiting. Entrance into the Basilica is technically free (but not obvious), a donation is requested at the door but you aren't forced to pay. Inside is magnificent and is well worth the few coins you throw in the donation box at the door.You do pay extra to go up the tower, but its a must do. The views from the top of the Basilica are stunning, with some great views down to Hero's square and the Parliament building.

Go to the tower. Inside the church are lots to see (statues, frescos, paintings etc.), but I was with teenager, who was little bit bored. We also went to see the saint's hand, but it was covered with cloths and was in a small glass case in a dark room so there wasn't much to see. It is possible to go to the tower (little payment). You can go there by elevator or by the steps. If you go by elevator with infant, it is better to leave the pushchair before the second elevator, because after that you have to clime some steps before you are at the lookout point. The views from the tower are great!

Very beautiful and inspriring place. Free to the public but a donation is expected, beautiful place with a great feeling of community and faith. Worth a visit for those not religious but interested in art and culture. A walk up the 300 steps give a great view of the city for a small fee.

Impressive. Beautiful architecture and ornate interior. It was definitely worth the stop for my wife and me. If you are not afraid of heights, you should go to the tower; there is a small fee to do so. Great view of Budapest.

Avoid on Sunday mornings. We were dropped here on a city tour to spend 90 minutes in the area. St. Stephen's is the main attraction, but it does not allow entry during Mass on a Sunday morning. To make matters worse it was pouring with rain, however there are lots of lovely cafe's in the area offering fine coffees and local cakes.

Impressive building . We have been to a number of basilicas and cathedrals, but the central area was one of the darkest we have ever seen..which was a bit disappointing. We didn't do the more formal tour but we around the Basilica in about 25 minutes. But if like architecture, this is definitely worth seeing. Plus makes for a great spot to get into if you get caught in a rainstorm.

Most notable Basilicy. Named after St. Stephen this Building is one of the most important church Buildings in Hungary. Finally unveiled in 1905 the basilica stands about 96 meters high, just in correlation with the countries millenium. Ist twin towered dome dominates the sky-line of down-town Budapest; visitors can get on top of the dome earning a panoramic viewof the town.The basilica hosts the mumified right hand of Hungary`first king St. Stephen -he died in 1038- known as the father introducing christianity.Like the Houses of Parliament and the State Opera House the basilica is built in neo-classic style
Pyhän Tapanin kirkko. We visited the church. You can´t image the size of the church without seeing it. There is a nice hand to see.

Central location, beautiful architecture. This is one of the main hop on hop off stops, off the world heritage Andrassy avenue, close to the Dec Fenec tere metro station. Impressive architecture and worth spending 1/2 hour

Interested but would skip it next time.. I felt that a visit here was a "must do" but in hindsight, even with 3 days in Budapest, I would choose many other things over the pubic baths. First disclaimer: I am from Florida where we have the most amazing pools and waterparks. Second disclaimer: crowded pools freak me out. With that said, it was a crazy interesting place to people watch! Bodies from around the world In every imaginable shape and size. The outdoor pools were in good shape and clean but the indoor facilities like the locker area and changing room were old and just felt kind of dirty. I believe it was about $25 per person (same price for child) which in this area of the world is a ton of money unless you plan to spend half or all day. Bottom line if you are not desperate for a swim - skip it! Spend your money at your hotel spa .
Gorgeous. Free to go in the church and look around, We paid 500 huf each to go up to the top and walk round definitely worth the small cost for the amazing views of Budapest

Must see. On the Buda side. Nearby is fishermans bastion and the old palace. Nice walking areas nearbyInside of cathedral is impressive. They have old grave inside. Nice artworkDon't miss the included museum to the left of the main alterBuy a ticket to get in (across from the cathedral)
Spectacular..... The basilica was an fascinating architectural experience. The intricate artwork, vibrant colours, and stained glass made for great photos.
Beautiful.... Beautiful church, didn't have the time to tour the inside unfortunately. Would recommend approaching from Roosevelt square to get a lovely view and walk to the Basilica.

Great acoustics. The Basilica itself is very beautiful, but beyond that, you can go up to the top, where you'll find a beautiful view of the city. There is a lift for this purpose if desired (it's paid). The acoustics of the Basilica is excellent, and there are often concerts in the spring and summer evenings.

Another beautiful church . If churches are your thing, go here. Entry is free. Note that you will have to pay 500 FT if you want to go up in the dome. Like all the older buildings in Budapest it's absolutely gorgeous.
magnificent edifice. A must-see sight in Budapest; beautiful basilica with the preserved hand of St. Stephen on view. Attended Sunday mass and it was a lovely service.
Beauty on a grand scale. The first thing that will go through your mind is WOW. This building is truly magnificent and the interior is stunning. An absolute must when staying in Budapest.

Beautiful church. Visited this church twice and first time it was closed as they close early on a Saturday. A donation of 200 HUF is required and you can pay extra to go on the tower to look at the views. The interior was beautiful however did not realize the history of the church was quite recently. Less than 200 years old (?) couldn't really remember the exact year...

Didn't see the famous mummified hand of the king. Considering this place required a forced "donation" of 200 HUF per person (there was a guy sitting at the entrance watching everyone)... we were quite disappointed that there the famous mummified hand of the king was not on display. We definitely came at the right time according to the signage at the door. There was no one to ask to. It was a beautiful church just like any other churches in Europe...

St Stephen's Basilica on a Sunday . I have been many times and the square outside is a great public place I have even seen a number of couples do an impromptu Argentine tango However on this occasion I was on the Square on a Sunday morning where the mass is played on loud speakers Beautiful choir sounding out across the square was very moving experience

High quality cultural experience. Do not miss this beautiful Basilica its ornamentation is elaborate and almost breathtaking.If a concert is on during your stay - this will be a perfect opportunity to combine an unforgettable musical experience with the beauty and great acoustics of the Basilica.Classical concerts are on several nights a week usually starting at 8pm and usually lasting 1hr. Often you will have solo performances - trumpet players, violinists or vocalists (sopranos/tenors) during the concerts.
Felt very spiritual . Not the most impressive basilica I've been in but interesting nonetheless. There was a lovely calm atmosphere inside and you can wander around and take your time.
St Stephens. Walked in off the street by accident and it has got to be one of the special places of worship in any religion, stunning construction and ornate features..

Beautiful church. This enormous church is right in the center of Budapest, and one of the most breathtaking buildings of the city. Worth to pass by while walking around the area, which has also many cafés and restaurants to offer.
Beautiful church. The Basilica was lovely, definitely worth a visit and the square it sits in has several places for,refreshment.

Beautiful. Take the time to stop in and admire the beauty of this basilica. I usually take a short break in most churches we pass by, but this one is really worth your time even if all the other churches you've visited are jumbled in your brain.
Impressive!. You enter it with awe. Its a huge construction, magnificent. Everyone who visits Budapest must see it.

Beautiful St. Stephen's. I usually tend to prefer Gothic churches, but this Neo-Classical was one of the most beautiful I've seen. The colors, the touches of gold, the paintings and statues....all very inspiring.
Amen... A site to see..Panoramic views. It's beautiful and decadent!! Am must visit and do go to the top.. Doesn't cost much and has amazing panoramic views of the city.

Got to see the right hand of King Stephen. How many church do you get to see the remain of a country's 1st King right hand? My kid got a real kick out of it and the basilica is indeed impressive inside. Suggested donation is 200 HUF

A place of peace. Unusually for popular tourist sites the injunction to be quiet inside the cathedral was generally followed, giving a calming, peaceful aura; which is what a church should have. The baroque interior is as intense as any in this part of Europe and there's an interesting display (in English too) about the architecture and construction.

Beautiful Basilica and the square and streets surrounding. We couldn't go inside when we intended to as there was a mass or something like that. The Basilica is beautiful and so is the Square and the streets surrounding it. I have to go back to go inside it!

Wonderful acoustics for an organ concert. The period of architecture is not to our taste but the quality of the workmanship and materials serve to celebrate the Saint.
We greatly enjoyed the concert with singers violinist and trumpet player enriching the performance of well known classical pieces.
Uplifting !

Very beautiful church inside and out. St Stephens's is beautiful inside and out and we were able to enjoy the interior even more when we attended an organ concert on the Monday evening we were there. We highly recommend to take in an organ concert here as you can here how nice the organ sounds with its great acoustics as well as you get to stare around in detail at the intricate interior of the basilica.

Worth the climb. The church is awe-inspiringly beautiful inside and out. To view the church and the reliquary is just a 200 HUF donation. To climb to the top is 500 HUF. I highly recommend the climb. It is a little strenuous, but there is an elevator available. (I climbed up and rode the elevator down.) The views at the top are incredible. You can see all of Budapest and walk all around the dome.
St Stephen's Basilica. A lovely basilica in the heart of Budapest well-worth visiting. There is a beautiful Luca della Robbia fountain in the side chapel

Thursday evening organ recital. We went to this knowing they don't use the large pipe organs and were a little apprehensive but we were thrilled! Sound was fantastic, listening to music in a church without a service allowed us to really take in the beauty of this church. The two accompanying soloists - one flute and one vocal - were great.

Beautiful, impressive & a must see. ... And I'm an atheist! The building is imposing from the outside, but stepping inside is a revelation. It's huge, and hugely moving (even for a staunch non be.iever like me). A small fee grants access to the spiral staircase to the dome, from where the views are breathtaking. Thoroughly recommended.

Lots of steps but worth the view. We climbed the 302 stairs bu for t the view around Budapestand it was fantastic, if you don't want to climb there is an elevator. St Stephens was also beautiful inside. There is lots to do around the church also

We visited during the day and returned for a concert. We also took the elevator to the top for a view of the city. Don't take the steps. Take the elevator. You still have some steps to climb but there's nothing to see on the steps. Don't miss St Stephen's hand behind the altar. Just open the door and go back. The concert at night was beautiful and definitely recommended.
worth the climb. This is a lovely church, and it is also worth it to climb the 295 steps to the tower. The view of the city is magnificent.

Superb building. . This building is lovely. The panorama views will cost you around 500HUF and is worth it for the views. There is also lifts so you don't have to tackle hundreds of stairs. The inside of the church is a true wonder and the decorations are beautiful. Highly recommended.

Very good visit. Very interesting and beautiful building. Again you can take photographs. Well worth the visit. Ladies make sure that your shoulders are covered as you cannot get round part of it with bare shoulders
Nice with many eateries around . Beautiful design and square. There are a lot of restaurants to explore along side and walkable from the chain bridge and other metro stations.

Terrible. Please don't get me wrong, but if you've seen one of these churches you've pretty much seen them all. They are all veriations on a theme pretty much. Everyone still marvels at the domes etc. Usually dating back 100's of years...this one finally got finished in 1900. Anything remotely interesting there is to see, you will pay for. The rest will soon uninspire you after a while.

Worth the effort. Make the effort to climb to the top of the Basilica the view is tremendous of the surrounding area. It need a lot of energy to make it to the top!!! the inside is very interesting and worth taking the time to see.
Beautiful! . Beautiful view! It's great for helping o get oriented to where you are if you climb to the top! The inside is beautiful as well! I can't wait to go back during my time here.

Beautiful. This wonderful church was just round the corner from where we stayed. Only €2 to travel to the top. They had a lift which is great if you struggle with the stairs. They have a range of concerts available.
A place not to miss. The grandeur of the place is something to marvel, I went here as a part of our day long private tour. I would surely recommend it to others who visit Budapest

A beautiful church. St Stephen's Basilica dominates the square in central Budapest. It is an impressive building on the outside but even more so inside. Take time to walk around the whole interior, including the chapel at the rear. Beautiful statues and stained glass windows are a feature. To have a great overview of the city you can pay a small entrance fee and climb many steps up to the dome where there is a walkway around the entire church offering 360 degrees of Budapest. Well worth a visit even if you have seen many other churches in Europe.
Amazing views from the top!. The inside of this basilica is stunning but the real view comes from climbing the 320 stairs to the top of the dome for panoramic views of both the Buda and Pest sides.
Beautiful Views from the Top. Beautiful basilica, approx 500 ft to go up to the top and the views of the city are ion credible - be prepared for lots of steps!
Super location. Do not miss thisNice view from here to PestStairs You can have here a nice walk tooCombination with the museumVery close by

Beautiful ... Beautiful building, Mass was being conducted whilst we visited with a gorgeous choir. Visited, not there for the service were permitted to stand at the back of the church. Much smaller scale to St Paul's in London, but every bit as beautiful.

Another must visit place. The Basilica is beautiful inside and out and is a place of worship so please be respectful when inside the main chapel. An example of great craftsmanship and the detail of the ceilings and the windows are as good as any cathedral you will see. If you are in Budapest add this to your itinerary.

Breathtaking!. A beautiful church. Take your time to fully appreciate this church and walk around it to take in the grandeur of this building.If Mass is not in progress your have access to the the back altar ,so maybe thru the week is the best time to visit.

Typical. If you have seen cathedrals and large churches in Europe, this one will offer nothing new. They do have a small, but well-stocked gift shop with items different from what I had seen in other shops.

Beautiful Basilica in a wonderful square. Don't miss this beauty, situated in a lovely square. Grab an ice cream or a bite to eat, then get in and get your pictures - the inside does not disappoint. Named after the first King of Hungary (apparently his incorruptible right hand is in the reliquary), this is one of the the two highest buildings in Budapest.We attended an organ concert in this Church and it was spectacular. The players and the counter tenor sounded amazing with the acoustics. If you have never heard a church organ live, then this is the place to do it. I thought it could have been louder but all in all, it is something to feel.A very special place and a popular venue for tourists. Don't miss it.
Quality views . Great site and square, rickety route to the top for a great view but worth it. Has to be on your list of things to see and from there you can access a range of other attractions.
superb. this is a must see. lots of cafe around outside the basilica with lots of food option. good place to just sit and spend time

Brilliant (and bargain) city viewpoint...and a grand church too. You can visit St Stephen's as an impressive church or a city viewpoint tower or both. It's excellent on both counts.As a church, we only had a peek as there was a private service on. It's grand and ornate and they only ask for a small (and voluntary) donation of 200 HUF (about 50p - or less than one euro) to go in.We spent more time enjoying the views of the city from the balcony outside its lofty dome. To go up you pay at a ticket window just to the right of the main church entrance. It's 500 Forints (less than £1.50) and it's a long spiral staircase up. There seemed to be a lift too at the opposite side of the church entrance to the pay desk, just behind the souvenir kiosk. But don't think it was working when we went. There's also a space half way up with a few low key arty things and another small lift - that goes up only.It's quite a climb unless you're fit but well worth it. Great views of the city in every direction as you can walk all the way around. It's the highest vantage point available and a brilliant way to get a sense of the city.It feels safe enough to take kids (with energetic legs!) up. Busy but not too crowded when went up late on a Saturday afternoon in June. And a complete bargain too.
Eü . There are many churches, cathedrals and basilicas through Europe but this is one of the absolute most beautiful. It is awe inspiring and beautiful.
The top attractions. One of the top attractions in heart of Pest side. You must to buy a ticket about 600 Ft...maybe 2 Eouros. It is a good deal, trust me :)

Don't miss this out !. What a beautiful building !, its free but you can ' donate' if you wish to gain entry also if you would like to light a candle. But its worth it and the money helps to keep the building in amazing condition.

Important History and Architecture. We visited the Basilica with a Viking River Cruise guide. There is a lot to learn and a guide really opens up the many facets of the building and its' many features.

Subtle not a virtue here! Have a peep, great views from the dome.. This is a dominating building but worth a visit, the entrance is a donation of a suggested 200 Huf. There is a lift service to almost the top- this was the same price as climbing a lots of steps! We enjoyed this as the views were good and it gave an interesting perspective of the domes construction.

Building commands great location. Set among quieter pedestrianised streets, but close to the Parliament building and the River Danube, this structure commands its presence within the centre of the City.

World Class. Interesting from the outside, spectacular on the inside. This is a marble and gilding wonder. A must-see in Budapest. Nice view from the tower. The stairs are an adventure but take an effort. We took the lift down.

Chamber Music with a Stunning View. Was lucky, as I was there on a random Tuesday evening and asked the very helpful informative counters (dotted along all the touristy areas in Budapest) for suggestions to do at night (other than drinking).
Lo and Behold Chamber Music in the Bazilika! Ticking off 2 of my must dos.

great place to visit. It's a great basilica very different from what you usually see in Eastern Europe. you can make the hard climb to the top of the rotunda but the reward is a stunning view of the city
Sanctuary . The church is huge and beautiful architecture. Inside is stunning! Great done with fascinating fresco painting in the middle of the space. Delicate ornament. Free entry and open daily.
EXTRAORDINARY. I almost skipped it, thinking "it's just another church" so why bother? Very glad I decided to go inside. It's extraordinarily beautiful and full of history.

Splendid inside and out. The outside architecture and the inside furnishings, paintings and windows are a must see if if you go to Budapest. There is a slight fee to enter. At night it is stunningly lit up. We thoroughly enjoyed the Christmas Market that stretched down the streets for a couple of blocks from the front

Beautiful Basilica. St. Stephen's is a beautiful church and well worth the nominal 200 HUF they request. You can easily enjoy everything in 30 minutes or less, making it an easy add on to other sites. Don't miss St. Stephen's hand-located in a chapel at the back left of the church. They also host many performances throughout the year (for a VERY reasonable price), so make sure to check that schedule as well.
Beautiful cathedral. A beautiful cathedral and place if worship.one of the jewels of Budapest and a must visit when you are in the city.

Spectacular Church . Do not miss this! Interiors were beautiful. We bought the elevator ticket to go up 3 floors, then walked the stairs another 3-4 floors up to the view balcony surrounding the great dome. Amazing views of the city. A bit sweaty and out of breath, but worth the effort.
Worth the effort. Post ice cream essential. Make the effort to climb to the top and enjoy the view. If nothing else you will establish where the trendy roof bars are in the city.
Classic. Obviously you want to go see the hand, but beyond that it's an amazing building from outside and inside
Spectacular in & out. Being on a tour, we were escorted in & out, but felt the crowds detracting from enjoying the special features & history of the building.

very beautiful architecture; central point of attraction in Budapest. very beautiful architecture; central point of attraction in Budapest.The weather was good; so I went up to the tower for a panoramic view. The view was OK.Don't go for the view when the weather is dizzy.I loved the basilica and especially the place around it. But I did not like that I had to pay to enter the church; so I left with mixed feelings.Shoot your photos of the church just after sunset; they are so much more beautiful.
A must see. You can't come to Budapest and not visit St Stephen's Basilica - absolutely stunning with the added attraction of the mummified fist of St Stephen himself!

Fantastic Vista. St Stephens Basilica is a must see attraction 10 minutes walk from the Danube. To enter requires a 200 forint contribution which is only about 50p. Inside are beautifully ornate paintings, statues, and stained glass windows. To get to the top of the Basilica requires a ticket which is relatively cheap. You need to be healthy to climb the stairs but the view of the city and surrounding mountains at the top make it all worthwhile.

You must go to the TOP!. I heard a local woman, if we would like to see the best panoramic view from Pest side, we must go to the hihgest buildings the Basilica. So we went and we was really happy, becouse this view from the TOP IS AMAZING!!! SO guys...lest's goooo !
Great Basilica and Holy Site . Beautiful Roman Catholic Church with incredible art work and architecture. Pictures are allowed and there are tours. We just looked around and it was great.

City landmark. From Buda the impressive Basilica can be seen rising high above it's surroundings. Inside is a rich mix of religious and historical artefacts and of course many interesting references to St Stephen. A visit here puts the history of Hungary into context.

Beautiful day & night (go to the top). We visited it with my boyfriend at night and on the next day as well. Amazing architecture outside and inside. To go inside is free. The entrance fee to go to the top is around 500/600 HUF which is very cheap. There is awesome view to the Danube, the Parlament, you can Buda side with the castle and the Fisherman's bastion. You can see the whole Pest side. Worth going ;)

Basilica. This church is a beautiful building inside and out. It is in a very central location with lots of activities around it. It attracts lots of visitors and for a church was quite noisy. There is a person at the entrance ensuring you make a 200 forint contribution before you enter. I personally do not believe you should pay to enter a church, there were no quiet areas to say a private prayer, but the ceilings and statues were all very beautiful. Well worth a visit.
Impressive dome. If you want to appreciate the architecture that never dies, you should visit the Cathedral. Inside and out it is full of artistically elaborate details.
Amazing views from the top. Definitely worth visiting and paying very little to climb the cathedral. Amazing Panoramic views of both Budapest and Pest as well as mountains in the distant.

MAKE SURE YOU GO TO THE TOP!!. The views at the stop of St. Stephens Basilica was incredible, such a lovely building but it is a definite must to go to the top. It's incredibly cheap too! I think it cost a couple of pounds each to go up, so definitely worth it!

Stunning architecture and amazing panoramic views . Definitely a must-see while in Budapest. The architecture and ornamentation of the basilica is outstanding. The panoramic views from the bell tower (requires a ticket) are breathtaking. There is also a machine by the ticket booth where you can get a very nice souvenir coin.
Impressive. It is a beautiful church in the downtown core and it is a top attraction. The entrance fee was a reasonable 0.67 Euros

Beautiful but crowded!. This is a beautiful church, inside and out! It is definitely a must-visit attraction in Budapest. It was pretty crowded which took away from the experience a bit, but that was to be expected.
Simply beautiful . There's not much more to say apart from it's a beautiful building and fascinating. Climbing the tower is a must to get panoramic views of the city but it does cost extra.

Beautiful view. I was saty there today! AMAZING! If you come to Budapest. you must to go to here! St. Stephen's Basilica Pest side the largest and highest building and the panoramic view is the BEST!!!!

Beautiful building. You can't really visit Budapest and not go to see St Stephen's. It's a very impressive building and very beautiful. A nominal donation is requested on entering to help towards the upkeep but the donation box is not manned & it is totally optional.

Fabulous especially the panoramic views. Beautiful building, lots of tourists wanting to see the hand of St Stephen (Istavan in Hungarian)...Relics are not my thing.
The chapels are beautiful and when the crowds quieten down you can find yourself having a moment of contemplation/ prayer.
The extra charge to go up to the panoramic view is worth it.

Take the stairs.. Didn't know anything about this place, but saw that you can go up in the tower for a couple of bucks so decided to do it.Was awesome! Great views, you can walk all the way around the dome on top and can even see the inside.Don't take the elevator though, it's not that high and walking the stairs is half the fun.

Ateist with goose skin. Breathtaking ambience, huge space, organ music, frankincence in the air - we stayed amazed .Entry is free of charge, for 500 HUF (approx 1,5 €) you can visit a tower - upstairs will reach you above cupola of duomo (crazy feeling - you can still hear the organ music from there) and nothing compares the view from the tower.

Must Visit!. One of the highlights of our visit to Budapest. Entrance to the main parts of the basilica is free. Be aware that they close off the center entry when weddings are scheduled, however, you can still see the insides of the basilica and the chapel located in the rear (left) using the two side aisle entrances. Another interesting part of the Basilica visit is the climb to the observation deck around the dome. Tickets for that are sold in a recess just outside the entrance on the right side for about HUF 3000. There are two ways to get upstairs. The simplest way is to climb the spiral staircase right next to the ticket booth up to the 3rd floor and the take another spiral staircase to the very top. This could be physically demanding for some people, but most can make it with short breaks along the way. The view inside the structure of the dome is also photo worthy. Once at the top, there is a 360 degrees observation deck around the outside which gives you a beautiful view of the entire city. The clock tower chimes on the hour. There is also a large square in front. There are also two elevators (on either sides of the entrance) that can take you up to the 3rd floor, then you change to a second elevator which takes you all the way up, but I cannot confirm this second part. The capacity of these elevators is only 6 or 8 passengers and the lines are long. The other interesting thing (sorry to to digress) is that there is a lovely gelato store called Rosa Gelato on the left side of the Basilica as you exit the front side. It's next to a money change shop with a right red sign. By the way that exchange shop gives excellent exchange rates. The gelato store is known for its servings of gelato shaped like a ROSE with multiple colors/flavors! It costs HUF 600 for two flavors and HUF 700 for 3 flavors. Have your phone video recorder ready to capture how they make these works of art! I found the pistachio flavor to be the best one, yum! Enjoy.
Stunning church. One of the things that you must do on a visit to Budapest. The decorations are beautiful, although the saint's mummified hand was not so impressive!

Great early morning before the crowds. Worth a walk up the hill from Chain Bridge early in the morning. No access into the church but free access around the battlements and also good for the picture taker given the freedom of movement
Stunning inside,. Beautiful inside when the sunlight streams through the stained glass dome. A small entry fee of 200 HUF required.
Great church. Beautiful church. Also is a tower tour which provides great panoramic views. Great museum on upper floors of church with loads of interesting treasury items.
Winderful view from the top. This is a really magnificent building. Inside is very majestic and very beautiful. We went up to the tower (by lift) and the views from the top is breath taking

Even Better the Second Time. This was our second visit to the Basilica, and it was even more amazing given the ongoing service at the time. The interior is one of the most beautiful we've visited in our travels around the world.

A real focal point!. We spent a lot of our time around the Basilica during our trip to Budapest. There is a lot to see and do in the immediate surrounds, including some great food and drink options.Inside the Basilica is equally impressive as the outside - if not more so. Make sure that you pay (I think 500 HUF) to climb to the top to get some of the best views available in the city!

Beautiful building and zone. We never went inside but even so, this was one of my favourite stops. The architecture obviously is stunning but I also loved the square where the entrance is, the atmosphere there both by day and by night.
Nice location.. It is beautiful, but honestly its similar with others in Europe. It is nice located, with easy access to the other sights. With nice restaurants and hotels around.

An organ concert on Monday Wonderful!. A great concert with nice music and a reasonable price. It was just over 30 minutes which was perfect. We ended up in the back and our seats vibrated from the sound. The setting is magnificent . Perfect visit for us! If you here on Monday, organize your day so you are nearby and can attend!

Beautiful Church. Great Views. Went to basilica today. Lovely church which is free. Nominal charge for the tower definitely worthwhile. The tower opens at 10. We were the first up and it was fab.
Worth seeing the Basilica at night beautiful
Beautiful. A wonderful basilica, one of my favorites in Europe, love the architecture of the building! It's a must see if in the city.

Iconic Building in Budapest. One of the Iconic buildings in Budapest and very beautiful basilica in Budapest and in Europe as well. Interior of the church is very beautiful and the exterior is stunning. Entry into the basilica is free but there is donation box at the entrance.

Lovely Cathedral unspoiled by gilt. We had hoped to hear an organ concert but at least we did hear the magnificent organ being played in a place with spectacular acoustics. some of the organ pipes are in the sacristy, others in the rear of the building offering stereo sound. If you have long enough in Passau you really should go to a concert.this building is baroque but not at all gaudy, very little gilt except above the altar, and beautiful stucco work.
Great attraction. Take time here it's one of many but a wonderful attraction.We went on a Saturday and it wasn't at all busy .

St. Stephen's Basilica (Szent Istvan Bazil. St. Stephen's Basilica (Szent Istvan Bazilika) is very beautiful to see though you have to pay entrance fee and there are a lot of tourists. Still worth seeing.

Breath-taking. For an agnostic-atheist, even I could appreciate this place. The interior is unbelievable, they were happy for you to take pictures inside - even flashes were going off during communion - and the staff were helpful. Would definitely recommend for the small donation fee of 50p.

Make the Climb . St. Stephen's was staggeringly beautiful inside and entrance to the main sanctuary is free - they have a suggested donation box. Pay the 500 HUF to go to the very top and if you're able, take the stairs up. You get such an amazing perspective as you go higher and higher, including seeing the other side of the magnificent dome. From the top you get a 360 degree view - absolutely stunning. Take the elevator halfway down and then walk the rest. You'll be so glad you did.

Beautiful church in Pest. One of the top attractions and certainly worth visiting. A minimal donation is asked for entry. I got to see it fairly empty for a bit as they were ushering people out. Beautiful stained glass. It's usually crowded.
FABULOUS BASIIICA. fabulous Basilica for both its imposing appearance and for its interior decorated with 55 different types of marble.
Breathtaking. This was my favourite tourist stop, utterly beautiful building. Must see. Brought a tear to my eye. The decoration is amazing and in a great location, some nice coffee shops outside

Again, a majestic and imposing building.. When I felt I had lost my way back to my hotel, I just asked any passing person where the Basilica was located and they knew the direction. It is a popular landmark known to many if not all HUngarians.

Majestic Basilica. Monumental St.Istvan Basilica, you can`t pass by without visiting. Inside you can find very rich decoration. Plus interesting advantage - an observation deck on the dome, the whole city at a glance.

A must see with free entrance. The church is named after Saint Stephen I of Hungary, the first King of Hungary. It is a very good example for the Renaissance Revival architecture. It is located in the city centre, and entrance is free of charge. Well worth to spend some time inside and appreciate the features...
Awsome. Beautiful Basilica!!! Rainy day, sunny day... not important. Amazing, wonderful church. I was inside so many times, but it's amazing!
Fabulous interior. Beautifully decorated, well worth the visit. We saw a wedding in progress so couldn't get into the central section but well worth seeing it

Glad we made it to the concert. We were pleased to arrive just in time to hear a lovely evening concert in this beautiful building, where the sublime music was assisted by excellent acoustics. The building itself is well worth a visit.
Huge Basilic on a lively square in the mid of Pest. Absolutely a must when in Budapest. The decor in the church is marvolous and the whole building impressing.
Beautiful basilica. Gorgeous church. For an extra fee you can climb to the top There is a donation request for entry into the church itself.

Must see if you love churches. Entrance is free, but be nice and make a donation. The outside is gorgeous, but the inside is even more impressive. One of the most beautiful churches I have ever seen and I have seen a couple in big cities that are mentionable. So many details and it is massive! Be sure to check out the hand of St. Stephan, the king of Hungary who's wish it was to spread Christianity throught the entire country. The church is also on the Unesco-list.

Wonderful View. We were here on a holiday an thus the entire Basilica was not open to the public, unfortunately.We did buy tickets to go to the top, which is a must for a beautiful panorama of the city. Be sure to take advantage of the elevators!

Beautiful Cathedral. I stopped here for a quick sight tour of the cathedral before being whisked away to a wedding. I'm very glad I stopped and saw this. The cathedral is beautiful. There was organ music in full swing which really added to the atmosphere of this place. The outside of the building is quite imposing with it's statues, quite a sight. Inside is just as wonderful and I would say to take the time to see The Holy Right Hand of St Stephen the King of Hungary, which is on display. Obviously being respectful as nuns are on 'guard'. Though I would check in advance if its on display all year around.
Awesome. Basilica is a stunning building set in a stunning location. Interior is superb, with a extraordinary chapel behind the main altar - wher one of St Stephen's hands is on display.

Architectural gem . Even the briefest of visits to the Basilica is enough to be wowed by the stunning interior. Take a small hand mirror to avoid getting a crick in your neck as you admire the lavishly decorated ceilings. If you have more than a few moments to spare, wander through to the area where the King's mummified hand is proudly displayed.
Visit and concert. go for a concert its fabulous and well priced - you can buy ticket on the day directly at the Basilica
Impressive Basilic. Very impressive large Basilic, The chapel with the relics of the saint is very beautiful and the main hall is very impressive.

Beautiful and worth the elevator fee to the top. Gorgeous church and newer than most throughout Europe. The view from the top of the basilica is worth the trek and the few euro to take the lift to the top. Buy your ticket before getting on the elevator!

Great views. We enjoyed our visit. The interior was nice and impressive. The real draw to this place is the view at the top. Be prepared for quite some steps if you decide to go up on foot.It has a nice panorama view over the city without any annoying opsticals like fences or other view obstructing protection.Budapest has quite a few view spots (most on the Buda side), so this one on the Pest side is nice as it offers an entirely different scenery.
Beautiful. As you would expect the interior was sumptuous and inspiring. The history speaks for itself here. Worth a visit.
Truly Beautiful. Gorgeous and grand, the basilica is awe-inspiring. Don't miss "the hand" to the left of the altar. We loved the scale and silence of the church.

You will be truly amazed. I visited the Basilica to attend a music recital I have visited many churches, but nothing prepares you for the magnificent interior of the building. Every wall and ceiling is highly decorated. Don't miss this building - something to behold

Absolutely beautiful Basilica . A beautiful city like Budapest must have an absolute beautiful Basilica, and Saint Stephen's does not disappoint. Absolutely amazing, beautiful, and breathtaking all at the same time. As beautiful as it is during the daytime, do not miss the opportunity to see it at night. Budapest is a truly beautiful city, but something about that city at night really stands out to me. When you are at the door steps of the Basilica turn all the way around and if you walk straight it will lead you straight to the Chain Bridge and you will find several restaurants and bars along the way. Enjoy
Great view from the top!. Largest church in Hungary! Interesting historical facts. You can buy a ticket for about €3 and go to the top of the dome. I love the Hungarian double cross!

Magnificent and grand. It is just amazing the Brasilia is still standing magnificently after more than a century of history , intersperse within the more modern building around it . One have to view it to appreciate the pure beauty of it .
Stunning!. This is an amazingly beautiful church and well worth the visit. There are also concerts during the spring and summer months,

Stunning!. This is a beautiful Basilica. It is well worth a trip up the tower where you will have stunning aerial views of this beautiful city. If you feel energetic, you can climb the spiral staircase although for the less lively or disabled, there is a lift. It is so peaceful inside with such beautiful decor.

Lovely church. Not really into churches but this one is as impressive as they go. Great square in front of it too. We went up the tower which is worthwhile considering they only charge you 500 Forint (about £1.30!). Some previous TA advisors say this offers the best panoramic views but I disagree, the best are from the other side of the Danube on the Buda side (Fisherman's Bastion and / or Buda Castle). Still worth it though for an alternative view point.

Must go to the top for the view!. Loved this basilica! It is gorgeous and a must see in Budapest. I went to the top of the Basilica (you can take and elevator, Recommended) and got the most breathtaking view of the city. I would recommend this earlier in the day as it can get crouded.
Large lavishly decorated basilica. Large lavishly decorated basilica with different chapels and a crypt you can visit. Not to expense and has a big square in front

A neo-classical chef-d'œuvre. One of the most magnificent building the the City of Budapest.Located in Pest and with a large square where you can enjoy your time under the sunlight...The building is amazing with its 2 towers and the large dome.The inside is just magnificent with a wide bave and trancept.The colors and illuminations are just awesome...Definetely a architectural chef-d'oeuvre...A Must see!!!

Beautiful . I visited St. Stephen's basilica on a trip to Budapest for my birthday. We weren't able to do it or because they were in the middle of mass comma however we were able to take pictures of a few things.
Awe inspiring . Truly awe inspiring. On the outside and stunning on the inside. The climb to the top of the dome is pretty easy and the views are incredible

Very ornate!. Inside of the basilica is very ornate with gold plated interiors. If you go inside a small chapel at the side of the main altar, you can see the mummified palm of the first king of Hungary.

Go up to the top!. The walk to here is very nice and the inside of the cathedral is impressive with an interesting history. Although, nothing compares to the view of the city from the very top! It is not too crowded and the view of the city is the best Budapest has to offer.

Another church ... not quite. Seriously impressive structure both outside and in. Unlike so many other churches in this part of the world entry is free but we did pay to climb up the top and it was worth it as great 360 degree views of the city can be enjoyed. Put a coin in the box to see St Stephens hand!
Truly mesmerising!. I was lucky enough to visit this church as my friend was getting married there. Truly magical place and so beautiful! Definitely worth a visit.
A beautiful church. This is a beautiful church still used for services; in fact, we visited during one. Free to wonder in and see the amazing architecture.

One of the most beautiful churches I have seen. Alcatel in the center part of town . The facade is awesome with tall carved statues all around the top part of the dome. The entrance is free but a donation box is there requesting a minimum of 1 euro for renovation contributions. Inside the columns /pillars are of high quality brown marble with "gold " fixtures al around .ceilings all around are very impressive , and so are the multiple 6-8feet statues all around the churches. Photography is allowed and there is a history of the church (in English & Hungarian) at the exit door inside the church.Outside the "square" is big and nicely decorated. There is a nice souvenir shop nearby with a very large variety of products. Also the exchange bureau has good rates for forex.

Very impressive. This Roman Catholic basilica is equally impressive from both the outside and the inside. We arrived by taxi and thought at first that the basilica was closed. However, the door was on the opposite side of the building from where the taxi dropped us. For a moment we were confused by the tickets for sale at the entrance. These were not, however, for entering the basilica but were tickets for a concert which was to be held there that evening. Entering the basilica, we were stunned by the beauty before us. Entry is free but there is a suggested donation of 1 euro. I was surprised that photography was allowed in the basilica. I might have been better prepared if I had realised that it was since the low level of light but brightly illuminated works of art make photography tricky. The whole basilica is beautiful and everywhere you look is stunning. The many works of art around the basilica deserve a close look - take time to see them. Look up from under the dome to get a real feeling of splendour. Of course, the basilica has many visitors who come to see its beauty but some sit in quiet prayer. Despite the many visitors there is a feeling of peace in the basilica.
Beautiful church, esp the leadlight windows. Lucky enough to have visited when there was a church service on. The organ playing was magnificent and added to the solemn, peaceful atmosphere.

Church part is enough. IMHO, church part is enough for every tourist. Tower's view is the not the best view of Budapest, actually bad view if you compare this view with another places. (bastion, gellert, buda castle etc) Also, other places are free. If you visit the church, you can see the great monuments, icons about Christianism, every corner of church worth to see in my opinion. If you spend money at there, you should take the souvenir coin from manual coin creating machines. (at the entrance of Basilica, and if i'm not wrong 2€/piece)

Gorgeous. Beautiful Basilica. Interesting things to read inside. Entrance is by donation with a minimum of 200 forints. Definitely worthwhile to visit to see the inside and outside. Nice to see the outside lit up at night too.

Worth getting in. This is the big basilica with a marble interior. It's impressive because of its grandeur. You want to see the real thing? I'ld say, go to Italy, those marble churches are magnificient.
Stunning. Well worth visiting it's a stunning building inside and out. Also worth taking the 368 steps up to the top for a view over Budapest, plus you earn your lunchtime beer!

Totally stunning!. We wandered into this impressive building while strolling the delightful streets around Parliament. For me the interior was truly breathtaking; the statues, the paintings, the ornate decoration, the mosaics on the domed ceiling, the sheer size of this fabulous cathedral, just silenced me.( I wish it had silenced all the silly, chattering visitors posing for selfies). Best of all was the heavenly singing of the choir which I felt so lucky to witness, and found very moving in this wonderful place of worship.
Beautiful building. It is well worth a visit to see the stunning inside of the Basilica. It is a beautiful place. It is free to go in. If you're in Budapest don't go without visiting.
Nice view. The basilica is not such impressive but the view from the dome is great. So worth a visit. The pribce is the same to take the stairs or the lift (around 1,5 euro)

Beautiful. Lovely church, beautiful interior, wonderful organ. There's really no charge to get in, but there is a free will offering expected. Try to go to an organ concert when you are there; well worth the $10 to get in and hear it.

Excellent acoustics. We took in an organ concert here. The price was reasonable and the acoustics in the building are really good. I am not but if you are catholic I am sure there are a lot more things you will enjoy in this place.

An underwhelming city landmark. Though the basilica is big and impressive compared to many major churches is other European cities it is nothing special. Neo-classic, with loads of statues and paintings and decoration it is nice to see but I found it a lot better when seen from the Castle at sunset and at night than seen at close distance.The square in front of the church is half tourist trap cafes and half ugly modern building and the neighborhood is a bit characterless.I did not have time to climb the cupola or visit the crypt but overall I was underwhelmed.

Stunning Inside. Please do take the chance to have a look inside this beautiful church. It's imposing as you approach it from the square at the front of the church but it's size is more than matched by the beauty you'll find inside. The height of the ceilings is quite breathtaking and you'll find yourself looking up all the time. If you have a camera that lets you shoot a frame over a number of seconds give it a go.

Lovely church with excellent views from the roof. A very nice church to wander around and look at the stained glass and decorations but the highlights are definitely the mummified hand of St Stephen (genuinely didn't realise what it was for a few moments but bit of a sight to see) and the panoramic views from the top of the roof. Getting up to the roof costs about a pound each but is worth the journey up in the slightly scary dodgy lifts (there are two different sections of lifts, both pretty tiny so not for those scared of lifts and cramped spaces!)
Wonderful church. The inside is so stunning, beautiful place to visit, lovely just to stand on the steps and take it all in.

Stunning church in the middle of the city. We went right when it opened and beat the rush for tickets. We enjoyed going to the top of the church. You can either take the stairs or the elevator. No matter what you have to take the elevator down after you finish looking around. They do credit cards and you pay right when you are entering the church. The stained glass is breath taking and the entire feeling in the church is wonderful. While walking around be sure to look up and see everything there is to offer. There is a beautiful organ and there is so much detail on every part of the inside.

A monumental neo-classical church. The co-Cathedral of the Esztergom-Budapest Archdiocese is the third largest church in Hungary and the principal touristic attraction in central Pest. Named after St. Stephen, the first King of Hungary, and the leader that converted the country to Christianity, the basilica houses King Stephen's right hand in the reliquary. The classical design in the shape of a cross, is extensively decorated by frescoes, statues, oil paintings and stucco work. It has great acoustics and is the site of frequent concerts. It houses and excellent organ and the crypt has a great collection of sacred objects. The facade is framed by two bell towers, providing absolute symmetry. In front of the church, there is a large square. There is an excellent observation deck around the dome, accessible by elevator or a vary long staircase (364 stairs). Since the Basilica is one of the tallest buildings in the city, the deck provides excellent view of the city and especially Buda, across the river.
Good Catholic Fare!. Gold leaf, incense, Art and lots of ritual, especially at Pentecost. Worth a visit even for non-believers. Entry by voluntary donation.

Breathtaking Building. The interior of the building is truly breath taking. Going into the church itself is free. I also went up to the panorama tower, the view is definitely worth 500 HUF. I'm not sure what schedule the organ player is on, but I was lucky enough to be there when they came out to play. If you can hear the pipe organ echo through the church, it will make your whole visit.

Majestic. This church is an absolute must to visit when in Budapest. Both outside and inside are impressive. Great architecture and artistry. Entry is almost free ( they just ask for a small donation,less than a dollar...
Stunning organ. Organ concerts are offered on Mondays at 5:00. The program included well-known classics which showed off the amazing instrument and fantastic acoustics of the basilica.
Stunning views. Great way to see the city from the balcony on top.It's quite a few steps to get to the top but you can also get an elevator for the last few meters which is useful.Beautiful building.
Impressive building. We didn't have time to go inside, but just looking at it from the outside, it is a very impressive building.

A must see!!. After visiting the Basillica during the day - which was absolutely stunning ( do pay the small fee to go to the top of church ) we took in a Concerto Organ concert at night. It was 6400HUF per person and worth the $$. The performance was around 75 min long and included both male and female singers, a flutist and of course the organist. What an unforgettable experience.

Another Spectacular Landmark!. Beautiful on the outside and even better on the inside. Entry only costs around 200HUF which is simply a donation for the upkeep of the basilica. There is a tower you can go up if you want to pay the extra (1000 or 1500HUF..... Can't honestly remember), which I think is well worth it! Views from the top are amazing!It is also stunning at night! You must visit here!

A beautiful Roman Catholic basilica in Budapest.. Built in neoclassical style with a Greek cross plan, the basilica as 87 m long by 55 m wide. The main facade is complete with two twin towers that serve as belfries. In his right tower is the largest bell and heavier Hungary (which has nine tons of weight).The dome has stunning panoramic views of Budapest, accessible by lifts or by steps.In the chapel behind the shrine, is conserved the most important relic of the Hungarian Christianity: the king's mummy Stephen I of Hungary, the first king of Hungary and founder of the Hungarian church.
Glenn . Very good church, many things to see inside. very cheap entry fee and they do great music nights there. 17 € tickets. wonderful evening .

A Basilica of huge dimensions. A huge Basilica, beautiful room, very catholic atmosphere. My personal taste prefers other huge churches (like San Paolo fuori mura in Rome) which are less overloaden with objects, altars etc. But for who likes the demonstration of church power and abundance, this is a good place to sense into it.
Special. Architecture was very stunning if you are a buff for ancient architecture.....great upkeep and very historical.
beautiful cathedral inside and out. Enjoyed taking photographs and lighting a candle for family. Many free concerts are offered at the door every evening.
Great views. A fantasy of nationalism with a quirky element- great views. A mite expensive for drinks etc so be prepared.

Beautiful by day, better by night. As we were on a photography holiday, this was a must do shot. It's lovely by day but I wanted to get this shot by night which is much more atmospheric in my view. It's an amazing building both inside and out and really should be visited on any visit to this amazing city.

Beautiful. It's near Chain Bridge on Pest side. It's beautiful. It's like typical church in Europe, high dome, beautiful paintings, fresco, and art all around the building. I personally would not say it's a must see, but if you have time and happen to be nearby, won't hurt to check it out.

Gorgeous church, creepy hand. The church is beautiful on the outside with towers, mosaic arches and statues. However, the interior reminded me of a smaller St Peter's.. lots of painted domed ceiling, marble everywhere, gilded decor...very beautiful. The organ above the main entry is nice. The famed hand of Stephen is in an enclosed glass case, which looked like a Wardian case, but you can see the old pale hand. A bit creepy. Overall, a beautiful church to visit.
beautiful. just like all of Budapest St. Stephen Basilica is amazing just a gorgeus building and well worth the visith
Wow. This is a must visit it's absolutely stunning the architecture is wonderful plenty of photo opportunities .

Beautiful basilica - extraordinarily ornate. In a lovely little square with bars ad restaurants all around which makes it a great place to visit and also sit and watch the world go by. Entry is free but with severe encouragement from man in front of the doors to give a donation of 200HUF. Very, very ornate inside particularly for a Catholic church (if you are English). You can go up to the top for fabulous views which I did on my last visit. Didn't do it again as you can go part way by lift, but then you have to walk up a rather open staircase to then go out onto a very narrow place jostling with other visitors to go around the dome. Too scary if you are not very fond or good with heights like me!

Magnificent . A trip to Budapest is not complete without a visit to Szent Istvan Bazilika the panorama in itself is worth the mere 500 forints to take in some of the best views of the city as it stretches away from you into the distance. The architecture and grandeur is a sight to behold as is the tranquility of a very magical place filled with ornate design and steeped in history and culture an absolute must for all. Not to be missed.

Beautiful church.... climb up to the tower to see the beautiful city. Beautiful church and must visit. Climb up the tower to dome and see the beautiful city of Budapest.... At night quite few cafes around the church to have a good meal and enjoy the site of the church fully lit up
Amazing experience. One of the most beautiful churches I've ever been in, truly impressive structure. Requires a small donation to enter (but im not sure if it's enforced).

Beautiful building and amazing acoustics . Went to tour this cathedral and was blown away by the beautiful marble everywhere and even more by the acoustics heard during a choir rehearsal. We decided to go back the next evening for a vocal and organ recital. Wow! Recommend checking out a music venue here as well as an amazing structure.

Breathtaking . Definitely worth the tiny entry donation! A very special place to visit, would highly recommend. They allow cameras in the main cathedral but no flash photography in the small room to the back, to allow people to reflect and pray in peace. A very humbling and awe inspiring building, even for people of non-faith like myself. Also they hold concerts here which are supposed to be very impressive.

Don't miss the view from the top. It's an amazing church to see inside, very ornate. They ask for a small donation to enter, but aside from that the climb to the top is a must. Pay the small fee and go - amazing views of Budapest. It was a clear day and we could see for miles!
Beautiful building. Definitely go inside, stunning architecture and another free attraction. Amazing view from the top and offers some great photo opportunities

The view from the top of the tower is well worth the climb!. A great place to visit, especially as it's free admission (donations). The tower is 302 steps up and is a great climb (although there is a lift if you're feeling lazy). Well worth the money (this bit is charged) and the ascent as the view from the top is sensational!!Highly recommend squeezing this into your Budapest schedule. Must see.

Amazing views from the top.. One of the most significant tourist attractions in Budapest. Amazing architecture and one of the tallest buildings in the city. Beautiful interior. A must see attraction. For a fee, you can take a tour to the top of the church for amazing views to the city below. Great for picture taking.
beautiful.. lovely area almost traffic free, trams and metro nearby plus resturaunts and souvenir market.very busy tourist attraction.

Famous Catholic Church in Budapest. Visited this roman catholic church - St Stephen's Basilica. Patrons need to make a donation before entering into its premises for excursion. Church may be closed to public if there's event and/or prayer.Nice interior aircon church. Licensed tourist guide will provide details of the church. Certain parts of the church were dedicated to Virginia Mary, The Great Mother of God.There's a fountain outside the church where many locals sit and relax. There's a souvenir shop near it, where most tourists visited and used their washroom.
Beautiful church. Lovely interior to this church.Beautiful stained glass in the chapel area, which housed the relic of St. Stephen. Worth a visit.

Must see church. Though not as old as most churches viewed when touring European cities, this basilica is beautiful. Make certain you visit the nave (St. Stephen's fist) and take the elevator up to see the panoramic view of the city.

building. brilliant architecture, one of the best things about eastern europe. its wonderfully preserved and is well worth seeing both at day and night. quite a popular place though so be prepared for plenty of homeless beggars, religious fanatics and tosspots.
Great view . Fantastic views of the city only cost £2.00 to get in there is a lift ,if you want to climb beware302 steps but is well worth the effort

Don't miss a climb to the dome.. We went here with Gaby, a guide from Budapest Locals. It was a lovely cathedral but the best part was climbing to the dome and seeing the city. There is an elevator that stops midway if you only want to climb halfway. You can also see the right hand of St. Stephan if you go to the left on the main floor. For a small charge lights will illuminate the hand.
You must visit inside. On a return visit to Budapest (after 21 years) we rediscovered this beautiful building. if you see nothing else in Budapest, this will make your trip.

Phew 302 steps!. Beautiful place to visit, forgetting our age ( wrong side of 50+) we opted for the tower walk of 302 steps, ( you can just get the lift) but it was early & we were up for the challenge, when you get to the top and see the view it was well worth it. If you want that special picture of the city it will cost you 400huf (just over £1.00) each. Lady in the souvenir booth was a bit stroppy for no reason but I wished her a pleasant day as I felt I had achieved my goal.
Pretty nice panorama, but not a "must see" place. There is a pretty nice panorama from the tower and you can see King St. Stephen's relic in the basilica which is supposed to be his right arm.

My first 5 star church.. St Stephen is simply breathtaking. I do not rate churches highly as they tend to be very similar. This building is just spectacular. The detail and grandeur caught me completely off guard. I was fortunate that there was a mass and music happening. And afterwards the church bells rang.I rate this very highly.

Strange exhibit. Large church with a mummified hand of King Stephen which is paraded through city every year. get the lift to the top for excellent views, tickets are sold at the front near the stairs, it's a bit confusing. Actual church is free and full of splendour.
Beautiful Cathedral. This is a beautiful cathedral both inside and outside. We were lucky enough to enjoy a wonderful concert in this gorgeous setting. Make sure to visit.

Beautiful. A beautiful cathedral. Really enjoyed the opportunity to look around. The best thing is to go to the top and walk around the dome. One gets a complete view over Budapest. Also managed to attend a concert in the cathedral. Worth the effort!
Beautiful church. A beautiful church with a great atmosphere. It is very conveniently located in the centre of the city.
A must see. The Basillica is a stunning building both inside and out. Lovely to just stop for a moment and take it in, have a quiet prayer and light a candle for loved ones.

Beautiful Campus. We were on a tour and got to see the inside of the Church including the treasury.
It was jaw dropping and the detail was very impressive.
Mr John Donegan. Well worth a visit interesting history easily accessibly by public transport: restaurants nearby are a rip off as are the taxis.
Great place to visit. i could have spent more time in here but it was closing, got to see an end of a wedding--when i first entered. that was pretty good

Amazing!. In middle of busiest streets,but seeing it makes you forget your rush.
Size of it makes you humble and atheist to religion.
Amazing part of culture! Loved it!

Nice basilica and wonderful views. The entry to the basilica is a donation of €1 and you can take a wander round and take photos inside the basilica. It has nice architecture and beautiful stained-glass windows. The basilica is at the very centre of the city so it's very easy to get there by public transport. Most importantly however, I suggest you either climb or even better, pay a small fee and take a lift to the dome, which has amazing views over Budapest. Unfortunately on the day we couldn't see the Holy Right as apparently there was a private service going on but I do wish we were informed of this before going in.

Absolutely gorgeous, especially from the walkway leading up to it. Nice by day and night, especially as you're walking the walk way from the bridge towards the church, it just catches your breath and you can't stop but stare at it and smile.We didn't go in but just admired from the outside very beautiful
Unique building.. For us, other than the beauty and construction of the building, it's also the starting point of our hop on hop off bus tour

Awesome Archtecture!. Totally worth a visit, although you are not going to spend more than 10min inside as there is not much to see apart from the building itself (and considering you will not pray). Entrance is 1 euro, but it is more of a suggestion than a request. Great restaurants and bars nearby!
St Stephens basilica. This is a wonderful church to visit . It is highly decorative with a huge dome which is visible from all over budapest. No charge for admission
Short visit. A lovely church with wonderful stained glass windows.I found the external architecture very beautiful.
Beautiful Basilica. Hit's every mark for travelers who like traditional ornate churches. Impressive organs, stain glass, painting on the ceiling, detailed wood work in the pews.
Beautiful. Gorgeus cathedral in the heart of the city. The architecture is breathtaking. Amazing gold decoration, stained glass. Lots of tourists but you still can feel the spiritual effect.
A Must To Visit. a beautiful church, lots of carvings, and beautiful stained glass windows. Definitely climb to the top, the view is stunning!

Beautiful and interesting. The Basilica was absolutely beautiful! The gold was amazing and the Easter service was interesting. Got to see the mummified hand of St. Stephen in a shrine and that was really cool to see. Highly recommended!
Church visit . It's a newer church built in 1896-1905. But the marbling work is good and the painting and carvings are real good. Well maintained. We heard a musical concert so was real nice indeed
beautiful, stunning, spiritual experience. worth the visit for sure, amazing what man can do in the name of God. well lit, maintained, only certain guides let in
Huge and full of gorgeous decorations. It almost feels like you are in Rome when you walk inside this church. It has enormous stained glass and gold decorations everywhere.
Stunning. Beautiful church with lots of history and beautiful architecture. The highlight is a box with a saints hand in it which was fascinating

Wonderful architecture. This cathedral is another beautiful example of old European architecture in the city of Budapest. Photographs of the structure and its details do not give justice to the wonder of the style and construction of the building. In person, it is truly astounding. One of many great sites and buildings to see while visiting the area.
Beautiful interior. We also came for the organ concert. The acoustics were amazing. Ther is no need to book ahead as you can buy tickets just before the concert starts.
Nice place. good to walk around, and nice view from the top of the towers. Take the time and ticket up to see the great view

Great view of Budapest. The church itself is free to enter but a small donation is almost compulsory. To be fair it is a very small donation, inside the church is interesting, beautifully constructed but quite plain and uncluttered in its way. The stained glass windows are excellent. In a side chapel they had the remnant of the hand of a saint. It's not much to see being encased in a gold casket but worth a look. The real purpose of visiting should be to go to the top of the dome. This costs around £1.35. You can either climb the steps or take the lift for the same price. Take the lift but beware there are still a few steps to climb to get outside onto the walkway around the dome. Once you are there the view of the surrounding area is well worth it.
beautiful, worth visiting. Really beautiful exterior and even more beautiful interior. A definite must-see on a visit to Budapest.

Amazing. This is another beautiful church. It is named for Stephen, the first king of Hungary. Supposedly his right hand is in the reliquary. Every Roman Catholic church has some kind of relic in it so this is theirs. We attended a mass here and it was a beautiful experience. The music was very nice and although this is an old church, they have very up-to-date technology--a see-through screen to the right of the main altar which displays the words to the songs and some of the prayers.
Worth a look. We briefly visited the outside of St.Stephen’s Bascilla. The building is really impressive, definitely recommend seeing it.

Beautiful and Very Impressive. One of Budapest "Must Visit" places. Grand and magnificent, this church is decorated with a great attention to the minor of details. The dome reaches the height of 96 meters, makes you feel "small".
Gorgeous. Beautiful and ornate church with the mummified hand of st istvan. Whole experience makes even the least of religious persons moved and changed after the experience.
Serenity in the heart of the city. The interior of this church is simply magnificent it is a must see you immediately feel a sense of calmness when you enter

Great panoramic views of the city. We went inside the Basilica which was beautiful - very ornate. But the better bit was the climb up to the top of the basilica. From there you could get panoramic views of the city - it was a really good way to get your bearings.There was a lift you could take to the top. We took the stairs and they were manageable if you have a reasonable level of fitness.
Amazing Church. great architecture and great location in the heart of town. Amazing place around with restaurants and cafes.

Majestic Basilica. St.Stephen'S Basilica is an imposig majestic monument worth visiting.It is also recommended to go up to the top where we have a nice view of Budapest. A big square at the Basilica leads to a walking area where all kinds of boutiques, restaurants and caffe-trottoirs are found
Panoramic view. Don't miss the elevator by the exit which takes you above the dome for a 360 view of the city. 500 forint per ticket. Some steps to negotiate.

Great building, great architecture. As most of the buildings in the centre of Budapest, they have an amazing architecture style. You just stare at them all the time..Don t forget to see the holy hand inside the church!

Great for an evening concert. . We went to one of the evening string concerts and enjoyed it immensely. It was great to experience with no crowds. Close to the Rosa Gelarto for great (and beautiful) gelato.
Elevator. Views from top was great, more great was elevator that stop on middlefloor where was no exit (and elevator hadnt mean to move)

Great Viewing Point. Took the elevator to the viewing platform which goes around the outside of the dome. Also went inside but must of it was roped off for an event, which was too bad since it was beautiful inside.

Climb the tower. The church isn't that big, because of the restricted parts. Just walk to the left at the end of the church and you can visit the hand of one of the kings. And for a 400 or 500 florints you can climb the tower (or take the elevator). For a 360 degrees view of the city.

gorgeous building with an even better view. I've never been inside the actual basilica, but I did climb up the tower and let me tell you, it was well worth it. The ticket is only 500 HUF and the view might be one of the prettiest I've ever seen. Bring your camera with you and go to the top - you won't be disappointed!Tip: get the lift to the top of the tower - saves both time and energy.

Grand looking. Yes, there are bigger and grander looking churches in many countries in Europe, but this ranks among the top in Budapest. Both the interior and exterior of the church are very ornately decorated and makes for good photo opps

Beautiful church . Beautiful basilica in budapest. Not as grand as I thought it would be but still very beautiful. Worth the visit if in budapest for a few days to go inside. If u don't have time your not missing much but a view from the outside is beautiful

Nice place . The basilica amazing real art , I can't say anything about it amazing, and the area as well perfect there is shops and restaurants , u can walk around have ur dinner and drinks at night , and there is alots of activities

Stunning Interior!. Even if you've seen dozens of the most famous churches across Europe, this one is worth stepping into. It's free, and the interior is beautiful. It's more colorful than most churches, and the organ is unbelievable ornate. There's not much in terms of art compared to Rome or Florence, but the architecture itself is stunning. Be sure to check out the holy relic of St. Stephen himself!

Stunning architecture. First king of Hungary, István I (or Stephen) devoted himself to the Christianization of the Magyarab people (people who lives along the Nile River in Egypt and Sudan). He founded several monasteries and was sanctified. This is his Basilica. Huge, with capacity for over 8000 people. The most important church in Budapest (along with the building of the Hungarian Parliament) is also the tallest building in the capital (96 m). The number 96 symbolizes the arrival of the Hungarians in the Carpathian basin in the year 896. The church was built in the 19th century in neoclassical style. Although it’s called as Basilica, it’s more like a Greek church in a cross shape. It offers a beautiful view from the top of its dome. In recent years, the Basilica has another function as well: nowadays St. Stephen Basilica is also the Budapest Cathedral.

Amazing building and great religious themed artworks. Go early in the morning to avoid queues and crowds. Take your time to look at the inside, every inch of the building is incredible. You'll find plenty of photos on Google so put your camera away and enjoy your visit.

Amazing views of the hole city!!. Recently visited here on a long weekend in Budapest. If you are not scared of heights definitely climb to the top of the basilica as the view are exquisite! Still worth going to for the ground floor alone.

No Right Hand. The Basilica is not that old and it sits in a square where other buildings are too close for its splendour to be properly revealed. The Hand of St. Stephen was not available to view but seeing a full church was some compensation.
One of the best in Europe. If you could listen to a concert in the Basilica this will the ultimate. it is absolutely a must see on a visit to Budapest.
Just Fantastic. Just a wonderful place to reflect there was a service going on we were able to stay through out a place to be quiet and take in the beauty

Daily organ concerts and amazing city views. Europe is filled with majestic churches and at some point they all start to look the same. What makes St. Stephen's Basilica special are the daily organ concerts and city views.
Stunning . Absolutely beautiful. This church was filled with gold and lots of colours. The detail was amazing in sculptures and paintings. You can pay extra to see the tower and St Stephens hand.
g\Very pretty. Beautiful church with an amazing organ and organist. Don't miss the small cathedral with a relic of the right hand of the king. They even parade the hand around once a year in August!
beautiful!. Walked in and were overwhelmed with the beauty. Looks like it was built recently. Marble and gold were amazingly shiny.

Great views and interior.
