Fantastic interior, mesmerising to look at.We got there when it first opened so it was a little confusing when we tried to find the stairs or escalator as they didn't open until 10 am. At 10 is became very obvious where they were, right by the main entrance!We took the stairs and it wasn't too bad. I suffer from a touch of vertigo and it was only the last couple of sets of metal stairs that were difficult as you could see the height most clearly.The view was stunning and it wasn't that busy when we went between 9.30 and 10.30 on a Monday morning.

Gorgeous On The Inside - Tower Part Just Ok. So you can have a look around the inside of the Basilica for free which to be honest is the best part about it. The inside is actually breath-taking and well worth a look if you have time to do so. The structure is incredible and the art work on the inside along with the marble and gold has a real wow factor about it. We then paid to go up to the balcony on the tower - I mean this was just ok the views aren't bad but they aren't anything particularly spectacular to be honest so you wouldn't be missing much if you didn't pay to do this. The only reason it was slightly better for us is the fact that the air show was going on at the time so we got a good view of that! In all seriousness though we had a better view from Bar 360 when we had pre dinner drinks the previous day! Do go inside the Basilica though because this is the real treat and it's completely free!

Beautiful Basilica in Pest, easy to reach by Metro or bus.. Near main high street and a few minutes from river Danube. Pay a little extra to take two lifts to the balcony at the top of the dome. Great views over Buda and Pest. Many cafes nearby to relax. There are often evening concerts.
Worth every penny! . I paid to go to the top and inside the church, beautiful architecture fantastic painting and gold everywhere. The view from the top is the second best in Budapest :)

Amazing Building. A wonderful basilica with an incredible interior and views from the cupola.The interior is open for a minimal contribution, visits to the treasury and cupola cost extra - both about £2 each, so not hugely expensive. The visit to the Cupola is well worth it - there is an elevator - so not a massive climb
Beautiful. When in Budapest you really need to visit this! It is spectacular from the outside, and I regret not being able to go inside.

Budapest Cathedral. St Stephens Basilica is a hugely impressive structure in the centre of Budapest. The approach to the front door gives a taste of what to expect inside. The altar is richly decorated and the artwork around the cathedral walls is of the highest quality. I arrived to late to view the crypt and ascend up to the dome. The entrance charge is 1 Euro.An amazing place to visit and one that I will go back to.
Beautiful & Tranquil. I am not religious at all but this church is really stunning and is an oasis of calm in the middle of the city, well worth a look

Amazing Basilica, the crypts amazing, the tower worth climbing for the view, a full day can be spent here.. Absolutely beautiful, the crypts worth seeing ( extra $ but worth it ) the climb up the tower is worth it but treacherous - only one way up and down so you are fighting traffic, a must see when visiting Budapest.
Beautiful. Absolutely beautiful and we got to hear the choir singing which was amazing. Cost 500hun to get to the top but worth it for the views. Worth a visit.

Impressive large cathedral. St Stephens Basilica is a very impressive building with an interesting architectural back story involving different architects and designs.The building inside is more decorated than many churches but to be honest is similar to many other churches. The dome is very impressive and the altar is very ornate.The mummified hand of St Stephen in the back chapel is an interesting relic.There is a small donation fee for entry to the church.We did not go up the tower so cannot comment on whether that is worth doing.
Very beautiful. Very beautiful church, worth a visit. Would reccomend going inside and up to the tower. Views are amazing.

Beautiful basilica. Beautiful building and well worth a visit. The dome paintings alone are worth it alone to visit. It was mid week when we went and it was quite busy. Easy to get too and a pleasant area of the town.

Beautiful church on a lovely square. Great place to have a coffee at an outdoor cafe to people watch in the square, admiring this beautiful building. To see everything in 48 hours, try one of the hop on hop off tours. Then select places to go and explore more

Visit it watching a concert. If you have visit big churches around Europe , it is not something special. We bought tickets for a concert(inside the church), which was a nice experience, and we had the opportunity to see the church.
Beautiful. Have a coffee in the square and enjoy the view. Don't bother with the tour unless you studying religion or architecture - the walk through is enough.

Nice place to visit . Its very good place to visit. If you have seen st basilica in Vatican then you'll not find it that much interesting.Overall its a good experience however i would recommend to explore the nearby streets of this church.

Beautiful basilica on pedestrian street - heart of the city. In 1991, the street in front of the basilica was a traffic mess. Now the square is stunning and the basilica can finally be the focal point. Free to enter, donations appreciated, this stunning church and the setting are very inviting. It's proximity to the Daube walk, and The Gresham Palace all on pedestrian streets make for a perfect evening stroll.

Don't miss the mummified hand!. Definitely Worth a look, especially in the Chapel where st Stephens' mummified hand can be seen! Beautiful dome, donation only required to enter. Not long needed for visit unless you stay for organ recital.

Beautiful Church. This was our second visit to St Stephen's. We were there 2 years ago and had a full tour thru out the Church. This visit was on a Sunday morning and since they were having Mass we could not take in a full tour. We did get a short look inside between masses. The inside is simply beautiful. The roof is stunning.

Again just a walk around but a wonderful building. Last time I was here I visited inside the cathedral and it's well worth the time to do so as it's very beautiful. The view from the top is stunning. This time was just a walk past but still struck with the beauty of it. Well recommended for you to visit inside and out

Great concerts. First night in Budapest, while meandering around downtown we ended up at the front steps of this basilica. It is beautiful inside and outside and ended up purchasing tickets for an amazing organ concert.
Outstanding. Make sure you visit this magnificent piece of Church architecture. Take a camera. Make sure you go around the full building
Beautiful inside. Well worth a wander round, it's only just over 100 years old but the decoration inside is stunning - free to enter donations invited!

Nice view from the top. The Basilica is beautiful from the inside, but don't forget to climb those 300 stairs to the top of the roof, to have a great 360 view of the city (costs around 500 HUF). and there is an elevator of you are lazy or incapable of climbing the stairs.

Great if you like that sort of thing. Opulent gilded monstrosity.. For a start we were told this was free by a guide, but if you dn't make a "donation" an angry man has a go at you. Inside it is over the top, gilded and frilled, I found it a bit oppressive and horrible, I think many would disagree. Whether you like it or not, it is certainly impressive.

St. Stephens Basilica, Budapest.. A absolutely magnificent building, free admission. Lit up rather grandly at night .
Well worth a visit.
Magneficent. This was a magneficent experience! The Basilica is so beautiful, and from the tower you can see all of Budapest. There is a elevator to get to the top, for those who cant do the stairs.
Go and see St Stephens mumified hand!. Beautiful Basilica, very intriguing casket in the back with St Stephens hand in! Take some coins to 'light it up'

Unbelievable . Beautiful cathedral near the Parliament building. This is the sister cathedral to Stephansdom (St. Stephens) in Vienna and, in our opinion, is more beautiful. Part of the reasoning is that Budapest was less damaged as Vienna during the war.
The cathedral is dark but elegant. Make the small donation and go inside. You won't be dissapointed.

St. Stephen's Basilica. Definitely worth taking a visit up the tower on a clear day - take the lift up unless you are feeling fit enough to take the stairs! It wasn't very busy when we went during the morning and the views are spectacular.
The Basilica itself is impressive to view both inside and out.

One of the most beautiful basilicas. You would probably go by this place several times while in Budapest, it is definitely a good idea to go in and have a look. The interior design is absolutely amazing...the relics of st. Stephens hand are a bit strange and you can't really see it.
Beautiful. This worth a visit, You don't have to be religious to appreciate this beautiful place. The use of marble is wonderful.

A very cool building. Here's another quick tour that you can do. This one can be done inexpensively as they ask for a 200 Forint donation at the door. Depending upon how long you want to oogle at the beautiful interior, you can go through this building in 15 - 60 minutes and it is well worth it.

Recommended. We visited here first thing when quiet. Lovely interior and some iconic statues. We came back later to go up the tower. It was packed by then no space to move around. Definitely recommend the lift up to the Tower. I found the stairs a bit iffy and packed full where it was stupid. Good views over the area.

Beautiful basilica. . Stayed in the square at PALS hostel overlooking the basilica. Beautiful inside and out . Also they have concerts that are really nice to purchase to attend. Some things they charge for but it's extremely costly to upkeep this piece of history...and I don't mind helping. Must purchase a ticket to go up to the top to have a panoramic view. Lots of tour groups 7 days a week inside the basilica...but not miserably crowded because it's so big.

Beautiful and a must see.. This is worth a visit. The Basillica is lovely with interesting features but for us, the best bit was getting the lift to the tower. It was only a small amount to go up and the views of 360 degrees were worth the price. We were lucky to go on a sunny day and were rewarded with views of both Buda and a Pest and also the River Danube. A must do in Budapest.

Panoramic views and beautiful interiors. The ascent to the viewing level (just at the base of the basilica's central dome) is accomplished in two stages, each of which can be tackled via either steps or elevator. I'd recommend the elevator for the first leg – and for the second, consider taking the steps route in at least one direction, as the winding succession of staircases and corridors is fun in itself. Once you're at the top, the views over Pest are beautiful on a sunny day.Inside the cathedral, the decor is beautiful and inspiring – look in every direction (including up and down) and you will find something to enjoy. The relic may not be to everyone's taste (especially with the coin-operated light system, which reduces it to something of a funfair clot machine) but regardless, the reliquary is a work of art in itself.

An imposing building. Neo classical building & if you have been in Europe for a while you will not notice a lot of difference to others What's makes this interesting is the small Holy Right Chapel which displays the supposedly mummified right hand of St Stephen in a beautiful display case
Beautiful Archetecture. This is a historical place that is magnificent. Beautiful Archetecture and fabulous sculptures. Don't miss it.

Simply beautiful!. A beautiful church. Did not go up to the top but hear it has a great view. The mummified hand of St. Stephen is kind of creepy but it seems a lot of these old churches like body parts of saints. Outside is a nice area to sit or do a little shopping. You can get a rose shaped ice cream on the corner.

Impressive and beautiful.. Worth a look - it is not an ancient church but is very grand and beautifully cared for. The dome and painted interior are beutiful and there is so much gold and fine work.There is also the venerated relic of St Stephens' hand which has its own chapel and is a very prized relic for the Hungarian church . The Basilica is a real landmark in the city and its dome can be seen from far away. It is a symbol of Budapest and well worth a visit.
Awe inspiring.. A spectacular church with wonderful views. St Stephen's is truly marvellous in an excellent central location.

Very moving experience. We arrived at St.Stephen's early on a Sunday afternoon to discover that service was in progress complete with a small young choir. The church was full, so we simply took a seat and experienced a real sense of community. When the service was over, we took photographs of the interior of this very beautiful baroque style church but what will remain with me is the sense of connection with everyone in the church. So,if it suits you and you can be there for a service, I would certainly recommend it.

Budapest Views 🤘. St.Stephen's basilica was awesome both from the inside and the outside... It was just a coin donation to enter and had amazing decorations and awesome views of Budapest up the 302 stairs!! (Which you had to pay more for but was awesome) very beautiful place to visit, recommend it to everyone.
Good. Nice architecture with a lovely square in front of it. Recommended to be visited. Have a coffe in one of the cafes in the square and enjoy it.
Tourist. Beautiful church. Mass was just starting when we went there so attended mass. The singing was beautiful, even though it was a cd. Worth visiting.
Beautiful! . It's was only 200 huf to go in, and it really is a stunning basilika. Outside the basilika it a great place to sit and relax in the sun.

Beautiful Basilica. St Stephen's Basilica is in the centre of Budapest. The façade is superb and best seen from the far side of the square in front. Entry is free, but pay to go up to the top of the dome for panoramic views of the city (lift in 2 stages from near the entrance). Built in late 19th century as a neo-renaissance church. Stunning dome. Don't miss the mummified right hand of St Stephen - rather hidden in a side chapel. Actually, the casket it's in is better.A must-see in Budapest.

Do not overspend on organ concerts. As a local I keep seeing tourists buying expensive tickets to organ concerts at Basilica. Yep, it's worth it. But I just want to make community of travelers aware about the alternative. There are many free organ concerts going on in Budapest on a regular basis. Yes, the trick it to get to know where they are ;) budapestfreeevents.com should come handy. It lists all of the info in English.
Overwhelming beauty. Overwhelmingly beautiful neo-gothic cathedral in amazing condition inside and out. Definitely a must-see!

Beautiful Basilica. I liked St. Stephen's Basilica really, but I did not give me any awe experience. It was more likely regular basilica, like the ones I have seen before! Anyways it was a very good experience and worth of visiting it! The fee is 200HUF/person.

As inspirational as it possibly can be.. If you're just a tourist or visiting for inspiration from your faith, this cathedral is worth a visit. The architecture is awe inspiring and the ornate details and art are a treat for the eye.
Good experience. This is as nice as the Peters Church in Rome. Its free entrance and a sight for sore eyes. I recommend to go here for one hour to feel the history. Good option.
Lovely Church. Lovely Church located in Budapest centre, beautiful inside and outside. Was lovely to see the church ceilings and the true history of the place.

Stunning. A must see when visiting Budapest! We went a few weeks before Christmas and the feel of the markets surrounding the Basilica was lovely. Inside, beautiful architecture. Definitely worth visiting.
Lovely. Very nice and popular site. Looks even better at night, as most of these historical sites do. Also liked the square and the vibe around the area.
The tallest in the town :). It gives an impression of the most important building in the Pesta's side of the town. You can not miss it from when watch from Buda hill. So mighty.

One of the most beautiful and popular sites!. Another must when visiting budapest! Stunning building and a popular square and lots of bars accompanying a nice place either to start your day planning where to go or to end it with a nice meal and a few drinks!

Beautiful building but the customer service is bad. This is a beautiful building to visit but be prepared for some very "retro" customer service of old ladies who know zero about customer service or how to deal with tourists.You pay your entrance on the right hand side, which includes the stairs to the panorama, but the woman behind the counter doesn't tell you that there is a lift at the OTHER end of the building. Why doesn't she tell you? Because she has a "don't care" attitude and doesn't have any customer service skills. Also there are no signs anywhere to show you that there is a lift to the top. Horrible, retro, incompetence that shouldn't exist in such a central and beautiful location. This is typical retro Hungarian mis-management and staff / management incompetence. Also the lift to the very top of the building is too small and looks dangerous and old. It is also incredibly poorly labeled, there are no signs anywhere, and it is incredibly hot in summer.This is a beautiful building but be prepared for some bad service with outdated and incompetent staff who don't care about visitors.
A MUST. Pretty and central chourch.Real amazing from inside !On sunday people marry there !U can go to top of the chourch and see all amazing Budapest! Cost but cheap

Do not miss the view from the Panorama of the Basillica Dome!. If your not healthy or scared of heights this is definitely not your ride! But if you can handle a lot of climbing and the weather is nice, this is the best views on the pest side.
special birthday. Couldn't spend a long time here but still worth seeing as part of all the other things in the area.or can just sit on the steps and take in all the goings on.
St. Stephen's Basilica. The size will take your breath away, both outside and inside. Very busy after 10 am..till late afernoon.
Very pretty . The line to go upstairs to see the view was long, and we didn't have much time. We walked through the basilica for free. It's very big and pretty. We spent about 15 minutes inside.
Amazing !. There is no entrance fee however a donation is optional. Awesome photo opportunities here, very worthwhile you will not be disappointed
Stunning. Beautiful building. Stunning architecture, recommend a visit even if you aren't mad about visiting churches

A Church at Sunset. It was the end of the day and we decided to went to the Basilica and explore the nearby places outside. Once arrived, at the sunset, that was a magnificent view, we went inside (you pay something symbolic to the priest in the door) and then we were overwhelmed with the rich and beautiful inside of the Basilica, is something that really worth a visit in Budapest.
Beautiful church. Visited on a Sunday morning the church was very light and airy and has beautiful painted ceilings. You can also get panoramic views of the city from the dome.

Worth the walk up the stairs!. The inside of the Basilica is really beautiful. The view from the top however is what makes the visit. We walked up the stairs but you can take an elevator and the panoramic views from the top are genuinely stunning.

great church to visit. St Stephens is one of the more beautiful churches in Europe. Take the elevator and then climb the rest of the way to the top for a magnificent 360 degree view of the city. It's well worth the effort. The music on Friday night is wonderful!
Faith. This building is so beautful both out and inside. I can sit there for hours and just inhale the atmosphere this Basilica have!!
exeptionlly beutiful building. really nice nice church among the best i've visited on my travels well worth a look. entry is free but you can make donation if you wish.

Royal View. Amazing place to visit, and take pictures. Very famous in Budapest, so I didn't regret visiting. It is possible to find coffeeshops near and great restaurants. You can get yourself a coffee from Starbucks and enjoy the view of Basilica.
Beautiful Basilica. Place this Basilica on your list of 'things to do when in Budapest". If you can attend a concert, even better!

Nothing special for a price. This was an average cathedral. It costs money to get in and there isn't anything particularly memorable about the interior. Your best served by just walking by the outside and heading towards a nearby park or square.
Interesting Basilica. St. Stevens hand is certainly a conversation starter. Worth a quick visit while in town. It is near the Jewish section and around the block from a great outdoor market.

Panorama Views. When we arrived the church was closed for a concert in progress but we were told we could take an elevator to see the panorama. It was a minimal charge and it was the same fee to climb 350 stairs or go up in the elevator so we decided to give it a try. I expected to see a panorama of the church but actually it was a 360 degree panorama of the city from the highest dome. We took lots of photos even though it was very windy and cool outside the dome. It's a worthwhile experience.
Impressive and guilded . A wonderful basillica with stunning artwork. Really great to see. Lots of guilded adornments around too. You'll get dizzy looking up all the time!
Nice Basilica. The Basilica is free to enter and the interior decorations are very pretty. Take your time and enjoy the museum too.

Stunning but found the severed hand in a box odd. Stunning church, well worth a walk around. In the back area you can see the hand of st Stephen in a box which is supposed to be sacred but honestly I found it a bit odd...
Beautiful cathedral. Visited on my last day, is just a gorgeous church with paintings and statues. Reminds me of anything you might find in italy.
Incredible impression. In addition to great architecture you can enjoy a wonderful acoustic during the holiday / Sunday services with organ and chorus or evening concerts.
A nice place to see Budapest!. The Basilica is a nice place if you want to see Budapest from the birds eye and also if you want to take some stunning photos! Really AMAZING!

Beautiful Church. This was a beautiful church. As you walk in someone asks for a donation and honestly I think they use every penny to keep the church looking beautiful. We have been in so many churches in Europe and a lot of them are not well maintained - This one was! Worth seeing!
Very spiritual. This is a must-see when visiting Budapest. The architecture is stunning. The chapel has the mummified hand of the first King of Budapest.
Worth a visit. Definatley worth going inside and having a look round. Plenty to see and when we went mid-afternoon there were only a few people looking round.

Stunning!. We were only in Budapest for a few days and took the Hop On Hop Off tourist bus. From time to time we would get a brief glimpse of the Basilica but never a proper look. We decided to take a walk down on our last day, and it was simply stunning. Well worth a proper visit.

Wonder church. The church is open to the public and you can wander in amazement at the interior. We were able to go to a concert at night that filled us with classical music including the great organ of the Basilica

Beautiful Architecuture. I have vistied many Basilica in Europ, but this one is huge. Architecure is also different. It is beautiful from inside and outside. Must see night view from street straight from chain bridge
St. Stephens Basicila. This was a monumental Basilica with so much history, art and the architecture is phenomenal. If you are into religious history, or just adore architecture, this is a must see!

Peaceful Basilica with Fab Views. The Basilica was large with great architecture. Please don't missing going to the top to see the City views. There are other attractions in Budapest that could offer better views; but would still recommend visiting this place. The 'Treasury' attraction in it was a bit of disappointment. Did not see much in it.
High Climb Worth it!. Paying to go up to the dome was totally worth it, absolutely beautiful 360 view as well as seeing the inside building structure.

Beautiful. Very beautiful basilica outside and inside. We visited in concert here too, very nice experience. No entrance fee to church itself, but you must pay if you want to climb to tower. It's about 300 steps, but views are great!
Beautiful building in heart of city.. Did a walk by with my wife while strolling through Pest. Beautiful to look at. They were setting up sound system for evening concert.
Wunderbar. Fantastic edifice inside and out. Excellent venue for organ recital when you can really appreciate its magnificence without the swarm of tourists!!

Beautiful building. This is a lovely building and well worth a visit.
If you don't want to look around ot you get a pretty good look at it from the tour bus.

Beautiful. The basilica is amazing and the square is awesome. There is a great restaurant Platz on the corner and the gelato is served as a rose on a cone next door. The cafes along the street are awesome and you can walk up the street to the Aria hotel for a beautiful rooftop view and cocktails.

A great photo opportunity . St. Stephen's Basilica is a very impressive building that is located on the Pest side of Budapest, do make sure that you see both sides when visiting it does make a great photo opportunity.The interior is beautiful and as long as there is not a service on at the time of your visit you are able to walk freely.Photography is allowed inside too.Definitely worth a visit to see on your visit.

Your typical awesome European church. Definitely would recommend it. I've seen several cathedrals/churches in Europe so the initial grandeur is starting to wear off. That being said, this Basilica was on par with the others I've visited, albeit being newer. What put it above the norm for me was a visiting children's choir that began singing as we were checking the place out...the acoustics were amazing.

Simply Beautiful and mesmerising!. An absolutely beautiful Church to visit. I could have spent a lot longer there, just taking it all in. A very peaceful place, with so much to admire and look at. I would recommend a visit even if you are not religious as it is a beautiful building which is both beautiful inside and out.

Lovely sight. Located in the centre of Budapest, St Stephen's Basilica is near other main attractions, so definitely worth a visit. Be sure to go inside as it's a grand building totally comparable to the best churches of Rome.
Wonderful.. When I visited this basilica, I was highly surprised by its magnificence. Even if one is not a very religious person, one will be impressed with this basilica. It is just beautiful.

Not Chiesa di San Pietro but very beautiful anyway, worth a visit. If you go to Budapest you have to go to this church. It's beautiful! And you get the most beautiful and tasty ice cream in the city from the ice cream shop right in front of the church.

Even if you don't do religion, this is a must see.. This Basilica is outstandingly beautiful. It is beyond general description, but the ornate ceiling murals and the structure itself make a visit compelling. If you have the energy, you can also climb the basilica to see outstanding views of the city scene. The basilica is actually the highest point in the city, together with the Parliament buildings.Quite often, there will be a visiting choir singing, which adds to the who;e experience.

A pleasant surprise. This is a grand and imposing building in the heart of Pest, but the interior was infinitely more impressive than I imagined. Beautiful, and free to enter (they suggest a 200 ft donation which is about 50p). Well worth a look.

I think I might be "churched out"!. Having traveled all over Europe and seen so many grand churches, I think I might be a bit "churched out"! I did not find anything too spectacular or interesting in this building. However, I am compelled to write a review because the most attractive and interesting part of the church is easy to miss. Off to the side of the main alter is a door that leads to a small chapel. There is a beautiful holy water fountain just outside the chapel and a intricate shrine containing a relic inside the chapel. It is not really stunning visually until you drop a few coins in and turn on the lights that illuminate the shrine. It is quite lovely and it made this visit.

Breathtaking beauty. Such a masterpiece of architecture, and very remarkable art and statues. We just strolled through, so we don't know too many details. Unbelievable domes and stained glass windows. A true jewel.
Good experience. I think that many travelers would appreciate the history and beauty of the basilica both for religious and non-religious ponderings..
Beautiful. Highly recommend it. Beautiful and you can take pictures inside. They expect 1 Euro donation at the door. You can also attend organ concerts on certain evenings.

Magnificent. A beautiful building, inside and out. A must see attraction. The walls and ceilings are splendid and the atmosphere is very peaceful and calming. A wonderful place to meditate contemplate and just take some time out from the bustle.
Beautiful . Definitely worth a visit.Free to enter (donation ).Great art,sculptures and Windows . Outside there is a large square with numerous coffee shops to sit and enjoy .
Beautiful!!!. It was very peaceful and serene. Loved going there and would recommend it to all. Its next to Fisherman's Bastian.

Emotionally inspired. Know not one single word of the language, but do join the mass - the experience is indescribable! Bonus points if you are architect or interior designer, the interior details are magnificent! Reminds me of St. Peter's Basilica in Vatican, Rome.

Mesmerizing Space. I was staying at Aria Hotel just yesterday and was (literally) steps away from the Basilica. Originally was drawn to the outer art works (sculpture, details, etc.), but wanted to make sure I saved a couple hours to go in before leaving. SO HAPPY I DID!!I went in around noon and spent a couple hours immersed in this beautiful masterpiece. Upon entering there are so many incredible works of art to absorb. The ceiling is incredible and I am so happy I happened to fall right next to this space during my stay in Budapest as not too sure I would have known to go otherwise (was here for work and did not do my usual research as would not have too much time to explore).A must visit/see for sure!
Blessing visit. Participate in the holly mass even if you don't understand the language, the feeling is diificult to describe. It is emotional. So, so beautiful.

Impressive Cupola. St Stephen's is an impressive basilica named in honour of Hungary's first King. It has two symmetrical clock towers. Once inside your eyes are drawn to the Cupola which is colourful and intricate (see photos). Allegedly one of St Stephens' hands is stored in the reliquary.

Lovely Gilded Interior. Beautiful glowing interior due to all the gilded moldings and details. I really liked the Hungarian Embroidered Altar Cloths, they were very beautiful and quite colorful. This basilica is home to the holy right hand of St. Istvan which is housed in a jeweled chest in the Szent Jobb Kapolona chapel.
Lovely . We had a walk around. And had a spot of lunch here. Lovely square outside. So nice in the sun. Pop here for a visit if you're in Budapest

Makes me feel engulfed . Spiritually and emotionally. We visited the Basilica at the crack of dawn so it wasn't ideal for taking photos. We entered in and joined the service. My goodness great acoustics and I had déjà vu the same feeling when I visited St Peter's Basilica in Rome when I was 23yrs old. Got to read about its founders and so much history of Hungary, no tour guide. Budapest's structure has made it easy for tourists to feel comfortable and relate to the outstanding beauty that lies around almost every corner. We returned to take photos in the afternoon so the sun was on the the front of the Basilica. Good to plan your sight seeing around the direction of the sun.

great concerts. On Monday and Friday nights there are organ concerts that last about 45 minutes. The price is fair (I think it was about $5-$10). At the concert we attended there was also a beautiful singer. It was so nice sitting there in this beautiful place listening to the music.There are also other music opportunities on other nights. If you go at another time just to view the Basilica, we were told they ask for a minimum donation, maybe 200 forints, which is about 75 cents

Beautiful place. Our hotel was right next to the Basilica. It is absolutely stunning from the outside, it was a gorgeous sunny day when we were there and lots of people on the steps. We entered and paid our money up the tower, wonderful views. We came back down and went inside the church where rehearsals were under way for a concert that evening. Sounds were fab. Find it strange to have to pay to go in here but was worth the money.
Gorgeous Church. Beautiful building - inside and out. Only 200HUF (recommended donation) to go inside to see, worth it.

Beautiful on the outside, but.... This church has some of the most beautiful exterior architecture I've ever seen -- it's like a Roman temple. However, I was very put off by the internal decorations. Too much gold. It just seemed tacky and made me feel uncomfortable.

Beautiful architecture. Another beautiful building to see, inside and out. Easy to find. Can see inside for a small donation. Very ornate and peaceful. Pay to climb the tower. Lovely square in front with a few cafes at the far end. Not touristy which was great.
History. Joined a walking tour - we were given the history of all the statues in the church - beautiful stained glass and ornate decorations

Amazing!. Visited this with my partner. It was a spectacular building and utterly beautiful inside. 55 different marbles used within the interior. The stained glass windows are some of the best I have ever seen. Beautiful views from the roof top even if it was a little windy. Was a lot of steps to get up there but they have a lift for the less abled.Highly recommend! A must see!

Beautiful church. We walk here on a Sunday as a wedding party was taking pictures on the out side. The church was beautiful inside with lots of pink marble high ceilings and amazing pictures. It cost 200 hf to enter.

With a visit. We visited whilst in Budapest and would recommend. The inside of the cathedral is spectacular, with beautiful frescos, from floor to ceiling throughout. If you go you should go up to the roof top to see amazing 360 views of the city. Great for photographs!
Breathtaking church. Really breathtaking, luxury renovated church in the middle of Budapest.Near to the river, near to the centrum.
Beautiful roof top view. Don't miss climbing to the top to see the panoramic view! The basilica is beautyful from outside and indoors, but the view is just great!
Religious opulence. A wonderfully impressive building with plenty of ornate gilt to see inside. The highlight for me, at under £2 , was the panorama with fabulous views from the top.
Marvelous. Do not miss this place. Remarkable architecture. Close to everything downtown. Hungarians have reason to be proud.

Not an ordinary church. When visiting Europe, chances are that you will find yourself in an old church at one point or another. There's something special about this basilica however, that's tough to put your finger on.On a clear day it's well worth paying the small fee for the panorama lookout. Walk over 300 steps (or take the elevator) to the top of the basilica's dome. Photographers will especially be able to appreciate spectacular views!

Gorgeous. Another must do in Budapest! I have said it with a lot of my reviews on Buda, but the architecture really is sublime and inside is even better. The Basilica is on a lovely square, where there are shops and places to eat and drink.

Only Elevated View of Buda. Since Buda is on a hill overlooking Pest, there are not many places to do the opposite from a height. Climbing to the top of St Stephens Basilica is one way and definitely worth the 350 steps or so to get there. The Basilica is also very impressive and still active. A boys choir was practicing while we were touring.

Magnificent!. I am sure we all have been to numerous places and witnessed the beauty of a church, cathedral and even a chapel....St Stephen's Basilica is one of those massive structures......but can feel intimate too....No long cues......easy entrance and exist.....no gimmicks. If you are there in Budapest go see it.....find an empty seat....and pray... If you do not wish to pray...it does not matter...its' effect on the eye will move you in spirit....unless you don't have one....

Nice views from the top. My partner and I paid to climb to the top. This is up some very wobbly spiral staircases at some points so I wouldnt recommend if you are scared of heights! The views from the top are beautiful and you can see a lot of Budapest's main sites.

Best basilica in Budapest. You can see the entire basilica for free. Also, there are paid programs. Go see the panorama view at the top of the stairs. You'll climb a very long flight of stairs to get there. Skip the treasury exhibit, because it's small and esoteric. I also recommend the organ evening concert that takes place inside this basilica to see this marble setting in its night time glory while enjoying classical organ music such as Liszt and Beethoven played by a famous organist musical professional.

A must see!. After touring around the impressive buildings, St. Stephen's Basilica is quite a sight. Do not miss the chapel where the Holy Right Hand of St. Stephen is displayed. Regular mass service is held in this Basilica.

Worth a walk around. I didn't do a guided tour, but took a walk around it. Although a relatively modern religious building it shows a great extravagance in its internal architecture and decoration, the amount of gilt is amazing. The surrounding square and general area is lovely and it is definitely worth a visit if your in Budapest.
WOW....... We had a chance to see the easter sunday mass and it was breathtaking. This church is a must see in the city.

Simply stunning..... I think it's the square fronting up the Basilica that gives people most pleasure for photos and the like. We ventured inside, it was peaceful, tranquil and stunning. We didn't go up the viewing platform this time...maybe next time.

Excellent . Only squabbles , different costs here and there for different rooms etc , Other than that it's a beautiful place , you must do the view from the top, you can either take the stairs or take the lift! the stairs are fun but there are loads! we did the stairs up and lift down.
Beautiful building. This is a lovely building, that looks as good day or night. Worth a visit, even if you do not have time to go inside.

Impressive. I'm not Catholic, but still this Basilica is worth it. I was surprised by how massive it is, and of course beautiful.Inside we had the opportunity of enjoying an Organ concert. The architecture is striking, the decoration inside just amazing,It is a MUST on this city (just as Goulash is)

Fabulous view from the cupola. St. Stephen’s Basilica is named in honour of the first king of Hungary. This is a classic Roman Catholic Church and can accommodate 8000 worshippers, with two large bell towers and a majestic dome in the middle. We didn’t spend much time inside the basilica, but we took the elevators to go up the cupola to view the city of Budapest. What a view that is.Happy Travelling!

Beautiful. Amazing example of traditional architecture with exemplary artworks. This is one of the most magnificent churches I have been in outside of the Vatican. The entry costs 200ft and it is obvious the pride taken in meticulous restoration and maintenance of the Basillica. Well worth a visit, including the gelato stall across the square. This is a must do in Budapest.

The guided tour of the basilica. I did not visit many European cities but this is the largest church/basilica that I have seen. the interior is beautiful. I thought as a so popular tourist attraction, the guided tour has to be pre-booked. I have sent the church two times about arranging a guided tour but there was no reply. When I get to the church, they just said there are no tour available with the limited English of the person selling the ticket to the church tower. We went to the church to ask about this early in that morning but we still did not get a chance to join the tour. I would advise any travellers planning their visit to send the email at least 1-2 weeks in advance.

Amazing archetecture - must visit. A must visit if you are around Budapest, it's one of the most amazing, breath taking basilicas , the rich history of this basilica and the amazing archetecture is simply breath taking
Amazing view from the panorama. Great views from the top and cheap, only 800 Florints.There was a wedding so didn't get to see the hand :(.

Well worth a visit- especially up the tower!. This beautiful building was easy to find and close to metro station: Bajcsy-Zsilinszky ut. It's only a donation to look inside and the decoration is beautiful so well worth a look. I would recommend going up the tower to look at the views as it was only just over a euro. Lovely views across the city. Be aware that it is about 300 stairs up but there is a lift.

Massive church with a holy relic. This church is massive! The day we arrived there happened to be a choir singing outside on the steps- it certainly added to the surreal awesomeness. It's stunning to walk around. It's kind of funny seeing the relic (I believe it was St. Stephen's hand? Sorry if my memory is off), because for something like 200 forint, they will turn a light on in the relic case. It just felt weird to me, but whatever. Stand there long enough someone will pay and boom- everyone gets a good gander. What I loved the most was the ability to walk to the tippy top of the tower and overlook the city from the Pest side and see over into Buda Hills. An awesome church.

Climbed the tower. 500 HUF was all it cost. Easy climb to the top. First part is a wide spiral stone staircase. Midway there is the Treasury where art is on show, then a steel spiral stair to the top. Great views of the city from the balcony round the dome.

Beautiful inside and outside. Beautiful church, really beautiful! There is a small chapel in the back too. It costs 200 Ft./80 Euro cents to get in, candles can be lit for another 200 Ft. Lovely place for a break and a quiet moment.
Great view!. Definitely worth to get up there, the view on the city is amazing. 302 steps is not that much, or you can take an elevator (have not tried it).

Pricey, but good. We didn't pay for a tour guide, and found the rooms very interesting. There's a lot of information written up about what we were able to see and there are some interactive displays offering info. There is a lot to cover and we were there for about an hour.

Beautiful inside and out. Amazing interior, a must see! It has 2 smaller chapels opening from the inside one. One of this chapels holds the Holy right hand of St Stephen king.It is free of charge but you can donate 100-200HUF for the entry.If you want to climb up to the top and look around from there than there is an entry fee.
Nice !. We walked through city center and St Stephen's was one of the most beautufil churches i have ever seen. We came during mass so there was a mysterious atmosphere.
Beautiful!!!!. Definite must do!!!! Climb to the top to enjoy the views of Budapest. Fun experience for teens, adults, and seniors alike.
a bit disappointed. it's free of charge, but you see two priests with big wooden board with a donation sign. interior is amazing. but not all information in English. can visit if you are around.
Wow. A most impressive church. as good as any iv seen in Rome, Venice or London. music recitals are on most days. as you walk in and look up to the ceiling, you cant help but say Wow

Breathtaking!. Was in Budapest a few weekends ago for a hen party and some of us decided to arrive a day early to have a little explore around the city. This cathedral was absolutely breathtaking. Like a huge work of art. Stunning.
Gorgeous basilica!. It's absolutely stunning. You have to go inside and see for yourself. Everything is golden and colorful and it's free to walk in and look around.

Christmas Eve. I went to watch a concert for Christmas, it wasn't as I thought about a concert because people were singing and playing the instruments alone and one by one, I Loved The Adagio Playing...The basilica such a pretty place is in the center of the city were the Christmas market been...

Awe inspiring elegance. Although it was crowded, the crowd appreciated the solemnity of the church and there was a hush when we were inside the sanctuary. The carvings were elegant and beautiful. The statues were awe inspiring when you gaze at the glory on their faces as they face heavenwards. The church was simply gorgeous and gothic. I am glad we went.

Mesmerising. We visited on a Sunday morning, during mass. I can honestly say it was one of the most beautiful, moving and enchanting experiences I have every encountered.
St Stephen's itself is so beautiful , words cannot describe the breath taking décor.
A must see place to go.

Exquisite Basilica. Compares to beauty and grandeur of parts of the Vatican. Wonderful exterior architectural elements and observation deck accessible by elevator plus stairs to the rooftop. After seeing the interior alters, be sure to enter the private chapel to the extreme left of the main alter where you can view the actual hand of St Stephen found intact 50yrs following his death & canonization. It's wall mounted in a glass box and not particularly easy to view but very exciting to say you were there standing right in front of it! A must-see sight. Don't miss the adjacent roof top lounge at the Aria Hotel, music themed boutique property a sight in itself, where you can get some fabulous photos with Basilica very close in the background. Outdoor bar with comfy lounge chairs and heaters are worth the price of coffees or drinks. It's Budapest...make those memories!
The heart of Pest. My view each morning, we became quite attached. Wonderful example of mans ability to create a masterpiece.

Amazing. The outside is not the only fine feature but the interior is beautiful with highly decorated ceilings.Their was a service in place and the atmosphere was peaceful.Candles are available to light in remembrance.There was no entry fee just a donation is welcome.
St. Stephen's Basilica. If you go to the top there is a beautiful view of the city. The inside is lovely and a work of art to look at.

St Stefan's church. It was a big church in the heart of Pesti. you could visit the church, it costs 1euro or 200fiorins. We visited the church, according to my opinion it is a nice catholic church, but it reminds me all the other churches that I have visited in the past. It was not something unique. I propose to visit it as the ticket is very cheap. Also, the visitor can visit the panorama. I don't remember the price, but it wasn't expensive.
Magnificent church!. You can feel the wings of history in this magnificent church. Many tourists of course, but it didn't bother me. Recommended!
Pay to go to the roof. Pay the 500huf to get up to the dome terrace , great views of the city, lovely church inside with concerts and performances on in the evenings

A jewel on the inside . Seeing this basilica from the outside it just looks big and plain. However, when walking inside you will quickly change your mind. Such a peaceful place with a beautiful altar surrounded with frescos and statues. It's a must see when in budapest!
Nice. Very nice church with nice architecture inside. Church asks for a 200 forint per person donation to come inside. However, we were told they would accept whatever currency.

Organ recital. What amazingly beautiful surroundings. Please be aware that seating is very soartan and uncomfortable. The internal temperature plummets despite the outside temperature being 20'C. Wrap up well if attending concerts or services.
The organist was very good. Shame that the baritone and wonderful flautist were not named on the programme.
Impressive church.... Visit the Basilica at Sunday morning if possible when you can watch the ceremony. The interior of the basilica is very beautiful.
Gorgeous. Quick to visit but Gorgeous Baroque interior. Nicely cleaned up inside and outside. A treasure to see when in Budapest and only 5 min walk from the Chain Bridge
Amazing on the outside and in. A truly remarkable building that captivated the whole family from the outside and was totally serene on the inside. A wonderful experience for all.

A masterpiece....a must see. My hotel (The Casati) is just a 10 minute slow walk for the Basilica. Visit during the day to go inside and admire this remarkable place. You must visit during the evening when it is lit up.... really is worth a visit and.... lots of decent bars and places to eat in the area.
Phenomenal . Brought a tear to my eye it was that breath taking! 100 % recommend a visit, you can light a candle and say a prayer, we didn't attend a service but next visit we will!
Impressive building!. Beautiful inside, a used basilica which I think is just great, using old, beautiful buildings rather than turning them into tourist attractions!! Great history.

Pretty inside, beautiful outside. The church is beautiful but I was a little bit frustrated with the inside. Maybe because we visited the Matthias Church before abs it was amazing. Don't get me wrong, the walls and decoration are beautiful inside and it is pretty much free. You are only encouraged to make a 200 Ft donation. In a small chapel you can see the mummified hand of a king who was canonized. You have to pay another 200 Ft for the light to turn on, but we basically didn't pay it because you can see it on photos.
Lovely at night or during the day . I was staying very close to the basilica Its very impressive and well worth a visit Strongly suggest making the time to pass byEnjoy
Worth the climb up!. The best view of Budapest for a very small price! We went 30 minutes before closing and there was no wait.

Szent István Basilica - it is the beautful heart of Budapest. The Basilica - it is in the heart of Budapest, and of Hungarian history.
Inside of the wellformed architected building there are a lot of masterpaintings and sculptures, chapelles with hungarian ornaments... There are evening miesses and musical concerts, too.

Very nice. Another beautiful building in Budapest. The architecture is great to see. Takes great photos. Plenty to see here and enjoy walking around it. Great views from the top so this is a great photo opportunity place.

So impressive. This church is very centrally located so there is a little chance you miss it. During our visit there was a praying ceremony which was accompanied with music. It was so relaxing to be there. Not far away from there on an Oktober 6 utc street just in the corner you can dine in a very popular and good restaurant TG Italiano.
Worth visit. Very beautiful basilica and worth visit if you like to see these old european churches. Some travel to cross river from Buda side to get to.

What a church...!!!. Splendid, awesome and so picturesque...don't miss entering the Basilica of Szent Istvan as it is called in Hungarian...beautiful paintings, wooden decoration, spiritual atmosphere, so big and grandiose in the city centre,,,a beautiful alea/square just on its feet with shops, statues etc....Another must see in this so beautiful and unique city!
Beautiful (minor) Basilica!. Went to Easter mass here. It was a wonderful experience. They should grease the tourist door though, it makes a LOUD squeal all through the otherwise beautiful service.

Stunning building. Free to go around ( small donation ) but once inside the building it takes your breath away, the detail of the gold work and stone work is incredible. Misty with incense burning, the atmosphere is difficult to describe. Well worth a visit.

Beautiful views - worth climb to top . Beautiful church with a 360 panoramic tower at the top. There is an elevator or you can climb stairs but it is absolutely worth a trip up to the top to get a different perspective of the city. The church itself inside is lovely as well.

stunningly beautiful. We visited the basilica on easter sunday. the bells rang continuously while we were there. You can go inside for a small donation, around 1 euro. The ceiling is overwhelmingly beautiful. Make sure to visit the Basilica while in Budapest.
The diamond of Budapest. Another must of your visit . Great church ! Opposite the entrance there is a small restaurant . Nice but very very slow !

Stunning . Personally I preferred to stay outside or on the roof of the basilica, the interior for me is too much. Too dark and ostentatious. The exterior however is stunning and it's nice to sit and have a coffee in the square and admire the basilica. Very chilled out vibe and beautiful architecture.

What a church!. From exterior to interior, this church blew me away. Located just behind Gresham Palace on the Pest side. The tallest building in all of Budapest! You can pay £1.25 the go up the towers to the top. You can also pay a couple of pound to visit the interior. Can only afford 1? on a budget? Go inside (Views from Buda for free can satisfy you). It reminded me of my visit to St Peters Basilica. Marble pillars, Beautiful architecture. Its also the home to St stephens mummified hand. which is to the left of the alter through the door into the back. Enjoy this Budapest Highlight! Have a great vacation!
Meh. I've been to a lot of churches and basilicas throughout Europe. It's a nice area and the place looks nice on the outside but its just so-so on the inside.

Beautiful church in centre of Pest area. This is a beautiful church, just to not that they suggest a donation for entry its not a lot but make sure you have change. The inside is beautiful and you can attend services if you wish. The ceiling is wonderful, it is a very peaceful place to visit
Great view on the top!. I didn't went inside the Basilica but I went up the stairs to admire the view and it was worth it!! around 1e/person your legs will remember the stairs climbing ;)

Amazing view. Went here basically just to see the view from the top. Went quite early when there was not too many tourists out yet, which is recommended. The view over to the Castle district is really amazing!

Lovely views. We climb the tower 302 steps to the see the view which was well worth paying. Don't worry if you can't climb that many steps they do have a lift. Afterwards we went inside the church which asks for a voluntary donation of about 50p. Breathtaking architecture the ceilings are beautiful. Glad I visited.

Beautiful church. It is a beautiful church and well worth visiting, however, if you are planning to visit on a Saturday afternoon, it may be partially closed due to the weddings taking place there. Keep that in mind.

A beautiful Basilica, in the center of Budapest!. This beautiful church sits high upon a mound of imposing steps, adding to it's height.The interior has exquisite paintings and carvings on the walls, ceilings and columns.There is a small gift shop. I was fortunate enough to attend a service on Sunday morning (in Hungarian and Latin), a very moving experience. Not to be missed! Jon

Very beautiful church. Gorgeous interior reminiscent of the grand churches in Rome. The vaulted ceiling is beautiful and the fresco in the cupola is superb. Don't want to say too much as I don't want to spoil it. It's free and so worth entering.

Beautiful . Beautiful church, well worth a visit, and easy to find! I didn't get to go up to the tower, but I didn't feel the need, since you can get a great view of the city from one of the boat tours
Beautiful church!. Definitely go and visit this beautiful art work! The church and the square in front of it are really beautiful- the church is still used for mass.
Beautiful Basilica in heart of Budapest. Beautiful church located in downtown Budapest. This is a must see. Very ornate on the interior and beautiful exterior as well.

Short visit. Stumbled upon this whilst we were on our way on the big bus. A wonderful church. We never knew that the church has relics of Saint Steven. The church is 5 mins walk from the big bus stop a must see
My favorite location in town. I love visiting churches when we travel and St. stephen's didn't disappoint. It is a must see for anyone traveling through Budapest.

Beautiful. The interior of the church is wonderful to see.we were surprised by the memorial to Cardinal Mindszety. It is easy to miss in a dark alcove in the back of the church. I was unhappy with the organ concert. They did not use the church organ but a small console in the front. You don't need to spend the money for the more expensive seats . All the seats were close. The night we were there was a crying baby and the parents did not leave and I was disappointed that the ushers did not ask one of them to take the baby outside.Across the square there is an area with considerable night life.

Worth of visiting. Propably the best church I've ever visited, on the other hand I'm not a big fanatic for this kinda attractions, but this was a huge thing. If you visit Budapest, you must visit here. There's a panorama level as well...
Visited twice. We actually visited twice. The basilica is fairly modern but definitely worth the visit. Take the elevator to the top of the basilica for 360 degree views of the city.
Check out the city from the top of the Basilica. Check out the city from the top of the Basilica, It is really beautyful, worth to go up. You can go around the cupola and see Budapest from there.
A must visit. A stunning building steeped in history regardless of your religion. Magnificent views of the city from the tower.A must see!!PS if you don't fancy the 302 steps, there's a lift :-)

Well worth the visit. This was the first thing we visited when we arrived in Budapest, it is beutiful inside and you can take photos as long as there is no flash, we visited the tower by walking up but there is a lift if you need one but you still need to climb the last bit by foot. How did they manage to bulid and decorate these things so long ago and they are still standing!

A fair way up but stunning views . As stunning to look at from the street, the view from the top is really what you are after, this provides a wonderful panoramic view of the city which shouldn't be missed, just be aware there's a fair few steps to the top

Worth Seeing. Beautiful and large Basilica in the center of Budapest with possible view from the top. In the Christmas time there's one of the best Christmas market in the city in front of the Basilica and in the summer place for vine festival or others.

Awesome . Awesome architecture and only 200HUF per person. It is still running services and ceremonies so some sections are closed so make sure you check. Am going back today to see St Stephen's right hand!

I love this place. This is one of the most beautiful places I visited while staying in Budapest. It's so calm inside and the architecture is beautiful. I'd highly recommend going to the top (although the the stairs can make you dizzy). There is a lift too, the views are incredible. You can see many perspectives up there and for me it made my experience even better. I can't wait to visit this place when I return! It's a must.

A magnificent cathedral in the heart of Budapest, which will exceed your expectations.. The building itself is worth visiting. Beautifully renovated.Do not miss to see the mummified right hand of the first Hungarian Christian king Saint Stephen I. (1000-1038) - the "Holy Right", which is on display in a chapel to the left from the altar. If you cannot find it, just keep asking, until you are led there!The other attraction is the panoramic city view from the top of the Basilica. You have to take two elevators to the top. The fee is not high, better skip a coffee, than save on the visit:o)

Breathtakingly beautiful. As much as I love sacre coure and Notre dame this is on another level, the art is incredible and the magnificence of the building is unquestionable, especially considering how young it is compared to other magnificent churches across Europe. Shame the staff inside weren't as warm and welcoming as the magnificent building....

Beautiful Inside and Out. A mass was about to start when we came to the basilica on March 10. I don't remember paying any fee. We were so grateful to have attended a concelebrated mass in commemoration of Pope Francis's election. The mass was in Hungarian but the readings and homily were done in both English and Hungarian. I found myself captivated by the beauty of the church throughout the mass. A few steps from the basilica is a Starbucks, some souvenir shops, and a lot of places to eat.

A definite place to visit when in Budapest . Seen one Basilica, seen'em all? This is a beautiful building from the outside, and the inside is adorned with just as beautiful statues and icons. But, for me, the best part is when you climb, and I do mean climb, to the roof of St Stephens Basilica. The views are breathtaking from this vantage point, from the flat built up historic Pest right below you, to the more mountainous Buda across the river with its castle and numerous churches. If in Busapest, take a bottle of water and a mars bar and make the climb. Well worth it.

Amazing cathedral. This is my favourite spot in Budapest. This huge cathedral will amaze you. It is nicely decorated. You can go upstairs and have a wonderful view. The right hand of our first king is also kept here. A very histrical place. The whole area is charming full of souvenir shops and restaurants. If you are in Bp. It is a must to see.

A must to visit.... I love churches and this one is impressive, great work on rebuilding it, like all other churches and monuments in Budapest. St. Stephen is a vast church, beautiful work inside. Chapel with relics, hand of St. Stephen, yes see it, put coin inside to light up the reliquiar!

Wonderful basilica. One of the best basilica in budapest. I visited many times but always very crowded. Facade so beautiful, but inside was fantastic. On monday's there were some concerts, I could not attend.

Great View from the top. cheap and cheerful way to see stunning views of budapest you will need to pay a small fee to gain entry and climb a few stairs but once you get to the top its all worth it the views are amazing i

Wonderful Basilica. The architecture is wonderful. We also climbed the stairs to the viewing area, which gave you the most amazing views of Budapest and well worth a visit. There are lifts available if you can't climb the 369 steps.
Stunning massive building. Located on the vast square, it stands tall and massive in its beauty. The details on it never cease to amaze me!! Do not miss out!
Beautiful. This is a must see while in Budapest! It is amazing and captivating. Do not miss it. Close to many restaurants and nice bars.

Magnificent Basilica at the heart of Budapest !. St.Stephen's is absolutely georgeous ....to say our prayers and take a tour. Enchanting architecture and panoramic view from the top, from the Pest side of Danu. I happened to be there during evening mass on a Monday ...absolute harmony !

Beautiful. Very beautiful and active Basilica
Challenging climb to the top of the viewing platform, lots of stairs! Nice views from the top of the dome.
a really impressive church building. Over the top gold and ornate church building which is well worth a visit and going inside as well. It is really beautiful and Hungarian.
Impressive building - with a beautiful interior. Went to see the Church in the morning - very impressive and the interior is very ornate. Worth a visit

Worth the visit!. If you need a break from the citylife, or want to admire the great art and architecture, St. Stephens is well worth the visit. My group was asked to donate a small amount at the entrance, but I later understood that this was completely voluntary. I don't know much about the church itself, but it's impressive both on the outside and inside. :)
Gorgeous. What a beautiful place! Sundays there is a free concert, whether you like the classical music or not, the acoustics are worth it.

Make sure not the miss the view!. Beautiful and impressive church - from the outside as well as from the inside. Make sure to pay the small fee to get to the top of the building: the view from up there is fantastic. There is also a lift.
Beautiful church. Very beautiful and large church near the Danube river, on the Pest side. You can pay to observe the city from a balcony. Definitely worth you while on a clear day.

Grab a coffee and chill around the Basilica.. We (a couple) think that the St. Stephen's Basilica is one of the most beautiful buildings in Budapest and the area around it as well.Make sure you have a wide angle lens with you in order to capture the huge building of the Basilica that stands proudly right in the middle of the square. The best place to have a coffee around is the corner Starbucks, where you can sit and have a direct view to the church.Also, many other cute stores are located around, where someone can find souvenirs, clothes, books, etc. We recommend the Bestsellers bookstore which is very close to the Basilica, where you can find English language books.All in all, make sure you visit Basilica in case you are in Budapest.
Just amazing. Another one of Pests amazing buildings. Inside and outside are a must to see. Situated in an area you would not expect to find this beautiful building.

Beautiful church, must see. The basilica is stunning and a must see when visiting Budapest. We paid a small fee to climb to the 360 degree viewing platform at the top and the views over the city are well worth it. There is a lift so you do not have to climb the steps all the way to the top. The only complaint I have is with regard to the rudeness of the woman in the ticket booth at the bottom of the steps.... Not expected particularly from someone working in a church!
Evening Organ / Opra. Bach, Ava Maria, etc. in the most wonderful surroundings.What an experience - highly recommended. The organist wasamazing.
St. Stephens Basilica. This is absolutely stunning, both inside and out. It's free to go in parts of it when there's no service - quite amazing!

Fabulous Church. One of the main attractions of Budapest.Not to be missed.When you first see the basilica it is breathtaking. The architecture is stunning.We were lucky it was a sunny day because as we entered all the stain glass windows are at their best.The painted murials were stunning.We heard some explanations by guides but we're not sure these were done by the church, but maybe if you ask.We still appreciated it all without explanation.It was also free admission but voluntary donations welcome no pressure. Do not miss!!
wow. this is an amazing cathedral for lovers of old buildings but as i found out when there its not as old as i thought

Very cool church, great athmosphere. Once you get inside it is truly amazing with all the art and decorations. Take a look at the severed hand as well (wait around till somebody else pays for it to light up ;) )
Beautiful church. The church is very ornate and peaceful inside. It is centrally located, and a must see for any Budapest tour.
Church. A beautiful and cheap church to see. You can go to the the top for an extra fee and and get a good view of the city.

Amazing architecture. Free to go in but you can make a donation. We took the stairs to the top and it was worth it for the views. There is a lift if you need it. Do not forget to see the mummified hand.

Absolutely breathtaking. The history almost comes out and touches you. Such a beautiful artistic time piece with such a rich and meaningful history. The Europeans call church ABC- Another Bloddy Church but for me I couldn't get enough and this one stole my heart.
nice!. If you like cathedrals, you'll like this one. its pretty large and the visit was free. This was a stop on our walking tour.
Tour of Basilica. Have been there many times with family and friends; always in excellent shape and representative of various phases of Hungary's development in the last few hundred years.

Very, very nice architecture. St. Stephen's Basilica is very beautiful church. Need to see if you go to Budapest. It is at city center and one trip need to start from it. After then can go at Budavar.
Impressive old building with great view. A beautiful basilica to visit. Check out St Stephen's hand and admire the frescoes. Walk up to the top of the tower for an impressive panorama of the city.

landmark building. ST STEPHEN'BASILICA ( SZENT ISTVAN BAZILIKA) is one of the most stunning building's in Budapest The exterior of the Basilica is awesome and commands attention. The interior is cool with great little details and frescoes and the views from the dome are outstanding. You can reach the dome by a lift or if your feeling energetic climb the 300 plus steps, either way you will be rewarded with fantastic views so don't forget your camera. The suggested entry fee is 200Ft which goe's to the up keep of this wonderful tourist attraction.Well worth a visit on any holiday to this wonderful city.

Wonderful classic concert . A vast and most beautiful church with amazing acoustics. Live performance of several soloists. Soprano. Tenor organist etc for hour and a half with no interval. At around £40 per person not cheap but a brilliant performance and ambiance great. I think they do these regularly checkout websites Budapest concerts.

Stunning. Really gorgeous! Suggested 200 Ft donation to get in. Unlike Matthias Church, there is beautiful marble all around. One of our guide books said the basilica was gloomy. Absolutely not! Very holy relic, the mummified right hand of St. Stephen, is located at the front left. There are a few photographs of the hand on a bulletin board in the room before you enter. You can also pay 200 Ft to illuminate the actual hand for 2 minutes, otherwise it's not too easy to see. Also take a look at the wonderful carved wooden doors as you enter and throughout the basilica. Definitely a must see!
bello. is really nice place, syou can go till the top... where you can see all the city....Sure isn't Florence, but is nice to see....

A really beautiful church. This is a really lovely church and is free to enter however they do suggest a donation. You can go up into the dome either by lift or taking the 364 stairs but there is a charge for this. Along with the Parliament building this is one of the tallest buildings in Budapest.

Wonderful . This was our first call after a trip around on the hop on hop off bus.From the fantastic outer architecture to the inner beauty we enjoyed this beautiful basilica .Dont miss the anti chamber at the rear with the mummified hand. Is possible to pay a small amount and see it all lit up .It is entry by small donation from 200 huf. Which is only pence.. and also able to climb to the dome balcony for views over the city. Entry from 500 huf. We never got back to do this sadly.There are also concerts at various times and a desk just by the entrance has all the details

Impressive. St Stephen's Basilica is the church dedicated to Hungary's patron saint who has led the country to Christianity in the XI century, and it still hosts the former king's embalmed right hand which is the key feature of the August 20 (St Stephen's Day) Catholic processions to date. The basilica offers an impressive view of the city and the Buda hills from its balcony. Worth the small admission fee!

Spectacular holy place. Szent istvan is definitely on the top list of Budapest must visit place. There are stunning historical decoration on the roof. It makes people clam and peaceful while looking at holy statues.
Stunning. Amazing architecture with great richness of details. We've visited it during the local mass, which made our visit even more special.
beautiful. Small admission charge but worth a visit. the view that you get from the top is beautiful, you can see Buda all long.

Simply Stunning. Possibly more beautiful than the vatican! An amazing cathedral well worth the visit contribution of 200F.Visited during day when the stained windows were stunning also at night for violin concert which was very good. Go up the top for a good view across the city.

lovely building. the views from the top od the tower are to die for and see the whole city 360> there have a lift to the top if you don't fancy the stairs too in side the building its is amazing would recommend
Impressive. Small admission charge but well worth a visit. Situated on tour bus route but also easy walkable from Deak Square city centre where the metro lines meet.

Stunning views. What a view from the top! The stairs do go on for some time, which the other half was grumbling about! But the views from the top were well worth the trek. We spent some time getting full views of Budapest. Not expensive to go up either.

Lovely cathedral. We visited twice during our stay and enjoyed this beautiful basilica . Dont miss the room at the back with the mummified hand - you can pay a token amount and see it lit up knuckles and all . The evening classical concert was an hour long and with 4 performers a great way to spend an evening in a lovely environment

Stunning Architecture. Beautiful from the outside and the inside. Not much to really say other than to make sure you visit during your stay in Budapest! Won't take long and will make for some great photos!
Beautiful. Donations only, very beautiful interior and serene well worth a visit, we were lucky enough to hear a choir rehearsal as well..

Large church centrally located. This is Europe so there are plenty of churches for you to pick from. St. Stephen's Basilica is lovely, but I think there are other churches that are more beautiful. With that being said, you only pay a donation to enter (around 2 euros I believe) and the church is centrally located so you'll most likely pass it at some point so just pop in for a quick walk-around.
Stunning!. Take a peek inside this colossal church and you won't be disappointed! It's austere, it's colourful and as with all churches - it feels like escaping from the bustle of Budapest.

Amazing building. I visited the Basilica when I was on holiday in Budapest, I initially came here at around 4-4:30 pm and explored around the area, I couldn't see too much at the time as there was an organ concert taking place at the time to which I bought a ticket to see which I feel like was not that expensive. The concert started at around 5:00 pm and lasted approximately 45 minutes and it was just breathtaking, the soulful music that was playing was just amazing. I think it was actually my first time going to an organ concert and I'm really glad I went to it. I actually came back to the basilica the next day so I could go up the tower. You have to buy a ticket to go up but again it wasn't too much, to get to the top you will have to climb I think it was 364 steps but it so worth it as the view from the top was absolutely stunning. Absolutely amazing building and everyone should visit the basilica and especially stay for the concert if you could.

Worth a visit. This impressive church / basilica is well worth a visit. Easy to get to as its centrally located it offers prime views of the city if you decided to take the time to climb the dome. My suggestion would be to visit in the morning as the best view from atop the dome is across the river towards the castle and palace. Both of these lies to the west of the basilica so if you visit in the morning you will have the sun behind you thus you will not be shooting straight into the sun.
Good View of city. Good View of city from top of the roof , a few stairs but if you don't like climbing them there are two lifts you can take but right now the upper lift is broke.
Interior Joy Best View At Concert. Excellent interior very spectacular when lit at night for a concert. Impressive from the outside and dominate the landscape when viewed from the castle.

Neo Classical Exterior, Baroque Interior-Must see. One of the best basilica's I have seen recently in europe. The structure is a little "heavy" because of the roman arches, but the inside is beautiful and rich in texture. The dome is taller than imagined. The square outside is so picturesque and inviting and the building draws you in. Another plus is that the suggested donation is about 50 cents, unlike some of the places in Europe that ask for 10 or 20 euros to enter. Missed the

Lovely visit. Visited here with my friend. We climbed up to the observation deck (approx 364 steps) which costs HUF 500 and has great panoramic views of Buda and Pest. We also went inside the Basilica where a HUF 200 donation is recommended.
Beautiful church, absolutely. I love a good church and this was a good church. Suggested donation 200 frts (50p) and no pressure to donate. We also lit a candle in remembrance.

Beautiful church and architecture. Excellent views from top. This church is visually beautiful with detailed, passionate architecture. If you're not afraid of heights, go to the top of the dome where you can go outside and walk around it, taking great photos. Quite a few steps upwards but if you're fairly fit it shouldn't be a problem

Excellent place!. This is the grandest church I've ever been in. It was brilliant. Took some awesome photos. We went up the spiral stairs right up to the top and went outside the dome for a look over Budapest. More great photos from up there! We took the lift down... my Mum has vertigo so getting her up the stairs was hard work! Worth a visit for definite!!
A must-see. We came upon this by accident. It's breath-taking inside and out, an absolute must-see if you're in the area. It's also free to enter (just an obligatory 1e donation).

Stunning church in the heart of Budapest. Been to see this church twice now and think that it is an amazingly beautiful church,second only to the Vatican in its splendour.Well worth the time to visit.

Awesome Architecture. We visited the Basilica at night and day! Both times it was outstanding. It is well worth going in and wandering about. It is a small donation which is more than acceptable for the upkeep! (200huf)

Impressive church with the most important hungarian relic. It looks really impressive from the outside- huge and majestic. Really spacious inside, though not exceptionally beautiful. ;) Don't know if it's real or not, but we can find the most important relic of Hungary there- right hand of Saint Stephen.
