Stunning interiors, weekly organ concerts on Monday. This newish edifice is an amazing feat of architectural engineering. You'll be interested to know a large chunk of it fell down the first time they tried to build it - this is the re-do! Even better is the setting - located at the start of a wonderful walking street with shops and restaurants. If you like old body parts, check out the chapel where there's allegedly a bit of a saint's hand (eeew) in a gold and glass case.
passed many times. We walked past this on multiple occasions during our visit. Great views and architecture. Busy area. Nice square with amenities.
Right of hand. St. Stephen's Basilica is the place to go if you want to see the famous mummified real hand of St. Stephen's.Entrance to the basilica is free.

Impressive inside. Loved the outside but the lighting inside was incredible. We were lost for words when the sun came out and pinpointed details up high. A mummified hand is always worth visiting - but the glass windows around it were astounding in the light. Inspirational and beautiful.
Grand. If you like architecture then this is for you. Magnificent building inside and out. Beautiful statues and iconography. Lots of steps up to the entrance.
Trip to st Stephens basilica . I must say Im not a fan of churches, but going up the odd 304steps you reach the amazing top of the basilica and the view of Budapest is amazing.
Breathtaking. Breathtakingly Beautiful. You must sit down and have a look up, down and all around to really take in the beauty. I was in awe.

Organ Concert worth doing. We attended the 5pm organ concert with soprano soloist, it was 45mins of beautiful music in a stunning building. We had considered going to an evening concert at twice the price, but we were glad we didn't as it was quite cold in the church, so a short concert was enough.

St. Stephen`s Basilica. This Catholic "Basilica" is Hungary`s third biggest church. It is a major tourist attraction in the city center. Named after St Stephen, Hungary^s first kind and founder, it a beautiful building and inside you can find the right-hand of St Stephen. It is a must to visit if you are in Budapest, it hosts excellent concerts. You can also catch some weddings. The son of famous Italian actress Sophia Loren got married here.

Worth the climb. We had a couple of hours spare on our last morning in Budapest so decided to climb the dome at St Stephen's Basilica. There is a lift but surely half the fun of getting to the top is the climb! The views are spectacular and are definitely worth the HUF 500 admission charge.

Breathtaking building. (When you go in they do ask for a small donation, I think it was 200huf each. It isn't compulsory but we didn't mind giving a little!)This place is not to be missed if you're visiting Budapest - it's absolutely breathtaking. The detail is incredible and it's full of character. The photos speak for themselves.The only negative comment I have from my experience here is that my boyfriend and I were sat in the pews and an elderly lady came and sat next to us - she was well dressed, clean and certainly didn't look like she was struggling. She asked us if we were from England and when we said yes, she proceeded to tell us how she couldn't afford to eat and hadn't had shelter in a while, it was quite a lengthy plea but as we had given a donation to enter we had no change to give her. She pestered us for a while until moving on to others. I don't know if it's a common thing there, but perhaps bear this in mind!It didn't take away anything from the experience however, and it's well worth a look around if you like architecture, culture and history.
Stunning in every sense. Taking time out to go inside it is inspiring to see and appreciate St Stephen's. If you are visiting Budapest take the time to go
Beautiful. Not to be missed. This is just stunningly beautiful. Gorgeous ceilings. Breathtaking detail. Well worth spending a little time here.
Wonderful. Beautiful place, beautiful view. cozy restaurants nearby.Beautiful building! Must see for tourists!
Well worth the walk up oh so many steps. Beautiful building and all worth a visit. We chose to walk to the top to experience the stunning views across the city.

Spectacular Cathedral. We visited St Stephens Basilica in February for 2 main reasons. First was to climb all 316 steps to the tower and secondly to get a fantastic view of the city.It cost about £1.35 to climb the stairs and there is a lift for people who can't manage them. To enter the cathedral it is a donation of approximately 50p and to see the beautiful art work and stained glass windows is a must.

Fantastic architecture . Really loved this trip! We took the tour up to the vantage point which was absolutely stunning, and then through to the Basilica itself. The architecture is pure genius in this building. Great for a rainy day.

Breathtaking . We stumbled on it one cold afternoon walking back from the Parliament house. What a beautiful cathedral. We sat inside there for a while as a group in the front was holding some sort of a service or briefing (can't understand Hungarian lol) -& marveled at the architecture, sculpture and ceiling paintings inside. The photos seal for themselves I reckon.

It`s a pity!!!!. Me and my friend have tried on two occasions to enter in the Basilica and even have the possibility to go up by lift or with the stairs to see the view of the city, but we were not lucky. this is since the first time there was a concert going on and the second time we went but the basilica was not yet open. Despite all of this we have appreciated the beauty of this basilica especially the piazza in front of it.
Horrible. I really don't like it. What else to say? Not my cup of tea, there is better to do in Budapest, no doubt.
lovely spot. visited on our last day its like 400 huf to go up to the top and look over the city amazing views. must see!!!

Decent church. The exterior of the church is more interesting than the interior. Make sure you see the holy right hand of St. Steven. May be slightly dissapointing to those who have seen great cathedrals elsewhere but worth a look. Would recommend climbing the dome for the best view in Pest.
St Stephens Basilica is breathtakingly beautiful from inside and out. A trip on the roof is a must and inside is beautiful too. The views from the roof are the whole of Budapest. A must see in Pest
Worth the visit . I'm not a church fan, but this one is really worth the visit. The entrance is free and the architecture is amazing! It really surprised me
Bascilia. Lovely building especially lit up at night. We didn't go inside but note that there's plenty of coffee shops /cafes around.

Excellent interior and definitely do the climb!. To walk around inside is free and the interior was beautiful and we even had the chance to listen to some local school children singing some hymns. The fee to climb was not much and the views were amazing. You can see Buda very well and they are plenty of great photo opportunities.

A Must See in Budapest. This is the main Cathedral on the Pest side of the Danube. It is similar in some ways to St. Paul's in London It also houses what is supposed to be the mummified hand of St. Stephen the first Christian King of Hungary

Primary cathedral of Budapest. The most important clerical building in the capital city. Burial place of noblemen and highly decorated citizens. Often the venue of high style weddings. Daily services for the religious people and for faithful visitors as well.
Cracking view. Once you recover from the amount of steps you have to climb to get to the top the view is amazing. Well worth the minimal fee to do so.

Dont take the stairs. Everything is beautiful with so much detail. The stand out point is the ceilings and stained glass windows. We paid extra to go up to look at th views but omg i wasnt prepared for a indurance test ! Take the lift unless you are fit.
Beautiful Building. Beautiful ornate building and has a mummified hand and crown jewels. Climb to the top of the tower to get an amazing view of the city

beyond beautiful. The building and art is breath taking, as one can only stand and marvel at the high genius of the builders and painters that contributed their skills to this loveliest of Christian adorations.
Worth going as the sun goes down

Lovely church, small donation to enter. Other fees to go to tower.. If you would like to enter the chapel, there is a small donation required. To go up into the tower and overlook the city, I think it was 1000 forints per person. Lots of stairs, naturally, but there was an elevator available too. The tower is worth the visit. The King's right hand is available for viewing in one of the back chapels, and if you deposit 200 forints in the box, a light will come on to see it better. For the life of me, I couldn't figure out where to put the money. There was a slot in the top of a brass box, but there was a protective bar over the top of the slot and it didn't look like there was enough room to fit a coin, so we didn't.
Make sure you go inside. Whilst impressive from the outside, the inside is amazingly decorated, well worth a visit, be respectful and leave a donation even though it is voluntary.
Beautiful! Well worth the visit!. Beautiful on the ouside but even more so on the inside. Really breathtaking. Free admittance. Well worth the visit.
Wow!. Just beautiful, this place has the 'wow' factor. A very beautiful creation, well worth a visit and always helps to understand the history
History. It is a historic basilica and you can check inside of it the treasure of the church. Also the architecture is incredible.

Brief visit. Saw this from tour bus but only made it there Sunday morning, while there was a service on. Mostly in Hungarian, but they gave a short talk in English, which we sat to listen to. Voluntary donation to enter, and small fee to go up the tower, which we did. Excellent views from the tower.

There is a lift!. The cathedral is beautiful! And we'll worth the suggested donation of about 70p. However the best bit has to be the outdoor balcony and views over the city. You have to pay to go up but it's less than £1.50 and there is a choice of 302 steps or a lift (with about 10 steps) Well worth a visit!

Beautiful building but extremely rude staff. The interior and exterior of this building are stunning and well worth seeing if you're in Budapest. The view from the top is amazing with the 360 degree views of the city. When we bought the panorama ticket we were told (or this is what we understood) that this also enabled us to go to the treasury. We showed our ticket when we got out of the lift to be greeted by the staff member literally screaming in our faces that it was only for panorama. We tried to explain that we were informed that it was for both but she continued shouting at us and was extremely confrontational. When we got back to the main entrance, we checked the ticket boards in more detail and we discovered that we did actually need separate tickets for both attractions (note to anyone who is planning on visiting the basilica). We know we made a mistake, probably due to a language barrier however the way the woman in the treasury spoke to us made us leave immediately and not purchase the ticket to go back up to the treasury due to her rudeness as we most certainly would have done in another circumstance. A beautiful building but a disappointing end to the visit. The building in itself is a 5/5, the staff on this occasion would be lucky to get a 2/5.

St. Stephen's B . its a breathtaking moment when i make a visit to this church. All the little detail of the building is very artistic and grant. They charge for an admission fee to go up to the very top of the building where you can see a panorama view of Budapest. its really worth the money. Only if you dont mind that you needs to walk 375steps of stairs in order to earn that views.

The most interesting Basilica I have ever seen.... Inside this Basilica they actually have a relic of St. Stephen's hand. If you would like to pay, it even lights up for you. I was strangely interested in the phenomena of giving money to see a hand, like nothing I've ever seen. Worth a visit. You don't actually have to pay, I just waited until some other tourists did so...hahah

Breathtakung. A huge assemble in the heart of Budapest, St.. Stephen's Basilica impresses both by its size and interior. The acoustic is mild and I enjoyed listening to the priest and an extra-celestial sound of the choir.
Awesome building. Fantastic visit to an architectural splendour - well worth a visit as part of your itinerary. The interiors are well worth a visit alone.

Beautiful church, entrance fee is only 200 HUF. Very decorated and beautiful basilica. The hand of the saint is located here, if you want to see the one of the most famous attraction of the Hungarian Catholic church.
Amazing. Very beautiful, and the entrance is free, I was also able to see saint Stephen's relic , a must see in Budapest
One of many must-see places in Budapest. Absolutely worth of seeing even on a rainy February day... Huge church in the heart of Pest with truly great interior as well as quite impressive exterior.

The Little Cathedral!. St. Stephen’s Basilica is the largest church in Budapest and can hold up to 8,500 people. Although in architectural terms it’s a cathedral. The inauguration ceremony took place in 1906 and was attended by Emperor Franz Joseph. Don't lose the Xmas concert on the night of 24th december, it's amazing!

Sightseeing day. Views of river were wonderful. Very interesting place lots of historical facts. There are a few buildings to go into they have services if you want to take part. The walk way is good along the river if weather is good

A must-see. Saw the church interior, the chapel of the Holy Right ( Hand), then paid the very reasonable fee to see the Treasury and the Panorama Tower. Brilliant views of Budapest and surrounding area from the Tower, worth the 302 steps up. Stunning, architecture, plenty of gilding. Nice to sit on the steps outside and watch the world go by. Attended an evening concert in the Basilica, 6000 HUF ( in the cheap seats ) for about an hour's music of God's Greatest Hits played /sung by 5 soloists; a worthwhile experience and this performance seemed a regular feature for each week.

Splendid . Sunlight was pouring in through the southern aspect window brightly flooding the otherwise dark interior with strong shafts of light. This really emphasised the abundant gold decorations and adornments.This Cathedral is interesting in how it's a mixture of Christianity and Hungarian King-saints.

Amazing architecture . Another of Budapest's must see sites. Small suggested entrance fee but only 50p or so. Well worth it and even my 7 and 10 years old children were impressed. You can pay a bit extra to go up a 150 or so steps for a cracking view of the city. Avoid if you have fitness issues!

Beautiful. The Cathedral is amazing and worth a visit. The stained glass and marble work is absolutely stunning, don't miss it. The church is also located on a nice little square with restaurants and gelato.
Stunning. Suggested donation of 200 ft required to visit St Stephens Basilica. Beautiful inside and also hosts the hand of St Stephen himself. Stunning building well worth visiting.

Breathtakingly beautiful inside and out. This is an imposing church from the moment you approach it. It doesn't seem to take up a huge amount of space on the ground and yet it is quite awe inspiring in size. It must be because of the height of the dome and the accompanying towers. Entrance into the church is free (suggested donation is 200 flt). It is beautiful inside and even forgetting some of the masterpieces around the individual chapels, the ceiling is glorious. And the mummified hand is something that my children thoroughly enjoyed!We paid to to visit both the Treasury - which is a small collection of the church's silver and some of the bishops' robes etc. If you are interested in church regalia, it would probably be of interest. The main feature though is the view from the rotunda. You need to buy a ticket - I think it was about 350 flt - and then you either take the 302 steps to the top or go up in the lift. There are two sets of steps and two lifts and even taking the lift still requires taking a few more steps to the top, so it isn't accessible to the infirm. But when you do get there - wow! The views are spectacular. Absolutely a must do if you're in Budapest.

Awe inspiring . The basilica/cathedral is beautiful inside and outside. The design is breathtaking and the stained glass and ceiling inside is one of the best we had seen. There is also a holy relic to see in the chapel

Beautiful church. Limited access when we visited but worth going in to see the interior and hear the acoustics. Mini organ concerts were offered in the evening but didn't manage to fit one in. Would go back for a fuller visit next time.

Visited on a Saturday. This was basically the last on our list to visit so we ran over on Saturday morning before our departure from Budapest. So glad we went! The square where St. Stephen's is situated comes alive on Saturday with a market and there was a performance of the army band which was delightful. The Basilica is beautiful and there is a wing over on the left side as you enter that has some interesting photos and history.

St Stephens. Beautiful, atmospheric, huge, remarkable ceilings and stained glass windows well worth a visit.
Didn't ascend to the top due to queues but were advised that the view was worth it if you have the time

Very grand. Amazing views from tower!. Inside of St Stephens is very grand and beautiful. Could walk around and look at the architecture and paintings on the ceilings for hours. It is breathtakingly beautiful. Don't miss the small chapel through separate doors where the mummified hand of St Stephen is displayed! Entrance to main church asks for a small donation. Additional fee for visiting the tower. I think it was 2000HUF? We walked up the steps (there is a lift for those who don't fancy it) and although exhausted when we got to the top... The view was definitely worth it.

A must see. The interior of this building is incredibly impressive. Free to enter with a small donation of about 50p. Afterwards we paid a pound to climb to the top of the tower which provides amazing views across the city.
Spectacular!. Majestic cathedral. Very well kept and suggestive. We went all the way to the top and the view is breathtaking

Exquisite Church. Having experienced St. Stephen's Cathedral in Vienna and the hoards of people inside and outside, I wasn't so sure how I was going to feel about St. Stephen's in Budapest. If you are like me and visited Vienna before Budapest, wipe everything from your mind about St. Stephen's in Vienna because St. Stephens of Budapest is completely different - it's a much better and much more spiritual experience.First off, the crowds are nothing compared to Vienna. You actually have room to breathe and reflect in this church. You have room to move around and take in the stunning beauty of the church. The architecture is fabulous, and the church is much easier to revel in. This is a must visit in Budapest.I'd highly recommend going up to the top of the tower to take in views of Budapest. You can take an elevator most of the way, or you can really be adventurous and climb the stairs the entire way. We did the stairs. The stairs can be a bit narrow and nerve-wracking if someone is coming the alternate direction, but just move aside and hold your breath, and you'll be fine if you're afraid of heights like I am. You can spend a lot of time at this church. It's more than a quick visit location, and fits in to a day trip in Budapest, or a several day trip. We merged this in with a visit to Parliament and the Central Market, and walked the whole way. It was a great addition to our trip and a highly memorable spot.
Gorgeous building. Amazing building, size is staggering. For a small donation can wonder around and admire the craftsmanship. In a central location.
True baroque building. It is nice place to be seen. All environment is nice the object is true baroque landmark and it is well ilumintaed over night
Quick Visit. roamed around inside, it is fantastic, the pictures and architecture is magnificent. Something for bored dads/boys is the severed hand of st Stephen. gruesome.
Stunning interior. Visited here in Feb 2016. It is an impressiv building from the outside but is even more impressive from the inside. Dramatic and a huge amount of gold on show?
Arcitectural miracle. Another sight will must not miss in case you are visiting Budapest. It is in the center of Pest and the interior will take your breath!

concert in the Basilica. I was there on the Chrismas Holidays and we heard the Messia from Hendel with a very good choire and solo singers. the place has a fantastic accustic. The price is very reasonable, not expensive.
One of the best in Eastern Europe. Fantastic architecture and some beautiful art inside the little chapels. You should see it at day and night.
A great place. This is a church which is very old and not unlike many other ones so if you are limited for time, I would skip it.

Beautiful building . The inside is just as stunning as the outside. If you go to see the miracle hand then make sure you check for times. We went just to look inside but due to a mass going on, even though we could walk around there were some areas blocked off and didn't see much of the stunning features in the building.
Stunning. I'm not catholic, but really like to see churches around the world. This is one of the most stunning one I ever have seen .
Beautiful basilica. It looks similar to many churches in Rome, but this has got amazing soul. Good to visit in sunny morning - stained glass

Beautiful church located in the best section of Budapest. St. Stephens is located in the best tourist section of Budapest. The church is surrounded by shops, restaurants, and cafes. The church itself is typical with the exception of having small museum that houses St. Stephen's right foot......

Stunning. A beautiful church inside and out. We walked near this each day of our trip and I loved looking at it each time. We paid to go up the tower, 302 steps!! It was worth it though. The views were amazing from the top.

Right place, right time!. We happened to visit during a wedding of some circus performers who had an ELEPHANT waiting for them outside...! The basilica itself is absolutely beautiful - definitely worth seeing.

Missed the Elevator ?. Marveled at this magnificent Church from outside as we waited for the curator to open and once he did we were treated to it's glorious interior. Fantastic size & beautiful fittings , statues, altars & exhibits ! The hand of St. Stephen was an unexpected bonus but on par with St. Peters in Rome. Strange how these relics survive the centuries but that's faith, isn't it ? Somehow I missed the Tower , so now have to go back to Pest !

Impressive Basilica at a price. They say it is free to visit yet when you enter there is a priest at the collection box asking for a suggested donation of 100 Czech dollars per person. Once inside it's very impressive, you can take photos without using flash and make sure you also visit the small chapel at the back.
Beautiful church!. This is the main church so Budapest! A Really big square introduce to you at this pretty and holy place! Good place,I recommend to ente inside! :)

Lovely, large basilica. This church does not have the "history" of many other European churches, but it is beautifully adorned. Be sure to visit the chapel on the left not only for the shriveled hand of St. Stephen, but to admire the glorious stained glass windows.
Fantastic Views from the Tower. This is definitely worth a visit! Go to the top of the tower for great views of the city, there is a charge to go up to the top of the tower but it was very cheap!

Go to the top!. Extremely gorgeous inside and out, but you must go to the top of the tower. Take the elevator up, as there are too many stairs to climb up. My friends and I went up when it was raining, and got a great view of the city from there. One of the best experiences you can get in Budapest.
One of our favorite places. The bascilla is grand in stature and beauty. It towers the area and is just beautiful. The outside alone is something that should not be missed

Go upstairs!. Beautiful Basilica in Budapest! It's seriously a fascinating building and you shouldn't miss to walk upstairs (entry about 400-500 HUF). There is a beautiful Panorama view once you made it to the top. Very recommended! You shouldn't miss the scenic view up there!
Magnificent architecture. Really a place you can't miss, inside is beautifully decorated with a strong air of grandiose, a basilica fit for a grand King!
An impressive Church. An impressive church to visit. Check opening times before you visit to ensure that you are able to see St Stephen's fist!!!

Every time we come to Budapest we come here. Beautiful, peaceful and a must see. 200 HUF suggested donation entrance fee. You can't fail to be wowed by the ornate decoration and atmosphere. Good for spending an hour on a wet day too.
Extra charge for the balcony (lift or stairs). Small gift shop outside the main entrance.

Szent Istvan Bazilika. One of the highlight of my visit in Budapest.
Amazing architecture and stunning views from the top on the city.
Wonderful decorations. Large church with nice decorations and many details. For an enthusiast there is a lot to observe. There is enough light to take photographs without flash.

Great and Historical!!!!. Place is in very good condition and worth to seen. We spend short time there but enough to feel a history and seen some historical things. Basilica is situated in best part of town and if you are in Budapest come and enjoy a place.

Take the elevators to the top. The view from the top is awesome, especially for the Pest side. It is about 500 HUF (2 euro) to ride the elevators to the top. 200 HUF to enter the church, which is beautiful and can be seen in about 10 minutes.

Massive Church Structure . Kind of a coincidence as yesterday was in a church of the same name except in Vienna.
This is a large structure but does not seem as large or as high as the similarly named structure as an operating church in Vienna.
Anyway it is an architectural wonder worth visiting.
the Doctor
Majestic. The place where Franz Joseph was crowned in 1867 is a masterpiece of architecture. The huge nave is overwhelming.

St. Stephen`s Basilica is a wonderful building.. St. Stephen`s Basilica is well worth a visit and is convenient to Andrassy Street. You can see the hand of St. Stephen in a glass case in a smaller chapel to the left of the High Altar.

amazing place and view!. this place was one of the highlights of the trip! super worth it! I highly recommend to go upstairs to the tower. Amazing view! the only drawback was the weather, but beside that is worth it!. Inside the basilica is definitely beautiful!
Go to the top!. Best views of Budapest, you definitely have to go to the top. Check for the several discount possibilities. Interior is stunning as well and a "do not miss" visit in Budapest.
Stunning building.. The Basilica is amazing,the arcitecture and scale of it will take you breath away.Shame there was a lack of information or tour about it when I was there.

Beautiful Architeture. you can easily reach St Stephen's basilica, by walking straight on Audraussy road (opera house direction) or take metro 1 (the yellow color, old line), get off at Bajcsy-Zsilinszky.The entrance is free, but 200huf as donation is at the entrance. The architecture is amazing, with perfect lighting, and giving peaceful feeling. Almost every night, there will hold concert, sometimes string orchestra, sometimes chior concert. It s worth a visit.

Stunning church. I don't normally go back to a place twice while I am on holiday but this Basilica deserved a second viewing and I was awe struck on both occasions. The architecture is magnificent, the stained glass stunning, the peace and tranquility you find these is perfect to escape from the mayhem of tourist attractions. Go into the chapel with the gilded hand, sounds a bit macabre but what a lovely little chapel to hide away in for 10 minutes.Light a candle and just enjoy the quiet for a few minutes.

St. Stephen's Basilica. A gorgeous structure, but the best part is the panoramic view from the top. It's cheap and well worth its value ten times over. In my opinion, it's an ever better view than Castle Hill, not to mention they have a lift.
Climb up to the cupola!. The climb up to the cupola is well worth it! The structure inside is interesting and when you walk out, the 360 degrees view of Budapest is spectacular!
Lovely Basilica. We attended a nice mass here once last year for Easter. Was in the smaller back chapel room. It is also a must see sight for visiters to Budapest!
Nice European style church. If you like seeing different churches around the world then well worth a visit. It free to wonder around the main area but there is a charge to go to the dome area.

Good panoramic view of the city!. Really nice inside here. The interior is designed beautifully and it is really peaceful.St Stephen's hand was slightly disappointing but definitely worth going to see.If you decide to go, definitely pay to walk up to the roof. You get a great panoramic view of the city! Just be warned that there are a lot of stairs to walk up (and majority of them are in form of a spiral staircase!) It's free to go in but they do recommend that you make a donation (there is a man sitting next to the donation box so you feel you have to donate - the recommended amount was incredibly cheap though).
Nice to watch it. Very nice inside !!!! Wonderful view of the town if you go upstairs! !!!! The ticket for upstairs is 500 fiorins.

Absolutely stunning. The basilica is beautiful inside and out. It's an imposing structure, even more so during the night when it is lit up! Inside, it is so detailed, much like you'd expect of a church in Western Europe. You are able to walk up the top and there is an AMAZING view of the city from up there
One of Budapest's stunning buildings.. Another of Pest's wonderful buildings that should be visited on the hop on hop off tour. Well worth it.
Fabulous concert in beautiful location. Classical concert for my husband's birthday, extremely high standard and truly atmospheric, loved every minute.
Must visit!. A beautiful basilica in Budapest which is a must visit! The architecture is exceptional.. Do take your time inside to marvel at the intricately designed and painted domes!
Inside is even more beautiful.... I thought it is again just another church... but inside I felt God is just next to me. It was very touching.

A time of reflection. We visited the basilica on New Years Day after a superb evening cruising on the Danube to welcome in the New Year. There was a Christmas market outside the Basilica and we had warmed up across the square with a hot chocolate before entering. The architecture is stunning and there was still a Nativity displayed inside. We lit a candle for a friend from church who had recently had major surgery and reflected on how fortunate we were to be in this building - despite there being lots of people around us it was possible to have a quiet time and reflect and take in the works of art - wonderful.
Mind the steps!. It was one of our very limited options on Christmas Eve. We took the (307 I think) steps to the top, but the view was pretty compensating.
Concert . Gorgeous chapel. Excellent concert very varied music - soloist , horns, group . Very special evening . Just looking at the interior is reason enough to go in .
Fantastic place to visit in Budapest. Budapest is wonderful. Easy to get around and tremendous history. This site is no exception. One you definitely don't want to miss.
Stunning. It was free to enter but you are asked to make a small donation. It is well worth a visit and it will take your breath away.

One of the most beautiful churches. Like an elegant aristocrat, the basilica sits in the center of the city, surrounded by pubs, restaurants and shops. It is the center of the nightlife of Budapest too, so try to walk there daytime and nighttime: visit the inside and sip wine marveling its lights from a close bar when the moon is up.

Stunning stained glass. Wow - what a privilege to see such a stunning building - a work of art. This must be on any ones wish list for Budapest - arrive early morning 10 (ish) to avoid all the queues.

Wonderful. A lovely church and great to stop by for a quick peek inside! Wont take more than about 20 minutes though unless you're interested in seeing their holy relic which is a chopped off shriveled hand....

Amazing architecture and 360 views.. This is a beautiful building and even if you don't like churches go up to the dome to experience the amazing views of the city. There is a small charge to do so but I think it is more than worth it as this was a highlight of the trip.Be aware there are quite a few steps to climb but there's also a lift that can take you part of the way.May not be suitable for small children as there's not a lot of space once at the top.Also if you're scared of heights you may not like it!
beautiful building!. A very beautiful building with lots of history and culture, tucked away but not too far from the chain bridge!
Awe inspiring basilica in the heart of Pest.. You don't want to miss this basilica with its many pieces of religious art and its beautiful structure.
The most beautiful panorama of Budapest. I recommend go to the top of the Basilica in a sunny day and you will see the nicest panorama beyond in Budapest.

A beautiful Church definitely worth a visit. This Basilica was so beautiful and the relic of St Stephen was unbelievable. The location was very central and easy to get to. Hop on Hop Off Bus stops right there.
Stunning. This Basilica is a must-see when in Budapest.It is a stunning place with lots of little chapels to see.

ST STEPHEN'S A CENTRAL PLACE TO MEET UP IN BUDAPEST. St Stephens is a great place to meet up with people.It is a vast structure, historically significant, and a great place to meet up weith family or friends. Restaurants and cafes very close and shopping is all around this area - the river Danube is a short walk - and the bridge across the river. Good public access by subway, metro, bus.

Beautiful Basilica--not just another church!. Throughout Europe, there are magnificent cathedrals, and this one is as well. Worth a visit through; take a guided history as this one has so much to offer!

Stunning building but not keen on the hand. I recently visited the basilica and was very impressed by both the exterior and interior. There is so much detail throughout the building and while inside you just find yourself walking around looking up at the ceilings the whole time.You can also go up to the top for a panoramic view of the city, however I didn't end up doing this as there was a bit of a queue to go up.You can also go and see St Stephens hand which I though sounded a bit strange. When you enter the room there are several pews looking toward the hand which is held inside a glass case. You can't really see the hand until you pay to light it up which I think is a bit ridiculous. It can be argued that they don't have the light on all the time to help with its preservation, however the way it lights up makes it look like something at a fairground.Admittedly this wasn't something that interested me but for those that are more religious, I imagine it is very interesting.
Incredible architecture. Another must-see when you visit. The interior is just as fabulous as the exterior...make the effort and go to the observation deck. You won't be disappointed.

Beautiful. Lovely outside and even better inside - classic and ornate. We went in December and the Christmas market outside it was nice and looked nice with a light show projected on the wall of the basilica.

One of those truly impressive European churches!. This is a very fine example of a well maintained church and a perfect place to linger for a while or sit on one of the benches will admiring the dome!

Beautiful place to visit!. Before we visited, we had no idea how beautiful this would be and hadn't really thought about it. After entering, we both were blown away. It was beautiful and the interior was spectacular with a very serene feeling. We lit candles and took all the little details in. It itself is free, but costs to go up to the tower which was INCREDIBLY worth it and very cheap. In the tower, you can see spectacular views of buildings such as parliament and all over the city. Do not miss if you are visiting Budapest.

Relaxing moment to my busy sightseeing day. The basilica is beautiful in the inside. Definitely go see it! There is no entry fee but there is a donation box at the entrance. I went here during Christmas time and there was a wonderful Christmas market outside.

View from the top is worth it!. Absolutely stunning basilica. Paid the extra to go to the roof. Fabulous views and worth the climb. Only noticed the lift once we reached the top!!! Would highly recommend a visit here.

Great !. This church is enormous inside and very well decorated with mosaic ceilings etc, sat inside for a few moments and enjoyed looking at the architecture! Don't forget to light a candle when you leave

Cool but they ask money at the entrance, don't give them!. The building is impressive inside and outside, but they ask for money at the entrance, it looks like it's an entrance fee, but it's not, you can enter without paying and then pay only if you want to climb upstairs.Never give money to enter a church!

Stunning Inside and Out. I have been to many cathedrals in many places and this si really good - very different and brilliant interior. Yes there is a fee but worth it - and of course there is the amazing view across the river to Pest.
Impressive. Beautiful, big, overpriced, worth a short stop, not much information inside, learn your stuff before you go. Good stop for rainy day
Beautiful structure. A beautiful Basilica and the surrounding area us nice too, hard toiss as it is right in the center of the Pest part of the city.

Panoramic views from the top and beautiful inside.. This was the first thing on our list when arriving in Budapest. We went to the top (at a small cost) which allowed us to get beautiful pictures across the whole of Budapest and allowed us to get a footing as to what the most important landmarks are (eg. The Palace, the Citadel and the Parliament building). When entering the actual Basilica, it was absolutely stunning! I have travelled to Venice and Barcelona and seen plenty of impressive Holy buildings, this is in my top 3. As its relatively new the colours and gold leaf are in perfect condition adding to the beauty. Very interestingly they have St Stephen's right hand (first King of Hungary) which was removed after his reburial and then stolen, it was later found in1084 by King László.
Impressive. I visited close to Christmas time and I am not religious, but really appreciated the serenity of the place and the beautiful design! Well worth a visit and it is free!

Amazing!. A trip to the Basilica is a must, even if you are in Budapest for a short time. The architecture is beautiful outside and in. Completely worth paying the small amount extra to climb the spiral stairs to the top for a breathtaking view of the city.

Very Serene. Loved visiting this building. It is beautiful inside and out. It is free to visit but there is a small charge (1 euro) to go up to the tower. Would recommend doing this as the view over Budapest is amazing. There is also an art gallery on the upper floors. There is a small shop inside that sells lost of souvenirs and is very reasonably priced.
HUGE and beautiful place.. I don't think I've ever been to such a huge cathedral, really worth seeing. It is even better if you can enjoy and have lunch on the restaurants that are around.
Amazing Architecture. One of the most beautiful churches you will see, from the floors to the windows. I lit a candle in every chuch!
Another stunning building. A very important building for the Hungarians and stunning to see. As around budapest these buildings are amongst modern buildings but doesn't take away from the splendour

Stunning church. We visited and were amazed by the beautiful church and its decorative ceilings and walls . Admission is by donation. There is in the smaller chapel at the back a relic which is the severed right hand of Saint istvan that is still used for some religious ceremony's. It is a lovely church to sit and gather your thoughts. We would recommend a visit whilst in Budapest.
Beautiful church. Worth climbing to the top for a wonderful view of the city. A wonderful building in its own right but a also a centerpiece for the city
A stunning nice place. The best view of the city from the tower, and a beautiful cultural heritage. Worth visiting any season.
Beautiful . We went here twice as it was closing the first day we got here. I strongly recommend paying the 500HUF per person to get great panoramic shots from the top of the Bascillica. A must see

I attended Sunday Mass. The interior is beautiful - how can you go wrong with a basilica in a major European city? A bonus was that they summarized the homily in English for those of us who don't speak Hungarian.

Wow. Beautiful basilica with interesting and beautiful art.
We enjoyed seeing the relic and found the site to be peaceful and interesting. Be generous with your donations.
Stunning. Well worth a wander, the ceiling is supreme and I wish we'd gone up to the viewing platforms. Careful to go slowly so as to not miss the nooks.
Opulent. What a majestic interior. Sunday visit perfect even for a non religious person, beautiful, the music and sermon were lovely.
Beautiful spot for photos . This is central to Budapest so you might as well go have a look. It's good for photos and at the least will act as a navigation spot for the rest of central pest.
Amazing architecture and art. A must visit if you're in Budapest! The art and detail are amazing. It's great to take the short tour and also take pictures of you're into photography.

Don't miss it. One of the must-see in Budapest.
Beautiful from the outside, as from the inside.
Around Christmas, there is also a market in front.

Impressive. Very grand from the outside and beautiful interior. Recommended 200Huf entrance which is voluntary I believe but if a member of the clergy is sat by the box I think anyone would find it difficult to pass it by and it is such a small amount anyway (about 50p).

St. Stephen's hand. Beautiful Basilica. You can actually see St Stephens hand there. Creepy-Cool. We happened to catch a wedding the day we went. sat respectfully In the back until it was over before exploring but it was wonderful to see

Commerce vs Religion. I like visiting these church's, cathedrals, basilicas etc and never fail to marvel at the ornate decoration, the skill of builders so long ago etc, and St Stephens Basillica doesn't disappoint. It is stunning, but I do object to being told how much to put in for a candle etc. however, what really rankled was having to insert cash to light up the cask that holds the mummified hand of St Stephen. That is, frankly, over the top. I accept these places need cash to keep them going & I do donate, but lighting up the casket makes it seem like a fairground attraction. Take the lift to the viewing area, it's a great view

Awesome. Most beautiful church with wonderful organ that enhances some great Catholic liturgy. A must visits, especially for those who want to experience the full beauty of good orthodox Catholic liturgy
Great viewpoint. Very picturesque views, you can make a lot of great pictures especially on sunny days. Be ready to walk a long way upstairs.

Impressive Architecture. Impressive for its size and grandeur - this type of edifice never ceases to amaze. The main part of the church is simply enormous - breathtaking on its scale. Free to visit (there is a voluntary donation system - enforced by the local clergy), it is worth a look for is architecture alone. There is a tower that can be accessed, but this attracts a fee. It was foggy the day of our visit so we didn't go up it

Do the Dome. By far one of the best things we did in Budapest was climing the dome of the Basilica. It's really cheap, unlike some other churches in Europe, and offers spectacular views of Budapest. The inside is similarly beautiful, a large area that makes the interior decorations really lovely.

Must See. Stephens Basilica is dedicated to St Stephen, or Istvan, the first Hungarian Christian King. You can see the dome from all over Budapest. The church is beautiful. Be sure to go into the side room to see the Holy Right Hand, Hungary's most unusual relic, the mummified forearm of King Istvan.

Peaceful tranquility. The exterior of this church is impressive but when you walk inside if is really Impressive! Visited during the evening and sat listening to a male soloist (possibly clergy) singing whilst the organ was being played. It created a lovely ambience.Similar internal structure to other European churches. Lovely building and only 200Huf donation.

Impressive Structure.. Interesting with a tour guide who is very knowledgeable in Hungarian History. St. Stephen was Hungary's patron saint. His hand was cut off and missing for years but now is glass encased on display in the Basilica. For years his Crown was for safe keeping in the USA after World War II. I think somewhere in Ft. Knox but no one knew for sure until it was returned to the people of Hungary not that long ago.

Wow. What an amazing place. Looks great from outside but set foot inside for an absolutely amazing sight. The architecture of this building is wonderful. We visited on a Sunday as a service was taking place, I'm not a religious person but I was blown away by the site.

Well worth calling in they just ask for 200 florin donation. Beautiful interiors. We revisited later that day as there was a organ recital and a violinist ....really good and the music made the atmosphere of the wonderful building come alive. Otherwise a ten minute look around will suffice

Amazing on christmas. I have the oportunity to visit this place on christmas and it's very beautiful with a long christmas market around and delicious food to eat and of course hot wine, inside the church it's nice like most churches on europe

Must See (:. My mother and I visited St.Stephen's Basilica as soon as we arrived in Budapest. It is absolutely amazing, and there are many towers that you can explore. Great to look out at the city and locate other places to visit!

Go there!. NIce place, also if you visit a concert, its a nice atmosphere. Outside, on the stairs, wedding crowds are quite common. Now the tower of the Basilica is open to visitors, and its not expensive at all. I suggest you go up, its an amazing view of Budapest, from up there, you can see how huge it actually is.

Awe-inspiring. Sit under the majestic cupola and look around - absorb the tranquillity and beauty of its architecture, it is a unique experience. There are splendid organ concerts in the evenings which are well worth attending.
Beautiful Basilica. Beautiful Basilica. One can pay some money to go to the top of the Basilica . You will see the whole of Budapest up there. No English Mass in this Basilica

A 'definite' for Budapest Visitors. Like the Parliament or the Bastion, this is one of those buildings that epitomises the city. Definitely take the opportunity to visit this while in Budapest. My time here was somewhat rushed and I didn't get the chance to fully appreciate it (mainly because theres so much to see here that 5 days wasn't long enough!)

Beautiful church and great organ concert. Able to have a good tour around the church followed by a superb organ concert with solo soprano. A truly inspiring experience when the music echoes around the dome!

nice place on Winter Holydays. the most important and beautiful church of Budapest. it's a real pleasure to see it on Christmas Market, when all place is sourrended by colour and Hungarian tasteful food.
Stunning . A must see - it is absolutely stunning - take the steps to the top its well worth the 320 steps - though there is a lift !!

GO INSIDE!!!. The inside of this place is so stunning!! This is not a place you want to view from just the outside!! One of the most gorgeous Basilicas I've seen!! The amount of gold inside is unbelievable!!
Ok. The Basilica is big and very beautiful outside, inside is OK. I didn't do the guided tour so not sure I missed anything inside...
Beautiful landscape. You can see all over Budepest from the top of the Saint Stephen's Basilica, so i can tell you it is worth to climb it

Not very old but spectacularly beautiful. Beautiful both inside and out. Go to one of the evening concerts offered almost nightly; we heard an organist, violinist, and tenor performing a variety of works, including one by Franz Liszt.

Impressive building & views. Amazing views definitely worth a visit!
Cheap to get in approx £3 each
Treasury not the best but worth a look!
Lots of bars / restaurants round the area & other bits to do!

Beautiful . Beautiful church.
We went twice as first visit there was a wedding and we couldn't access much of the church.
Definitely worth visiting plus the wine bar (Di Vino) opposite is nice.
Gorgeous views. We visited Budapest in September 2015 and paid to go to the top of the Basilica - although it be hard work and some very steep stairs it was 100% worth it for the views of Budapest!
High Praise. A very beautiful church built to honor a 'home grown' saint...Stephen. Surrounded by marvelous statuary, the interior solemn and respectful.
Impressive . The Basillica is very impressive, we didn't go up but still visiting it was one of the highlights of the day cause its elegant and you can feel the holiness

Great view. I'm not much for churches but going up for the view is worth it!
The inside is gigantic and it's an impressive building.
Beautiful inside and out. We paid 200 forints as a donation. You have to be silent inside - probably not somewhere to take kids. It was incredibly beautiful inside.

Another beautiful church . I'm glad I made time to stop here. I'm always left in awe of the beautiful architecture in Europe. Wasn't let down here. It's a free entry into the church itself, although 200 HUF is a suggested donation. Photos are allowed inside, but silence is a must.

A brilliant gem. The best way to experience the Basilica in its full glory – in my opinion – is to approach it from the Chain Bridge on the Pest side of the Danube. Start walking straight inland from the Chain Bridge. You’ll have to get across a small grassy island and then on to the street ahead of you. Then the Basilica slowly emerges at the vanishing point where the two sides of the street converge. Also the best time to visit it – again in my opinion – is near sunset when the facade of the building glows in the magical golden light. The Basilica is one of the five ubiquitous structures in Budapest which can be seen almost from anywhere in the city, the others being the Hungarian Parliament which along with the Basilica are located in Pest, and the Buda Castle and Fisherman’s Bastion along with St Matthias Church are located in Buda. The church is named after Saint Stephen I of Hungary, the first King of Hungary (c. 975–1038), whose "incorruptible" right hand is said to be housed in the reliquary. You can actually view the relic. The building was completed in 1905 after 54 years of construction. It is one the two tallest buildings in Budapest, the other one being the Parliament building. The number of tourists flowing through the marvellous interior makes it rather difficult to sit for a quiet prayer. That being said, I went there almost every evening for two weeks and sat for half an hour of bliss. Whether you’re a religious person, or a lover of architecture or student of history or an inspired photographer the Basilica will not let you leave empty handed

Basilica St. Stephen's .. A truly remarkable building both inside and out and the view from the dome must be one of the best in the city. A truly majestic building and definitely worth a visit. It has a tiny entrance fee.

Detailed. It is only a donation to get into the basilica. The basilica itself is quiet and dark but absolutely beautiful. Probably the most ornate basilica i have seen in europe. The viewable areas are fairly small and it doesn't take long to see everything but it is worthwhile.

Beautiful inside and out. Absolutely beautiful. Take your camera for some truly magnificent shots. Make sure to take the elevator up to the dome where you can experience some lovely views of the city.

Fantastic views of the city. Climb the stairs or take the lift to the top for a small fee to get fantastic views of the city. You can walk around the whole way at the top and see the city from every angle. It's great for lovely photos.

A place you will want to visit more than once. I visited the Basilica twice last year; both times with friends and family visiting from the UK. I was more than pleased to have the opportunity to re-visit this amazing building. All I can say is don't overlook the Basilica as a tourist destination on your visit to Budapest. Even if you are not religious, the interior architecture and decoration is so breath-taking and the acoustics are to die for. My very favourite area is a small side chapel where the relic of Stephen's hand is situated (I think that is what it is!) The reason I love this so much is the stain glass windows. You really should go and look at them. They are worth the visit without the splendour of the main Basilica, with its gold leaf and marble statues.I would love to have the chance to attend a concert here; I can imagine that it would be magnificent. Entry is by donation.

Disappointed . Due to it being low season, I called in here to admire the views and interior of the famous basilica to be welcomed by only the chapel open, and at that - only 1/3 of the chapel was accessible but had plenty of "donation" boxes dotted around the opened parts of where the public did have access too. There weren't any signs to say that the tower climb was closed due to low season and the main part of the church was also closed. Shame, because I imagined it to be stunning.
Beautiful Church. It's free to go in (1 euro donation highly encouraged), and an absolutely stunning interior! Definitely a must see!

Beautiful tourist spot. Worth a visit.. Beautiful building with so much history. We grabbed a beer (and an ice cream- well, we were on holiday) from one of the many shops surrounding it and just gazed at it. Definitely worth a visit.

Amazing architecture . Unfortunately, we didn't make it inside as there was a service on and we didn't make it back, but I was impressed with the architecture and imagine it is also very beautiful inside
Breathtaking place in Budapest!. We visited this Basilica on our last day in Budapest. This church is simply breathtaking, we sat there for 20 minutes, just admiring the beauty of this place.
Absolute must visit. Walk or talk lift to roof for fantastic view over Budapest and to be in the roof where the dome in situated,
The inside..... wow. Dont look like much from the outside, but the inside, so beautiful and the story about the kings and also the hand ! Worth a visit
Paris like church with interesting history. In the centre off the city with restaurants around is this beautifull church located. Nice to walk around if you like old architecture

Beautiful view - great for those on a budget. Entry to the Basilica was a 200HUF donation. Not a lot and the interior is lovely. The highlight is the climb to the top though, another 500HUF each but worth it entirely. Fun climb to the top (302 stairs) and a great view of the city from a different perspective. Well worth a visit!
impressive. The Basilica is really impressive outside and inside, although it is only over 100 years old, located in the very center

The outside is much impressive . It's a young church compared to the other domes in Europe. The building is completed by 2 architects after a failure. We didn't see the tower cause we were not so very interested with the work inside. Nice but not so impressive. I believe watching the city view from the Gellert Hill was a better idea.
Historic. Beautiful architecture and rich, meaningful history right downtown. This is a very popular attraction, as it should be, among locals and tourists alike. A must see for Budapest tourists.
Beautiful. In a lovely area, beautiful church worth going inside. Plenty to do in surrounding area. If I was to return I would attempt to make Sunday service I imagine lovely

Beautiful. Beautiful from the outside, from the inside and views over the city.
Small donation to go inside and a bit extra to climb to the top of the dome. But worth doing as better views then from the castle.

Moving.. While the Basilica itself is a little overkill with it's terribly ornate decor and religious relics it's certainly worth visiting for a quick history lesson and cultural fix. The birds eye view from the top which can be reached by elevator is guaranteed to thrill and if you are lucky there is generally some kind of art exhibition half way up.
Nice inside and out. Very nice place, we went up to the top, you have to pay a 1000huf for it. To go inside of basilica you need to pay a 200huf as a donation but the guy let us in free.

Totally Awestruck. In the last 6 weeks and 7 countries we have seen many cathedrals, I must say. However, this has got to be one of the nicest of the bunch. It is so ornate and serene and beautiful. An unexpected and highly acclaimed surprise in Budapest.

Beautiful...no doubt about it. This basilica is gorgeous both inside and outside. The entrance is free of charge, with a fee applying if you would like to go into the tower at the top. The interior is beautifully decorated, and is a no-miss place for any Budapest tourist,
Nice views. It's costs 500 HUF to go up to the tower where you'll get some great panoramic views. The outside of the building is impressive but inside it's nothing special. Worth checking out though.
Bellissima !. This St. Stephen Basilica is a must see from outside and more from the inside, it will take your breathe away.

Stunning baroque interior. Stunning baroque interior, covered with gold, paintings and decoration and its only 200huf to enter! Yes, its a not entirely voluntary 'donation' but its only 200 huf, so you can't complain really. Very pretty and definitely worth a half hour visit.

Grand edifice. As churches go this is a nice one, however I hate to have to pay to enter one and given the grandiosity of this building I am amazed to have to pay. Honestly take your pics from the outside and save your HUF for a clean toilet mid city walk.

Impressive church and building. This church has great architecture!
We were there before christmas and with the christmas market the outside square of the church was really beautiful and it is worth to spend sometime around this church to see also inside!
Beautiful. St. Stephen's Basilica is beautiful both from outside and inside. It is free to public. Nice for short visit. Must see.
Gorgeous. Beautiful church inside and out. Small donation (200 forint) to get in. Absolutely do not miss while in Budapest!

Not what we expected. It was a nice experience, don't get me wrong, but not what we excepted. They charge entrance to church (plus you can leave donation, which is silly if you already paid them) and cupola (view of the city). I would say they charge it too much! More beautiful attractions in Budapest are more affordable.Plus, the view is not as stunning as from Castle Hill or Buda Castle.You can look at it from outside square and it would be enough to experience it.
Don't miss the cupola... Don't miss church's cupola! You can go all the way up by elevator or climb the stairs.. It has a small admission fee but the view is just priceless!
amazing place. Amazing place to visit. Very beautiful basilica. It is so spectacular. Good experience to see this Basilica
Beautiful. Beautiful place.One of the must visit places if you go to Budapest.I was there in December. And in front of the Basilica is the Christmas Market.

A really spectacular place!. We went to the cathedral right off the plane, expecting to be so tired we would not even enjoy the experience, but, you know, it is impossible NOT to be impressed by Szent Istvan! It is so exquisite and impressive. And the day we were there, the Christmas Market was in full swing in the square in front of the cathedral, and light images were being projected onto the facade. If you are ever in Budapest at Christmas, do NOT miss this wondrous place!
nice inside and outside. Its a sort of City centre where everything happen around this church specilyy at christmas time.Lovelly
if you like history.... if you like history, culture and religion this is your place. St. STEPHENS Basilica is a part of the historic town of Pest and is a must if you visit Budapest
An incredible monument. Such a beautiful building! Took a stack of photos with my partner and got a token coin! A must see for shizzle!
Beautiful inside and out!. Must see in Budapest. Great location and free to the public. The also have concerts here but we were unable to make it. Amazing Basilica.

Quite stunning. A donation is required, not an exhorbitant entrance fee. The building exterior and interior is beautiful. Stautues , carvings and glass all intricate and beautifully presented putting together something that was quite stunning
Amazing. Love these old buildings. but I didnt enter the church. just from outside. also we ate our breakfast in Bazilica cafe near it..

Great looking church. It actually reminds me a bit of the Basilica di San Pietro, in it's ability to make one feel small and insignificant. And the comparison pretty much ends there, but that doesn't mean that the church is not worth visiting. Quite the contrary, I heartily recommend it. You will not be dissapointed.

Nice to visit but too commercial. The Stephen's Basilica is nice for short visit. We were a little turned off by the commercialism of the church. Example that a donation is requested to enter and a retired priest sit by the entrance to make sure all visitors pay their donation. It's definitely not the donation suggestion that bothered me but the fact that someone is watching you pay "your donation". Also the entrance to the other treasury and lift will require additional fees. A view from the top is most likely the best attraction. Too commercial for me.
This was the view from our apartments- stunning. we stayed in the Basilica apartments on the top floor and this was the view we had- absolutely lovely
Breath-taking buildung. One of the most breath-taking buildings I ever visited! Take a few minutes to enjoy the silence and to take the atmosphere in.

Don't miss seeing this!. This Cathedral is beautiful inside and out! The architecture is amazing in itself, and upon entering, you are just enthralled by the beauty everywhere you look as you wander around the large interior. Make sure and take the time to walk up to the top of the tower. There is a small fee but it is totally worth it. The views of Budapest are wonderful, and the climb was interesting as well.
Impresive basilica. from outside it's nothing compared to what you will see inside the church.It is impresive and you can just stay there for hours and you will fell calm

Beautiful basilica. The construction is amazing both from outside and inside.. the ambience is too good..one can stay inside as long as they wish. The pillars and d design are beautiful.. must visit..
Baroque. I have done my share of Gothic Cathedral's. It was amazing to see the Baroque ones. You need to sit and take it all in. Beautiful.
Incredible . Absolutely beautiful building. Would most definitely recommend to visit whilst in Budapest, even if not religious. The interior architecture and decor is not to be missed!

Good view . Take the opportunity to look around from the top of the cathedral.
Otherwise it is one of the main churches in Hungary (the other is in Esztergom) for the Catholics so it is fully renovated and full of gold and stuff.

Beautiful inside. Someone had told us that the Synagogue was more glamorous than the Basilica, but they couldn't have been more wrong. It is beautiful inside with some amazing art. Be sure to see the black Madonna in the back right corner for a different take on traditional christian art.

Concert at the Basilica. We went to hear a concert in the Basilica It was an incredible spiritual experience. Organ music and an opera singer, combined with the acoustics of the place have created a striking effect that is hard to describe in words.
Fantastic views . Great afternoon exploring the area. Clear skies amazing views across to Pest. Took the funicular up to the Castle and walked down.

Beautiful Inside and good concert. We visited on the 2nd of January for the Organ recital at night. It is stunning inside and the music was good. The price was reasonable for the tickets and you just pop along during the day and buy a ticket (cash only). Turn up 20 minutes before and the doors open and you go in and the concert lasts 70 minutes. Enjoyable!

Must see. St Stephen's Basilica is a Roman Catholic basilica in Budapest and it's one of the most significant tourist attractions and the third highest church in Hungary. We visit St Stephen's Basilica in late december. Would recommend visiting this place.
Amazing views. The interior is nothing special but the views from the top are amazing. It was very cold, but the pictures turned out great.

Incredible views from the top!. For a real view of the city then pay a small fee (equivalent to £1) and walk around the top. Also very easy to get too and pretty inside for a donation of around 200 florint. A definite must see for any tourist!
Sightseeing in Budapest. Great Church. Excellent organ music with chor. Several famous Chappell incl St Margaret. Not far from the pier for the river tour.

Worth a visit. This place is beautiful, has a gory relic of a hand preserved, ceilings are beautiful '
Very crowded keep your belongings close as like every where pickpockets love tourists,
No entry fee but you are expected to put donations in box on entry
Allow a minimum of an hour to visit

Not just a prayer. It's a beautiful basilica, a bit dark inside but the building is impressive especially if you reach it from the river side along a street full of food stalls and other stuff.The relics of the saint are a worth a visit as well as the top to admire the city
Beautiful views . Well worth the ascent up the spiralling staircases to the top of the basilica - beautiful views across the whole of Budapest, do not miss this place!

A place to visit, definitely!!. We paid to get up in the tower and took some amazing pictures there. The view was superb! It cost 500 HUF (less than 2 euros; 1e=300huf) for two so really, really budget friendly! Would recommend visiting this place to everyone!

Budapest journey. This church is masterpiece of baroque churches in middle Europe . This church make Budapest highlights so picturesque and make this city what is it . I truly recommend this church especially climb up the stairs of bell tower because this view is amazing . Interior looks quite new .

Majestic from outside as well as from inside. One of the places I highly recommend to visit in Budapest. The basilica is situated in the city centre, and is very beautiful! I highly recommend to visit also the organ concert and to enjoy this place from a different perspective.

Organ concert. I was only in the basilica for the organ concert. Have to say it is a great venue to organize such classical music concerts, despite it was quite cold for sitting for 2 hours in a freezing day :)

Very nice church. This church made it to my top 3 churches I have seen so far (together with Wavel in Krakow and Berliner Dom). It's free for visit, just recommendation for donation at about 200 HUF (0,6 eur). I was surprised that church was finished just 100 years ago. I recomment to have 200 HUF coin with you to start a light on relikvia. Definitely worth to visit !!!
Amazing . It was breath taking, your mind just can't capture its beauty nor any picture of it though we tried hehe. Definately a must.
Fabulous. Beautiful basilica and architecture So much history and beauty in this city. Highly recommend . Must see
A view on the square. Worth the trip to the top . . . offers a nice view of the square below as well as a panoramic view of the city. The statues inside the Basilica are beautiful.

Must see. We arrived early and had the entire place to ourselves. It was all dressed for Christmas and had a somber feel. I could've stayed much longer to soak in the art and architecture but 1 year olds are like sharks, they have to keep moving. 😊 Perhaps on our next trip we can explore it more.
Very nice from the outside. Very nice church in the heart of Budapest. Very crowded with people, but it's definitely worth a visit

Beautiful Basilica a Must Visit. During the month of December there is a lovely Christmas Market behind Basilica worth visiting as there are many good artisan products made in Hungary. The Basilica itself is majestic and Grand and very beautiful
Smiles !. Visiting in winter was not bad, after visit the church a cup of hot wine will keep you warm. It costs 3 Euro :)

Beautifuk. This building and the Hungarian Parliament are the only very tall buildings seen in Pest (Can view from Castle Hill in Buda). Learnt a lot about this building whilst on a walking tour, definitely recommend to find out more. Another building that was meant to be built for 1896 (Hungarian Millennium). Fun fact the dome height of this building is 96m to remind Hungarians of the date 1896. Even with a Christmas market surrounding this building it was beautiful.
worth seeing once. take your time - dont rush this.. Kids may get bored. so much history. a lot of walking. Phone camara may not capture all the details

Christmas Spirit!. If you are in Budapest around Christmas, make sure you visit Saint Stefan for the evening prayer. It's a warm and devout feeling. It has a lovely christmas street market just outside.

New Year's Eve 2015. With a very busy Christmas market and illuminations ...it was quite impressive. Very near the other main venue (Voresmarty Square) about 500 metres. If you are looking for impressive fireworks on NYE FORGET IT . Budapest does not do these in spite of comments you may find. A beautiful cathedral and interior.....take time to visit inside.

Ridiculous . Awe-inspiring stuff! Do not walk by without entering.
This thorough review was written for you after our minute spent in there on New Year's Day
Breath taking. A beautiful building inside and out! A must see when in Budapest. This history it holds is just simply amazing.
Beautiful!. Downtown of Pest you can find this beautiful building. It was not my first time here I have been on concerts and masses before.

Beautiful Views Inside And Out. Stunning building inside and out!
Well worth a trip to the top of the tower for the 360 view of Budapest from the balcony.
Stunning architecture and design inside, very lavish!
Very Scenic. We didn't go inside the Basilica, but the square out front was a nice area to walk around. It also homed a great section of the festive markets.

Beautiful Basilica. The Basilica was stunning visually and did have a great feel to it. Seemed to be located very strangely but this added to the charm and obviously the buildings surrounding it have been built subsequently. Enjoyed the experience of walking around but as many other reviewers have said the way "donations" are demanded and taken as well as the way I was told to remove my cap was a bit much!

Magnificent!. This Basilica is truly stunning and not to be missed. You don't have to be into religion to enjoy the beauty of the beautiful altar, statues and artwork. Stand and stare up into the dome and take in the experience, or better still attend one of the concerts. I was visiting over the New Year period and celebrated the ringing in of 2016 from the square in front of the Basilica where the Xmas markets are held. An unforgettable experience.

Superb views . Be sure to climb the tower for a small fee. You get beautiful panoramic views of the city and there was even a small art exhibition half way up.The church itself is very beautiful and entry is on a voluntary donation (although they do watch to see!)

Beautiful Basilica!. The Basilica of Saint Stefanus is an extraordinarily beautiful Basilica. For a fair price it is possible to climb the stairs to have a nice view over the city. The Basilica itself is beautiful decorated and has a very large dome. Absolutely a must see for everyone who likes architecture and old buildings.

A must see in Budapest. We walk. We walked here several times from our apartment near the Central Market during the Christmas holidays. The basilica is beautiful, inside and out. They have concerts frequently (for a fee). At Christmas time there is a sound and light show on the outside every 15 minutes.
Just great. I only was in the city for work, but could not miss to stop by this amazing building. The market was right in front and beautiful concerts i could listen to.
gorgeous. wonderful sight in Budapest, gorgeous inside and out. Well worth the visit to this beautiful church.

Go to the dome for awesome views. Would highly recommend going to the dome for the 360 view of the city. We took the stairs and it was not that bad if you are in decent shape. Or two elevators gets you to the top. Great on a clear day and really affordable!

Amazing. A wonderful temple and one of the most distinctive landmarks of budapest. Not only it is amazing from the outside, but also from the inside. You can also go to the dome which provides you with a great view!

A religious site without extraordinary artistic value. A 19th century building, the center of the Catholic congregation in Budapest, is the biggest cathedral in the city. Music events are worth to attend.

The relic of St. Stephen's severed hand, preserved and on display!. Beautiful and well-maintained, this Basilica venerating Hungary's beloved St. Stephen is easy to reach via the beautiful plaza. Enormous inside, visit the many side altars until you reach the actual resting place of St. Stephen's hand, the only part of his body that was ever found. Sounds macabre, but is history. You may even pay a few forint to have a light briefly shine on the hand. Beautiful church, unique story, light a candle, say a prayer, make your wish, just don't miss this beautiful landmark!

Great viewing point. Basilica is impressive as are most, but in addition make sure you take the stairs to the top for a great 360' viewing point. Basilica is 'free' (donation requested), and access to the top is a minimal charge (if i recall correctly around 200 huf).

Be sure to stop in and see this beautiful church. A gorgeous church, we attended Christmas Day mass. Absolutely stunning setting. A must see! Take the elevator up to the top and you overlook all of Budapest.
Incredible ceiling decorations!. The location of the church is right in the center of Pest, however, the church itself has been overrated.

Beautiful Structure. While there are enough churches/ cathedrals throughout Europe, this one can surely feature in the Top 10. It is a functional church so you may not get to go and see the interiors if theres a private ceremony like a wedding. But it is one that definitely demands to be seen if you are in Budapest. Its got a grand structure and has many food places nearby so suggest that you go there around meal times. The rose shaped ice creams in the stores nearby are not to be missed.

Breath-taking!!!. You cannot visit Budapest without seeing St Stephen's Basilica! What a magnificent building! We visited over Christmas and were fortunate to catch a Christmas Mass in progress. The architecture is simply mind-blowing. It has to be one of the most beautiful buildings I've ever seen. To round off the lovely experience there was a Christmas market just outside the entrance to the Basilica, where there was an array of lovely art & craft on sale, and the best hot chocolate I've ever tasted!
Christmas at St. Stephan's Basilica. Visited the Christmas Markets ate the cabbage rolls and enjoyed Budapest. A little cold but can be ameliorated by mulled wines.

Nice!. A nice church located near the city center of Budapest. Did not have the time to get inside but from outside it looks pretty fantastic. A walking distance away from the parliament or the shopping area of Budapest, it is definitely worth a visit!
Fabulous. A true surprise. A big cathedral, beautifully embelished, withmarble walls and little tiles on the ceiling. All perectly harmonic.

What a stunning building. This is certainly a must see when you visit Budapest, it has beautiful architecture and when I visited in December also had a lovely christmas market outside. It really is a grand and impressive building.

Must see!!. I don't remember being inside something so beautiful. You have to pay 200 HUF to get in but it's simbolic price which is probablx for the ones in need, same as the candles inside if anyone wishes to light one for his family. One of the greatest buildings i have seen

Very impressive. Even if you are not religious this is a must see. The grandeur of the building is amazing, and the artwork and beauty inside is unbelievable. It is imperative that you got to the panarama tower for some amazing views of the city
beautiful. was there during christmas time so ambience was great with a massive christmas tree and the local market. the church has beautiful interior
During Christmas time . An impressive architecture, in front a huge Christmas market and laser show on the building, was really nice to see and experience.

One of the landmarks of the city. Astonishing church, outside and inside. The outside market at the entrance makes the whole feeling a little bit worse.
From the inside marvelous beauty.
Worth a visit. Beautiful church and one to spend a few quiet moments in, before or after touring the inside. Be sure to walk around to the back to see the shrine...interesting.

Beautiful church. Beautiful church ,must visit if you arein Budapest ...Even more beautiful in Christmas days .Do not miss the little shows every night that the church turns into a big moving video wall.

Great view. We went to the curch itself and to the top. You have to pay it separetely but both cheap and worth it. You can get some great panoramic view and pictures at the top. For those who are afraid of hight definitely use the elevator because the stairs get a little bit crazy at the end.

Don't Miss this Chance for a View. The views from the dome are as good as any in the city. You can take a lift to the roof and the panoramas are photogenic and unforgettable. The charge for the lift is minimal and the rewards are excellent.
Christmas week. No words to describe the beauty of the Basilica. Christmas market infront of the church,so great and lovely.Christmas events during the week.
