Basilica. The biggest church in Hungary. Monumental building in centre of Budapest. It is possible to go inside and see St. Stephen's relics.
Beautiful, worth the trip. Don't leave Budapest without taking the time to see the inside of this incredible church! We were so glad we did, even despite the crowds.

An Attractive Church. My husband and I visited the basilica on our trip to Budapest during the festive period. The church is beautifully decorated and the addition of Christmas trees was a lovely touch. The only anomaly is that my guidebook said it's free entry, yet the presence of the donation box complete with turnstile and a man on door duty suggests otherwise. Definitely worth a visit though.

Wonderful structure. My sister and i visited the xmas markets that were situated in from of the Basilica recently...wonderful atmosphere and there was an amazing light display projected onto the front of the basilica while we were there...

Breathtaking . It's both beautiful from the outside and inside. The church cost a small amount to enter but when you were inside it was incredible and worth the cost of entry. St. Stephen's steps were a great place to meet up with friends.

Lovely church . Worth a visit as its free and very lovely inside and the market and crib outside is splendid.
Do visit the chapel of the holy arm very interesting
The most beautiful church I've ever seen. A must see. Even returned the next day for mass. It was in Hungarian but still impressive. Suggested entry is HUF 200.

Christmas mass in the church. We decided to visit the church on christmas eve,and it was absolutely magical.The place was packed with people but it didnt feel crowded. If your not going on Christmas I recomend going to one of the organ concerts they have almost every day, its an amazing experience.The artwork and sculptures are very impressive, and its walking distance from most of the other attractions in pest (and from castle hill in buda its very easy to get there)You have to pay 200 forint donation at the enterance,so come prepared with small change
Great Church beautiful art. Very nice church, gorgeous art, everything in amazing condition. Well worth a look and go up to see the view!
Must visit. Very nice church, beautiful architecture, free to enter, history picture, one of the list must visit in Budpest

Awe inspiring. Wandered into the Basilica whilst waiting for a bus... the inside is beautiful and well worth a visit. There is no charge, although there are requests for a small donation of 200 huf (about 50p).

Beautiful views of the city from the top. This really is a must do when in Budapest. It's such a beautiful church (and the largest one in Budapest) and you get a great view from the top. It's only 500huf to do so and its well worth the climb up the many stairs to the top as you get a really lovely view at the top. There is also an option to get a lift up but there was quite a queue for this.

The middle of Budapest. Just a few steps away from the Budapest Soho a very nice winter tourist place. The building simple unique and eye catchy between the other normal ones.Frequently place for seasonal markets and surrounded with great restaurants and wine bars.
Simply Amazing. Cant say enough about the sites in Pest. First rate all the way. We took to underground to the Parliament and walked to all the sights. Makes for a long day but well worth the effort.

Something special at Christmas. This is one of the most beautiful sites to visit especially at Christmas time. The basilica is beautifully lit up and the Christmas markets in front of it add to the scene. Inside this beautiful building is just as fantastic as the outside. Make sure you take the time to do a tour and see all it has to offer.
Beautiful Christmas Market. Spent a lot of time at the Christmas Market just outside the Basilica, which was wonderful as is the outside architecture of the church. Well worth the visit
Very nice .... St. Stephen's Basilica is a very nice piece of architecture , you can't miss it while you are in Budapest . go inside the interior is breathtaking !
Great views of the city !. Lovely old Basilica - very ornate inside - go to the roof area and you will get a great view of Budapest.
Beautiful . Beautiful, very nice and open to all. Architecture was amazing. Defo worth the visit can go to mass if you wish .........

Basilica St. Stephen's. Basil, you look at it, and you can also poslikate in the Interior. The whole building is filled with beautiful frescoes, statues and shines in full gold. Next to the Basilica there is also a smaller Christmas fair. Visit!

Agree with other reviewers, one if the most beautiful cathedrals in Europe.. Just wanted to mention little know attraction which is the cathedrals catacombs.They are accessed by a stairway down , to the left side and just before the entrance to the chapel of the hand. There are tours every half hr which are limited in size. You pay as you exit to the street so leave this to last. (Unless you are interested in church vestments this is far superior to the "museum"). The guide was terrific, very informative about the many interesting customs of burial. Short tour probably about 20 minutes. I agree that the Cathedral itself is very beautiful!
Stunning. I am so glad we went into this Basilica, even if you feel you have seen so many cathedrals, it is really worth it.

Simply Amazing!. Very recommended to go on a clear day, as the Basilica has a 360 degrees panoramic view of the city. and the fog might ruin the experience slightly.Other than the view, the building itself is a very impressive sight, inside and out.One of the must-do's in Budapest!

We did not go inside, but absolutely beautiful. We visited during the Advent markets, and it is every so beautiful. I have marked it down because I was very unimpressed with the toilet selection outside, with the most disgusting portaloos I have ever encountered. However, the building itself is extremely beautiful and a must see if in Budapest.

Magnificent.. Has to be one of the most beautiful basilicas in the world, we were lucky enough to be there just before Christmas and experienced a pre-Christmas service, it was a beautiful experience.

Amazing!!!!!. We visited the Basilica early one morning, there were very few people inside, when all of a sudden someone begain playing the huge pipe organ!! And then we were treated to a concert with both a male and female vocalist singing separately. What a magical morning! We even went back the next day to see if it was a regular thing... It wasn't.

What you'd expect..... Like every other Basilica, the architecture was amazing and relics unbelievable. What I didn't expect to see was St Stephen'a hand in a chapel in the back. Be sure to take coins for the light box, otherwise your well not see anything.

Beautiful . The basilica is beautiful and at the time of year having a Christmas market outside made it all the more enjoyable l. During the evenings a laze light show is projected on to the front of the church
Beautiful . The basilica is absolutely stunning inside with gold detail. Well worth a visit. Can also view st istvans hand. Very impressive

Pre Christmas Eve concert.. The Basilica is stunning. The staff were friendly and helpful and we were lucky enough to attend a concert inside the Basilica in the evening. It was truly magical and I would recommend it to everyone.

Beautiful! . This basilica is gorgeous. Ever since I went to the sagrada familia in Barcelona no church or has been able to compare (not even notre dame) but st. Stephen's definitely blew my mind. Absolutely gorgeous architecture, if you're into that sort of thing like I am. Not religious myself but I appreciate a beautiful church. There's a lovely square in front of it as well where there was a cute Christmas market on for this time of year, which made it even more beautiful.

Beautiful Basilica!. St. Stephen's Basilica is so massive! When you're standing in front of it or near it you just feel so small. It's hard to take your eyes off it. It's beautiful inside as well. We went to the top where for a very small price you can enjoy a beautiful view of Budapest :)

Historical and elegant. The Basilica is free to enter, but when I went there, there weren't any English introduction booklets available, and the very few introduction signs in English. The architecture was beautiful, it would be better to know more about the history etc. about it.

A must as your touring the city. We were here in Dec. There was a huge Christmas market set up in front, periodically there was a nutcracker theme show projected on the church after dark. We walked in and toured the church at night. It was beautiful inside and out.

A Magnificent & Elegant Basilica. St. Stephen's is absolutely elegant! It's design shows off the rich red marble throughout the Basilica along with the many gilded areas. Walking it is breathtaking. We had been to numerous churches, cathedrals and Basilicas on this trip to Europe and St. Stephens is splendid. It was wonderful to visit early on as Saturday morning with no crowds. It allowed us to take our time to see the various altars, artwork, statues, side chambers, and altars. It is also very large. There is a fee to take the elevator to the top which was well worth it. Actually, you take a couple of elevators and walk through some of the areas above the interior dome and its inner structure. The view for the top is fantastic and great to see Budapest and the surrounding area. A "Gem" and "Must See" on a visit to Budapest.

Beautiful . The Basilica is free to enter and the architecture inside is stunning. We also went up to the tower where there were great views to be had for a small charge. There are also lifts that will take you to the top.
Richly decorated church. We went there in the evening for a concert with pianist, violin, trumpet and sporano bringing music from Bach, Haendel, Vivaldi Mozart and Schubert...
Glorious at Christmas. We saw two laser shows being projected onto the facade of the Basilika during the Christmas markets. Outstanding! The one of the Nutcracker is stunning!

A church. A stunning building where a donation is 'recommended' with two patrons standing by the donation box as if they are checking. Despite its beauty and amazing organ siund what disturbed me the most was the ongoing movement and clicking sound of cameras. When I walked in there was a service of some sort going on. Although the tourists were, including myslef, quiet it did not make me feel too good about this place of worship. If you love architecture its a must. But I am not sure about visiting during a service. But then that might just be me.
Must visit. This is a beautiful building right in the heart of the city. I did not go inside but I believe you can. As we went in winter the Christmas market was right there too. Well worth a visit.
...must-visit attraction. A must-visit attraction which wasn't too busy late afternoon. If you are planning to be there in December, I recommend the small Christmas market just outside the Basilica.

Nice place to visit and enjoy a classical concert. The cathedral is well conserved and makes the visitor trip to the old times when it was in its glorious moment. Do not miss the opportunity to take a ticket to a classic concert and appreciate the trip to the old times on the sound of violins.

Very cool architecture but to many tourists!. We went on a Sunday and although it was very beautiful, it was jam packed with tourists. Overall it was definitely a place that should be on list to visit, especially considering the price (200huf donation @ door).

Gorgeous Church!. Absolutely stunning, well worth a visit- free entry! Worth it to pay extra though and walk the 300 odd steps to the top of the tower for the most incredible panoramic views across the city! Truly mesmerising.

Xmas visit. A spectacular church, elevator right to the top for great views of Budapest. Small charge 500huff for the lift. Nearby Xmas market as well. Children's choir were on the steps when we arrived. Recommend a visit.
One of the finest religious buildings I've been in. Absolutely loved this church, from the domed ceiling to the organization everything was really interesting and so so beautiful
Wonderful. Yet another must see in this amazing city that has so much to offer. The walk around is lovely and especially at night

Beautiful Church. This ornate church has a large square in front. The structure is 315 ft tall with 2 bell towers. The loft ceiling, stained glass windows, treasury and Szent Jobb Chapel are amazing. A careful walk through the church is recommended else you may miss something exquisite. Open daily 9am-5pm. Entry fees - Treasury HuF400, Tower HuF500

Very central, easy to reach and awesome architecture. Difficult to miss the Basilica if you are in Pest. In size and beauty it's very like a lot of the great cathedrals in Rome and elsewhere so a must visit. It will take about 30 minutes to visit and photograph as part of a walk around central Pest.

Gorgeous Building. St. Stephen's Basilica is a stunning piece of architecture. It is worth paying the small donation to have a look inside, you can also see the hand of St. Stephen and climb to the top of the dome for a beautiful view.
Worth a short visit. You can see a fist of St.Stephan. And you have to pay for it. The Basilica itself is a traditional one.

Christmas Market - Beautiful location. This was my favourite market in Budapest The atmosphere was lovely, with beautiful lights and music playing. There were loads of really reasonably priced restaurants around and lots of lovely stalls. Can recommend the chimney cake and bars/hotels had great priced sparkly wine.

Stunningly beautiful!. This church is very beautiful and very ornate. There are several nooks and crannies to look into and if you go through the church too fast you will definitely miss something. We went back in the evening for one of their classical music concerts and it was very enjoyable. The acoustics are good and you get a very different view of the church in low lighting.

Inside, outside and upstairs leave you wanting for more! . Inside of the Basillica... What can I say? It's gorgeous. Photos can be taken, but without the flashes (even though NOBODY seems to care). The workmanship, carvings and detailing a of everything is to a tee. I just wish visitors would have been less noisy, refrain from using camera flashes and don't slam the doors! The view from the top is great. Don't bother to wait for the lift as it will take a while. I opted to climb the never-ending winding staircase, but overall it's manageable. The view I get, The climb was worth it.

views from St Stephens Basilica. While in Budapest if you have a chance climb to the top of St Stephens Basilica to take in some amazing panoramic views of the city. You must pay a small fee of 500HUF per person which works out round £1.20 but worth the small price to take in every angle of the city and get some great pictures. Their are 364 steps to climb before you reach the top or their are elevators if you wish to use them.

Impressionable catholic church.. Entrance is free, but there are some donations stands right before you go in. Every year, at the end of Nov., beginning of Dec. there is a big Christmas market organized in front of the Basilica.

Breathtaking. This was a really stunning church, very easy to get to near the centr of Budapest. The decorations and stained glass in the church were marvellous and there was a real sense of the history and tumult surrounding Saint Stephen's hand. I doubt if one went in summer that one would get near the holy relics but at this time of year the basilica was perfect

Beautiful Building and Super Christmas Market!. Came back here several nights during our weeks stay in Budapest because of the Christmas markets. The Building is lovely and the Christmas markets were just great! Not far from the main markets at Voros Marty Square, which were just heaving with people every night. Don't think a lot of them realised there was stuff going on here as well because it was much quieter and relaxed which suited us down to the ground! Didn't get a chance to go inside the cathedral which was a shame but I highly recommend going here during December at night to see the Beautiful Christmas tree, ice rink, markets and light show display on the cathedral!
Beautiful sanctuary. Definitely worth a stop - beautiful cathedral, even just for a 5 min wander and a few moments reflection. Only asks for a small donation on entry.

St. Stephen's Basilica. A must see in Budapest! The trip alone to the Basilica, along the winding paths, the beautiful gardens made for a beautiful Sunday afternoon outing. The Basilica is lavish and reverent.
Christmas market at St Stephens. Loved walking along side here with the Christmas markets and lovely smells. Wished we'd taken time to go in and look around St Stephens.

stunning veiws from the dome. Amazing veiws await you from the dome ,,lift access for those not wanting to do the spiral staircase 180 degree veiws over the this beautiful city ,,,The Basilica is beautiful decorated inside

A great place to attend Mass.. Early on a weekday morning, we stopped in to check out the interior of this very impressive old cathedral, and found a morning Mass getting ready to start in one of the pretty chapels off the main area. It was totally in Czech, but we got the important parts OK. Some beautiful old sculpture and internal architecture to be found here. Well worth the visit! Onward to find breakfast!
Go to the Top !. For an amazing view of Budapest, buy the ticket for the Panoramic view and climb to the top. It is well worth the trip !

amazing historic place. one of the must see in budapest. its beautiful inside as it is outside, try to walk in the street that comes from the river in direction of the basilica where you looking at the basilica all the historical buildings and beautiful architecture with the basilica on the top of your site.

Beautiful panorama view of the city. If you go to the top of basilica you can have a 360 degrees panorama of the city because when you go up you can walk around the dome. On the same square there are exellent restaurants and Starbucks.

Jewel in the crown. What an absolutely beautiful breathtaking Basilica inside and out. The interior is like nothing I have ever seen , beautiful gold carved statues painted ceiling and alters , beyond beauty , we claimed up to the done viewing balcony which you can walk all around and the views where breathtaking, in the evening we attended a classical music concert hoisted by the most famous .Hungarian Organist, where we where delighted by Tenor, Soprano singers a Violinist and a gent playing the trumpet, it was a beautiful experience and the acoustics where amazing.
Unbelievable beauty and historical significance!. It is wonderful trip through architecture and history of Budapest and its religious transformation throughout years.

Another beautiful Cathedral in Europe!. If you're into Old beautiful Cathedrals, like I am, than it is worth checking out! The marble and architecture is amazing. Was surprised that it wasn't as big inside as most cathedrals, but was still beautiful.
Beautiful. This was a very beautiful Basilica. Much better than the Matthias Church. I would definitely make an effort to go see it. Also got some excellent pictures.
Amazing basilica. The outside and inside of this building is amazing. We've had the chance to listen to a student shoir.

Do not miss the dried-up Holy Right Hand of Saint Stephen!. Like many of Budapest's monuments, this huge, impressive cathedral was built in the 19th Century, and seems far too big for the present size of Hungary (because the country lost over half its territory after World War 1). The cathedral's prize possession is the Holy Right Hand of Saint Stephen, housed in a marvelous little golden reliquary, which can be spot-lit by inserting a few coins into a machine. It is well worth a visit. I walked by one Sunday, when there was a small procession around the building, with loudspeaker music and a man throwing rose petals down from the upper balcony.
Amazing church. If you like visiting church's this one will take your breath away when you go inside. It's huge and completely dazzling with its decoration, also had a great market outside

More beautiful in december. The ever beautiful Basilica more beatiful in december,when there are the Christmas shopping around here.You can sip some fine wine,and do your christmas shopping.There are huge mass of people,and some fanny thing.
Worth a vist. We went along to check as heard they sold tickets for music events. These are organ playing. If this is your thing I would recommend. The interior is beautiful and free

wonderfully ornate. Ignore the donation if you want. This is another fascinating architectural monument which obviously requires upkeep. Cant understand why people have trouble throwing a euro in and have no problem getting ripped off in the New York Cafe
Beautiful. Beautiful old church, with self guided tour within walking distance of our hotel. I would recommend visiting.

fine visual experience of the city. The church is by European standards very new 100 years but worth seeing.The thing we really liked was going up in the tower and walking all around it for a great outside view of the city. There is a fee and do not confuse it with the treasures - separate events and entry close and confusing so check. It was not crowded and we spent as much time as we wanted.You can walk or take a small elevator most of the way. Along the way you can see various simple devices they have set up the check tilt and wobble in the tower ( they are unmarked but look - hint glasses with water, hanging ball)

amazing. Amazing views inside and outside. Beautifully decorated and lavishly renovated. We went their in early december and could see the Christmas markets outside as well.the food joints should be placed far away from the place, else you smell food at the gates

Beautiful Basilica.organ recitals+++. Welcoming cathedral. Gorgeous interior. Organ recital on Fridays and some Sundays. Dont miss the music. Usually with a voice and also a solo instrument. When the grand multi pipe organ opens up its stops, the music is famiiar and divine.

Beautiful Basilica. This is one of the most beautiful examples of architecture in Budapest so do not miss it. Also, make sure you climb the tower as you will get some spectacular views of the city. There is a lift available as well.

Amazing panoramic views! Lovely at Christmas!! . Beautiful place, and a lovely Christmas market outside. During the day we went up the top and the views were amazing. There were Christmas light projections on the building at night, accompanied by music. The atmosphere was great.

Excellent views from the tower.. 320 steps to the top for fantastic views. I went at 15h and the night came down slowly so I could see colour changing and it was just beautiful to be up there. I send few pics on my Facebook that my mates like.

Organ Concert. Very nice organ concert...just right length, 45 minutes, so the kids weren't too fidgety. There sre longer concerts, but this one wasn't too crowded. Beautiful church and Christmas Market just outside.

Top of the To Do List. Amazing interior, peaceful and touching! Great square in front of the church as well. Wish I had paid to climb the stairs. Also, displays the hand of St. Stephen, a founding father of the country (such as it was), in case you are interested.

Must Visit! . St. Stephens Basilica was a truly incredible experience. In my opinion the only Cathedral with a more beautiful interior is St. Peter's in Rome. A donation of 200HUF (<1€) was asked for entry. For an additional 400HUF you can climb up to the panoramic balcony on the dome. The view was incredible and worth every penny.

Interior absolutely stunning.. This is our second visit but the interior still amazes with all the reds and gold perfectly illuminated. Also good to take the 151 steps to the top of the tower to get an amazing view of Budapest

Good view. St Stephen's basilica is amazing inside. You can go to panorama terrace and have really nice 360 view of Budapest. For only 500HUF (app. 1,60€) it is worth it. There is elevator available but u also can climb the steps.
Must see in Budapest

Great. We just stopped there and it was really beautifull.
It was located in THE city centre so its pretty walkable distance
Eventhoug it was very busy we found spots to make some pictures

Beautiful!!!. We happened upon this Basilica by accident. As we strolled the streets of Budapest on our first day, we saw the spires in the distance and just a few blocks from our hotel was this beautiful Basilica. The day we visited was just 2 days after the shootings in Paris. There were many candles and flowers on the front steps. We weren't sure if the church was open for viewing because it was a Sunday. Once we went through the heavy, large doors.....what a sight it was!!! We got quite a few pictures and was glad that we went inside.

wonderful view.. For a small fee you can climb the 304 steps to the outside of the dome to view the wonderful panorama of Budapest. If your not feeling energetic then there is an elevator to take you to the top.

Huge church!. Nice place, huge building, very important for the history of the Hungarians, you must definately visit it. Amazing from the inside too! The olny thing i didn't like was that there are no english translations under the statues and the other things the church has inside. So i just looked without understanding... Also, even though they told us that it was for free, there was a priest in the entrance and asked us to give him 1 euro each. We gave him what he asked, but it was quite strange because some people didn't want to pay (they were also told it was for free) and he then let them pass without paying. I am not sure what happened...

Wonderful Basilica . Wonderful Basilica which deserves to be one of Budapest's most visited attractions. The enormous building is fully decorated with gold, famous scenes from the bible and art. Despite the basilica is quite old, everything looks really well preserved. There is no entrance fee, though a (small) donation is really appreciated.

An impressive place in Budapest. Situated near the metro station of Deack Ferencz is one of the great basilic that I saw, you can go in for free but if you want the see the city from the top of the basilica you can do it for about 3 euro. In the front of the Basilica is know a very nice Cristmas Market with local food and wine.
Fab views.. Easy walk from hotel. Fantastic views over city, lovely building. Hundreds of steps up but so worth it!

Stunning building, even more impressive inside. We first saw this venue whilst visiting the bustling Christmas Market at night, when it was cleverly lit in pastel shades and then had a ballet performance projected onto the facade. Went back the next day and found the interior to be equally impressive.

Another must-see in Budapest!. The Basilica is a beautiful work of art in itself - and well worth the visit. There are frequent organ recitals and other musical events that take advantage of its acoustics. Entrance is free though a donation is suggested and encouraged; help them keep up the monument!

Serenity . Took some time out from the markets to visit the basilica. There is a very spiritual atmosphere here. The paintings and carvings are beautiful and fascinate young and old. The chapel holds the relic St Stephens intact hand in a box which you pay to light. No flash photography permitted in this chapel .

Fantastic . Popped in to escape the cold. Impressive church but wouldn't expect any less with the wealth of the Catholic Church. Gold guilded walls and ceilings, intracate paintings and stained glass. The church also houses the hand of a previous king (Elledged) likely to be the hand of a random deceased person. There's an interesting article about it on Wikipedia.

A Must Visit. The outside of the Basilica is imposing and austere but once you enter you are taken back by the amount of colour. It is truly wonderful to walk around or just to sit and enjoy all the different aspects. Entry is free but they do ask for a small donation towards the upkeep of the Basilica. The view from the roof is amazing looking over Budapest but the stairs are not easy but there is a lift which has a small fee to use.

Amazing. The basilica is really beautiful and adorned with a lot of gold which I love seeing. The let us in for free, though they're supposed to take I think 200 forint per person which is next to nothing. It's in the center of downtown so there's little reason not to go.

At Holiday Time Especially- But Anytime It is Worthwhile. There may be more magnificent cathedrals and Duomos in Europe, but this one doesn't have to to take too much of a back seat- especicially when you approach it from Szrinyi street off of Oct 6 utca. Very Impressive. The view is somehat obscured by the Christmas Fair there throgh Jan !, but then again the market offers other possibilities for eating, drinking and browsing.The Basilica itself offers the backdrop fro a multi-media display flashing on the edifice. The interior is beautiful- brighter than many in Europe. A trip to the top offers impressive views.There are many affordable, quality and healthy eating options within a short walk On Oct 6 utca there is a Hummus Bar and Pad Thai restaurants- highly recommended. For the best steaks in Bp, there is KNRDY restaurant, though be prepared to pay for the privilge of your tender succulent steak, chop or seafood. Worth it if you can pay.

Absolutely beautiful church. This is a must see,an absolutely beautiful church. We were so lucky to be there while a Christmas rehearsal was going on,the singing was beautiful in such an incredible setting. Made it really special. St Stephens hand was a bit odd!

Stunning cathedral. This is really worth a visit. Hungarian buildings in general are beautifully ornate, but this takes it to a whole new level. Absolutely stunning. Unfortunately, missed the organ concert on a Friday night, but this is the perfect setting.
Beautiful. Well worth a visit, entrance is a suggested to 2000huf but we gave the guide 5000huf for 2 of us and he was so grateful. well worth more.
Magnificent Basilica!. The inside is really beautiful. Make sure to go inside. If you pay, you can also go up to the top and get a cool view of Budapest from a different angle not normally seen.
Beautiful. Lovely Basilica, surrounded by great restaurants and coffee shops/gift shops! Free walking tour guides often meet outside so it's very easy to join a tour.
Good view from the roof. Great interiors. Very good view on the city from the roof. But it's not easy to get upstairs) There is a lift that cost 1,5 €.

Incredible place, especially the views!. A very impressive building to visit, but best of all, make sure you pay the £1 to climb to the top, the viewing platform. The views are incredible and this was one of our highlights of our trip to Budapest.

Beautiful. Visited this beautiful Basilica last week. The paintings are exquisite. Climbed the steps to the observation tower (should have used the lift) beautiful views from the top. Went to a fabulous symphony concert on Sunday evening, really enjoyed it.
Amazing. We were so lucky while we walked in the basilica as there was a choir singing there and it made the experience extremely holy!! The church is beautiful inside out!

One of a must see place in Budapest. I think you will like the Basilca, even if you are not fond of churches or you are not a religious person. The architecture of the building is impressive. There is a nice square in front of the Basilica. Recommend to walk down the street to the Danue and enjoy the landscape to the Castle hill.

Beautiful building. The architecture on St Stephens Basilica is amazing! The building is huge. So much work went into Creating this masterpiece. I didn't actually go inside but I'm sure it's just as wonderful inside - I was more taken by the cute Christmas market stalls outside in the square!
Huge, beautiful building. Nicely decorated old building, the biggest church of Budapest. Front of it a beautiful square, and nice buildings around. Must visit

stunning. There was a christmas market in the square where the church is located and I have to say that it was my favourite amongst the many chrsitmas market sites in budapest. The chrsitmas tree with its lights and the skating rink was gorgeous....WE also attended the mass on sunday and the choir was lovely plus the inside of the church itself is spell-bounding!

Beautiful. I visited that Basilica in April with my partner and it was absolutely stunning.We visited very early in the morning which turned out to be a great choice as we were the first ones there and the silence inside added to the experience.Lots to look at and everywhere you look there are different things to discover.Would also recommend climbing to the top to see the panoramic views, very cheap and absolutely stunning!

I gasped.. It was one of the pit stops for our free walking tour. I was impressed from the get go. It's such a beautiful building and nothing beats walking down the narrow streets, with St. Stephen looking pretty majestic indeed. Day or night, it does not matter. Just go and bathe in its sights.

Nice panorama!. We climbed on the Basilica and the view was just stunning. Definetly a must when visiting Budapest. P.S.: I don't really know how many stairs there are, but when we got up there we were tired as if we climbed a mountain. And we do climb mountains! ;)
Fantastic view :-). Do not miss to go to the top where you can see the Buda hills on the other side of the Danube and also the downtown structure of Budapest! :-)
Lovely old church!. Once again the architecture employeed in this old structure is amazing. We were impressed by the age of the structure and the fantastic job of preservation.
Great views. Pay the small fee to go up the dome where you will be rewarded with great views across Budapest. A lift is available or you can take the stairs.
Beautiful church. Quickly jumped in for a short visit, loved it. You'll pay 200 HUF optional donation at the entrance, to access the top of the basilica you need to buy tickets (not expensive).

Nice views. St. Stephen's Basilica is a beautiful church. It is very opulent and is well maintained. A quiet prayerful place.Climbing to the top of the basilica gave us an incredible view of the city and a great perspective of all the buildings.A must visit if in Budapest.

A Budapest Sight Well Worth a Visit. A visit to the Basilica is well worth the time spent. In addition to the interior of the Basilica the climb to the dome (via stairs or lift) for the views of Budapest for a minimal fee enhances the overall experience.

Must see. The church is named after Saint Stephen I of Hungary, the first King of Hungary (c. 975–1038), whose supposed right hand is housed in the reliquary. This church is one of the most photographed in the world- and it is easily understandable when you stand under the enormous dome in the middle of the church. Free entrance. The best way to get an overview of concerts and activities taking place at any point in time is by visiting their local homepage - you found an English version ther being quite useful
Stunning Interior. Not to be missed. The interior is amazing. See for yourself. The decoration and artwork is wonderful.
Simply awesome. Simply an amazing place to visit and should not be missed on a tour of Budapest. So atmospheric and the design of the interior is awesome.
Stunning architecture. What a stunning building, definitely worth a visit and would recommend climbing the 300+ steps to the top of the dome for great views of the city.
Phwoar. The building is lovely, the design inside is amazing, it's massive and it's for free :) I loved the basilica
Stunning Basilica. A stunning Basilica with interesting history. Great views of the city. Well worth the visit. Very central and close to other sites and landmarks.
Great Place. Lovely place to visit, beautiful interior and great views from the top of the Basilica. Great little Christmas market outside. Would definitely recommend a visit.
Beautiful. Do go inside, look up at the dome and ceilings, truly beautiful. A peaceful refuge from the Christmas market outside.
Go to the top!. One of the best views of Budapest at the top of the Basilica and only costs around £2! Particularly lovely now with the Christmas markets below.

Beautiful church . Not much to say about this church except that you only pay 1 euro as opposed to some other churches Inside is beautiful it's grand and has beautiful paintings and frescos. Worth a visit
Beautiful place to go in BP. We went there Saturday evening. It was mass time. A christmas market outside and a special building projection. Beautiful inside and outside. Worth a visit.

See the Enormous Dome. This neoclassical basilica is named after Hungary's first king, Stephen (997-1038). The dome is 315 feet high. The mummified right hand of King Stephen is exhibited in the basilica. There are some beautiful stained glass windows but overall the church is rather dark.
Impressive!!. We were really impressed by St.Stephen's Basilica. Even though is not very old it is very stylish and well maintained. Really worth visiting

Gorgeous Church. This church is stunningly beautiful - especially inside. I believe it was damaged during WWII and just finished renovations in 2003. It is worth walking around and viewing the mummified hand of St Stephen in the small chapel in the back. (200 HUF donation to enter the church)

Striking Interiors. It is massive and though it doesn't look spectacular on the outside, its interiors definitely make up for it. The wide sanctuary and its dome are especially striking as are the floor-to-ceiling altars on the sides. There is also a small Black Madonna chapel round the back. No fees but donations are welcome.

Doesn't get more romantic than this. Had a stroll around the Christmas market after a meal just around the corner. Wonderful friendly atmosphere, pretty much a perfect Christmas scene, we just needed a bit of snow 😁

Wow. Any visitor to Budapest has to go in here. We first went up the lift to see the views from the top. This was 500HUF. You can either walk 300+ steps or get the lift. We opted for the lift! You then walk a few steps up into the actual dome on the top. Wow, inside you can see the structure and appreciate the sheer size of it. You also get to see the concrete "cap" from the inside of the dome in the church below. Stunning.Then outside you get to appreciate 360 degree views all around Budapest.Once back down we entered the chapel. No ticket as such but there is a box with a 200HUF recommend donation. Honestly, I was blown away with the inside. Red marble, gold everywhere, just incredible. I have been in some amazing churches and the like around the world but this has to rank as one of the most impressive.Definitely visit!

You must go up to the Dome. The church is phenomenal but the view from the dome is in another world. Well worth your time to take in the 360 degree view . Wish I had time to return for the church concert

Very impressive. The largest church in Budapest, a cathedral really but they prefer to call it a basilica, is most impressive. Entrance is free. The main emphasis is on Stephen who, rather unusually, probably uniquely, was both the first king of Hungary and also made a saint because he led his hitherto pagan people into Chiristianity. His hand is preserved here as a relic.

Friday Concert Very Nice. We went to St Stephens and enjoyed taking in this marvelous basilica - beautiful and different from so many others in Europe. It was a Friday and we noticed that there are classical concerts in the basilica on Friday nights so we went back later for this marvelous show. It's only an hour but had beautiful organ, trumpet and vocal performances of Bach, Handel and many others. Highly recommend.

Stunning both inside and out. Fantastic nave, alter and chapels especially the one with Stephens forearm on display. A trip to the top of the tower (all 363 steps, make sure your fit as it is all spiral staircase or use the lift to go up and get the buzz walking down) is well worth it as the views over the city are remarkable. This is, by law, one of the two highest buildings in the city at 96 m and much higher than the ferris wheel they have erected and charge you 5 times the amount to ride in.

St. Stephen's Basilica. St. Stephen was the first of the Hungarian kings. He was crowned in the year 1000 and died in 1038. Bones from his right hand are entombed here. He was canonized shortly after his death. Mainly because he brought Christianity to this area. But the church is worthy of a visit in its own right.

So Gorgeous, Had to Visit Twice!. We visited the basilica on our first day in Budapest. There happened to be a wedding taking place so we couldn't see everything that we had hoped for. Because the interior was so gorgeous, we returned on another day to complete our visit. This is not to be missed!

Best View from the top. Find a sunny day, visit St. Stephen's Basilica. Take stairs go to the top of the church, you will see the best view in the city. The stairs is truly fantastic, when you close to the top, don't forget to take a picture from the top of the stairs. Really impressive.

Mass. Went for a walk around the Basilica our first afternoon in Budapest. It has spectacular paintings and statues inside. Attended latin mass on the Sunday morning and although none of us could understand it, it was still enjoyable.

Must see whilst in Budapest. This place is gorgeous inside; outside it's a busy and vibrant square and yet as soon as you're inside it is so peaceful, quiet and serene. Free to enter too, just suggest a donation of 200 HUF which is nothing (pennies in GBP). Would recommend that you pay the additional money (can't remember exactly how much but honestly it was no more than a couple of euros) to go up to the viewing platform, you can take the stairs or be lazy like me and catch the lift. So worthwhile to do this as not only is the view from the top breathtaking but you also get to see the inside of the building - including the 'fake dome'. TIP - go at sunset as I got some beautiful shots of the sun setting behind Castle Hill with the city in the foreground and if you can be bothered to stay up there for long enough you'll experience the view in dusk and when the city lights come on

The most known church. Surrounded by one of the Budapest Christmas markets, the basilica is an impressive architectural monument. The entrance is free of charge, but the access to upper terrace is not free. Didn't tried the terrace because of a very strong wind.
Amazing architecture. This basilica is one of the highlights of Pest. The church is incredible, and is a must see feature of the city.
Serene Experience. St. Stephen's Basilica is really worth a visit. It's fabulous architecture is impressive in sight while the interior is interesting with its intricate decor and serene atmosphere.
Magnificent . This is a must see my destination. Please take your time to really look around and enjoy a magnificent views outside and visit some of the small shops.

beautiful!. Really big church!!! there is an elevator to go up to the tower and the view of the city is fantastic.. don't pay to see the jewlery treasure or something...it's a waste of money..it's just a small room with a crown..

St.Stephen's Basilica. The basilica is so centrally located it would be a shame not to visit it while in Budapest.it holds a lot of the city's history.they ask for a donation of 200 forint which is so little It's maybe 80cent,if you go to see St.Matias church on the Buda side you can not enter without a ticket which would cost just under €5.I believe the interior of the basilica is far more beautiful.there are views of the the whole city from up high.during the time I was there at night an amazing light show was produced on the front of the basilica.
Beautiful church . Beautiful and quite new church, built around the turn of the last century. We went in during a service, and didn't have a guide. This might add to the experience.
Impressive place. The place looks very impressive. I would advice you to buy a ticket and go upstairs to enjoy the view of the Budapest. I liked that one can use elevator to go there.
Wow!. Most beautiful cathedral I have been in. The use of granite and marble in the design is unbelievable. A must see when in Budapest!

One of the “Must See” places in Budapest!. This Basilica is an amazing place! The feeling of 'presence" is everywhere. We were fortunate to participate in an evening mass, and it was an experience we'll never forget. Not only is the artwork fantastic, the statue of St. Stephen is radiant. You’ll not be disappointed. Flash pictures are discouraged, so use a setting that allows you to take without flash. We recommend using a monopod or tripod.

Totally worth the visit!. St. Stephen's Basilica looks great from the outside, but when you get inside you will be amazed by how many details are there, and huge it is. There is a small fee / donation to enter, and also a second fee if you want to take the stairs and get to the panorama tower on top, which was totally worth for us! You get to see the city from up there, and besides that you will see the inside part of the main cupola, I was very fascinated to see how it's made.. The stairs itself were also a fun part as they are going into a circle and the view from the above is amazing - pure art! Overall, well spent a couple of hours inside the Basilica and I would definitely recommend it to anyone!

Good views from roof. Inside the church is very pretty and is free entry.  I would recommend you buy a ticket to go on the roof as it has fantastic views. Be warned that even if there is a lift it does not go to the top. You do have to climb a lot of winding stairs which is quite physical.

Impressive.. We went through St Stephens Basilica and it is very impressive. It is a main landmark and major attraction in Budapest. We paid and climbed to the top. This is a solid climb up steps and if that is not to your liking then there is a elevator you can take. I would recommend going to the top as the views of Budapest are spectacular. A must do when in Budapest.
Stunning. Stunning beautiful views, a must in Budapest . Many steps but so worth it and such a beautiful basilica .
Stunning church. Definitely worth a visit. Grand church. A must see. Can go in for a small fee. Classical music during 10am mass on Sundays.

Beautiful church. This church is beautiful inside and out. We attended an organ concert, which was excellent, and when we came out the exterior of the church was bathed in colours from a digital light show, which was a great surprise!

Loved St Stephens Basilica. Fabulous stained glass windows and beautiful ceiling art. We were lucky to hear the beautiful organ being played on our visit. Due to the snow and rain we did not venture up onto the roof.

Pretty impressive in a world full of impressive churches.. Huge with impressive architecture together with all the usual features of a Catholic Church but plus the holy relic and a bit of history thrown in to boot.

Great part of Hungarian history. Wonderful place. An important piece of very amazing hungarian history. 2 or 3 years after
renovation of the walls. Still looks brand new😊 The real heart of the Castle Hill. Definately MUST SEE!

A beatiful landmark. I love the Basilica. A must see when in Budapest. The inside is as magnicifent as the outside.. If you have time, grab a coffee in one of the nearby cafes and marvel at its glory from a distance.
Great view. Beautiful church.You have lot of things to take picture with and with a snall fee you can see the whole budapest from the chapel!!!Great view

Walk around the church. Went into the church for a look with our tour guide & we weren't disappointed!
The church inside is impressive. We were told it can hold upto 6 thousand people for important masses.
Well worth going into to have a look.

Beautiful interior with Beautiful music. We went here to see the Organ concert on Tuesday at 8pm (all seats are good, no need to spend for the VIP if you're on a budget). The church is stunning with great acoustics, hearing the power of the organ reverberate was a great way to experience the space.

Must see . If you're in Budapest then you know this already--you simply must see this incredible church. The outside gives you renewed faith. The inside takes your breath away. Best $.50 you'll spend in Central Europe.
Amazing view. Definitely worth the visit. The inside of the Basilica is as beautiful as the outside and make sure to climb to the top of it. It has an amazing view overlooking the city of Budapest.
True Renaissance architecture. This stunning and historically significant church located in the heart of Budapest, houses the right hand of Saint Stephen I of Hungary, the first King of Hungary.
Endless stairs for a great view. One of the best places to see Budapest views. Also there is a lift but we noticed it while going down.

Grand and austere. Like most famous basilicas, the sheer size is breathtaking. It's quite dark which adds to its dreamlike quality; all subtly lit with candles. A must see. Wanted to hear one of the organ recitals but was short for time. Highly recommended.
Glitzy Church. Enjoyed walking around this vast place and looking at the Christian art. Chose not to climb to the top.

Beautiful.. I only managed to stumble upon this during a ramble through the streets. I only stopped outside for a few minutes to have a look, in that time I heard people exiting the Basilica sounding very impressed with what they had witnessed. You can enter the Basilica for free if you wish to!

Magnificent. As beautiful a church as any we have seen anywhere. It is very opulent and is well maintained. A quiet prayerful place; while open to the public they have taken care to ensure that people understand it is firstly a place of worship.
Amazing city views. Climbing to the top of the basilica gave us an incredible view of the city and a great perspective of all the buildings.

great view!. You can enter the church for free and it's beautiful on the inside as much as it is from the outside. By paying a small amount of money ( 2-3 euros, I do not remember the exact amount) you will go through many steps that will lead you to the stunning panoramic views of the church that are totally worth it. Do not miss it! There is also, right outside the church a square with shops, restaurants and cafeterias.
Just beautiful!. A beautiful Basilica, inside and outside. It's a huge building on large square, with an ornate interior. I especially loved it in the evening light.
Beautiful. Well worth a visit as it is such a beautiful church inside. Also, do climb to the top and have a birds eye view of the city.

Opulent Basilica. I could walk here from my hotel, and there is no doubt that the building and interior are stunning. As with most famous churches it is highly decorated but does offer people the chance for prayer and reflection should they wish to, or they can just look around. Recommended donation when you enter is200 forint, and candles also 200 forint if you wish to light one. it could do with more English annotations so you can read more about the Basilica, as English is only referenced in certain places. I would allow 30 min for this, and plan it whilst on route to Parliament or Soviet memorial, or Heroes' square perhaps.

impressing!. Nice monument,worth visiting it!it is free of charge.you can also go to the top see the beautiful view of the town.you can reach there by elevator or stairs,and you pay a small fee.the church is located at the very center,in a nice road with cafe and restaurants.

Very beautiful basilica. A very beautiful basilica! It even has the preserved hand of Saint Stephen, although it was impossible to see and there was a fee to light up the case holding his hand which we didn't pay for. The fee was a one euro donation and was very worth it.

Sightseeing. My boyfriend & I actually went back to St Stephens as we wanted to see the inside of the Basilica (our walking tour took us past it) very touching to see candles on the steps leading up to the entrance. Equally beautiful inside as it is out

St Stephens Basillica. Whist visiting Budapest in seemed almost rude not to visit St Stephens, Apparently one of the top 10 most photographed building in the world. Its located about 10 mins walk from "chain bridge" (pest side) and is reasonably easy to find. The Church itself is very large & impressive,(donation on the way in) I went for the panorama views from the tower myself. It cost 400 HUF (less than 1 GBP) to climb the 300+ steps of the tower (or you can catch the elevator if the stairs are an issue). Great views over the City and of the other towers. The staircase itself is also impressive. A must see whist in Budapest. enjoy

Don't forget the tower!. I've been to St. Stephen's about 10 times. Every time friends come here to see me in Budapest, it's one of the first places I take them. The entrance is a mere 200 HUF and the interior of the church is out of this world so people are always overwhelmed. Don't forget the little chapel on the left of the alter. This is where St. Stephen left his hand. He must have been in a hurry or something.It's only recently that I took my first trip to the tower. Idiotically, I tried to keep up with my 30 years younger nephew but, eventually, even I made it to the top. What a view! I'm not much for heights, so obviously I was close to dying all the time I was up there but it's worth it to crawl/hike/puke your way up there. I think it's 500 HUF and there actually is an elevator for those smarter than me.
Beaut. It's so pretty to look at outside, from all angles!! It's definitely one of the nicest buildings I've ever seen! Just lovely
Stunning. This is a gorgeous Basilica. A must visit in Budapest. Beautiful lit at night and also in daylight. Stunning inside. On the Pest side of Danube.

Simply beautiful. Very nice to see, day or night. I understand the dome is a close replica of the St Peters basilica in Vatican. Lots of space in front. Imposing structure, reminded me of St Paul's cathedral in London. You can go inside and am told the choir is a good one to listen to. Lots of restaurants close by for food cum snacks cum coffee. Highly recommended.
Beautiful. Beutiful buiding, very easy to get , a lot things to see in side. Around Basilica there is a lot of places where tourists could set down for coffee, lunch and just to enjoy seeing it.
Amazing.... Went for a visit. Arrived during mass. Acoustics were amazing. Have to say it is a beautiful place. Worth a visit.

Beautiful in the Day and Night. I would recommend you have a tour guide , like a bike tour, i learned so much history about the church, St stephens right hand is in this chruch underground you cant see it though, if you go to the top of the chruch you can get an amazing view its not free to go to the top and there are 302 steps so just make sure you are fit
Amazing view point. Very impressive architecture. Must see.Go up by the elevator or use the stairs, and enjoy one of the best view points of the city!
Beautiful. One more amazing church - be sure to go to the top (there is an elevator available). We caught an amazing sunset form the top.

Pay for everything in budapest. To pay for a church it is stupid.to pay to go up to the church to see the view i can understand.any way it was just a beautifull church.yoy have to pay 200ft it is not that it expensive but it is stupid.

Beautiful church!!!. Szent Istvan (St Stephen) is a functioning church, so PLEASE be respectful of any worshippers during your visit!!! It is also the co-cathedral of the Esztergom-Budapest diocese. Entry to the church is free but there is an opportunity to donate to help with the upkeep. St Stephen's gives beautiful concerts (mostly organ and/or choral) so check the basilica website to see what might be going on during your visit. Just down the road from the Arany Janos or Bajcsy-Zsilinszky metro stops.
Lovely Church. Very peaceful inside, some great architecture, easy to walk to from the city centre, definitely worth seeing.

Beautiful. As like most religious buildings of this era they are very similar in look and aspect. This building is very polished and contains the usual iconic items. What is different is the hand of St. Stephen displayed in a golden casket. My eye sight is not what it used to be so had to look quite hard to see it. There are lots of reference to this buildings history and town planning - diagrams portraying the building in pen and ink/lithographs.All in all - well worth an hour to walk around and read all that interests you. One thing that did stand out is how gleaming all the artifacts are - that's some cleaning and a lot of Duraglit!!! Entrance is free - always a bonus. Next time I might stay for mass, this could be an interesting experience.
Beautiful. Good place right in the center of the city.Loved it. Their is a small fee to enter the Church, but it is worth it.

Amazing view from the dome. St Stephen (Istvan) was the first Hungarian king. You could see what is believed to be his right hand displayed in the Basilica. I'd highly recommend going up to the dome's observation desk to enjoy a beautiful 360 degrees view of the city. You need to pay a fee, but it's worth it.
Beautiful . Beautiful building that you'll see from the river. Alot of detail in the building itself. You can go up to the top and get a fab view.

Lovely Church. This church was conveniently located a few blocks fro my hotel. The lovely interior is very well preserved with a light, airy interior. Do not miss the are with the royal right hand....creepy.

Beautifully captivating. I was quite overwhelmed by the splendour of the interior, spending quite some time sat on a pew to marvel at the architecture. I was fortunate to have visited towards close of day on Monday when you can pay 3000HUF to attend an organ concert after normal closing time. This brought a whole new experience to the church and was well worth the money.

Modest version of The St. Peter Basilica in Rome. A solemn place to unwind after a day long exploration in Budapest. I remembered St. Peter Basilica the moment I stepped inside the cathedral. Smaller in size but the ceiling and the altar are as beautiful as the St. Peter cathedral. Anyone who is not afraid of the height can go,up,the church tower to have a glimpse ofmthe city.

A beautiful church, not dark and intimidating like a lot of other European churches. Such a beautiful building with such amazing craftsmanship. Well worth a visit. This church feels so warm and welcoming and not intimidating like a lot of other European churches
Beautiful. Beautiful place. Both church and surrounding area should not be missed. The next time I will visit dome (missed that this time).
A piece of "home"!. Even it is a monumental building, I felt I arrived "home". I sat down, I think God was just next to me...
Visit to St. Stephen's Basilica. We went to visit during the day and ended up coming back in the evening for a one-hour concert that was simply outstanding. One of the highlights of our trip.

Beautiful . My partner and I came here on our last day in Budapest and we were not disappointed. It was beautiful on the inside. Very decorative and peaceful. I recommend you go up to the viewing tower. You get a great view of the city and its really worthwhile.
A must. IT is considered one of the top ten attractions of BUDAPEST. We suggest to visit also the top, it isnt expencive.

Simply magnificent outside and inside. 22nd October 2015. Such an impressive building, best viewes from the square in front. Inside it's all marble and gilt, and in immaculate condition. I particularly liked the pulpit which had an inner staircase. One of the most impressive cathedrals we've ever visited. There is a 200HUF "donation" to go in, and a priest sits in the entrance lobby to shame you into paying!
Grandios, monumental, amazing basilika with long standing history. It is a must if you are in Budapest.It is monumental, huge, amazing. The square in front of the basilika is also magnificent.

A most memorable and humbling tour. I happen to run into St. Stephen's Basilica by accident. I was enroute back to my hotel when i saw signs to the Basilica.The Basilica is situated close to city center. It is surrounded by stores and restaurants. The Basilica itself is open to the public. Visiting this church is a humbling experience. Viewing the religious Relic is even more astounding. Viewing the Relic requires 2 forint coins and will illuminate the Relic for a short period of time. Enough time for people to view the Relic. The Relic (the Holy Right Hand of St. Stephen) is located in the chapel just to the back of the main altar.If you visit the Basilica, do so when there are orchestra scheduled. The acoustics of this old church is wonderful.

Free with small donation. Entrance to the basilica is free, although it requests small donation at the entrance. Separate entrance for the tower which require a ticket, which can be purchased at the base near the basilica's entrance. The basilica is beautiful as expected and worth seeing.
Church near Opera House. After seeing so many churches in several weeks, this was not my favorite inside. It seemed especially dark and the interior was not as impressive.

Not just one more cathedral.. Try to approach it from the square. The façade is as beautiful as 'Notre Dame" but the entrance seems more open and inviting. Inside, like many old churches, is very impressive. Having information as to what you are seeing is very helpful.
Great. It is a very great building. The architecture is very beautiful and by night it is really good lighted.
wonderful view of the city from the dome. nice church, but the real highlight is the city landscape you get see from the roof, the treasury isn't worth the extra money.

Beautiful but not for prayers . When I entered there it was just WOW! But then I saw people taking selfies etc.It's a church, remember! Some security/stewards should be there. All in all - it's worth visiting.

Very Beautiful. We were staying near the Basilica and visited the site twice. It is definitely worth seeingbut make sure you go inside and spend some time looking around. The whole area around the Bascila is clean and beautiful with many good restaurants close by. You could easily spend half a day in the whole area. Best to go when there is not a service so you can visit right to the very back of the building. Do read about it so you will know the history and what to look for.

Interesting and Unusual Architectural Blending. St.Stephen's Basilica is a unique and interesting blending of architectural styles. You can definitely see the Ottoman Empire influence incorporated with the more expected Western European influences with wall to wall mosaics and color juxtaposed onto soaring cathedral walls. Very unusual. The Basilica has many museum chambers and corridors, so go early in the morning and allot enough time. After a quick lunch, head to the palace. This was my favorite attraction on Castle Hill.
Eye opening. Be prepared to feel emotional. It's good to sit by the shoes for a little while and remember what happened at the river bank
Perfect concernt hall. Saw a classical music performance in it. Acoustics were amazing and all the atmosphere and quality of the singers was amazing.

Beautiful basilica, climb to the top for a stunning view!. The basilica is absolutely beautiful and made us stop in our tracks during our segway tour around the city. Our lovely guide informed us that for 400HUF or 88p we could go inside to view the museum and climb 306 stairs to the balconies for a great view of the city.So we did just that and I'm glad we did! The view was amazing and we got to see the sun set whilst up there. You can literally see the whole city including parliament, chain bridge, buda castle and the danube river.The viewing gallery shuts at 16:30 so make sure you get there before then otherwise you'll be disappointed as they are very prompt!The climb is mighty but worth it and there is a lift which you can use to take you about three quarters of the way up.

A beautiful place of worship. This is a glorious building, with close connections to the Monarchy. Those kings and queens who chose to be crowned were crowned there, and a moving memorial service for the last crowned queen, Zita, was held there, in the presence of her son, Archduke Otto, who was warmly received by an enthusiastic crowd

A beautiful building. We visited here as part of our walking tour and were given some of the history by our guide. It is an impressive building and can be visited inside as well as the tower can be climbed as well. We didnt have the time this time but would love to do so next time.

A beautiful example of orthodox architecture.. This cathedral is quite different from the gothic cathedrals that you will see in France. It has a Constantinople touch that reveals the Turkish influence. It is quite remarkable and you should spend a good hour just admiring the beauty of the colors and the light coming through the " vitraux ". Another example of what makes Budapest unique.

Amazing building, inside and out.. This Basilica is very beautiful from the outside and the interior is simply stunning, don't miss it! It has a lovely, peaceful atmosphere inside.......you are asked to be silent inside, and apart from a few thoughtless people who were chattering, most observed this rule. Entrance is free but donations are encouraged.
Overwhelming in it's beauty. This magnificent basilica can not be overlooked. Even if you are not a fan of churchs you must see this one to apprecite the art work and stained glass. Beautiful

You can't miss it. It's one of the most beautiful places of worship in Eastern Europe. Very impresive and rich in decoration cathedral with one of the biggest pipe organs in Europe that happened to play when we visited. The sound was something else.
Organ Concert. Be sure to take in an evening organ concert - a magically beautiful venue, great organists, and, if you are lucky enough to be there when Kornelia Bakos is singing, unforgettable.
What a view from upstairs. It costs only 500 HUF to climb upstairs and to see beautiful Budapest from above. Definitely recommended for locals, expats and visitors

Wonderful. This religious place has his history.
Amazing ancient Basilica is located in the heart of the city Budapest.
There is service on Sunday in Basilica.
The beautiful square is always great looking.
There is always fabulous Christmas market in December.

Cheapest way to get the BEST 360 view of Budapest. Walk inside (it's free!), be amazed at the basilica's ornateness! Check out the withered hand of St. Stephen! And it's only 400 HUF to climb to the top where you get the BEST view of Budapest. Stay up there as long as you want! Do it, you will not regret it.

Very good concert. Being in March 2015 in Budapest I enjoyed the concert in the church. This time the church was full of spectator, but even then, the temperature did not raise. It was chilly.In November the same year I took some free time to visit it and to enjoy the building. It's a place you need to see. The decors and painting are beautiful.

Beautiful Place of Worship. The Basilica is very beautiful and regal. There is a sense of calmness and peace around the church. The design and architecture are superb and impressive. One of those places that you should not miss if you are visiting Budapest.

Budapest biggest basilica with a nice wiev from the dome. Very nice building, I really like the way by feet to the dome, you can see the old parts and structure of the building, if you reach the top of the dome, you can see this nice city from a different angle.

A Most Impressive Basilica. We were impressed by the front of the basilica which was in eclectic style. There was no entrance fee for the main basilica hall but a suggested donation of 200 HUF (approx. 0.60Euro) was suggested to help with the upkeep of the basilica. The interior was beautifully decorated with lots of marble and gold. To go up to the viewing platform in the dome, you had to purchase a ticket. The small price offered amazing views all over Budapest! Wonderful! A must see!

Beautiful building and a memorable concert. Attended one of the classical concerts that are frequently held here one evening during our visit. The building is stunning - particularly the interior which glistens with marble and gold mosaics - definitely well worth including on any travel itinerary. The concert was of a very high standard - popular classics performed by talented musicians/vocalists. If you're a classical music fan I'd highly recommend combining one of these concerts with your visit.

A place of peace and beauty. Easy to find in the centre of Pest, the Basillica is set in a broad pedestrianised square and entering from the main doors affords a view of the impressive front facade. It's free (unlike St. Matthias church which has a commercial ticket booth outside which feels all wrong) and it is simply stunning both in scale and grandeur. The architecture, frescos and stained glass are awe inspiring and the natural light entering through the windows really add to the atmosphere. Stunning.

Attend the High Mass. We actually visited twice. The 10 AM service is a high mass. This service includes the full choir and pipe organ. It was amazing! Non-Catholics may experience this mass by sitting in the back, where it is roped off. The mass, lasted an hour, and the priest spoke in Latin and Hungarian. The inside is beautiful with lots of marble, stained glass and gold leaf. It houses the mummified hand of St. Stephen in the church reliquary. This was a highlight of Budapest.

A must visit when in Budapest. An awe inspiring interior with beautiful decorations and gilt. The view from the top is magnificent and well wealth the small fee, plus there are two lifts making the accent and decent easy. The church has undergone restoration in the last year or so and now looks fantastic from the square. Organ recitals and other musical events are held throughout the year and well worth booking for; even if you are tone deaf like me. The acoustics are very good. When in Pest it's a must regardless of your religious belief or not
Gorgeous . Beautiful and listen for the bells, they sound for several minutes. They do ask for an entrance fee, 200 HUF, but it is worth it

Largest church in the city.. Lovely old church/basilica. The rooftop viewing platform offers one of the best panoramas in the city. It contains the mummified right hand of St Stephen, king and founder of the Hungarian state.
Amazing!!. This is a must see and a real thing of beauty! There is a small charge to go to the top of the tower, but if the weather is good I would definatly recommend this.

wonderful neo classic architecture. Great place to visit! It's free, although we were asked to pay minimum 200 ft (less than 1€) for charity before entering. It's possible to take pictures without flash, has a small chapel with the right hand of Steven, the first king of Hungary. There are concerts inside but I didn't go. I don't know if it's for free or not. A must see in Budapest.
Stunningly Beautiful. The Basilica is beautiful, one could really spend the day there. The story of St. Stephen is interesting.
Concert in the church. We love concerts in churches and ordered by internet this organ concert in the church. Beautiful music in a beautiful church that has excellent acoustics.
Magnificent interior. we visited on a Sunday morning during service. Excellent ambiance in such an awe inspiring building.
Wow. Visited St Stephens today and I'm just amazed by how beautiful it was. It was one of the nicest churches I've ever been in. Absolutely fabulous.

Majesty. Being slightly ignorant, my girlfriend and I walked along the side of the Basilica and assumed it was the front. It was only when we walked around to the front that the majesty of the basilica loomed over us. The cost to go into the church and then to go up to the top is negligible, for the sheer artistic majesty that you will experience when visiting. If you see or visit one thing in Budapest, make sure it is St Stephen’s Basilica.
When in Budapest.. Like most places of worship in big cities failing to visit St Stephens would be such a shame, you will not be disappointed.
Beautiful church. Wonderful church to look through. Doesn't take too much time. Nice central location. Enjoyed the gold leaf decor inside. Definitely something different

offers a great view. the basilica is dedicated tot he founder of Budapest, Istvan I - it's beautiful and it's easily accessible. It's not as big on the inside as it looks from the outside. You can go to the roof - we had no queues and it wasn't expensive, so a nice visit to do, especially if you are pressed for time and cannot see many attractions.

Magnificent. Another great church in central Europe. Love it inside out. Huge church with grand interiors. Did not go up the dome but apparently the view from up there is worth the climb. Not to be missed when in Budapest.
good location and building. If in Budapest it is a tourist destination. It is beautiful inside and the outside building is amazing too. There are lots of places to eat nearby so very accessible.

Go During An Organ Concert!!!. We had the option to visit the Basilica during a standard tour and boy am I glad we didn't! Instead we bought tickets to a weekly organ concert of classical organ pieces with some accompaniments. The music was great and the space is wonderful at night when there are far fewer people and the whole cathedral is lit up in its grandeur. Cheap concert too, around 25 euro for 2 people, excellent performance! And what a unique venue!

St Stephen's Basilica. St Stephens Basilica is named in honour of Stephen I(975-1038) ,Hungary's first King whose mummified right hand is housed in the church reliquary.It is the third largest church building in Hungary and the tallest building in Budapest along with the Parliament building having a total height of 96 meters (315 ft).Its architectural style is Neo-Classical and its facade has two large bell towers with the southern bell tower housing Hungary's largest bell weighing 9 tons.The Basilica is also famous for its musical concerts with the head organist of the church always considered one of the best musicians.The Basilica choir often performs in different parts of Europe and during the summer months perform every Sunday at the Basilica premises.Attended the 0830 mass with the mass rituals similar to masses held in my native India only slight differences being language and a few different religious rituals during the mass..At the end of my Central Europe tour have to say that all Churches i visited in Vienna,Bratislava,Prague,Kracow,Wadowice and now in Budapest resembled Palaces in religious art decor and murals.
The Basilica is VERY beautiful.. The 302 steps to the top above the Dome ARE worth it for the view. The Basilica is very beautiful and ornate.

Impressive architecture in Pest. Some of the best architecture in Pest is found at St Stephen's Basilica. I was in a rush was I took photos from the street, but I've hear you can also go inside to explore and catch the view. I'll be posting my photography of it on Visit50.com

Not bad, not perfect. It is a catholic church with a very average decoration on the inside... The sculptures were pretty ugly tho.. If it didn't have those gold designs it would be totally not worthy I believe. The view from the tower is pretty nice, even if its not so high as I believed it was. If it wasn't free i wouldn't recomend visiting it.

A day in Budapest. We were on a river cruise of the Danube and spent a day in Budapest,there were so many wonderful features to see including St.Stephen's Basilica we would liked to have stayed much longer.If you ever visit Budapest be sure to go to the indoor market[bazaar] also a must see.

Another Beautiful Budapest Tourist Site. Truly a beautiful church both from inside and outside. The outside is very impressive and ornate. It is seen at the same time as visiting the Fisherman's Bastion and the Palace. Again, the view of Budapest is wonderful from ground level and even better from the tower.. There are plenty of restaurants in the immediate area and in the plaza in front is a vendor selling hot drinks and a wonderful cherry pastry. Watch for pits.
Absolutely Beautiful . Inside and out -it is beautiful. Well worth a look around during the day and photos of exterior by night. Lift to the top for some amazing views

Brand new looking basilica. This beautiful basilica is named after Saint Stephen the First, the first King of Hungary. I was very surprised to hear that this building is only around one century old, i thought it was much older. That’s probably the reason it looks brand new.The interior is definitely worth a vist, it’s lavishly decorated with lots of statues, marble everywhere and very nice stained glass.There is also a small chapel where you can admire his ’incorruptible’ right hand.It’s a pity i couldn’t visit the dome since my party was to tired. Only later i heard there is also an elevator.I will be back for this since the view over the city should be breath-taking!

Better Than Notre Dame Cathedral!. The day before I visited St. Stephen's Basilica in Budapest, I was in Paris visiting Notre Dame Cathedral. I found Notre Dame Cathedral to be utterly underwhelming compared to St. Stephen's Basilica. The Basilica is HUGE and is architecturally interesting and very pleasing to the eye. I saw the Basilica during the day and also at night - it was worth spending the time there - if you have to choose one time to go, I would go at sunset or at night. I also attended an organ concert here (every Thursday night, I believe). While the performers were not amazing (very good but I was not sitting on the edge of my seat), I still thought it was worth the inexpensive ticket to attend. The area around the Basilica is very nice and safe to walk at even during late hours.
Panorama view . I would recommend panoramic view, you must climb 302 stairs and than ride with elevator, but the view is stunning. And price is low, only 500 HUF.
Amazing view. A lot of stairs but they are worth the amazing view. Made some of our favourit pictures of Budapest from the top.
Beautiful church. We stumbled across the church lit up at night and fell in love. It truly is a beautiful church and was an interesting contrast to the gothic churches we had visited.

Stunning. A reluctant walk to the top !! But rewarded with stunning views of the city. If you don't like heights this could be the challenge you need . Seriously.....so glad that I did it !! Interior of basilica beautiful and peaceful and tranquil. A Must See

concerts at the Basilica. The St. Stephen's Basilica is inherently interesting, and it is located in an area of town with many nice restaurants. The main attraction for us was an evening organ concert. The church has a first rate organ, and the musicians were also first rate..highly enjoyable.
