Worth seeing.. Easy access via a short walk from the Parliament building. Great photo ops and people watching. Lovely building!

Worth Seeing. Beautiful church that is definitely worth seeing if your are in Budapest. Photos are allowed and if you don't want to pay for a full tour, you can just walk in to take a quick look. Just walking around the outside is amazing with the level of architectural detail.

Beautiful . I visited during the day, and to my delight stumbled upon a wedding. Amazing. I returned for an evening string recital with soprano and experienced a truly awe inspiring evening with the beauty engaging all of my senses. Several times during my stay in Budapest I passed the basilica, only to notice yet another detail of the tremendous structure. On my final day I went into the tower to see the views of the city from that vantage point only to wish I had not left it to the last minute so that I could have enjoyed the experience more thoroughly.

Really Impressive!. This was one of the first churches we visited in Budapest and during our trip to Eastern Europe (17 days!) and it really set the mood for us. Beautifully restored, this is Budapest's largest and most important Christian house of worship. A gem of neoclassical architecture that took more than half a century to complete, the dome can now be scaled. However, the highlight of our visit was to see Hungary's most sacred object: the right hand of King St Stephen. I couldn't really see it that well in the box, but it looked pretty gross!

St. Stephen's Basilica . Absolutely beautiful. EVEN IF you feel like you've been cathedral'd and basilica'd to death during your European vacation, it's still worth it. There was something so calming about it; I guess it's because there wasn't a flood of people inside (like there was in Notre Dame cathedral). The maroon-colored marble columns were my favorite detail. If you're ever in Budapest, I highly recommend this beautiful place.
Lovely church . Superb decoration but lacks real history of other European churches entry by a donation which as a Catholic I found acceptable
view terrace. Visit Saint Stephen basilica but not only for the church but for the superb city views from the tower

The climb is worth it. It's a beautiful place but sadly we ran out of time to listen to a recital. We climbed to the top and the view is breathtaking. Incidentally the climb is also breathtaking - literally. Attempt the climb only if you are fit and your knees can take it.
Amazing place. We visited this during the day and it was truly amazing-we also went to a musical recital in the evening which was simply wonderful and very moving

Relic of St Stephen is inside. St. Stephen was the first king of Hungary, circa 975- 1038. His name is all over the country and supposedly a relic, as in part of his hand, is located here as well. It’s a nice church and after seeing so many churches the past week, I was becoming numb to its beauty. Don’t get me wrong, I loved it, but if you have been following me through the trip, beautiful churches are a plenty in Europe.One thing that this church had that others did not was the relic of St. Stephen, so that was worth checking out.Today was a national holiday, so most of the stores were closed. Touristy places, such as this Basilica, was open, and the public took advantage of it. We shuffled into the church, and there was a sign suggested the donation is €1,00. People dropped coins in the bucket as they entered. I didn’t quite have €2,00 so I tossed in one plus whatever coins I had left from the trip. As my Stephen said: we donated our toilet money to the church.      The Chapel in the back had his relic and it was enclosed in a case.In the back of the church was a door way leading to a small chapel. The chapel had a few pews and along the wall were stained glass windows featuring Saints that were important to Budapest, such as Margaret, who has a bridge named after her.Just past the altar is a case, and inside was the supposed relic of St. Stephen. Every few minutes the case would light up, and you can see the hand. Pictures were allowed, as long as there was no flash. If they caught you using flash, there would be a penalty charged.
Monumental church. Very nice monumental church with fascinating interior (the dome, golded decoration). Quit place in the city rush

An amazing space. Well worth going for 5pm as you get to hear the organ which is a fabulous sound in this awe inspiring space; you have to be quiet during the service but you can watch from the back. Well worth the climb to the top for the view. We paid to go into the treasury; it's tiny, but good if you're interested in catholic relics.

eat ice cream next to the Bazilika. We spent a long weekend in Budapest. The weather was just perfect because sun was shining and we could eat ice cream next to the Saint Istvan Bazilika. The city is beautiful and very peaceful! It’s very good trip for a family. Hopp and off tour good for a sight seeing. better by bus for a family!

Moving experience in music and reflection. The magestic Roman Catholic Basilica is an icon of Budapest with beauty inside and out. A refuge for peace during ones travels, but when visiting buy a ticket to an evening concert of trumpet and organ as we did to be enthralled by popular spine-thrilling sounds from two wonderful instruments.

beautiful but very rude staff. There was no tickets avaliable to purchuse to enter the basilica. When me and my mom try to enter there was a man screaming a us in hungarian. When I said sorry? he was like donation donation. that meant that you need to give a forced donation to enter the church. I mean that is strange. I am always willing to help or pay the fee but to make a forced "donation" is just ridiculous.
Magnificent. Well worth a visit, different shape to most cathedrals. We managed to go to a wonderful organ recital on a Monday night and there were also choral concerts, all at a reasonable price.
Beautiful. Take pictures the inside is well worth the time for a tour and visit. Come outside a look across the river to Pest from the palace side, Buda

A very beautiful church. This church was a massive and interesting both inside and out. We climbed to the top and was spectacular to be above the dome. The views from the top of the church were amazing. I can't comment on the religious aspect because I am not Catholic but it if you want a great view of Budapest this is the place to go.

Perfect place to watch the sunset.. I was here with my girlfriend last week and it was a very romantic evening because after we climbed the stairs which was quite a lot, we spend like 2 hours up at the top of the Basilica. We watched the sunset, which was gorgeous! Totally worth it! Entrance fee 400 HUF. Closes at 17:30.
beautiful outside. We didn't have time to go inside but the outside was beautiful and picturesque. We had lunch outside in view of the basilica. There are a lot of options around.

Beautiful and Peaceful. You must make this top of your sightseeing list for Budapest. It is a most beautiful experience and so quiet and peaceful inside. Would love to have had time to hear a concert in there, as have been told, the acoustics are fantastic inside. Budapest, you are very fortunate to have this in your country. Beautiful!

Beautiful to the core. I visited this place by walking from Jewish Quarter to Inner city. This place is located in a big square and is surrounded by many touristic places like restaurants bars etc. One can walk from the riverside to this place also. Interior decor is splendid and gives great photo ops. Located on pest side of the city.

Gracious Church in center of Budapest. This was fairly high on my to-see list when I was in Budapest in Oct 2009, as it turned out, there was a choral concert there during my long weekend and I was able to get tickets. The church is fantastic and has great acoustics. Fairly accessible by metro.

Beautiful re-built church.... The view of Budapest from the church is worth the trip. It is easy to get too from Pest by walking or taking the number 25 bus. The tile roof on the church is new and beautiful. Inside it is just as pretty.

NOT THAT HISTORIC. Although a massive church in the center of Pest, St. Stephen's is a relatively recent building only completed in 1905. It has elements of neo-classical, baroque and other elements. It is in an upscale retail pedestrian part of Budapest -- surrounded by shops, restaurants, cafes and not far from other truly significant and interesting attractions.
Definitely worth seeing. The importance of St. Stephen to Hungary and the beauty of the Basilica is more than enough reasons to visit this site.

The richly decorated interior is something to behold..... It is well worth spending the time to go in to this beautiful cathedral. The interior decoration is stunning and there are lots of artifacts to see.
Awesome, definitely stop inside. Amazing church, very lovely inside. You can take the elevator up top for great view of Budapest. Enjoy a drink at a cafe on the plaza outside.

Just beautiful. Should bot miss this amazing Basilica. The architecture, the hand made details be it from the outside or the inside; they are all breath taking. Well worth your time & highly recommended
Beautiful Cathedral. Again ideal to visit on a dreary day. A wonderful old church with many artefacts to look at. All walking distance of other attractions, if you like historical buildngs.

Magnificent, do not miss. In June 2015 by the time our tour got to Budapest we were tired of visiting churches. Our guide insisted on taking us in and we were surprised to see how beautiful it was. In October 2015 I was again in abudapest after a month of traveling and visiting churches. I made a point to go inside again. Some of us went back at night for a violin concert inside the church, that was an amazing , moving experience. As an Architect I was particularly pleased to see how a building can evoke such sentiments in a person.
Great view!. Beautiful basilica with a healthy climb up the stairs to the cupola for a breathtaking view of Budapest.
Place to pray & listen fo music at night!. Great place to pray! Wonderful peace of architecture! Great acoustic & memorable concerts in the evening! Music of Mozart & Strauss!
Beautiful architecture. We were able to go in just before a Sunday service, it was stunning, the acoustics and architecture were amazing

Concert in the basilica. Attended a string ensemble concert here, which was excellent (once you get used to the reverb in the building). It's an amazing setting for a concert, and the cheapest seats afforded an excellent view, so no need to pay the highest prices! Definitely recommend for a cultural evening

Lovely : inside and outside. Must visit especially from inside if you are in Budapest. You can walk from there to the Parliament and see the building architecture on the way which are quite well maintained. Very touristy area. You can go up to the dome of the Basilica to get a view of Budapest. See the attached photo for the inside look... really beautiful.
Beautiful. No trip to BudPest would be complete without a visit to the Basiliica. Try go go in the day and visit at night. Stunning

Amazing historical landmark. Fascinating history attached to this Basilica, especially the 'right hand of Stephen ' story. Beautiful architecture and so well preserved and treasured by the Hungarian people. Well worth a visit, looks greta at night too with all the lights etc

Amazing building. We went in the evening, it is donation request (suggested at 200 huf (50p)) we wasn't in there long and didn't have a tour or anything but was able to see everything we needed. Listened to the organ which was worth listening too. Looks beautiful in the evening when lit up

Incredible. This place is simply beautiful. My friends and I had a wander round inside and took in the amazing arcitecture and we then decided to pay 500 HUF to walk to the top of the tower. The sights at the top were great and we really enjoyed our time spent at St. Stephens Basilica. I would suggest you pay it a visit when in Budapest, you will not be disappointed!
Rich. Our visit was on a sunny day, so the glass stained windows looked very beautiful. Very special was the little chapel with the mummified relic hand.The church is very impressive from the outside

Beautiful and historic. Building has great architectural relevance and is located in a square so you can take plenty of photos from many different angles. The area is filled with lots of restaurants and trinket shops you could easily spend several hours here and you probably should, the area is also very safe. I didn't get a chance to go inside but I hear it just as amazing inside and they offer tours as well.
Must visit. Dont miss st stephens hand which is in a small side room to the left. Get the lift up to the top of the copula. 400 ft to go up and walk around. Good views of budapest from the top.

A beautiful church. Such a stunning church, the moment you walk in your brain is chasing your eyes to take it all in. We were lucky enough to be visiting when an all male choir was singing in the church. It was just amazing.

At least the architecture was different. I've seen enough cathedrals in my trips to say this may be the last. However the architecture was different than most I've seen and the interior is incredible especially when you compare the massive and rich interior with the number of parishioners that have been provided seating. Another showplace for the ruling class.
Beautiful panoramic view of the entire city. Want to see the whole of Budapest from a 360 degree perspective? Pay 500 florints and head to the top of the tower at St Stephen ' Basilica. Stunning!
I loved visiting this cathedrial. St. Stephen's is truly impressive. I happened upon a concert while visiting. What a delightful treat! It's just beautiful!
Beautiful!. St. Stephens is really pretty. Worth the euro donation. It has a souvenir stand at the entrance which is mildly annoying. The mosaics are stunning.

Such a beautiful church. Often quite crowded, no fee but You can donate some sum what ever You think is appropriate. There are also many other churches in town, some of them even more beautiful. Take a walk and give them a chance too!

Amazing !!!!!!. Wow what an impressive building we paid to go to top and the views from the viewing tower were amazing well worth the small fee. The decor inside needs to be seen to be believed as well amazing a truly must see.

Grand Basilica. Beautiful mosaics cover the dome,relic of St Stephen displayed in the Holy Right Hand Chapel, Gyula Benczur paintings of St Stephen and others. Check to see if there are any organ concerts during your visit

Beautiful and traditional. A beautiful structure and well worth a night time photo when illuminated. The inside is fairly traditional, in the style of other European cathedrals but there are some special interesting features, such as the reliquary containing St Stephen's hand which is in the side chapel. A 1 euro donation is recommended in entering which seems very fair.
Drop in off the street. Incense heavy, Baroque style basilica,like a smaller version of London St Paul's Cathedral ( dome is 300 ft rather than London 365 ft )

Another beautiful Cathedral. Only a small donation is needed to access the cathedral. It is important to read the history of the Church which is on the wall in several rooms and near the exit especially about st Stephen's hand.We have visited dozens of churches throughout Europe and as this is in the centre of the City it is easy to get to.I particularly like taking photos of the stained glass windows in all the churches we visit.
Stunning colored local marbles and stone. This artistic Baroque building is laid out in a Greek cross shape. The story of Stephen and why he is their patron saint makes this church a stand-out.
Epic view from the top. A must do in Budapest is to go all the way to the top of the Basilica and check out the awesome views of the city. Great photo opportunities.
nice view. Beautiful BudapestBeautiful Basilika in the centre of BudapestI am surely come backYo have to see Budapest

Stunning Interior & Nice Panorama View. The entrance to the church is free. The interior of the church is so fascinating and beautiful. Definitely a place that worth to visit. I went up to the church tower with an entrance fee around 1.20 euro. There are quite a number of stairs you will have to climb up to a certain height. Make sure you are fit to do so and in order to go to the top to have a look at the panorama view of the city, you can choose to go up by stairs or lift.

360 degree view of Pest side from the tower. Entry to basilica is free but to the top of the tower its charged.You should visit the top of the tower people having problem climbing can access the lift. The whole basilica structure is really breathtaking. From inside its very peaceful and beautiful interiors. there are 3 different architectural styles used for basilica and each has its own unique features.

Georgeous Bascilica. A cute and cheeky guide we had on a city tour said that after a while, one says "ABC....another bloody church!" however, in this case, it's certainly worth at least a walk through to admire the incredible baroque architecture, alters and statues. While one may walk to the top of the dome, time did not permit it on this trip (thank goodness, I think!). The surrounding area/plaza outside the church is colorful and energetic, lots of cafes and an opportunity to do some great people watching. Go, it's a must do while in Budapest!

Stunning. We visited on a Sunday morning whilst there was a service on and whilst you are unable to explore the whole building whilst this is happening the building is properly lit during this time so the gold gilding looks amazing at this time. We revisited the folio wing day to properly explore but we're glad we had also been the day before to experience the atmosphere with the organ playing and candles lit- if possible visit twice to get the two different experiences- my favourite place in Budapest.

Beautiful!. I studied this Basilica way back when I was in college and everything we studied about it came right back to me. This is an absolutely beautiful building and is a must see when in Budapest. It will not take you long to walk through it.
Impressive Church. We stayed very near the Basilica and the square within the Basilica. Its a beautiful church both during the day and at night. Its worth while visiting it at either time.

Beautiful Architecture!. There are some beautiful Churches in Europe, but this one is one of my favorites. It's just magnificent. I also love the area in which is it located. Your going to pass by it if your downtown. I would stop in for a look. The don't make them like this in Canada.

Very elaborate. I'm not a huge fan of over elaborate churches, but, if you are you will find this well worth a visit/ the dome is spectacular. Tour buses stop nearby but an easy walk along the river to access it.
Amazing. Beautiful Basilica and its free!! You must go, it will just take you 10 min. There a square aoutside and lots of cafes outside.
Panoramic View. The best of the stephen's basicilica is the dome in the dome, you can see it while accessing the rooftop to see the panoramic view.

Beautiful, with a few different Payment Options. There is not a lot to say about the Basilica that others have not said. It is beautiful which I tend to expect from the grand churches of Europe. And as someone who prefers visiting a church which has a tourist inclination (i.e. they ask for fees), the two hundred forint recommended donation provides a welcome into the main church.Beyond this, there are a few more payment options. You can see St. Stephen's hand, which I did not do. You can also take one of the elevators, near the ticket booth, to the treasury. Something that I don't think is particularly worth it, as it shows a small set of the standard monstrances, candle holders, sceptres and robes that you see in so many other locations. Although it does give a bit of history and was a place where it seemed like I escaped the crowd.The elevator, on the opposite site of the entrance, will take you to the floor where you can start climbing to the panorama. Not a bad climb, with landings where it is fairly simple to pass someone and normally good head room. Nice 360 view when you reach the top, but made somewhat less memorable by the other options in Budapest where you can get, what I think are, better views.
Make time for St. Stephen's Basilica. Even if you're not too interested in visiting churches, make time for St. Stephen's Basilica. Immense & wonderfully decorated, it's worth a visit.

Worth to visit. The St Stephen's Basilica is an amaizing place where you can see not only famous incorruptible" right hand of St Stephen (reliquary) but also great architecute, and rich adornments. Ticket only 200HUF (ca 4 euro)
St. Stephen. It is in the heart of Budapest. Very close to the parliament, a nice church. You should have a look if u are near.
Beautiful!. A stunning building inside and out. Would definitely recommend going up to the observation deck, although be warned it's a lot of steps up!
Moving mass. I decided to attend mass at 6pm, rather than merely touring the church and it was a moving experience! The church is beautiful.

Very nice ! . Although we didn't pay the fee since we thought it was a little much for a church. Anywho the outside of the church is quite stunning. It was a busy day when we went so the long lines also made us skip going up. Overall worth a visit whether you go up to the top or not.
Just go!. The view from the tower of the city is amazing! Easy to get to its right in the city. Well worth paying to go up to the tower! Beautiful at night too.
Interetsing place. Visited on our recent trip to Budapest. Very interesting. went to a concert here last week which was OK but a bit middle of the road and with a singer who was a bit superannuated
Beautiful Budapest. Beautiful town! We loved to be there. People were kind and helpful and English is the language wich is spooken bij many people.
huge. You should pay the fee to visit the cupola because you can get a nice view from up there. The architecture is just beautiful.

This is a beautiful church in the heart of Pest. Everywhere you look there are beautiful ceilings, altars and statues. The workmanship simply astounds you. There is so much rich history here and it is worth spending time here.
Great. Lovely place to walk around as the local area is really nice. It's even better inside. The decor is amazing and well worth seeing.
Wonderful view. Take the stairs up to the basilica tower, and you will have a breathtaking view of the city of Budapest for almost no money.
Must see the Hand. Quite beautiful Basilica. A strange box where the alleged hand of St. Stephen lies encrusted with jewels. St. Stephen was named saint because he was the liberator of Hungary.

A glorious place to visit. This is a very splendid place, but I would not believe the hideous 60s façade which has been erected on one side of the square in front of the basilica. It is shameful, as the rest of the square is so beautiful! Well worth a visit.
Glorious. This Basilica is worth a visit - it has glorious stained glass windows and. It was good to see the original architect's plans.

Amazed. Well worth a visit and good to get the history behind the building, we did the free walking tour that leaves from the front of the Grand Opera house daily at 10 am and 2 pm, this gives you good basic information on what to see and why. It was because of that information that we returned to the cathedral and it was very beautiful

Impressive church. It was a really beautiful and impressive basilica. You pay 200 HUF enterance - altough they say it's a voluntary contribute, I couldn't pass the gentleman in between the moneybox and the entrancedoor without paying - but it turns out to be really worth it. Don't skip the left side from the altar, here you can see the famous mummified hand of St. Sephen,
Beautiful resortation. Really enjoyed seeing this lovely old cathedral. The restoration work was very good. The best part was climbing up to the very top!

Outstanding views from the top. St Stephens Basilica is breathtaking! The architecture both inside and out is beautiful. However, we paid to go into the treasury and we're not too impressed, but the view from the top of the Basilica was amazing!

Reach for the sky..... by lift if you find the stairs difficult. Beautiful church in the heart of Pest. Highly ornate and decorated inside. There is a small chapel at the rear which has a small reliquary which houses the right hand of the first king of Hungary. You can access the dome area of the church and gain some wonderful views across the city. If stairs are difficult, two separate lifts take you almost to the top so t's worth a visit. The church is free to visit but there is a small charge for visiting the dome.

Must-see place. This basilica is reputed to be one of the ten most photographed buildings in the world. When you see the interior you will instantly see why, a breath-taking marvel of red marble and gold leaf. Try to attend one of the evening concerts there as the acoustics are fantastic and the setting a marvel.
Wonderful Church. We enjoyed the Beautiful Church and its surroundings. The number of side chapels and their beauty was amazing!
Beautiful Church. It is worth the stop to visit this beautiful church. The stained glass windows are amazing as well as the history of the church. For a quick stop you won't regret it.
Great basilica. The most beautiful church in the city. Magnificent artworks in it. More information for the artworks needed.It is a big show of marbels.

Beautiful Working Cathedral. Historic Catholic Cathedrals are a real passion. What impressed me most about this St. Stephen's was that it was not over the top and gaudy. In so many ways it seemed like large parish church. I loved how the altars were decorated and some of the statues really touched me. They would not be considered great art but possessed a certain charm for they bestowed the subjects with an air of humanity.

Surprisingly impressive late nineteenth century building. I had hoped to see a building with more history. It is a very attractive building of it's type and if relics are your thing you won't want to miss St Stephen's right hand which you can illuminate for a mere 200HUF. The organ is worth hearing.

A must see. Beautiful church. We were lucky enough to to have a tour in Budapest which included St. Stephen's church. A couple of things to notice is the picture of Christ on the cross to the left of the alter. The knees are painted to always face you no matter where you stand. If you exit the church on the right it leads to a small chapel. At the back of the chapel is St. Stephan's HAND! In a case where you need to insert a coin for a light to go on in order to see the hand. It is his right hand to show the power he had in Budapest. It is kind of creepy...

Great views and beautiful decor. You can climb to the top of the dome for 500 forint (about £1.20). There are a lot of stairs, for those that don't fancy walking up there is a lift! The views from the top are great and you can see all the famous monuments of Budapest from it.Inside the church the decor is simply breathtaking. To get inside you need only make a small donation (recommended 200 forint). A very cheap, easy and worthwhile place to visit.

CHURCH IN THE HEART OF PEST. This church is in the centre of Budapest on the Pest side just opposite to the Metro station. The architecture and the painting insde the Basilica is very nice and beautiful

This is the Cathedral of Budapest. Although not as large as many Cathedrals you shouldn't miss a visit. We did in fact attend a short musical recital there but it was a program of short pieces of classical music and I would have preferred only one or two pieces.
Worth a quick vist. The Basilica is a stunning building especially inside. Worth having enough 200HUF coins for donations and if you want to see their relic of St. Stephen.

Wonderful building.. Beautiful church inside and out. We paid for the panoramic view from the top which was worth the price. Also paid for the treasury which was cheap not particularly exiting or extensive.

Very Beautiful Building. Inside this place is wonderful. The architecture inside is very beautiful, there is an entrance fee but it's not very much and well worth it. The atmosphere is wonderful too and so much more spiritual than St Matthais by comparison. They also hold concerts inside, so if you get the chance go for it.

Beautiful Basilica with great city views. This Basilica is quite large with lovely pastel colors and uniquely patterned walls. The Dome is very intricate and colorful and kept very quiet inside (as it should be) so you can sit for awhile and reflect. If you want a great view of the city (different vantage point than from Buda Hill) going up to the Tower is worth it (around 100 HUF). The Treasury is very small but well done. I would only suggest paying for this (also around 100 HUF) if you are interested in the significance of the Basilica's well-known priest.
Big. Huge basilica. Nothing I haven't seen before but still very impressive. Local concerts played there are supposed to be a real treat, but have listened to one myself.

Must see in Budapest. Majestic basilica full of history, beautiful artwork,glorious glass and carvings. Many relics of numerous saints. Outside, spectacular views of Pest especially Parlament house across the Danube and many cruising boats lined up on the river. Many special photo ops. Almost across the street is a great little pastry shop w a wonderful cafeteria style bistro that features local cuisine at a good price. Hint, convert your euro/dollars to florints(this applies to all of Budapest as some take euros but kill you on the conversion and still give you local change)

Stunning place! Brilliant concerts!. The Basilica is a stunning building. I attended two classical music concerts there - the quality of both was very good but the Friday one was outstanding. Two organists, two organs, trumpeter and soprano. To hear the pipe organ played well was a privilege.

So grand. We toured the Basilica with a Viking tour guide. The architecture inside and out is so detailed without a plain wall is sight. I thought we'd be churched out after seeing so many outstanding buildings but this one stands out. It is a must see.
Marble marvel. The interior of this church is incredible with marble decorating the entire area. It was a pleasure to visit.
A definite must-see!. Amazing architecture. Interesting history. We did have to pay 1 euro each to go into the building despite being told they we could enter for free if attending mass.

Wow a beautiful cathedral. We visited this amazing place. It is great they charge to keep the place top shape. See the 1000 year old hand of the Saint was a real exciting moment for us. This must see and pay to go in all the beauty inside
Beautiful Church. The church is beautiful inside and out. To me the most interesting part is the story & display of the holy right hand of St. Stephen. Another must see when visiting the country.
Beautiful. Worth a visit only for 20 mins. Pretty square and lovely lit up at night. Wonderful dome. Expensive to eat and drink in area as always in tourist spots.
Very beautiful. The St. Stephen's Basilica is very beautiful . It's stay in the Pest side. It's a place you must go.

Beautiful interiors. St Stephen’s Basilica, the largest church in Budapest, is a beautiful building. The church is the current custodian of the holy relic, the mummified right hand of St Stephen. The relic is confronting but it does have an interesting history of its own. During our visit we were treated to a spine tingling impromptu acappella performance.

Impressive. No one can mistake the mystique, majesty and grandeur of this cathedral. Even from any religious viewpoint it deserves your respect. It can house surprisingly small group of peole. It is well protected by cctv.

Try booking for an organ recital. This splendid but not gaudy Basilica is worth visiting and we thoroughly enjoyed an Organ Concert where the magnificent pipe organ was played by a world-class organist. Hearing the sublime music surrounded by frescoes of celestial angels does lift the spirit even on the wettest of days in Budapest

Breathtaking architecture and an ode to excess . I visited this basilica last week on a rainy cold day, I must say I had seen the cupola several times from afar, I had hired a guide to take me around Budapest on Sunday and her description of the basilica and the efforts to build it, and the meaning behind it, made me add it to the list of places I wanted to see. It sits on its own square and it so big and so disproportionately tall among the surrounded buildings that it makes you stop in awe and approach it, touch it, feel small for a moment next to it and imagine the thousands, millions of souls that have gone through its walls. Aside from having fantastical proportions, it is beautifully symmetrical and although tall as a skyscraper, it sits serene, self-assured, as a testimony of what human beings will do for their faith. It has intricately decorated ironwork fences, exquisite wood and stone carvings and breathtaking ceilings...and all of this is on the outside. When you enter, the mix of marble colors, gold leaf, polished shiny brass, gold relics and harmonious lead stained glass giant window panels reminds of St. Peter's at the Vatican. This building is much much smaller, but the carefully designed columns and the proportion of height vs width at the side naves provokes exactly what it was meant to provoke when built: awe, you're in the presence of the Divine, sacred soil, this is intended to make you feel small, powerless and well...poor. Sarcasm aside and being catholic myself, these days I go to church when feeling compelled, when traveling, I don't visit every church there is and don't feel guilty if I didn't make it, I don't believe in a God that I see inside a building, I see HimHer everywhere. Nevertheless I think this is the first review I post on a church and to me, this one is worth visiting. The cavernous inside with its side cupolas flanking the central dome is exquisitely preserved and it smells clean inside, it was also warmer than the outside, I think it's a great rainy or cold day activity, or a way to close a day of walking n shopping. The piazza radiates walking promenades from it, with nice restaurants and some shops, it is primarily a touristy area, clean, well preserved and cared for, and you see an international crowd walking or lunching. It all feels very European and quaint. I went in by myself, I didn't do a guided tour, but I saw a big one being given in Spanish, and it wasn't "esta es la cúpula central, este es San Esteban...gracias por venir..." It was detailed and technical, the guide was mixing her knowledge of the architectural details while explaining who St Stephen is. As a feat of daring engineering, considering the difficulties to transport marble chunks and work them into solid columns, and nothing this tall existed thereabouts, it is a testament that when there's a will there's a way. Just like visiting mosques, temples and pagodas in Asia when I travel there, I go into evoking buildings like this to see, to feel, to smell and to learn.

try to go for a concert. This was a beautiful setting and we bought tickets at the Basilica to listen to an organ concert. The concert was beautiful. I don't think there would be a bad seat, but we bought tickets very reasonably for the front block of seats and got there early to get front row

Better from the outside. I didn't like the interior of this place but then again, entrance fee is only 200 HUF so... It's more impressing from the outside, nice views from the sunny square. Other than that, the church on Buda Hill has FAR more atmosphere and beauty.
Beautiful and huge building. Beautiful and peaceful despite the numbers of people moving around. Well worth a visit. Amazing to wonder how a building of this size was created.

A must. This is a must on any trip to Budapest.
It's suggested donation of 200fts is a bargain for how stunning it is inside.
If you want to see the hand of St Stephen I suggest waiting for someone to pay for it to be illuminated as it happens very regularly so there is often no need to pay yourself.
A CHURCH. Is a typical cathedral church with all of the characteristics.Located in the center of the city.There is also a big square in front of this with a lot restaurants and cafeterias.

Amazing building. Again only viewed from the outside but another building not to be missed when exploring Budapest, located on the Pest side of the Danube, easy access and quite near to the Parliament building. I understand the inside is great and there were people walking around the top when we were there so I can only imagine another great view across the city.

Seems backwards. I've never been to a Basilica where Christ isn't at the main altar. Instead he is outside over the main doors as you enter the building. Steven, Hungary's very revered first king is placed inside at the main alter. Beautiful building nevertheless.

See an organ concert here!. Excellent concerts at this church. Sound is out of this world. You dont need a 1st class ticket. get the middle ticket.1st class sits on hard benches-2nd and third class sit on chairs. The chairs are better.
Beautiful to See. We got to see inside the Basilica and walked up to the top of the duomo glad we had time to do this you get a good view
Very classy church. St Stephens is a beautiful church. It is very tastefully decorated without being over the top as many European churches are.
BeautiFul church. Went on a tour here, nice tour for photo taking, spectacular views inside, walked around the town afterwards, take cash with you for the cathedral gift shop and surrounding shops

A must see basilica in Budapest. Certainly one of the most beautiful basilica located on a large place. Many interesting statues and explaination inside the church. Beautiful lamp post around with delicate design.
Great view. The building is incredible but not for the unfit as it is alot of steps! But well worth it when you get to the top- amazing !!
Beautiful Church. We visited by day and then we attended an organ recital with trumpet and mezzo soprano on a Friday night. That is quite a magical experience.

Enjoyed the climb. WE rally enjoyed the climb up to the top of the tower. Reasonably priced entrance fee but you need to be fit and you get dizzy going up the spiral staircase and down again.The Basilica itself is outstanding even to go and sit and watch and have some quiet time in such beautiful surroundings.

Lovely but could prepare better for tourist. This is a beautiful place but you have to pay to go to the top and again to go inside the cathedral. Then I went looking for toilets which were outside on the street out of order, by the time I got back they wanted more money at this point I left and did not see everything but I would have liked to

Lovely place to relax. It was raining heavily when we went in. Only 200ft donation at the door.There was a Mass taking place and we sat at the back and watched.Lovely little chapel at the back.Well worth a visit.
Beautiful but too opulent. I didn't like that after entrance paid there were far too many collection boxes around the building. With all the poverty it was far too opulent & made me sad.
Excellent views. Well worth the walk up the windy stairs, the views over the city are amazing. There is a lift for those less able to walk

Great for Photographers, and to see great views of budapest. We were lucky enough that from our flat we rented was directly in front of the Basilica and we however left it as a last thing before we go back home. Inside the Great Basilica the grandeur of it makes you feel overwhelmed. and when you climb up the stairs or by lift (pay a ticket) you will be even more overwhelmed when you see the panorama. Photographers here will enjoy themselves

Nice church in the center Budapest. The view of this church is amazing if you see it from the Zrinyi Utca (street). Cafes and restaurants are along this pretty street . It is nice to walk along this street from the Chain bridge to the basilica.
nice church. since in town center wander over there-- nothing dramatic--esp if you have seen the churches of Italy or france----

Top spot for photography and superb. This church is free to enter (well, 200 florint suggestion donation) and it's magnificient inside. The structure, the size of this basilique and the art inside is interesting. For the hand of St-Stephen, you have to pay to lit it up and I thought it was a bit sad, but well... not a big deal.You have to pay 700 Florint to go at the top of the basilique, but it's really worth it. The view on top is incredible, you can see all of the city!It should be on your itinerary!

Magnificent church and celebration of Hungary. This is a 19C building that is both a church and a celebration of Hungary's proud, but sad history. The internal building is magnificently proportioned and richly decorated. We went to the High Mass at 10 a.m. on Sunday. The choir sang beautifully. We did not understand the sermon in Hungarian, but since it was an archbishop giving it, we sat up straight! Perhaps one should appreciate a church by using it for its intended purpose.I am told that the view from the roof is the best in the City, but we did not make it up there.It was a lovely experience to be in such a monument at such time

Beautiful any time of day. One of my favorite buildings in Budapest. It was close to our hotel so we would go by it several times a day. Every time you thought that the light during a certain time of day on it was your favorite, you would go by it a different time and think that time was and so on.Make sure to go up the stairs and get a view of Budapest from above. Probably the best view you can get on the Pest side.

A BUIG Cathedral. We wanted to attend Mass here in the evening but, after walking all day, we decided that the old seats and kneelers were a bit much for us. Maybe sometime in the morning would be better.

Beautiful Church!. This church is simply breathtaking. The exterior is very picturesque with Liberty Square directly in front of it. The interior is beautiful! You can attend mass if you understand the language, but even if you don't, there's something quite rustic about the experience.

Beautiful Church!. This church is simply beautiful. The interior is quite breathtaking. The exterior of the church is very picturesque with a huge open space in front (Liberty Square). The Ferris wheel is nearby as well as many restaurants and shops.

Can't build this today. Sometimes you just can't believe the things you see. You look at the ceilings and wonder how they got up there to paint and draw and make sculptures this has to be the biggest and most decorated church that I have ever been in. Well worth spending some time just looking at the statutes, walls, floors, columns, and pictures.

302 steps to the top. Went here on a rainy day, just a short walk from our Sofitel hotel. Beautiful interior. Small fee to walk to the top of the dome and get a great panoramic view of the city. Unfortunately foul weather interfered with the picture taking. On a clear day it would be well worth the climb.

Beautiful. Visited as part of an Imperial City tour organised by Rail Discoveries of York. You are expected to make a contribution to go in – understand 200 Forint is required. This is a beautiful church and our Tour Guide was most informative. The church does get full and the walk through to the mummified hand of St Stephens is uneven, narrow and gets very crowded.
Beautiful!!. We came across the Basilica by accident and thankful that we did. What a beautiful building. The interior is magnificent and breathtaking.

A massive and richly decorated Basilica. This church is the tallest building in the city, in fact no other building in Budapest is allowed to exceed the height of thia imposing Basilica. Must go inside to view the rich ornaments adorning the interiors. View of the surrounding area from the top of the building is breathtaking!

Central Budapest. St Stephen's is the central gathering place in Budapest. Besides the Basilica (worth a visit) there are many, many cafes , restaurants and bars immediately adjacent. It is a very popular spot at night for gelatos, a drink or just to stroll around. The Basilica, when lit up at night, is gorgeous. There are many good restaurants in the area.

Lovely church. A beautiful church in a great location. We went to a concert there, it was a lovely setting.
Nearby is a small shop where they serve great ice cream and coffee at reasonable prices.
Great view from the dome. Well worth a visit for the decoration of the inside alone. The visit to the dome costs 500 HUF (just over a £1) . There are 2 lifts if you cannot manage the stairs.

Impressive. The basilica is very impressive .The surroundings are well kept.
The different group tours are well organised.
Steps from Aria!. Historic Basilica, a marvel of construction from prior centuries, with beautiful stained glass. A must see!

Amaing Church!!!. Marble walls and columns, beautiful frescoes covering all the ceilings.
They do pay the money(a few dollars) to go up into the tower. You get amazing views of the city. There is a lift to take you most of the way. We walked up the steps and it was tiring! Not for those afraid of heights.
gerat view. It is realy beautiful! You should pass on top for view over Budapest, it is really great and city looks fantastic from there.

Great for evening concert. We went one evening for the organ concert. It was only 10 euros and lasted an hour. The basilica was a lovely venue for the music, which that evening consisted of the organist and a soprano. I was told that the church is not usually lit during the day so seeing it at night (well-lit) was a treat.

Beautiful Interior. In conrast to St Matthias Cathedral which has a very impressive exterior, St Stephen's exterior is rather plan. ALso in contrast to the dark, dreary interior of St Mathhias, St Stepehn's is brightly lit a covered in gilded decor. It is quite beaurtiful.
Beautiful church. Beautiful church inside - worth a visit. Stunning colours and magnificent ceiling. Wasn't sure about paying money to see St Stephens mummified hand!!

Great views. We paid to go to the top of the dome and was able to walk around outside to get a lovely panoramic view of the city. Make sure you talk the lift if you value your legs...it's a long way up!!!!!. We went in the basilica but you were very restricted where you could go and it was very crowded..i email literally shoulder to shoulder.

Huge and impressive this is nice to see. The outside is impressive enough but the inside is beautiful. It's probably best viewed on a. Tour but we didn't bother, the squire outside is very attractive too.
Must see in Budapest. Really nice church. The building looks Roman inspired, lots of coloured glass work. Fantastic views of the paint work on the ceiling.
Stunning!. Beautiful catholic church, stunning architecture. Entrance is 200 HUF donation. Highly recommend going up the tower for a spectacular view of Budapest.

You can't miss it!!!. This attraction is on the Pest side of the city and is 100% one of the sights you have to see when visiting Budapest. This church is overwhelmingly beautiful and make sure to have your camera at the ready!!

St Stephens Basilica . My husband and I spent a lot of time here. The architecture was incredible. We sat in the basilica for quite a while and every where you looked you would see something that was truly beautiful.
overwhelmingly beautiful church. We arrived on Sunday morning just as mass was ending. Frankencense and myrrh were in their as the organ filled the space with ethereal music. Very inspiring. W

Lovely big basilica. Lovely church. Enjoyed listening to the organ music. Didn't agree with the Lonely Planet that the interior was dark and gloomy. The whole thing with St. Stephen's hand struck me as a little macabre, but hey, if that's important here culturally, that's interesting and and of itself.
Beautiful church. An enormous church with a fantastic story. Lovely to see such a well-kept interior. Admission fee is a 200 HUF donation.
Beautiful church. Beautiful church. Nice setting, outstanding interior. We did not go up in the tower but I am sure the views are outstanding

Iconic and Great views. Crowded but still worth seeing. They really try to get money out of you at every step though - pay to get in, pay to light the box with the relics in it, pay to go up the tower. But it is beautiful! Only take the stairs if you are feeling very fit and do not have small children - they are very narrow and there are over 300 of them! The panoramic view from the top is great.
Must See. Amazing architecture, very easily accessible. A must see if in Budapest, even if very brief! Very close to all the other touristy attractions too.

Stunning!. You have not seen as much gold leaf anywhere! An absolutely stunning example of Catholic basilica, and we have done many in our travels. It is interesting too that it was built in the 19th century, so illustrating the richness and wealth of the Austro Hungarian empire. A must see.

St. Stephen's Basilica. It took three architects to complete the 96 meter tall Basilica in Central Pest. An excellent visit for persons of all faiths. Ask about the significance of the 96 meters when you visit
Exquisite building. We went to the Thursday night organ recital and for me the star of the show was the building. Ornate, rich, opulent and magnificent.
Magnifique!. a day in Budapest is not finalised if you don't go for a cup of hot chocolate near this amazing Cathedral by night :)
Breathing, must see.. A very impressive structure from the outside. It was closed when I visited, so I was unable to go inside. But I was told a small donation is needed for admission.

If possible, take the walk up to the dome for incredible views. Incredible, you cannot miss this Basilica. I was amazed at how beautiful the alter is. And there are often concerts at night. Very convenient to Andrassy and the river.

Not really very old but great views from tower. A neoclassical styled cathedral, it's only about 150 years old and located on the Pest side. Climb the stairs or take the small elevator (either way there's a fee) to enjoy 360 degree views of Budapest.If you want to see an older, more beautiful cathedral with a spectacular view and a more interesting history, visit St Matthias on the Buda side. This was the favorite for coronations and weddings church of Austrian-Hungarian Empire. It is recently restored and stunningly beautiful inside and out!

"Breathtaking, stunning, beautiful". It's a very impressive structure from the outside, absolutely breathtaking on the inside. A small donation for admission, jaw dropping beauty & so peaceful, close to chain bridge, 15 min walk from parliment, truely a must see.
Must see. One of the 10 best attractions in ..Pest.. Easy use the tran to get there. Small entrance fee requested Euro one. Sit down and look up. Very impressive. Recommended MeuterMedia
Interesting . Basilica is well worth a visit. Situated 10 mons from the parliament building and only a few pounds to get in

most beautiful basilica. I think this is the most beautiful basilica of the capital .Inside and out for sure. It’s in the city centre, in the heart of Budapest. You can take a walk around the church, or just sit on the stairs for a while and watch the different people of the busy city from all over the world. The building and its sorroundings looks gorgeous in the evenings with the lights on. If you into music there are also concerts in the Basilica and there are several restaurants and bars in the near. The little square in front of it is usually quite crowded specially around Christmas time with all of the hot wine and honey cakes booths hmm it smells so good. Really love that place.
massive. It is a massive structure . words cannot describe unless visited its enormous beauty and decoration.
Don't miss the relic.. A small donation is requested, though not mandatory. Inside is a typical Church. The building is not that old, but viewing the relic is fun.

Get a great view of Budapest from the dome level of St Stephens Basilica!. St Stephens Basilicia is very pretty, but pay the extra money to take the elevator to the top level of the dome. The view is stunning!
worth the visit. a must visit on the tourist route, the mummified hand is interesting, someone has to pay to see it lit up

Sunday morning special. Sunday morning service but they let us in to see the beautiful painted ceilings and all the other beautiful things inside. Lovely singing.Lots of dogs outside for the monthly dog walk and I think blessing.
A great Basilica in a great City. One of the most beautiful Churches in Europe. I believe this houses the largest organ in Europe. Very special place and worth the trip to see.

Beauty!. Beautiful day or night... Great building . Great plaza... Great places to have driink around it and admire its stunning size and design. ..Beautiful when it's lit up and the bells explode... and this from a guy who is no church fan.
Beautiful and historical. The place is a sight to see. It's beautiful and must be seen to belive it. The inside is a must if you can.

Very Ornate. I read on-line that there was a charge for entry but when we arrived it seems that the charge is only if you want to go up the tower to the look out point. Beautiful and very ornate inside, well worth looking around.

Super impressive structure. The basilica is a beautiful piece of architecture and that's emphasized further because one can see the entire structure in its entirety standing in the square. I was a bit awestruck when I came face to face with the basilica. The interiors too are beautiful (like I mentioned in my review of St. Matthias Church - we were pleasantly surprised by the internal beauty of the churches in this part of the world). Read the story about the basilica's construction written near the exit door. One can take an elevator up to the tower. They have musical organ concerts Thursday and Fridays.
Stunning. Well worth a visit for the beauty of the dome roof and the majesty of the place. The views from the roof more than justify the effort to climb the stairs

The largest church in Budapest. St. Stephen’s Basilica is the largest church in Budapest, Originally designed in neo-classical style looks really amazing, the dome is 96 meters high, the exact same height as the Budapest Parliament Building. In fact current building regulations stipulate that no other structure in Budapest can be taller than 96 meters:) For beautiful, panoramic views of Budapest walk up the stairs (364 steps) trust me the views are really impressive, There's no cost to enter the church, but there is a nominal fee of HUF 500 to go up to the observation deck, to be honest with you no one controls and i went up for free, For sure one of the best places to see in Budapest
Nice place . Very nice to see and visit. Architektur is nice. Adds some culture to your visit. not seen the inside..........

Free Admission with Suggested Donation. Admission is free for this iconic basilica but a suggested 200 HUF is requested. In addition there is a 500 HUF charge to climb the Cupola. Saint Stephen's housed the Mummified Right Hand of Saint Stephen in a jeweled glass box which lies just to the left of the main a;tar. Insert 100 HUF and the jeweled box lights up making the hand clearly visible and the jeweled box glow. Many pilgrims come to the basilica to honor St. Stephen's and see the hand. The hand is paraded around the basilica on August 2oth which is Saint Stephen's day.Guided tours are conducted Mon-Fri (10-15) Adults 1,100 HUF or 1,600 HUF with cupola climb, chapel and treasury, Foreign language guided tours are conducted, Adults 1,400 HUF and 2,000 HUF for cupola climb, chapel and treasury. The basilica is open to tourists Mon-Fri (1-17), Sat (9-13) and Sunday (13-17) with free admission. There are periodic organ concerts conducted by Kolos Kovats. world recognized organist. The basilica is located in district V with access on M3 (Blue Line). There are a lot of nice cafes and shops around the basilica to sit and watch the crowds. Bring a low light camera or your pictures will come out blurry.

Magnificent, central & easy to enter.. A magnificent church maintained in perfect condition. There's always something going on in front of the basilica. The cost to enter is one gold coin, which can be a little as the equivalent of 5 cents.
Place of Calm in a Busy City. Fabulously impressive building, even though there was a steady flow of visitors whilst we were there, it still remained a calm and peaceful place to visit.
Concerts in the Basilica. Beautiful building and set in a lovely square. Close to restaurants and wine bars. On some Sunday evenings they hold classical music concerts inside.

Stunning Basilica. Wonderful architecture both inside and out. Worth visiting. No entrance fee - but a priest seems to be on guard at the entrance staring everyone down before they enter. Didn't see anyone dare to avoid paying something into the "contributions" box!! The most beautiful and awe-inspiring interior. Of course visiting the box in St Jacobs Chapel to view St Stephens hand is a bit weird...

Breath-taking. This is a spectacular building, it really has to be seen to be believed. Having seen St Pauls Cathedral in London, the Duomo in Milan and others, I thought I knew what to expect. This is unfathomably majestic. A word of warning though; the roof is not for the faint hearted!
Wow! . The architecture ( inside and outside) of St. Stephen's Basilica is one of a kind. This site is one of the most important in Budapest and it is a must see!

Great views over the city. We climbed to the viewing platform in the late afternoon and were very impressed with the views of surrounding Pest and across the Danube to Buda where the sun was setting over the hills beyond. At 500 HUF (just over £1) this is a very affordable way to get a great view of the city and you get fit climbing the hundreds of steps to the top. As well as the outside view of the surrounding city you get a chance to see the two separate domes that form the roof of the Basilica - very impressive.
good one to see. there are many churches to see in budapest. this is a good one. if u have time and love to see churches, u should see it. easy to find out and nice out look.

Fantastic view. Only 500 HUF to get to the top and it even has a lift. There are some art installations in between floors to keep you entertained and the views across the city are unbeatable. Pay the 200HUF suggested donation to go into the basilica and see the right hand of St Stephen. We particularly enjoyed putting the extra 200HUF coin in the box to light up the hand!! Bit morbid but kinda cool to see. It is also an incredibly beautiful building inside and out so for the money really is a must see!!

Spiritual Heart of Budapest. A beautiful expression of Romantic religious architecture, in fact one of the best we've seen in Europe. Visit the chapel housing the relic of St Istvan's hand - a national treasure.

Classical Serenity. if you have a choice, visit the Mathias Church across the river in Buda--the polychrome interior there is the polar opposite of this serene, classical interior. It's a matter of taste, really, and this basilica may well be a fine example of its style, but I responded to the vivacity of the other and this one left me cold. Both serve as venues for concerts, so it depends on what you want to look at as you listen.
Excellent meeting point. If you go to budapest everyone knows this place. A real downtown. The square in front of the basilica is full of cafés, restaurants, bars.

Perfect. The best area. You can visit it just paying alittle amount. And it is huge and amazing. And there are lots of local and touristic places around. It is one of the best living place in pest at night and day.
Budapest is Awesome. Be warned, there are hundreds of stairs, but the trip up to the top is worth it. Try not to have too many beers before the spiral stairs
Majestic church. This is one of the most beautiful churches I've ever visited. Full of art and history in a very opulent surrounding. Don't forget to climb the tower (there are elevators).
Put it on your list. The initial appearance draws you to visit this amazing church there maybe better churches in Europe but the initial look is amazing and the interior is beautiful
Beautiful Cathedral. This is a MUST when travelling to Budapest! The cathedral is beautiful, and you can go to the top and look out over all of Pest.

Breathtaking cathedral, a must see if you visit Budapest. The wonderful red marble and ornate decorations are amazing. They ask for a suggested small donation at the entrance. We got tickets for an organ (and flute and singing) concert one evening, worth doing if you like that sort of thing and is not expensive.

Architecturally magnificent with a relic of St Stephen, and a centre for musical events inside and in the square outside. Built between 1851 and 1905 in baroque style, and restored after it was badly damaged in the Second World War, the best way to approach the Basilica is to come up from the chain bridge to the open square, Szent Istvan Ter, from which its facade rises up to the heavens. The main doors have carvings of the heads of the 12 apostles and there are fine painting incorporated in the architecture of the magnificent and richly decorated interior. There is a small exhibition giving information on the history of its construction. The Basilica's main treasure is the mummified forearm of St Stephen, only brought here in 1945 and held in a beautiful miniature representation of a gothic church.This is one of the "must-sees" in Budapest. It also holds organ concerts and the square outside is very much part of the life of Budapest, being used for events and musical performances.

Don't miss to see St Stepehn's right mummified hand kept in a small chappel. Do visit before 17:00 , as this closed early. Also don't miss to view St Stepehn's right mummified hand. To view it properly keep aside 2 50 cent coins , which will switch on light for few minutes.
Climb the tower. We climbed the tower to find wonderful views over Pest. Despite my fear of heights it was a very enjoyable and worthwhile thing to do.
Amazing. Have been in many similar places and this is by far the most jaw dropping beautiful inside and out. Went to a concert at night there and the acoustics were amazing. A can't miss place to see

Amazing. This was absolutely amazing, the architecture is fantastic and we went up to the top and the views were incredible - even better than from fishermans bastion. In the treasury, not much was written in English but it was still interesting and the decor inside was just breath-taking. One of the best buildings I have ever visited.
Grand. Beautiful building and a very grand interior. You don't need long to look around but it's worth pausing to take it all in. €1 suggested donation at entry.

Great view of Budapest from the top. Definitely worth going up the tower, tickets to get up cost less than £2. You get up via combination of stairs and lift. Great views from the top, we saw a beautiful sunset on a very clear day

From the top the best!. From outside inside it's worth for a visit cause it's a beautiful building. You can go upstairs for the view point, it coast around 700 HUF. The view is worth a visit. You see the urban style and life from the top.
One of the most beautiful. The cathedral is huge in dimensions, and one of the most beautiful that I saw. It's very nice at day from outside and even more at night, with all the lights on it.

The Hand of the King. St. Stephen's Basilica is a Roman Catholic basilica named in honour of Stephen, the first King of Hungary (c 975–1038), whose right hand, now a holy relic, is housed in the reliquary. It is a beautiful building, and the transition from the bustling square and surrounding city into the sombre, dimly lit and ornate building is an interesting experience.It allows you to take in the exquisite details of the building, its stain glass windows and the many nooks and crannies of the structure. It is well worth the visit.

Not to be missed. A lovelyl church both inside and out. A small donation is requested on entry but it is well worth it and a lot more. There is a small chapel with a relic of one of St. Stephen's hands in a reliquary. For 200 HUF the hand can be illuminated; we didn't bother.

ST. STEPHEN'S BASILICA. St. Stephens Basilica is beautiful, visited a while back. Lovely alter, high dome, statues and stained glass windows. We waited for the Chapel of the Holy Right Hand to open so we could se it. I believe Holy Left Hand is in a church in Dubrovnik Croatia.

One of the most ornate and best decorated religious buildings we have visited. The interior of the Basilica is a feast for the eyes - such ornate decoration in a very clean and tidy maintained state.There is an opportunity to climb to the top of the dome, but as it was an overcast day, we felt that the effort would not be rewarded with good views.

St Stephens Basilica. Beautiful architecture close to the Parliament Buildings and in the centre of Pest. Well worth a visit with stained glass windows, art and sculptures. Large mall in front is great for a rest and to decide where next to go.

Worth a visit. This is an imposing basilica with a sprawling square in front. If it impresses you from the outside, the interior is even more impressive. Besides a day time visit, we went there at night for an organ concert and music by some well known Hungarian artists. The place provided the best acoustics and it was a good experience
Largest church? Maybe. But only in volume.. 19 century marvel. Rather average in European context. Expected much more than this "copy" style. Disappointed.

Beautiful basilica. A very impressive interior awaits at this wonderful old basilica. The stained glass windows are fantastic as are the several alters inside but the ceilings are the best feature in here. They are covered with gold leaf and paintings - beautiful. Take a look you will be impressed.
Worth a visit . We were lucky to visit the basilica when a wedding took place, but in any case it was a beautiful building from both the inside and the outside.

Stunning Basilica. This is one of the most beautiful churches we have seen in our many travels. Marble covers every surface. The organ is very impressive. Don't miss the side chapel with the relic of St. Stephens hand. There is a tower with a beautiful view of the city. Steeped in history.
Beautiful church. The basilique is well worth a visit. The interior is impressive. But also take the stairs or an elevator up to have a wide view of the city 60 meters above it.

great interior, don't go to a string concert!. This is a truly stunning building, built in the latter part of the 19th Century. We went to a string concert there, which proved to be not a good idea, especially since the prices started at 6500 Huf (about £16): the acoustics of the building really aren't suitable to hold such an event. The long reverberation time meant that individual notes tended to be subsumed in a mush, and the bass, because of the sound characteristics, seemed to be playing almost at a different tempo. The seating was uncomfortable, long cushions each covering several (creaky) stand chairs. So visit the building, just don't buy the tickets.If you have a head for heights, you can go to the lantern for spectacular views.

Beautiful Basilica!.... Walking through Budapest was so nice... loong distance between every historical attraction, but still nice to go by foot and visit all these places, St. Stephen's Basilica is one of them...

Important Basilica. It's a pretty typical neo-everything Budapest building. It's really dark inside even on a sunny day. There are interesting side things though. One is the picture of the Black Madonna. Unfortunately this thought provoking painting is in a vestibule in the back. The other interesting item is the hand of St. Istvan in a relic case. Even if you wait for a tour group to put in money to light it up, it's still just a withered stump. An important one none-the-less, I am told ;)

Exceptional Basilica Rich with Local History. This was our very first sight our very first day in Budapest and it was as good as anything you will see in Italy outside of the Vatican! St. Stephen was originally King Stephen who converted the Magyar people to Christianity. When the Danube flooded, the people prayed and miraculously the water receded. They marked the very spot and built the Basilica there. Be sure to see portrait of the Black Madonna in the back. Come back for one of their weekly pipe organ concerts. Gorgeous sound!
A must see. Very beautiful church with stunning adornments. Well worth a visit no matter what your religion or no religion

Simply breath-taking. This is a stunningly beautiful building. We went up to the panorama level (up two lifts and a few stairs) to see the sights from the top and it is well worth the admission fee (I believe 500 HUF per person at time of writing). We also explored the insides of the building which was also well worth seeing.
Architecturally Beautiful. St. Stephens Basilica is an outstandingly well made building that is a prominent part of the skyline in Budapest.

Great view point at the top. The bazilika is very beautiful and worth to visit inside, but whats better is the view from the top. For few houdrends of forints you can go up and have a beautiful view of the city
Stunning. Don't miss this well worth a visit quite stunning on the inside. Free to get in and right in the middle of the town.
Beautiful. Beautiful both inside and out. Definitely worth visiting. A service was being held when we went in and although visitors were welcome, I still felt I was intruding.

Beautiful Temple. A beautiful landmark in the heart of Budapest, outside is a very impotent building as soon as you get inside you can feel the peace and spiritual atmosphere, if you are lucky you can enjoy a concert with a incredible acoustic. You will learn in this temple a lot about the history of the city and how it change later the name, don't forget to go at the back of the temple and admire the exhibition and learn more about the Holy relics. If you have extra time you can go up to the tower and enjoy the view of the city, Budapest is a beautiful city

On everyone's list visiting Budapest, and rightly so.. To enter the church you are asked for a 200 HUF donation. The church is rather large, and beautiful on the inside (paintings, ornate walls, altar, dome).The hand of Hungary's first king Stephen is being kept here. It's lit up when someone (or you) puts a coin in.However, the magic was climbing the dome (500 HUF). It's quite a long staircase (302 steps), but the views over Budapest are superb. For part of the climb there is an elevator. During our visit a military band was playing at the square in front of the church and added to the experience.
Amazing. One of the most beautiful basilicas I've seen in my life. I was really impressed by the vastness and richness inside and the wonderful facade.

Not only the church but also the area around it.. Church itself wasn;t very impressive for me, but still its worth to see it. It's very dark inside (at least it was when I was there) and its hard to take any pictures. The most imporant (?) part of the church with the relic of the saint was closed during my visit...In the area around the church you can find a lot of nice bars and restaurants.
Bastion of the christian religion.. If you never visited Rome and the Vatican this basilica could be a preview of the magnificanec in store for the visitors.
They ask for 1 euro donation. Lovely church not far from the Danube. Impressive spire. Lovely inside. Quite glitzy and ornate. In the old town centre not far from the state opera building

Historic beautiful main church in Budapest. Beautiful historic church rebuilt after bombing. Very impressive interior and altar. A memorial service was taking place when we were there, which added to the religious ambiance.

Beautiful Basilica. We attended a musical performance at the basilica one evening. Very impressive: organ music and beautiful singing in an inspiring environment. The church is located near some excellent restaurants; so we were able to have a superb meal about a block away and then walk to the performance.

Breathtaking view over Budapest. Be sure to climb on top of the Dom. The effort is rewarded by a breathtaking view over Budapest.For less mobile people elevators are available. The Cathedral's exhibitions should also be visited. It is worth it!

Beautiful on the outside and on the inside!. One of the most beautiful basilicas I have seen. The rooftop alone is incredible!!! It is very big and the inside is very special. You have to pay to go inside but it is worthy of the cost.Outside there is an amazing view to the Danube and the "Pest" side of the city.

Must see historical landmark. You will not have the opportunity to see this collection of architectural styles ANYWHERE else in the world. This is truly a must see on your visit to Budapest. The surrounding neighborhood Area 1 is rich with culture and it all begins here. Please go inside and bring your camera. The views from this vantage point are breathtaking. Enjoy the past and what it brings to our future.

It's a must when you visit Budapest. It's a must when you visit Budapest. You can take the free tour walk, and they will tell you the history and show you many things there. This was one of the places they showed me. And I

Must see in Budapest . Look - I'm not a huge fan of wandering in to churches in foreign lands. However, as churches go this one is particularly ornate and is very pleasant to wander around.The hand of Stephen - Hungary's first king - which is mummified and was taken from his coffin is on display. It's not lit up, and two minutes of lighting will set you back 200forint (50 pence). I put my coin in and a vast crowd of people - around 25 - rushed over to see it illuminated. Quite why they were all skimping on the coinage is beyond me.Anyway, entrance is 200 forint - so you can see why the light is a little on the pricey side. Further you can climb or get the elevator up to the dome rooftop for a further 500forint. The entrance to the tour is hidden, and I am sure many people miss it and don't bother to climb. That's a shame as is well worth it, and offers brilliant views over the city.Be warned - if you're climbing it is 299 steps so hard work. You do have the option of doing half and getting the lift for the other. I say it's 299 steps, a sign said it was 302. I counted and got to 299. I don't think I would have been three steps out so I am sticking to my number.
Fantastic church. Massive church. Very beautiful. Well maintained. Very low cost to enter maybe 200 ft pp. Worth an hour of your time.
St. Stephen's Basilica. It is one of the most beautiful Basilic I've ever been. If you are catholic and go to church every Sunday, you will enjoy if you go there.

Amazing church, plenty of steps to walk up!. We visited this church in Sept 2015, the square in front of it offer fantastic views of the church, and the church itself (especially on a night time) look beautiful in its current location. You do have to pay to go up the stairs (and there are plenty of them!) to get to the lookout tower right at the top of the church, but once up there it offers outstanding views across all of Pest and out towards the Buda side also. Selfie's are a must!If you do struggle with walking there is a lift/elevator that takes you so far up, with a secondary one available.Definitely recommended if you visit Budapest.

Well worth a visit. Beautiful, beautiful, beautiful. A fantastic interior which is outstandingly and seriously good. The decorative walls and ceilings are simply gorgeous. We did an organ concert, and their organ is a fabulous sound.
Must see in Budapest.. Old and beautiful church,a real symbol of Budapest,and a real witness in history.Magnificent-inside and outside,really beautiful pictures and statues,great organ.
St Stephen's at night. A must to be seen at night from one of the adjacent restaurants or bars. Great to explore during the day!
beautiful Basilica. We stopped in for visit it was amazing I don't think a trip to Budapest would be complete without a look at the Basilica, it is beautiful inside and out.

A must to visit. A must to visit in Budapest...We tried to buy tickets to go on the rooftop of the basilica.. but the surprise is they don't accept Euros only HUF.. so we didnt go up.. we had only euros :(
Magnificent. A magnificent place to visit, amazing internal painting, a very calm place to visit during your stay in Budapest
Weird things in there!!. The basilica was very pretty both inside and out but they had some weird things in there- St. Stephens severed hand and also emperor charles' rib. Worth a visit though!!

Absolutely stunning . Really beautiful church and only asks for a small donation. Really ornate inside and a definite must-see in Budapest. A lot of history happened here and there are concerts in the evening.

Stunning interior, good organ concert. Went here for an organ concert. The inside is very lavish with gold and marble everywhere. A bit over the top but stunning nethertheless. Has the wow factor. Organ concert on Thursday good but didn't use main organ and that would have sounded amazing. I think Friday they do use it. Recommend check before booking. Organ they do use still fills the basilica. Flute player and soloist brilliant. Worth going.

Beautiful church. Beautiful church on a large square in the middle of Pest. Definitely worth the visit. If the weather is warm look for the ice cream shop on the edge of the square. They do flower shaped cones which are attractive and tasty.
Outstanding. This building is amazing. Around the area is teeming with cafés and restaurants and likewise tourists. It is a spectacular building from all sides and you cannot miss this

Well worth venturing inside - beautiful place with a surprise item to view. The most beautiful building set in a large clean square with cafes nearby. We had a coffee and then went in. The dome and decorations seen from inside are beautiful. free entrance but a charge to go up to the top. We spent ages wandering through the aisles and admiring the beauty of the place before reaching the main attraction (?) of St. Stephen's right hand. Yes, really! If you are curious, go and see for yourselves...
Stunning for weddings. Very elaborate church, but much of it was closed off to us due to a wedding, which was fun to see. The wedding party did not mind us taking photos of them.
A must see..,.. I was fortune to have live across the street from this beautiful landmark..If you can go up to the walkway the view is unbelievable.
Go up!. Visit the Dome. The view is worth it.The Bazilika is very beautiful and it's a mandatory visit while in Budapest.
