Church is nice, don't like that you have to pay. The church is very nice inside and out. The right hand of St Stephen is quite eery which is good as it makes it a bit different from your usual church. I didn't like the fact that you had to make a 'donation' it felt as if you were forced to pay money and that should not be the case when entering a church. Its not the actual cost of going in but the principle behind it. If people want to enter the church they should not be forced into paying. It should be entirely up to the individual to make a donation. That said when you do pay to do the panoramic platform the view is fantastic over all of Budapest!
Stunning Church. What a beautiful Church! I believe it was 200 HUF to enter but it was well worth it to see the incredible details of the Church. Enjoy your visit!

One of the top attractions in Budapest (don't forget to go to the top). Visit it and go to the top where you can have a bird's-eye view of the city.It has a relish and it's the biggest church in Budapest.
The best view in Budapest. I haven't been in the basilica itself, but git up to the top of it's tower and it was awesome. Just 300 steps and 2000 huf stand between you and the best view in Budapest.

Climb to the top!. The inside is beautiful, but the climb to the top showcases Budapest in a way that can't be beat. Bring your camera! And don't let the sour faced tickets ladies deter you! The square in front of the basilica is equally enthralling. The bell chimes on the hour (quarter hour possibly?) and the lights are night are beautiful. Plenty of places to 'hang' and people watch!

Excellent. A must see. Day & night. This area is a hub of activity. The basilica is one not to be missed. It is free to enter and magnificent inside although there is a charge if you want to take the lifts up to the top of the tower ( in busy times this may take a while as the lifts only accommodate 6 and then 4 people at a time). Take note, you can climb up the tower but you can also get two lifts if you are feeling exhausted after walking up several others. The lifts are not very well publicised so look out for them. Otherwise it's another keep fit session. Once up in the tower the views are beautiful.In front of the basilica at night the whole area is buzzing with restaurants & street food. There is a good atmosphere & this is well worth a visit. It seems popular with locals and tourists alike and feels safe and welcoming.

Gorgeous Basilica, Central Location. We visited St Stephens at the end of a long day sightseeing in Budapest. Although we did not make it to the tower, just seeing the intricate detail of the outside structure and the beautiful interior is worth the trip. St Stephens is up there with all the famous cathedrals in Europe.
Nice place !. The most well known church in Budapest ! It is verynice to watch it .. We went on time that the towers were closed .. but it was nice that we went !!

A visit of worth. Few minutes after meeting's ending it was the first place which I visited in Budapest. According with time, it was thirty pas six p.m., for the interiors only. We have in Our country(Italy) many churches built in many different styles but S.Stephen abbey I think could compete with the best of ours. It was a love at first eye which I felt as soon as I acrossed the main entrance. The visit last not more than half hour because they close down at seven p.m. and I regretted to end it soon. Please do not do my mistake, believe me, S.Stephen's deserves all your attention whatever could be your religion or creed.

Beautiful views!. St. Stephen's is so beautiful! Easy to locate. Make sure you go up to the very top. It is a steep climb but so worth it. It was 500 forints to climb to the top. Compared to 8 Eu it costs to ride the Ferris Wheel it was a bargain and you have 360 degree views of the city and are actually up HIGHER than the Ferris Wheel! Make sure you go into the cathedral to look around, this will be a 200 forint donation but well worth it. We went on a weekday during August and there were no crowds. Gorgeous!

Great views from the tower. Paid the 500ft to journey up the tower and take in the views. Having seen what this side looks like from Buda Castle and Gellert Hill, this complemented that with views the other way. Worth a look.

Head for the roof!. This is a must-see for any visit to Budapest, not least because entry is by donation. The interior is very fine but the highlight for us was going to the top of the dome (HUF500). The lift was out of service so we went all the way to the top by steps, this gave a view of the dome within a dome roof and of course great views across Budapest from the circular balcony. There was even a free WiFi service up there!

Have lunch or dinner in this area. Beautiful church and great area. I suggest having dinner in this area. It is a great place to people watch, great choice of resturant all with beautiful views of old architecture.

Grand architecture in the center of Budapest.. Well worth a visit, this church is not that big but is very grand in its appearance. Lots of iconography if you like that sort of thing. Very ornate and impressive alter.

Gorgeous!. St. Stephen`s is one of the most beautiful cathedrals in Europe. There is a good selection of concerts at St. St. Stephen`s. It as a wonxerful venue. Besides the music, the lighting is terrific

A Don't miss in Budapest and I'm not a duomo fan. One of the most beautiful basilicas I have ever seen. It is astonishingly gorgeous. The area around this church is very worth visiting as well. It is 5 minute walk from the amazing Parliament building too.

Magnificent Cathedral. Magnificent Cathedral, great architecture, fantastic interior. Can visit the balcony around the dome and get good views of the city, but lifts very busy at peak times and there are a LOT of stairs if you try by foot !
Worth a visit. it is beautiful inside and out. 500 HUFs (£1.25) to get a lift to the top for a spectacular view and well worth it
Impressive monument . This building is impressive with its size and its shape. Worth a visit and having a look from every possible angle.
Don't miss this site!. Magnificent interior. Also relic of St. Stephen (right hand) in one of the chapels. Organ concert is a must hear and see event.

Quality Basilica. We went into this basilica and were instantly taken by the brown marble featured throughout it really impresses one and paints a very formidable quality picture in your mind, everything about this basilica just cries out quality again and again

A Grand Church. This Basilica is not only very large, it is very beautiful inside, its not too overdone (as far as Roman Catholic churches go) but it's definitely worth a visit. Its easy to find, its close to the centre, at Deak Square and towers so high in the sky, its hard to miss. Attending a service is great or attending one of their Organ Concerts (brochures freely available at the door) is certainly very special. There are 8 pm concerts and for a lower price, also 5 pm. The organ music was so powerful, the acoustics so excellent, it felt like the walls were vibrating and for a few moments I thought the organ would explode ! Loved it.
Beautiful and FREE. Located in city center with good metro station nearby. Really lovely. Don't miss the small chapel in the left front of church.

Grand gilded basilica. Impressive basilica with the very unusual feature of a statue of St. Stephen on the main altar where you would normally expect to see a statue of Jesus Christ. Our guide told us that permission was given by the Pope for that to be done, apparently because St. Stephen had been so successful in converting great numbers of people to Christianity.

A beautiful church , lovely organ music and a great panoramic view. First of all , this church is definitely very impressive and is designed in an interesting and beautiful way. To my surprise, I was lucky enough to hear the Basilica's organ player play while visiting this sight, and it has added a lot to my visit. I also recommend buying a ticket and climbing the 302 stairs to see the panoramic view on top of the church. (It is also possible to go upstairs by taking a lift).

Breathtakingly beautiful building, breathtakingly beautiful views!. Take your time to really appreciate the depth of beauty in this magnificent basilica. Don't just take a selfie outside- actually LOOK at the beautiful design and decorative features of the facade of this iconic cathedral. Go inside and really look at the amazing features of statuary, paintings etc and the superb dome. Take the time to climb the 312, not 302, steps to the viewing platform on the dome(there is lift if you need it!) for amazing views over this amazing city. Like all great experiences, this basilica demands time, not a few selfies and a cursory glance!
Ornate. The Hungarians like to deck out their cathedrals and this is no exception. There are organ concerts performed here and the one we saw was spectacular. I highly recommend.

A truly lovely basilica. Having seen many, many churches, cathedrals and basilicas in Europe over the years, this is one worth viewing. However, I would also suggest paying the extra couple of euro and taking the stairs (or lift) and going to the top where you see both the top of the inner dome (wood) and there is a balcony going around quite a bit of the basilica and you have a fantastic view of the Danube and Budapest.

Beautiful! Make sure you check out the interior. Walked passed the basilica a couple of times, took photos and all that. One day we walked passed and saw people going into the church and we followed suit. The interior is incredible, the craftsmanship alone is just wonderful. Shortly after we took the elevator to the top of the church and were greeted by a stunning view at the top. Once you're up there, take your time and enjoy view (it's also a good way to orientate yourself around the city as it puts things into perspective)
Excellent concert. A very good baroque concert although £20 a head is a lot. You are paying for the setting and I would imagine the overheads are very high asmaanythingelse.
Nice. Second tallest building on this side after the Parliament, third biggest church in Hungary, has the biggest bell... the list goes on and on.
Climb to the top!. Climb to the top, the views are stunning!! It's relatively cheap, a good workout for the legs and you can get some amazing pictures for the holiday album!

racisct. Well we payed the money to get in and I payed the money to light a candle in my fathers honor, then perhaps 3 minutes later, some official vigilante told my husband to take his hat off or to leave the building. My husband is an observant Sikh, who wears a turban, which is as different from a hat as a "religious habit" from a bath robe. This man actually followed us out of the church to make sure we left. I tried to reason with him he, no joke, did this.. ¯\_(ツ)_/¯ .Great metaphor for 77% of Hungary - Great people.

A beautiful church. It seems we had visited a lot of churches in Europe that were somehow connected to our Gate1 tour. This one was another beautiful church in a lovely location. I suggest if you have the opportunity to go inside, do it.

Great music in a great attraction. Large and very interesting basilica. Off the cuff organ recitals really good - a real surprise! Make sure you view St Stephen's mummified forearm in the room behind the altar.

The most beautiful church I saw in Budapest. Definitely worth a visit and there is no entrance fee. This church rivaled the churches in Italy. Ever wall is covered wiith marble , statues of gold. Magnificent.
Great view from outside!. Great view from the outside, beautiful facade and pavement. Word of warning; you can't wear shorts inside so come prepared.
A must to visit - don't miss. The most beautiful church ever inside and out. Really a must to visit. Saw St Stephen's right hand and so enjoyed the history about the church and the city.

Rivals Italy. There are few cathedrals outside of Italy that rival the best of Italian Christianity. Malta has one (as good as the Vatican). This might be another. Wonderful. Uplifting and magnificent. And it's FREE!
A Fine Church. A beautiful building both inside and out. And you can access the dome for great views over the city.

Magnificent . Visited briefly on a walking tour and was impressed so decided to return and was not disappointed. The architecture is outstanding and so to I s the interior. There is a piece of St. Stephens arm inside. Well worth a visit if you like cathedrals
Beautiful. . It's a beautiful building outside in. The detail on the walls is beyond perfect. Absolutely loved it. It's worth giving it at least 30 minutes to appreciate.

Magnificent Basilica and square. While visiting this basilica you can find many attractions like street food or folk dances in the square in front of the basilica. The interior is astonishing and there is no entrance fee.
Rest, Relax and Contemplate the Eternal. A beautiful and peaceful oasis of tranquillity. Take the time to sit back and chill out in truly spectacular surroundings. You won't be disappointed.
Short visit. Have to be honest, we only caught this briefly during a tour on the Hop on, Hop off bus. We then walked the area the next day walking up the road leading to it. Very impressive.

Church with Organ concerts. Beautiful church on the Pest side of town. Check out the organ concert schedule. The organ music is beautiful and the cost is very reasonable. Beautifully restored in every way.

Another cathedral yes, but what a cathedral!. By this time on my Danube cruise I have seen several cathedrals and they get a little tedious, but this is impressive just by its size and the beautiful dome. The exterior setting is well-designed with a large open square allowing for a view from a distance appropriate to the scale of the building.

A sacred space in Budapest. This church is so ornate and sacred. There are many side chapel rooms. In one room is a display of St. Stephen which is very unique. Saying prayers here and taking pictures of the ceiling made for a beautiful afternoon.
St Stephen's. A magnificent church - great architecture and interior. It also has organ concerts. The relic of King Stephen's right hand is in its chapel inside.

If you can only see one church....THIS IS THE ONE. This basilica ranks in the top 5 in the entire world, not just Europe.Take your time and visit every alcove and side altar. Just sit and enjoy the absolute splendor of this incredible church.....and yes, pray for whatever your priority intentions may be.

Visit to St. Stephen's Basilica. Our visit to St. Stephen's Basilica was just amazing. It was a truly beautiful / inspiring church structure that has been kept in very good shape. The can be times in the summer where the crowds are very large, so early is better.

Beautiful. Fantastic building, also very large so although tour groups were also there it wasn't hard to find a quieter space.
Small gift shop (cabin) outside, with lovely items, slow (but friendly) service due to space limitations.

A must see - sheer grandeur and beauty. Gorgeous overwhelming architecture. Amazing sculptures and paintings on every area of this beautiful building. Use the lift to go up to the top of the Basilica to see the most fantastic views of the city

Lovely place. It is on the Buda side high above the Duna, so there is agreat view over Pest. The site us well preserved.
We took great shots here.
Epic . Bassilic is absolutely epic - monunental. It was like to be in some fairy tail. But think - where those money to build it come from?

Not that old, but very pretty interior. Like so much of Budapest, the church looks older than it is (completed 1905), but this recent construction pays off in an interior which matches any baroque church in Europe for beauty and majesty.It is worth climbing (or catching the elevator) to the top of the tower for one of the best views you'll get of low-rise Budapest.It is also well worth attending the ORGAN concert on a Monday at 5pm as the church's organ is large. (Don't mistake a string orchestra concert in the church for an organ concert).
Adventure Budapest. I cannot say enough about how beautiful this Grand Building is . We were able to attend an Organ concert last night. Just incredible and worth the visit.

Amazing views of Budapest. Offers an excellent view of Budapest and surrounding area. Ideal for picture taking and also a beautiful church in the area.Can be reached by public transport or hop on hop off bus.
Beautiful church. Truly impressive. We only walked around the outside but we could see it lit up at night from a rooftop restaurant. Don't miss if you're in Budapest!

Check out for free concerts. We went to a free concert on Sat night. It was supposed to start at 7 but was 15-20 min late which was only a problem because we had to leave at 8:10 for an 8:15 dinner reservation. The Basilica is beautiful, the concert was delightful; a contrast between traditional choir music (about 45 singers) and a middle Eastern solo singer.

Great Acoustics. Well worth attending one of the Organ recitals. The Acoustics and ambiance were great. The event was not too expensive and was good value. Also if only lasted 70 minutes which allowed us to do some more sight seeing that evening.
Arrive early. Arrive when it opens if you go on St. Stephens Day to avoid crowds, as later on there is an enormous outdoor mass and procession and you won't be allowed in.

Beautiful. A must see if you are in Budapest.
What a beautiful Basilica, the ceiling is something special.
Not much to say, just go!

Beautiful architecture + worth climbing!. The basilica is huge and just beautiful. In front, it has the Latin golden writing which means "I am the way of truth in life".
We didn't go in but we did climb the stairs (entry fee) and although its' spiral stairs seams endless, it's worth it: the view from the top is beautiful (windy though!).

Stunning church and tremendous view from the tower. Yes, they ask you for a donation when you enter (if it isn't at standard worship times)--less than one Euro. It's quite a bargain. There is another fee to go to the top of the tower--also worth it. A great workout (there is also an elevator for most of the way up) and you have a stunning 360 degree view of the city. The tower is not stroller friendly.

Go up top for a good view. The inside of the Basilica is adorned with gold and marble. It's a lovely place to enjoy some silent time in a busy city. If you go to the side chapel you can see the mummified hand of Hungary's first king, who also sits above the alter.
Peaceful. Interior of basilica is beautiful. Saw the "Hand" of St. Stephen. Low entrance fee. Very peaceful experience.

Beautiful . We both thought the inside of the basilica was stunning and both enjoyed catching our thoughts while looking up at the beautifully painted ceiling, we payed the extra to go to the top, nearly 400 steps! Stunning views around the city.

Fabulous church. We were very blessed to be able to attend Easter services at St. Stephen's Basilica! The church itself is beautiful inside and out, but the addition of the lovely organ music and choir singing just sent our visit there over the top! It was very crowded, as anyone would imagine, so I'm planning on returning on a quick visit next year to go inside and take a look at more of the details. If you have a guide, the story of the church will make this even better. There is a box at the entrance with a suggested entrance fee. If you don't have it, it's still alright to enter. If you'd like to give more, they would be appreciative. The square in front of the church is a nice place to rest a minute and take in the views and the people.
Impressive. This gigantic church is a classic bit of late 19th century architecture. It is magnificent inside and out, and the Greek Orthodox layout is interesting. Admission costs very little.

Nice. really nice . someone was getting married when we went so so didn't get a chance to visit all of it. the square in front of the church is really cool nice restaurants . If i had to go back i would choose an hotel next to the church

Classical musical thrill. We experienced the evening double organ concert with soloists which turned to an outstanding and emotional experience. The sound in the basilica made the experience so thrilling. And the length was just right. We bought the tickets at the basilica several hours before the performance and were glad as the event sold out.

Extremely Impressive . The Basilica is simply astounding. Both the interior and the exterior are breathtaking. There is a suggested donation of €1 at the door and one can purchase tickets to ride the elevator to the very top of the building to walk around and take in the sights. I would definitely recommend buying a ticket for the elevator. From what I can remember, the tickets were little more than €1 each. If you are looking for a restaurant in the area, I wholly recommend Tom-George directly opposite the Basilica.

Must go up the tower. The basilica itself is amazing.... We saw St Stephens hand while both eery and interesting its still a must see. We climbed the tower and the views were unbelievable worth all 300 steps(they were well spaced and wide very easy compared to st matthias).We took an elevator down.
Beautiful Basilica. Gorgeous place and really enjoyed our tour. Wish we had more time to wander around but is a must see.

A top Landmark, this basilica celebrates Hungary's first Christian King, St. Stephen. Located in Pest, this is Budapests largest Church. Beautifully restored interiors. Two things stand out, One, not Jesus over the altar, but a beautiful statue of King Stephen, and two, in a reliquary in a side chapel there is the right hand of St. Stephen. If you slide at coin worth 200 FT into the slot, the reliquary will light up for 2 minutes. Entry is free, but a donation of 200FT is strongly suggested.

A beautiful church.. So lovely to be visiting such a stunning church free of charge. Of course, we all made our donation (suggested at 200 HUF. I don't mind paying entry fees to places, but not to churches.
Second best church to visit in Budapest. Impressive church and Marbel structure (inside) nice windows and nice decoration. There are also some concerts given at the evenings.

Astonishing temple, wonderful view. It is one of the most amazing Christian temples of the world, immense and imposing. Also, the views from atop are amazing - you have to take two fast and cheap elevators to get up there.
A privilege. True art and an insightful share in history. Each section is different and special in its own way. The mummified hand intrigued me - food for thought.
Sightseeing. Place of worship worth visiting. Very impressive structure, holds 8500 standing visitors. Also worth visiting at night when it is all lit up.
Should miss. Incredible interior one of the nicest churches of all in Europe that I have visited. They ask for a small donation, about 2 Euros

Walk around this basilica and look up.. Another must see in Budapest. The interior is dark but very interesting. The building itself is very interesting. Like a lot of buildings in Budapest a lot of it has been rebuilt after the WW2. It's also free to look inside. A climb to the top is fee based.

Interior did not dissapoint. This place was absolutely amazing inside. The detail and the art is so astounding. My boyfriend and I went to one of their organ concerts. A lot of talent but unless you like the noise of an organ going for over and hour I wouldnt reccomend.
Very impressive. Very impressive and beautiful building from inside and outside. There is some voluntary donation at the enterance.
Must see. A really beautiful temple. The interior is absolutely impressive. There is no ticket to get in but there is one in case you want to go up to the tower for the city view.

Beautiful . I was here on September 2015, the basilica is extremely huge. The basilica is a few step away from the hop on hop off bus station, even walking distance from the city center. It is so beautiful, huge. I felt so fortunate that i had been here.

Like a piece of Rome dropped into the middle of Budapest . This is well with a visit.It's a small donation to get in, but once you're inside there's so much to see (and, of course, somewhere to pray). The walls are marble and feel grand and the chapels each have their own charm.The high altar was breathtaking.There's a funny side chapel which has a holy right hand (of St King Stephen- not St Stephen the first Martyr who was mentioned in Acts). It's slightly cheesy 'cos you have to put a coin onto the box to get it to light up.It costs 500huf to climb the tower. It's a long way up so, if you're not quite fit, use the lift. Once you get to the top the views are wonderful. If you're in Budapest and you're looking for something to do, this is a good way to spend a couple of hours.

Grand building with panoramic views of city. St. Stephen's Basilica is locate don the Pest side of Budapest. It is a grand Basilica.On the day we visited, there had been a wedding ceremony. The bride and groom and all the guests were assembled on the steps of the Basilica posing for a photograph. The entrance fee to get to the top for an adult is 500 Forints and for a child is 400 Forints.There are two small lifts that get you to the top. There are a few more steps on an iron staircase to get you to the very top.The views from the top of the Basilica are simply fantastic. I feel sure that you will not get a better panoramic view of Budapest from anywhere else. The space for walking at the top is quite small and on busy days can get very congested. There are various art works hanging on the walls in the Basilica. Some of the were easy to interpret - others not so easy. The square by the Basilica is pedestrianised and a great place to sit and watch the world go by.Definitely worth a visit.

Awesome Architecture inside and out!!. Beautiful church in idyllic surroundings. The architecture is truly amazing, we would highly recommend a visit due to it being one of Budapest's landmarks.Does not cost much, a small donation to the Roman Catholic Church of 200ft. And they have preserved the mummified hand of the first King of Hungary.
Nice view. Beautifull church inside and outside. Definitly worth it to go upstairs and enjoy the view over the zhole city of Budapest

Don't miss seeing the inside and going to the top for the views. The exterior is very similar to many others in Europe but it is worth a look inside and the 3 euro entrance to the top is also well worth it. Beautiful views over the whole city. While we visited there was a wedding being held in the Basilica so 80% of it was roped off which meant it was hard to see much but what I did manage to spy, was beautiful gold, gold and more gold.

Impressive. Free to enter although a contribution is expected at the entrance. Spectacular building with stunning interior. Very crowded and quite noisy despite a Christening taking place.
Almost too much to take in in one visit. Famous for the Chapel of the Right Hand.

Fabulous!. This is a truly beautiful place of religion, and well worth a visit. We were lucky enough to go to a classical concert in the Basilica one evening when we were in Budapest. I would not say we are big classical music fans, but the choice of music was such that anyone could enjoy it! The evening was magical, the acoustics brilliant. A very memorable evening, reasonably priced.

Beautiful architecture and history. Gorgeous, but crowded. Forget about personal space. It is not a stroller friendly place (even an umbrella stroller). I have never been there when it hasn't been packed. It's worth going in ( there is a 200 HUF suggested donation box) and people still get married there. We were there on a Friday afternoon around 1 and the place was mobbed. You can take photos and light a candle for yourselves/family /friends. You can also use one of the side boards to kneel and pray. As a non-catholic, I was awed by the architecture and beauty of the place (and lit a candle for my catholic mother in law!) .

Site of St. Stephen's Hand Relic. We visited this church October 2014. We were a bit late for the mass and we were not allowed to enter a railed (enclosed) area nearer to the main altar. Many of the mass attendees were old people and there was only one mass schedule per weekday. One will see that it is a very beautiful church if you get to come when most of the lights are on. There was a short line to the right hand relic of St Stephen maybe because it was a weekday. We did had all the time to read and pray before the relic. The area going to the relic and within the relic itself are quite dark. There was no one to guide us nor to give assistance. There are other tourist spots like the Opera within the area of the Basilica. We stayed in a hotel nearby and we just walked to these places.
Multi cultural Budapest. Ornate as per Catholic churches of status but none the less it was an interesting insight alongside the nearby Jewish Synagogue and across the water at Matthias Templom

amazing. This is a truly amazing building. If you can, you should try to approach it from the river so that you experience its full splendour and majesty. The interior is difficult to describe without using the word awesome. I cannot recall having seen a more beautiful church apart from St Peter's basilica in Rome.
Don't miss seeing this gorgeous Cathedral.. St. Stephen's Basilica is an amazingly beautiful cathedrals. One of the best we have seen in all of Europe.
Beautiful. Architectonically perfect I'll say... Amazing as everything builded on those times. I really enjoyed it. All worth to be visited.

A true Cathedral!. A true Cathedral Church worth a visit. I remember it some years back before it was cleaned and restored... still felt it was worth a visit. Today it's a must! Beautiful on the outside, intricate stone work, and even more so inside with glorious paintings and statues.

Stunning. It was an amazingly beautiful building. We went round and appreciated the art and went to look at the famous relic which was an interesting and new expirence. There was plenty of information I could read in English. If you like panoramic views it is worth going up the tower for some stunning views.

Worth a visit.. Like many places of worship in cities, probably needs tourists to help finances.
Decor not to my liking, but it is dramatic and interesting. People, particularly tour guides, not good at keeping quiet.
Worth travelling to roof for magnificent views over city.

Don't miss the chapel . A site I had not visited on my previous trip to Budapest. The basilica includes some key history details and the chapel at the back includes St Stephen's mummified right hand. The back chapel has lovely stained glass windows and the hand is not that visible if not illuminated. Also there is the opportunity to go up to take in the views. Regular organ concerts in summer and early spring.
well worth a visit. We climbet to the top which gives a good view and attended a church service on sunday. The church is very beautiful inside and the acoustics for the organ are very good.

Amazing Inside , a must see .... . As soon as you get through the door here the detail inside takes your breathe away . I've been to the Vatican City and this is certainly on par. You need a good hour here to walk around . It's free to enter and you pay a small fee to go up to the dome, unfortunately I didn't have timeIn this trip to go up but will do it next time .

Unreal views . Defiantly worth a visitIf the inside of the basilica doesn't impress you nothing will it's stunning. The real wonder though is the view from the top. Beautiful and the best spot for a few photos.Would recommend paying the 500 forint (just over a pound) to get a lift to the top. Those stairs could kill an Olympic athlete :)
Beautiful Building. Beautiful inside & out &I the views from the top are amazing. Definitely recommend a visit if you are in Budapest
beautiful. its a beautiful structure with amazing interior and majestic from outside.the work done inside the basilica is one of the best.

Beautiful and peaceful. This is an oasis of calm in the city. The architecture is stunning. Please spare half an hour to visit and find yourself in tranquil peaceful and beautiful surroundings. Entry is just a modest donation and it genuinely offers you a place for thoughtful and self contemplation. Do not miss out. Also offers regular concerts etc so worth checking what's on also

An active site. Chamber music is offered at this Basilica on a regular base. The concert that we took in was excellent, and every seat was a good one. A very sofisticated site to hold a concert of this type.The Basilica itself is a gem and well worthwhile to visit in its own right.Other concerts are also held here on a regular basis..... Excellent

Beautiful Cathedral. Beautiful cathedral in the heart of the Pest side of Budapest offering stunning architecture and beautiful decor. It's a busy place in Sept. and we could not go inside due to a wedding, but were allowed to stand at the door and take photos and view the lovely setting. There is also a viewing platform.
St Stephen's. I would recommend a visit to St Stephen's Basilica, an amazing building inside and out. Beautiful designs inside.

Beautiful!. A stunningly beautiful church! This IS a church! Please be respectful of how others worship. A couple large tour groups were there when we were. Embarrassing! We have seen other of Europe's great cathedrals. We did not expect this in Hungary. The windows, the ceilings, the walls...it's all beautiful.
Beautiful . A visit here is a must and only costs 200 huf. The decoration is stunning and very surprised just to be able to wander so close to the beautifully decorated box containing the hand.

Beautiful architecture and decor inside. Recommend a visit to this beautiful building and the decor inside is befitting of a Basilica. Pay the extra and take a hike up (360+ steps) to the top of the Dome for a 360 view of Budapest. It certainly brings new meaning to a knee trembler when you get to the top!

A lovely Basicilica. Probably the first thing you should do when arriving in Budapest is visit St. Stephen's. It's a wonderful building both inside and out. Definitely take the ride up to the top for the views.
St. Stephen's Basilica. St. Stephen Basilica is free to the public. This beautiful church houses the famous Black Madonna. The church itself is a very attractive architectural masterpiece.

Beautiful . Beautiful building and well worth a visit. It is centrally located and made for a nice visit between the parliament and the Dohany Street Synagogue.For some reason the relics associated with St Stephen are not here but kept in the parliament building (with the exception of a mummified foot at Matthias Church).But it is a beautiful building and absolutely worth visiting.

Impressive. Vast building with beautiful architecture and huge square in front of central entrance. Very impressive at night when the lights of Basilica switch on. This place is 'must visit' for everyone who wants to fill spirit of Austro Hungarian empire.
Historic Budapest. The various exhibits which include robes and Jewels give an interesting insight into Budapests history

Gorgeous! Amazing views from top. Check out concerts!. This place is gorgeous anytime of day. Definitely pay the 500 to go up to the top for some fabulous 360 views of the city. You climb part way, then take an elevator the rest of the way. If you're there on Sunday, chances are you'll see some weddings (i can't imagine getting married in a place so grand, but i guess "go big or go home" works, too.) I also went back at night to hear a string/vocal concert--ethereal doesn't begin to cover it. The concerts are not very long, a little over an hour. The repertoire is mostly crowd favorites, which is fine. It's pretty moving to hear Ave Maria against such a beautiful backdrop. Even if you're not religious, you still might have an moment of feeling in the presence of the divine/beautiful/something transcendent. And while the ticket may seem expensive (i paid 6500), a similar experience would easily cost 5-7 times that at home. Go go go!!
Highly advise. Brilliant architecture on this relatively modern basilica, the inside in amazing and is a great place to take in an important part on Budapest's culture

Very nice . Very nice building and wonderful architechture. Spend time going around this gordious place. Love it.
There are so many interesting places in Budapest to visit.

Stunning. By far the most beautiful church I have ever seen. Area around it is lovely as well. Went back for a concert the next night featuring various artists and thei music. Delightful and unbelievable opulence.

Monumental Basilica. This Roman Catholic Basilica is impressive in all aspects - both from outside and inside. Take you time to go inside and take a few minutes to contemplate, and to marvel at the greatness of mankind to have made such a building.

Impressive building. Impressive both inside and out. Unusual coloured red/purple stone in the interior. No difficulties with taking photographs inside. St Stephen's hand? Well there is an ornate gold and glass box that has something inside. I couldn't see what. What you believe is up to you I suppose. I know my own beliefs in such matters!Charge (reasonable) to climb to the top of the dome, lifts are available if you can't make the stairs. View from the top is very good, of the whole of Budapest.
Don't miss it!. Not to be missed when visiting Budapest! Beautiful and the views of the city are incredible! Be sure to visit at night too!

Beautiful building both inside and out... This attraction is free of charge to get into and just recommend a 200HUF donation. You can pay to take a lift to the look out at the top although I'm not sure of the cost. The building inside is beautiful and would recommend as a nice place to visit, even just as a quick pit stop.
Must-see. Stunning. Hard to over-emphasize the appeal of this place. The location, the setting, the detailing is simply ott.A high priority. Do not miss!!!!

Magnificient, must see in Budapest. Very majestic interior and fantastic views if you travel to the top, there is a small fee for either walking or taking the lift to the top. If you are visiting Budapest, definitely worth visiting - it is beautiful
Just Awesome. Breathtaking the decor in this place is incredible a 200 Forint (50p) donation is all that is required to go in

Be sure to visit this Basilica. A beautiful Basilica with a story to tell. You do not want to miss this landmark. The day we were there, the death of the Archbishop was being commemorated and the bells rang for at least 45 minutes.

Beautiful. We went there for an organ concert. That was majestic. The acoustic and the interior were awesome.
I'd suggest going there for a concert. It was my first concert in a building like this.

Magnificent Basilica, Awesome Exterior and Spectacular Interior!. This is a must see when in Budapest. The exterior is impressive and interior is magnificent. The basilica is dedicated to St. Stephen, Hungary's first king. From the spectacular altar, to the stained glass, to the cupola, there are so many wonderful things to see inside. If you can, visit the cathedral during an organ concert. It's a fantastic way to hear some of the world's best compositions. But even if you don't get to hear an organ recital, don't pass up a chance to visit this awesome place, truly spectacular.
Walking tour. The basilica and the square in front of it is a beautiful place to meet and relax. There are many restaurants and bars in this area.
Stunning Basilica. Very positive vibe to this church, gloriously golden! Totally recommend paying for the tower access!
Beautiful basilica. Go there if you are interesting in history, go there if you are a fan of architecture. Very nice view on the top of the basilica. Entrance fee is arbitrary.

Memorable. Beautiful church in nice down town area right off the pedestrian section of city. They have concerts a few times each week in evening. Very close to subway stop. Concerts in this type of atmosphere are special.

Week in Budapest. This is a beautiful church for a small cost. We also went up the tower for a small cost. There are a lot of steps so you are warned. and part way up to the tower there is a random art display. from that point you can take an elevator the rest of the way up. Because the cost is so little, I recommend this to visit!

You cannot miss it......... Even if you want to, it is situated in a very central spot. You can enter the church even if there is a service, inside the building is breathtaking due to its size and the statues and paintings. Inside there is a relic which has visiting hours and not all times open to public. You can also visit the dome by paying a small entrance fee and with the use of an elevator.
Great views. Great views and a beautiful building. There are 302 steps to the top but there are 2 breaks on the way with mini exhibitions which are interesting and you can take a break if needed!

You get a nice view at the top. It is a very beautiful place to visit in Budapest, it is centrally located therefore easy to reach at any point. Pay for going up to the top of Basilica, it is worth it for the view - I think you can only visit during the day.
Beautiful!. Such a beautiful cathedral... Inside and out! Was amazed at the interior. Outside was stunning as well.

Not just another church!. A beautiful church built to honour the man who united the tribes to make the Hungarian nation; St. Stephen. You can either go in and see the church itself, or peel off left or right before the entrance and see the preserved hand of St. Stephen or go up a tower and see a splendid view of Budapest. Would recommend for a quick stop at least as it is very central

Rushed tourist attraction. Magnificent building but the the tour was very rushed and too many people in the group. Enjoyed the very short concert at the end. Did not like that you had to pay to take photos.

Beautiful church. This place is a major tourist attraction. We were walking away from the church and every time we looked back the view was different and beautiful. We could not resist but click pictures for every 10 meters we walk.
Make sure you go up . Make sure when you visit this cathedral that you go up to the tower. It cost 500 each & when you get up there the view is amazing. Definitely a must

Absolute must visit. It's one of main symbols of a magnificent city.Gorgeous interior.Plus the area around the cathedral is also one of the best in town.Visit it at day and also by night to see the light on that beauty
worth a visit. Just beautiful worth a visit and also recommend a visit at night to see it illuminated. Beautiful architecture
Grand. 200 forint to enter $1. To assist with maintenance. Truly a magnificent building beautifully maintained with exceptional art work and architecture

Love the symmetry as you approach the basilica. Another massive catholic church with an expensive rococco interior. A riot of marble, gilt and paintings/ friezes. Best bit is the symmetry as you approach from the pedestrianised street and square towards the Basilica. Much preferred Mattyas church by Buda castle.

divine. probably one of the most beautiful catholic churches u had ever seem. u don't pay what is a plus. the windows and his mosaics,the statues and the altar are beautifull. the square were the church is located is amazing taking you straight to vacci utza street(very famous street)with hundreds of restaurants,cafes and stores.very easy acces with metro.at the vety end of the street sits the famous Gerbeau.must be seen
Worth It.. Beautiful church in one of the main areas of Budapest. Definitely something you should see if you're walking across the Chain Bridge into Pest.
Beautiful!. We were staying very close by. Walked by here everyday. So beautiful. There was a wine festival on outside which was great and a good atmosphere!
A must visit Pest church. Beautiful building both inside and out. If you like churches this is a must. Is very much recommended. Located centrally so it is no big hassle it you are nearby.

Another amazing building. This building and the area around it have really been renoavted beyond recognition since I visited for the first time in 1997. The way that the surroundings have been pedestrianised and are now full of bars, restaurants and festivals is impressive but the greater impact is that you can now see the basilica in all its glory. Worth a visit during both day and night.

The best is the view from upstairs. The cathedral itself is very worthwhile to see, of course - as most of them in the city.This is the key difference: For a little entry fee you can walk up the stairs and anjoy the view over the city. This is probably the best viewing point to look at both, Gellert hill with citadelle and the Royal Palace hill. Also the further distant Parliament can well be seen from here. A perfect view point for the entire city!PS: Elevators are available - but walking is more fun :)

Neo-Classical architectural style church building. St. Stephen's Basilica church building in Budapest, Hungary with a architectural style of Neo-Classical having two large bell towers is a Roman Catholic basilica named in honour of St. Stephen, the first King of Hungary, it is the third largest church building in Hungary.The Saint Stephen Basilica has played an active role in the musical community

Amazing view. The best part about the basilica is not the inside, which is nice enough, but the trip up to the top. You get a 360* view of Budapest when you walk around the outside of the dome. Well worth the trip.
Another huge, beautiful church.. The tallest building on the Pest side. Very beautiful inside and out, so if you are not all churched out, go for it!

Spectacular church. You are in awe as you look up to the frescoes on the domes of the church. It is large enough to impress, but not so large to lose you. Special chapels are worth taking your time to view and spend some time in the shrine of the hand

The opulence will amaze you!. I'm not a religious person, but I love exploring old cathedrals to marvel at the architecture, art, and opulence of these places. St. Stephen's has to be one of the best in Europe, in my opinion. It glistens with gold and is perfectly designed to take advantage of natural lighting. If you're into photography, bring a tripod. This place will amaze you!

Nice attraction. Very beautiful basilica, we had the chance to catch a wedding there...all i want to say is that it looked like in the movies. If you have the chance, go and visit it, it s free of charge!

Must See. In the last 6 weeks, my wife and I visited 2 such buildings. This and Venice. Both are simply beautiful and must see if you are there.Luckily the queue here was not long and much better. They are both just as beautiful. Pity that every building was just as beautiful around it here that we simply could not see them all. but This one you must see if in the City. It was our lunchtime mention on the second day.Use the "hop on hop off" bus to get to see all the attractions. But make sure you work out the times so you don't have to wait for the bus long.
Amazing experience. The building from the outside is impressive but the interior is breathtaking. We were lucky enough to hear the organist practise. You have got to go there!
Beautiful inside and out. Impressive basilica. The decoration was delicate and intricate. Excellent view from the top. There was also an art exhibition on the way up.

Up the tower. It is awe inspiring. It is worthwhile. If you are not afraid of heights and in good shape, definitely go up to the tower for the amazing birds' eye view. the walk up costs 500 HUF (a couple of USD) cash.
Awesome. A must see in Budapest. Its awesome!! Its so beautiful inside and not so expensive to enter as other sites.

You Have to See It.. The National Cathedral, it is a must see. It is a different style from the Saint Matthews Church which is close to Castle which is Gothic with spires. This is more of a tradional church. It is beautiful with a large square with many restaurants and cafes within steps. In fact, was there yesterday.

Stunnning, especially at night. Didn't go in but enjoyed the architecture and atmosphere on the square surrounding the basilica. This may have been due to the wine fest taking place there this weekend but either way worth a visit

Imposing Cathedral. This is one of the most important churches based in the New Town in Prague, close to Wenscesles square.This building is in neo-reanaissance architecture 96 metres high the exact height of the Hungarian parliament to symbolise the equality of the church with the state.St Stephen was the first king of Hungary & his mummified right hand is kept in a glass case to the left of the altar.The interiors are imposing with the 15th century painting of Madonna & altar paintings by the Hungarian Karel Skreta.There is no entry fee but you pay 500 HUF if you want to climb the 360 odd steps to the top observation Deck to view the city.

The best church in town. If you like churches, the time you spend to visit this Basilica is more than worded.
You will enjoy seeing its interior and enjoy looking all the paintings and details.
Beautiful. Magnificat structure and impressive inside. Gold and gold. The interior is huge and has much of the glory and opulence of the RC church of years ago. It is a very impressive sight.
Very nice. Well preserved cathedral in the middle of a nice square. Nice interior also, great windows with biblical scenes.
great. it is imposing. we got inside and it was really beautiful. we also climbed all the stairs up to the top to see the view-really tiring find the elevator!!!

Really Nice!. This beautiful Basilique, in the middle of a nice walking area, is even more beautiful once you enter it and discover the golden walls and domes. Try the restaurant just across the street (Lugas Etterem) Good food for really cheap prices!
Magnificent. The interior of the Basilica is very beautiful. We happened to visit while an organist was practicing. The acoustics are perfect. There is a 1 euro entry fee.

Impressive cathedral - must see in Budapest. We traveled in group and over past years we've seen a lot of cathedrals. This one is one of the most beautiful we saw. It's also a great start point for tour because you can see the whole city and get the necesery orientation for smooth cruise throught the city.

Sumptuous Interior. A stunning example of neo renaissance archttecture. There was a Mass in progress during our visit. The splendour is breathtaking, every bit as good as the best we have seen in Tuscany or Umbria. We are not of the RC faith so it was not a religious pilgrimage. A must see when visiting Budapest.

Impressive Church must see in Budapest. The interior of the Church is very impressive. After visiting take the elevator, or walk up if you have the energy, to the observation platforms for a great view of the City from the Pest side of the river.

Beautiful cathedral. Very nice cathedral in Budapest. You see this if you walk across any Danube river bridge ( Margaret , Elizabeth or Chain bridge). Magnificient view of this landmark from Danube river cruise but even more impressive up close.
Very ornate!. Well worth a visit, but parts were closed off so we couldn't see it all, which was frustrating. Not sure why it was partly closed.

Visited for Mass on St. Stephen's Day. We were fortunate enough to be in Budapest for St. Stephen's Day. Quite a celebration.
The Basilica is gorgeous!
Well worth a visit. Well worth seeing. Visible from far .Both out side &a Inside very decorative. Dome nicely decorated as is rest of basilica

A miracle in Budapest. I can't describe what you feel when you get in this Holy Place. Just take a look at the wall-painting on the roof of the Temple. You will see God like it is there. Really really impressive. Don't miss it.

One of the hight light of the city. Its a very nice basilica in town and surrounded but most of the city attritions.
Not to spend so much time on there but thats up to any one likes

Organ Concert at the Basilica. My husband wanted to go to a classical concert in the stunning St Stephans Basilica so we booked in to attend the Organ Concert. I am not a concert lover but this was a really lovely experience. Sitting in such an amazing place listening to beautiful music played and sung was a real treat and well worth it.
Beautifil monument. Dominant, beautiful and amazing build in city centre. Especially at the night, the impres is unbeliavable

Good to see but it's not the most amazing basilica I've ever seen!!!. Enjoyed my visit here but you need to manage your expectations. Whilst it's a lovely building and seems to have a very active congregation it's not the stunning interior of other churches and basilicas I've visited
The best view. Basilica is very nice, but the best thing is the view from its top. Take an elevator to the top or the steps and enjoy the view!
Beautiful.. Beautiful building in a lovely square. Well worth a visit to see the inside and to take in the architecture.
Fascinating history. Fascinating history lies behind the St Stephen's Basilica! Worth a trip - find out more about the history to make your trip more worthwhile

More Museum than Church!. Seems like they treat the place more like a museum/concert hall than a church! I couldn't get in the first time. I came back looking for some quiet time and the place was still topped off except the back. Big thumbs down!
Amazing basilica. Amazing place. Our visit was curtailed by a wedding that was on at the time and was cordoned off. Still worth the visit though.

Stunning . Have visited several times. The outside is a sight to behold especially on a hot sunny day. The interior is magnificent, with a lot to look at and understand. You will eventually come across " the withered hand of Saint Steven", which is obviously kept in a sacred glass box covered by a holy cloth. Definitely worth going, even if churches are not your thing. It's part of the culture of Budapest, and should be seen. Free to enter, although you may be asked to give a small donation.

A chance to find out about the mummified right hand of St Stephen... A small donation is all that is asked if you want to look around the church. The domed ceiling is amazing, though there is too much gilt in much of the building for my taste. But it was interesting, it's only a 5 minute walk from the Chain Bridge and looks amazing lit up at night.
nice place. Very nice architecture with a lot of little details al around the building it's a walk worthwhile and take a look in side
Nice to See. The architecture is wonderful but if you have seen one church building in Budapest you have seen them all.

such a beautiful monument - a must see. We were stunned by the architecture of St Stephens Basilica even just from walking past it. On our second from last day we finally made the trip up and the view from the top let you see for miles and miles across our new favourite city. If you're in Budapest, don't miss it!

Beautiful Frescoes!. The frescoes in this massive basilica are beautiful - don't miss the amazing paintings in the dome of the basilica too! The sheer size of this building is enough to make your jaw drop and for a couple of euros is well worth a visit.

Beautiful landmark - go inside.. This is a landmark on the Pest side that's worth visiting. If I had to choose between St. Matthias church and the Basilica, I'd choose the church, but if you have time to do both, go for it!
Impressive. Just amazing construction - especially at night where it's beautifully illuminated. Take the tour and enjoy the architecture.

Best part is the patterns on the floor in front of the church. They said the bad spirit is waiting for people come out from the church and attach to their half opened heart. The pattern in front of the church is very powerful which seems to be able to defend the evil.

Go up the tower for great views. Climb 302 steps, or take the lift, to get unparalleled 360 views across the city of Pest and across the Danube to Buda. It only costs Huf500, about £1.25.In addition to the external views you also get to see the other side of the internal dome, and some modern devotional art in a gallery at the top of the spiral staircase.You might think you're at the top when you get to the gallery, but there's another set of stairs after that. You need a little patience and understanding to share the stairs with people coming down. The lift gets you mostly there but you would still have about 20 stairs to get to the viewing balcony, so not suitable for wheelchairs.The views are awesome though! It's also with pausing to look up or down the spiral staircase!
Beautiful interior. Worth going to see the inside and paying to go up to the dome for viewsWorth remembering that it views inside can be limited if mass is on
Lovely. Lovely place.It was a part of our city tour.Luckily, we had great weather. Not too hot, not too cold

Beautiful St Stephen'sBasilica. Did not appreciate being coerced into making euro donations to enter the basilica. The day I visited, the lift to the top of the dome was not operating either. However, there is every bit of majestic beauty to admire that match the beautiful churches in Italy.The elevated position of the little coffin storing the right hand made it poor to see. Handy explanation about the travels of the hand before being placed at the back of the basilica was interesting. However it is a pity that the meaning of a strong and just right hand is lost to many these days.
Unforgettable. Wonderful, marvelous. It ia a real.... It's a must see for all tourists! I recomend this place for everybody!

A beauty. I went there 3 times. The first time it was raining, but still it was beautiful. The second, it was night, so the lights were amazing, and the third time was a sunny day, whick made it perfect for walking around.
Amazing Bazilika. Very big bazillika, i was there on 20.08. 2015. It wss st. Stephen birthday, Cool. The place ask for fee of 200 cn, but it is not mandatory.

It's a Church. We did a hop on hop off bus tour and it was a great way to get around & one of the places we stopped was St Stephen's Basilica. It was lovely inside as far as churches go as I'm not a religious person by any stretch of the imagination but I did like the magnificent interior of the church.
The holy right hand!. This is a beautiful Basilica that is well worth the entrance fee. Research the holy right hand of St Stephen before you go.
Go to the top. Beautiful - be sure to take the elevator (or stairs) to the top for 360 degree views of the city. The architecture is gorgeous.
Architectural marvel!. This church is very impressive on the inside and outside. It is even well lit at night. We have been to many churches in Europe, and this is one of the best.

One of the Postcard attractions of Budapest. One of the most epic buildings in Budapest, a must visit inside and out during any tour of the city. Smack bang i the middle of the Pest and surrounded by things to see, do and eat so no excuses really.

A Church you know.... I`m not the best one to talk about it cause I`m a little sick of visiting churches this summer, although I have to recognise that this Basilica it`s beautiful and worth visiting.
Definitely Worth Visiting!. I loved St Stephens Basilica, it's a beautiful old church full of history, and has amazing views from up the tower, for me it's a must if you visit Budapest.

Not just another European church!. One of the more beautiful churches in Europe. Ornate, architecturally pleasing and worth a visit while in Budapest. Good photo opportunities inside and out! Close to other significant attractions and other sightseeing opportunities. Don't miss it!
Very lucky!. We arrived by lucky on 20th august! The day of prosession of the Holy Rigth hand! The place is very beautiful! Very gold! And shiny! A must!

Mind-blowing!. This building is truly mind-blowing. It has a great impact on you when you glimpse at it for the first time. It took the builders 50 years to construct it and 2 of it's architects died during that time. It took a great effort to build it's 96 m dome high dome. The interesting fact about this dome is that the parliament building's dome is exactly the same height too, which shows Hungary's balance between the state and religion. No building in Budapest is allowed to be built higher than this. Inside this church we can see beautiful artworks, mosaics and stained glass windows. It also has the most sacred relic of Budapest, the right hand of St. Stephen. The church has two bell towers and the largest bell of Hungary. It is called the Szent Istevan Bell, and it weighs nearly 10 tons. Do not miss going up to the observation deck of the dome to see the same beautiful view of Budapest. You have to pay a donation of 200 HUF to enter the church and a small fee to to visit the observation deck.

Great place to hang out.. A Roman Catholic Basilica with Neo-Classical style architecture. A tourist attraction with lots of eateries and bars in the area to hang out especially at night and enjoy the view.
St Stephen`s Basilica. Another beautiful Basilica.The setting of St.Stephen`s Basilica makes it a must see.Lots to do around.
Beautiful. A must to see . Very beautiful place . Great work and level of detail. Dont use the coin machine thou it dont work and then the staff dont speak english when it suits them .

St Stephen's hand?. The building is imposing and impressive. For an extra sum go to the top for a great view. Small chapel off to the side has a small case which is said to contain St. Stephan's hand.

Awesome Basilica in heart of Budapest. Wonderful experience touring this church. Great history - bombed in WWII but the bomb fell through the roof but did not detonate. Highly recommend touring this basilica.

Stunning . This is definitely worth a visit. Really beautiful place. We found it by accident when walking towards the river one evening. truly breathtaking. There's lovely cafes/bats surrounding it too. So its a nice few
Nice and peaceful !. Beautiful church and we visited the Observation Gallery too from where the whole city can be seen. All this for only 1000 HUF.

Lovely. This is a beautiful building inside and out. Well worth a visit. Free to get in with donation boxes available. Can pay to light a candle. Hand of St.Istan can be seen here although I didn't see it as the queue was too long!
Very busy and touristy as expected.
Beautiful Bach. Try, as we did, to attend the regular Monday evening organ concerts here. All your senses overwhelmed at the same time -- sight, sound -- a real experience!

Beautiful church. Make sure you go up to the top inside the church--very interesting views of the skeleton of the church! The stairway going back down is a steep spiral staircase. The interior of the church is beautiful and the views of the city from the wall outside the church are spectacular!

A Majestic uildning. We have seen a lot of churches, cathedrals and basilcas during our travels, and Szent István Bazilika is not the most impressive we have seen. However, as you walk on Zrínyi utca, the sight of the Basilica impresses you, especially during night time as it is illuminated. We were more fascinated by the exterior than the interior.

Magnificent . This is a magnificent piece of architecture but I must admit that I could only lyrics see it in a hurry because of time constraints. Located at the end of a vibrant Street lined with cafes this is not to be missed. I need to visit again one day to explore a bit more.

Climb the tower for the best view around. The Basilica is worth visiting inside, as it is stunning in size, structure, and decoration. And don't miss the climb up the tower! There is also an elevator, which I believe goes to the very top. The view is the best around, 360° of Budapest. When we climbed it, there weren't even that many people at the top. Just magnificent.
Very attractive. Having visited many churches over the years we had little expectation but this is a lovely church. Worth paying the little sum lift to the top to provide a great view of the city.
Place to visit. Nice Church in the center of Budapest. No fees to pay. Worth the visit. Not too much people if you choose the hour

Basilica befitting Budapest, dedicated to founder of the nation. Very impressive basilica in a lovely square with pleasant avenues leading to attractive views. Many restaurant terraces to sit, day or nite, to rest your eye on the charming vistas and edifice columns. A modern built (1906) structure in neo-renaissance style, dedicated to the founder of the nation, Saint Stephen.
beautiful. we didn't go in but just from outside, your jaw drop. it's so big and beautiful, so grand. It's worth to even just take a look. I am sure inside would be even better.

A Dominant Structure in Budapest. It is hard to go anywhere in Budapest and not see the spires of St. Stephen's Basilica. The inside of the church is spectacular and should not be missed. Also make sure to go behind the altar where the shriveled hand of St Stephen is displayed. There is no charge for the visit to the church but I recommend paying for the opportunity to go up to the dome. There are both steps and an elevator and the view is worth the effort to get there.
Rich and free. Beautiful and rich church. Free entry. A lot of golden decorating on the ceiling. Not too crowded. In city center.
Lovely. Simply beautiful. We arrived here on our tour, but during mass, so it was lovely to sit for a few moments and take it all in. Architecture is stunning.

Amazing town and amazing Basilica. There is not one place in Budapest that I would miss, including this Basilica. Budapest is one of my most favorite cities in the world. Nice people, easy to get around and filled with history. This Basilica is just one of the locations in Budapest that will not disappoint you.

Absolutely phenomenal!. Entrance to this beautiful religious building was free but there was an option to donate some money for the church (which we did). The entire building was so beautiful inside and outside with the decor being stunning. I am not religious but I felt very moved by the building and the whole atmosphere was great!
Beautiful building. Beautiful church. The exterior is very attractive but inside you get the atmosphere and the details from the architecture. If you go up, Budapest will show you its splendor

Prepared to be awed. One of the most spectacular churches we have ever been in". So much to see, lots of side areas to explore.
If you can come for an organ concert it is worth hearing.

Popular attraction. It opens at 7.00am and entrance is FREE. Go early as it gets crowded with people on Tours. Beautiful interiors specially the ceiling. It is a bit dark inside. You can go to the top tower to see Budapest. There is a fee for it. It is a popular attraction. There are lots of lovely restaurants near the church. A beautiful site at night when the building is illuminated.

Nice church. Worth a visit when you can spare the time. They ask for a donation instead of an entrance fee. Inside you can see glass windows of local saints and a relic that would contain a mummiefied arm.

Organ concert. We went here to the organ concert on Thursday evening and were very impressed. It was around 70minutes and very moving to say the least. We sat at the back and this was perfect as we could see everything.if you don't like classical or opera style then avoid as a few people walked out during the first half hour sadly.

A must see. Make sure you get a chance to go in and have a look. The view from the top over the city is a must as well if you can stomach the height! Be warned - the steps feel like they go on for ever, but there are lifts for parts of the journey up if you need to use it. We went to the back to see the relic of St. Stephen but it was very busy and hard to get a good look,
Pretty church. A very nice looking church, the chapel of the sacred right hand was amusing. Entrance is a donation so easily worth poking around.
Good . Very beautiful place outside and more beautiful inside. Must visit place in Budapest. If you going to Fishman Bastian buy tickets to Basilica too . You won't regret it.

Extremely beautiful. A visit to the Basilica was lovely. Extremely beautiful inside. Whilst I sat and viewed the detailed ceiling and walls, my husband and 15 year old son went on a climb up to the top. Of the Bascilica. For people who are used to extreme rides and heights, this was nearly too far/high for them. Very insecure ladders and bannister. (Less than scaffolding at times) Only for those who need to find their pulse.

Music Performances Both God and Man can Appreciate. If you can go to an evening concert there performed by Bartok prize winning artists for a fraction of what you would pay to see the same performance quality in New York, London or Vienna. The church itself is amazing tribute to King Stephen from about 1000 whose right hand is preserved there as a tribute to his becoming a saint. It is one of the most beautiful cathedrals in all of Europe without being over stuffed with painting after painting but the architecture and story of St. Stephen are what make this place so special
do pass by. The basilica has nice architecture and the area around it is surrounded by coffee shop and restaurants.

interesting basilica. Look at the photos in the enterance of how much damage this basilica suffered in the past to appriciate the quality of the restotation. Slow down and appriciate every angle and you will enjoy it

Must see. A beautiful cathedral, Spend time just sitting so you appreciate the ceiling and the details found inside.We walked round and nothing disappointed. Postcards can be bought at the small shop as you leave

Definitely worth Looking. Gorgeous Inside and Out. Not quite as impressive as the Cathedral in Vienna, yet still breathtaking and a must see. Do yourself a favor and walk toward the river and take snapshots about every half block for some great photo ops.
Beautiful Church. Liked the church in general but the hand of St Stephen was a disappointment. Could not see it even after paying the money to light it up.

Impressive exterior with lots inside!. A very impressive building from the outside, St Stephen's Basilica does not disappoint when you venture inside.The high altar and the central dome are amazing and when you go and see the mummified hand of St Stephen, the King of Hungary who died in 1038, you can't really believe what you are seeing.In the evening they hold various concerts there and the one we attended was superb. The acoustics are perfect as you would expect and when candle lit in the evening the gold leaf is breathtaking. Beautiful music in beautiful surroundings-don't miss it!
Golden at night. worth seeing in the day time to be able to go inside to see lovely ceilings but also worth seeing at night when all lit up. Looks like its made of gold,
nice place. Nive view, but dont buy ticket to go inside unless you are virtuoso. Therte are many paintings.that is all)

must-see in Budapest. This beautiful church in the centre of Budapest is a historic monument worth visiting. The entry is free of charge, and you can find Hungary's most famous relic here, the right hand of our first king (I'm not entirely sure if that's free too). There are concerts too, if you're interested in such event, check out the calendar and attend one.For anyone not very familiar with the country's history I'd recommend to either read about the Basilica in a guidebook or take the time to do it in the church, there are informative posters in there.

Beautiful building. Very nice place with large famous pictures on the walls and celling.
the place is not for tourist only so we got luck and we intend in real wedding ceremony .
the entrance is for free but you can donated 200 flu if you want and to go to the upper point (300 stairs) the charge money
Another gorgeous piece of architecture. The details in the construction of this Basilica are amazing.. A gorgeous structure to see during the day as well as at night when it is lit up. don't miss it!

Don't ignore the surrounding neighborhood. St. Stephen's Basilica was tremendously impressive, and definitely worth a visit. But equally impressive, and often ignored, is the surrounding neighborhood, consisting of a number of quite old buildings with well preserved exterior decor, a number of craft shops and galleries, some outdoor cafes, and a quiet residential section with a hilltop view across a portion of the city. A good place for a morning or evening walk preceding gallery browsing and refreshments. The views from St. Stephen's are also spectacular, as is the restored interior.
BEAUTIFUL BASILICA. Definately worth a visit, this Basilica is truly beautiful. There is no charge for admittance which is always a bonus.
Stunning! !. What a stunning building outside and in. Even got to see a wedding while we was there. Very central to all the other locations.

Concert at St. Stephen's Basilica. St. Stephen's is a gorgeous basilica and an easy walk from the major hotels in Pest. Last night we attended a fabulous concert featuring organ, violin, trumpet and operetta. The basilica is even more beautiful bathed in candlelight and the music was fantastic. We bought VIP tickets for about $45 each and sat in the front row so we could see the musicians. The concert plays weekly and tickets can be bought at the basilica but they only take cash. This was one of the highlights of our trip. I would highly recommend seeing this lovely basilica in the evening and hearing the concert. It was an hour and ten minutes of joy.
Worth visiting!. Very beautiful and rich with history. Do read about it before coming (or book a guide) to appreciate what you see!

History, Beauty, Music, Location. Szent Istvan Bazilika is easily the most important landmark in Pest. It was named after Stephen, the 1st king of Hungary circa 1000 AD. The Basilica is beautiful, and provides choral music, classical music, as well as contemporary musical performances -- these concerts include arias sung by Kolos Kováts, famous concert and oratorio singer; and organ recitals by Miklós Teleki, also the country's finest. A flutist and violinist also performed solos during the evening I attended. The acoustics in the Basilica are amazing. Cost of tickets are minimal at the window inside the front door -- just stop in mid-day to check performance times and purchase your tickets.

Grest. The interior is amazing looking up at the dome. Do the tour around the outside of the dome. We have kids buggies and there is a lift to take you most of the way. Just beware once you get out of the first lift you have to leave you buggy. Then take the right hand side door in the galley as this is another lift. The left door is stairs and it's quite a few as we found out.
One of the most beautiful church in Budapest. The Basilica is in the heart of the city, inside and outside is beautiful, if you are in Budapest you can not miss it!

Worth a visit!. Beautiful! It is located right in the square with lots of restaurants and shopping..It is 200 huf to get in which is about 75cents. No hats. They sell beautiful rosaries outside the church, large selection. Bought several. loved it!
Lovely basilica.. Huge basilica at the center of Budapest wih neo classical style architecture. It was very hot during our visit but worth a visit.

Holy place with great energy and location. One magnificient building with great location and energy.
It costs almost nothing and do not forget to go to the top floor there you can treat yourself a wonderful city view.
Fascinating history. Beautiful church with lovely stained glass and a fascinating history. Light a candle for peace. Best to visit early in the day to avoid long queues.
Beautiful. Viewed from the outside it was an impressive structure. You can walk all the way around and the streets nearby have many cafes.

Beautiful inside. We happened to visit on a Sunday morning...all visitors were requested to be super quiet so as not to disturb the service. The echo of the chant and father's voice set the mood for a worshipful place. Candles lit everywhere to pray for loved ones. The service was a baby baptism...precious. This church was most impressive in decor and it is quite prominent outside as well. I really liked that it has a courtyard outside ( unlike other Europen churches where people unfortunately propped buildings up around them). People sit on the steps outside or mill around in the courtyard. Makes one want to sing w Mary Poppins "Feed the birds". it was too hot of a day to climb the 364 steps to the top but I wish we had done so.

Another Budapest Must See. Just when you think you do not wish to see another church, here is St. Stephens. Take the time to come here and walk around inside and out. The neighborhood is lovely and has many places to eat or have a coffee. Come back in the evening when the facade is lit and glows against the night sky.
Holy delight by the Danube. Definitely a must in Budapest. The interior decoration and structure makes it a beautiful piece of art. Try to attend to organ concerts as the acoustic is excellent.

Beautiful church. Be sure to go inside this beautiful church! Very ornate and beautiful pictures and gold inside the church. Great place to take pictures of the outside and the city's sure. There are nice cafes that line the square for a drink and people watching.

The most beautiful church. Well worth the visit . The church is one of he most beautiful we have been in . Also definitely worth the small fee to go up to see the panoramic view . Take the elevator up . It costs no extra. Fabulous visit . Was enticed to come back for the Ave Maria concert but was a bit disappointed with the sound as thought you would hear the music well in the cheaper seats but the size of string group I think suited a smaller venue as you couldn't really hear the nuances or the passion of the music.
Bazilika by night. A wounderful place in the middle of downtown Budapest. Plenty of space, specially lovely during summer nights. Plenty of places to have a drink around the Cathedral.

Beautiful in and out.. St Stephen's was my location beacon - once in view, I knew the way to my accommodation. A stunning building in and out. I had great pleasure in attending a delightful recital, with excellent acoustics.

A must to visit and light a candle. We actually visited last Thursday before dinner to the Organ concert. a little hot but enjoyable the Basilica is absolutely a must to go inside and visit it is lovely

Great place to hear a concert. If you have a free evening I recommend a concert at St. Stephen's. It is a breathtaking church and the music is very good quality. Originally thought it was touristy but was wrong, it was a perfect evening after a day of touring the city. Eat dinner at one of the nice restaurants on Zrinyi before hand it it will be a recipe for a great night. I only wish the church was a bit more lit up before the concert to appreciate the beauty but they keep most of the lights dimmed at night. Visit during the day & then return at night.
