St. Stephen's Basilica . Propably one of the greatest corners in Budapest. Not only the church is magical both inside and outside, but also you can have a great panoramic view of the city or enjoy great dishes, cocktails or THE best ice cream ever in the streets around.
Fabulous Church. Fantastic church, the architecture and decor is fabulous. A place of contemplation and inspiration in the heart of Budapest. A must to visit.

The most beautiful Church we have seen. The marble interior and painted dome awesome. We stumbled across this beautiful Church. It is most interesting from outside from all angles. From the front it is elevated and looks down on a patterned square. The best part is the interior though. There are just beautiful statues and sub alters to look at as well as the main alter and organ. We could not get over the use of marble with rich reds and greys. The ceilings were stunning with paintings of angels and saints and much gold leaf. Well worth a look when you come to this great City!

A beautiful landmark. We went in unintentionally but were pleasantly surprised - you must see the mummified hand relic! It was very atmospheric and a choir were rehearsing whiuch added to the general ambiance - A pleasant hour!
spectacular. very grand and spectacular. was very impressed but the story behind St Stephen's fame was quite distressing ....

SERENE CHURCH. We were in Budapest in last Easter holidays and on 3rd April 2015 we started our tour with this Basilica. It was very closed from our Hotel at Budapest. The St. Stephen's Basilica is the largest Roman Catholic church in Budapest. It took more than 50 years to construct . Entrance is free, however a token donation of HUF 200 was requested. We also went to the treasury, which was open to public. There was a well preserved cut- off hand in a glass box of the ancient king. We did not go up to the dome , however it is possible with fee and there were stairs and lift for going up.

Must see. One of the most beautiful old church in Budapest. It is in the central and easy to visit. They do a lot of christening and wedding. All fantastic events. But if you just go to see the Church still plenty to see about the art of the time and teh talent of people who planned and build it .

Don't miss the panorama . Beautiful church but try to avoid the tour buses as there's not a lot of room for crowds to view the relic.
Don't miss the chance to go up for the panoramic view from the dome. There are two elevators so don't worry about the stairs.

A must see church in Budapest. There is a lot of history in this church. The altar, typical of older churches is far from the pews. The interior has a familiar color palette...like paprika is sprinkled into the paint. The Jewish Synagogue has a similar look on the outside.

Stunning Budapest. This building is simply stunning from every angle. It sits in a large traffic free square surrounded by shops, cafes, bars and restaurants. It looks even more amazing when lit up at night.

Unforgettable view at dusk. The best time of day to view the Basilica is right at dusk. The lighting hits the building and the chimes call the worshipers for mass. I still get a chill when I think of that moment.

Amazing . Just popped in for a quick look and so glad we did. The place was awesome and had so many things to look at inside- all breathtaking. View from outside also impressive and surrounded by area with buzzing atmosphere and some great places to eat.

Impressive church . The church was quite impressive. Worth visiting when you are in Budapest. You are expected a donation of 200 HUF pr person when you enter. Still very different from the Mathias church in style.

Go when they illuminate the interior!. We visited here after walking through the Christmas market. Unfortunately, it was extremely dark - we couldn't see much or snap photos. The only light came from stained glass windows, but it was gray and cloudy outside so no light came through. Later, we heard that the time to go is at night when they illuminate the beautiful interior for organ concerts. Keep that in mind!
Beautiful Church. Excellent place to attend Mass and to pray. We also attended a classical music concert there and it was beautiful. The acoustics of the Basilica are excellent.

Beauty and Reverence combined. Impressive. BEAUTIFUl interior, gorgeous church. It is a stop for Catholic pigrims or tourists. I happened to visit the Basilica during a choral concert, the combination of stunning interior and amazing music was superb.

Awesome inside and outside!. Bazilica is amazing! The view from the top lets you see the whole city. It is both awesome inside and outside!
The church is very beautiful at day and even more amazing at night! A lot of concerts happen here almost every evening, so you can enjoy the beauty of the church and the music at once.

Beautiful discovery. My husband & I were lucky enough to visit the basilica while a choral concert was taking place. The setting & the music were beautiful.
We also climbed the 300-something stairs to see the view over the city, well worth the effort but a lift is available! Definitely a must see for any visitor to Budapest.

Very pretty stained glass; interesting reliquary of St. Stephen's hand!. This is a must quick visit for historical Budapest- the stained glass windows are beautiful, the acoustics wonderful (we visited during a choir rehearsal). The quirky bit is that you get to see St. Stephen's hand, that miraculously does not rot, in a reliquary that is paraded around Budapest every year. If you drop in a few Hungarian coins, the lights around the display will light it up for you for about five minutes, well worth doing. Much more interesting and kind of grotesque than the Museum of Terror. Kids will love it!
Owesome!!. The church was beautiful with rich history. Only that visitors need to pay 200 Ft (around US $0. 6) to use the restrooms. The attendant was very rule.

A sight worth seeing. Very good price to get inside, and so much to see.It really is a magnificent building, very busy but so nice to appreciate it's architecture.The attention to detail is fantastic and can stare at the various domes throughout.
One of the most beautiful churches in the world. Impressive and beautiful. Must be seen. Evening concerts are arranged. The environment is also fantastic.
holy than thou. wedding on so we couldn't visit the main part but did walk up (a lot) of stairs to have a look at the view over Pest
Interesting church. It seems to incorporate various styles. Definitely worth visiting. We stayed nearby and is on the way to other attractions easliy reached on foot.
Great Location. It is in the center of the city and free to go in. Stunningly beautiful church that is worth stopping by.

Beautiful!. Breath takingly beautiful.The only thing keeping me from giving it 5 starts is the fact that is was rebuilt and nothing is original. We walked in during a choir singing and it made the experience so much more incredible.

Go inside . Its free .. Take your time and see this wonderful piece of architecture . No entry fee . Just an optional donation .
Didn't realize that a great football player's remains are also there .

Great Church and Great Views. It's free to go into this lovely church and it only costs a small amount to go up the tower. It is fascinating to see above the dome on the inside and the views from the balcony are excellent and you can go all the way round.

One of the best spots in Budapest. Being in the center of the capital city it is a good spot to start you tour from here. It is very close to two main streets (Andrassy and Vaci streets) and the Parliament. Restaurants and hotels nearby make this one of the most visited sightseeing of Budapest.

Stunning place, both inside and out. I was already amazed by this gorgeous structure from the outside but the moment I stepped inside, I was even more blown away. Unfortunately we didn't stay for long as there was a service going on but just those few minutes spent inside the majestic interior was enough to make me feel in awe of the place. Definitely worth dropping by for a look if you're in the city.
nice city view. nice basilica, you can feel history of this building inside. it is a time for light a candle and say a short prayer

Near the shopping street. The height of the dome here is the same as the parliament, we couldnot go inside, our feet were killing us, so we chose to sample the ice cream and rest while drinking in the beautiful details of this construction from the outside.

Touristy yet calming. Majestic and awesome to just stand back and admire. Outside, is an open area where no traffic drives through so it's a good place to take videos and stop for a cappuccino and listen to the church bells.
Best View of Budapest. As far as Basilica's go, not my favorite but the view from the tower is the best in the city. Make sure you check it out.

Same church as everywhere. Do not expect to see anything out of the ordinary, it is quite nice although and it worth a half an hour. Donation is not a must but you will have to confront an old man at the entry therefore you should have some coins to give.

Stunning church!. From the outside it is very nice, also at night it is great to have food at one of the restaurants in the sqaure with the church in the background, inside it is very very stunning, it reminds me very much of a smaller version of the vatican church.

Fabulous cathedral. St. Stephen's Cathedral is a gem in Budapest. An architectural wonder it also has an exquisite dome. It contains many side chapels including one to the Black Madonna. It also contains the famous 'Holy Right', the hand of St. Stephen, King of Hungary. It is a must see in Budapest. Plan on spending at least an hour or two at the cathedral.
itself is not impressive but... big cathedral but not impressive if you visited other Eurpoean cities. however around here, you can find a good restaurant and sweets shops.
Ornate and a beautiful living Basilica. If you love ornate Churches then this will fit the bill. Its a warm living church serving a community, not an empty dusty building.
A must see in Budapest!. A beautiful church, right in the center of Pest. Make sure to visit and don't be rushed. Take the time to admire the artistry and reflect.
One of the best view point. It was fabulous! Third highest church in Hungary. One of the best view point. Bigestneo-classical church.
Well worth a visit.. A beautiful Basilica in the heart of the City. You cannot miss it, and you should go in. It is splendid, even if you are not religious.

Recommended. We visited this basilica when we were attending the organ concert. Interior is nice, and we would recommend to attend the concert so you can enjoy the interior and the concert at the same time
Magical. Beautiful view - the evening we arrived we realised there was a live opera performance being broadcast in front and spent the entire night in front of this stunning building.

Panorama from Basilica. You can see another view of the city from here. The best part is the straight way leading to the basilica, the rest is normal. The price is cheap though and sometimes they dont even check the ticket :P Bring your student card if you have one!
Holy Basilica!. St. Stephen's is a beautiful basilica with a wonderful facade. It is appointed with statues and architectural details inside and out. It is worth the visit. Enjoy!

Just unbeliveable!. Can't put in words the beauty of this Basilica!!!
I've seen some, and this one is one of the most impressive.
Try and visit on concert time.
Unforgettable.

Don't miss it.. Justifiably famous, it was crowded when we were there, but I imagine it always would be. It's a beautiful cathedral. There seem to be many "St. Stephen's" all over the region, but this seems to be the most famous.

impressive church. astounding, intricate architecture - the entrance is free and the the view from the top is also stunning, and not too expensive to get up to. definitely go see it if you're in Budapest.

Beautiful architecture. It is one of the magical buildings in Budapest, I have always felt really good whenever I was in this church. I used to live in Hungary and this was the church I used to go whenever I needed to relax a little (even though I am not a Christian). It is just beautiful inside, it is definitely one of the most beautiful buildings in Budapest...

Impressive church. I am glad we visited St. Stephen Bascilla in Budapest first before we visited St Stephen Cathedral in Prague. Though smaller than the cathedral for the same name sake, this church is equally impressive and beautiful. We enjoyed the brief visit before relaxing in the nearby cafe. Why not drop by and enjoy the cool and calm environment.

Very impressive . Located in the central Pest area of the city, the basilica is definitely impressive. For a small donation you can enter the church to see the beautiful ceiling and interior of this beautiful structure. Pilgrims will appreciate the holy right hand of St Stephen, the patron saint of Hungary, is kept intact in the rear chapel of the basilica. Definitely worth a visit.

I preferred it to the vatican. We took a walk round this church with amazing sculptures and paintings, we climbed up to the dome and took photos on the balcony, the views of the city are great up here. A mission is a small donation for the church and a small price for a ticket to the dome. I found it to be less busy and fussy than the Vatican, but no less impressive

Very good, especially if you go to the organ concert. A must-visit, better read something beforehand - it'll be even more interesting.Do buy tickets for the organ concert - you'll not regret a single time.
Huge and nice Church. Very imponent Church, huge, nice around it, nice walk, very pleasant. Nice meeting point to see and to start a walk, nice restaurants around it, many memorials.

A lovely, central place to gather.. A beautiful church with colorful history. It sits in the square surrounded by coffee shops, cafes, and evening strollers. Always full of people walking by and a good place to sit and enjoy the afternoon or evening. On certain days they have an organ concert with a soloist with the huge pipe organ. Very beautiful.
Unfortunate. Beautiful, but unfortunate. On the day of our visit, tne air con had broken down so we could not bear to stay. It was 36 degrees outside so you can imagine what it was like inside......
Beautiful Cathedral. We toured the Cathedral on Wednesday afternoon and learned there was an organ concert on Thursday evening, so we signed up. It was delightful.
Worth it!. This is one of the most amazing churches (actually a basilica) I have ever seen. The colors are so unusual for a church and just stunning, as are the candelabras, paintings and flooring.

St Stephen's Basilica. A beautiful church in Budapest, right in the heart of Pest. I didn't have time to go inside, as I was on a walking tour, but from the outside it looked really spectacular. If you wanted to explore this, you would need a bit of time, but even from standing outside in the surrounding square, it is vast and impressive. And not to mention, it is hard to miss if you are in the area anyway!
St. Stephen's Basilica. Awesome cathedral with super fantastic view from the top! It took a long time to enjoy the view on the Budapest city :)

Make the trip to the top!. Amazing building inside and out in a really nice square with cafes and restaurants surrounding. Make sure you pay the 500HUF and make the trip up to 302 stairs (!!!) to see the panoramic views from the top. A must do in Budapest!

Cannot be missed!. Located in the very center of Pest, this Basilica is definitely a must go! From the outside, the architecture is beautiful, and the public place in front of it also has a beautiful design. I suggest you go inside to visit (it costs 1 euro or 200 Forints)
Just one of the highlights of Budapest.. Went to the top of the Basilica -- well worth the climb. Many things to do and see in Budapest -- really a great city to visit.

Beautiful church and inviting plaza. The basilica is beautiful inside and out. We also attended a fine organ program there. The plaza in front of the basilica is bustling with activity of food, shopping, sightseeing, etc. Highly recommended.
Outstanding performance of the Mozart Requiem and Bach`s Toccata and Fugue. We were lucky enough to attend a superb Organ recital at the Basilica. Strongly recommended if Bach is your thing.

Spectacular - but my partner found it too opulent. The cathedral is truly magnificent. It is ornate, with gold, crimson and paintings throughout. The dome or cupola is over 90 m high, with a beautiful fresco. The height means the interior does not feel as large as it is.To the left hand side of the main altar is a side chaple. This has the mumified right hand, supposedly of St Stephen, the first Hungarian king. We did not hear an organ recital, but tickets were being sold at the door for an 8 pm concert.

Beautiful Basilica and definitely worth a visit!. When you first see the basilica it is spectacular from the outside. I saw it during the day and at night and it is beautiful. I also went inside and it is very impressive. They have the mummified hand of the church's patron - St Stephen

Impressive church. Big with magnificent architecture church. Visited the church during our first day in Budapest but we were unlucky and as same night was planned a concert thus church was closed for the public.Because we would like to enter into the church we visited the place again the last day and enter the church.For sure worth the time we spend for visiting the church second time. Inside the church is very impressive and you can sit a bit, calm and clean your mind. Its good to read about the history of specific church prior visiting. As entrance fee there is a donation of 200 HUF.
Very Impressive. Very impressive interior and exterior. Worth going to a service. Massive scale. Also concerts on some evenings.
0PULENCE. Fantatasic architecture and opulence but is this what God wants. Certainly worth a visit and superb views from the Tower. Suprisingly peaceful in this busy part of town

Beautiful Building. What a truly beautiful church, truly magnificent architecture and a incredible dome. If you get the chance to hear a choir singing inside the sound is incredible. Well worth taking the time to have a look around.
Amazing Architecture!. The interior of the basilica has an amazing architecture, very beautiful. Entering the dome is a very nice deal, it was ~2€ with access to a lift, so no steps.

Spooky hand, impressive view. Absolutely a must see. Tickets to the dome are bought to the right of the entrance. The lift is however located to the left behind a small shop. Amazing view!!To enter the cathedral a donation of 200 HUF is required to be paid in cash and at the door.On the left "hand" side and behind the altar is the disembodied hand of St. Stephen (really!). For another 200 HUF you can get it illuminated... which is even more creepy. Photo allowed.

Wow!. This is one of the most beautiful buildings in the city and maybe in most of Central Europe. We toured the whole place. The history is exceptional and I loved the architecture. It amazes me that all of this could be built with such amazing detail so long ago. Love it!
Spectacular!. The most beautiful church I've ever seen, it was 10 times more spectacular than I anticipated! I didn't want to leave it was so stunning, a photo just wouldn't do it justice!

Excellent architecture and brilliant place to sing!. We visited here with a school choir and had the privilege of singing for the mass from the gallery. The sound is beautiful from the gallery and the acoustics are magical. The Basilica itself is an awe inspiring place to be and I would recommend it to anyone looking to visit the city.

WORTH A VISIT. The basilica is located about four blocks from the danube and is fronted by a large open square which has coffee shops and restaurants around it. The church itself is an interesting architectural piece with a magnificent dome.

Beautiful from the inside and outside. Definitely worth a visit. The plaza outside has a number of cafes and restaurants. The Basilica is gorgeous from the inside as well. You can also go all the way to the top and have a panoramic view; only issue, they don't take Euros

Stunning. The best cathedral, church or basilica I've been to in Europe. The architecture and internal decoration of the basilica are just stunning and a must to visit if you are visiting Budapest. The square around the basilica has many cafes and a great atmosphere as well.

Outstanding View. We paid to enter both the tower and the church, which might account for why it is so beautifully maintained, though we had to wait at the ticket window for about ten minutes as the line lengthened and the cashier engaged in an extended and what seemed to be personal phone call. The tower offers stunning vistas of Budapest and allowed us to watch a thunderstorm make its dramatic and cooling entrance into the stultifying heat of Budapest. The sanctuary was beautiful and full of tourists. An intriguing attraction was the thousand year old, mummified remains of St. Istvan's right hand on display, the view of which is somewhat obstructed by the ornate case.
Magnificient church. When you read the history of the church and what happened during it's construction you will appreciate it.
It was nice. The St. Stephen's Basilica is very beautiful building. You can go on the top and there is a magnificent view. You can see everything. Near Basilica is Starbucks :)

Speechless!. The Basilica was something I wanted to visit when in Budapest and I have to say it was amazing. The minute I saw inside I was speechless. The detail of the work that has been done was just wow. I've never seen anything like it before.
Beautiful Church. Don't forget to go up to the lookout terrace. you can see whole Budapest. it costs only 500 HUF! there is an elevator (actully 2 :D) so dont need to walk!
Absolutely gorgeous!. The most important religious monument of the Pest side. It also houses a rare relic, the hand of St. Stephen, first king of Hungary.
Wonderful building. Every part of this wonderful building was marvellous, we had a brilliant guide and she made this a very memorable trip

Beautiful church . Not much from the outside but inside it's simply beautiful. We spent an hour just inside. The climb/lift to Panoramic view (@500 HUF) wasn't really worth it. We didn't have time to visit the treasury though.

Breathtaking inside and out. One of my must see parts of Budapest and where I take any new visitors.Even if it's closed just the photo opportunity outside is enough.If your lucky enough to go in then prepare to have your mind blown by the breathtaking interior.Go up the tower for the best views in the city as well.Then enjoy the ambience of the street restaurants all around...my tip for great cheap eats is the Humus Bar just around the corner, another of my must visits.
Saints Hand. The plaza on approach is unreal but the Church is almost beyond belief with St Stephen 's hand. We spent a couple hours there as every section has a lot to study

Same as always. Yeah of course it's awesome church but compared to the rest of churches around the globe nothing special. Better ask yourself why these kind of churches full of pomp and circumstance and around the people are very poor and church won't help them or give them to eat.
Buy the ticket to the top. Definitely buy the ticket to the top so you can get a birds-eye view of all of Budapest. It can get crowded once you're up there, so be patient.

Magnificent in a perfect neighborhood. Unfortunately we went two times to the basilica in the evening, just before sundown when the last sundrops lightened the tops of the basilica. Perfect light for a guaranteed beautiful picture.Around the basilica there are several streets with nice restaurants and bars, a ice place for a great evening.

One of those places you have to visit, but not one of those you will remember. In my opinion, best thing from this place is the atmosphere in the surroundings. A lot of people in front of the building doing a variety of things or simply sitting at the terraces. Then, the inside is also nice, but perhaps not impressive

Most Magnificent!. We had a bit of free time between our morning city tour and our afternoon nap and decided to go back and visit this magnificent Basilica. You will be happy that you took the time to enjoy inside, and if you are at the right time, perhaps an organ concert too.
Gorgeous. I would say 100% worth a visit, we were in a hotel round the corner so we could see it out the window and it lo
One another middle age church. although the place is well built with full of medieval architecture, I don't really find any other interesting things
Amazing. Our walking guide gave us some background history so it made it a lot more interesting to visit than just entering another church.

Love St. Stephen's Basilica. The church, its surrounding, it is all beautiful. The Basilica is beautiful both outside and inside. The ornaments inside should definitely be seen. As a matter of fact, some of the most beautiful photos I have taken in Budapest were of the Basilica.

Beautiful building. Travelling around Europe involves seeing a LOT of churches. The good thing about this one is that you can go to a fabulous organ concert in the evening and sit back to enjoy the music while you soak up the atmosphere and admire this beautiful building.

Like Any Other Basilica. This basilica is not particularly big. It is in excellent condition and very ornate. I like the fact that you can go to organ concerts here in the evenings. We attended one such concert and it was a great experience.
GO HERE!. It is a very beautiful church, the climb to the roof is a bit difficult but so worth it. The view of the city is very beautiful.

Beautiful Chapel. The outside of St Stephen's Basilica is amazing and you really can't miss it. The first day we went to visit it we didn't go in as there was a wedding & it was lovely to see the happy couple outside the basilica getting photos taken. We did go back to see the inside of the chapel and we were glad we did. It is simply beautiful. You will be amazed at how lovely it is and is worth a visit. It doesn't cost a lot to visit and they recommend 200 HF donation.

Solemn and serene. I enjoyed visiting this beautiful church, though occasionally felt crowded by the tourist parties going round. It was nice to spend a moment of quiet contemplation in the midst of the city's bustle, and I appreciated the fact that the church asked for a donation (which most people gave) rather than charging an entrance fee as some others do.

Not to be Missed. What a wonderful Basilica, much smaller inside, but a fantastic church, with wonderful stained glass windows and beautiful murals. Also plenty of little chapels with beautiful alters and also a small chapel dedicated to St. Stephen. Marvellous

Lovely neo-classical church. An impressive building, both outside and in. I particularly liked the cupola and the large old organ. Went to the evening organ concert and the sound is superb. Just remember to pick a seat where you can look over your shoulder as the organ is behind you.

Be sure to visit him while you're there!. The basilica is a work of art in itself. Beautiful mosaics, frescoes, stained glass windows, and marble. But be sure you go into the small chapel that contains a relic of St. Stephen himself!

Great place. Big one catedral the atea very clean very nive with some bistros and area to take a break impressive architecture tha place also have near a subway sandwich place i cant believed
Most to be here

Simply amazing. The outside of the building was simply amazing with its beautiful structure. We went inside of the building and the interior structure is just amazing and a sight to behold. The place to visit if you are in budapest

St. Stephen's Basilica. We enjoyed visiting the church, but the best part is going up to the dome for the best views of Buda, Pest and the surrounding area. Spectacular!
Just be sure to have some coins as it cost to go in the church as well as to ascend to the dome.
Best budapest sites. The church is still used. Large impressive site, well kept, impressive interior, well worth a visit.

An absolutely stunning church.... My mum and I recently visited here whilst on holiday in Budapest. Naturally it was very busy and a tourist hotspot, but it really is a beautiful church, especially the ceilings!

Spellbound Art. The Basilica is A great experience for a person interested in Architecture of the times with beautifull Interiors and the exteriors done on the buildings...A must visit for your budapest trip

Budapest's Largest Church, Withered Fist, Great Views. The withered fist belongs, supposedly, to St. Istvan, Hungary's first Christian King. It's a thousand years old, and has held up pretty well.... At some point when exhuming his body, this hand/fist was miraculously preserved. So much beauty and history is found in the old European churches - don't miss this one.
beautiful church. This Basilica stand out as a memorial to the nation life of Hungary throughout the ages. It is a must visit place in Budapest

The tower. We we're up on the tower and it was amazing (only 400Ft. for students and 500Ft. for adults) and you can also go by elevator (but when you want to go up by yourselve, there are pretty narrow stairs). View was excellent.

Attend a service. St Stephen's Basilica is in the heart of Budapest and is imposing from the outside and spectacular on the inside. I recommend that you attend a service here for it is used every day and the organ and singing is wonderful. The interior is full of wonderful paintings and statues. It can be very busy and crowded and it is difficult to find any peace amidst the tourist throng.
Well worth the Visit. An impressive huge old church.Well maintained - easy to find - ongoing services but tourists can walk through and take photographs

Beautiful church. Be overwhelmed by the sheer size and beauty of this basilica. Free entrance. Still in active service (there was a mass ongoing while we entered and a beautiful sign which said "tourists stop" to indicate we couldn't go any further. But we took it for granted and remained politly behind the chain). We shot some great pictures and soaked in all the glitter and glamour.

Beautiful interior. Thought this might be just another Baroque church but this one was special with a lot of wonderful marble inside, I was amazed at all the different colours. Definitely worth the time to take a quick peak inside.
Beautiful Architecture and History. Our 14 days in Central Europe and 5 countries all had magnificent cathedrals, this one is spectacular

Interior and organ concert were exellent. If you want to get good seat, you have to go out very early because there is no firm seats. The room was too dark to see the church interior, however, still you can get some impressions during concert. Very beautiful church and concert by Miklos Teleki, Kolos Kovac and Eleonora Krusic was enjoyable. The program includes Mozart, Vivaldi, Stradella, Albinoni, Liszt, Schubert, Schumann, Bizet and Bach.

IMPOSING AND IMPRESSIVE. A must to visit while in Budapest. An impressive building with beautiful stained glass windows and ornate ceilings. There are many interesting features to look at and entrance is for the cost of a small donation.
Beautiful church!!. Interesting story about how this massive Catholic Church has Jesus playing "second fiddle" to a king at the altar. An incredible city filled with amazement around ever corner!!

A special place for us.. St Stephens is the largest church in Budapest with the largest bell in Hungary it has some amazing architecture, carvings and paintings and IMO a must see when in the city even if its not your thing its worth the visit. The special part to us is something many people may not know is that St. Stephens has an Under church. I happen to have family buried there so when I am in the city we go to pay our respects. For you football fanatics it is also the resting place of Ferenc Puskas.Note the under church can only be accessed by family.

Mesmerising, amazing. A must see in Budapest. The exterior is impressive, the interior is sublime. Great to go and gather your thoughts, and even better to get some stunning photos. There's a 200 Forint entry fee, which is about £0.50, so worth every penny.

Anniversary Concert. Went here for the Ave Maria concert. Husband had spent a lot on VIP tickets that he'd bought online thinking it was the opera (a combination of confusion on his part and mis-selling from the agent). We had a pleasant evening; although I would say that they whipped through the play list, so the concert lasted just under an hour. The quality and the acoustics, however, were good. The soprano sang for 3 of the 11 pieces.The church itself is stunning and it was lovely to be in there in the evening on what was a very hot day.Value for money wise, it could have been better. I thought it was quite expensive and poor husband was sold it as an opera, not a string concert of 7 people. Though they were obviously incredibly talented. I wouldn't visit again, I'd prefer to go to the State Opera if possible.
Beautiful church in the middle of Budapest.. Beautiful church in the middle of Budapest. Make sure you climb to the top of the Basilica for a beautiful view of the city.
Beautiful. Definitely worth a visit ,so beautiful pics do not do it justice ,it is spectacular and has such a sense of serenity
Must See. Beautiful Church. Steeped in history, so really worth a visit, especially for history and culture buffs.
Simply awesome. Incredible views.A great place to take many pictures.Parliament building is just opposit and the view is to die for. A must see when in Budapest.

Gorgeous Basilica. I first arrived in Budapest in the evening and discovered the Basilica with its beautiful lighting. THe next morning we came back to see the church. It is very beautiful and impressive and gives a short glimpse into the beginning of Hungary as a nation.

a dominating exterior. leads into a large and decorative interior with interest at every turn. This church is a powerful statement of faith and is well visited and can get very very busy. You get better ambience when it is quieter and you can appreciate it to the full.
View over Budapest. Thie view from the roof is every penny worth. Inside there is the supposed hand of St. Stefanus....after you have climbed the stairs and got thirsty, go for a good wine to Divino
Best view in Town. We climbed the final steps and were rewarded with some fabulous views over the city and took several photos

Beautiful area, beautiful basilica!. We visited the church at Christmas time; it is a beautiful church at any time of the year, however Christmas spirit added some more; Outside the church you can wander around the Christmas market, listen to live gospels, etc; Allow some time to climb the top of the church for beautiful views; the street that leads to the St. Stephen basilica is yet another great place in Budapest to experience, you will love how the view straight on the Basilica opens as soon as you turn to the street;
Great alternative to the ferris wheel. We just went up to the top of the basilica to see the views. It's a great and much cheaper alternative to the ferris wheel in Erszebet Ter (Elizabeth Square)
Worth seeing. incredible sight to see, do not skip seeing the HAND, on the left side towards the back, in a separate chapel.

Talk to the Hand. St. Stephen's Basilica has something that many cathedrals do not have. An actual hand in a glass case that once was "used" by Hungary's first king--St. Stephen. It is in a back room, so it is not easy to find. Other interesting things to note are the beautiful domed ceiling and frescoes and the chance to hear beautiful organ music played sometimes by music students performing there for their final grade.
Beautiful decor. Wow. Wot a amazing place, decor was fantastic, the details in then ceilings was brilliant. Well worth a visit
Let down. The outside of this basilica is quite impressive but the inside is gaudy, unpleasant and not particularly impressive. Could easily give it a miss

Ornate. Worth visiting - ornate of course, but rather lovely. Not so sure about the Thursday evening concert - the acoustics are not that brilliant for the singer and the flautist, although the organ was lovely - if a bit heavy. Worked best for Bach.

basilia. This visit to the basilica was the highlight of my holiday.The king of Hungary wanted to build this in his name, King Stephen. It is an historic building and attracts many visitors due to the magnificent construction and design of the building.

Walking tour of Pescht. . Enjoyed our tour with Viking tour. As you walk into the main church the glory of God overwhelms you. The golden high ceiling and domes are magnificent. You might be lucky enough to see a bride and groom. See the small chapel around the side.
Unbelievable. The magnificence of the art work takes ones' breath away. Our tour guide provided background information which enriched this visit.
Great Place for Concert. Modern structure with rather simple colors. Great view of the city from upper dome (worth the visit). They often hold concerts and the church has good sound.

Pretty views, ornate inside. . We took about an hour total to explore the inside of the church and the bell tower area with views to the whole city. Very impressive and cheaper than the Eye. On our way down we stopped to see the relic hand which was interesting if not a bit touristy with the pay box to make it light up.

Check on private events before entering!. This is an impressive building from the outside and, probably, equally impressive on the inside. Unfortunately, after we had contributed our donation to the Catholic Church ( do they really need more money?!) we entered the church only to discover that it was closed for a private event! Next time, I suggest you warn people that the church is closed before accepting donations!

Prettiest Cathedral!!!. Over the course of this trip we've visited cathedral's from Cologne, to Melk Abbey to Notre Dame, but none were more beautiful than this one. If you go, be sure to go upstairs and then keep going up for a great view.

Scary priest. Beautiful building but be aware that the "donation" is actually a fee . The people in front of us decided not to donate and the priest very angrily made them pay. I am happy to pay but call it an entry fee.

Great views from the dome. This place is definitely worth a visit - the interior is beautiful and the views of the city from the dome are really good. There was no charge to enter the basilica, they just asked for a small donation, and it was cheap to get entrance up to the dome. Would recommend going.

The largest Roman Catholic Church in Budapest. Home of a Hungarian relic, the Holy Right, the mummified hand of the first Hungarian King, St. Stephen.I love stained glass windows and in this Church I had the chance to admire some of the best I 've ever seen.It reminds me some of the Colonial Basilicas built in the Americas by the first Spaniards, but this one has something unique (I still can not find what)
great view on the top. You can take the elevator to the top to take a panorama view of this beautiful city. Otherwise, the tour inside is also stunning. It also has some Turkish influence as well.

Beautiful and striking building. I didn't pay to go in but had a quick glance through the window in the lobby on the way to the baths; the interior was breathtaking and I wish I had gone in so I would advise that it's worth the fee!
Beautiful inside and out!. Basilica is grand both on the inside and out! Entrance fee is very reasonable (1 euro) and there was no line up when we went in the morning.

Magnificent!. Although this Basilica does not have the age of many of the churches in this part of Europe it is still a stunning example of ecclesiastical architecture. Stop by for a few minutes and gaze in wonder.

Unforgettable organ recital . The organ recital is something you shouldn't miss. The organist, flautist and bass were all Hungarian and they performed a variety of works (all with organ or solo organ performances) chiefly a religious theme. The acoustics of the Basilica are fantastic for creating a grand atmosphere. With candles, floodlighting, ornate decorations and high vaulted ceilings there is a sense of majesty and reverence that we've never felt in any other concert hall.Couple the 8 pm performance with a10 pm dinner cruise on the Danube and your night will be complete.

Awesome. The Basilica is beautiful, Hint! To take pictures inside put your camera on open exposures visit and with a flashlight paint the walls and altar. The results are magnificent!Visit Herrend China works, Lake Balaton as well.

An experience not to be missed. One of the most beautiful neo-classical buildings of Budapest, with construction starting in 1851 and being completed in 1905 before suffering from wars, storms and earthquakes and being reconstructed ifrom 1983 - 2003. The most important Church, and the third highest, building in Hungary dominating the skyline and with an absolutely stunning interior which, literally, takes one's breath away.Regular organ concerts are held in the Basilica and we attended one of the regular Monday concerts - pay by cash on entry - and the experience of sitting in the Basilica and being exposed to the full range of music from the great pipe organ is an experience not to be missed, even if you are not a classical music fan.

Stunning architecture. Went to the Basilica during the day and found it interesting. I wouldn't normally be into religious site but the buildings architecture is amazing and the artwork inside the main area is stunning. Found the room containing the holy relic to be a bit daunting as it is a small, quiet room with pews for praying and not much else. Overall, I'd recommend seeing the building if you get the chance.

Interesting to see part of a Saint. Odd to British eyes to visit the mummified hand of a saint, but well presented and an interesting story. Lovely decorated church. Found it peculiar that there was a voluntary admission fee that was compulsory because a gatekeeper demanded it. Why not just sell admission tickets?
Beautiful!. Beautiful church. Not crowded. Lots of nice shops located nearby and great I've crram shaped like a flower!
Stunning!. Absolutely beautiful. The outside was stunning, particularly due to the wonderful tiled roof, but it was just as beautiful inside. Well worth a visit.

Tuesday night concert at the Basilica. What a wonderful way to end our visit to Budapest by spending a little over an hour in the Basilica listening to a beautiful concert. The acoustics were amazing and the talented musicians were so professional. It was the perfect ending to a wonderful vacation in a beautiful venue!

Nice example of 20th century arcitacture.. Very beautiful throughout. Example of grekk cross and neoclassical design. The tallest building in Budapest along with the parliament house. Symbolising spiritual and worldly equals. No building is permitted to be taller than these.Pay the extra to go to the top and view the city from the tallest building.
Stunning!. Even late at night the atmosphere around the Basilica was festive and breath-taking. There are many wonderful restaurant options near the church. Don't forget your camera!

Magnificent Cathedral. St. Stephen's is a working Catholic Church dedicated to Hungary's patrol saint, King Stephen. The architecture shows eastern influence with cupolas and mini towers rising above the street. Civilization has crept up to the sidewalks around the church so it is difficult to experience the full majesty of this building, but even on the street looking up, it is impressive. St, Stephen's is a must for mass.
beautiful cathedral. if you love cathedrals you will love this one. old, architectually beautiful. a must see on your trup. stain glass, mausoleums. has it all.

One of the most impressive buildings Ive ever seen.. This is truly one of the most impressive buildings Ive seen - globally. I spent hours walking around it and photographing it from the outside. Once entering, I sat in silence and just absorbed the atmosphere. One cannot but be in awe of the frescos and the structural detailing. It is too beautiful for words!There are many magnificent buildings in this world; larger and more ostentatious. However, St Stephens Basilica is elegant, regal and gracious and the dramatic interior is like an unexpected gift.

Beautiful Basilica. It's a stunning structure from the inside and outside. The view of the city from here is amazing. Just outside There are a few people trying to sell tickets. Pass them up. We found the children's choir was free.

Little Italy in Budapest :). The square in front of the Basilica is just like I'm in Italy, I love it! The inside of the church is so amazing and breathtaking....! Huge spaces, fantastic athmosphere, rich decoration. You can really feel yourself close to God.....
Amazing. What a wonderful visit to worship in. A bit busy but if you go early or late it is fine. Inside is breathtaking! Credit to those who rebuilt it.

Vision completed. It is nearly 20 years since I last saw St Stephen's Basilica at which time the first part of the restoration work had been completed and opened for viewing. It was a tale of two halves - half of it was superb and the other half drab and gloomy.Last week I paid a second visit whilst celebrating our Diamond Wedding in Budapest.What a joy it was! This must be one of the finest Basilicas in the world and I have no hesitation in recommending anyone visiting Budapest to put it at the top of their "To do" list - they won't be disappointed.

recoment to catch a concert there. we bought tickets to a great concert from the official tourist information stalls spread around town and that way saw the basilica and listened to a high quality concert, the basilica is beautiful with great aquistics

Most impressive from the outside. My husband and I both paid the "voluntary" donation to enter the church as well as the fee to go up the dome for views. While St. Stephen's Basilica is stunning - large and ornate - from the outside, I found the interior underwhelming compared to churches in other cities. Unless you're a big church fan and it's meaningful for you, skip this one. The views are okay, but I thought that the views from the Castle Hill district were far superior (and free!). See this church from the outside, but save a little money and time and skip the rest.

Beautiful Basilica!. The Basilica is visible from most tourist destinations in Budapest. A stunning structure from the inside and outside. The view of the city from the top of one of the pillars is amazing. It looks especially stunning at night when all lit up- as most attractions in Budapest.

Even after being tired of seeing churches it is fantastic. I am traveling to numerous cities in Europe so I've gotten tired of seeing churches but since this is one of the must see things to do in Budapest I stopped in (it is also one of the few free things open at 9am), and I'm glad I did. It is one of the better ones I've seen. Also the impromptu organ concert didn't hurt. Lastly, just a heads up in case they advertise a free children's choir concert again in the future- it is part of a full on service. They neglected to tell us that in the poster. The kids are pretty good though if you can make it through the service portion.
One of the Most Beautiful Churches in Europe . Hands down one of the most beautiful churches in Europe. I was in awe. Even with the restoration in progress. This is a must in Budapest.
Unbelievable. Got to sing with my choir from the loft above the Basilica. WOW! The beautiful decor just adds to the experience.

Astoundingly grogeous -- daily organ recital!. The Basilica really is among the most beautiful I've seen. There was an organ recital at 5pm. I believe it's daily. It was a privilege to hear those pipes, all 5,598 of them!

Here the organ . See the organ. Amazing architecture both inside and out. Fantastic story of its design and the history of the build.If you have the opportunity attend one of the organ recitals - the resonance of the organ resounding around the Basilica is very special
Stunning. We toured the church and also went to Mass on Sunday morning. The church is beautiful. I would recmmend viewing the art and also going up to the towers.
Wow. The Church looks amazing from both the outside and in, plus only a small, optional donation is required to enter. I would highly recommend a visit.

Impressive!!!. It is the most impressive cathedral in Budapest. You will see it from different points of Budapest – from Fisherman’s Bastion, Gellert Hill and Rose Hill. And you realize that it is majestic even from distance. And when you approach to it you will understand that its architecture outside and decor inside are fantastic.

Must Visit. A stunning structure worth seeing. Entrance to the church is by donation and you could go up to the tower to get a nice view of the city (there is an entrance fee for this). It's a beautiful church and there's even an exhibit of Saint Stephen's right hand in there!
A Must See in Budapest. If you can, go to a concert here in the evening, we went to an organ and soloists concert which was superb. if not, visit to see the stunning, beautiful dome and interiors.

Stunning. Unfortunately, I was not able to go inside the basilica, but the outside is stunning. Everywhere you look there is a picture worthy view. Be sure to get there before it closes. If the inside is half as impressive as the outside, it will be worth the visit.

A must visit when in Budapest. This is such a wonderful architectural building both externally and internally . the inside is stunning wonderful preservation of the artefacts, so peaceful in busy modern city, no matter what religious convictions you have this is a moving place.

Concert and Panoramic views. We enjoyed walking to the dome. We took the stairs and took our time. The cost was 500HUF. The views from the dome were breathtaking.
Later in the day, we returned for the concert. The interior of St. Stephen's Basicilia is beautiful. We enjoyed the concert, Ave Maria Air Alleluja. The cost was about 3000 HUF. I would definitely return.

The most beautiful basilica ever!. When in Budapest don't miss this beautiful cathedral. The interior is absolutely beautiful as seems to be the trend in Budapest....everything in such good taste. The ceiling, the floor, the nave, the apse, all stunning! We had visited the last time we were there but in a hurry and it was all darkish but still amazing.Be sure to check their timetable on their website for the wonderful concerts they hold there.On a Sunday morning we happened by and Mass was in progress. I thought we might not be able to enter but then we saw many people walking in from the side door, so we did too. The whole church was lit up enhancing all the beautiful artwork on the ceilings and all, and so stunning! It was fabulous! we got to hear the choir which was really wonderful. I am far from religious but it was the first time in my life that I felt a semblance of spiritualism (albeit fleeting).

Majestic elegance. We truly appreciated the art and architecture of the St. Stephen's Basilica. You can't help feeling small and humble within it's walls. You can feel this even as you are approaching the building through St. Stephen square. Beautiful statues and paintings everywhere and the main altar is simply mesmerizing. It's vest cupola is decorated with a beautiful fresco. It's hard to describe the feeling and the view that awaits as you walk in. We also climbed up to the cupola on the spiral staircase. I only recommend this to adventurous travelers for it has over 300 steps up and just as many on your descent. The view worth the effort however and you can see the Buda castle and the Parlament building from there with a beautiful panorama of the city. This is a must do in Budapest.
Beautiful cathedral!. We went to Sunday mass here and it was just great! A nice experience. The basilica was just amazing from the inside and out!The area around it was nice to walk around as well.

The Best Way to visit St Stephen's is during an organ concert. Go to a concert in this terrific hall - you will not regret it! The sound reverberation is beautiful. The seats are reasonably comfortable. The price is affordable. You can enjoy all aspects of the building while you listen to the program, offered once a week on Wednesdays. Worth the ticket.

Beautiful. A beautiful building from both outside and from within. The inside is stunning and a trip up to the top gives some wonderful views. There are lots of nearby restaurants and we found ourselves eating nearby in the evenings.

Don't take the stairs. Definitely worth a visit to the top, entrance is free on Sunday's but it's 500 HUF for the panoramic view up on the dome. very nice view... Just remember, 203 stairs is much more than you think

Stunning. This free attraction is a real assault on the eyes in a good way. It's a riot of gold and glitz. If you like your religious buildings simple and low key you won't like it but if you prefer OTT you'll be in heaven. .

Just beautiful. The overriding impression on entering is just warm pink marble. It's a beautiful Cathedral with lots of detail to see. At the front left hand side is the entry to a separate little chapel which holds the relic of St Stephen, easy to miss on a casual walk through.

Beautiful basilica. I've seen many basilicas, and St. Stephen's is particularly ornate and impressive. Not all the basilicas feature the floor to ceiling detail and decor, but this one does. I can only imagine the perseverance of the artists in finishing every detail and stroke. Important church in the history of Budapest since St. Stephen is responsible for bringing Budapest into Christendom. Worth the visit. For Catholics attending Mass, go to the left at the entrance to avoid paying the tourist fee to the right inside the door.

Tranquil refuge in a bustling city. Beautiful, historic building not far from the chain bridge. Inside is a quiet retreat away from the vibrant city. Religious works of art within a huge vaulted space. Take five minutes out from your day to explore this wonderful building. ⛪️

Heart of Budapest. St Stephens Basilica dominates the City skyline. It is in fact the heart of the city to which all roads seem to lead. It is not named after the first Christian martyr (or yours truly!) but Stephen, the first King of Hungary 975 - 1038. You can pay a small fee to see his incorruptible hand!It is built in neo classical style and is not unlike many other similar churches. But the view from the dome is spectacular. Matched only by that from the Duomo in Florence. You need a bit of a head for heights although it is possible to get to the top using two separate elevators if you cannot mange the climb..
You cant miss it. Beautoful Basilica, it is an icon in Budapest. The paintings,just all the sanctity of the church makes the visit worthwhile.

Beautiful Building and Concert. This was incredible. We arrived in and found out there was an organ concert that night! My boyfriend and I rushed in since we are music fans. We bought the cheapest seats in the back, but we sat right under the organ being controlled in the front. The acoustics were unreal, and was my first concert outside of a music hall. I enjoyed all of the performers, and think that the staff was excellent. They are multilingual and euros (exact change which for our seats was 15 euros a piece) card and the local currency were accepted. You can purchase the tickets ahead or at the Basillica entrance. For the regular tour of the Basillica, it's only 1 euro worth for entrance during the day. Pictures are welcome, but keep in mind to be a bit quiet for those praying. I wore a conservative outfit, but it wasn't required. There are cafes nearby, and it's a stop on the metro route.
Brief Trip. This basicilia has a great interior and the surrounding area around the basicilia is nice for shopping and cafes. Starbucks next door!

Prayers and icecream roses. This church is one of the most beautiful churches I have visited. Very holy athmospere in big church build of green and red marble, goldrn pilars and marble statues. After visiting this you may find a gorgeous icecream shop very near. Gelato Rosa is to the left from main entrance of the church. Easy to find, there is always que to get Home made icecream roses.
Beautiful!. Most definitely recommend to do! So beautiful! It's better than the synagogue in my opinion and it's free (except for a small donation)
Lovely!. The Basilica is beautiful and inexpensive to visit. There's a small gift shop to pick up a few items if you wish - cash only.

Disappointing concert. A beautiful building both inside and outside. Worth going up to the dome for the views across the city, and they have installed lifts for the less agile. There are organ concerts, for which there is an entrance fee, one of which we attended. Disappointingly, it did not seem to be the main organ being played, and the acoustics were not good for the accompanying flautist and the bass singer. There was too much echo, and the organ music tended to drown the soloist. Added to this, our enjoyment was further ruined by other people holding up mobile phones and cameras to record the concert. It should not have been allowed. We had enjoyed a much better concert in St Michael's church the previous evening, which we would thoroughly recommend.

Huge and breathtaking. Well worth a visit. The architecture is wonderful - the dome impressive. Baroque at its best. It's the tallest building in Budapest. We also attended a concert in the evening - wonderful.
Stopped by on a Sunny Day. Amazingly quiet and cool in the midst of the city. Loved the way the sun was coming through the stained glass.

Very impressive Basilica. I visited the Basikica atkeastv4 times - attended Mass there last Subday which was great. Itvis a beautiful Basikica and the view from the top is the best view of Buda- Pest. You can walk up or take the elevator for a small fee. Did not attend an organ concert but understand they are amazing. A wonderful,place to sit on the steps of the Basilica and people watch -

Beautifully ornate interior. St Stephen's Basilica should be on everyone's 'must do' list while in Budapest. It is situated in the city centre, walking distance from most of the main attractions, but with plenty of transport links if you have limited mobility or are simply tired or lazy! As with most other significant churches in cities around the world, it sits in a plaza with plenty of coffee shops around the edge, including the novel Gelato Rosa (see separate review) Unlike many other churches, there is no entrance fee.It is the largest Catholic church in Hungary and the beautifully ornate interior reflects it's importance. Take the time to look up into the dome. The Holy Dexter, the preserved, severed right hand of St Stephen is kept in one of the side chapels. If you have the correct combination of coins you can pay for it to be illuminated for a few minutes, otherwise it's difficult to see much.It was busy when we visited, but there was a calm atmosphere throughout and plenty of space to take a seat and reflect for a while.For a small fee you can take the lift to the top of the dome and stroll around the outside balcony for a view over the city. You really shouldn't miss it!

Imposing basilica. This building is very impressive both from the outside and inside. You can go to the cupola and have a great panoramic view over the city.In front of the church there is a large square where you can buy some souvenirs and take a coffee or have a meal.RIP Ferenc Puskas.

Nothing special. It's a big church. It's nice to visit once, but its nothing special. Ok, i am not the best person to comment for this, but i had heard so many things before so my expectations were really high! Worths a visit just to take a photo or two.

beautiful church and lively square. as architecture students we loved this basilica, we had both been to Rome and found St Stephen's to be on a par with the grandeur and beauty of churches there! the square outside is a lively place as so many of Budapest's public spaces are, we attended a wine festival there which was great with the basilica to sit and look at

Go to the Top. I've been to several churches in the last few months: Notre Dame, St. Paul's, & Westminster. St. Stephen's Basilica is just as beautiful. I got the rich history lesson from a friend I'm visiting who is Hungarian. We went to the top and for amazing views (fee for this). There is a very small entry fee. I really enjoyed it.

Beautiful inside and out. This is a great church to visit. If you are fairly fit, take the tower tour. It is high, but the guides stop you twice on the way up and down and give a little talk. The views are outstanding.
Wow. What can i say its a very beautiful church I think if you visit Budapest you need to walk into this Basilica
St Stephens basilica. Very ornate. Worth a visit. There is a 1000 year old hand in there. Only takes 30mins so can easily do it on the way to the bathes.
Spectacular!. We attended a classical concert in the Basilica which was the perfect backdrop for the programme. The building really is quite spectacular and it was a lovely way to seethe building.

A church with a lovely rich feeling. A lovely square outside giving a good view of the imposing front façade, only a short walk from Chain Bridge and the Opera House. Refreshing to be able to walk around the interior of the cathedral without paying a formal entrance fee. I was happy to make a donation for my visit, and didn't bother to visit the areas which attracted additional entrance fees. Although large, the interior had a lovely warm and peaceful feeling and has plenty of rich decoration and stained glass.
Beautiful. You have to see the relic of St. Istvan's arm, just breathtaking and the basilica decoration is awesome.
Beautiful. As we walked by, a wedding had just concluded. We were able to walk into the chapel - gorgeous. Very peaceful and religious.
A Wonder in budapest. Beautiful church in honor of St. Stephen (Istvan). Especially interesting is the chapel with the relic of St. Istvan's arm encased in a casket. Don't miss It when in Budapest.

Mass in a foreign language . The church, centered in a plaza, is so convenient to get to and so lovely to be in. I went to a Hungarian mass there. While I understood 1.0 % of the language, I felt at ease with the similar flow that I was used to in the states.
gold trim. Fantastic golden dome inside the Brasilia that is a must see if you visit Budapest. It's only a short walk from the chain bridge over the river Danube that's another must see in Budapest

Beautiful and absolutely worth visiting!. The best view over the city you will get going on top the cathedral! for kids it may be a bit scary, but you will definitely ejoy the view! inside you will be astonished by a beautifully painted dome. it's one of the Cathedrals i will remember forever! a must for everybody visiting Budapest!

The black hand is memorable. The place is huge and dark. It is nice, but not as charming as many of the smaller buildings in town. But do not miss viewing the hand in the very front chapel. Pay the 200 florint to get the light to turn on while you are there.

This is an important landmark for the founding "saint" of Hungary. If it wasn;t for our excellent tour guide, I would have been none the wiser about Saint Stephen, who has no resemblance with the feast of St Stephen. Basically the founder of Hungary either 25 December 1000 or 1 January 1001. It's especially impressive though some of the buildings adjacent would be better had they not been built there.

Beautiful Basilica. This is also a must see sight. St. Stephen's is one of Budapest landmarks. The inside of this church is rather unusual but very interesting. You can go up on the dome - via lifts - and have a great view of the City. The most unusual aspect of this dome is that when you go up there you realize that the dome you see when inside the church is not the dome you see on the outside. This dome is actually double layered.

St StephensBudapest. My favourite. We spent several hours there The organ was thunderous and spine tingling and we went back to hear a string ensemble in the evening. The acoustics didn't suit the soprano in my opinion but she only sang three numbers. It was a very pleasant programme

Impressive building. Looks quite impressive from the outside but inside is very ornate with frescos and other pieces of art although nowhere near as good as St. Peters in Rome. The lift up to the dome walkway (there is a charge) gives great 360 degree view of the city

Opportunity for prayer and reflection in an architectural marvel. Attended Mass at the Basilica. Added bonus was a Confirmation service conducted by the Bishop. Beautiful building. Also paid to go up to the tower to check out the view which was awesome on a beautiful sunny day.

pretty church- go to the top. It is a very beautiful church. They light it up at night too and it is very pretty. Climb up to the top and you will see great views of the city, but don't go if heights make your nervous. We went to mass on Sunday which was also very nice.. mass was at 10.

Unmissable. You cannot go to Budapest and not see the Basilica.The interior is very picturesque: there is a huge amount of marble used in the floor and columns, and religious paintings are dotted throughout the church, surrounded by gilded frames. There were some particularly colorful stained glass windows, and the altar looked very magnificent. The pews were also tastefully carved. In a small room on the left side of the church, you will find the Holy Hand of St Stephen, which is actually less impressive than it sounds. You have to put a coin in a machine for a light to illuminate it for a short period of time, and all it turns out to be is a blackened dry fist. It may be gruesomely fascinating for some. Climbing up the stairs all the way to the top of the Dome was definitely a highlight, with great views over central Budapest and the River Danube. There was an entrance fee to access the stairs to the top of the dome, but it was not too expensive. The exterior facade can make some great photos if you can get a shot without too many people on the plaza. It's still nice to just stand in the middle of the square and look at the entrance of the building. A must see.
Great place to hang out. Beautiful building, but the energy around it is amazing. They had live music 2 of the 3 nights we walked by. Lot's of restaurants within view. A great place to be.

Wow !. Brilliant . Historic . Worth a walk up to it. Close to deats square. Lovely spires. Stands out from many of the buildings around them. Gorgeous inside. Bus on off stops right outside it if you don't like walking.

Beautiful. We visited during a service, so we could not wander through the whole Basilica. However, it was extremely atmospheric hearing the singing. Unlike some european relgious buildings, tourists are permitted to take part in the service. The interior and the exterior are both stunning.
You can pay and climb the tower.
balance in beauty. Amazing building, both architectually as spiritually. Beautifully balanced. Entrance on the left is for free, entrance on the right is donation advised.
True beauty. Amazing building, makes you feel so small and insignificant...Beautifull architecure, like all of Budapest...
Beautiful Church. We attended a choral performance here. The interior of the church is ornate and magnificent. Very well maintained historic building.

Amazingly beautiful, but a little chaotic. We travel a lot in Europe and attend Mass everywhere we go. While it was in Hungarian, some of the prayers were available on a teleprompter, which was cool. The only down side is that the church remains open to tourists (only in the rear) and that can be quite distracting during Mass, especially with those camera flashes. Otherwise, for the small suggested donation to come in to look, it's a wonderful way to spend an hour or two.
Can't miss in Budapest. It is a massive cathedral. Was in awe by the golden decoration inside. One of the most beautiful cathedrals I have seen in Europe.
Stunning inside. The building is impressive from the outside, but even more so inside. Plus, it's only 200 HUF to get in!
Awe inspiring space!. Here you can view the hand of St Stephen, housed in a gilded casket! Small entrance fee to enter.One of the few places in the City to give English descriptions.

Cool church. This is a very different church than most in an architectural standpoint ( the church os orentated differently). Also don't miss the hand of St. Istvan in the back chapel. It's his actual hand in a case.

Peaceful yet grand basilica with great views from the top. Really enjoyed walking around and up to the top of this fabulous church. Of course, to see a proper relic (unlike the fantastical things they purport to have in the Vatican) like the right hand of St. Stephen, was something special, and the views from the cupola (500 ft each) are well worth the little fee.
Beautiful church. Lovely ceilings in this church that is located in the heart of the Pest side of the city. Easy to cover in a fairly quick span, but a lot to see!

Historic Basilica. Impressive large and historic basilica, relic of right hand of St, Stephen, early Mass in chapel before cathedral opens, also chapel of Poland's Black Madonna. Excellent location - near Parliament and Danube (& nearby post office)

Beautiful Church. A little away from other sites. Worth the trip, but so many great churches in Europe you have to like this. A beautiful city and English friendly. Most sites have Hungarian and English lang. on everything.

Great Piece of Arquitecture. This is a great piece of Architecture. The only reason I can't give it 5 stars is because although it is amazing we have been to other Basilica's (like St Pauls in London) that are even more amazing. As a building, if we compare to the Parliament no building should get 5 stars. So, apart from comparing it to other World Top building this is very much worth taking a look. Also, nice area for a Coffee, Ice Cream or even a Meal.

Gorgeous. I thought this was one of the prettiest churches we saw in all of Easter Europe. Like all churches, there are concerts you can attend here (which we did not) but I could imagine that it would be lovely. We paid a small fee to go up to the top and see the gorgeous views. There was a baptism in the church so we did not get to see the shriveled hand but interestingly, this was not the only shriveled body part enshrined in a church that we came across in Eastern Europe so we didn't feel like we missed out. There is also a Starbucks right by here - which on a boiling hot day and after much walking was a sight for sore eyes!

Beautiful interior and great views of the city. Aside from looking impressive when you are standing in the square in front, it is also very beautiful from the inside. For the main church, there is a small requested donation, but you really should pay more and go up to the lookout. (One note: a guide told us this lookout was better views and higher up than the Budapest Eye ferris wheel, a new attraction - not to mention you are only at the top of the ferris wheel for a short time while you can spend whatever time you like in the Basilica lookout). There are lots of stairs up to the lookout (they post how many) but there are also elevators if you choose. The interior of the church is very pretty and worth seeing, and this is the location of the hand of St. Stephen. While gruesome by today's standards, it was considered holy and people used to make pilgrimages to see it. Definitely a must-see in your tour of Budapest.
Amazing. You should read the history of St. Stephen's hand, and the story of his crown. The building is completely amazing. A must see sight in Pest.

Superb Cathedral in city center. This enormous church is architecturally magnificent and well worth a half hour look see or more. Besides, it is at one end of a short major avenue that leads to the Danube, passing through the hottest city district en route.

StStephens Basilica. A must see visit.Most beautiful interior.History abounds with frescos,domed ceilings plus there is a nave attached with small chapel.This is not another ABC situation and visitors should have a look.Plenty of cafes of the side streets to have some cake and coffee!

Beautiful building. Such a beautiful building.Lovely stained glass and painted ceilings.Peaceful atmosphere and somewhere to switch off from the busyness in the square outside and soak up Gods presence. There are organ concerts 3 times a week which are quite literally music to your ears.

Always a must !!!!. Still the number 1 attraction in Pest.. a church that should be viewed by every visitor to this beautiful city......The outside is breathtaking and when you tour the inside, you will probably be hard to find the right words to describe what you are seeing..All of us travelers have seen great churches in Europe's major cities, but this ranks right up there with the most impressive...Must be added to your list of MUSTS............ the chapels etc must be seen.......

One of the most beautiful cathedrals outside of Rome. if you enjoy seeing churches and cathedral as, this one is not to be missed. They do ask for a donation to go inside, but it is well worth it and needed for maintenance. It's on an honor system, so I would think some people slide by. It has not just a relic, but the whole remains of St. stephen's right hand in a chapel, which can be lit of for another donation for a 2 minute period. There are so many tour groups that come through, we just viewed it when they paid to turn on the light. The views from the top are magnificent.

Truly Stunning!!. Didn't go inside as it was closed but even from the outside and the steps that lead up to it, one of the most imposing and stunning churches that I have seen. In fact the whole square (Szent Istvan Ter) is a magnificent place. Please if you want some visual brilliance, go to the square at night.

Beautiful Building. If you like architecture then this is a must-go. It's very much like many of the cathedrals and basilicas you might see in Europe so read up on the history first so that you'll see it from a different perspective.

We visited and discovered concert being performed the following night so we returned. A beautiful church.. A beautiful, ornate church not to be missed. They hold concerts regularly at low cost. A wonderful experience.
Lovely church . We visited the church on a rainy day so exploring along the balconies and walls wasn't possible. The details were beautifully done - in typical Budapest fashion!

Great architectures. This chapel has a mumified hand that you can see, but some of the hand is missing and placed in different countries. The church is ornate and worth visiting. It costs 200 huf to enter, although i think this voluntary.

Impressive building, great views. The Basilica itself has free admitance, though you are encouraged to leave a donation for maintanance. Inside you are impressed by the dimensions and the architecture. We enjoyed just sitting there looking at the details and seeing people passing by.Behind the altar you can see the mumified hand of St. Stephen. The relic is displayed in a glass box and one can barely see any detail, even if you insert the coin that lights it up - we had a better view from the pictures displayed at the entrance of the room.One can pay a small fee to go up the tower and enjoy an amazing view of Budapest - totally worth it!

Going up the dome is a must. This church is huge & looks stunning on the outside; the interior didn't impress me that much, though I can't but admit that the decoration is very rich. However, the main thing to do here is climbing to the top of the dome. For a small fee you can either get there by an elevator (though you'll need to walk some steps up anyway) or climb all the way up the spiral staircases. There's a small exhibition midways showing different basilicas from around Europe (including St. Istvan's) compared to each other. And finally you reach the outer rim of the dome, from where there's a clear view to all sides, with all of Pest down below, with all of Buda & a bit of Danube in the distance, with all the landmarks like the Parliament, the Fisherman Bastion etc. clearly visible. Definitely worth it!
Brilliant. Brilliant place , love the energy of the place . Can be reached by walk from Erzebet Sq. Lovely dome and quaint chapels

A Breathtaking Example of the Beauty of Budapest. Truly gorgeous, and shouldn't be missed in a tour of downtown BP. It costs 200 Ft to go up to the top, and it's totally worth it. It gives amazing views of the whole city.

Beautiful Basilica which also offers great views of Budapest!. The Basilica is beautiful outside and in, and you can climb (or take a lift) to the top for a few hundred forint where you will find a beautiful 360 degree view over Budapest.
Beautiful Bassilica. This is an easy place to visit, well worth stopping in, certainly worth attending mass. Remember to be respectful.

Calm, Serene and Peaceful. Majestic on the outside - calm, serene and peaceful on the inside. Located in the center of Budapest - this is a must visit - and as this is easily approachable on wide pedestrian streets, it is a fantastic place to see the architecture of Budapest.

Peace in the city. St Stephen's Basilica is an oasis of peace and beauty. The church really is quite extraordinarily beautiful and tranquil, even when full of tourists. And the views over Budapest are well worth the climb. There is an elevator, but you still have to climb the last leg. We stayed for Sunday mass, and after the sermon, a second priest stood up and gave a brief, English translation of the sermon which we thought was a nice touch.
imposing and lovely square. We sat by the basilica which is very central at a lovely café and listened to the bells, saw wedding parties and enjoyed the excellent architecture of the basilica
Imponent Basilica. Lots of details and the right-hand of Saint Stephen in a magnificient building makes it worth a visit! Try a organ concert in it pleases you, because it's also very nice!

What a Beautiful Church!. This church has such gorgeous stain glass windows! The Black Madonna is some thing different from the other churches. There is lots to do in the area around the church. A concert was on while we were in the court yard area. An enjoyable way to spend an extra half hour while in the area.
Amazing!. We visit every Basilica we can find in out travel but the size and beauty if this one is really extraordinary.

Beautiful & ornate church. we visited this church on a crisp ,clear afternoon .the sky was blue & it looked perfect & wonderful,. This church is an important & famous & therefore tourist flock to it & not disappointed . The interiors are baroque & gorgeous ,the ceiling is high & the painting on it are wonderful .we took a trip up to the dome by paying 500 fonts per person .
