The view as it goes is pretty but honestly to me the view inside the church is prettier.

Absolutely beautiful!!. Amazing!! No words to describe this! Myself and my two young children were blown away with the awesomeness of this place! Wish I could have spent more time here. A definite must see!

Splendor!. It might not be the most impressive cathedral from the outside but what you will see inside beats everything you imagined! The finest red marble and gold! It is so beautiful the Russians did not even DARE to let it rot away and upkept it during their entire rule between 1956-1989, even if religion was a thorn in their eye.. A MUST see!

beautiful. We visited here on our trip to Budapest, definitely worth a visit if you enjoy admiring beautiful architecture. It was really cheap to enter too, they asked for a donation equivalent to approximately 50p! English cathedrals/churches take note!

Great tour of ornate basilica. Great basilica in the heart of "Pest" side of Budapest. lots of other sites to see in the area, including the Opera House. Great tour of the basilica with majestic steps leading to the entrance.

Stunning interior.. We visited this as part of an organised tour and the building is hugely impressive.. The roof tiles are beautiful and very colourful. The interior is stunning with hand-painted interiors and lovely stained glass. Very tranquil and peaceful. The view outside is wonderful overlooking the Danube and Pest. Not to be missed.
beautiful. The best is to go into the elevatror and see the city from the high.the Stephen hand is not so important
impressive. I visited and found this beautiful Basilica breathtaking. Entry was by a small 'donation'. The gift shop was quite reasonable.
Beautiful church. We really enjoyed our visit to this wonderful church.They also have a machine where you can buy cute medallion souvenirs .

Beautiful Cathedral. In the centre of Budapest, this basilica is very like those found throughout Italy. Beautiful windows and ceilings and a very spacious feel to it. It's free to enter and feels very tranquil.

"What a beautiful church". This is a must to see it is a lovely church very big an you may take pictures, deffintly go up the dome the views are fantastic and a really good picture opportunity !!!!! ( although a lot of steps)

The centre of so many things. This whole area around the Basilica and 6 October Street has everythingThe Basilica is a great building in itself but it is also the hub for so much more. The street bars and restaurants of superb quality, the National Bank building, the Wheel. When you are at the Basilica you are at the heart of Budapest Walking distance from everywhere
Magnificant!. Awe inspiring church that was free to enter. Beautiful inside. Great photos from the street in front of it. You can go up the tower for a cost and there is a lift.

Concert Venue Too. Not only did we enjoy our visit to the wonderful basilica, we returned one evening for Mozart's Requiem. The seats are not the most comfortable and the acoustics not terrific, but the experience was worth it!
Perfect spot for pic's. one word to describe this building... beautiful!I did'nt get the chance to go inside but spent time taking pics from the outside

Not all Basilicas are the same.... You know the drill.....another famous church, temple, cathedral or basilica, after a while they all just seem to blend into one and become very samey!! Then every now and again you stumble upon one which just stands out........ for me, this was St Stephen's Basilica. I'm not religious in the slightest and have absolutely no interest in religious history, but I love and appreciate beauty, ingenuity and vision on all levels. Just walking around St Stephen's I found a real respect and wow factor for the plush and very grand and heavily decorated interior, it simply is a stunning basilica and one of the nicest I've ever seen. For just a few pounds you can take the many steps to the panoramic views at the top of the dome, which I thoroughly recommend as the views and quiet are quite something. I'd definitely go back here again. Oh.....and go to eat at 'Olivia Etterem' restaurant just across the road....... the best meal I had all week in Budapest and one of the cheapest.

Impressive church. This an impressive building and you only need to give a donation which is good. We also went up the tower for which there is a small charge,but the view is well worth it.there are lifts and there was a display of interesting art work part way up.

very Impressive Basilica. The visit to the Basilica was free of charge, but there is a fee if you want to climb the tower for a city view. While the exterior is impressive, the inside is completely decorated. In the small chapel behind the alter, you find the relic of St. Stephen's intact hand (if such things appeal to you).

Great View of Budapest. A terrific church with beautiful architecture and conveniently located in the city center. Make sure you climb the stairs to the top for some really beautiful pictures of Budapest. Well worth the time.

Attend an organ concert. The basilica itself is beautiful and well worth a visit. Climb the tower and get a great view over Budapest. Even better, go to the organ concert and enjoy the rousing music in the most brilliant setting.

pretty and not crowded. I went to the Latin Mass on the Sunday morning and the cathedral was cool and fresh. It did not stink of incense and I also visited it for a concert organ recital with my mother
Awe inspiring!. A beautiful and awe inspiring building with lots of information about the construction and history of the building and its role in the story of Budapest!

WOW! Jawdroppingly gobsmacking WOW!. This was the place I most wanted to see in Budapest and it didn't disappoint. Absolutely stunning!!! Entry to the church is a small donation which most people selfishly just walk by. It is nice that the church doesn't charge a ridiculous entry like Westminster abbey etc. How long that last is anyone's guest but for now this is a must see. Beautiful pictures of outside at night like most of Budapest's sites

Grandeur and splendour. The first impression inside this cathedral is its generous proportions and spaciousness. The eye is drawn to the beautiful sanctuary with its incredible mosaics. The place is filled with gold which is beautifully reflected in the lighting. The cathedral is named after the HungRian King Strphen who was later canonised to become the country's beloved St Stephen. There is a first class relic of the Saint on view to the public. It is known as the Holy Hand ie the right hand of the Saint.

Spectacular! In the top 5 buildings we have visited anywhere.. A really beautiful building both inside and out. External architecture is majestic and the pale stone complements it beautifully. Inside too, the architectural design is stunning. Many arches, beautifully decorated. The artwork is wonderful and choice of materials just perfect. It is a huge building and a total work of art. Difficult to find enough superlatives. A climb to the dome offers excellent views of the city too.
Extremely Ornate Interior - Free Entry. Defintely worth entering to see beautiful interior, gilded everywhere and coloured glass windows. No charge for entry but you can leave a small donation.

Do visit but be prepared to dodge the photographers !!. Lovely building with beautiful features. The only problem (for me) was that a lot of the visitors simply wanted to take loads of photos with no regard for others and didn't care about the fact that this is a place of worship!! That said, it is spectacular and a trip to the top (the dome) is highly recommended.

Nice church. As someone who has visited the great churches of the world, I can say this is a good solid gothic? church. Very big. Walk up to the top for some great city views. The inside is nice but not the best imo. Unfortunately you must visit if in Budapest.

St. Stephen's Basilica. Just got back from visiting St. Stephen's Basilica. Climbed the tower to a breathtaking panorama. Laid out before one are all the iconic buildings that the 'Pest' half of Budapest is renowned for. Great way of getting a sense of Budapest. Being a Sunday I suspect we were lucky that we arrived early afternoon when Sunday masses were over. Reading an earlier review I suspect that was why another traveller did not get access on a Sunday morning. The fee is 500 Ft p/p. There are 2 lifts. The main one that goes to thr 3rd floor, followed by a reasonably steep climb to the top. Or you can then catch another lift which takes you almost to the top. The interior of the Basilica is vast & ornate. Be sure you visit the little chapel (almost missed it) with the mummified remains of King (cannonised to saint) Stephen's right hand. An important aspect of the Basilica. A must see. The other must is The State Opera House. Guided tours on the hour in various languages. 2900 Ft per person + you are supposed to buy a ticket for taking photos. Worth every florent. The Opera House guide we had was great value.

The roof is unusual and worth the detour.. More spectacular with the ceramic roof tiles on the outside than the inside. Not to be missed the Hilton hotel with its mirrored windows makes great pictures and the fisherman bastion !

beautiful and full with music. it is beautiful and rich. we've been on the classic music concert. children till 14y don't need ticket! the concert was amazing. we got the far seats but we enjoyed the concert very much! on the day visit the basilica looks less inviting then while concert.good location.

At the day of Corpus Christi. We took the chance to celebrate at the day of Corpus Christi.
ceremony ked by cardinal
impressive in this reach surrounding
we walk around as well
we visited a separate hall with a hand of Hungarian Saint Stefan.
Worth to pop at least for some minutes

INTERESTING CHURCH. Beautiful Basilica set in a lovely square. Very interesting inside the Basilica, namely no crucifix above the alter, this being replaced by a statue of St Stephen. Fascinating relic - St. Istvan's hand - well worth a visit.

Beautiful European cathedral. Very beautiful cathedral and well worth the visit. Like many catholic cathedrals who house the partial remains of a saint it has the mummified right hand of St Stephen in the reliquary.

A must for turists in budapest. Enjoyed very much the view around the dome, definitely worth 500 Forints for using the elevator.
Fantastic panoramic view of the whole city from the higher point of view in the city.
Very nice. For non-christian it is another butifull lace. thke the tour up to the observation tower - it has very good panoramic viewpoint over the city.

Quietening.. A beautiful quiet retreat in the centre of wonderful Budapest.
This building is an active church, but also a wonderful testament to the Christian history of Hungary.
Allow a good hour or two to enjoy this haven.
Great views. Really enjoyed the views from the balcony around the dome, definitely worth the 302 steps to the top! (there is a lift for less abled people!)
Great organ concert in a magnificent church!. the church is a beautiful old building and it is the 2nd largest building in Budapest. We attended a concert that was excellent..
Impressive church. Must see at night. . Amazing place. It is stunning lit up at night. Try to get to the roof. Very interesting. Place is beautiful inside and outside.
Amazing Church... must visit the Dome. Went to the Church early on a Sunday. Took a trip to the dome. It is simply awesome. HAs the best views of PEST. Must visit for any one going to Budapest.

Cathedral square not just for tourists. You feel devoutness just when you enter the church. St. Stephen's square becomes very popular especially at night, where from the restaurants - bars outside you can take wonderful views of the lighted Cathedral.
Incredible. A place not to miss. A most amazing Basilica in really good condition. East to get to and well worth the visit

Would be better if it was less popular!. A magnificent building - and well worth visiting - but the pressure of tour groups does take away from the peace and sense of space that large ecclesiastical buildings can provide.

Magnificent Views. The day we visited, it was rather crowded and we barely got a glimpse of St. Istvan's hand, but we did trudge up hundreds of steps to the top of the building, and it was very much worth the task! Wonderful views of Budapest were to be had! Definitely go!

Definitely pay the €1.50 to go to the rooftop.. Definitely pay the €1.50 to go to the rooftop. The best view of the entirety of Budapest...make sur to take the lift as there are hundreds of steps to climb otherwise.

Very impressive church. The church is located in the center of Budapest and it has ceiling paintings, it is very big and fancy. in my personal view, once you've seen a big church, it's enough. but if you are in Budapest, it takes only a few minutes to see.
Stunning at night!. A beautiful cathedral inside and out, reminiscent of St Paul's cathedral, which looks stunning lit up at night! There's a lift up into the gallery if you want great views.

A must see. Came here on a small group tour. Place is beautiful. Guide suggested we go to the top of the Basilica. Really glad we did. The view is spectacular. Seeing the inside of the dome was great. A must do if you come here.

The Uncorrupted Hand. Beautifully gilded Baroque interiors, one of the few "Black Madonnas" in the world, and an opportunity to view the "uncorrupted hand" of St. Stephen in its magnificent glass case - what more could you ask for in a European basilica? Oh, and it's free, as well.

Magnificent location interesting history and architecture. The area all around the Basilica is worth a visit. Very historic area with interesting buildings offering much history if researched. Dont miss the Crow on the top of the Basilica and the interesting roofing.Incidentally there is yet another small garden area beside the Basilica where musicians met to offer excellent music which was a delight and offered a break from walking during a hot day.

Nice but disappointed. A beautiful church but that's all I would say. It's a must see but don't get your hopes up. Also whilst they say a voluntary contribution is appreciated, the entrance is manned and they are looking at how much you contribute.

Organ Concert a Bonus. We visited the Basilica on a Friday and learned of the 8 p.m. concert. Just buy the cheap seats! Really no difference in beauty of the music, only a little closer to the vocal and trumpet soloists in the expensive seats. 11 Musical selections including several classics. Lovely building, much history. Hearing the organ played was a bonus for us. We were not enthused for St. Stephen's hand on display.

Climb the tower. If you visit the Church, then you must climb the tower for the beautiful panorama view you will get there. Otherwise the Church is impressive in it's scale and is very beautifully ornate. You must pay for the tower access but the Church is free to visit.
A must. An absolute must. We went to the top and the view is unbelievable, we took the elevator at a minimal cost, its worth it, there are organ concerts at times, check if its when you are there
A "must see" in Budapest. Beautiful neo-classical interior, spectacular cupola and well-cared for throughout. One of the tallest buildings in Budapest.

Magnificent. A magnificent basillica and so easily reached with a bus stop right at the door. The Hop On Hop Off bus stops there too but I chose to do Budapest independently as such an easy city to travel around

Beautuful. One of the most beautiful Catholic Basilica / Kathedral I have seen in my life (and I have seen a lot of them)! The interior is just amazing, everything shines and blinks, even the walls shine! We were there on a Sunday and during mass you can enter the Basilica with no problems. It gives a very special feeling when walking outside hearing mass through the speakers with the imponant building. Amazing!

Attend Mass if you can. This is a wonderful example of high baroque architecture. Very impressive. My wife and I, although Protestant, decided to attend the Latin Mass at 10 AM on the Sunday included as part of our stay in Budapest. We didn't have a clue what was happening, but the experience was memorable, largely because of the beautiful architecture, the choir and pipe organ. One can pay to ride the elevator to a point that looks out over the city. We didn't but imagine that the view would have been wonderful.
Another Great Cathedral. Unfortunately we saw this at the tail end of a lengthy trip and must say it was OK, but not spectacular. Better, bigger cathedrals are throughout Europe.
Historic. The tours are really the way to learn about all that can be said about the Basilica. The paintings and statues are so beautiful, the entire Basilica is overwhelming.

Just beautiful. A magnificent building, beautiful, peaceful. Just sit and take it all in.
They also hold recitals here, what an experience!

Stately. The Basilica is typical in appearance to many churches built at the time. Beautiful inside and out. In front of the Basilica is a small square with a few restaurants. The Basilica is a must see in Budapest.
A beautiful building. I am not religious but enjoy beautiful architecture.This place is stunning.It is amazing to see how these places were built.

Beautiful. St. Stephen`s Basilica is a must see when in Budapest. The interior is beautiful but you definitely must climb the stairs to the top. The views are spectacular. We climbed up just before sunset.

Must see Cathedral!. Impressive Cathedral. Expect donation at the door ( suggested donation 2 euros). Gilted dome and columns. Highly decorative motifs and frescos and tiles. Lots of gold and colorful walls and domes. Must see .

Beautiful Basilica in the downtown of Budapest.. Very spacious church right in a square downtown. Several organ recital were on the agenda but due to schedule problem we could not attend. The altars were spectacular with a lot of gold leaf. Statues were amazing, as well. It was a functioning Catholic church.

Beautiful typical RC Cathedral. Lovely interior. Lovely exterior which just looms up from the side streets!
Small donation requested on entry but not compulsory. I had no small change so shuffled in with another party, no problem.
Don't miss the mummified hand of St Stephen, at least it's behind glass so don't worry!
Get inside!. It does look great from the outside, but make yourself a favour and spend some minutes admiring the interior. You won't regret it!
Stunning interiors.... A great historic monument of pride for the Hungarian people. The shiny brown marble is artificial marble as the king - 250 years back - did not want to import form Italy.

Most beautiful church I've ever seen.. The bascilica is just so beautiful. I have been to many cities in Europe and this is my favourite church. A must see . It's also worthwhile going up to the observation level where the view of Budapest is spectacular.

Serenity with briliant accoustics. this ancient basilica doesn't look much from the outside but once you step inside you feel the sense of the many who have stood in this magnificent church before you. The carvings and sculptures are incredible and if you get the chance to attend a service you really do felt he full reverence of a very special building. The Organ concert recitals are absolutely fabulous if you are lucky enough to attend one... the hair will stand on your neck. Well worth a visit and free to walk into as an observer
Fabulous cathedral!. No entry fee, with small fee to go up to top of dome. Very opulent, and worth a trip to see both outside and inside.
"Photographic heaven from the top". Awesome architecture well worth a visitViews from the top amazing, plenty of photographic opportunities
beautiful basillica. it is a must see i Budapest, very beautiful decoration. we vent to the small museum in the basillica it was not the good
Basilica. This Basilica is huge and beautiful inside and out. It is a must see. Beautifully guilded and decorated. The alter and side chapels have beautiful paintings.
If you only visit one church in Budapest, this is it!. Beautiful inside and out. Spent an hour just wandering around outside, amazing stonework. Just go and see for yourself.

Awesome. Not much makes me stand agog, but I was stunned by the inside of this building. The fact that a choir was practicing with a soloist was even better. It is free to enter but they ask for a donation of 200 hUF. Although I am glad they don't charge, I would plead wi people to donate generously (not just the 48p they ask for) because tourists want these buildings to stay open and would pay for any other attraction. And yes, of course I practice what I preach.

A Nice Church. This is a nice big cathedral in the heart of Budapest, containing the Hand of St. Stephen. The interior is wonderful, though it is only about 150 years old. There is a small admission fee for tourists.
Yes!. Beautiful church and amazing views from the top. One of my favorite things to do in Budapest again and again!
Well worth a visit. Such an impressive building from the outside and matched inside. This should be on the list of to-dos for any visitor to Budapest.

The True Jewel of Budapest. It is truly a magnificent-beautiful church that sits in the heart of Budapest on the Pest side of the Danube. It is still a grand gathering place, not just for the tourists, but for the locals as well.

Beautiful in and out. Gorgeous basillica in and out , don't miss going up to the dome overlooking the city amazing pictures from there.Every other night they offer different concerts.We went to a Violin and Opera absolutely awesome to enjoy classic music in such a unique environment. Buy tickets outside the basillica.Lovely plaza with not traffic around it, many cafes and restaurants.Beautiful architecture.
Landmark Budapest. Imposing baroque cathedral in the Budapest landscape. Worth a visit for the architectural concept. Visit the sacristy for the dome tresure.
Lovely church. We went to visit this church and found it very nice going to the balcony it is a fantastic view from the top it was by lift so no climbing of stairs.
Lots of history. well worth a visit and go to the viewing gallery for a great view of the city .Beautiful dome and lots of history .

Great church!. Very impressive Baroque-style church; our breaths were taken away when we first entered the church. And they didn't charge an entrance fee to enter the main nave -- unlike some of the other (less impressive) churches we encountered on our trip.

Awesome. A beautiful place to see. It has wonderful art and interesting history. There are concerts performed there at various tie. it is definitely worthwhile to hear one in these spiritually uplifting surroundings.
Stunning. A truly beautiful building inside an out, well worth a walk around. Though there is no admission charge you are encouraged to make a donation of c. 1 Euro.

Beautiful, inside and out!. From the outside, it is a spectacular sight! The inside is even better! And the view from the top...even better!!We started by walking around the big open square. We went around 11am and there were quite a few people but it wasn't packed or crowded. Looking up at the church, you can see where the viewing area is and it doesn't seem like you'd get that great of views...but trust me, it's worth it!We headed inside which costs 200 HUF per person (there's a change store within eyesight if you haven't changed money over yet). I am by no means religious but the interior almost made me shed a tear. Truly stunning! Finally, we headed up! It was 1000 HUF for 2 adults and 1 three-year-old. It was a lot of steps and quite a workout! When you think you're at the top...you're not. There's a little gallery about halfway up where you can take a little break. Then head up some more narrow steps to finally get to the top. You're out on a little platform that goes all the way around the dome so you can see everything in every direction. Amazing views! When you've taken pictures in every direction and given you're legs a break, you can climb back down...which may be harder than climbing up. There is an elevator...but my 3-year-old climb up and down every step so you can too.
Awesome -. Big, and shows the power of the church. Great frescos and worthy of a visit. Although I imagine this is on most peoples top ten tick list :-)
Beautiful and Imposing. This is a beautiful church with stunning views over the city from the top. It's nice to sit in the square with a glass of wine and look up at it.
Stunning at night.. We walked past this beautiful building at night and was blown away. Simply stunning. Came back the next morning to look at it again and take more pictures.

Great view from the top. I think this is a must do! Great views of the city, and a beautiful staircase. The church is beautiful also. Finish then come and sit on the stairs with the locals and tourists and soak up the sun.

Been to many churches, but it still Amazes! . Absolutely beautiful, with high ceilings, gold everywhere and so serene. A definite must to go up to the tower.The first few steps (about 100 of the 300 steps) are an easy climb. The next section is different.If you are afraid of heights, take the lift from the half way platform. If not, take the next 200 steps up metal stairs to the top.An easy climb, but not for those with a fear. A lot of people were scared.The top is beautiful and you can really see everything from there.Going down, either the stairs or the lift again.Worth it.

Nice to sit on the steps in the sun.. The Basilica is in a really sunny spot. It's great for sitting and eating as ice-cream (especially if you buy one from nearby Gelarto Rosa). The architecture and inside decoration is typical continental over-the-top cover-everything-in-gold-leaf-and-statues which is fine if you like that sort of thing. Me? I'll stick to ice-cream on the steps.

Views from the Tower. Great walking tour of Budapest and St Stephens was recommended to visit as well as climb the tower for great views of city.Had climbed so many towers in our epic Eastern European tour and this was a reasonable one to do.At least it was not cold up there unlike Riga and ST Petersburg.

Not just another church. It is large and central in the city. It's side alters are beautiful and the main alter spectacular. It sit in the middle of a plaza and is convenient to everything. It is worth the time.
Spectacular. What a beautiful church. Nicely done and really spotless inside and out. Free to see and amazing architecture and beautiful artwork. Definitely worth a visit.

Imposing outside and dazzlingly lovely inside, and make time to visit the dome. Stephen I, the first king of Hungary, was responsible for the conversion (occasionally under coercion) of his people to Christianity. He was canonised early in the 19th-century, and approximately a hundred years later, Budapest's Catholic basilica was consecrated and named after him. Despite being somewhat boxed in by surrounding buildings, it's difficult not to be impressed by its impressive size. And together with a neo-classical design, the basilica is a prominent landmark in the Palace district of Budapest. Facing the east facade of the basilica from St Stephen's Square, its central dome is flanked by two distinctive bell towers. Above the main entrance, the Latin inscription reminds believers that Jesus is "the way, the truth and the light". Visitors enter the basilica via a side door but take a look at the main door as it bears the images of eleven loyal apostles and St Paul.However, it's really the interior of the basilica that takes one's breath away. The cupola is not as large as the one at St Peter's Basilica in Rome, or as stunning as the Cathedral of Santa Maria de Fiore in Florence but it is nevertheless beautifully stunning. Within the rest of the basilica, many of the arches and walls are elaborately decorated and gilded, so everything looks especially lovely on a sunny day when the basilica receives plenty of natural light. Look out for the pipe organ perched above the pews. Finally, if there is time, climb the narrow circular staircase to see the dome. While not particularly spectacular, you'll notice that it's really two domes, one atop the other. Stepping onto a narrow walkway that surrounds the dome, there are terrific views of Buda's skyline as well as across the Danube River to Buda Castle.

Go up to the roof!. The Cathedral itself is beautiful, but you have to go up to the roof. It costs a little over £1 and not only are the views spectacular, but by walking up there you can see the engineering and carpentry which went into building the dome.

The Heart of Budapest. I was very impressed to see this cathedral . Well every monument in Budapest is just walking from here. and the best this is just there are volunteer young tourists guides' meeting point is just in front of this cathedral. you must visit this anyway .have a nice journey in Budapest.

Worth a visit, if only to go to the top of the dome and see the views. We went here on a,relatively, cold but very windy day. The church is impressive but, when we were there, so full of tour groups that it was hard to get a real sense of its religious significance. We paid the (very cheap) 500 forints to go up in the lift to go up the dome and get a breathtaking (literally as it was so windy) view of Budapest. If you are only in Budapest for a few days, as we were, it is worth visiting.
Breath taking basilica. I was in awe every step I took inside this beautiful basilica. The art work and skills of the individuals who created this masterpiece is truly inspirational.
Awesome. This is beautiful although large very peaceful and spiritual a must whether you are religeous or not

GREAT LOOKOUT. The interior of the Basilica is huge and beautiful. Take the time to climb the stairs or take the elevator to the copula level to see an excellent view of the Danube and across to the Buda side. Worth the climb, but I would recommend the elevator.

Stunning. St Stephens was a short walk from our hotel. I have to say the exterior does not do the interior justice. It is one of the most beautiful churches I have visited. The interior (certainly significantly smaller) reminded me of St. Peters in Rome. The reddish granite, intricate carvings, columns, arches, and altars are a masterpiece. I was blown away. Budapest was the first stop of our river cruise, and I did not know what to expect. To think this beautiful church survived WWII and the communist era is truly a miracle
An orchestral concert. A really great evening in interesting surroundings with the lady on the violin beingexcellent, as well as a tenor, soprano, trumpet and organ.

Unique Basilica. Very decorated interior, with lots of gold leaf, and paintings and ceramics, a real architectural wonder, and well worth the visit , also located along a very busy shopping area of the city of Budapest

One of the most beautiful cathedrals we visited in eastern Europe. St. Stephen's Basilica is one of the most beautiful cathedrals we visited in eastern Europe. After two weeks of castles and cathedrals, it would have been easy to write this off as "another old building." My advice is don't! There is a nominal admission charge, but the beauty of the cathedral is well worth it. The construction is of course awe-inspiring, but take some time to look at the murals, artwork and architecture.There is also a relic of the Catholic church in Hungary in the cathedral-the right hand of St. Stephen. St. Stephen is credited with accepting Christianity on behalf of the Hungarian empire, so this may be a big deal to you if you are interested in church history. Personally I wasn't moved by seeing it, but I'm also not Catholic.

Must see St. Stephen's!. See the beautiful interior and saints memorialized inthe glass coffins. Great views from the hill top to the Danube and city below! There is an optional tour of the church museum as well (small cost involved).

Iconic building. Superb architecture, and a tower that we started to climb, but soon gave up - I have asthma, and was short of breath after about 400 steps! There's plenty to see inside the Basilica, and we spent an interesting hour there.

Impressive.. One of our small group was very religious and this was a high-light for her. We went along and could not help but be impressed by the building. There is a little exhibition near the exit, showing photographs of the construction/planning/etc which was quite interesting. The major attraction for devout believers is the presence of the relic of St Stephan's severed arm. This is kept in a church shaped casket, in a little chapel behind the main alter.
Impressive. This is a very impressive building. It cost very little to visit. Beautiful from the outside and also inside.

Simply Stunning!. This is a definate must to see on your visit to Budapest. Everything about the Basilica is amazing. You will not be disappointed with your visit. We also went to the early evening organ recital held in the Basilica, about an hour long, it was one of the highlights of our stay.

Takes your breath away. This church is enormous and absolutely beautiful. Words don't even discribe it. I is worth your time. You will probably see a bride or two getting their pictures taken outside in the square in front of the church.
The jewel of Pest side. The jewel of Pest side, definitely a great place to visit day & night. It is easy to find good restaurants to eat around it.
The red basilica. This is a fairly modern basilica. The marble decoration is a deep red colour, which gives the inside a more sombre appearance. Some beautiful altar decorations in the chapels.
Foreigners are welcome at mass. I was most pleasantly surprised by the fact that every is welcome to join mass. The choir is so amazing and the ceremony is full of pomp and splendour.

Stunning beauty. The pearl in Budapest's crown.. If you were impressed by Melk abbey,... That beautiful rose marble with lavish gilt adornments, then this interior will just blow you away. The proportions of this basilica are perfect for me. The ceiling and domes decorated in restrained tones that lift the spirits. Sit here and contemplate the beauty of life. A rewarding visit.
A must visit. It is a stunning, beautiful and richly illustrated church. Spend a little time within the basilica to imbibe it's tranquil aura and beauty.

Go to the top. So this structure sits at the end and dead center of beautiful pedestrian street, all very nice. Inside gorgeous decour, interesting thousand year old withered fist. Take circular stairs up, up and up to panoramic view of city. Then we took elevator down. I am recovering from broken leg and I felt very secure on stairs.

Beautiful. We attended an evening concert here, the Duna String Orchestra. What an absolutely fabulous venue for such beautiful music.
There are plenty of beautiful churches in Europe and this is right up there.

My brains just leaked out. This is one of those places that attacks the visual cortex with a surfeit of architectural and religious iconography, until you feel that your brain is going to explode onto the marble floors. The result is a rapid purging of the nervous system of all remembrance of what you just saw. I defy you to walk into this place and casually wander about (as most of us tourists do) and then coherently describe what you just saw after you leave it. Go ahead, try it.Although relatively recent in the architectural church history of Europe it is still impressive in its ability to overawe to the point of befuddlement. No wonder Emperor Franz Josef was nervous that the dome was going to collapse on him.
Wonderful Edifice. This Basilica should not be missed. Our Guide took us to see this and it was indeed wonderful and well worth a visit. One could spend quite a lot of time here admiring its beauty

Must see. I strongly encourage the big organ concert! my husband talked me into the concert here and I did not want to go. I'm so glad I did it was amazing. Take the time go do the tour and the concert if youhave time
St Stephens is a MUST !!!. Fabulous!!!! Loved the story about the Madonna hide in the wall.It is a truly unique house of worship.
Impressive. A must in Budapest. Dont forget to go to the top - amazing view over the city. We visited on a bank holiday and where therefore able to listen to the orgel - impressive sounds.
Stunning!!!. This church is jaw-droppingly beautiful. You must take the elevator up to the top for amazing panoramic views of Budapest.

Must see . Beautiful church inside and out go to the viewing dome from which you can get a 180° view of the City, inside steeped in history and houses the mummified hand of St Stephen also its famous organ which is used during the concerts which are held their on Tuesday and Sunday evenings which I sadly missed on my visit but I believe are a must see according to reports I got from fellow travellers.
Magnificant Church. This Bascilica is well worth seeing , very old historical building with beautiful statues, altars & ornate features.

Not to be missed. The magnificence of the structure should not be missed. From the architecture to the interior design, paintings and altars this is a church to be seen and remembered. Also recommend the organ recitals held almost nightly in the church
Amazing Structure. Amazing structure withastonishing architecture. Both the interior's decoration and the impresive volume of the whole structure impresses the visitor. You can' t miss it .

Brilliant Views. Pest is truly the city that iron built. We visited St. Stephen's on a Saturday and saw several weddings taking place, one after another. We decided to go up on the dome of the cathedral which from below is very impressive and imposing. You can either take a lift or the stairs - we opted for the lift, as we had to make our way to the Opera afterwards. Going up inside the inners of great cathedral, you could see how iron and steel were used to support the structure. The views from up top were splendid and gives one a feeling for the size of the Pest side of Budapest as you're smack in the middle of it. Highly recommend seeing the inside and going up on top.

Beautifuland Spiritual. Often when visiting a famous church, basilica or cathedral there is a lot of chatter and distractions. That was not the case here. There was a peace and reverence maintained throughout our visit. It was easy to pray and meditate--just close your eyes and be peaceful.
Awe-inspiring!. One of the most beautiful churches in the whole world. It's truly breathtaking, everyone should climb up to see the beautiful view of Budapest!
Simply beautiful. this is a gorgeous church. Wonderful place to light vandals for family/ friends who passed on beautiful.
Luxury church. In the same height with the parliament, free access. Every item in gold and silver, very nice statues, pictures on the glasses and the hand of St. Stephen which is kept inside a box.
Lovely church. Really worth visiting, beautiful church. King Stephen's mummified right hand to be seen. Easy to find just up a street with lots of restaurants

Beautiful church with great panoramic view. The church is located at the end of a long pedestrian street leading to a large square. It is very large and is of the Baroque style. It has a relic in it, the hand of St. Stephan. Unfortunately we were not able to see it because the most of the inside was roped off for a ceremony. We think maybe a wedding as we saw a young woman in a white bridal gown outside taking pictures. We decided to pay the fee to go up to the observation deck for the panoramic view of the city. There are quite a number of steps or 2 separate lifts if you can't do the steps. Once you get to the top and go out to the deck it goes completely around the top of the tower. The view of the city is wonderful. I recommend doing this if you decide to visit the Basilica. The church itself is very pretty inside but personally I liked the Matthias Church better.

Stunning church. after seeing many churches in Europe this is one of the outstanding ones. The scale and design are incredible. The story of St Stephen is worth reading and go to the back chapel to see his intact hand.

If you like churches. This one is right up there. Went on a Sunday during a service (happenstance - I'm an atheist) and was impressed with the pipe organ. The church is beautiful inside and is worth a visit. I'll go when less crowded to catch the elevator to the observation areas. Lots of cafes all around.

Beautiful Church. A very ornate and impressive church you can also walk to the top for a small donation to see spectacular views of Pest and over to Buda. It wasn't a great day for us with heavy rain but still definately worth a look.
A must see--only 1 hour necessary. Another beautiful European church with a relic of St. Stevens' right hand!!!! Need I say more? Worth the short time visit.
Wonderful basilica. Easy to find and enter, s good choice for 30 minute visit of a beautiful historical basilica in the center of the city.

Great looking church. And free!. Beautiful building. Inside and out.
Much better than that Matthias church.
And unlike many other tourist trap churches, it's free! So go see it

Beautiful church. This is a lovely place to see, does not cost a penny to go inside (unlike many churches throughout Europe) anD holds the holy fist and a Black Madonna. Do research the silly story of st. Stephan and how is arm got chopped up and sent to various places and how the hand was kept during WWII out of Hungry, send back much later to take its place among such holy artifacts. The church itself is beautiful to see, there are elevators to the top of each side which cost a few Euros, or you can walk up the stairs.

GLAD IT'S NOT MY HAND THEY'VE GOT. The Basilica is both clean and handsome and the view of St. Stephen's severed hand. . .well . . .what can one say. . .it IS unique. But go there for a service on Sunday morning when the choir is in full voice, and even if you do not speak a word of Hungarian (we don't) you'll walk away inspired.
So beautiful!. Incredibly beautifully Landmark in Budapest, surrounded by cafes and bars and short walk to the shops or the river!

Attraction that you should not miss in the City. This cathedral is the biggest in Hungary and for sure you should not miss it . Inside you can find the hand relic of King and Saint Stephen. Also do not miss the views from the Cupola. One recommendation do not pay to visit the treasuries not worthy
Gorgeous. Beautiful church with amazing ceilings and gorgeous stained glass. Worth a visit even though there are so many thing to do in Budapest.
A must.... One of the most beautiful baroque churches in Central Europe, St. Stephen's Cathedral should not be missed! It is an outstanding monument¡

As beautiful as St. Peter's in Vatican. The St. Stephen's is worth a visit even for those who do not like churchs because it is one of the most amazing church in the world. The interior is fantastic and a really good surprise for me. You do not know what to expect until you find yourself inside the buildiong. It is just speechless

what a beautiful church. as the church was not far from our hotel and we went in to have a look. Normally my opinion is simple: all the churches are the same but for this church I would like to make an exception. It is really beautiful.

Sights and Sounds. See the beautiful exterior and interior. Climb or pay small fee to use elevator to go up North Tower. Views of city are spectacular. Do not miss an organ concert (fee depends on evening and event). Afternoon concert lasts about 45 minutes. Several nice cafes nearby.

Great Cathedral to visit. We previously saw this cathedral, but for a concert at night (which is wonderful and worth going to), but this time it was late afternoon and the sun shone fully on the front. We toured the inside which is a grand experience, taking lots of pictures, then went out to the mall to view the front. The sun was square on the face and it was a grand experience, well worth the time to see. There is a separate climb to the dome base which we did not do, but it would give you a great view of Buda and the Danube.

Nice building. We visited this nice church and also went to an organ concert. I bought 2 nd category tickets and we were very well seated. Good quality, good opera singer and very well qualified flute player that night !
Historic church in Buda. Beautifully restored church of historic importance in the Buda part of Budspest overlooking the Danube river. Well worth a visit.

No words. Named after the 1st King of Hungary, is a beautiful Church on the Pest side of the city. Amazing frescoes, mosaics, statues and a great Altar. Must visit.I also attended a concert in the evening at it is worth an experience.
A gem of a church. This church is one of the most beautiful gems we have seen in Europe. The scale, the windows and the colors of marble accented by the gold trim make it a must see.
impressiv. in a lively surrounding, very well visited but also a quiet place to rest. impressive bulding at night beautiful lighted.

A pearl in Budapest. The most impressive and beautiful church I have seen ever,
The fantastic dome in the center of the church, Big candelabra on the walls, and a beautiful city view from outside the dome.

beautiful. This church is well worth a visit. It is quite unusualand in a great location.
Tickets need to be purchased across the square at the ticket booth
Interesting Basilica. Beautiful restored church of St. Stephens. However the steps going up are steep and narrow so once you start up you need to continue no turning back.

Beautiful . The St Stephens basilica is such a beautiful building! You can go inside and even up the tower, there's a lot of stairs but there is also a small elevate you can use, we took the stairs and the view from the top was so rewarding!
A nice landmark. Located in the centre surrounded by cafes and restaurants. There is an elevator taking you up to the dome! Don't miss it.

Imponente!. The cathedral is in the centre of this big area..for the second time a find a marriage..maybe because it is very fascinating to say YES in this atmosphere!the church is enormous and pick all the ancient spirit of Budapest

One of two must-do churches in Budapest. St Stephens is a magnificent cathedral right in the middle of the Pest side of Budapest, and is very significant as a place of worship for many reasons. Marvel at the design and sheer scale of the interior. By the way, the second must-do church is Matayas in old Buda

massive edifice. we were there for an hour, huge structure, beautiful steps leading up, interior very peaceful, carvings, paintings and sculpture.
there is a fee to go up to view the city which we did not do as we already get a superb view from fisherman's bastion.... for free.
starbucks café next door is very nice for a coffee break.
radha aiyar.

Gorgeous Church, Great Views from the Dome. St. Stephen's Basilica is a wonderful church situation in a large courtyard in the middle of the Pest side of the river. I visited on a day when my friend was unwell and after taking in the dark beauty of it's interior I decided to pay the 500forint to climb to the top of the dome and have a look see at Budapest from above which I am so glad I did. Not only did I find the charge to do this extremely reasonable in comparison to most other cities for a similar experience, the views are breath taking. There are two lifts that can take you up there or you can be a dare devil and climb the 302 steps to the top like I did. Being terrified of falling from heights this was a huge thing for me, some of the stairs are quite steep and relatively unguarded. I managed to get up there but took the lift back down. It was definitely worth it however.

Impressive, but .... Any visitor to Budapest is likely to visit this landmark building - one of three highest in the city. Although the Basilica appears to face onto a main road, the actual church façade is approached from an attractive paved square. The outside with its towers and dome is very impressive, and I liked the sculpted figures looking out from the walls. The interior is big and grand and ... I'm searching for a word that expresses my feelings without causing offence! ... ostentatious. My impression was that it is all very large with lots of gold. I have visited many cathedrals, but I regret that I didn't find this one very appealing.

The organ concert was breathtaking. We made reservations for the one hour long organ concert at night. It was one of my favourite parts of the trip. It was organ music with opera and the flute in different short pieces.

Magnificent. The Basilica is huge and imposing. The inside is ornate and beautiful. Plenty of places for a quick prayer or just quiet thought. You can go to the top of the Basilica for around $3 and you will be rewarded with an amazing view of Budapest.

Great view of Budapest. The Basilika is not special in my opinion - it is more or less like other basilikas. However the view from the top of the cathedral is worth the fair fee. There are more than 300 steps up there but there is also elevators to take you up and down. In clear weather it is possible to see all of Budapest and to get some good photo shoots.

Beautiful building. . A must see in Budapest. Interior of the building is beautiful, we took the lift up to the top for a couple of euro to see the best views of the city also. The views were excellent...plenty of photo opportunities. There is no charge to view the inside but they ask for a donation if u wish to give.

Beautiful buliding. We didnt go in but happily spent an afternoon in a local cafe looking at this spectacular building on a sunny day. You can go the the top too, which we didnt but would imagine this is pretty amazing too!
Worth a visit. Our hotel was really close to the Basilica, so we could not go. It is really a beautiful place to see. At night the outside is flood lit.
Breathtaking. Quite honestly one of the most beautiful places of worship in Europe. Take time to light a candle, sit, pray and enjoy the space.

Truly beautiful. Magnificent church both inside and out. Interior is truly spectacular. Pay extra to go to see the panoramic view of Budapest but well worth it. Like the idea of giving a donation rather charging admission fees

Magnificent and a great venue. We went to St Stephan's for an organ concert and spent a good deal of time admiring the wonderful interior. Fabulous detail and like St Matthias it is very tasteful decoration. Well worth a visit.
Worth a visit. in the centre of the tourist area and not expensive to visit......plenty of restaurants etc around this area
Not as good as some we have seen. was a little bit dissappointed with our visit to the basilica have some nicer churches inside than this one. Did not pay to see the panaromic view

Very beautiful.. A beautiful church both inside and out. We were there on a Sunday morning when mass was being celebrated so didn't really have the chance for a good look inside. No time to go back again.

Magnificent church. Spacious feel, and beautiful features. Interestingly it is probably the only Bacilica where Christ is not at the centre. The Saint Istvan is the central image. The other thing tnat REALLY Irked us was being asked to pay for entry. We refused as we are Catholics and we do not pat pay to go and say a prayer in a church!

Breathtaking. Budapest offers a plethora of amazing sights, but this church was simply breathtaking. The ornamentation was epic and I felt awed being in this church. This amazing sight is free, but they do humbly ask for a donation and I highly encourage as there are plenty of lesser worthy sights that demand fees and more for photos and this church has neither.If you're anywhere near this church you owe it to yourself to spend a brief stop to take in this majestic monument.

Number 1 "building to see" in Budapest. Make sure to go and check it out at daytime AND at nighttime. Beautiful building hidden between little streets. Absolutely loved it and when to see it every single day on my trip.
Fantastic church. Very nice building just in the middle of Pest.Curious st Stephan hand relic!. Nice windows and staff. You can go to the tower for a landscape wiew!
Nice interior. The main interior is nice, other rooms are not that interesting. The are regular organ recitals during the day that are for free.

A beautiful church. We had a good visit to this beautiful and important building. It was not very crowded on a week-day morning in April. We also went back later for an organ concert which was wonderful.

Amazing Basilica. We were stunned at the wonderful structure, inside and outside of this church are simply amazing, and different than other big similar churches you find in europe, a must visit while in Budapest...

Beautiful. Beautiful - try and see a concert when there we went on a Tuesday evening to an organ recital with several singers, the programme was excellent and the musicians fantastic, an evening to remember. The concert started at 8pm and finished about 9.10 so not a late finish.

One of those over the top golden churches. one just has to stand there with mouth and eyes wide open and gape in awe
Liked the paintings, sculptures, and all of the gold

A beautiful building in a lovely area.. A great landmark to aim for, such a strikingly beautiful building in a lovely area to relax over a beer or a meal at one of the many bars around it. An area not to miss.
Wow. You will not see a better example of a Cathedral/Church in such good condition anywhere... Considering it was under Communist rule for so long its beautiful

Lovely Basilica. We were fascinated by the story of the hand, you will have to visit to hear more. I'm always awed by the majesty and grandeur of the older churches, basilicas and cathedrals. This one was no exception. As an aside, on the way in through the main entry, there is a small kiosk type gift shop. I purchased a rose petal rosary blessed by Pope Francis for about $5.50 US.

Big & Spacious. Quite a place and full of tourists, almost all the time. You could spend your time outside seeing everything and still be a couple fo hours. Great views of the city of Budapest as well.
Breathaking. a must for Budapest, amazing building inside and out. You have to donate 200 forint to enter but its a small price to pay to visit such a fabulous building. great all around

Worth a quick visit. St Stephen's was big, sure. A relatively new design inside, and felt more like a busy parish than a major tourist attraction. This is fine, but would not be on a short list of must-visits for me.

Organ Recital. Our first night in Budapest we went to the basilica, a very impressive building worth visiting for itself. The organist was a musician who's worked all over the world and hearing the classical programme (including Bach's Toccata) in this setting was almost overpowering. Also a soprano, tenor, violinist and trumpeter. I believe they have this programme every Tuesday in the summer.
Beautiful Church. This is a Church that is a must see. Just beautiful inside. No admission price which is good. Located on the Pest side.

Stunning Neoclassical Basilica.. An awe-inspiring sight right from the outside and the inside. It's located on a nice little square where they had a christmas market until the first of January. It's free to get in and well worth your time. You can see it from all over Budapest so it also serves a point of reference when walking around the city. I was lucky enough to hear a choir perform and the effect of the voices in church was amazing.All in all, a great recommendation

The hub of our trip. Our hotel was less than 5 min walk from here and so we went to the basilica everyday. We loved to sit outside at DiVino and have a look at it and watch the world go by.
Inside the view is nice from the top.

A Budapest Must-See. The incredibly ornate interior is one of THE Budapest sites. I personally find the "St Stephens Hand" exhibit a ludicrous joke, but people do apparently travel miles to see it. Put money in the box to light up the mummified hand so you can see it - no, really.Tip: allow enough time to go up to the dome and walk around it. 320 steps if you're fit enough; two lifts if you're not. The views across the city are simply the best. Go down to the buzzing plaza area in front to sit in the sun, if it's out. Platz is a great bar/cafe there. Montmarte is not: avoid that one.
Magnificent. Magnificent outside and just as imposing inside. There was a service for a school party when we went inside, gave some atmosphere to the visit.

Breathtakingly beautiful!. Such a large church with soo much to see. Free entry and only a small charge to see the roof. The details on everything inside and outside is enough to stop and stare for hours.
Beautiful Place!. It was a nice place to visit...the line was a little long. Probably the best place we saw in Budapest.

Beautiful Basilica with amazing views from the ramparts. We visited during the Easter Ceremonies and the atmosphere was amazing...it's worth taking the lift up to the outdoor ramparts for great views over the city.It would add to the experience if they installed some signage to inform visitors of the views from each side of the ramparts.

Bring a picnic lunch and enjoy the view from the tower!. there was a service taking place when we visited. We had a pleasant browse around, and noticed the steps going up to the tower, just as we were leaving. We paid the small entry fee. And boy was it worth it! Climbing up and seeing the interior is an experience, and then at the top. Well, the views naturally are brilliant. We spent about an hour walking around, pointing out points of interest to each other, finding our hotel, places we had eaten etc. we took lots of photos for other visitors up there too! We wished we had brought a picnic lunch! All in all a very pleasant piece of sightseeing!

Another Beautiful Church With A Miracle To Boot!. St Stephen's Basilica is simply awe inspiring and compliments the wonderful city of Budapest. No visit to the country is complete without visiting the church which honors the man who brought Catholicism to the Magyars. Inside, you can see the hand of St Stephen which did not deteriorated after his death. However, the beauty of this place is the inside of the basilica itself. Do not miss this one. Time permitting, head next to Estergom to visit the marvelous church there.
Overpriced, in our opinion.. A beautiful church but expensive to visit, even with the simple museum included. For that price, a tour should be included.

CATHOLIC GILT?. The gilt I refer to is all part of the lavish decoration adorning this wonderfully impressive Basilica in the very heart of Budapest. We arrived during a well-attended service, so we were not able to walk around on this occasion. The many visitors attracted here can if they wish ascend to the building's great dome to obtain a bird's-eyeview of the city beneath. Organ lovers may like to know that St Stephens runs a series of summer recitals on what sounded to us when we heard it like a very beautiful instrument indeed - blessed, of course, with a massive, wonderfully spacious acoustic.

Yes! go here. Do visit the St. Stephen's Basilica. Its impressive from inside and outside. The entrance to the Basilica you have to donate something, but I entered even without donating. So I would say its free. But the secret tip is to go up the tower. Its got a wonderful panorama view. You have to pay 500 HF to get up, about 1.5 Euros, but that's worth it. You have stairs and elevatorThis is probably the center of the city center, so you will be able to reach everything else from here as well. The Basilica has a large courtyard in the front to stroll around. And many restaurants and shops in the lanes in front and side.

Stunning . Gorgeous building inside and out! I would definitely recommend this attraction. Surrounded by lots of lovely restaurants and cafés so you can sit and admire. My husband and I sat on the steps eating our Chinese take away, lovely.

Budapest's largest church. This Basilica and the Parliament are both 96 metres high being the maximum height permitted in the city. It was only completed in 1905 having taken fifty-four years to construct. It benefits from the large open square in front of it and internally the dome and gold decorations are magnificent. In a chapel at the rear of the church is the almost 1000 year-old mummified hand of Saint Stephen the first King of Hungary. It is kept in a glass case.
Beautiful church. A beautiful church with some interesting history. Worth the walk to visit. Only 200 forins to enter. The equivalent of 72 cents.
A must see!. A must see! She is beautiful inside and out. Very near many of the other attractions in the old city

Don't forget the view from the top-360 degree Budapest at your feet!. Beautiful church in the middle of the city. Don't miss the relic (the right hand of king Stephen/ István) in one of the chapels (easy to miss). Take the elevator up to the outside terrace to see the city laying at your feet - truly wonderful! If you want to walk up the last bit, you can skip the second elevator and use the stairs instead. You are rewarded with a glimpse of the big cupola from the outside, the "backside" of it in plain English! Make this trip to the terrace both in the morning and the afternoon and you will see Budapest 360 in the best light!
Well worth a visit. Don't tend to do loads of churches when away but have to say this was well worth a visit. The work that has gone into the beautiful windows, pillars & ceilings. Quite stunning
Great majestic church!. Great ornate structure on such spacious grounds. Interior was breathtaking with lavish gold decorations - the outside view at night was worth another visit as well.
Huge. Stunning. Beautiful. Well, you feel soooooo small just standing next to it... It's really awesome. It is definitely worth visiting.

Worth a Visit. St. Stephen's Basilica, the largest church in Budapest, is dedicated to Hungary's first king, St. Stephen. It was completed in 1906 after 6 decades of construction. One of the 'treasures' in the church is the mummified right hand of St. Stephen in a glass case in the chapel area of the church. There are also several beautiful stained glass windows throughout the church.

Must see while in Budapest!. The church is beautiful, classic, modern and magical, inside and out. I've been to hundreds of churches around Europe and the world. This one is impressive! It's not the Notre Dame but still very beautiful. Beware of crowds! There's a few cafés right outside the church (with wifi) so if you want a break from sight-seeing, I recommend going there. Enjoy!
Stunning!. Absolutely beautiful try the walk up to the panoramic view it's a long way up but there is a lift!! The view is well worth it

Great view of the city from the top!. Pretty church with a great view from the top! There are two ways up...stairs and elevator. ...however, just because there is an elevator doesn't mean that you will not have a few steps to climb... If you choose to take the elevator, you will actually go up part of the way in one elevator, walk thorough a small gallery, walk up about 8 steep stairs, get on a smaller elevator (4 people max) and then go up about 16 to 20 more steps to get to the top. It isn't too bad, but if you have mobility issues, be aware that there are stairs to navigate. Unfortunately, it is not wheel chair accessible.
Great view from the tower. I am not a fan of churches but I recommend going to the tower (there is a lift) to see an amazing view of Budapest.
Gorgeous. The interior of the church is splendid and it's well worth it to spend a few forint to go to the top of the dome. The view from above is second to none.

Absolute favourite. Great architecture, beautiful ceilings, grand chandeliers. I spend an hour inside during the Sunday mass and then outside just enjoying the sun and a cup of coffee. Very relaxing place in a nice spot in the city. I kept coming back again and again during my 3 days stay.
One of best Basilica's in Europe. I just loved my visit fo Basilica of St. Stephen.It has great rooftop view, it is free to enter and is very easily located just 500m from chain bridge.

Nice building. We entered at the cost of a small donation and were very impressed by the interior in terms of decoration & size. It is good for photos both inside and outside - but there is not much more to do than this.

Opulence. Designed by the same architect who designed the Budapest Opera, this is another grand building. Plenty to see inside, as well as a magnificent entrance. Go and look at St.Stephens hand, it has been on a European tour over the years. Take a walk up to the tower, of just be lazy and go in the lift. Here you have the best views of the city.
Central attraction. Packed with symbolism, this Basílica is central in Budapest at close proximity to the river, Vaci Street and other landmarks.
Well worth a visit.. Some fabulous architecture and decor. No issues with using your camera. I welcome opportunity to sit and take a break from sightseeing.

great 360° view. costs little to nothing, is a tiny exercise and gives you great views over the city - would definitely recommend everyone who isn't afraid of heights and narrow stairs to go up to the tower and simply enjoy everything from up there (there is an elevator too - but walking upstairs is half of the experience)
Beautiful. Beautiful Basilica. A bit too dark for good pictures but beautiful nonetheless. Loved going outside on the observation walk at the top. A wonderful view of Budapest.

Be sure to go to the top. St. Stephen's it's a wonderful place to visit and must be on your list when visiting Budapest. We went to the top of the dome and got a beautiful view of the city. The architecture inside is stunning.

Stunning. Timing is everything and we got here just as a wedding was ending and the recessional beginning. We watched the bride and groom as they left the church through the main door (the one that the visitors don't use). After we visited the church itself, we bought tickets and went up to the dome for the panoramic view of the city. It's mostly elevator with just a short flight of stairs at the end. BUT, you have to exit the first elevator and then find your way to the second elevator. We were there with someone who knew where to go, otherwise, it is very confusing since I didn't see any signs at the top of the first elevator.

Domed cathedral dominates the capital. This basilica has a picturesque exterior and the walk to its main doors from Sczhenyi square is great for a photo. We walked up the 300+ steps to the balcony around the dome and the vies over the whole city were rewarding.

A neoclasical church with great views from the dome.. Well worth a look inside even if this is not your normal thing. Taking pictures is allowed and the stain glass windows and domes along with the interior walls make it worth a visit. Take a lift and then stairs up the dome for great views.

Beautiful. This church/cathedral is absolutely stunning inside, I've never seen so much gold leaf. We didn't visit until the end of the day and a recital was just finishing which we missed, so it's worth visiting earlier in the day in case there is a concert later on.

Very Impressive!. This is an amazing place with incredible sculptures and architecture and it is free to simply walk through the building and see the magnificent artwork and detail of that work inside.

A Beautiful Church. The interior was absolutely amazing - we were told 38kg of gold leaf was used to embellish the carvings - the church must have been a beacon in the not to distant past of this beautiful city.

Beautiful Views. The Basilica is beautiful from the outside, but for only 500 HUF per person, we went up to the top where we saw stunning views of Budapest. On a clear day, this is a great way of seeing panoramic views of the city as you can go all the way round. Be warned there are quite a few steps to climb (though there is the option of a lift for the last few sets)! We didn't go inside so can't comment on that. Highly recommended!
Tremendous. Perhaps the biggest church I've ever been in. I was not so lucky, but some friends was visiting on sunday, with a concert, it was breath taking experience.

Wow. These iconic buildings never seem to disappoint, the hand of course is the biggest attraction being that it is a 1000 years old! The internal decor is stunning and you can also participate/listen in to a sermon. Perfect opportunity for great photo's.
Visit. Just lovely, easy to find and free entry, a short walk from the chain bridge and other sights.Even if you don't like churches it's worth a look.

Re: landmark. It's a must see in Budapest area. We did two half days of the walking tour and this was the last landmark we saw. It's amazing from the outside and inside. Our tour guide, Kati led us to St Stephen's relic. Be sure to see the relic lighted up.

Worth a visit. This basilica is incredible from the inside and out. It's impressive architecture on the outside is reinforced with incredible art on tehe inside. Don't miss the hand of St Stephens which has been spookily preserved for centuries.This basilica is one of the highlights of Budapest.

nice panoramic view from the top. More than 50m tall dome from the 2nd half of the XIX.century with nearly 400 stairs, but you can use elevators as well. The construction lasted 50 year long from 1851 due to an engineering failer and the collapse of the main dome.Giant inside with rich decoration - the scene of the movie "Evita" with Madonna
another buitifull building. a highly decorated building with a buitifull dome towering upwards.smaller chapels around the main building also highly decorative. free entrance but donation requested.
Best city view!. Don't forget to go up to the cupola where you can admire the most beautiful city view! Definitely recommended!

Must see. Another 'must see' and trip up the tower well worth the effort.The inside of this basilica is amazing. It has a beautiful alter, ornate ceilings, spectacular stain glass windows, organ, pulpit, sculptures and paintings. Thebasilica is very large and no expense was spared in building it.Probably the most beautiful place I have ever seen. Totally breathtaking!
Breathtaking. This church is one of the amazing churches I have ever seen. Its very spiritual, there was a chant concert at the time and it took my breath away. Amazing experience

Lovely Church, Worth a Visit. Was fortunate to enter the church during a service...lovely church, cold inside (as most European churches are), but huge and inviting.
Didn't see whether there were any tours, so just wandered a bit...being mindful of the service.
Beautiful view!. The roof has fantastic city views - well worth a visit! Both elevator and stair options - the stairs are steep, though not impossible for those who are more ambitious.

Must-Visit Monument. Amazing church that you fell in love even if you are far from a religious guy. Amazing architecture that will leave speechless. No admission just a a small donation for the church
Very picturistic. Hard to miss it from Cat cafe to the parlament walk. Big building,very decorative and gorgeous to take picture of it.

Awesome golden rooftops. On one of my few free evenings, I attended a short service at the Basilica and made a small candlelight prayer. There were no tour guides at the time but the view of the rooftop from inside was indeed awesome perhaps more than the imposing view of the Basilica from the adjacent Andrassy street.
Another Beautiful Building. Worth a visit to this lovely Basilica, Holds the mummified hand of St Stephen!, Frequent concerts are held here - tickets can be bought on the door

Impressive. No entrance fee so another pleasant surprise in . Budapest.Really ornate with a beautiful dome. An especial treat was the organist practicing for the concert tonight. The area at the front of the church is much more classy than the streets behind it.

Gorgeous Church!. Everything about the Church is wonderful - a gorgeous church worthy of a MUST SEE on your Budapest visit. Although be careful of the staff - they can be quite rude! We had the mishap of running into one guy who was extremely rude when we inadvertently tried to take the lift to the top of the church before opening hours. The lady at the small gift shop also was rude when approached about how to navigate the elevator system but she quickly apologized when I told her that after our encounter with he rvery impolite collegaue I was not in the mood to be met with rudeness again. However the beauty of the church overshadowed our interaction with their personnel.
Visiting Budapest. I wanted to visit this church after reading about it on trip ad visor & was not disappointed the square were it is is beautiful also with cafes it's busy but not too noisy

Breathtakingly beautiful!. We like going into this kind of place and this did not disappoint. We also had the bonus of attending the organ concert (every Monday) which was very well attended.The interior is as spectacular as the exterior.If visiting cathedrals is your bag, then you will spend a very pleasant time in here.Obviously, it is full of tourists taking pictures, but that's the nature of this kind of landmark.In short, worth the visit.

Don't miss it!. They have organ concerts here, most times with an opera singer. The basilica itself is just beautiful -- so magnificent. We took a taxi there from our hotel and when the concert was over walked over to the Four Seasons hotel to get a taxi back to the Boscolo. On your way over to the Four Seasons down the promenade, you'll find lots of great restaurants and shops to visit.
Bazilika. Impressive building from outside and inside,great architecture,get the elevators to see all the surroundings.

Amazing . One of the most amazing things i've seen in budapest. Just make sure you have 200huf with you. They want a donation upon entering and lots of people block the entrance due to not having a 200huf coin (they don't give change, because you drop the donation in a box).

Amazing. The building is very big with great architectures, very beautiful.. With great interiors, its so stunning.. Me and my friend also going to the tower and enjoy the amazing Budapest city view from up there. But at the time we went there, its so windy. My friend almost drop his phone when he try to take some picture and suddenly the wind blow so hard. But still you must go up there to enjoy the view.. Really amazing..
Beautiful. Beautiful church, architecture and design georgeous. Climbed 300+ stairs to see from the basilica ... what a view of the city and beyond!

Beautiful Building with Odd Artefact. Very beautiful building with exquisite artwork all around. The ceiling is amazing. The odd artefact is poor old St.Stephens right hand. I'm sure that he would have preferred it to have remained with the rest of him!! There is quite a lot of information in English and details of the construction ( and some of the destruction) Lots more information on Wikipedia. There is a lovely square outside the building as well

Massive.. Reminded me of Vatican City in Rome. You won't be disappointed and this church is located in the high tourist area. Many shops are on either side as you walk up to the church from the chain link bridge.

Amazing light!. I want to live here. The basilica is beautiful, ornate, and impressive. The day we went, warm, glowing light bathed the floor and walls. Definitely take the time to climb the stairs up to the tower for views of the city (small fee, bring some hungarian forint). The square is also grand and beautiful. Check out King/Saint Stephen's miraculously mummified hand. Not to be missed.

One of the nicest buildings in Budapest!. A great and imposant building. Because our appartment was in the vertical street across from the Basilica we walked by it erery day muliple times, but still I was impressed by it's magnitude!

Beautiful. Expansive Basilica with a beautiful dome, marbled walls and floors, sculptures, and impressive paintings. Don't miss the relic right hand of St. Stephen. It is in the chapel in the back left side of the Basilica.

Stunning Interiors!. If you have time, take the stairs up the tower of the Basilica to enjoy breathtaking views of the City! The interior walls are clad in beautiful coloured marble stone! A must see!
Beautiful. We have visited Budapest in Easter, so they had big services there with a lot of people. It is very nice from the inside and outside. I would recommend visiting it.
Remarkable work of art. Breathtakingly beautiful with its enormous red marble pillars and paintings. This church is definitely one of the best I have ever seen.
Majestic. Imposingly from the outside and truly amazing inside. A monument of the city that must be visited as it is one of the symbols of Budapest. I would recommend visiting it.

Not very old and not very interesting.. The basilica is barely a century old but built in the grand neo-classical style with a bit of baroque thrown in. All they missed out is what in Britain would be called Victorian Gothic! So, it is big and it holds the hand of St Stephen after its peregrinations over many centuries around Eastern Europe and which landed it in Hungary. If you pop a few coins in the slot, the hand is illuminated. I think some folk stand around the reliquary that contains the hand in the hope someone else will drop some coins in.The rest of the basilica is big and rather ordinary as cathedral-like buildings go. Still they only suggest a donation for entry. I believe that the organ concerts that are held regularly are worth attending to hear the great organ but we missed out on those. Perhaps that would be the way to experience this otherwise ordinary if very big church building
Beautiful. This has got to. E one of the most beautiful churches I have been in. The paintings on the ceilings and walls decorated with gold are stunning. This is a must see.
Fascinating basilica!. It is really very importante to visit St. Stephen's Basilica. Its beauty is amazing! At night it is worthy of a visit too.
Nice church. Although i did not go in, the exterior of the church was truly beautiful. One of the best churches I have ever seen.
Majestic church, great panorama. Really great, you should check it out. The admitance price is totaly worth it. It holds the hand of the Saint patron.

Magnificent. We attended Sunday morning Mass on our visit to Budapest. This was a very moving experience for us albeit in Hungarian and Latin. The Mass also included wonderful choir singing and the magnificent organ. Hundreds of worshippers attended and of course tourists are not permitted to wander about the church during the Mass, although they are welcome to participate. When visiting the Basilica as a tourist (admission charge applies) the church is lit with natural light. At Mass the church is additionally illuminated with the numerous chandeliers and looks even more magnificent.
Views. Climb the stairs or take the lift to fully appreciate the magnificent views from the top! Great restaurants around this spot too.
