Worth a visit. The most beautiful basilica in Budapest.At the door there is a suggested donation to enter and visit the magnificent interior of the church. You can also pay a little extra and climb the tower for panoramic view of Budapest either by stairs or elevator.
Beautiful place. Beautiful builiding, nice area to visit around. entrance paid if I remember correctly 1000HUF, lots of tourist around, but in April we had no problem to get to it.
Amazing. Beautiful, the building (especially the ceiling) was beautiful, very Rome!!! Can't say there was anything i disliked!!

Just beautiful. Not being religious , we were a bit "ho hum " about seeing this Cathedral , but religion apart this is a beautiful building almost on a par with Gaudi's Cathedral in Barcelona and is well worth a visit . Photo's are allowed and there is lots to photograph including the ornately painted ceilings...ar la The Cisteen Chaple.
Beautiful Basilica. I did not do a guided tour, but just walking through the on my own. It took my breath away. It is beautifully maintained and in amazing condition.
Breathtaking Views and Beautiful Inside. Truly magnificent inside. Photos don't do justice to the grandure, scale and intricate detail of this beautiful building. Would highly recommend visiting.

Fine position and building.. Not encouraged to sit as so many rows were roped off.Quiet is requested.Don't miss the well travelled "Holy Right Hand" of St Stephen.Would be good to hear an organ concert here.

gorgeous. I literally burst upon this while wandering lost and what a sight! The square before it is totally open and has some decorations. The inside is gorgeous. 4/5 because I tried to climb the belfry but they told me it was closed despite being during the stated opening hours. I tried to ask why but they just said "open tomorrow". I didn't go back for it.

Beautiful. A sacred place with vast history,the architecture and amazing sculptures decorate this huge Cathedral.
Pay a little extra and go to the top....worth it!
Church looks incredible.. Church looks incredible. Must necessarily climb the tower for an incredible view . The price to rise 1.7 euro / adult and 1.3 euros / child.
Spectacular Views. We were told 360 stairs to the top (altho there is a lift too) but the view is worth the effort - it offers 360 degree views of Budapest.

Visit. Great thing to do. Please go up in tower and enjoy the view(s). You will not regret it.
Inside it is also beautifull. There was a summary going on when we visites, so we missed a lot, but still a must do.
Beautiful and wonderful view from the top. Lovely view from the top well worth the climb but there is an elevator, 500 HUF entrance fee. Budapest is breathtaking when viewed from this height.

Entrance Fee ?. Unbelievably beautiful cathedral in the midst of the city Center .. It was just unnerving to see a big, big dude in a knight's cape standing by as people throw their 250 huf into the pot to gain access.

Red Marble Interior. There was a suggested donation to enter. Magnificent interior. Went into the chapel to see the mummified hand of St. Stephen, but it is difficult to see in the metal and glass container.
Worth a look. Loved the scale of the building, the acoustics, & the choir singing the Hebrew Slaves Chorus from Nabucco during Communion at 5pm Mass brought tears to my eyes.

Worth a visit. inside the church is gorgeously decorated. To go inside the main part you are asked for a donation of 200ft each. There is an exhibition at the back left side of the church where you can go and see the mummified hand of St Stephen. We went through out of curiosity. It is in a box which is dark and you are then asked to pay some money to get a light to show the hand. It just felt that everything was being up sold. We then paid to go up to the top. To do this there is an initial stone circular staircase and then you get to a room where you can either get an elevator or go up these metal stairs. We went up the stairs. I must say I never thought I was bad at heights but these stairs were awful. You can see right through to the ground and they seem to twist and turn forever. It's safe to say I had to get the elevator down.The views at the top are lovely. The observation area isn't very wide so be prepared to rub past people once up there depending on how busy it is.

Breathaking view. The interior was a bit too ornate in my opinion but still very beautiful. The view from the top was breathtaking. It's one of the tallest buildings in Budapest so you could see the entire city. Great organization - there are stairs and elevator to the top.

Beautiful. We strolled to the Basilica and were greeted by the sounds of beautiful singing outside. It seemed anyone could join in. The basilica is impressive from the outside and once inside you feel a part of something special. Entry is by 2 florin donation, well worth it.

Take the elevator up. Visit the basilica in doors, but It worth the 500 Ft. to take the elevator and go to the top. The view from the top of the city is very nice, you get a good perspective and you can take pictures.
Nice!. Beautiful church, very large - the largest in Budapest, Gothic style. Definitely should not miss! You can also climb in the tower to see the city panorama (you have to pay a fee).

breathtaking architecture. I have visited many cathedrals but this was one of my favorites. It was hard to narrow down my photos because every one showed another work of art or magnificent window or arch. Don't miss this when in Budapest.

Amazing place to visit. Very different from many other European basilicas, it is truly an amazing place.
Stone work is brilliant and the various chapels add to the complexity of this building.
Worth at least a short visit!

Stunning and breathtaking. It pays to remember that this is a working church with a congregation. The interiors are just stunning and no charge to enter. Take your time to find the smaller chapel at the back. Not too busy and sit and enjoy the history.
Beautiful church. Very impressive from the outside, really beautiful building and the interior is amazing, well worth a visit
beautiful place. it is a marvelous place to visit when you are in Budapest. also very impressive. it is near to the Parliament, so you can connect these 2 points of interest.
Beautiful church. This is a beautiful building worth a visit. The remains of St. Stephen are in the church. I would recommend.

Review of the basilica. I love this cathedral, but I have reviewed it before here. here, I will concentrate on the viewing area at the top of the Cathedral. There is a small fee to enter the viewing area (Ft 500, for adults). You do have to walk up several hundred steps, so, be aware that there is a long and steep walk ahead of you. There is an elevate available, but many people in line for it, therefore, you may have a long wait. Ultimately, I have to say, the view is not worth the effort. Most of the view is obstructed by the surrounding buildings, and you can hardly see anything of interest. Indeed, even the Danube is not visible. If you want a really great view of Budapest, take the funicular up to castle Hill, and get some great views from Fisherman's Bastion. You cannot beat those views, and they are much better than the view from the Basilica.

Average for Large European Churches. Having been to many Basilica's and large churches, this one is nice, and worth a walk through if you like old churches like we do, but it's nothing special to go out of your way for. The view from the top is no better than that from the castle so no need to do both.
wow. this is a massive church. The architectural inside is amazing like any other churches we visited in Budapest. so impress
Beautiful church. Beautiful church to visit. Marvellous landmark and very ornate ceilings an altar. A nice place to sit, reflect and to say a prayer. Free entry although they do suggest a donation.

Climb the 300 odd steps !. I highly recommend climbing those 300 odd steps to the top of the dome I was there on a sunny clear day and the views were matched only by the Diomo in Florence. It was also really interesting to see the inside of the dome, as you climb

St Stephen's Basilica. If you like visiting churches then it's a must.
It's like any other Basilica that I have visited & we had to pay 200 HUF

Nice Architecture!. This place is very nice! The building itself from the outside looks awesome! The inside is a must see, although I am not religious, I still came and see how beautiful it is inside!

Pretty Basilica. It is surprising that this basilica survived communism in tact and still as beautiful. It is as lovely as some of the others in the rest of Europe. One can tell it is not as used as a by the smell alone. There is a small donation that is asked for as you enter.

Very beautiful. We attended easter Monday communion service it was very moving to be in such beautiful surroundings with the sun streaming though the stained glass windows and the easter flowers decorating the basilica

Beautiful. This church was beautiful. We paid a little bit extra to go up in the dome and the views were fantastic! The inside of the church was beautiful and peaceful as well. Our kids enjoyed walking thru the church as well. I definitely recommend going up to the dome. There is a lot of steps, and you can take a lift for part of it.
Worth the clime. Yes I mean it go and see this magnificent building and take the time to cline up to the top to see the castle as well the city from a different angle.
Impressive church. We only stayed a short time, but really appreciated seeing the beautiful interior of this huge church with fabulous dome. Elaborate gilding throughout.

A very prominent and beautiful landmark. This is one of the towering sights in Budapest and is visible from most parts of the city. Magnificent and huge hall, and the best part was the mummified hand of the founder king over centuries old.

Gorgeous!. The Basilica offers a classic beautiful exterior. The interior is warm and welcoming as it bathes you in rich colors and delightful patterned wood accents and columns. For a minimal fee you may climb to the exterior of the base of the dome for spectacular panoramic views of the city. The location is in the city center and is easy to get to.
"Stunner". All I have to say is that the architecture and colours together make this basilica one of the best in its kind.
Beautiful . This is a must see.. Some people are saying you need to pay... You don't at all and you don't need a tour to see the inside and understand what is what. To me it's a must see.

jaw-dropping. what a fantastic place. for the small 'donation' of 2 euros you'll get to have a look inside at the BEAUTIFUL ceilings and design, architecture and detail. truly fascinating . right in the center so it is easy to find and get to
Wonderfull. The St. Estevão Basílica is a wonderfull place to visit in the center of Budapest. A visit to the roof is highly recommended despite the lots of stairs but the rest is also very pretty.
A taste of history and great workmanship. The Basilica is very beautiful, and if you take a trip to the tower you get an amazing view of the town.

St Istvan square is stunning especially at night. The Basilica is an imposing building and the square behind is an excellent place to stop and have a ice cream or a glass of wine. make sure you go in the evening as that is when i think it is at it most spectacular
Worth the 300 steps. After the 300 or so steps to reach the dome of the basilica, you are encountered with an absolutely amazing 360 degree view of budapest. Don't forget your camera.

Just beautiful. This really is a compulsory stop when you visit Budapest. The basilica is very central, surrounded by great shops, cafés and restaurants if you want to combine shopping and sightseeing.
The place is absolutely beautiful, it's amazing that it survived the various occupations of Hungary.
Sad and poingant. A moving memorial to citizens, mainly Jewish, who were killed and thrown into the river in 1944 by the Arrow Cross Military.

Basilica. Great place to visit if you like looking at the history and architecture of the buildings, beautiful inside but if you walk to the top there's loads of stairs!!! There is a lift available if you need it. When you get to the top the views are amazing.

An another European cathedral (in good way). Someone wrote here "an another European cathedral" where I would like to add "in a good way". Check the pictures if you are hesitating. It cost a few euro to climb to the top and view is excellent.

Incredibly detailed architecture. We attended Easter Sunday mass in this absolutely beautiful Basilica. The architecture is amazing, and every inch of the church's interior is decorated with various statues, carvings, paintings, stained-glass windows, etc. Listening to the choir and organ was very enjoyable. We did not see the holy relic nor go to the top to see the view. To visit the church itself there is no fee, but there is a fee if you want to go upstairs to look out from the dome.

A very different experience. The view from the dome is fantastic and the many features within the building make it a "must see" for any tourist. The prices are very reasonable and the exhibits well worth seeing.

A truly humbling and awe-inspiring visit. Don't forget to see the holy hand relic!!!. Truly brilliant experience. The title says it all. The church is ornately decorated and is magnificent. We were there during service and the organ sent chills down our spine. Be sure to go to the other end of the basilica to see the holy relic!!
Beautiful view from the top. Beautiful architecture. Would definitely recommend going upstairs. Possible also with elevator and the view of the city is really nice.

Impressive... But just another European cathedral. Title says it all. It is a very pretty structure and if you are in the area already, you should stop to see it. Not worth a separate trip in my opinion.

Baroque highlight. Definitely a must see if you go to Budapest. At 96m the dome is the same height as the parliament building, so it is visible from a distance!The good news is that a closer inspection will be rewarded: much love and treasure was lavished on this building. A fine cathedral for a grand city.

Among the best in Europe. I personally think this basilica can be said in the same breath as St. Paul's, Notre Dame, St. Peter's, etc and all the other great cathedrals of Europe. It was as grand and beautiful as any of them. The view from the top is a must, has a great view of the Buda Castle and Liberty Statue. Really, wasn't expecting a church of such high quality art work to be in Budapest, but I was very wrong.

Recent monument, worth a visit. The building is worth a visit, it will provide some of the spirit of recent Hungary as the building is a fairly modern classicist addition to the city. It also makes a good starting point for a stroll towards the river and iron bridge.

Definitely worth the visit. The building is beautiful and we are happy we decided to enter the church. Visits are not paid, instead you make a donation when you enter.Make sure you include it in your itinerary during your stay at Budapest!

Nice view from the top of Basilica. You need to give a donation for Basilica 100 forints (cca 0.33 euros). You can see right hand of first Hungary king Istvan (Stephen). He is one of the seven saints of Arpad dynasty. From 2000, he is saint in Orthodox Church. His son Emeric is also a saint. The other five are Ladislaus, Elizabeth, Margaret, Kinga and Irene. Irene is olny in Orthodox while others are only in Roman Chatolic. You can climb with the stairs or take a lift to the top of Basilica where you can find an excellent view on the whole city.

Large 19th century church. This is not an old monument - it was built over 50 years from about 1850, as a memorial to Hungarian nationalism, and anti-Hapsburg sentiment.In my view it is heavy, over-ornate, and full of the nationalism that drove Europe to wars in the 20th century.It has the (miraculously) preserved right hand of St Stephen - the first king of (a very different) Hungary from 975 AD. It also has an interesting Black Madonna Icon from this century. Otherwise it is full of 19th Century gilt. Entrance fee is 200 HUF via a very grumpy concierge.As there are so few other good churches in Budapest due to wars & invasions plus Communist rule, it is worth a visit, if you like C19th neo-classical buildings.I believe the organ is first rate, but we were unable to go to a concert in the time we had availble

This was the most amazing Easter Service Ever. I attended the Latin Easter Mass this morning with my 11 year old grandson. The choir were angelic and to make my day they finished the service by singing the Hallelujah Chorus. We were made welcome and it was a great chance to meet lots of other Christians on holiday in Budapest.

A Must see. If your in city centre its a short walk. 500fl to the tower view and 200fl donation to enter the Basilica. A Basilica is a large and important church that has been given special ceremonial rights by the pope. So there are other Basilica's around the world. All the other reviews have it spot on- wow - I liked the windows. Just a quick note on Budapest - on my first day in the city a helpful tourist information attendant joke fully asked how many times I had been scammed - says it all!! But if your on holiday don't worry it's power for the course- have a good one.

Beautiful exterior and stunning interior. I am not religious myself but I do find the majesty and beauty of religious buildings quite enthralling - the Basilica is a beautiful building inside and out, perhaps not in the league of say the Duomo in Florence but stunning in its own way. The interplay of light though the windows inside and the incense and candles burning within adds to the atmosphere and projects a sense of well being and calm. All this for free too - excellent.
Beautiful building. Lovely old church which you are able to go in and walk around The dome is fantastic and the decoration and marble and gold leaf is very impressive as is the altar

A nice church and surrounding area. Cool to walk around and have a look at the amazing architecture and roofs. Its right in the center of Budapest and near all the shops and coffee places. Although a surprisingly few places to eat on a budget.
Beauty surrounds you here!. St. Stephens is a must see...beautiful inside and out. Walk up the stairs to see more unique and lovely architecture. I love their painted walls and the marble tiles.

A treat. We stayed right around the corner fr
On tha Basilica, passed it daily at least 4 times. Beautiful building from the outside and even nicer on the inside, it is grand!!!
Absolutely gorgeous . For just symbolic fee of less than 2 eur you get chance to observe all of Budapest from breat-taking height. Pictures get just amazing. Best memories of the Town.

spectacular. Beautiful building, architecture is wonderful, then you enter and it is truly beautiful. If you are visiting here remember to visit Gerta Rosa for a flower shaped ice cream shop is on the left opposite the front of the steps of St Stephen's

Spectacular. The interior is beautiful and I was getting a stiff neck from just looking up in wonder. Silence is requested when one is in the Cathedral and I agree this should be adhered to, so it was disappointing to hear a very loud tour guide explain the interior to her large group. Surely explanations should be given outside and people view the interior with respectful silence.

WOW. One of my favourite sights in Budapest. It's beautiful inside, but even more breathtaking if you go all the way up to the top. You can see all over Pest, and over the Danube to the Buda side, which houses Castle Hill and Gellert Hill. If you're into photography, head back here at night. They light up the entire church and you can get some really beautiful shots of it at twilight.

Mosaic art at its finest .. this is more than a quick-look-see visit .... be sure to save enough time to walk slowly through the Cathedral and view all the chapels and smell the incense. The Basilica has been cleaned since I first saw it some years ago and is even more awe-inspiring and wondrous. Don't miss it.
Georgous with great views. Stunning architecture. Beautiful interior. Great sites of the city and river from the walls. And a really nice surrounding area.
Brilliant panorama views from the top. The view is breathtaking especially while the sun is going down. you need to pay a little for the lift but the view definitely worth for it :)

Good view from the top, treasury not worth it. We paid for both panorama and treasury. The treasury was not worth it to me, it is very small and probably only interested in people who specifically came for these objects. The panorama is pretty good. There is also a relic of some guy (a hand) in a small room in the back of the church. The people around were apparently not smart enough to figure out how to threw a coin in the machine next to it to make it light up, so after a while of observing them being confused i did it. Unfortunately these respectless and apparently extremely dumb (European and Asian) tourists then suddenly felt entitled to photograph with full flash on although it says on the signs everywhere in big fat letters and with images that flash is not allowed. I guess that is why we can't have nice things, selfish fools like to destroy stuff in their egoistic ignorant ways. (YES FLASH DESTROYS THINGS)

Impressive, ornate architecture. Huge building with beautiful ornate decoration including much gold leaf. Key interest is the relic of St Stephen's mumified right hand which is visible if coins are placed in a box to illuminate it!

Beautiful and elaborately decorated. Beautiful and elaborately decorated church interior. Stop by the chapel in the back where st. Stevens hand is kept. Definitely worth the few euros to climb up to the top of the dome.

Beautiful Architect. Very beautiful building from the inside out. This is one of the most beautiful churches we have seen. You can pay a small fee to go up to the rotunda and see another view of Budapest from there. The church itself is stunning and worth a visit.

Probably the most beautiful church. ...that we have seen, and we have seen plenty of them. Pay the small fee and go up to the rotunda and see the view of Budapest from there. The city is so dense and studded with gothic and neoclassical spires and towers throughout.The church itself is stunning, and is worth going to just having a seat in and soaking it all up for a long while.

nice building. the church itself is very beautiful, but the view from the top is totally worth it. Just go to the door on the left side of the church and take the elevator for like 0,50 cts. Great place for pictures and checking the entire city and gougers top ceilings.
splendid. A place you must see, I enjoyed a long coffee sitting along all of the external walls, it's as beatiful as expected :)

Beautiful combinations of marble. This cathedral is not very old - less than 200 years, but it is still worth a visite. The facade is stunning, and there's a big square in front of it so you can really appreciate the architecture. The interior is decorated with marble in different colours combined with gold leaf. A lot of dark red marble. The two domes let in a lot of light, and the mosaics inside the domes and on the ceiling are wonderful. It's not an huge church, but large enough to give you the feeling of awe.The hand of St Steven (the main relic) is in a little chapel in the back of the church. I especially loved the stained glass windows there.

Walk by. I only was in Budapest for a weekend but I got the chance to get a water tour passing by here and walk around the area. It was awesome scenary and worth the trip! Next time I will make arrangements to actually go inside
Must Visit. We went there during Christmas time...very pretty / great Christmas market / local food and nice leather products.

Beautiful. Visitors to Budapest should visit this stunning building and appreciate the magnificent 19th century architecture. There are many items of interest within one of them being the side chapel containing the hand of Hungary's founding father St Stephen and also the memorial to Emperor Charles IV the last King of Hungary.

Simply Stunning. This amazing building in the heart of Pest is a must see for all, not just for it's stunning architecture and history but for it's amazing view point, looking out across Budapest. We started with the 300+ stair walk to the top (a lift is available if needed!!), it was pretty tough but well worth the walk. When we made it to the top, the views were breathtaking!Back down the stairs and feeling slightly dizzy, we then went into the church (free entry but donations requested) which was also a stunner, Be sure to take in the detail of the decor and admire the effort that has gone in to this spectacular building. I could have sat in the main building for hours!

Amazing views, must see!. The views from the Basilica are some of the best I have come across in Europe. Visitors are treated to a panorama of both Buda and Pest, and fantastic views of the Danube. Well worth the rather exhausting walk to the top!
Must see in Budapest . Irrespective of the religion, I feel everyone will enjoy the church, beautiful, stunningly artistic. It's almost like the sree Padmanaba temple ìn kerala
Great venue for a concert. Went to a concert sunday evening, mid march a bit cold in the Church but well worth it.4 violins , a cello and a double base,main theme AVE MARIA. Uplifting ..

Beautiful. St. Stephen's Basilica is a massive monument which is marvelous from the outside as well as the inside. You can admire all those architectural things as well as you can notice that it was built in the different style that it was finished. Inside the Basilica is a very special interior and one can really find a peace in his mind in this place.I surely recommend to visit this place.

Interesting church. Visited just anout 10 am before the crowds arrivedFree entry but donations requestedBeautiful church worth a visit while in Budapest it is definitely a highlight especially if you are interested in churches or historical buildings

The Basilica. Beautiful Cathedral , magnificent architecture, And ornately decorated interior. An absolute must visit in Budapest. We combined our visit with a Bach concert in the Basilica. The acoustics were mind blowing.
Amazing. Came across the Basilica, beautiful building with lots to see inside. Nice quiet spots to reflect. Great photos as well.

Breathtaking . So nice the interior structure. We entered on Sunday during a mass and we could listen toThe acoustics. It's was really awesome. And as it was Hungarian Revolution day , I guess it was free entry.

Saint and King, now there's a thing!. A great example of a religious building. Marvellous depictions of various Saints.in particlar, of course, Saint Stephan himself. Splendidly decorated with masses of gold leaf.  Very ornate marblework is very much in evidence, and the grand scale of the place has to be seen to be believed.

Beautiful building with stunning views. Beautiful building which looks spotlessly clean. 200 florint entrance fee (about 50p). Its an additional 500 florint to climb the 302 steps (there is also a lift) to the too to enjoy the amazing views of the city. At less than £4 for the two of us this is an absolute bargain

Wow!. Nearly St Paul's, but not quite. Nevertheless there is no escaping the size, grandeur, and presence of this basilica. No entrance fee, although there is a suggested "donation" at the entrance (the 200 HUF suggestion converts to 50 pence GBP. Very ornate inside, lots of gold leaf, and a huge Central dome. It has Wow Factor and if you are minded you can pay to climb the stairs to the top of the dome for a panoramic view of the city. There are better views from the Fishermens Bastion, or the Liberty Statue.

Right in the heart of Pest. Must visit. Right in the heart of the city. Richly decorated with brilliant mosaics and red marbled columns. Peaceful. We didn’t walk up into the dome but I imagine you would get great views across to Buda
Amazing. Must see!Absolutely beautiful, it snowed whilst we were there and it only added to the charm.I would love to visit again!
Beautiful architecture. Loved seeing the architecture and learning about the history. Very calm atmosphere...and a lovely place for a spiritual moment.

Amazing. St. Stephen's Basilica is worth a visit even if you are not religious man. The temple is very nice and there is a great view from the tower because it is one of the tallest buildings in the city.

Lovely and serene. Please note there is an elevator for the bell tower so do go up for a birds eye view of Budapest. Displayed In the treasury is the largest monstrance I have ever seen with rock crystal sides! The electrified gold candle sconces each holding 16 lights are magnificent

Wow. The inside is breathtaking and a must see if you are in Budapest.. Take your time. Light a candle. Say a prayer of just take a picture. Beautiful inside and out. Definately a peaceful atmosphere and great way to relax for 30 minutes.

Worth the climb. Want to work off your goulash? Try climbing to the top of St. Stephen's Basilica. That will definitely burn some calories. And the views from the top are worth the climb. Inside, the basilica is lovely. Queuing to see the "hand" is interesting.
look out for St Stephans hand. Beautiful inside and out. There is an entrance fee but Its a few pennies so go and enjoy it and find the side room where St Stephan's hand sits in a glass cabinet

AND I THOUGHT SAINT MATTHIAS CHURCH'S INTERIOR WAS COLORFUL!. About time; a different type of Basilica! I loved the width. Most cathedrals look like they are trying to squeeze the sides together and have everything pointing upwards. Here the facade is a rectangle, with the 2 spires (clock towers) on the ends. Built with a lovely white stone; but where are the 2 missing statues from their niches?Have a look at the back of the building. Fantastic. This looks beautifully planed and executed. Most others look totally unplanned and are a mess, and hope that no one will venture here.The interior is gold, red, orange - and the floor orange and white -- and there is not a square inch uncolored. Up front there are pews, then rows of (dare I say it) cheap looking single chairs - that look like they would struggle to hold me. And nothing to kneel on!I liked the lanterns on the 2 spires and the dome. But could not understand the pastel pink, blue and purple on the interior of the dome.Brian, from Perth. W. Australia.

Magnificent historical church in the center of Pest. Streets around the cathedral all seem to slowly wind towards it and build up to a breathtaking approach to this massive historical site where the holy relic of St. Stephen is housed. Views from atop the basilica are simply breathtaking and photos will be clicked non stop!

Opulence and splendour. Don't miss this amazing sight when you travel to Budapest. The interior of the Basilica is breathtaking, with marble and gilding galore. Magnificent is the only word to describe it.
St Stephens Basilica. Wonderful architectures and beautifully ornate inside. It is worth taking the trip to the viewing promenade for a marvellous view of the city.

In the Eye of the Beholder (or Ear....). Gorgeous stained glass and frescoes, the photos will not do it justice without photoshop. Lots of artists inside sketching away. Only disappointing aspect was the lack of acknowledging requests for silence. Tour guides with flags bellow to their respective groups...without respect.

beautiful/restfull. Stunning building, with calmness and peace you would expect. Quite small but well worth a visit.The lightening alters from fairly dark to dimly lit. So quite tricky to take photos unless you have a fairly good quality camera.
Beautiful Church. Definitely worth a visit. It is one of the better churches I've visited in Europe. Beautiful inside and out.
Worth the Visit. It is definitely worth visiting this church. It is very different from the typical Gothic church you see in Europe. It also had quite a history.

Simply Beautiful !. A huge church that can house more than 8000 people. Noticed amazing paintings, sculptures, side chapels and other smaller details that kept us busy. If visited in the evening you may attend a concert. Opens daily from 9:00 -19.00.No entrance fee but a donation of 200 F might be asked. For a small fee you can visit on of the towers for a nice view but there is always a long queue out there. It is close to the central metro station.
Beautiful. Stunning building. Definitely worth a visit while in budapest. The architecture is outstanding. Did not pay to go up stairs but felt the church itself was enough

Beautiful . This place is beautiful visited while on my stay in Budapest. Great views over the city from the observation tower. But of a walk up the steps but well worth it. Inside is beautiful and stunning. Well worth a visit
Gorgeous!. This is a must see. I recommend paying the small fee to climb to the top as you get 360 degree views of the city!
In the centre and full of history. This church is in the centre of the City, nearby Danube river. It is full of history. You can view the City from tower or see treasury.

magical experience. We made a point of taking a couple of hour's out if our trip to this wonderful city to go and explore ST STEPHEN'S BASILICA, (SZENT ISTVAN BAZILIKA),and what a great experience. It's a beautiful building, Roman Catholic Basilica, named in honour after the 1st king of Hungary.The interior is breathtaking,stained glass windows, interesting architecture, superb little details that keep popping up the more you explore this wonderful building.It dominates the area of Pest,the organ concerts are a must go ,if you can book your tickets but to me the best part is the roof top views, a small fee gives you some of the most stunning views of this great city ,great photographic opportunities. Very easy to locate, near Parliment building. Opening hour's are; Monday to Friday, 9am till 5pm. Saturday, 9am till 1pm.Sunday, 1pm till 5pm.
Great View. The Basilica had a wonderful view of the city - probably the best view save the one from the Citadel.

Best Views of Budapest. The views from up here are incredible, you can see for miles on a clear day. There's a restaurant here to although choice is a bit limited. The building itself is quite incredible and the roof is beautifully tiled. At the top there's also a small Marzipan cafe, go in for a look - it hides within it an awesome museum including buildings and all sorts made of Marzipan! And at only £1 a go, it's well worth a look.

Rooftop views spectacular. The Basilica is great to view both inside and out but the best thing to do is go to the top of the building to get a view over Budapest. Absolutely spectacular and well worth doing!

Blown Away!. Well what can I say, I have been in some Basilicas, seen beautiful ones in Italy, but I was totally blown away by St Stephen's. I can honestly say it is one of the most beautiful buildings I think I've ever been in, We just sat there for ages taking it all in, the beautiful stained glass windows and the paintings that adorn the dome and the walls are just breath taking! If you go nowhere else in Budapest, go here - Amazing!!

amazing building. This is a building which dominates the skyline of Pest. It is well worth visiting for its paintings which make you wonder how they managed to achieve so much detail inside the domes.It also holds the mummified hand of the first king of Hungary.

Great Place. This is one of the largest basilica in Hungary. The ambience inside is very calm and quite. Additionally lot of the history can be learnt from this place. One pay a small price to climb up to the top to have a nice view of the city.

The usual Baroque. One cannot visit Budapest without stopping in to see St. Stephen's Basilica. He is the king who decided Hungary would join the Latin (as opposed to Byzantine) rite church. Bbeautiful to be sure but there are many beautiful cathedrals and basilicas throughout Europe. This one dates from the 19th century - not back to the time of St. Stephen - and is dotted with several contemporary statues of St. Rita, St. Therese of Lisieux & St. Joseph that just don't seem to "fit". There is a small chapel to the rear housing the medieval relic of St. Stephen's hand...the reliquary is housed within a larger container making it nearly impossible to see. The suggested donation is a minimum of 200 huf.

Peaceful. Its difficult to grade places of worship as they are not always that of your own religion, butSt Stephens is quiet different to most Ive been in. Some places are over touristic, queues around the square etc, etc. St Stephens has a great atmostspere wonderfully decorated and the dome outstanding and to top it off, the sacred hand in available toreflect to those of this particular religion. Easy reached down from Parliament towardsDeak Ter. Visitors who re more adventurist can take the lift to the top Basillica.

Beautiful building. Had to walk around the outside as the inside was closed for the evening concert. What I could hear through the doors and windows, however was exquisite. If only I had bought tickets.... check because the concerts run from 5PM - 6PM during the week.

Wonderful. Very very beautiful, stunning architecture masterpiece. Close to the Parliament, you can see them in the same day. Just another beautiful place of Budapest to sit and observe the details and think of how wonderful is this city. You don't have to pay to get inside.
beautiful. wow,wow i would really recommend a visit to the Bazilika.It is awesome.Peaceful place to spend a few minutes in
Budapest visit. Amazing place and so easy to go around, just took the lifts to the top of the Basilica not even a queue, fantastic views a wonderful visit
Really beautiful basilica. It is a really beautiful basilica with great art and details. Remember to also go to the chapel, it is worth taking a look at.
Beautiful. Went to St. Stephens Basilica many years ago after a work trip with the Nuclear Team from Atlanta with my ex husband. Fabulous old structure very well preserved

Fantastic cathedral. The interior is well worth a visit, very well maintained and ornate and has a wonderful atmosphere. Don't forget to make sure you have HUF200 in change with you as you are expected to make a 'donation' to enter.

Beautiful Basilica with brilliant Interiors!. This Basilica is a must visit! It is a beautiful basilica and one of the most significant tourist attractions! We took a hike up the spiral staircase and it was well worth it..however it is not free! You get breathtaking panoramic views of the city! The interiors are amazing with walls that are clad in different colored stones! Performances & concerts also take place here! Overall a must visit!
Beautiful. Absolutely beautiful on the inside and out, you don't have to be religious to appreciate the work and effort that has gone into building St. Stephens. Costs 200HUF for entry.

Takes your breath away!. The interior of the Basilica is absolutely amazing ,with its marble columns and Gold fittings,stain glass windows and its Dome! We paid extra to go up by lift to the roof and its views of the City below!

Concert visit. It was cold in the church but the experience was very worthwhile. We were in a very highly decorated high ceilinged church for about 70 minutes listening to a string orchestra and soprano. Our only disappointment was that the organ was only in one piece.
I am hoping to return to climb the tower.
beautiful building. It took 50 years to build this building, that includes a Renaissance-style coupole. There is a mosaic dome and panels illustrating the life ofKing IstvaN.
Fab. Really nice building. worth going to look. it i in the centre of Bp so you have no travel costs getting there.

Astonishing!. I was on the fastest ever trip to Budapest and needed to find the Post Office. Right next to the Basilica, I was told, so off I rushed. I have to confess that I was preoccupied with stamps, catching my flight, last minute packing and so was unprepared for the effect of the scale of the Basilica. It is vast and very, very beautiful. It was early and so I could not see it in detail. Do not do what I did, make sure that you visit. By the way, the PO was great and so well organised!
Beautiful, don't pay for the big tour. Buy a ticket, walk through, take your time. As in all travel, read some of the history of Budapest a you will enjoy it more. The views are stupendous.

A must see when visiting Budapest. You cannot travel to Budapest and not visit St Stephens Basilica. It dominates the central area of Pest. It has great historical significance to the Hungarians. You pay a donation of 200 HUF to enter the building - roughly 50p. The architecture and history of the building is fascinating.
Ornate interior. The interior is beautifully ornate. I was amazed to see the paintings covering all the walls. There is a small fee, but well worth the price.
Night visit. We chanced upon the Basilica at sunset. A service was about to begin so we didn't stay too long, but it was long enough to take in such a beautiful surroundings.

Stunningly beautiful basilica. This is the largest church in Budapest. Saint Istvan was Hungary's first Christian king. The basilica is very ornate and beautiful. We pre booked an organ concert and it was simply incredible. Miklos Teleki was the organist who graduated from the Liszt Academy of Music. The soloist sang Ave Maria and it was absolutely glorious. The performance lasted 70 minutes and I hated to have it be over. Pieces from Mozart, Vivaldi, Liszt, Schubert, Bach, and Schumann were performed. With the backdrop of the ornate altar and the marvelous music, it was an evening to remember for a long time.

Stunning - Inside and out. St. Stephen's Basilica towers above the Budapest skyline from all sides. Walking straight up from the Danube and you arrive at the very impressive front of the Basilica. There were no crowds when I was there and I walked straight in. It is a Catholic Church that has daily Mass and various other religious ceremonies. It was a voluntary donation at the entrance to the inner Basilica and a mandatory donation to climb up to the dome (about 2 euro). The inside is spectacular with highly ornate stained glass and a very decorative organ. I was fortunate enough to witness the singing of local children in preparation for their First Holy Communion. It truly continued the wonderful tradition of music in Hungary and was just magical. After climbing to the top of the dome, the view over Budapest was great, but there was quite a haze the day I was there. It was the inside of the Basilica that really did it for me. Wonderful.

Majestic structure. This is a massive building, right in the center of the city and it was visible from far off. The architecture is just amazing, very well done. Luckily not very crowded during the visit and its beautiful inside as well...
Great views of the city from the roof.. Spent time inside, must be seen! If you do the roof, take the lift although there are still a number of steps up to the roof area.

amazing. The view was amazing and you can see for miles but I didn't want to take the steep railcar the walk up to it was long and the cobbled roads hurt your feet so I recommend sturdy trainers and a camera. Once up there it is amazing the castle is gorgeous and the view is even more so.

Magnificent!. I never went inside, but the St Stephen´s Basilica is beautiful! It is huge, and with all of those details. I was told it is free to go inside, but there is a mandatory donation.. I would not call that free, and would prefer them saying there is a fee with possibility of donation.

Stunning Building. The enter fee was 200 Florin's which is not a £1. The building has stunning workmanship inside and out and the colours of the artwork world is stunning and so bold. The ceiling is breathtaking. We also found it at this time of night 18.30 a very peaceful and place to sit and think.
Impressive. Impressive site centrally located. Nice to walk around the area and make it to the Jewish quarter on foot. It is close to shops and cafes
so large..so peaceful. It would be difficult to come to Budapest and not visit the Basilica. So many people stand and stare outside, the entrance fee is not great, but the rewards are.

Superb view from the rooftop. Great view from the roof, via 2 lifts. Cheap way of getting great pictures of Buda & Pest. Opening times didnt seem to be rigid- it wasnt open yesterday morning but we purchased tickets and went straight up both lifts without a queue. Odd.
Great panoramic view. Interesting Basilica, but the best experience was on the roof, enjoying the panoramic view of Budapest city. If you can try to attend a concert.
Well worth the climb.... As well as the interior of the Basilica which is very impressive, you have the option to climb up (or take the lift) to the rotunda and get a view of Budapest from above.
Definately worth. Impressive church! One of the highlights in our trip! Our hotel was really close so we were able to visit it often.
Wonderful Building. If you have time you should go up to the top of the building and look over the city. From outside it is well worth a view. Looks fantastic.
Must go inside.. Amazing place, beautiful place and amazing to see. There' is a small fee but completely worth it, I was amazed by the Basicila.

beautiful. Define they make a stop to this church. One of the most ornate churches I have ever been to. It is free, a small donation was asked for, but you do not have to give a donation for admittance. Inside is a lot of gold leaf and sculptures of different saints that are important to Hungarian culture. I found it quite interesting that instead of having Jesus on the cross at the front of the church ( like most Christian churches do ) that st. Stephen is in the front of the church instead. Make sure to do your research before coming about st.stephen. very interesting individual.... and when you go make sure to look for his right fist that is encased in a glass box in the back left hand side of the church. I know it sounds strange...but like I said, do your homework. Very interesting historical facts behind this amazing basilica!!!!

A great, austere church - worth seeing!. A great architectural monument with ornate and lavish decor inside. Visited the basilica in the afternoon and also passed by it in the evening - and the lit up church was even more austere and breathtaking in the moonlight. Overall, very impressive site to see!

Great Views. It only costs 500 forint (£1.25, €1.50) to climb or take the lift to the top of the Basilica, and from there you get the best view available from Pest, looking out over Gellert Hill and Castle Hill on the Buda side of the Danube.

Stunning!. We visited St. Stephen's Basilica for a concert one evening which was really lovely. The history of this church is interesting and it is beautiful in an opulent and totally over the top way - lots of gold leaf and cold marble etc which personally I can live without. It certainly has the "wow" factor for anyone deeply religious. One tip would be to wear warm clothing if going to a concert as it is cold when sitting still.

View from the dome is outstanding. Lovely building to explore, with well marked exhibit section. Take the elevator and stairs up and enjoy the view from the base of the dome. It's well worth the effort and small fee. There's a second elevator to reduce your stair climbing, but some is inevitable.
Good church. A really decent church well worth a visit, very grand from the outside and quite stunning on the inside and one of the very few sites we went to in Budapest that was free.

Wow! . I am reviewing this as a building and a total delight for the eyes for anyone who appreciates a beautiful building, we did not go inside this building, however it blew us away from turning a corner and unexpectedly seeing it before us, it's even more impressive lit up at night
best views of the city. well worth the cheap entrance ticket. Took the lift up to the top of the tower and got some amazing photos of the city.

Money-grabbing - not very Christian-like. I had real high hopes for St Stephen's Basilica and it was at the top of list when prioritising places to visit during our four day Budapest stay. The building from the outside is stunning, and there's plenty of room on the square to get a great shot if you're into your photography (also a great view from the wine bar, Di Vino, opposite, if you're more into wine!). However, as soon as we climbed the steps to enter the Basilica we were met with the ominous stares of two cloaked priests. They didn't seem to want to inform us of anything, and we didn't really feel the need to buy a programme, so we proceeded to the entrance. When we got to the entrance door, there was a donation box, with a sign suggesting a donation of 1euro. We had expected this, and will often make a modest donation of what we can when visiting any church or other place of worship. It was then that we noticed we had been followed into the entrance hall by one of the aforementioned cloaked priests. Without a word, he pointed aggressively to the donations box. We had planned to make a donation on our way out, which we had always found to be quite acceptable to many of the other churches we have visited before. But this guy wasn't taking no for an answer. As I pulled out my purse and emptied my coins into my hands to count out my donation, the guy shouted 'coins, coins, coins', which I took for him meaning I should donate more. This made us angry and feel that this was all they had been interested in. This suspicion was then confirmed when we approached the mummified forearm of St Stephen in a small chapel at the back of the church. I struggled to see the actual specimen, until another cloaked figure appeared and pointed out the machine which you needed to pay money into before the forearm would be lit up! I found this absolutely unbelievable and would never wish to visit this church again.Any church should be open to the public for a donation of their choice - it made me wonder whether they would really have turned us away if we hadn't had any money with us! Disgusting.They should really be aware of how wrong what they do is in this regard - we would most certainly have made more than the suggested donation had we not felt forced into doing so. As a result of this, we didn't then choose to pay to go up the tower either - they would be better off trusting people to donate what they can.
beautiful. Absolute must to visit this church nicest one we have seen only a Donation to look around there was restoration work going on but didn't ruin the trip
Spectacular. Beautiful Church, well cared for and reasonable entry charge. Restoration work being undertaken at present.

The best view of the city. Indeed, better than their "Budapest Eye" wheel on Erszebet ter. Super cheap for having such a great panoramic view. By the way, it is illegal to build buildings that are taller than Basilica anywhere near it.

If you love history. If you have an affinity towards history and you are in Budapest then you must visit this place. Amazing artwork and architecture give you a glimpse into the medieval era. Just an astounding place to stand and admire all of the work and craftsmanship that went into building it. Also you most go and glimpse the supposed hand of St. Stephen.

Bittersweet feeling. 3 main comments:1. You don't have to make a donation to go into the church. Just walk past the donations box if you want. Kind of confusing when you get there and wrong to ask for money to walk into a church. Zero stars for "customer service."2. It is beautiful inside, ornate, just lovely! The outside is also just gorgeous. Wonderful presentation of architecture. 3. My son was hoping to see the bells and when we asked the lady who managed the ticket booth to go upstairs If we would be able to see them she said yes. You can't. It's a crazy long walk up the stairs and you can see just about everything else you could see from the top of any other building. Don't bother with going upstairs. Go up to buda castle for a view instead.
Beautiful. Beautiful building, inside and out. We enjoyed a quiet moment inside. Lovely art work. Seemed to allow photos to be taken.

Beautiful. It is really something worth going, but the main problem w faced were crowd wanting to get in and out at the same time, while the half of Basilica was closed due to some wedding which took place at the same time. People got stuck in the main gates, not being able to move back-or-for. It seems like all of us, tourist visiting Budapest at that point wanted to see it at the same time. Wrong timing, our fault!

Breathtaking. We went up to the tower to get a view across Pest and across to Buda. It was reasonably priced at around 500ft but be aware there is 300 steps to the viewing tower! Worth the climb for sure. Didn't get a chance to go inside the Basillica as they were preparing for an organ concert but definitely a must see for our next trip.
Amazing church!. I've been to many beautiful European churches, and this one was one of the best. So beautiful and definitely worth the trip.
worth a visit, and if you can go upto the top. you have to do certain things when on a city break, and visiting the city basilica is one of them, and there are plenty of cafes nearby,

wonderful concert venue. We attended the organ concert on 3rd March. The acoustics and splendour of the location made this a wonderful experience. Prices start at around £26 per person for a concert lasting around 70 mins. It's not particularly cheap, but we would not have missed it and would recommend to others considering attending a concert at the Basillica. We were in area C, the cheapest area and whilst the more expensive tickets might be better for the acoustics, we still found the sound beautiful.
Impressive. Absolutely beautiful inside. Huge and very ornate.Take a walk up the tower, it costs about 50p and the views of the city are fantastic. There are a lot of steps though!!
nice view from the top. We got on top of St. Stephențs Basilica and the view of teh city is lovely from up there. There are like 364 stairs but it is worth.

Great for concerts. Beautiful surroundings and acoustics. Sit in area a and b .... Not c. They have more concerts than those on a thurs and sat. Went to organ recital with soprano, trumpet, tenor and violin ... Lovely.

Grandiose basilica, don't miss the view from the cupola. St. Stephen Basilica is a must-see in Budapest. The building and the square around it is also impressive. I love the view from the cupola. The Holy Right Hand of St Stephen /Szent Jobb/, a national Hungarian relic is displayed here. It is supposedly the naturally mummificated right hand of the first Hungarian king.
Unwelcoming. They kicked us rather brusquely out after only two minutes but from what we could see in the time this was about enough anyhow.
view worth the climb. Beautiful building inside but also a great view over the city from the dome.there is a lift part way but the steps were a good work out!

Very impressive. Very impressive Basilica from outside and inside. I recommend to climb the 302 stairs to the top and enjoy the view of Budapest. (Can use the elevator as well). The church itself is beautiful.

One thing you cannot miss. it´s one of the obliged stops in Budapest. The Church deserves a visit.The building is also placed in the most beautiful quarter of the city, nice palaces and interesting architecture.
Beautiful. A beautiful basilica with a nominal entrance fee. Worth a look! Located centrally with a huge plaza in front where lots of events occur as well.
Interesting. Did not get chance to go inside but it looked extremely busy. The queues were very large and this was off peak time, so maybe need to go early in the day.
Pretty Church. This place is worth seeing it is pretty inside with stained glass and fresco paintings. I was told by a local that you can also climb into the dome for great views of the city.
beautiful!. it is a very big church,which is nice to see!especially if it is your first time in Europe.also you can make nice pictures!

Interesting & beautiful. It's a must see in Budapest, the architecture, painting and sculpture are amazing and it has a very interesting history. Photos are allowed without flash and you're required to pay 1€/200HUF before entering, which is reasonable.

Beautiful building, great panorama. An exquisite building inside and out- and you can see the incredible workmanship between the interior and exterior domes if you go to the top of the tower (lift available) to see the fantastic city panorama. The chapel containing the Relic of the Holy Right Hand is very impressive.

Absolutely beautiful.. I sincerely enjoyed visiting the Basilica the other day. It is slightly unfortunate that you are asked to pay before entering, however simply pay the contribution and don't take a tour. It's cheaper, and you have more time to wander at your leisure. You can always read up on the history afterwards.Photography (no flash photography) is allowed, but do be respectful, as this is a place of worship for others. Definitely worth a visit.
Lovely building. This is a spectacular building its beautiful inside and out. Its also got a few nice little cafe bars around and about for a quiet drink

Don't miss it.. Another site not to be missed in Budapest. Gorgeous, historical and a must see. Stroll around, take in the sites and sounds. Plenty of cafes and shops to enjoy while visiting this basilica.

Beautiful, inside and out.. Nicely located church that offers a impressive exterior with a beautiful interior. Entry was by donation and you could spend as long as you wanted there. I went during Winter so it wasn't too busy. I did t go up the top, as I had already been to Fisherman's Bastion for my panorama of Budapest. If possible check to make sure Church services aren't happening when you plan to visit. That being said if they are, the Church is so close to other sites you could easily come back later.
unusual. beautiful interior, amazing views from the top of the dome, central location to visit. cost to go up was low, lift available too
Magnificent . Worthy to visit this temple.It's magnificent.Be aware though the many pickpockets around the plaza.The plaza as well has many restaurants and cafés .

Beautiful Basilica. The Basilica in itself is absolutely stunning and really opulent. Though I would suggest for a Panoramic view of Budapest go to the Fisherman's Bastion on the Buda side, as this one is not worth the price.

Beautifully renovated basillica. The building is beautiful. We visited the basilica itself, as well as the top for a panoramic view of Budapest. We panoramic view might not totally worth the price, since you can get approximately the same view at Gellert Hill. We attended an organ concert, which will gives you goosebumps for sure.

The Stairs Are Worth It. The inside of the basilica is absolutely beautiful. I'm not a huge church person, and I was in awe. You absolutely have to do the 300 stair trek to the top though. The view of Budapest is absolutely breathtaking.

Probably the best view in Budapest!. Not a lot to do in St. Stephen's Basilica. The Starcture is magnificent, but besides that, the only thing to do here is climbing up the tower and look on Budapest from above, which I believe is worth it.
Impressive. An incredible structure situated right in the middle of the city. The architecture is simply amazing, take your time to fully appreciate what is there.
Wonderful architecture. The interior is stunning and the lift to the roof is worth it. The stairs get quite packed and it can take a while to reach the top. 360 degree views are superb!
Exquisite !. One of the most beautiful churches I have ever been in ! Guilded with lots of marble. 1 euro donation entry fee to church.

Very beautiful. One of the really beautiful churches to be found in Europe.Supposedly free to get in but an official church representative stood by the entrance and the donation box making you feel like you actually had to give a donation.The chamber for King Stephen's hand should have been open according to the times on the sign but it wasn't, so we missed out on it.

Astonishing, inside and out. I can only use so many superlatives, but this place is magnificent, architecture, interior design and panorama alike. The organ and the main altar are making a great balanced opposition on the main part of the building, the Saint's Right Chapel is beautifully hidden behind the main altar, the small side-altars add a little plus to the feeling, and the panorama on the balcony around the main dome is breathtaking. You can see the whole of Pest, and the best of Buda, from there. The treasury was somewhat a disappointment, quite a small exhibition, but then again, it may have just been my own expectation.
Great grand place. A must visit. You will be in awe for the awesome sculpture, design, architecture and view of this magnificant place.

Beautiful church. This is a beautiful church. Expect to pay a donation to enter but seeing the inside is worth it. It has gold details on the interior and a large dome. We entered during a concert and the church had many sections roped off so visitors couldn't walk around, but we were allowed to stand in the back of the church to observe and listen to the live music.

Beautiful. We paid a nominal fee to walk up the 300+ steps to the outside of the dome. well worth the climb!!! (there is a lift) The views all the way around are stunning. The inside of the church is beautiful and well worth a wander round. You can even see the mummified hand of St Stephen! in one of the back rooms.
Beautiful Building. Beautiful building, richly decorated with great views from the roof (and a lift to take you most of the way up!). Small fee for both basilica and roof access.

Recommend a Visit. We visited the Basilica on our holiday to Budapest and would highly recommend a trip here. Entry to the main part of the Church requires a donation only. Apparently the tower is also worth visiting for a small charge but we didn't have time to go there.

Well worth a visit. We started our visit by climbing many steps up to the walkway outside the dome. Whilst climbing up up can see the structure of the dome. From the outside you get some wonderful views over the city.Inside the church there are many statues of various saints and a bust of the cardinal who fought against the inhumanity against the prisoners during the hungarian uprising.In a seperate room known as the chapel of our lady is the mummified hand of St Stephen. The cannoniesed former King Stephen the first king of Hungary

Breathtaking opulence. Not to be missed. Very opulent with the shiny marble and gilt but it was a very serence place of worship at the same time. We were lucky enough to hear a children's choir while we were there - it was an ethereal experience.

Beautiful Architecture. You must Climb to the Top. This is a wonderful building, the interior is spectacular and there is masses to admire. Though important, to those in Budapest/Hungary,the mummified hand of Stephen is not very attractive!
It is worth paying and climbing the steps or taking the lift to view the city from the top of the dome.

Outstanding view of the whole city. Well worth the trip to the top to take in the view from all angles.
There was a lift running to the top or you could take the 300 steps.
The church is worth a walk around to as full of art work

Beautiful architecture. We visited in February and paid to go up to the gallery which provides a lovely view of the city. There is both a lift and stairs although the stairs are narrow and winding and are used for both up and down. Even if you take the lift, there are still a few stairs to navigate so it's not suitable for buggies or those with walking difficulties. Totally worth the view once you are up there. The inside of the church is fantastic. Beautifully decorated in ostentatious gold and bright colours. Interesting history - it looks a lot older than it is as does much of Budapest. Definitely worth visiting.

Beautiful Church. Fabulous church - very different from St Matthias in the Castle District. St Stephen's is very ornate, quite like a church you might find in Rome. Take a trip up to the dome to enjoy some lovely views.
Impressive!. Definitely worth having a look around here. Impressive dome and ceiling paintings. Interesting viewing a thousand year old mummified previous King's hand!!

Panorama view from the top of the St. Stephen's Basillica. Currently I live in Budapest. If I have a visitor here, I always suggest her/him to go up to the top of the St. Stephen's Basillica. It is about 400 stairs up in a narrow winding staircase but it worths. There is a beautiful panorama view on the whole city. (Price 400 HUF - less than 2 EUR)
Beautiful cathedral. A must-see in Budapest - beautiful cathedral - visit for free - only small donation requestedIn walking distance from the Chain bridge at Pest side; near lost of nice restaurants

The third largest and great views from the dome.. This magnificent catholic church, built in the first years of the 20th century in neoclassical style, is the third largest in Hungary. This church and the Parliament are the tallest buildings in Budapest (almost 100 meters) and they represent the two pillars of the city, the secular and the spiritual one.The eye will be delighted also with the artworks from the inside. Everything is to the superlative.If you want to go up to the dome's observation deck it is a small fee, but worth it. Great panoramic views.
Fantastic. A fantastic building easy to find ,and beautiful inside.No charge to view only thing people trying to sell you things outside

Don't miss St. Stephen's. St. Stephen's Basilica definitely needs to be on your must visit list. The beauty absolutely defies description, and I'm sure you will be amazed by both the beauty, as well as the history of this historic landmark.
Outstanding. Very pretty church. Easy place to pray and feel the presence of a greater being. We were there when there was a Christmas market in front of it. Very fun

The largest and greatest basilika of Hungary. Beautiful newly refurbished church. Fantastic surrounding, Danube is close with exciting river restaurants on it.
The St Stephen's Basilika has a top terrace, open to the public, with incredible view to the whole city.
Must see in Budapest!

Stunning... yet sickening. We visited the Basilica during one of the free walking tours (1.5hr) so our time there was a bit rushed, but from what we saw, it was a beautiful place.Being a Catholic church you are expected to make a donation as you enter so we threw a couple of coins into the collection pot. From inside you can see where all the money goes as it's a stunning place, however I personally felt a bit sickened about how much money must've been spent on it. I'm not a religious man, but even I imagined Jesus berating the religious leaders for such waste.Within the back of the church you can also see the hand (allegedly) of St Stephen, the first king of Hungary. If you put another coin in, you can also light up the case! Wonders will never cease.
visit. a must for anyone interested in churches ,cathederals etc,very close to danube and city centre ,close also to other attractions ,parliament,margaret island and others
Magnificent but out of its time. it is opulent with dizzy making heights, but it is much younger than it looks. Given that it is out of its time, I would not return when I am next in Budapest.
Great View. We could of stayed at the top all day and night.Great all round views of the beautiful city and beyond! Loved the place!

Beautiful view, small treasury. Just came back from my trip to Budapest and it was outstanding!This is my 2nd time in Budapest and this city developed well in past 5 years.I visited Basilica the last day of my visit and spent about hour and a half inside. The whole tour is inexpensive, only 3 euros per person to visit treasury and to "climb" on the top of the Basilica and catch a beautiful view.The view is perfect and you can see the whole Pest. You can choose weather you want to go by foot or by elevator.We also visite treasury which is too small. If you read every single thing, you can't spend more than 20 minutes inside. There is a room of about 20 square meters with treasure, but that's it. I visited Vienna last year and in comparison to that experience it is less inspirational.Still highly recommend to visit this church! :)
Beautiful building. Beautiful church, amazing marble walls but not sure about St Stephen's right hand - not a fan of relics.

Definitely visit. We absolutely loved St Stephens Basilica. Not only is the exterior lovely, especially when lit up in the evening, the interior is also stunning. We bought both the panorama ticket and the museum ticket (mostly because we couldnt understand which ne we needed) however would recommend just the panorama ticket unless you specifically want to see the museum. The view is incredible...but COLD in February!!

Amazing - large and spectacular. Although we have seen many churches in our travels through Europe this is another standout. It stands out in the city with its tall spire and is the focus of anywhere you can see it - the sheer size grabs the eyes. Inside the size becomes even more impressive - it makes one feel so small and insignificant.There are 2 chapels at one end of the building (you need to go through doors). One is to the Black Madonna and the other has a display that lights up if coins are inserted (a bit kitsch for a church) that you should visit. We enjoyed our visit and was free - we are left wondering why some, like this are free, and others like the Matthias church in Buda are charged. A visit is highly recommenced if in Budapest
Stunning exterior. Beautiful church and the exterior certainly creates an impression. The inside is very dark but worth the visit.

Interesting history and beautiful interior. Finally a church which doesn't charge entrance fee unless you want to go up the tower and even that is a very reasonable Ft 500. You can wander around in your own leisure and the view from the top of the basilica (there is an elevator!!) is fantastic. On display is King Stephen's mummified hand. However the painted walls and ceilings impressed me more.
Beautiful!. Lovely place, beautiful decoration, even an odd severed hand :) Plenty of space here so you can get around those annoyingly large groups.

Beautiful Building. An absolutely stunning edifice. The only church I think it is rivalled by is St Peter's in Rome.There is a climb to the viewing gallery (305 steps, I counted!), but the view is magnificent. A 'must do' on any visit to Budapest
Nice church. Be sure to see this church during the evening with the ambient light. It is great during the day, but awesome during the night.
evening service. I was lucky enough to catch a service there one evening it was lovely and very moving . The church is stunning inside with some of the best architecture I have seen

Perfect architecture!. What a nice building for a worshiping purpose. We liked it as a whole family. The marble on the floor, walls and facade is various colors. You can kindly light a candle and make a wish indoors. Very comfortable entry is welcoming people for prayers.

Breathtaking interior. Absolute must see while in Budapest.....2 Euro donation....We had the pleasure of attending an Evening Concert inside with string quartet and soprano female singer...Ave Maria was magical. Two adult tickets....approx £24.....worth every penny for a truly unforgettable evening.four concerts a month....Pay at entrance.

Great views from the top!. We visited the basilica which was lovely inside , but the real treat for us was climbing the 302 steps to the dome where you can then go outside for stunning views of the city - truly worth the effort (there is a lift you can pay a little extra for that takes you half of the way)!

Beautiful. Beautiful! I found the quietness inside to be a delightful respite from the “city” outside. There is no fee to enter, however a donation is recommended. We had found a map of sorts online, which I found helped us know who the statues and painting were depicting. If you go in the back room to see the right-hand of St Stephan, know that you have to drop money in the machine for the “box” to illuminate, otherwise it’s hard to see.

Gorgeous church with great views from the climb. This is a fantastic church and well worth spending some time to look around, especially since there is no charge to get in! There is a donations box at the entrance way and this money is clearly used effectively since the building is well maintained and clean. Inside the church most areas are open for you to look around. St Stephen’s hand is in a side room away from the main church area so do ensure you don’t miss it. The area in front of the glass display isn’t massive so it can get crowded easily but if the display isn’t lit I’d recommend dropping a coin into the box to activate the light; seeing it in full glory is both mesmerising and a little creepy!Outside the main entrance door to the church is another door where you can climb (or take a series of lifts) to the viewing area around the dome. There is a small charge for this collected by the lady behind the glass window, but it is totally reasonable. Being one of the two tallest buildings in Budapest (other being Parliament) you get a great view over the city and a different perspective that from the hill in Buda. If I recall correctly there is around 320 steps to the top. There are plenty of ‘passing’ areas for a quick rest if your legs begin to hurt but the climb isn’t as bad as other towers I’ve visited! Around halfway up there is an open area exhibiting a number of displays for other churches around the world. Unfortunately none of these displays were in English but it’s a interesting chance for a breather.From what I could tell during our visit there are no bathroom facilities in the building available to use so might be worth a consideration. The area around the church has plenty of cafes and restaurants, some with nice views over the front entrance of the building, so I’d highly recommend allocating at least a couple of hours to visit here; it’s a wonderful example of a neo-classical building.
Worth a visit!. Impressively big church in the centre of the city! The outside of the church is beautiful with a lot of details throughout the monument!

Beautiful building. We did the free tour of the inside and the dome and a funeral happened to be going on but they still allowed us in.Such a beautiful place,very very beautiful with a great lookout view of the city

Stunning outside and inside. what a fantastically well looked after catheral. Outside stunning, inside majestic and glorious in all its splendor. Well worth a visit and no charge for the main building, just a small donation. Try and visit whilst a service is being held, it's also presented in English.

Beautiful Basilica. A must see basilica, the reliquia of Saint Stepehen's is exposed. The outside is beautiful and we went during Christmas time, so in the square in front of the Basilica they had a very nice Christmas market

Excellent church in centre of town. St Stephens is right in the centre of the town and, as so, dominates the town. We visited on a rainy day 2 days before Christmas. It was a bit of a job to get into the church due to the crowds entering for the carol service but we did manage to see the creche and the stained glass windows. Quite impressive and would be lovely on a quiet day.The relics, such as the jewelled hand of St Stephen, are amazing.

Stop in and see St. Stephen's hand. Pretty nice basilica. They have concerts in the church which provides great classical music in a nice setting. Some interesting relics inside including the hand of St. Stephen of Hungary in a beautiful bejeweled glass case

Beautiful Organ. This is my favourite cathedral in the World. Simply see it to believe it! I went to an organ recital last week which no words can adequately describe. What perfection there is in its voice, be it in the lower or upper register. Bachs Orchestral Suite No 3 in D major, his Toccata and Fugue in D minor and Albinoni's Adagio were stunning.Traveller Tip. When you finish your visit, walk around the corner to Andrassy Ut, one of the most appealing boulevards in Europe
st stephens petrified hands. Beautiful cathedral. Lots of art students sitting around sketching. the petrified hands of St Stephen are a little disconcerting. within walking distance of river
Gloomy. Very gloomy and oppressive building... avoid if you are short on time. There is a charge on entry and another charge if you want the holy relic to light up!!
Worth a visit. The view from the top of the tower is just about worth the climb (about 300 steps) and the main building is also interesting although frankly we didn't stay long.
Fantastic view from the dome. well worth a visit and a climb of 300 odd steps to the fantastic views, get the lift back down and spend some peaceful time in the church.
Lovely view. Wonderful views of Danube & city, great backgrounds for photos, ships up and down the river, really nice
Beautiful. I didn't go in because there is just too much to do in such a short amount of time I had here. But it is an amazingly beautiful structure !!
A must see church. An impressive building with the most beautiful interior! Well worth a visit. Important to remember to be silent.

Truly beautiful. Churches can often be spectacular and it is easy to become jaded. Take the time and pay the 'donation' at the entrance to see the interior. The sign recommends 200HUF which is only 1Euro - well worth the price.

Lovely. The Basilika is absolutely beautiful no matter the season. Although, in the summer it can be even more fun to hang out on the steps and watch the world go by, both day and night. The basilika is beyond picturesque and definetely worth a visit.
Never seen so much granite and marble. Beautiful and stunning. Not to be missed. We spent a while in here because the atmosphere was so peaceful.
A beautiful building, my favourite in the city.. This building is huge and was my favourite in the city.It is very central and can be seen from all over the city, especially from Castle Hill.
Beautiful Old church. Amazing architecture inside the church, the outside was great also. The view over the whole city was breathtaking, a must palce to visit.

An Amazing Church. My wife is a church fan and we must must have seen hundreds around the world. But for me I am just an admirer of great buildings. This is simply one of the greatest church buildings and located in the centre of Budapest. Is free to go and look around but the tower/dome part costs.
Well worth seeing.

WoW!. Amazing architecture inside the church. I dont mind giving donations for church but when they demand (buying tickets) to get in then the real purpose of the church seem to disappear. Sad really.

Amazing. The size of this place is overwhelming. So beautiful on the outside as well as inside. First we climbed up to the tower (you have to pay a small fee).
