The view over the whole city was breathtaking, was so worth climbing up the many, many stairs. You can then take a lift down to the ground and you can look inside the Basilica. All the fine details and the height of the ceiling was magnificent. It's a must see if you are in Budapest!
beautiful. Beautiful, from the outside and from the inside. They often distribute flyers with concert dates -- if you can, try and go to a concert. The atmosphere is great.
Basilica. A Beautiful Church, the achitecture is trully magnificent, beware of beggars in the square outside. though they do not press you.

Amazing church in center Budapest. Almost Free of Charge just 2 Euros for church donation.Neoclassical building with circular apse.Started 1851 and finished after lot of stories around 1900.Tallest in Budapest same as the parliament with high dome 96 meters.Amazing style and shape, go inside and look for on of the best ORGAN in the world with around 6000 Pipes. if you are lucky maybe you can hear it or enjoy a concert.Beautiful dome and mosaics and nice painting of St. Stefan the first king of Hungary.If you come before 5pm you have the chance to see the Relics of St. Stefan.Not very famous art work but whole is a good example of early 19th century churches.On of the stories that this church changed the SAINT PATRON

impressive. Impressive church on the Pest side of the city. Looks even better on the insight. There is no entrance fee but do not forget to donate some money when you get in - the priest sitting there will not like it!

the best after the vatican. Its one of the most amazing churches round the world and I have seen a lot for me its ranked after the Vatican its amazing and spiritual you wouldn't have visited Budapest unless u go to st Stephan basilica
10th wedding anniversary. a very impressive Basillica. amazing architecture.Well worth visiting with a guide. you get a real sense of belonging
The most beautifull Basilica in Middle Europe. It's really beautifull! The St. Peter's Basilica in Rome was model for the builders (to my mind) and it's as magnificant as the church in Italy.

Incredible interior. The interior of this huge church is extremely ornate and has an amazing ceiling/dome.
It is set in a square just off the main shopping area and is visible from a good distance so you can't miss it.
Well worth a look around. It's free although they recommend a donation (suggested amount circa 50p UK) so great value
35th wedding anniversary week in Budapest. What a place. Fabulous and our first visit was made extra special with a visiting male choir practicing. Beautiful

Shhhhhhhhhhhhhh. This is a wonderful cathedral. You should go if you are in this lovely city. But why, oh why, oh why, do people make so much noise when others are trying to reflect in a House of God?? Zip it guys!

Wonderful experience. One of the "must sees" in Budapest. Absolutely stunning from a distance and definitely worth a close look! A little smaller than St. Paul's! They were tuning the organ whilst we were there!!
A beautiful church and wonderful place for reflection.

Very interesting and beautiful cathedral.. We visited St Stephen's with our wonderful guide for the day, Andrea Makkay from Budapest Guide. There are many very interesting stories relating to this cathedral so we were happy to have her share them with us. It was very interesting to note that it may be the only cathedral church without Jesus displayed at the the front as St Stephen has taken that place. You need to visit the chapel in the back and put change in the display to see a very interesting and somewhat gruesome display, St Stephen's hand. Well, worth the visit.

Another beautiful European church. The title says it all... One thing that sets this aside is that they have a chapel called "the Chapel of the Kings Hand". It is a chapel with, literally, the Kings hand. It was cut off at some point and it is now on display. The lighting made it difficult to see, but they have pictures leading up to it.Speaking of lighting, the main church was dimly lit by maybe 50% of the lighting capacity of this church. I don't know why but it was kind of dark. It is free to enter, but with a 200 forint donation (there is a guy that stands at the entrance to make sure you donate).
Impressive building. Despite the miserable weather this church was still impressive. Beautiful architecture. We didn't bother paying to see the view from the tower as it was an extremely foggy day!

very beautiful church. I love the church. Beautiful and good acoustic. When we were there, there was a group of men who sang. It was pleasing to hear their voice. The architecture of the basilica was very good. I was amazed with the grandeur of the basilica. The little chapel was charming. And the little shop infront the basilica was nice. I bought two beautiful rosaries and the salesperson spoke good english. A visit to the basilica must be for catholics like me. Highly recommended.

Lovely building with excellent acoustics. We went to the Basilica twice, once for a visit to the church and once to a concert of Christmas music. The building is beautiful and very elegantly decorated. The acoustics and the magnificent organ made the concert delightful.

Stunning!. Worth a visit! The basilica is stunning and the square in front of the Basilica is full of life with street musicians. Sit in any of the cafes after and soak up the atmosphere after the visit!

last hours in budapest. it is worth to visit..we started our last hours in Budapest and we were glad that we still visited this basilica. if you take the stairs (or elevator) you get a very nice view all over the city

Incredible architecture and craftsmanship. To only see the exterior of the basilica and not enter the building would be a huge mistake. Unlike many other attractions in the city, they don't ask much for entry. A friendly old priest asked for a small donation of 200 HUF (less than one Euro) for the maintenance for the church. It was a steal.The interior of the basilica was overwhelming with many ornate decorations on the walls and ceiling. Marvellous paintings surround you between leaf golden painted backgrounds and architectural elements. Lavish marble pillars and wall elements confirm the majestic history of the basilica and Budapest in its heyday. I've visited many cathedrals, basilica and churches all around the globe but this one will have a place in my memory forever.

Stunning. One of my favorite buildings in Budapest. It is absolutely stunning from a distance and when you take a closer look too. The basilica is build in neo-classical style. It's greenish roof gives it an antique look which perfectly fits with area of Budapest. The beige stone walls complete the effect. The basilica is very tall and the visitors may access the dome and enjoy the view.Besides, the streets offer a perfect vista ending with Basilica - truly amazing view. The area is full of good restaurants, bars and coffee houses - to stop by for a while and enjoy the ambience of the place.
A chruch. It is a church, nicely decorated, alot of gold, and a mumified hand of the first christian king: st. stephen. Don't get me wrong, it is a nice chrurch. But nothing spectacular.

A must see. This stunning church is a 'must see' in Budapest. A thousand year old hand of St. Stephen's in a special glass box was an interesting find, but one must pay money to turn on the light in the box to actually see it...
fab views from the top!. Excellent value in money to visit the top of the church £1. Excellent views you can take the stairs or the lift. we opted for the lift. Highly recommend visiting.

Beautiful. The Basilica is well worth a visit, and very reasonably priced entry. There's impressive architecture on the outside as well as inside... with lovely stained glass windows and art work on the ceilings etc. A trip up into the massive roof/dome area is a must and then out on top to admire the view and get some pictures while up there.

Rivals basilicas we saw in Rome!. My fiancé and I have come across many basilicas in our time travelling but the architecture of this beautiful building rivals anything we have ever came across before. A truly stunning building; inside and out! A must see in Budapest.

Beautiful! With gorgeous self-cleaning ceramic roof!. It's breathtaking, as is the view from the area around it! Don't miss it! You will regret it. There is a tiny cafe up on the wall where you can have a glass of something stronger (or not) and enjoy the view.

Lift or stairs?. A beautiful church and worth a visit - after many days of walking we decided to take the lift to the top of the dome - unusual that you can go almost all the way by lift and the price is the same as for the stairs! Choose a clear day to do this if you can.
Breathtaking. Well worth going to see and it is free !!!!!! you just have to find the right door!!!! We also went to a concert and the acoustics were superb.

St Istvan Basilica. Imposing building, worth to see inside and outside and i mean go to top of the Basilica and you can see great wiew on Budapest (great panorama on the town). Go to top if you aren't afraid of height and you are going at your own rish on the top. Entry on top is 500 Ft.

Stunning. I went to Budapest with my friend who recommended we go here as it was mentioned in the guidebook so we meandered the streets and sat on the road leading up to the Basilica for a quick hot chocolate and it looked stunning from there, let alone what was inside!Inside we were greeted with vaulted ceilings and immense golden decor, you were also allowed to take pictures. They do ask for a donation to enter which we were fine with but I know this will put people off. I would say as it is a donation put something little in if you are reluctant to pay as it is worth a walk round.We also paid to go up the stairs to the view point which was amazing on a sunny day and is just as good as the view point from Buda, so would definitely recommend it.
Beautiful. I was here for Xmas eve mass such a beautiful Church.. Worth seeing. We saw Cardinal Peter Erdo which was a good moment. It was fully packed.

Don't miss that view!!. Beautiful basilica from outside and especially inside. The best thing is that you can go up for small price and without waiting because there are two elevators which lead you to the top and that view from the balcony is breathtaking. Highly reccomend!!

If you're interested in Budapest, you must visit St. Stephen's. Sunday mass at 10:00 is a Latin-Hungarian mass. Absolutely breathtaking service with a choir that may make you weep just a little. I'm so glad we were able to attend.Later, we walked up the steps to the viewing area of one tower. It's a few dollars, but worth it. The views are great & there is an elevator for those who need it. The hand may or may not be St. Steven's 1000 year old hand, but it's neat to see anyway, I guess.
heavenly music. There are weekly organ concerts in this gorgeous setting. The Basilica's inside appearance has a rather "Eastern" flavour, with lovely guilded ornamentation. Beautiful!
wonderful place!. It is an wonderful basilica.And it was a Christmas market in front of it, with hot wine and sweets, and souvenirs.And music, of course.

The best place in the city.. We have been there during a day. Huge and perfect church. In the evenig we took tkts for organ concert. A little expensive but It was amaizing experience. Suggest to visit.

so many churches all have their own uniqueness. If you have time to wander around Budapest take time to visit St. Stephen's Basilica, it is in St. Stephen's Square. You won't be disappointed by the beautiful stained glass, the rose colored marble walls, and the beautiful cupola. I would buy a ticket for an elevator to walk around the exterior of the cupola, beautiful city views from up there -very safe for anyone who is a little afraid of heights.

Another amazing church. From outside, perhaps it will not be too impressive, but from inside obviously this church directly take your attention.I myself take roughly around 45 minutes just strolling inside the building to admire the beauty of the architecture.It is located in downtown so it is quite easy to find.

STUNNING !. This was our first port of call when we went to Budapest as it was just round the corner from our apartment. It is very easily reached from anywhere in the city and had major tour buses stop outside as well. Neither my son or myself are particularly religious but the beauty of the Basilica was breathtaking, we were lucky enough to catch the end of two services on our many visits which was lovely and we got to hear the magnificent organ playing also. We went up to the roof for absolutely stunning views of the city, you get 360 degree views which it fantastic. We also visited the treasury on one of our visits which was interesting. It is free to enter but they do recommend a donation which is very reasonable and there are lifts to the roof and the treasury ( there is a small fee for these though). This is a MUST see sight in Budapest I guarantee you will not be disappointed

iconic landmark, incredible inside and out. The basilica is found in the city centre and a favourite for tourists. It opens 9am so before most museums at 10am so worth going first thing, and entry is free but they suggest a donation of a euro or 200f. Inside you can wander at admire the stain glass paintings, relics, history etc and take photos. Stunning and a peaceful spot the escape the busy city

Interesting basilica... This building illustrates very clearly the history of religion in Hungary and definetely represents a masterpiece. The view from the top is absolutely spectacular. A must-visit in Budapest ! It is very easy to reach, as it is just 100 metres away from the Elizabeth Square and Vacs Street.

A highlight of my trip to Budapest. It really was breathtaking. I'm not a religious person at all but the scale and beauty of this building really took my breath away. I was definitely deeply moved by my surroundings. There is a small fee, 200 HUF to enter the church (less that £1) and if you want to climb the dome like we did then there is a 1000 HUF fee which is around £3 but well worth it. After climbing lots of winding stairs to the top of the dome we were rewarded but amazing panoramic views of the city. It was very grey and cold for most of our stay but the views were still spectacular. You can see as few at the Buda hills and make out all the major landmarks.If you visit in December there is a Christmas market outside which is a little cheaper than the main one and free ice skating.

Take the elevator to the outside terrace. You will get some of the best (and least known) views in the city from the Basilica's circular terrace at the top. You have to pay a small fee to ride the elevator up, but it's worth it.
A must!. Stunning! The cupola is a real work of art. The panoramic view from the top is worth it if the sky is clear.

Magnificent!. We were walking with my husband on our last day in Budapest, and we found the Roman Catholic Basilica. The interior is beautiful, and I can compare with many others of the world. The cupula is amazing, and there is a shop outside where you can buy authentic rosary, not only from Italy!

Gorgeous. This church is a must-see if you are visiting. Apparently you can climb up to get a view of the city but we didn´t have the time. Be sure to check out the chapel where lies a mummified hand that legend says belongs to St. Stephen himself!
BEAUTIFUL. Beautiful place very impressive. Stunning and impressive cathedral. A classic look and breathtaking. Walls, glass, atmosphere simply can not be explained, must visit and feel.

So much to see. The Basilica provides a lot to see and do, firstly you can go into the main church area which is beautifully decorated with gold and marble. This costs a donation of 200 HUF. Then once you leave this area, the stairs to the top of the dome are the next must see activity. To climb the stairs costs 500 HUF but the view from the top is worth it. (If you suffer from claustrophobia or are scared of heights this isn't the best thing for you). After climbing approx 300 steps you reach the top of the dome, and are able to walk around the outside. Here you can see the whole city and is a great place to be reminded of the beauty of Budapest.

It's worth. It's worth to go on top (with stairs it's not that difficult like for the tower of St Stephen in Vienna). Beautiful scenes; it ha been out first building we visited and therefore we could recognize all our next steps

Beautiful views inside and out. Beautiful Roman catholic Basilica - one of the biggest in Hungary - it houses St Stephen's (the first King of Hungary) right hand in the reliquary and has some beautiful paintings and stained glass. You can visit for a small donation and for an extra 500 fl, climb the stairs to the tower and get an amazing view of the city for your effort.

An excellent example of architecture. Go there, enjoy perfect atmosphere, take a ticket for evening concert - and what you could need after that, is only a glass of hot wine and walk in the city center together with your thoughts. Amazing.

Amazing place. St. Stephen's Basilica is an amazing cathedral in the center of Budapest.Has a stunning interior and is really peaceful.From entrance stairs we have an amazing view for the square in front of it.
Stunning. One of the most impressive churches I have ever seen - huge and the most beautiful decoration inside
MAGIC. Excellent example of cathedral. Excellent walls and pillars, free entrance of course and magic. Not suitable for people who want to pray

Cold and Uninviting.... I found St. Stephen's Basilica to be cold, uninviting and sterile. To add insult to injury, it was also cold.The concert we attended by orientation of seating, placed the soloist and the organist directly behind the audience. I found this to be frustrating and unfamiliar.If you enjoy spending time in gold-laden, crowded places of worship, than this is the place for you. Otherwise, stay home and pray...for free.
Great for photos. Amazing view of the city! Great for photo ops...Too bad the Church was under construction and we couldn't see the inside :(

Great. Must see, nice and grand bazilika, you may make a photo.
Easy to get there, it is in centre of city.
Great views over Budapest . Definitely worth a visit & climbing up all the stairs to get to the top (there is a lift if you don't fancy the stairs!) Lovely views over Busapest!

Breathtaking!. As I enter I was trying to set my camera and the moment I raised my eyes I was left with open mouth! Needless to say that the words "Oh my God" that slipped out of my mouth was right on spot :) It's a beautiful masterpiece, laid out in Greek cross, serene and majestic and every little bit is a work of art. I am not a catholic myself but that didn't stop me from admiring the architecture, the icons, the statues and the chancel. This stunning church can hold up to 8.000 worshippers! You feel tiny...! You can also go on an elevator to the top to a gorgeous view but you have to pay and there is also a mummified arm of king Stephen but you also have to pay to see it... You really can skip those. The church is an art work alone it will leave you satisfied. You have to see it!
Ken Kleins' St.Stephans Basilica Review. All churches are unique in there interior design. One needs to see it to appreciate such architectural beauty. This must be on list to see.
Lovely setting. We attended a concert in the Basilica and had plenty of time to inspect the surroundings. Really lovely, and the acoustics are pretty good, too.

Great views. Based on St Peters in Rome no doubt this is a very impressive church, if you can call it that. The interior is full of beautiful art and statues, painted walls and ceilings. It takes your breath away just thinking at how it was built. You can go into the basillica itself onto the 'roof' area to see the fantastic views across the city. If I remember there is a small charge but worth it, and you have to climb over 300 steps to get to the top. Again the views of the city are worth the climb up and down again.

Loses it impact when its the last cathedral on a 10 day tour. Beautiful cathedral, but after viewing so many churches in Prague and Vienna, the saturation point hit. Impressive, beautiful, stately and worth a visit even to light a candle.

The view. A must do is the climb to the outside of the Basilica. The view of Budapest is fantastic, especially as you can walk right around. There is an option to catch a lift if the stairs are too much.

Magnificent but modern. This is a beautiful basilica with all the usual gold leaf, paintings and statues. It is, however, very new by normal cathedral standards. The full magnificence was really brought home when the organ started playing, shivers and chills as that rich sound filled the air.

Wow. This church is beautiful, so much detail and decoration. Pay the extra and climb the steps to the panoramic balcony (over 300 steps) it's worth the extra cost and the climb for the 360 view of the city.
Beautiful. I would recommend going in and enjoying the beautiful art in this church. It is very magical at night. Highly recommend seeing.

Lovely Bascilica. Definitely worth popping into if you have the time. The outside of the church is spectacular all by itself, but the inside certainly doesn't disappoint either - especially keeping in mind all that this church has endured through recent history. Make sure to work your way towards the back to see the mummified hand of St. Stephen.

Beautiful Basilica. It was amazing inside. No need really for a tour if going with kids. Can climb to the top for a small fee, see the right hand of the King with no problem and just marvel at the beautiful decorations.

Midnight Mass on Christmas Eve - Wonderful. We visited the Basilica several times during our stay, and Midnight Mass was a wonderful and touching experience. So much so, we returned for Christmas Day Mass also, and were not disappointed. We visited the city to experience, amongst other things, the Christmas markets, the Basilica was surrounded by them - the photos say it all! And, importantly, and to our surprise, many were open throughout Christmas Eve and Christmas day itself. A great Christmas experience!!
Where else can you see a mummified hand?. This has to be one of the most impressive churches we have ever visited. The interior is so ornate. In addition, the hand of St. Stephen has to be seen.

Wonderful building especially at Christmas time. We visited the Basilica just at Christmas time and we had the luck to be able to listen to a choir singin Christmas songs on the stairs of the Basilica.We only had a quick visit of the building from the inside but it was magnificent.The surroundings are also worth visiting in the heart of Budapest.

St Stephen's Basilica. I don't think anyone could fail to be impressed by the frontage of this building which nestles in the middle of Pest. Look up as you climb to the top of the steps to the main entrance and be astounded by the artwork on the arch. We weren't able to go inside but I imagine it's spectacular.

Very nice but broken ticketing system. Very nice church a must see in Budapest but I hope the ticketing purchase system can be improved. Waited 15 minutes at -8 degrees because of new ticketing systems that are slow and keep collapsing....
Stunning. One of the most beautiful churches. The atmosphere inside was nice and quiet with the respect it deserves.
Astounding place. Not religious but I was taken aback at the splendour of the place. Simply amazing. Attended at Christmas and there was a light show on the outside. A must and easy to get to.

I'd say better than matthias. Absolutely amazing. Worth every penny, even though it's free Haha. We donated 200 (less than 1 dollar) like the sign says. We thought we read that it opens at 9. Maybe there was a delay for some reason or different because of the holidays, but it was open at 10. Took about an hour

Stunning. What a stunning place, Free to go in (Donation) £1.50 to go up to the dome for the beautiful views.
Also spent midnight mass here along with another 8500 people

Dazzling. We went for the Christmas Eve midnight service and by 11:25 it was standing room only. It was truly a joyful worship service! W had visited the Basilica earlier and especially loved the carved pews.

Beautiful church, but rather ornate..... Be sure not to miss St. Matthias Church near the castle...it is the loveliest church I have ever seen and Fisherman's Bastion (attached) is beautiful with spectacular views.
Magnificent Architecture. Such a beautiful basilica. Love the sculptures, statues and everything in it! It would be perfect if I am allowed to take photographs nearer to the altar.

Worth the (few) money!. Szent István Bazilika is the one of the most impressive cathedrals I have seen in my life! Although not distinguishing from far, due to the surrounding buildings, you will be stunned from the magnitude of the cathedral, when you will be in the square in front it. It's also worthy to climb up the stairs and enjoy the view of the city! Do not miss it, by any means!
Wonderful God house. Beautiful Basilica. The paintings conjure up wonderful atmosphere of the place. The façade of the old ego sum via, veritas et vita  subtitle beautiful golden letters.

Towering, majestic, yet inviting. This Basilica is amazing. It's size and dominance over the square and buildings around it is mightily impressive, but also strangely inviting and engaging. The architecture is of course impressive, but the intricate artwork upon the very archways, nooks and crannies, and cornerstones of the building itself perhaps takes the 'most beautiful' prize. The stat to St Stephen is also very impressive, be sure to get a good long look at it.
Basilica. Beautiful building, stunning architecture both outside and in and a wonderful range of bells. The mosaics inside the dome were stunning and St Stephen takes pride of place behind the altar.
Right outside our hotel...... This is a very beautiful Basilica and should not be missed when visiting Budapest. There is quite a lot to see in and around it and the food and shops are wonderful.

Don't Miss St. Stephen's. St. Stephen's is a fundamental part of Budapest. No visit to the city is complete without seeing it. Take your time and try to visit when there is a service or concert. This is a stunning basilica with a great history. Enjoy!
A very grand church. The church is very splendid. It has an concert once a while. Worth visiting. When I visited in Dec, there was a Christmas market in front of this cathedral.

Beautiful art and history. Like: the architecture and paintings
Free entry,
Right next to the main metro station
next to cafes and resturants (affordable)
you can take photographs

Marvellous structure.. When in Budapest one must visit St Stephen's Basilica and climb the steps to the top of the structure. The view of the inner dome as you are climbing the stairs is awesome. Great vies of Budapest and the surrounding countryside from the top.

Amazing. We rented a house just at the corner of the Basilica. I would say it is probably one of the best areas to stay especially during Christmas time as there is a big christmas market next to it. Also we attended christmas mass on 24th Dec evening at the Basilica and i must say it was a great experience...make sure you bring 200HUF to visit Basilica. They dont have change so make sure you have exact coins with you.

Climb the steps. Awesome viewing after you climb the steps to the top, viewing inside is spectacular, sitting in the pews to gather your thoughts and remember those who've passed, even light a candle.

Awesome structure. An awesome architecture! There was a Christmas Market in front and the choices of food were incredible. All local cuisines on display. The vibe was great. Situated in the city centre. Walk along the Danube River to enjoy the view.
Magnificent. It's a truly magnificent structure... Unfortunately, we couldn't make it to the top because there was a christmas mass, but we've been told its a glorious view from up there
Stunning inside. A very beautiful building with stunning detail inside.There was a very good food market and ice rink in the square outside when we visited just before Christmas.

Stunning...Patron Saint. Beautiful and opulent. Black Madonna stuffed into a back hallway (called a chapel...really?). We were there 5 days before Dec. 26th--St Stephens Day...beautifully decorated for Xmas with crèche and Xmas market out front. Stunning.

Stunning...Patron Saint. Beautiful and opulent. Black Madonna stuffed into a back hallway (called a chapel...really?). We were there 5 days before Dec. 26th--St Stephens Day...beautifully decorated for Xmas with crèche and Xmas market out front. Stunning.

a very nice monument. To those of you who like "imperatrice Sisi" movies it s like going back to the wedding of Sisi. And in December, there is a beautiful Christmas Market . Music and traditional foods. A must go and see.

A solemn church. A church as any other with murals, glass paintings and statues. The name of the church is from Saint Stephen whose right hand apparently is preserved.( could not see it due to time constraints). Well maintained and quiet place though there are plenty of visitors streaming in and out all the time.

Beautiful. If you are on a river cruise, St. Stephen's may not be on your tour. However, the basilica is not far from the docks, and the short walk there is worthwhile. We went at dusk, and so as it got dark outside, the lights were turned on in the church-- magnificent interior when lit. Additionally, the church is lit on the outside as well--fabulous!

The church of the century. Again all the architecture in this area is just awesome to view let alone step foot into. Having the opportunity to stand outside this church and experience the environment, history and architecture made for a great experience

Beautiful church. I love architecture...in fact I must say I liked this church more on the outside than on the inside...I'm not really into that baroque style you know. Anyway it's stunning...there's no entrance fee (at least we did not pay), but you can offer something to enter.

St. Stephen's Basilica (Szent Istvan Bazilika). The most beautiful big church in the heart of Budapest. Great scenery from the tower all around to whole wide Budapest. The interior is stunning with gorgeous golden decorations.
Awesome. Visited just before Christmas, many people visiting but everyone free to wander beautiful church, amazing chapel,set in the middle of Christmas markets,

Magnificent, glorious. This a Place which leaves my mouth open. Its is remarkaly beautiful inside, with harmonious colors of the marble ceiling, golden decoration and carving. I am envious to those who can have their prayers regularly in this church.

A must-visit in Budapest. What an elegant church. Beautiful architecture and amazing interior. A small cost to go right to the top with a brilliant view. Taking the stairs requires hard work and high levels of fitness, otherwise take the lift. I took the stairs which was shattering but it was worth it once i got to the top.
Grand. There was a Christmas Market, with an ice-rink, at the front of the Basilica. Beautiful building with lots to see.

What a beautiful church. What a diamond in this capital city. No entry fee just make a (generous) donation. The stained glass windows and decoration are beautiful plus we had the honour of being allowed to visit the tomb of Ferenc Puskes. A shame this is not open to all.

Very Beautiful. This is a lovely church in the centre of Budapest.
It's as beautiful as some of those we saw in Rome
You are expected to make a donation of 200 huf per person - about 50p per person
Lovely to see inside and worth spending a few minutes
Nothing great really. always asking for money - its a church !!!!!!!! i do not think clergy should be on the doors asking for money
beautiful!!. Saw a free concert and childrens choir. The acustics were fabulous and the church was breathtaking! A definite site to see

The Basilica. Even as someone with no interest in relgion (but an interest in the buildings) this is a must-see and visit. There is no charge to the main interior, but it really is a must see. Breathtaking.

A dream come tru.. It is so beautiful and it is a dream come tru for us. The minute you set foot in there you cannot imagine how beautiful architectural place of worship was constructed. Everything so perfect.

Wonderful, better from the inside. A beautiful Basilica. The Christmas markets outside were great and made for a great setting. Didn't know what to expect inside as never seen pictures and was awed by it. There a voluntary 200 HUF entry fee. Worth going in though and you can spend as much time as you want and take pictures.

very old church. This was an extremely beautiful church. Old world construction with a huge dome. The courtyard in front of the church has a christmas bazaar with food and crafts from all over Hungary
Amazing. Dont miss to visit this church and look inside. Its really spectacular and worth visiting. In december, front of basilica you can find Advent fair with lot of gastronomy atractions.

awesome. Beautifully painted ceilings , so much gold leaf magnificent dis not expect that. Also there was a lite show and music outside with images of Christmas. we enjoyed mulled wine in the market outside and there was a childs icerink outside plus lots of food stalls

Dont miss a visit but have 200 HUFs ready. We enjoyed our visit -You really need to go , its neo classical design is beautiful. The front door is monitored and a box which requires 200 HUFs each . The shrine of St Stephens right fist is an experience itself - watching the many visitors who stand around waiting for someone to put in some money to light up the shrine - you cant see it very well even then! Visitors may access the dome by elevators or by climbing 364 stairs for a 360° view overlooking Budapest
Gorgeous church. Named after the first king of Hungary, this is a beautiful building. Most of it has been rebuilt, but it is truly a beautiful piece of architecture.
good. this was a nice place to visit, however we only viewed it from the outside as we went to the Christmas market.

Beautiful Bascilica. I would rank it as one of the most beautiful churches in Central Europe. Located in the center of Budapest, it's steeples are part of the skyline. It is an architectural wonder of the Neo-Classical style. Be prepared to spend a couple of hours to explore all the artwork and features of this magnificent basilica. If you are physically able don't miss going up to the cupola for a wonderful view of Budapest (unfortunately it was closed when we visited it in December).

A View point Extrordanaire!. This building is spectacular, much like most of budapest, it is a brick built construction with a decorative fascia, so for those wanting to marvel at rawstone construction it isnt that! unfortunately the whole city bears the scares of so many wars that its building are mere pop-ups in the places that great structures once stood. dont be put off though, atop the plywood done is a viewing gallery that gives a perspective that is second to none. with a full panaramic of Budapest it CANNOT be missed! plus it only costs about £1 to go to the top and the actual basillica is free although they expect a donation of about 50p
Lovely Church. The roof has coloured tiles, so had to go and look in side though you have to pay, lovely art work in their though they are doing work in their so a lot covered up. at the moment.

Huge barn of a place. This really is a huge building. We attended an organ concert here and the acoustic was amazing. Not very good for quick music (the trumpet we heard was playing some fast stuff which just ran together) but the nave organ and the Great Organ gave out some huge and impressive sounds.

An interesting place to visit. This isn't an old building (1851 to 1905), but it's imposing from the outside and religiously-ornate on the inside. Its claim to fame, apart from some stunning mosaics by one Karoly Lotz, is that it houses the right hand of St Stephen. I'm not sure where the rest of him went to. This mummified hand, it seems, has been a well-travelled tourist since it first belonged to Stephen, crowned King of the Magyars in the year 1000. It somehow became separated from the rest of him when he left the throne for somewhere higher. Then, in the 13th century, it was taken to Dubrovnik to protect it from the Tartars (that warrior race who liked a sauce made of cream and capers with their fish and chips). Later, it travelled to Vienna and then to the Royal Palace in Buda. It didn't take up residence at his Basilica until 1945. It looks quite at home in its little gilded display case, which lights up when you cross the guardian's palm with a 100 Forint coin.

Magnificent. Located in the centre of Budapest this architectural wonder is outstanding. Be prepared to spend a couple of hours to explore all the artwork and features of this magnificent basilica - you can even view St Stephen's hand if you like to pay for the privilege!

Spectacular!. This is really worth the visit.
Both inside and out the architecture and decor is unbelievable and you cant help but admire the years of hard work that must have gone into it's creation.
Highly recommended

Grand Architecture. We didn't go inside, but it seemed very busy with large parties of schoolchildren going inside in groups. We spent 2-3 hours in the vast square in which the Basilica is situated, exploring the various vibrant side streets. On that day, there were several hundred chairs, all occupied, in the square, and a huge screen relaying the service from inside the Basilica. Unmatched gradeur, marvellous architecture, excellent atmosphere and enviable ambience.

YOU must visit this place. Only good things to say about this grand place , everything is perfect . I recomend it to anyone who travels to Budapest . Fees : -200 huf entry donation ( not even 1 euro)-extra tax if you want to climb to the dome ( spectacular view ) ,if i remember corectly the fee is abnout 900 Huf (3 euros and it is worth it )

Notice this Unique Altar!. Be sure to notice that this is a rare (if not only) catholic altar where you will not see the crucifixion over the altar. It will be St. Stephen instead. He was cannonized shortly after his death and the Pope allowed him to be depicted on his cathedral above the altar. This is one of the most beautiful churches I have seen. Prior to this one, it was Basilica Sacre Cour in Paris. There are larger churches like Notre Dame, Westminster Abbey, the Vatican, but they lack the architectural consistency and integration. Worth seeing and easy to find/access from the main hotel area on the Pest Danube River edge.

Go inside!. This church is really beautiful. You are expected to put a small donation into the offering tub, but it is well worth it. The frescos on the ceiling are breathtaking as is the architecture and the stained glass windows. There is a very respectful atmosphere in this place. I am a Christian and I felt a great sense of peace.
Stunning. This has got too be worth a visit it is absolutely stunning and its beauty cant be described it has too be enjoyed photographs don't do it justice

Well worth a visit. Took a break from the Christmas Market in the adjacent square. Beautiful interior and a nice interlude from the market outside. Well worth an hour taking in the impressive interior for the small contribution of 200HUF.
Nice building. We didn't go in but enjoyed walking around the Christmas markets in front of it and there is a light show every half hour which is nice to see over Christmas.

Interesting but .... This building depends on sufficient light to view the mosaics that are one of its features. Unfortunately the day we visited was inclement & there was not adequat artificial light to appreciate the work.

Beautiful. Beautiful from the outside and we wish we could have gone inside but when we visited there was a celebratory mass going on with lots of priests and such so entrance was declined. We did enjoy the Christmas market in front of the church.
Stunningly Beautiful. We spent all too little time here but were able to enjoy a concert that was fantastic in such a place. One of your must see places while in Budapest. Enjoy !
Wonderful. An atmospheric place. Sat here for a while and felt peaceful. Went outside and watched the light show on the facade of the Basilica. It was amazing
Christmas Festivities. The place is all pumped up for Christmas with a typical christmas market full of food, goodies, shopping and festivities around. Loved the whole atmosphere.
Christmas market. We didn't go inside, but enjoyed the view and the light show, the market was very pretty and the food smelled very good.
Worth a visit. Beautiful, ornate and lovely this is a treasure to see. Very busy and you could also do a mass. Best one so far.

Beautiful and remarkable in Christmas time. Not everybody knows that the St. Stephen's Basilica is not dedicated to the ancient martyr but to the very first king of Hungary, Stephen the first (975–1038), whose right hand is housed here in a reliquary. The architecture is in simple neoclassical style, like many others in central Europe, but the dimensions are awful: its height is almost 100 meters. The depicted windows deserve a careful view. In the Christmas time is something special.

the view the view the view. its so amazing make sure if you can to take the stairs on the right side of the entrance it costs 500 HUF to get to the upper terrace and the view there is just amazing also the way up there while taking the narrow spiral staircase is nice and then you take a small elevator up you also have a option of taking a larger elevator on the left side of the entrance ( instead of the stairs ) highly recommended

Amazing Basilica. The inside of this basilica is amazing. It has a beautiful alter, ornate ceilings, spectacular stain glass windows, organ, pulpit, sculptures and paintings. The basilica is very large and no expense was spared in building it. It also has a religious hand relic of the first ruling King of Hungry, Stephen, which is housed in a small, silver church shaped box. If you put a few coins in a nearby box, it will light up the silver church for 2 minutes. The relic is housed in a small room up front on the left side of the church. The room was very crowded with people taking pictures and trying to see the hand.

Beautiful and excellent view from the tower.. Another 'must see' and trip up the tower well worth the effort. Christmas market in the square added to the seasonal feeling with the Basilica reminding us of the meaning of Christmas.
Sightseeing . Lovely place to visit. The roof top has an excellent view of the city, very reasonable price. well worth a visit
Sensory and appealing. Sensory and appealing, just magnificent. Far too much to take in for one visit to really appreciate the space and contents, the relic being very special.

Pretty Church. Lots of history.. A visit to St. Stephen's is a must while visiting Budapest. Make sure to visit the reliquary to see the mummified right hand of St. Stephen on display and take the elevator or stairs up into the dome/towers to see a panoramic view of the city and Danube river.Entrance fee is a donation. To to up in the dome, there is a small fee.

Impressive but .... ... incredibly OTT. A massive building, solid outside and glitzy inside. But you can go up the tower for a great view of the area.A donation is requested as you enter but is not mandatory.And we visited in December so enjoyed the Christmas market in the square in front of it.

Breathtaking!. This is a breathtaking Basilica. Walking in, you are completely overwhelmed with it's beauty. Make sure you go to see St. Stephen's hand. You need to donate a euro to get the light to turn on but it's worth it. It's a bit weird, sure, but it's also an interesting story and unique. Not something you get to do everywhere.

Organ performance was great. We attended a well organized organ recital on a Friday evening at the church. Profoundly mesmerising recital that amplified sound in the church to its fullest potential. Hear and grow completely bowled over by scintillating music.

Magnificent Citiy on the Danube. Vienna, the capital of Austria, was once the center of the Holy Roman Empire and today it is one of the world's greatest centers of art, music and architecture. The Gothic masterpiece of St. Stephan's Cathedral or Steffi ("little Stephan") as the Viennese call it, is perhaps the most famous structure in Vienna and a testament to Vienna's status in the Middle Ages. Our tour via the Danube River was as exciting, educational, fun and yet it was also very restful - odd combinations but a wonderful mix of scenery, medieval cities,palaces, museums grand boulevards, old and recent history, restaurants, and culture.

Not To Be Missed. Even if you have only 1 day in Budapest Basilica must be visited. You see pictures, videos, read blogs and still .... when you get inside you realize multi-media couldn't give justice. Once in a lifetime experience.
Beautiful. Wonderful and beautiful a must see, the Christmas market was outside so if you go in December go at dusk it's all lit up outside too

St Stephen's is a must see Basilica. St Stephens was one of the first places we wanted to see, and were glad that it was open. The person at the entry door suggests you make an offering when you enter, but some people just went by and on into the church. We made a donation. The Basilica is huge and beautiful with mosaics, stained glass, statuary, and a huge open expanse that was designed to make you feel the immensity of the space.

Wonderful Organ concert. St. Stephen's Basilica is by itself pretty amazing but if you get a chance to attend an Organ concert there seize the moment! The Basilica was absolutely stunning. Don't forget to stop by St. Stephen's hand's display. It is a religious relic that is a little gruesome but was an interesting story. We also took advantage of an evening Organ Concert held at St. Stephens. The music literally filled the Basilica and encompassed your entire body. When they played Ava Maria...it was just magical.

Worth the climb to the top for the views. The inside of the Basilica is amazing and you can take the stairs (if you're fit enough) or go up in the lift to the tower where you can have 360 degree views of Budapest. Marvellous!

Great stained glass. It is a church, so it is similar to many others, but fun stops on the self-guided tour like the royal boxes and other side places were neat to see. The stained glass in this building was great.
Beautiful Church. Very beautiful church with the "interesting" relic of St Stephan's right hand ! A little bizarre but quite interesting history.

Beautiful. Visited on our last evening in Budapest. Entry asked for 200HUF donation (which nobody would have any issue in giving). What a beautiful building this is. Make sure to take a camera! You can also go up on the roof (no doubt the views were brilliant over the Christmas market, however this had closed when we arrived). Must see
Beautiful. We attended Mass, but visitors can simply walk through. The ceilings rival the Vatican without being as cavernous.

St. Stephen's Christmas Market. Unfortunately we only got to see the Basilica from the outside as it was closed when we visited. A small Christmas market was held in the square in front of it and there was a spectacular laser show projected onto the front of it. it is a very impressive building.
Stunning!!!. Probably the most beautiful place I have ever seen. Totally breathtaking.... Total "must-see" visit. Free to go inside the church. Wonderful x

ornate. This is where the organ recitals are held. Although we didn't go we're told by people who are culture buffs it is excellent. Worth a visit particularly if your in the large Christmas market outside.
Beautiful place.. I love it seeing is believing , it's very popular , but doesn't shut till 7 and you can take photos inside !

Take a trip up the tower for great city views. Spectacular inside but in the style of most Cathedrals in middle Europe but take a trip to the tower (I would suggest using the lifts!) and look out over the whole of the City, if you go as the light is falling it is lovely to see the lights come on.

Beautiful Church. We visited St. Stephens church during Sunday mass in September. It was such a peaceful experience. The choir was angelical and the architecture was breathtaking. The church has a rooftop with a 360 view of the city. It also has spiral stairs that make a great picture.

Well maintained and guided tours available. It's beautiful and I've no words to explain its magnanimity. You can just go around and takes photos, or sit quietly on one of the benches and and pray. The courtyard is huge and photos are a must

An historic church that is well worth visiting. We visited St Stephen's Basilica in the evening for a Christmas concert and it was a breathtaking experience. The interior was lit by spotlights, highlighting the ceiling paintings, the high altar and some of the side chapels. The acoustics inside are superb, so,that the magnificent organ sounded very impressive. The views from the entrance steps out towards the Christmas market were just beautiful.
amazing. beautiful and free was a wonder to the eye enjoyed the amazing architecture.The xmas market outside added to the magic of it all.Must be seen we viewed during a service on Sunday morning

Breathtaking. I was extremely lucky to visit on a Sunday mid service. The church itself is stunning with columns and gold plated filigree to name a few. I am not catholic but I could't help but be moved by the gorgeous choir. It was magical. If visiting remember to leave a donation by the entrance for maintenance of the Basilica.

Must see attraction!. Completely stunning building, was so glad that I had visited and got the chance to see it, was blown away by how beautiful it looked on the inside, I'm not religious at all but I didn't mind paying the small 200HUF donation which I used to light a candle, the hand didn't really impress me but the whole decoration of the building was stunning

Loved the concerrt. We walked through with our family, it is break taking inside! E came back in the evening for an organ concert, well worth our money, even our children loved it, they just wished we sat facing the organ instead of it being behind us in the loft.

Grand scale interior. As with many European churches, the size and grandeur of the marble interior can be overwhelming but is so exquisite. We didn't climb the tower as we were tight on time, but do follow the transept to the back left side of the altar to a smaller rear chapel. Here you will find a reliquary with the hand of St. Stephen in it. Will return here again the next time I visit. The basilica is also visible at night from the nearby Ferris wheel and is beautiful then as well.

Not to be missed. Our first visit to Budapest, visited St Stephen's Basicilica , was built in the mid 1800's but only finished at the end of the century. First mass was in 1905 just 9 years before the start of the First World War. It is beautiful both inside and out. Hungarians obviously love it as it is well cared for, lovely atmosphere. Very peaceful. No fee but have to make a donation

Great church and convert. We went to the St. Stephen's Basilica (Szent Istvan Bazilika) on our last night in Budapest. The city has many great buildings, but this one made us breathless.The concert, not cheap, but worth it all, was mainly organ with great soloists (violin, trumpet, tenor and soprano). The acoustics were great and the whole audience was greatly impressed from what we heard.

Very impressive. We timed this right visiting as it was raining outside. This building is so impressive inside and out. We braved the stairs to walk to the top and to see the panoramic view. Although it was a miserable day it gives you a birds eye view of this lovely city, cost of the veiw 1000 forints, would definitely recommend a muat do while in Budapest.
Must see!. So amazing this place! Beautiful church and interesting art everywhere. We spent about 30 minutes here just taking it all in.
Beautiful. Be sure to climb the tower because it offers a magnificent view on Budapest from all sides. Not expensive. Not a difficult climb: at the end there is a lift.
beautiful. Awe-inspiring, probably one of the most beautiful places of worship in Europe. Loved every aspect of it.
Dont miss it. Stunning, definitely go up to the top of the dome, the views are stunning and the Basilica is beautiful, well worth a visit

Impressive building. The building is impressive both inside and outside. We visited on a Sunday and as there was a service in place we were unable to wander around as much as we would have liked. They request a small donation one Euro to enter into the church.

A very beautiful basilica. The church is beautiful and worth a visit. We went up to the tower and saw the structure of the dome... It was very interesting, architecture-wise. If you are not scared of heights, it would be interesting to be up there as you could see the panorama of the city.

Must see in Budapest - but ignore the harassment by staff at the door. This is a stunning basilica that is a must see on any trip to Budapest. Apart from being a beautiful cathedral, there are interesting historical aspects within, such as the relic that is the right hand of St, Stephen. You must not miss this cathedral in Budapest.One BIG negative..... the staff of the cathedral INTIMIDATE guests into "donating" money upon entering the cathedral. This is a disgrace. I am very happy to voluntary donate money for the upkeep of any church property, but the intimidation by basilica staff reached an unacceptable level on my last two trip, and I simply refused to budge despite the intimidation. This did somewhat detract from an otherwise very pleasant experience.
A magnificent building. I have been planning to visit the basilica for a long time, and finally managed to do it. I loved the the colourful and grande interior and the atmosphere of the basilica.
Very nice!. We went after dark and it was so dark inside, it was tough to see anything much. Very beautiful from what we could tell though!
Lovely. Very nice building but unfortunatly couldn't go in as all doors were locked not sure why and no info on site .

Beautiful. I'm glad we decided to visit the Bazilika. We paid a little extra for the guided tour and I'm really glad we did. The building is beautiful and the tour guide was very interesting and engaging.
Beautiful. St Stephens really reminds me of San Antonio in Padua, Italy. The detail of work is just stunning and to imagine it was done all those years ago...fantastic
Great View of Budapest!. A couple hundred stairs and a stinky room leads to an amazing view of the city. Full 360º views, low price, fun for the whole family.
nice. the basilica is huge and nicely decorated, but did not evoke in me any kind of particular admiration
Stunning. A stunning sight & architectural delight. Sadly didnt have time to go in to enjoy the sights from within
Magic Place, Highly Recommended.. Magic Place, Highly Recommended, Quite and stunning place. You must take your camera with you. It's beautiful especially in the evening.

Ticks all the boxes. Easy to reach? 5 minutes' walk from most hotels near the bridge on the Pest side.History? Dedicated to the first ruler of united Hungary, St Stephen. His mummified hand can be seen in St Stephen's chapel on the ground floor, free entry (but do donate, as is customary, a coin box lights up the hand so it can be seen more clearly).Aesthetics? Beautiful architecture inside and if you pay to go up the tower (less than £5), you will view the beautiful 360 degree panorama of a city whose WW2 damaged buildings were rebuilt in their old resplendent style. Not to mention a great view of the Danube and Buda.You can get 2 lifts all the way up or you can walk. The walk is more fun if you can manage it.

who wants to see another basillica. it's not that if you seen one you have seen them all. Everyone is different everyone has it's own story based on age and counries history. This Basilica is a must see

Breathtaking!. Definitely do the panoramic experience (1100 HUF pp in Nov 2014) - we did the climb for a good workout (lost count of the stairs) but you can take lifts most of the way. The view from the top is amazing and a great way to get an overview of the city and sites as well as some terrific photos. The church itself is just beautiful. Unfortunately the chapel with St. Stephan's mummified hand was closed, but the black Madonna painting, statues, ceiling paintings, etc. were just gorgeous. We are attending the organ concert there in a few nights and expect it to be a memorable experience. No admission fee for the church, but donations accepted at the entry.

Gorgeous. I am in love with all the old architecture of Budapest. It is to me one of the finest cities in the world.
Just walking everywhere was great.
Wow!. Lovely structure inside and out. Very beautiful and worth a seeing. Make sure you go to the viewing tower!
Expensive ticket but worth it. Really amazing architecture. Truly worth the walk up the hill. We caught it in the afternoon sun and got an amazing view.

St. Stephen's Basilica. absolutely stunning, well worth a look inside. If you want to see the mummified hand of St. Stephen, it is at the back of the Cathedral on the left hand side through two lots of double door and in its own chapel.
Worth a visit. If you are near, you shouldn't miss the opportunity of going inside this basilica. Inside it, there is a huge dome, paintings and lots of details to wonder about.

19th/20th C version of a great cathederal. Worth the visit, Not just 'one more church'. Fascinating history, interesting altars pieces. Check out the display about Cardinal Minzenty (I apologize for the phonetic spelling).

Beautiful!. The architecture is incredible. No matter where you look at it from, any angle is beautifully detail oriented. It really stops you in your shoes to question who created this masterpiece. Totally worth a visit to!

In A Word, Awesome. A great place to just see, with the detail inside being nothing short of astounding. You can also see St. Stephen's actual hand in a side chapel. You can also go to an observation (panorama) deck. I went to two organ concerts and the acoustics are superb. Taking pictures is a must. Do not miss this incredible basilica in the city center.
Worth a Visit. Beautiful Basilica with plenty to see with being too crowded. Option to visit the Dome and a lift for those with mobility problems.

Stunning architecture. A must see when in Budapest. The outside alone is majestic. Take a look at the magnificent statues the surround the dome on the outside of the building from across the street. It is a beautiful building.

Beautiful. This Basilica is on the Pest side of the city and not too far from the River. It's a large structure and is beautiful inside and out. The interior is ornate, but not as over the top with gilding as some cathedrals of Europe.

This is very cool to see. We spent a bit of time out front. It's really pretty. We didn't go in this time as we had been in our last visit and it's really pretty inside. Take in a concert there if you have the time.
Beautiful covers it all. Love everything about this chapel. The paintings on the ceiling was beautiful and the statues were outstanding,

Best for concerts. It's a fine basilica in front of a large inviting square, although nothing spectacular if you've been to Notre Dame de Paris, the Vatican, or for that matter, to any of the great churches in Europe. We went there for an organ concert followed by a cruise of the Danube, and that's how I would recommend experiencing it, although honestly the accoustics aren't great for organ music.

Beautiful Building - Worth a look. I enjoyed a visit to the Basilica today. A stunning building. Lots of tour groups, that although I didn't do myself, sounded quite interesting. That said, if you do one, make sure it's not too long! Lots of people on the tour looked bored rigid!
Make sure you go up the dome. Impressive building. Great view from the dome of Pest. Not sure about the Right Hand relic ...... such things are not important for me.
St. Stephens basilica. Beautiful!!! That is the only way to describe it. It is one of the nicest catholic churches that I have ever seen.

Stunning . With so much to do and see in Budapest I imagine every tour, bus or even walking, will take you to or tell you about this church as it's a stunner! No church is the same and this one is so beautiful in it's unique atmosphere and the sheer beauty of it's artwork. Best of all in my opinion was the organ that sits inside overlooking the main chamber, huge and magnificent. It's free entry which is tops, but donation suggested. Also you have to pay to climb to the top to see the view. Also you can see the right hand of the first king of Hungary. Interesting!

Very beautiful church. St. Stephen's outside is on the plain side but the inside is very beautiful. Don't miss St. Stephen's mummified hand in the Reliquary. It's housed in a small chapel shaped box but there are no English signs. Pay to have it light up or you can't really tell what it is. I believe there are also concerts there on a regular basis.

Beautiful exterior but they charge to get in!. St. Stephen's Basilica is a magnificent church right in the middle of Pest, near the Parliament Building. It is huge and just awesome from the outside. However, they do charge to get in but it is cheap, about $2.00 but they only accept Hungarian Forints.

Wow! The best views of Budapest from here!. On our last day we were passing. We saw people up high walking around on a balcony and thought we would investigate. So pleased we did! A long winding spiral stairway takes you to the top of Budapest, 360 degrees viewing!

Beautiful and breathtaking. I don't know what more can I say except: beautiful. The only problem with this basilica is a guy who is standing at the main door and he is basically forcing you to make a donation. But you don't have to pay, just be assertive and ask him if you really must pay and he will laugh and let you in. I don't have problem with paying entrance fees, but forced donations for Church are a no NO!

Worth the. Modest admission price. If you approach from the Danube, there is a fabulous pedestrian street that leads to a square in front of this very lovely cathedral. Because we were on a river cruise and we're trying not to exchange any money into Hungarian florints, we hesitated when we learned they would not accept euros. We finally returned with florints and we're glad we did because the inside was truly beautiful
Worth a visit. I'd recommend taking the lift to the rooftop for the amazing views over the city: price (approx £3) was well worth paying for

Mind Blowing. From the outside to the inside and from the top this is a magnificent building. We travelled through Europe seeing a lot of churches, Synagogues, Cathedrels and Bascillicas. I would rate this a being right up there with the best. Beautiful art work, stunning marbel and statues. The petrified hand was a must see and the walk up the 302 steps to the panarama was worth the effort. You can also take the lift if stairs are an issue. Loved it.

better by candle light. During a short trip to Budapest I went to one of the evening concerts held at this church. I had just arrived and had no camera. The music and singing were superb as the acoustics are amazing. the church was beautifully lit. I returned with camera the next day. It was as though the soul had gone. the church was still splendid, but the shimmering loveliness of the night before wasn't there. Concerts are on Thursday evenings and organ recitals on Mondays.

Great view from the top!. St. Stephen's Basilica is a beautiful building. Its halls are huge and have a certain "vibe" that makes you feel so small, as is befitting a church.It holds the severed hand of St. Stephen, the Hungarian king that had introduced Catholicism to Hungary.The view from the Basilica's top is amazing and the climb up there is not bad at all (only 302 stairs that are not too steep). One can also take an elevator up there.To enter the Basilica you're asked to give 200HUF (less than 1 EUR or 1$) to charity. The climb to the top costs extra.

A must see. A must see in Budapest, from the moment you set your eyes on the building and when you step inside you admire the beauty of the craftsmanship and art. Take the opportunity to sit quietly and soak up the atmosphere and light a candle. Make sure you step back into the square to appreciate the building's beauty as a whole.
Wonderful and breathtaking. Usually full of people, but that doesn't really matter as all you will look at are amazing mozaics on the ceilings. Really worth a visit, regardless of your religion.

Religious. the basiclica is a wonderful structure and very well designed and religiuos. its worth a look especially climbing the tower and getting a view of budapest. my only issue was at the door to the church there is a 'donation' recommended of 200 ft or €1 which is nothing except they have an usher at the door to make sure you donate. i would give more except been pressured into making a donation is to say the least a disgrace

certainly worth visiting. A very nice church, Great inside Mosaic ceilings, and Although the many visitors, the church had peaceful calming atmosphere.The view of Budapest from the top of the church tower is spectacular. You can take the up to the tower, but still you will need to climb up few stair sets. This is certainly worth visiting and doesn't take a lot of time. Recommended

Beautiful Basilica, poor personnell. Basilica itself is very nice except for the fact that who is working in it does not understand that who access it are tourists and not Hungarians from Budapest. Rude and not happy workers!

Must see if you are in Budapest!. Besides the fact that it is one of the nicest Basilica's I have ever seen, it has some unusual exhibits as well. For example, here you could see the (preserved) right hand of the first King of Hungary. Also, the most famous Hungarian soccer player (considered to be one of the best in the World), Puskas, is buried here in the Basilika...

Beautiful place. Not so beautiful employees.When we came we did not know that the place is divided- church, tower view and museum. The worker was not very nice and we chose blindly because the place was opened till 16:30 and it was 16:00. The tower is great- watch out lots of stairs (163!). There is an elevator but they do not say it. The museum is one room! But pretty. Overall it was nice.

Beautiful, and amazing view as well. We visited here on our last day more to pass the time than anything, but am really glad we did. The building is very impressive with beautiful paintings on the ceilings, and a really amazing view of the whole of Budapest from the top as well (with a lift for a small fee if you don't fancy walking up all the stairs).

Awesome. There was an ongoing mass when we visited. St.Stephens is in the altar not a cross or anything. The pews were hard to kneel for these old knees.You need to pay to see the mummified arm of St.Stephens.

built a really long time ago... built a really really long time ago, well preserved. Gives a very majestic feeling as you walk in. Must visit when you are in Budapest. Beautiful outer structure and even more grand on the inside.
Great view!. Nice and renewed site on the castle hill, beside St. Matthew,s church. From here you will have the best view of the Danube and the Parliament building.

Go to the organ concert - majestic. Barely a one hour programme, but most of the popular "tunes" were played.For the price of a ticket ( I think it was 3500 Hungarian forints), you got the soprano thrown in and voice and keyboard/organ pyrotechnics in a wonderful setting.

I like to climb Towers!. There are many beautiful churches in Europe … I like to climb the towers!! The Tower at St. Stephens is about 300 steps, spiral stairs as always, and the look out point is great!! Views of Budapest are fabulous!!! I always try and chat to whoever else is up there and get a sense of other people's travels and stories while I am admiring the views!! Go for it!

Absolutely Stunning. I have been in multiple basilicas and churches in my life, but there was something about this one that was impressive. The workmanship and architecture are incredible. I am pretty uninformed about architecture, I just know when I see something beautiful. We attend a concert there in the evening: "Verdi"s Requiem" The acoustics were phenomenal. They have weekly concerts there so my advise is to take one in. This is on every tourist list, so don"t miss it.

Amazing place. Ok I'll break this into 2: the church itself and the climb to the top of the basilica also.The Church is amazing and visits free. Very atmospheric and francencense laden air. The scale is amazing and the relic of St Stephen worth seeing simply for it's incorruptibility - after 1000 years, that hand is pretty impressive. The climb to the top is not free but not expensive 500HUF. Personally I'm not good on heights so was pretty unnerved whilst out on the gallery. The walls are high but for a person with a fear of heights, just enough (safe) gaps to frighten me properly. If you're nervous, be sure to not be out on the gallery on the hour as the bells vibrate the structure! The views are wide but choose a time of day when the fog/mist is low. We are here in November in good weather but visibility was not superb. The ascent itself is optionally by 2 lifts. Even with a fear of climbing, the internal stairs are not too alarming when you compare them to climbing St Paul's in London!You can't really come to Budapest and not go visit this site, but I personally would not strongly encourage the climb to the gallery...

Spectacular!. Must see in Budapest. Had my wedding here, so my opinion might be biased. Anyway, Szent Istvan Bazilika is the most grandiose of the several really wonderful churches in Hungary. There is a separate room for the thousand-year old right hand of the first christian king of Hungary! Amazing.

Beautiful Cathedral. A must stop and tour while in Budapest. Make sure you get tickets (small fee) to climb up to dome for great views of city. The trip up is a bit tricky as you have a bit of a labyrinth to figure out to get to second set of stairs. Unfortunately elevators are even a greater challenge but they are there! A donation is requested to enter cathedral itself and well worth it. Interior is most beautiful marbles.

Beautiful. Dedicated to Magyar's patron saint who also happens to be the patron saint for Austrians who have St Stephens in Vienna. Budapest is free with nominal fee to get to the top. At Vienna you have to pay lot more but the view on South side is great.

Stunning. Subdued grandeur. Completed in 1905 after half a decade of building. Hard to believe it was badly damaged in WWII - restoration completed in 2003. Entry by donation. A must see for jaw dropping.
great place to visit. This cathedral is worth visiting. Inside and outside are very rich and tell us a lot about the past of buda.

Great views but not for the faint-hearted. We visited the Basilica after being told what great views there were from the top by our son.The first part of the climb is straight forward enough, up a marble, spiral staircase. This leads to a room where you can catch your breath for the second half of the ascent.The second part involves 2 or 3 steel, spiral staircases (which you can see between). This then leads to a number of steel, zigzag staircases.Eventually, you end up climbing up between the 2 inner and outer skins of the cupola (dome) until you finally arrive at the external viewing gallery.Stunning views but not for vertigo sufferers!

Largest church in Budapest. The building is nice. close to the Danube promenade. It is free.If you want to see the mummified hand of the first Hungarian king, a small donation is requested but the amount is up to the visitor. In a side chapel the hand is exhibited and for 100Ft it will be illuminated. Unlikely if you ever seen anything like that!
St Stephens. Beautiful Church, preserved without pictures of Saints because the Muslims had taken over the church. Make sure you go when Viking Tours are not there!

Lovely exterior. We didn't head inside the Basilica, but it is in a fairly central location and we admired it quite a few times from outside - which is free to do! Very picturesque and an impressive building amongst the others of the street.
One of the most beautiful in Europe. There are many special churches in Europe and this one is one of the most beautiful and lavish cathedrals in the old continent. I fully recommend.

Worth a visit. The inside is breath taking. It is worth a visit to the small chapel at the back which contains the remains of St Stephen hand. If you have a head for height it is worth a climb to the top of the dome. The views across the whole of city is worth the 305 steps it takes to get there.

lots of steps but well worth it. its free to go in the church ( they have a donation box) but you have to pay a small fee about 500 huf to climb the stairs , there is a lift part way up if you need it the views from the top are amazing well worth the climb

St Stephens. As the beginning point of our trip, Budapest boasts some of the oldest, most beautiful buildings I had ever seen. The St Stephens Church is one of them. It was the first of many churches/cathedrals that were named after St Stephen. Gorgeous cathedral, impressive and still used by parishioners today. The church has a massive pipe organ and soaring interior ceilings, and ornate interior/exterior walls that defy the ages.
construction under way. Hard to get in and near the church due toroad renovations and work on area around church,,,,should be done in a month or so.

Grand Catholic Monument in the Heart of Budapest. It's one of the dominant features on the Budapest skyline. An impressive Catholic Church built in 1905, and named for Hungary's first King Saint Stephen I of Hungary. You can see the remains of Saint Stephen's hand in a back room off the main basilica.We caught a children's choir doing a short practice while there, and it was awe-inspiring. It must be lovely to attend services there. It is free and lovely inside. Worth a visit.You can also see the remains of The neo-classical design has a grand plaza around it where you can grab coffee.
Beautiful peaceful church. This is a wonderful ornate Church in the busy end of budapest. It is free, and as most church do feels peaceful and relaxing, one can stop, take stock, rest and pray.
Beautiful. We only visited to look at the outside whilst we were enroute to another destination but the beauty is incredible.

Wonderful Basilica. I've never been to many similar basilicas, but St. Stephen's Basilica is one of those churches with a wonderful exterior architecture matched with very intricate interiors. With a spectacular alter and side "chapels" detailed decor brings a sense of perfect solemnity. Having had the chance to attend church services, the organ and the choir sounds majestic as the music and voices blend harmoniously and echoing through the walls.

Great Concert. We attended an excellent organ concert one evening. The basilica is a beautiful setting in the evening with soft light from candles and dim lights. The concert ranged from Bach to Gounod with several Hungarian composers as well. The organ is magnificent and ranged from mighty chords to a delicate Ave Maria. Budapest is a fine city for entertainment and this was a great example.

Must see . The basilica is free but a 200huf donation is recommended and well worth it, the basilica is stunning and in my opinion on par if not better than St. Paul's in London, the basilica is peaceful and relaxing and is just a few minutes from the chain bridge and deak ter metro station

Beautiful church. Don't miss visiting this very beautiful church which is the largest in Budapest. The altar is particularly spectacular and so is the cupola so allow yourself enough time to enjoy the detailed decoration of the interior of the church. There are also organ concerts so check the schedule if you want to attend one of them.

Wonderful. Got my daughter baptised here!!shame I've never been there even tho I lived 26 years in Budapest!trully beautiful place with such a helpful staff,and yes they speak English over there,the ceremony been held in English and Hungarian as my wife British!you must see this building!!!

a must see! especially from the inside. such a surprise we had when entering the basilic... th edifice is even more impressive inside.i advise people also to go on the balcony upstairs.the view is incredible for shooting photos of the city and there is elevator so no big efforts...exept if you decide to go by foot.(free as i remember)
Definitely worth a look!. The building inside & outside is amazing, there is no fee for entry into the main building other a donation, if you are in the area its rude not to take a look!

Must c. The Basilica is facinating and authentic, interior even more interesting, before exit stop to read and see pictures about Basilica history and must be among top ten sights to visit at Budapest.

Italian style neorenaissance church in city centre. It is highly recommended church in Budapest centre. It is worth for visiting. Entrance fee is 200 Ft. The decoration is gorgeous inside. Lot of different marbles, golden mosaics, statues, nice chapels. It is possible to go up to the cupola to see the view or to go to the crypt where Puskas, the famous football player has got his tumb. Every Sunday there is a mass with a choir. The organ is fantastic. Often they have organ concerts here.I was here last week with my friends, they enjoyed it.

Impressive Building. We didn't actually go inside (due to time constraints), but views from the outside were outstanding. You could see the Basilica from at least a block or so away. I recall walking around all sides of the building to get different views and to take photographs, much to my husband's dismay. Even on a dismal rainy day, it was well worth the walk!Note: We were actually in Budapest in December 2011 but TA does not allow you to select dates from several years ago.
wonderful. Architecture, art, history... you can see everything at this wonderful building which is a must to visit and admire.

Great light and colors!. I have been to a lot of cathedrals and they start to all look the same, so it takes something special for me to be impressed. This basilica really surprised me. The outside is pretty blank but the inside is a riot of color! Great domes and candelabras with wonderful shafts of light make for some very beautiful photos. There is a small fee of 1 euro to enter but it's well worth it. They also have the severed fist of a hungarian leader that you can check out, I preferred the domes! DO NOT MISS the Gelato Rosa that is about 30 steps from the front of the basilica near the Starbucks). Best gelato in Budapest - I had it 3 times while I was there!
