Stunning. Stunning basilica and definitely worth a trip. You only have to make a donation of about 200HUF (less than £1). It is said that the hand St Stephen who the basilica is named after is located inside. You can go through the little chapel and there's a very ornate box which houses the supposed hand.

Great view from the dome. We love panoramic views on cities. St Stephen's offers this from the edge of the dome. You don't need to take a lot of steps but two seperate elevators. The views were nice and it was not too crowded.
A Beautiful Basilica. The domed ceiling and all the ornate gold surroundings are beautiful. It is well worth a visit. It is the largest church in Budapest and took 50 years to build.

Great landscape. Historical monument. Good place to start your adventures in Budapest. Go to main tower where you can get with a lift or by stairs. Cost only 500 HUF and you can see whole Budapest up from there.

Majestic St Stephens basilica. An ornate basilica in the centre of Pest. Beautiful artistry with various religious motifs and legends that surround their placements in this church. A must-see.They also have concerts here which you can book when you visit the church.

Amazing view from the Dome. I am so glad that my husband and I decided to go to the top of the Basilica as it was totally worth it for the amazing view. When we went to the dome, the sun was beginning to set so the city's skyline looked extremely beautiful.

Stunning view at the top. It's my first time in The Basilica the entry is free (you can pay if you want) the building inside is amazing, but the place was super croweded with the Chinese tour that was very loud too.On the top floor we paid 500 FT and 400 FT for student. We tooked 2 elevator to the top floor and at the top we had to walk on the stairs, the view is amazing you can see Budapest from the top and walk around the roof floor to see every angle.

Loved it!. My boyfriend and I recently visited St Stephen's. We paid the small fee to walk to the top and the view was brilliant. The building also looks lovely at night time. It is also close to restaurants meaning you can have a nice meal with a nice view. The only thing I would say is if you struggle walking or do not enjoy heights - take the lift to the top instead, if not there are hundreds of winding stairs to climb.
Touring the Pest side. One of our favorite landmarks for views - MUST take elevator and stairs to balcony for this all around spectacular view!!!! Great photo opts!
Nice dome with the famous organs. Nice photos taken by nigh lights on the building. The songs played on organs are very very intensive - there is the nice acoustics in the dome.
Beautiful!. Opulent, airy and beautiful cathedral, well worth looking around. Lit candles for departed loved ones. Peaceful, lovely atmosphere.
Stunning building with magnificent tiled roof. This is a stunning building and the surrounding area is currently undergoing some refurbishment. Stunning views of budapest

St Stephen's. This is one of the many cathedrals in eastern Europe dedicated to St. Stephen. It is beautiful and grand and has a wonderful organ. We were lucky enough to be there at the right time to experience an organ concert that included two other musician. We also climbed to the roof to get a fabulous view of the city.
Marvelous. We like very much visiting churchs. It is always a breath taking visual experience. Located in the middle of Peste it is surrounded by restaurants and caffes.
Wonderful place. The reat place to make nice pictures from the top of the Basilica. And the building is very impressive. Must see, I think.

Awe inspiring cathedral. Having seen some amazingly grand and elaborate churches in places like Krakow, this was something different. Grand on more subtle way, it is a massively impressive building both inside and out. Looks beautiful at night too. Free to enter.
Stunning. A visual delight, calm, warm, and without an entrance fee. A moving experience. A must to visit on any trip to Budapest.
Istvan. A must see for everybody. The interior is amazing and the view from the panoramatic roof breathtaking.
Beautiful with Terrific Panoramic View. If you choose to visit the basilica, pay the extra fee to go up (via elevator or stairs) to the observation deck. It provides wonderful views of Budapest.

Churches can be much the same ..... We almost didn't bother going in and paying the 200 f per person voluntary contribution as many churches can appear to be the same but this one did have a lovely interior and is in excellent condition.

Big, glorious, beautiful. The largest church in the city and, to my mind, the second most beautiful. It is huge and ornate, but with a distinct Hungarian flavour. Note that organ and classical music concerts are held in the church several evenings a week. They are quite tasteful, and if the Subway trains passing underground were not heard very well inside the church, they could have been perfect.

Amazing - a feast for the eyes. All walls completely covered by wonderful painting and giltwork. So much to look at. The dome above was astonishing. The mummified hand of St King Stephen 1 (All kings became saints) who died in 1038 was awe inspiring.

Beautiful place. Looks lovely, inside and out,I walked to the top and the view is amazing. You see Budapest in a different light up there.Very cool Cathedral with a lot of interesting gold leaf and painted ceilings. In the far church you can see the mummified hand of a Saint encased in glass and adorned with jewelry.You can take the stairs and an elevator to the top of the dome (for a fee) and get some great panarama shots of the city. Must visit.

Beautiful. Although you have to pay to get in, it was worth it. Inside is sort of like any other beautiful church, except it was incredibly large. Enjoyed sitting inside for a bit and reflecting. The outside is amazingly beautiful as well. It should be one of the top locations to see when visiting Budapest! (:

Breathtakingly beautiful. The Basilica is beautiful - in side and out. It was extremely busy when we visited and many of the visitors seemed to be a little disrespectful .... They were loud and noisy, and disregarded the very polite requests for a measlŷ donation of 50p to help maintain this beautiful place of worship. Definitely go, ignore the touts on the steps and enjoy the beauty of the building within ( and make a small donation!) everything is so cheap in Budapest there is no excuse for giving a pound or two!
Beautiful. Try to make this a must see. It is closed to visitors during services on Sunday morning, but well worth working around this
Unmissable . The building is absolutely beautiful inside and out. There is a small charge (I think it was about 2 pounds) but it is worth much much more

Take the trip up the tower.... As a Basilica, St Stephen's is quite impressive. It has the size and grandeur that one would expect, the interior is suitably opulent and the slightly macabre sight of The Holy Right Hand of St Stephen has its moments, but it is the trip up the dome that makes the visit worthwhile. Not only do you get an amazing view, but you get to see how the dome was constructed - with an inner masonry dome and an outer wooden enclosure. Absolutely fascinating. I would pay good money to climb to the cupola, but the terrace is still well worth it. It works out about a Forint a stair/step, but there is a lift...
Impressive. A Roman Catholic church and it is the oldest church in Budapest. It is a must see place as it has such beautiful architecture located at the centre of the city.
Beautifull view from up there. Huge basilica makes a difference between the new buildings built around it. It is worth to climb up all these stairs to get a marvellous view of the town!

Worth checking out.. While we were there, the boys choir was having a practice. Although I am sure the buys would rather practice without an audience, they did sound great, and it gave the whole place a little extra something over all the other spectacular churches scattered throughout Europe.
marble and mystery. go early, before the place is mobbed. The famed hand of St Stephen is not nearly as gruesome as advertised. It's useful to go see the church of St Matthias as a contrast.

One of the most beautiful Basilica. We traveled across 7 cities in Europe on our recent trip and saw (not all but) the most important churches/basilicas in each city. Of these, we found this to be very beautiful. There is a 200 ft entry per person. Not sure if it is a donation or a formal fee, however, the box is kept right at the entrance with a board and i saw a priest sitting by it. so we made our contributions for the upkeep as well. and it surely was worth it...The work done on the ceiling, the altar etc is very nice. Also, you can enter the section which holds the right hand of King Stephen, king from the 9th century. here, to put on the light in the glass box that holds the hand, you need to put 200 ft.We also paid a fee of 500ft to go upto the tower. You can use the elevator or walk up some 200 odd steps. We took the elevator which takes you to one level, from there is a small flight of steps to get to the next elevator, which takes you to the tower top. The view from here is fantastic. gives you a birds view of the city.As most cities, we did this after one day in the city, so we could look out and recognize many of the prominent landmarks.A must visit.

The Best View in Budapest. If you want the best view of the city, take the 302 steps to the top or the lift and you will be blown away by the sights of Budapest from one of the tallest buildings here. There is also a beautiful church downstairs which is host to the arm of the king himself! Definitely check it out!
You have to go up the bell tower. You have to go up the bell tower, it is totally worth it.The view of the city was great! And the inside of the church was breathtaking.

Thursday night specials. Book an evening of music in this very special cathedral.70 minutes only so not too long but a wonderful way to appreciate the beauty of the church and to collect your thoughts. Euros 20, what's not to like ?

An Imposing Monument in Central Budapest.. One cannot go to Budapest and fail to visit St. Stephen's. A huge neoclassical church, as architecture I would not compare it to Wren's work in England. However, within its nave one feels the sense of the power of God and the church held by the nation of Hungary. A must see.
spectacular. well worth seeing and spending some time. Is easy to access from pest and other attractions nearby. Timing at weekend important is important as limited viewing during mass times.

Beautiful basilica. Basilica has a beautiful front view. There is a wide pedestrian only opening in front of basilica. There I had took beautiful pictures. I advise anyone coming Budapest to visit here.
Beautiful. Went to the top and admired the views in every direction from the tower. You can climb the steps or use the lift. A stunning building.

impressive building. St Stephen’s Basilica of Budapest is one of the most beautiful and significant churches and touristic attractions of Budapest and the whole country. it was bulit during 1851-1905 by 3 different architectors. Very beautiful. Using elevators and some walking you can see a the over view of the city.

Impressive basilica. If you are in the area it worth a visit! In the afternoons you can pay a visit if you are interesting of hearing music of the organ and a choir singing. Beautiful colors and impressive dome with a superb view.

Must see - take a private tour if you can. What a beautiful building, inside and out. The painted walls are a sight to see. We arrived when the schoolchildren were in the basilica, but around lunch time everyone left and it got very quiet. It's worth paying for a private tour from one of the basilica employees, you'll get a great historical background, and it's interesting to chat with the guide about their life in and out of Budapest.

Beautiful. Doesn't look much in pictures but it is very impressive when approached from the river. Inside it is opulent and beautiful. We were lucky enough to visit when there was a live choir singing, it was breath taking. The view from the dome is wonderful and well worth the effort.

stunning. The Basilica boasts architecture as impressive and breathtaking on the inside as it is dramatic on the outside. The chapel itself can be visited for just 200HUF donation, well worth a visit.
Enormous church. Highly decorative and filled with people at a service. Can visit the mummified hand of St Stephen if you wish. Religious grandeur at its highest.
Stunning architecture. The Church's greatest contribution (and perhaps only) to humanity - the preservation of art and architecture.
Worth seeing.. Very beautiful and worth seeing. We went to see it while on a private tour with a Trabant old east Germany car aficionado.
Beautiful. Beautiful building. There was a service on when we visited, very atmospheric. We were too late for the tower though.
organ concert in the Basilica. It is a great opportunity for tourists / visitors to listen to beautifully played organ music during mid-week performances.

Beautiful. The inside of this building is beautiful, lots of colour and very vibrant. There is a collection point at the entrance with a suggested donation. We visited on a Sunday and there was a service happening however the church was still open and people were wandering in and out. Parts of the interior were cordoned off, whether this was just because of the service I don't know. We were restricted to a small part but what we did see was amazing bright, colourful and lots of gold. We also paid to go up to the top of the building. There is a lift which would be very slow in busy times. There are over 300 stairs to walk if you prefer. Coming down however was only by lift which takes 6 people at a time. When we were up there is a good view of the rooftops of Budapest. I wouldn't bother with this again but would certain,y revisit the interior of the basilica.
organ recital. an hour of bach with a soprano singer was amazingthe bazilika itself is an impressive site so the music was a huge added bonus check if any concert is available before you travel
Great at night. After 7pm in the evening lights this church was amazingly beautiful, there are some great restaurants around the church, so it's really a great place to have your dinner.
Amazing!. Beautiful church and well worth the entry to go up to the walkway at the tops with great views of the city.

See the saint's hand. We had to see the mummified hand of St. Stephen, in an ornate reliquary in a small chapel at the rear of the church. It's placed high on an altar where it's hard to see, and you have to put money in a machine to make the light come on so you can see it. Still, it was worth the time.

Brilliant Basilica. This is one of the most ornate late 19th century basilicas in the world with extraordinary views from the roof. Great news for arthritis sufferers such as me is that there are 2 lifts which take you to the top with only about a dozen steps. Cost around $2 (Aud).

Beautiful building. Delightful architecture, well worth a visit (suggested donation of 200 HUF or 0.5 GBP). If you fancy climbing to the top the views are amazing (another 500 HUF). Definitely worth a look.
Great view. Looks lovely, inside and out, we walked to the top and the view is amazing. You see Budapest in a different light up there.

Fantastic Views. This was well worth the climb to the top...all 301 steps of a climb!! Cheap entry to get up to the 'panorama' level where, on a clear day, you can see for miles across Pest and over into the hills of Buda. It is also well worth making the donation to get inside the Basilica to see a level of craftsmanship that unfortunately may have been lost in the modern times.

Pay a little more to get the ultimate panaromic view of Budapest. Head up to the terrace! The effort (nothing at all if you're taking the lift) and money (again, not much) is worth the spectacular view from the top, around the dome. One of the highlights of my trip for sure.
Impressive. Free to visit and easy to locate with much to see inside and descriptions of what you are viewing, details of the construction etc

Monumental. Monumental inside, peacefull and rich inside.
Great view ( Budapest panorama ) from the cupola-about 150 stairs or elevator...Also good to visit the Chapel and the Holy Right Hand of St. Stephen, which you can illuminate for a while..

Born of a Magyar Nation. Went with Sato Tour trip.
Nice conservation inside,beatiful vitraux windows.
The guide tolds us the whole history of King´s Stephan,the Founding Father of Magyaric Nations( today´s Hungary)
Beautiful. 200 huf donation for a stunningly beautiful church. Pay extra for views from the tower if you fancy. Friendly and welcoming clergy
Amazing. Stunning inside with amazing views from the roof. There is a lift up there if you don't want to climb the many stairs!

Big and Beautiful. Lots of walking, but worth it for the great views. This is a massive structure with great over-views of the surrounding area. Under repair (cobble stones) while I visited, but this did not hinder the sightseeing.

Beautifully preserved basilica. saw an organ recital and loved the ambiance
Appreciated the beauty and presentation..would have liked to hear the main organ played so was a mite disappointed, but wonderful setting
Grand beauty. The Basilica is beautiful. We were walking on the street and turn the corner and couldn't take our eyes off the basilica. It stands out.

Ornate and decorative. Very cool Cathedral with a lot of interesting gold leaf and painted ceilings. In the far church you can see the mummified hand of a Saint encased in glass and adorned with jewelry. Please don't use your flash for taking pictures of the hand like the other dumb tourists we saw doing it.You can take the stairs and an elevator to the top of the dome (for a fee) and get some great panarama shots of the city.Make sure to tip when entering the main Cathedral, the local clergy will be hovering over you to insist you do.

organ concert in Basilica. My wife and I visited this incredible Basilica which has a regular evening concert schedule. The one we attended featured a flautist and a vocalist in addition to an organist playing the magnificent 40 pipe organ. An incredible setting for enjoying classical music while gazing at the beautiful architecture of this church. Highly recommended. All seats are good ; not necessary to buy front section seating.
red marble. Visited as part of a walking tour. Beautiful red Hungarian marble. Good story about St Stephen and the relic

great organ concert. We ere in organ concert in the 9th of October. THe concert lasted 70 minutes and was given by one of the very famous organ players in Hungary, The great Acoustics together with the artists that gave the performance, gave us wonderful experience. The only disadvantage was the hard seats because you sit in a bench ans it's really uncomfortable. prices are very good, and if you buy the tickets at least one day before, you will get a reduction.

Amazing Monday organ concertos. Just by chance passing around discovered that there is an organ concerto inside the Basilica. Very much recommended. The performers provide known masterpieces from Bach to Liszt. The acoustic is wonderful. When combined with the magnificent internal decoration you leave with excellent experience. Really, have not heard such a performance of Bach's Toccata and Fuga D minor as there, yet.

great views. Well worth the pennies to go up the tower, even if it is 300 and something steps. The views are fantastic in every direction.The Basillica itself is not Rome but its close and is what you would expect for a grand Basillica.

Must See. If you're in the city this place is a must see. Easy to find as you can see it's dome from almost anywhere in the city. The church itself is beatiful, stunning architecture and a real wow factor. You can also climb to the top of the dome for a small fee (500 HUF which is about £1.30) and the 360 degree views of the city from up there like none you will find anywhere else.
Beautiful Cathedral. An amazing building with a definate wow factor when you entered. One not to be missed. The decoration inside the Basilica was stunning.

Another Cathedral?. After a 14 day River Cruise I had seen just about enough beautiful cathedrals. However, spending two weeks in Budapest after the cruise afforded me time to see the "must see" attractions in the city, and St Stephen's was one of them. It is a very beautiful building and at least is a bit different in design than most of the cathedrals we visited. This really is a nice cathedral, so even if you have seen SO many, it is worth a visit.
WOW !!. OMG what a beautiful building both inside and out. We attended a concert in the evening - worth doing if you like organ / classical music; the atmosphere and accoustics were great

Beautiful church in classic style. Being the 3rd largest building in Hungry you can imagine the elegance and impression this neoclassic style church provides you. It is open from 9am till late afternoon 7 days a week (Sundays at 1pm) and admission is free except for the lookout.

Stunning inside. Looking at the Basilica from the outside it is hard to imagine the splendor inside. It takes your breath away.
Beware of the scam artists on the outside stairs who will ask for your donation.

Beautiful!. Really beautiful Basilica - breathtaking, both inside and out. First of all, we climbed the many steps of the spiral staircase to a 360 degree viewing gallery with wonderful views of the whole of Budapest. There is al lift for the less-able, but not sure if this goes all the way to the top. An interesting site inside the Basilica is the Holy Right Hand - the mummified right hand of St Stephen - which is encased in a very ornate case which resembles a mini cathedral. We could have easily missed this, as the hand is not immediately obvious at first sight. The Basilica is free to enter, although donations are requested, but not obligatory. In the evening, the Basilicia is beautifully flood-lit and looks wonderful. Concerts are often held there - there was an organ concert happening whilst we were in the city, but we didn't go to that as we had other plans. Would have been lovely, I'm sure.

One of the highlights of our trip. A beautiful basilica that was within walking distance of our Hilton Hotel.You could spend a week just looking at the many side chapels.There is no charge to enter this beautiful Basilica.
Overlooks Budapest. Close by the Hilton Hotel, beautiful architecture and lovely area to walk, like most places in the city a great place for scenery and photos.
wonderful. Though not a Christian I do visit places of worship when travelling. This is one of the finest anywhere both inside and out. No charge for entering but there is a box for donations,

Really impressive. A really impressive cathedral inside and very beautiful from the outside too. One thing you should do here is buy a ticket up to the top of the cathedral tower (served by two elevators) and walk around the roof. Fantastic views of the city. And only about £1 a ticket.
wedding at the basilica. went there caused by a wedding, the building is monumental and awesome, the frescoes are beautifull and you could see the right hand of St. Stephan the 1st.
Beautiful inside and out. Easy to find from across the city, Szent Istvan is definitely worth a peek. Interesting history though you have to pay a small fee.
Beautiful. We enjoyed walking up to the promenade around the dome...great views of Budapest...the inside is also spectacular.

Very imposing and beautiful. It's only when you walk round from the main road to the entrance that you get the full beauty of this building. The entrance opens out on to a bustling square with several bars and restaurants. Huge and imposing and beautiful - definitely worth getting up close to enjoy the architecture

A Beautiful Cathedral. Both St. Stephen's (on the "Pest" side) and St. Matthias (on the "Buda" side) are beautiful in their own way. We preferred St. Stephen's but both are outstanding. We were lucky enough to pop in St. Stephen's just as a wedding was finishing up so we enjoyed a wonderful mini organ concert and got to view the Huganrian wedding style. St. Stephens is also located at the end of a broad plaza and several blocks of restaurants and shops so it makes for a full afternoon visit. One suggestion - skip the display of the Saint's preserved hand (shown in a chapel in the rear of the Cathedral). Probably would be more meaningful to us if we were Catholic but you can't see much of anything - it's a big deal to the locals though.

AN impressive sight in Budapest!. Szent Ístvan Bazilika in Budapest is named after St. Stephen, who was the first king of Hungary. His mummified hand is a holy relic that can be seen during your visit. I love this place! Not only is it beautiful, but it gives me a short, peaceful retreat during my busy days in Budapest.It’s free to go into the basilica…just be sure to time your visit outside of the hours for regular mass, or you won’t be able to look around. There is a donation box as you enter the church, and donations go to the upkeep of this historical structure. If a guard is standing by the box and you don’t donate, he’ll say a few angry words to you in Hungarian! Opening hours are Monday to Friday 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM, Saturdays 9:00 AM to 1:00 PM, and Sundays 1:00 PM to 3:00 PM.Daily mass is usually held at 7:00 AM, 8:00 AM, and 6:00 PM every day. Sunday masses are celebrated at 8:00 AM, 9:00 AM, 10:00 AM, 12:00 noon, 6:00 PM and 7:30 PM. You won’t get to wander around the church while masses are being celebrated. There are wonderful concerts held at the basilica on a regular basis, and tickets are sold on the entrance steps throughout the week.Although entrance to the basilica is free, visiting the Treasury costs 400 HUF, and access to the dome costs 500 HUF. There is an elevator that takes you most of the way up to the dome if you don’t want to climb the stairs! The dome has amazing views of Budapest on clear days. Special guided tours of the church are available in English, French, and Hungarian, and can be booked from Monday to Friday, between 10.00 AM and 3.00 PM. These tours cost about 2500 HUF, and can be arranged in advance by emailing: turizmus@basilica.hu The guided tours include admission to the dome.I visit this basilica every time I take a trip to Budapest. It's a tranquil oasis in this bust urban city.
All roads lead to St. Stephen's. The tower could be seen from afar and was a landmark for us that led us back to our hotel. The basilica itself is very interesting and definitely worth a visit.
Go Basilica. Visitors are welcome to view the lush interior. Worth a look if only to inspire your next home furnishing project.

Amazing Monumental Church In Budapest Central. You must take in this cultural spectacle when in Budapest. It is rich in religious history. When we went there are a prayer taking place, your free to sit and listen, there are signs to indicate no talking and they are aging for a small 200ft donation at the door but it's well worth it, the church is massive and has ancient artwork covering the cathedral ceilings and gold leaf statues on the walls. They have candles for purchase as well as holy water at the entrance. We spent around 30 minutes but it was well worth it. It's in central Budapest.

Beautiful. First, the cost to enter St. Stephen's Basilica is less than 1 dollar and the cost to go up to the observatory ledge is about 2 dollars. Really a lot for your money. There are guided tours you can take also. We admired the interior, their relic, and climbed to the balcony at the top. There is some English history information of the relic. If you are afraid of heights (as I am), skip going to the balcony or take the second elevator up. The first round of steps is stone and spirals upward without giving you a view of what's below but the second round of steps is a metal spiral staircase above the church's dome. Once up, the views are awesome (if you aren't too terrified to appreciate).
Great Roof. We never went in as the day we were there the queue went around the block but you can walk most the way around and admire the architecture the incredible tile work on the roof

At the Top. Be sure to get yourself all the way to the top while visiting this beautiful Basilica. The long climb is worth it as you overlook the city! The view is panoramic and truly lovely. We could not help but think of all the people who have trod the streets, the years of upheaval and uncertainty and the energy with which Budapest welcomes tourists and proudly displays their present point in history.
Beautiful church. Amazingly beautiful church, still well maintained. Right in the square surrounded by lovely cafés where we had lovely coffee!

Lovely church. The church on the Pest side of the city - a short walk from the chain bridge - is simply stunning and an absolute must stopover when you are in the city.The church also provides some of the most amazing views of the city from its watch tower - to climb which you have pay a nominal fee.There are a number of organ and other concerts which happen at the church and if you are interested in music you might be well advised to come back for one of those. There are a number of shops and eating places close to the basilica as well. I remember an Italian gelato shop where the queues were massive so I am assuming they are quite famous (but we didn't stop there so can't be sure).The church reminds me of the St Stephen's Church in Vienna which is also in the centre of the city and an absolute stunner.
take the lift. Being up the top of the Basilica was a very memorable experience. There is a small fee but well worth the view.
Organ Recital. Excellent music, but the acoustics - 4-5 second reverberation in the building which for me spoiled some of the enjoyment.

Huge Church with Views of Budapest. Although a catholic church, the architecture and religious history can be appreciated By everyone. There is even a 500 year of St. Stephens right hand in it's own separate side chapel. The views from the top of the dome are spectacular and there are 2 lifts for the weak of heart, but not wheelchair accessible. Note: There is a cat cafe where you can have tea and pastry while about a dozen cats wander around (if that's your thing). Located about 75 meters off the back right side of the basilica.

Visited one day and returned for an organ concert later in the week.. This church is quite remarkable in that it is rather recently built. The inside is darker than one normally is used to but the biggest surprise is the statue behind the altar is not Christ but rather Saint Steven, the patron Sain of Budapest.We returned a few days later for an lovely organ concert. The concert included the front organ and the Great organ at the rear of the church plus a trumpet and a mezzo soprano. The acoustics are wonderful and its a grand experience to hear music reverbrate against all of the hard surfaces.Highly recommend.
A lovely old church. Worth visiting, beautiful old church,in the centre of Budapest it is a lovely building especially the ceilings and paintings. Easy to get too,

Beautiful, albeit not very old, church. I shall keep this short because it is one of those places you have to visit to appreciate the sheer scale, beauty and architecture.While only just over 100yrs old, the ornate decorations give a sense of something much older and grand. The interior is completely lined with gold, pretty much everywhere. The religious paintings on the ceiling, walls, and even doors, are colourful, well-maintained and a joy to behold.But by far my favourite part of the experience is to climb the tower of the church and view Budapest from above. The climb is narrow through timber lofts, staircases and rooms. Some 400 steps later, the view from the top is stunning. While not as tall as the hills, for example, you get a completely different inner-city perspective from the top. And the cost? If I recall correctly it was around two euros per person. Another bit of bargain brilliance in beautiful Budapest.
Beautiful. Well maintained and well worth a visit while there. It is surrounded by historic sites and lots of places to see around it

A very attractive church. This is definitely a must see in Budapest. Quite a dark interior in rich reds and gold. Lots of paintings and sculptors. It is free to go in but they ask you, understandably to make a donation to the upkeep. You can climb to the top via stairs or in the lift, but I don't think it is suitable for wheelchairs or buggies. There is a charge for that, about £1.50. Whilst there we realised tickets were being sold for a 5pm classical organ concert, supported by a soprano singer. You can sit anywhere and the cost was less than £10. It lasted an hour and was beautiful to listen in such wonderful surroundings.
Right around the corner from the Four Seasons. Lovely cathedral in a great location. Right around the corner from the Four Seasons on the Pest side.
Magnificently. Only when you find yourself in front of the Basilica you can understand how many knowledge and imagination needed architects. The interior of the equally magnificent as the outer part.

Beautiful Basilica. This Beautiful, well maintained basilica is hard to be miss. If weather is good the cupola is worth a visit. We had a great photos of the panoramic view of the city. Great experience!
Beautiful church. Got to go up to the top where the views are wonderful. There is 302 stairs or you can use the lift. The church is beautiful and really worth a visit

Be sure to visit inside.. Unfortunately we did not have the time to visit inside and also believe it's wrong that one should be charged.....but if the outside is anything to go by then I think it's probably worth it.
Lovely Church. A lovely Church in a nice square, you can pay to go up and view Budapest from the top of the church, from there you can see what a huge and fantastic city it is.

Amazing Organ concert in the Cathedral. The Cathedral itself is beautiful but the more interesting experience there was to go on an organ concert, I found out about it just from flyers handed out in the entrance. it was amazing to hear the huge organ there live with the incredible acoustic and surrounding, it also included an opera singer in some of the pieces played, it was a 45 minute concert with famous organ pieces (including the Tocata of Bach) for a ridiculous price (about 10 euro). In conclusion, one in a life time experience.
Great view from top. One of best panorama views in Budapest. Also great interior of Basilica. Definitely go on top of this church.
your soul is vibrating. Free entrance.I am not catholic, I arrived there during the service. My eyes were in tears. My soul vibrated. What else to say?

Beautiful Renovation!. The last time we were in Budapest St. Stephen's Basilica was closed for renovation. I'm so happy it was open this time, and well worth the wait. Everything sparkled, excited the senses, yet visitors were still reminded that it's a sanctuary for prayer and contemplation. Don't miss seeing this very unusually decorated church when you're in Budapest.
Good but not Great Cathedral. Be careful if you go on a Saturday - seems like there were back-to-back weddings when we went so we could only see the side sections. Impressive, but not a 'must see'.

A wonderfully ornate church. This building is certainly one of the best kept buildings in Budapest. A stunning view inside and out. The detailing inside the church is certainly worth seeing, and I've never seen so much gold detailing in my life. It's free to go in and have a look, and if you want to light a candle there is a suggested price of £0.50This activity would take no longer than an hour, but there are p[plenty of places around to see aswel
Beautiful. Worth to climb the stairs... breathtaking views of Budapest and of course the Basilica itself is extremely beautiful.

...Big !. I have been in many churches, basilicas, synagogas and mosques... This Basilica belongs defenitely to most beautiful ones! You can go up with the lift and enjoy the view from cupola. There is also mummificated hand of Szent Istvan

Worth the climb!. What a stunning church! Full of charm, artefacts, exudes peace, calm and magnificence. For 400 Huf you can climb a spiral staircase to the top of the dome where you a guaranteed a full 360* panoramic view of Budapest. Spectacular. It's worth the climb but there is also a lift. We didn't use it, so I can't comment if it is suitable for disabled visitors. Very easy to find, right in the centre of the Pest district. Highly recommend.

Organ Concerts. I had the pleasure of attending 3 organ concerts at St. Stephen's while staying in Budapest. To begin with, the cathedral is magnificent and well worth a tour but the real joy is to experience the Cathedral the way it is intended to be used . . . not just as a house of worship but an accoustical dream for Organ concerts. I highly recommend the Monday and the Friday concerts.

Going to mass is free. We just went to mass and despite not understanding Hungarian the organ music and singing )words in Hungarian on a big screen) it was lovely. The building restored is magnificent.

Enormous statement to Roman Catholic supremacy. This monolithis cathedral is relative young. It is built of stone and is awe-inspiring in scale but not a place to feel at home. A relic of a saint can be seen and venerated. One can go up to the roof - I didn;t; but the view must be good. It would be best to visit when a big service is in progress. A vast place which can been seen best at night from the outside as it is floodlit beautifully and can be seen from everywhere

A Lovely Church. A lovely Church in a nice square, you can pay to go up and view Budapest from the top of the church, from there you can see what a sprawling city it is.There appears to be some on going restoration work in the tower at the top. There is also a chamber set aside with small scale models of other architectural buildings around Budapest.
Amazing. Wonderful church to visit and in particular an amazing place to hear an organ recital. Quite superb interior and very dramatic.
Beautiful. Beautiful architecture, looks really pretty in the night! Inside it is just like any other big church but the location and the building is worth the visit!

Ok. The church itself was pretty amazing, very grand and beautiful, but when we went inside, after donating the suggested amount, a very grumpy man told everyone off for being there, saying out out its closed,however there were no signs indicating this, they were filming possibly for tv, but nothing to say don't enter, so that put me off and made me think they were only after the donations, i wouldn't go back

Beautiful. Beautiful building, very central. There were a couple of wedding going in when we were there and they looked lovely. It was nice to kind of be involved. Went up to the viewpoint and the views were stunning. Well worth a visit.
Take your time. Check the opening hours and plan your visit around the Castle area in order to avoid the big groups in this church; it deserves to be visited quietly.

Organ Concert was wonderful. Check out the Church's website for concerts. They are held regularly. We attended at 8:00pm. Lots of wonderful music ... Mozart, Liszt, Bach ... 1:10 minutes for 5000huf. Great enetrtainment.

Beautiful architecture - St. Stephen's Basilica. The majesty and quietness of this basilica is wonderful to just sit and enjoy. Reading the history of St. Stephen and seeing the holy relic is also fascinating. I hope to attend an organ recital on my next visit.
Historic St Stephens. The church to see in Budapest. Go up the tower for a panoramic view of the city. We also attended a concert here one evening - great acoustics!

Beautiful interior. The Basilica is an essential visit, amazing interior (and free entrance) though can be very busy with tour groups, so best to go early mornings. The surrounding square and walking along Zrinyi Utca towards the Danube river is very pleasant.
Stunning interior. This is a visually impactful cathedral, the artwork inside is breathtaking. It is well worth the "optional" donation.

Must see in Budapest, not as ornate as St. Mathias, but more history/character!. Paid for entry into all public areas and would do it again. Takes a little time here to fully explore the entire area and to get all the history!! Enjoy!
great site. Great cathedral enjoyed the visit. Then there was a brass band concert outside in the square. Famous rose ice creams just up the street too.

Spectacular Building. The outside of the building is spectcular looking down the square. It is unfortunate that it is hidden by all of the other buildings around it, but that's what makes it more spectacular when you round the corner and see this breath taking structure. The inside is restored and very beautiful. Another "must see" stop in Budapest.

Beautiful Cathedral. I had the pleasure to visit this beautiful Cathedral 'St Stephen's Basilica' in Budapest. This is one of the most beautiful buildings I have visited. The Cathedral was named in honour of Hungary's first King Stephen. His right hand is housed as a relic inside this Cathedral. It is one of the tallest buildings in Hungary 96 metres (315 ft) in height with a width of 55 metres (180 ft) and length of 87.4 metres (287 ft). The Cathedral took 54 years to construct being completed in 1905. It is of Neo-Classical architectural style. Beautiful artwork of angels and saints adorn the ceilings of the interior of the Cathedral, with ornate marble, widows, statues, sanctuary and altar.

A wonderful Concert venue. Apart from being a beautiful church, St Stephen's has regular concert performances. The sound got a bit lost sometimes when we were there but still well worth the experience. Musical performances are worth taking in while in Budapest and there are quite a few different venues. This is a good one.

Brilliant. Words simply do not do justice to this incredible structure or to the wealth of decorative detail its interior contains. While not old, it well embodies the spirit that built the great churches and cathedrals of medieval times.

Take the Panorama tour for the best pics of Budapest. St. Stephen's Basilica is a gorgeous structure that took 50 years to build, beginning around 1850. Beautiful architecture. We didn't have time to take the full tour so decided to take the Panorama tour (500 forient/person) and took two elevators to get to the top. The views from this vantage point were outstanding, and gave you a much better perspective on Buda and particularly Pest. Well worth your time.

Impressive basillica. Free to go in, but donation expected , very full of tourists, basilica is very ornate and beautiful, although dark inside, spacious and a place of worship that is very worth a visit if coming to Budapest
View over the city. The Basilica gives you a great view over the city, especially the Pest part.It's worth the 400 HUF (as a student) you have to pay to get up the dome ;)

Fantastic building and steeped in history. What a magnificent building, approached fromany direction. Inside it is magnificent yet retains its charm and is a working church. It is a shame that tour guides don't respect this and talk, even when the services are going on. You can climb the tower for a small fee and get wonderful views across the city . Marvellous architecture and fabulous place to photograph.
Amazing views. We took the stairs to the top, oh boy what a view once you get up there. There is a lift if you need it.
huge. Very big, I got there by a mistake, :0 however, still liked that. You can find there Polish mass if you look for one.

Well worth a visit. On the Pest side of Budapest. An imposing cathedral that's well worth a visit especially for the wonderful painting and stained glass. The outside of the building is also rather lovely and well worth a photo. Lots of eating places nearby for after your visit.

Beautiful Basilica. Really lovely basilica - very historic and well worth a visit. Very grand building with lots of history - we went as part of a group and had a tour so we got all the history. We also visited the side alter which was impressive.
St. Stephen's Basilica, Budapest.. Well worth visiting. Full of history, which illustrates the church and the political history of Buda for over 1000 years. Terrific views over the Danube and Pest.

Absolutely Beautiful. I love St. Stephen's Basilica. What a grand structure - I love seeing it from different angles in the area. Mass here is also very nice. Definitely one to visit, whether you're just taking pictures outside or going inside for a beautiful experience. Very special at Christmastime!

Impressive. Well worth popping in, very grand and impressive, there's a 200HUF 'voluntary contribution' to enter the Basilica (didn't do the balcony view), but I challenge you to get passed the old gentleman without contributing. Well worth it tho.

Gorgeous. Stunning interior. Unfortunately there was a service during my visit so I couldn't really get a good look at the altar, but the marble and gilt I could see up close were beautiful. Don't miss it.
Beautiful. This is a must see in Budapest. The view from the tower is worth the admission, but the treasury is not. The church is very beautiful.

Stunning view. Beautiful church, but nothing special in comparison to churches of other countries. You can get to the top of the towers if you want to without climbing the stairs since there is a lift that can take you up. The view is stunning.

A Must See Place. This place was really gorgeous. The inside of it was spectacular with the architecture and art contained inside. We saw a wedding outside on the Saturday we were there where the bride and groom let doves fly. It is in a great area of Budapest and worth a visit.

Jaw-dropping interior. The interior is mesmerizing, despite the hundreds of people inside. In my opinion is even much more magnificent than the Karlskirche in Vienna, which shows you the profound catholic devotion in Hungary. I recommend to take your time and enjoy the art instead of taking quick pictures and leave. If you have a regular camera, the photos will not look nice because it is a little bit dark inside.
Beautiful. A real must-see. Stunning both inside and out. You are able to sit and take in the atmosphere and light candles if you wish.
Beautiful. Worth a visit as it is beautiful both inside and out as well as during the day and at night. Many cafes nearby to soak up the view.

Incredible. It is easily one of the most beautiful buildings in Budapest, which is saying a lot for it since the city is festooned with incredible architecture. You surely won't miss it, but be sure to see it at night as well as the daytime. It glows magnificently!
St Stephen's basilica. A very impressive church with some nice cafes nearby, also some touristy stalls can be seen there. Approx 10 mins walk from the parliament building.

Great at night. St. Stephen's Basilica is amazingly beautiful in the daylight but you surely need to see it at night as well!!! Better to sit on one of the restaurants near-by and enjoy the view with a glass of local wine.

Fabulous basilica of the king-saint. I went to the side door to ask the gentlemen going in for directions to the front (it is HUGE) and later discovered I should have asked for autographs as they were performing that night. St Stephane and his basilica feature prominently in Hungary's history and in keeping with his role persuading the "christianism of the west to admit the Hungarian church...as an oyster admits a pearl" (see the blurb at the entry to the church) St Stephan's basilica is completely over the top. Their evening concerts of classical music are also well worth while and you must book because they are well attended.
Nice modern structure. Architecturally attractive church with fairly ornate interior, but this cathedral is clearly in a class below the many Italian cathedrals. It is, however worth a visit.

A world class Basilica. This building looks like it has been recently sandblasted and now looks beautiful inside and out. The sumptuous interior is red and gold with beautiful statues candelabras and stained glass.

St Paul's ain't got nothing on these domes. An amazing piece of architecture right in the heart of Budapest, it's worth the 500ft to climb the amazing spiral stair cases to the top for the panoramic views.

A Beautiful Religious House. St. Stephens Basilica is a landmark house of worship, filled with beautiful objects to inspire the faithful. Don't miss the Treasury containing a reliquary with St. Stephen's petrified hand. We enjoyed our concert there on an August evening. The organist was superb. Unfortunately, the acoustics at St. Stephens were not up to par. This vast space proved difficult to fill with sound.
Great view from the tower. It's a great and beautiful basilica. You can see it from Buda side of the river, it's enormous! The view from the tower is awesome, you can see the whole city there, 360o.

Who's the centre of attraction?. Architecturally wonderful and a great place to sit and reflect. Looking at the altar was a bit of a puzzle. The most central figure was the king after whom the basilica is named. No doubt Jesus got a look in somewhere but He wasn't immediately obvious. This is the most clear expression of the theological problem at the heart of Christendom that I've come across for a while. Surely God should be the centre of any church.
A beautiful church. Stumbled upon this by accident....so glad I visited. One of the best churches I have seen.Beautiful design.

Worth a visit. There is a small donation entry fee of 200 HUF, but well worth it.The well cared for Basilica has a different beauty from the other churches and cathedrals in the surrounds towns. The beautiful dome and murals make you want to sit down, think and take it all in for a few minutes. It is definitely, worth the visit.

Beautiful Basilica. As you wander over the Chain Bridge from the Buda side of the city you are enticed to walk towards the Basilica which is visible from a few hundred metres away. There is a nice square in front of the Basilica which is busy yet serene. Splendid exterior. It is a very worthwhile experience to visit, the cupola inside the church is magnificent. A must see when in Budapest.
Awe Struck. The exterior alone is stunning enough. But you should make the time to go inside to see and explore this massive, beautiful, Catholic church.

Great view from the Tower. Pay 500ft to climb to the main dome for a great view. There is an elevator option if needed but even if elderly the stairs should be achievable with a few breaks. It is free to go into the main building although you will need to dodge the Catholic priest tapping the 'optional donation' sign and glaring at you on the way in. The interior is way over the top but impressive, this is modern and it shows.

Awesome views from the tower!. It is a nice church in the inside, very well conserved and cared for, with amazing paintings and St Stephen's hand in an urn that gets lit when you pay.But the most amazing part is going up to the roof, where you have amazing views of the city. You can go up on a lift or through stairs, it takes more or less the same time. The place up there is narrow, and it goes all the way round 360 degrees so that you can see all the city. A visit not to miss!.
Breathtaking. This cathedral has an imposing presence in Budapest. A visit to the interior makes this church even more fascinating. The detail and beauty of the worship space is amazing.
Attractive overlooking the city. We walked up there and took a good look around, the only annoying aspect was you needed certain tickets to enter displays. but it was nice to check it out
beautiful basilica. One of the most beautiful I have seen in person. Only admission charge is a small donation, absolutely breathtaking once inside

Beautiful but nothing special. It comes down to the typical church you've probably seen so many times in different countries. But, the paintings, architecture (inside and outside) and atmosphere are still breathtaking.

Everything is refined, tasteful, in proportion. Monumental St. Stephen Basilica is as well groomed inside and outside as an imperial palace, but it has none of the excessive Baroque trappings of so many other European cathedrals. Everything is refined, tasteful, in proportion and a welcome relief!! We felt that the Church allowed for a quiet time of reflection anyone could reflect on the Divine without major distractions. We were there during a quiet time of day, and enjoyed over an hour in solitude. Yet as we explored the sanctuary, we couldn’t locate the obligatory Pieta and the Stations of the Cross. Of course, we had a lot of territory to cover; the cathedral is huge. After more searching, we still were not successful until we saw that a mass of tourists who were blocking a passage to a small chapel that we hadn’t even noticed was there. We painstakingly navigated into the room. Ah ha! we finally saw paintings of the Stations of the Cross. These depictions, artlessly framed in discolored glass, were mediocre and lifeless. But at least we had found them.Satisfied with one victory, we hoped to also locate the Pieta, perhaps in another recess that we might have overlooked. No luck. we just couldn’t understand how such a major Catholic cathedral could ignore the Pieta.Nonplussed, we still wanted to see the Treasury upstairs. As we entered, we saw a large old painting of the Pieta. It was a little frayed, the figures were elongated in the El Greco-Mannerist style that we have always felt are a bit off-putting, and both Jesus and Mary both appeared stillborn; they had little humanity. But aside from our criticism of the painting, at least it was there. And we was for now vindicated in my belief that almost every Catholic Church, no matter how obscure or celebrated, automatically includes the Pieta and the Stations of the Cross.As Tevye in Fiddler on the Roof used to proclaim in defense of a Jewish rite or custom, it’s TRADITION!

Typical Catholic Church *yawn*. Upon my visit to this impressive Basilica in Pest, I found myself continually reminded of the quotation from Pope Leo X: “how profitable this lie of Christ has been for us.”As one enters, one is immediately given the choice: tower or main hall. I selected the tower first. The student admission price was modest (though the man on the desk never did ask for my student ID), and from the top of the tower one grasps some excellent views of the city. There is also a lift, for those who don’t want the fun of climbing several hundred stairs.Afterwards, came the hall itself. One is asked at the entrance to keep admission free by paying a donation of 200 forint. How ironic. There are two guards making sure nobody gets in without paying something, though the full 200 is not compulsory. On the front door, women are politely reminded of their place in a religious society with several diagrams detailing what they cannot wear – no such illustrations exist for male visitors. Though, in credit to staff, the rule did not seem to be enforced as there were many female visitors wearing “banned” clothing inside. I remain sceptical of “his holy right hand” on exhibiton. The St Stephen’s hand does seem more plausible than many of the other blatant lies in European churches – such as the Jesus’ blood example in Bruges (and several other locations, coincidentally) – however a little more history and science would be nice rather than a simple declaration along the lines of: “hey everyone, look at us, we have St Steph’s hand!” Though, when have the Catholic Church ever shown an interest in what actually happened? Especially when it is far more profitable to ask visitors to contribute One Euro or some forint just to turn the lights on for twenty seconds and actually let people see the damned thing.On your way out, be sure to check out the gift shop where one can purchase, among other generic Budapest and catholic souvenirs, signed pictures of Pope Francis. In truth it is very similar to most other Catholic churches and cathedrals, the only real difference is the location. Excellent views are provided: probably the only redeeming feature.
Stunning!. Certainly should be high up on your places to visit list.The Basilica is absolutely stunning.Scrummy ice cream shop outside to have a sit down after your visit!!
Impressive building. It is absolutely beautiful both outside and on the inside. The decor is beyond belief in its beauty. It is a must do as it is difficult to describe.

A must see. One of the must see places in Budapest. Very busy but nothing like its equivalents that you'd find in other large European cities. They were playing the organ whilst we we're inside, so atmospheric.

Amazing Views. This cathedral is a "must see" The interior is interesting and beautiful but the views from the top are outstanding and should not be missed. For a very small fee there is a lift to the top where you can appreciate 360 degree views of Budapest.

Hard to see much. You might choose to pay to go up in the dome or to see the treasury, but if all you do is visit the inside of the Basilica, it's really hard to see much. A whole section was cordoned off because of a wedding, and the doors were closed at about 3 when the ceremony started. Very typical church of its time, but although it says it contains the Hand of the Black Madonna and some relic of St. Stephen, there were no signs that I could see pointing one in those directions..

Crane your neck. Pay the £1,25 to go up to the outside gallery at the top of the dome. Great views of the City. Then come back inside and marvel at the architecture and religious iconography. You will need about an hour and a half tops.
Very beautiful. So beautiful church, one of the most beautiful of the worldFree access a must see for every tourist who go in budapest !!!!

Very beautiful church. Very nice architectural features, inside and outside. The interiors are lavish, and certainly worth a visit. They do have concerts occasionally, and I had to wait at the entrance hall for that to finish before the church could be visited. Entrance to the church is free, but you have to buy a ticket for the tower and the crypt separately.

Go up in the lift, come down the stairs. This is a stunning interior, described by lonely panet as "rather dark and gloomy" so I was pleasantly surprised by how much light there was. Relics do not interest me, so only did the main part , and then went up to heaven - BE WARNED it is a long way up, the first lift from left side of the main entrance only goes so far, then you have to walk round the other side past an exhibition and get in a tiny lift max four people to go up inside the Dome, and then still have to climb a metal stair a short way to get outside. So waiting for lifts is time consuming, but the alternative is only any good if you are in training for the Iron Man, going down the stairs is easy, and saves a lot of time queuing.The views from all round the walkway at Dome height are well worth the effort of getting there, and the price of a ticket, you pay the same for a lift (500 Huf) as taking the spiral staircase.
Basilica. Loved the Basilica in Budapest. It was well worth the visit and we would definitely go back again. It is the oldest church in Budapest.

Interesting church. A few steps from the centre of Pest. We went to a performance of the Mozart Requiem there, and got a much better view of the interior. Acoustics were muddy for a full orchestral performance though.

Breathtaking!!. You cannot come to Budapest and not visit the Basilica. The view from the top is outstanding and the interior takes your breath away. It's beautiful at night time too when it is all lit up. I LOVED this place.

Beautiful, dome was worth it. My cousin took me here, it was beautiful. Absolutley beautiful. The sculptures throughout were amazing. We paid the small fee to get to the dome which was breathtaking. From there you can see the hills if buda and the city of pest giving you a hint of how the city began in the hills for protection then spread out as they developed and grew.
Go to the top!. The views are spectacular and not very crowded. You have to pay to go up to the top, it is not well marked but worth the effort. Of course the inside of the church is remarkable.

AMEN !!!!!. What a beautiful Basilica. Stunning architecture. Plenty of history shown and the most that impressed was the hand of Saint Istvan. Easy walking distance from our hotel and from the main shopping plaza.A must see !!!!!!!!!!!!

there's a hand in there. you pay only 200 florints (contribution) and it's not bad, but it's not st vitus in prague. a wee bit forgettable. maybe st mattius church on the buda side is more lovely and interesting from a purely beauty perspective.

Religion pur!. The building, though only a bit more then hundered years old, is a gem! Try to come on August 20th, for the celebration of the National Day, or better: The Day of the founder of Hungary, The Holy King Stevan - Istvan! And: Do never forget to stop at the fist side-chapel in the northern wing, which bears a reliq if the beatified Emperor Charles of Austria, the Emperor of Peace...
Lovely interior.. This is a very impressive building with a highly decorated interior. I am a sucker for decorated ceilings and here they are wonderful.

Very nice!. Beautiful old Basilica that is very impressive for all its splendor.
You should view the building from a distance and you will get a better view of its magnificent structure.
There are many great restaurants and pastry shops nearby.

Most beautiful church anywhere. Inside the church is so light and beautiful. Great site for a concert. The square around St Stevens hosts festivals on the weekends - we had a great time at the local wine fest. the square also has numerous restaurants, all of which we tried were winners.
Stunning St Stephen's Basilica. A must visit. Have been there many times before they charged to go into the area. Great architecture.

Very colourful, beautiful Basilica in the middle of Budapest. It was walking distance from the Sofitel where we stayed. It is a must see visit. There was a lot to absorb. It was busy but there were many spots you could sit and meditate and be by yourself.

The Right Hand of a Saint. Beautiful structure. Don't miss the preserved, or should i say 'survived'...right hand of St. Stephens. The basilica is beautiful without this historical backdrop. But, if if you do choose to visit, make sure you see the hand of the saint in the back. Yes, you can take pictures of it, without flash, of course.
Nice visit. It was a beautiful basilica with lots of construction going on outside . The problem is after a while all churches look alike

One of the most beautiful churches in Hungary. Iconic building with breathtaking atmosphere and amazing decorations on both in- and outside. Souvenir shop included. For those not afraid of heights, there's a possibility to step outside the roof and enjoy a circular panorama of Budapest. It's a working church so don't be surprised if you find yourself -like I did - in the middle of the Easter Mess ceremony :)
Nice, but not a must. I skipped the Basilica in my previous visits to Budapest. The building and interior are nice and interesting but not more.
Wonderful Basilica. Easy to spot in Budapest located two blocks from Elizabeth square and the Hop on-Hop off Tour Budapest.The street is Bajcsy-Zsilinszky útca.

Beautiful Building. Visited here a number of times to try and see all of it but 1st time we visited there was a wedding in progress which we could watch from the back. Costs 200 Forints as a donation ( about 50p) which is well worth it for the photo opportunity. We climbed the tower of 302 steps which is also cheap at about a pound sterling, the views are great and there are lifts if you are unable to manage the whole climb.
Picturesque. Attended mass on Sunday. Very beautiful church inside and out! Not to be missed! Right in the heart of "Pest", Buda is on the other side of the Danube.

Worth a visit. An interesting catholic church. Don't miss seeing St Stephen's preserved right hand - although it's hard to identify in it's case. Although there is no entrance fee to the church, a man at the entrance insists that the optional "donation" is paid. Most people appeared happy to pay this once, but if you want to enter the church several times during a trip to Budapest, bare this in mind.
Beautiful. Worth the time and few cents to see this beautiful work of art. Good lighting for handheld photography

Christmas Eve with a differnce. Went to midnight mass on Christmas Eve and although the service was in Hungarian it was a amazing way to spend such a special time. The church is amazing and it was full and the singing was heartfelt.

Visit for the view. My husband and I decided to take advantage of the opportunity to get a bird's eye view of the Pest side of Budapest even though we climbed many steps to do so. The Panoramic ticket was inexpensive and the chance to see the interior of the dome as well as a 360 degree vista of the city was worth the climb.

Impressive. Impressive from the outside. Can't tell you about the interior as it was closed when we went there!!It closes at 5PM so if you want to visit, go in the morning. I'm sure the inside of the Basilica will be worth a visit.
beautiful church with great views. The church was really beautiful inside and out, and the extra cost to go up to the top was worthwhile for the amazing views over all of Budapest.

Possibly more interesting if you're Catholic. I'm not, and only moderately interested in church architecture (mostly Russian Orthodox). The interior is decorated in a style that doesn't do a whole lot for me personally, and I'm not interested in relics either as a religious item or as a "lol look at the guy's severed hand" way. The treasure room (which you have to pay to see) is small and not very interesting.I hear the view from the tower is good and maybe I will go back for that someday, but otherwise, it's not the prettiest church I've seen and the historical exhibits are fairly minimal.

Organ concert. Visit to the Basilica itself is beautiful they have many concerts there we attended the Organ concert outstanding a must, you can also go to the top of the Basilica and walk round for an ariel view small charge for that.
A must see place. The Basilica is a pearl to be visited in Budapest. Not far from the Chain Bridge. Don't forget to go and see the 'Hand of Szent Istvan'

Like stairs?. Beautiful cathedral, amazing climbing up to the dizzying heights and seeing the internal structures, and quieting paying our respects to St, Istvin's relic . . . Definitely worth a look if you have time in Budapest

Don't miss it. It's one of the "must sees" in Budapest.The view from the dome is well worth the money and steps.The kids (6 and 8) were fascinated with Szent Istvan right hand. A bit weird, but ok (seeing without light is free; seeing it with light... just wait for someone that drops a coin... or help the church and drop it yourself!!)The interior of the basilica is great. Try to read something about the construction (the 3 architects, the dome falling down, etc).
Beautiful. The views from the 'gallery' are stunning & well worth the 322 step climb! The interior of the church has inspiring & breathtaking artwork & scuptures.
beautiful Church. The face of Budapest. One of the best Church Hungary has. Iconic and countrys landmark and a must visit. Vibrations is so positive inside the church and so as the whole church.

A Budapest Landmark. Not only is it beautiful to visit, but the church's spires make a good orientation point when touring Pest. Check to see when the concerts are given. We happened to be there for a dress rehearsal and it added so much to the visit.
Top arhitecture!. This is the place, wich all turists must wisite in Budapest.Entrance is free, but you can give some money for the church.Great!

Impressive. Very impressive. Very ornate. Darkly decorated. St. Stephen was canonized because he invited the church to Christianize nomadic Hungarian peoples around 1000 AD. Kudos to this bold and visionary leader.
National day 20th August. There was the religious service when we visited the basilica. It was very interesting to see how Hungarians celebrate their national day.

Worth the fee to climb the steps for the view (lift available also). Fantastic place and beautiful inside, one of the few places that accepted a donation for entry (200ft when we went) another 500ft to buy a ticket to climb to the viewing area at the top, but it is worth it - even the 300 steps.

church. we were lucky because we were there for the saint stephens fest, so the ceremony outside , and the thousands of people, were amazing, the church is beautifull, it is not a basilica but because of the importance and the size it is called so.there are also several events concert in the church with the organ and soprano, it deserves to do it it is not so expencive from 7700-4500fr

Magnificent. A highlight of our trip to Budapest. Great views from the viewing promenade at the top of the Basilica (there is a small lift, but surely better to climb the stairs). The interior defies adequate description. We also attended a concert in the Basilica, and the acoustics are as magnificent as the decor. The organ music is 360 degrees surround sound, which you feel as well as hear. The sounds of singers and violins hang in the vast space without echo. A pleasurable sensory overload.

Stephen's Hand. This is the largest catholic church in Budapest. It was built in 1851 and is a mix of classical and neo-renaissance styles. The interior is a riot of marble and gold. Entry is 1100Ft and for an extra 500Ft you can ride a lift (or climb stairs) to one of the towers. There are fine views across the city and you get to see the interior of the dome. Prize exhibit in the church is the severed right hand of St Stephen himself. He was the first King of Hungary, and his hand now lies is a gold casket on display at the back of the church.

beautiful and grand. I was bummed i wasn't able to enter the church. They had closed it to get ready for a concert and unfortanetly i was leaving town early the next day. I would have loved to have seen the inside and paid to go to the top. Gorgous exterior. Hopefully I can make my way back to this church again...
Beautiful. A few hours entertainment, reasonable prices to go up to the top and worth the effort for the amazing views! Beautiful inside and out, a very happy morning overall.

Beautiful Cathedral. The inside of the church is spectacular. We also paid extra and went to the top of the basilica for a fee. Views were spectacular. If you don't want to walk the 302 steps, you can take two elevators to get to the top. Well worth the couple of US dollars it costs to visit.

Is a Masterpiece with Hungarian Ceramic Tiles. This architecture always reminded me of the birthday cake houses with Marzipan roofs! It is unique and colorful and a must see. Don't forget it reach the crypt and spend a good half a day touring the area around the church and admire the view from above.

A beautiful church. St Stephen's basilica is beautiful inside and out. The tower is well worth the walk up the many steps as it offers amazing views of Budapest. St Stephen's hand is very strange but is an interesting part of Hungarian history.

Lovely cathedral. Again, beautifully lit at night - we sat at one of the cafes on the square at night, enjoyed a nice cocktail and just gazed dreamily at the cathedral. Later on we went inside: it is quite magnificent.

Nice church. Typically Hungarian - they ask for a donation and once you are in the door there is a sign saying the church is closed and this way to the exit. The church itself is nice - brighter than the one in Vienna, but it is not as spectacular as St. Matthias church - which is the best in Budapest.

Absolutely beautiful and magnificent Basilica!. I was overwhelmed with Basilica! It was so nice and magnificent! When we entered there was a Mass going on and it was a part on Hungarian and major part on Latin. You could really feel the power of Latin as a universal language. Although I do not understand Hungarian, Latin I understand a little bit so it was great to hear Mass in Latin and be a part of this mighty tradition.The interior is really nice and the square and the view from the outside is grandiose. When you are in Budapest, be sure to visit the Basilica you will not regret it!And then you can jump to the finest ice cream in Budapest in the form of a flower which is just around the corner.

Beautiful Church!. This church is beautiful inside and out and definitely worth the visit. The church itself cost a 200 optional donation and the panoramic view at the top and the treasury room were extra. We went to all three. The views at the top of the church were incredible. The treasury room was small but nice and had some beautiful catholic artifacts. If I had to do it again, I may have skipped the treasury room.

Gorgeous Design, Limited Access. Excellent example of Neo-Classical architecture and certainly a standout in Budapest. It has been meticulously care for and is in better shape than most of the churches I've visited in Eastern Europe, and many in Western and Central Europe as well. Access is limited and there seems to be a bit more emphasis on milking out more money from tourists to gain full entry. Perhaps it was the time of year that I visited, which was early March. I would have liked to spend more time, but I felt rushed to move on and leave.

Thank you Budapest for sharing this Basilica. From the time you enter the Basilica you have a wonderful sense of calm take over you. The frescoes, the altars, the beautiful holy statues are breath taking. Be sure to get there early and take the elevator up to the top to see up close the artists murals,frescoes. Be sure to have lots of space in your camera for photos as every painting is as beautiful as the next. There is a an outside viewing area, bit it is closed on Sundays..heard the view is amazing
ABC. Another beautiful church, there really is not more to say it's a church it has baroque architecture but to me it's another church

St Stephen's Bascilica. Stunning architecture. Beautiful building. St Stephen's hand is an interesting story well worth the visit. We attended a String Orchestra concert there one evening & it was fabulous. The acoustics were wonderful.

It's a great spot for people watching. The church itself is excellent, but not more so than a dozen other churches I saw during my week in the area, including some others in Budapest. But the square outside is a hub of activity worth watching.

more then worthy. We stayed near the Basilica so we were able to have coffee each morning and stare at this beautiful building. There is a fee (suggested donation) to enter but you should! It is just beautiful!

An impressive sanctuary. After visiting numerous churches and cathedrals in a two week period, were not expecting to be impressed with one more, but the church is stunning and the relics of St. Stephan, namely his hand, were amazing. Worth the stop by all means.

History in spades. This amazing church is the Center of Budapest's historic roots, and houses their holy relic, the withered arm of St Stephens. The tourists, whilst respectful, flock here making sure that this is not a haven of peaceful reflection. This is a visit for those who love old churches and history, rather than for those speaking out a moment With their God. The is no entry fee, but a donation is appreciated.
Impressive church. Very impressive building and interior with a beautiful cupola. The rotunda around the cupola provides great views of the city.

Enchanting basilica. "EGO SUM VIA VERITAS ET VITA" - remarkable quote on the front of basilica which means a lot to me. Its green towers dominate over the city landscape and are best seen, together with a Parliament building, from the Buda Castle hill. This church remind me of St. Paul's Cathedral in London that is also very charming. :)
Sense of peace and spirituality. A bold statement in a central city location. The sense of spirit and history is both seen and felt. Recommend a local guide to truly appreciate this.

Beautiful. We went soon after we landed in Budapest and placed our luggage in the hotel. This is a beautiful cathedral. The interiors and exteriors were very nice. We did not do the climb to the top.Interesting fact. Both the tip of the spire and the top of the Hungarian parliament are the tallest structures in Budapest. Both are 98 meters high.

Who knew?. This church may not look like much on the outside, but the inside is beautiful. Instead of Jesus at the alter, you'll see St. Stephen. Weird right? This is one of the very few Catholic churches that received permission from the Pope to do this. Don't forget to check out the mummified hand of St. Stephen.
Not very big but amazing. Amazing architectural sturcture though it is not a real basilica size building. Beautiful fresco paintings. It is located quiete close to the centrum.

Great view from the top. This is a very nice large church which is worth a visit if your in town. I highly recommend climbing the 250+ steps up to the viewing area atop the dome for a superb views of the city. We also went to a Friday night organ recital which was a great thing to do for music buffs!
Amazing decoration. We visited on a Sunday morning and were welcome to see the Basilica and listen to the service from the back. Wonderful music.

Enter the church and be amazed.. This basilica is pretty from the outside, but on the inside is much much better. If you have a dslr camera I recommend taking a monopod with you, to help you capture the fantastic collors inside. To enter the church its free, you only need to pay if you want to go to the top. For me this was the prettiest place in Budapest.
Holiday visit. Both the exterior and the interior design of the church building was beautiful and iconic. Simply breathtaking

A must see when in Budapest. There is nothing like it. For all artists, museum lovers, and architects - this is a must see. Close to the basilica is a busy pedestrian street filled with cafés, shops, and restaurants. We almost missed this beautiful landmark if it was not for having to meet close to the basilica for our night ferry ride on the danube river. Thus, I suggest that you visit this landmark at night as it is better with lights.
beautiful. A stunning Basilica and a must see in Budapest. I thoroughly enjoyed one of the regular classical concerts which are regularly held there.
It's a big church. Worth a visit. It is a very big church with a lovely square in front. Not as old as you'd think but quite impressive inside.
Amazing. Gorgeous basilica, one of the best places to go in my opinion, the dome is incredible, five stars! Loved it
Good place to visit. The basilica is very imposing. It dominates the square it is in. The surrounds make for a good backdrop for a very scenic part of town.
