Beautiful church. At the center of things, as far as we were concerned, was this beautiful church by Budapest's walking streets (no cars allowed). There were several shops and ice cream parlor's within easy walking distance, too, but St. Stephen's became a central attraction for us.

Don't Go to a Concert Here. I hate to slam a classical music venue of any kind, but here goes. The building is beautiful, in a cold, sterile way. OK for a short visit, and a good belly laugh at the "Insert 400 Florints to Light Up St Stephens Severed Hand" display. But as a concert venue, this is without a doubt, the worst one I have ever visited. The orchestra (which was excellent-the venue isn't their fault) was placed directly under the dome, and as a result, the acoustics were so bad that notes played a bar or two earlier were still echoing, leading to absolute aural confusion. You could not pick out any melody, even in the slowest requiem. Heaven knows how the poor soprano soloist made it through her pieces. And the wonderful concertmaster/soloist was totally wasted. It was a total cacophony. If you only have time for one classical concert, go to the Duna Palota (Danube Palace) a few blocks directly in front of St Stephens. Lovely acoustics, excellent musicians, and no late arrival tourists with cane and camera running all over the place during the concert snapping photos. If you have time for two concerts- go to the Duna Palota again. Just don't waste your money at St Stephens, sad to stay. Maybe if they experimented with repositioning the orchestra, adding some kind of acoustical fabric wings, or microphone enhancements, perhaps that would help.

So Impressive. St Stephen’s Basilica is in central Pest, not far from the Danube or the Government Building, and is an impressive, twin towered sight when approaching along the short pedestrianised street to its frontage. The Basilica is huge, and when viewed from Buda Hill, it’s apparent how much it towers over, and dominates, Pest.Entrance to the Basilica was free, although donations are welcome, but there is a small charge to climb the dome and also to visit the Treasury.The inside of the church is very ornate, with wonderful frescoes, statuary, stained glass windows and stonework, and has a wonderfully peaceful air.The altar is huge, with a statue of St Istvan, backed by scenes from his life.One of the must see sights in the Basilica is the mummified right forearm of King Istvan. This relic is displayed in a magnificent gold and silver case, styled as an ornate church, and is in a peaceful side chapel, which has beautiful stained glass windows.Given the vast size of the Basilica, it really is worth paying the modest fee to climb, or take the lift, to the top of the dome, and walk around the outside of the dome taking in some amazing views of both Pest, and across the river to Buda Hill.The Treasury contains displays of religious clothing and artefacts. To access the Treasury just use the lift opposite the ticket office / stairs to the dome.

Worth visiting. The Basilica, as all the churches in Europe, is a beautiful building. In the summer there's lots of weddings happening there. The best part for me was the climb to the top, but you have to be fit for it as it's a lot of steps. Once you get there the view is awesome, I really recommend it.
Impressive. Tourists congregate in this area and at the eating establishments that line the square. The Basilica is an impressive structure..don't miss seeing it lit at night.

Stunning interior and good views. Basilica is situated in a really nice pedestrian area, with lots of decent cafés, restaurants and bars. Once you climbed the stairs to the top you will certainly have earned a cold beer when you leave.Good views of the city from the viewing balcony. Especially the very ornate tiled roof of the treasury building. Quite a strenuous walk up the spiral staircases, especially if it's a hot day. There is a lift, which nearly gets you all the way, only have a couple of short flights to get to get to the top.The interior is stunning and well worth the small donation that you pay at the church entrance. Ornate decorations and stained glass windows. Make sure you explore all areas as well as you could easily miss the black madonna and then hand of St Stephen if you only visit the main body of the basilica. And please remember to turn off your flash when taking photographs.

Beautiful Basilica!. I always find myself amazed and I cannot imagine what people had to go through in order to accomplish such an amazing achievement as this Basilica. Beautiful architecture in a great place of Budapest!
Colourful cathedral!. The ornaments and paintings inside are colorful, interesting and worth admiring! The cathedral features a small museum inside, on the first floor.
A very Ornate Church. Magnificent artwork on the dome adorns this church and makes itvastly worth a visit. The exterior of the church is also a magnificent piece of architecture.
Worth Seeing. Worth a photo and the time to see it. You can see the holy right hand of St. Stephen, which is unique.

Impressive. Basilica is beautiful and carefully constructed ... worth a prolonged visit .I also seen evening concert who worth the money ... a gem well capitalized and very nice integrated architectural.

Beatifull basilica. Its an absolutely beatifull basilica with organ and beatifull singers. Area around is full of caffes, and in front of Bsilica there was a band playing, which made the whole visit pretty magic.

Definitely in my top 3 favorite basilica. The basilica looks enormous from outside. But once you're in, you'll realize there is much more to admire. The interior is so grand and spectacular, using colorful huge marbles and beautiful touch of gold ornaments. It will take your breath away. Don't forget to go up to the tower and get a nice view of Budapest. There's an elevator if you can't stand the stairs. Highly recommended for everyone visiting Budapest!

View from above. I've been to Budapest many many times before but I have never, until now, got to the top of this beautiful building.On a very hot July Saturday morning, my girlfriend and I have finally decided to go upstairs. We took the elevator to the 1st floor and from there we climbed the multitude of spiralled stairs till we reached the visiting platform of the Basilica.We have done this in Paris as well ( climbing Notre Dame) so we expected the same beautiful view and we were not disappointed. The whole city was at our feet, offering a 360 degrees panorama of the buildings, parks, large boulevards Budapest consists of. Every clmbed step was worth it and we enjoyed the sun and the perfect view of this marvelous city.

A gem. Definitely worth a visit. It is in the middle of the main shopping area with lots of restaurants around and it stands in the square just as you leave the narrow streets. What a sight!! I loved it. Inside is the right hand of St Stephen. The building itself is so breathtaking! I was amazed but then again, I have a thing about churches. I love them but this is a true gem

Beautiful.. For a measly donation your eyes a treated to arguably the most beautiful interior in Budapest. Located right in the city centre there's bars, cafes, restaurants and shops galore right on it's doorstep so spend as long as you like there because the rest of Budapest is on it's doorstep ready to welcome you back from inside this iconic Church.

Great views. Very ornate. Has the hand of St Stephen (supposedly) in a glass tabernacle - pay a little and it lights up for a better view!! Not to be missed is a trip up into the dome (a couple of lifts and some stairs) (must buy a ticket but well worth the florints) as there are spectacular views from the parapet.

Gorgeous interior and view. It's absolutely stunning inside. Pay to go upstairs to the balcony- the view of Budapest is great! Also check out the cool stained glass saints in the side room along with the King's hand (no joke).

Worth the visit. Apart from the church itself with the beautifully decorated walls and windows, if you go upstairs there is sort of a (very small) "museum" that shows artifacts used in the church. There is a fee for entering the church (I think 1.200HUF) which you can buy across the street. You can get there using the funicular or by car (I do not recommend walking, it's quite steep going up there).
Pretty. Very appealing to the eye. Inside was impressive, my wife wanted see the saints arm. There is lot of action at night bars restaurants but for young people.

Go for an Evening Concert. There is a charge to visit the Basilica so we decided to go to an evening concert, hear the magnificent organ, and see the Basilica. My husband was not interested in ABC (you know "Another Bloody Castle/church) so this was the perfect solution! We were able to hear the organ in all its glory, sit down, enjoy the magnificent art and relics in our surroundings. Afterwards, we went out into the square around St. Stephen's and enjoyed the lively nightlife with restaurants and musicians. This was an amazing evenign.

Stunning building, well worth a visit.. Visited as part of a city tour. I think there was a small donation expected for admission. The building is huge and very ornate. I don't think I'd go again, but I'm pleased I visited it.

Beautiful Cathedral magnificent interior. Beautiful sculptures artwork and stained glass windows, exquisite ceilings, aw inspiring domed ceiling, loved the architecture, also loved the views from the balcony over the city. Also loved the history behind the building and that it is so old.
Impressive. An impressive structure that has a 287 step climb to a tower affording great views of the city. A must do! The church itself is another beautifully decorated structure.
Beautiful place. The basilica itself is very beatiful, and the area around it is just breathtaking.really worth a visit.

Good Alfresco dining. The food was good. The waitress was always smiling and very pleasant and polite. It was in very close proximity to the Basilica, so we did not have far to walk to the concert after our meal.Sitting outside to enjoy our meal on a very warm evening, was much better than inside the restaurant and we were also able to see what was going on in the square.

Beautiful place outside and inside. If you go up there in church balcony,there is a stunning view all over the city. They are taking a little fee to get up there but its worth every forint. Inside the church is lot of paints in walls and roof, really a must place to visit.

Amazing, both from outside and within. It is a marvellous spectacle, and there are good open areas from which to view both the front and back, and take pics. Inside the vaulted domes are amazing, and so is the gold and red plasterwork. You can acsend for some spectacular views from the dome balcony, either by lift (small charge) or by stairs (smaller charge) - but there are a lot of them, and you need to be fit!There is no charge to just look around inside. A must-see for anyone on a visit to Budapest, no matter how short.
Beautiful. Stunning building, so big and grand! Worth a visit & there's loads of nice places to eat and drink nearby
Budapest churches are stunning. Do a church tour. I live gte architecture in every Budapest church. Don't skip this one. The details, the architecture is amazing.
Excellent Views All Around. Well worth spending 45 minutes touring the church. Great art work located around the church. If you are in to such things, you can see the hand of St. Stephens.

St. Stephen's. The church was beautiful. It was within easy walk from the riverfront. However, there seemed to be an entrance fee or donation. There was no one at the door who spoke English so it was hard to communicate as to what amount money had to be paid.

Beautiful. We paid the 500 Forints to see the view from the top and its well worth the small fee as the views are really good. The hand of St Stephen is hard to see as its high up but there is a small box in front of it where you pay 50 forints to light up the box which makes it easier to see. We visited twice, as if you visit after five there is a service going on which means you can't see the hand.
St. Stephen's Basilica breath taking. A must see,breath taking church & grounds. You can see the views of the Center of Budapest as well as the Danube River. Great tour of the Basicilia.
Beautiful church. We saw this church and it was lovely. It is high up on a hill.It is near restaurants and shopping. There are lots of churches in Europe call St. Stephen's.

short visit in BUDAPEST. It,s a very beautiful town,quite expensive but charminng....the food is very good,people quite kindly with tourist ,but sometimes they try to cheat them with the change money...
beautiful. Take the time to go up to the top. Beautiful views of the city. Been here before, but had to take my boyfriend to the gorgeous basilica and he was in awe!

For the religious people in the world.. I visit this place not long ago while in Budapest and well, its stunning! I went while in the centre of Budapest and when we entered, we saw the inside. Inside is like the Tardis, it is much, much bigger inside. I'm not really a person who would enjoy visits like this, but my parents very much did. I personally didn't see all of it, since I played on my iPad, but at the fronts, inside the church, you can light a candle for 200 HUF (or 1 Euro), and then on the sides you could walk down them. Apparently, on one side, there was the hand of St. Stephan there, but well, whatever aha. The whole inside of the building practially was full of gold! Very, very expensive but if you like stuff like that, then visit here. Also, there was a fee to get into the tower/dome, but we didn't go up since we decided to go to a Mini bar nearby.
wow!. A really big church. Insanely beautiful architecture. And if you climb to the top, it opens incredibly beautiful view of the entire city
Breathtaking. Just like walking into another era, this basilica had the most incredible atmosphere - something I will never forget

great views.... We appreciated the beauty of the basilica - but perhaps were most impressed by the views afforded up the stair case from the dome observation deck (p.s. - take a photo looking down the wrought iron railed staircase - great artsy shot). The city views are spectacular (there is a modest fee to go to the observation deck - the entry to the church is gratis). If you are looking for a workout - go around 3p on a hot day - climb to the top - you'll feel you've definitely done a cardio workout after reaching the summit.

Beautiful, but even better for the panorama . St. Stephen's Basilica is a stunning building on the outside, very attractive on the inside (and free!) but best above all for the views from the top. For the inexpensive sum of 400 Forents, not that much over €1, you get the best views we found in Pest over the city, with a good sight over the Parliament and Castle. Having seen the views from Buda, it was nonetheless well worth seeing them from Pest.
Largest church in Hungaary. The name of the basilica derives from the name of its patron, first king of Hungary. The view from the observation desk is beautiful.
must see. must see in Budapest. Nice place, sacred and beautiful. highly recommend ).............................

Beautiful. We came across St. Stephen's by accident - we turned a corner and there it was in the plaza directly ahead - WOW. If you think the outside is great spend 10 minutes and walk through the interior. Breathtaking. Look up inside the giant dome - how did they do that ? This is a "don't miss".
Awesome. No time to go in but you stand and look in awe at the sheer magnificence of it. Many people taking photos. Worth a look even if you don't have the time to venture inside.

Classical Recital. The acoustics in the Basilica are amazing. The recital was performed by 7 fantastic musicians and a very good opera singer. If you love Ave Maria and Handel's Messiah you'll love this. Cheapest seats offer the same experience as the most expensive. Costs around £6 for one hour of great music.

Magnificent cathedral! in the heart of things...short walk from Le Meridien hotel. Loved the architecture, both inside and out..don't miss! Loved the machine in foyer where you can press a coin with your name, date, etc. Watched part of a church service...very interesting.

Plan Your Visit. We visited St Stephens Basilica on a Saturday afternoon and were able to visit all the nooks and cranies. We returned to the area on Sunday and the cathedral was closed due to services being held. It is unquestionably worth the effort.

Definite visit - plan for the organ concerts. Definitely worth your visit in Budapest. A gorgeous church with lots to look at. You can get tickets to go to the panorama view, which is worth the cost. Take BOTH elevators - we didn't see the second elevator and were sorry for that! We made sure to come to the 5pm Monday organ concert - wonderful and reasonable. They offer other concerts during the week as well - would highly recommend.The only thing we didn't like was all the asking for money - tickets to the top, tickets for the organ concert, donation to go in the church (we didn't donate), another 'donation' to light a candle, and the worst for us, a fee to light up the hand relic - seemed commercial and disrespectful to us. At least they put all that money to good use as the church is in excellent condition.
Stunning. Inside is spectacular. The care and attention lavished on it is evident and the church contains some stunning wall paintings - good place to spend some time
worth the trip to the top. Take the elevator to a great viewpoint in the city, well woth the money and beats walking . Also the interior is amazing.
Well worth a visit. This wonderful building is well worth a visit and when you do go in make sure you have time to take a seat and soak up the silence and the atmosphere.

european vacation. the beauty and the vastness of the building was something to behold. the inside of the basilica is breathtaking. the reverence felt inside is unbelievable. it is hard to imagine the work that went into the creation inside of the building and being preserved for this many years

Fantastic- get up the dome for a view and a half. Good value, great flavour, even if you not big on churches dome great windows n colour with the sun behind is stunning.get up the dome though- blooming great view.looks great at night lit up, nothing to dislike about the visit.
St. Stephen's Basilica. Just beautiful! Take your time. They have concerts there. This summer they have organ concerts on Mondays. The stained glass is beautiful. Well worth your visit.

Go at night. Just for context, my wife and I are in our early 30s and are somewhat well-traveled.
European cities do a great job of lighting stuff up all pretty at night. Budapest does this with the chain bridge as well as St. Stephen's. Very pretty.
wow. the paintings and the size of it is just aweinspiring, although i couldnt get a good view of the hand of st stephen which is why it got knocked down a star

Holy wonderful.. There is a suggested donation of 200 florint, which is about $1, to be used for reconstruction. The stained glass and statuary are superior. You can pray, light candles, take pictures, view St. Stephen's Holy Right Hand (sounds gristly, but you can't see much in the glass case). I highly recommend paying an additional 500 florint ($2 or so) and take the 2 elevators up to the top of the towers for a unique perspective on the town.Of particular note is the ceiling and basilica aspects of this church, which still celebrates Mass.Lit a candle, said a prayer. Loved this church.

Well worth a visit. We read the reports of rude and unhelpful staff and were thinking twice about going. However we did and really glad we did. I am not religious but can appreciate the skill and effort that has gone into the building. I do not begrudge donating 200HUF to its upkeep, although I can understand if you just wanted to pray it might be a little offensive ... however somebody has to pay for the upkeep. So go and see for yourself, I am sure you will not be disappointed.

Beautiful Church and only 100 years old!. This church has an interesting layout and feel, as well as some beautiful sculptures and painting in the domes. They have two sections: one for the prayerful pilgrims and one for the us, the great hordes of tourists (but they are nice about it). If you want to take time to sit and contemplate without being too touristy and taking photos, it's worth it to sit quietly near the front to think about things, to see the sculpture of St. Stephen.Once you are done contemplating, head back to the tourist section to take your photos, and to see the reliquiary, if you are into that sort of thing. I liked being in there as a respite from the touristing cares of the day--but soon we were back out onto the streets and sightseeing again.
Breathtakingly beautiful. A gorgeous basilica. Beautifully painted. Visit the cupola, the catacombs, the museum all in one place.

Stunning and overwhelming.. Make sure you cover up your shoulders and knees in here kids, otherwise you may have to find yourself a map and make a poncho. The basilica is equally as amazing from the outside and the in. I don't feel like I've been to Budapest unless I've at least had a gelato on the steps.

Quite Beautiful. As you approach St. Stephen's you have a chance to see just how massive this basilica is. Great opportunities for photos as you approach and very beautiful on the inside. You can climb to the top for a breathtaking view of the city.
Great view. Wonderful area many restaurants offer great choice of menu and views are wonderful too the area is very clean and the buildings are so beautiful

Beautiful from many angles. There are many facets that make this church remarkable. Firstly, the square itself, which is pretty in its own right. Then the Church and the dominance that the church plays on the area, is quite overwhelming-spending some time viewing from a distance is also advisable. The interior is the next that is quite striking. Not over the top opulence, but enough to tell you that the Catholics had, and still have, a bit of money to throw around. Next, the view from the dome itself. It affords a panorama over the City, and gives you a good grounding of the surrounds near and far. Visit and be enthralled.

Top 5 Exhibit. This is one reason for being in Budapest - the wonderful Basilica in the heart of Pest. If you like beautifully decorated cathedrals, ancient churches and must-do religious houses - this is one for the weekend/week/fortnight holiday in Budapest. A top 5 attraction surely.

Well worth your time, inside & out - especially the open-air views from the rim of the dome!. My wife & I visited the Basilica the morning of Monday 5/12. Along with Matthias Church & the Great Synagogue, these three places of worship have iconic, awe-inspiring architecture with stunning interiors & remarkable artwork.The Basilica's interior is one that strikes a serene balance between awe & reverence. The lighting is muted with brighter accenting for the paintings & alters. Be sure to walk around the church & read the fascinating [English] descriptions of King Stephen's adoration of the Mother Mary, his aggressive promotion of Christianity, & his subsequent sainthood by proclamation.I also strongly recommend that you either climb up to the outdoor rim of the dome or - for a small contribution - take a sequence of two tiny elevators almost to the top. You can then walk around the entire dome with spectacular views of Budapest in all directions. Memorable!

Nice cathedral. is a Roman Catholic basilica in Budapest, named in honour of Stephen, the first King of Hungary.The architectural style is Neo-Classical and the façade is anchored by two large bell towers. The bell weighs over 9 tonnes Nice view from the dome and this can accessed by elevators or by climbing 364 stairs

Budapest Landmark. Although beautiful in its own right, both inside and out, the best part of this attraction was the surrounding square. The location is very popular and surrounded by restaurants, wine bars and walking distance to many attractions.

Panoramic view from the roof. The basilica is very OTT inside, lots of marble and ornamentation. However it is worth paying the 500 forints to access the roof - actually a narrow walkway around the dome. There is a superb 360 degree panorama of the city below and the roofspace itself is also interesting with a few artworks. There's a lift but you also need to climb some narrow stairs between the inner and outer dome to get outside.

Outstandingly beautiful. You have to visit the basilica if you go to Budapest, the sheer size and grandness of it all is truly something special. We went to see St. Stephen's hand in the chapel at the back of the basilica and because somebody took a photo with flash on, despite the signs and warnings being everywhere, the display lights were turned off - as a sort of punishment? So it was hard to see anything after that. The overall level of detail and craftmanship was outstanding.

Underwhelming. The reviews suggest it is the greatest thing ever. Prague castle had a far more impressive cathedral and they barely let you go inside this one. We were told donation was considered compulsory but afterwards saw many people not paying. Disappointed.

Serene and Stunning. The inside of this Basilica is very much worth visiting. It provides some lovely photos and some reflection - be aware - getting to the top costs money however is well worth it. Just please, unless you're a fitness addict and not scared of moving metal stairs and platforms, take the lift! :D

A small donation is requested. As cathedrals go this is relatively modern being completed less than 200 years ago but it has many traditional features and it is very well maintained. Unlike many other sites within the city there isn't an entry fee as such, just a polite request for a donation of 1€. In the rear chapel is some St Stephen reliquary said to be his hand. It is easy to get quite close to this to see the mummified hand in the gold and glass cabinet .
TO SEE. It inspires great devoution. Very large and a great place of art. Great mosaics. May Saint Steven protect Hungary.

Absolutely Don't Miss. I've been to the Vatican and have seen many churches throughout Europe and I believe this is the most beautiful church I've ever seen, simply breathtaking! No admission fee, but donations accepted.

Definetely worth to see. With her majesty, this churck rules upon the nice and central square where it has been built. You definetely have to get into, I am in love with churches from all over the world and I found it simply amazing!

Imposing interior, worth a visit. This basilica is the biggest church in Budapest.
It has a very imposing and ornate interior, with many golden decorations, beautiful mozaics and stained glass windows.
It's certainly worth a visit.
Please note that the crypt with the relic of Saint Istvans right arm closes at 5pm.
Wow. Just wow. . This place took my breath away. It was stunning from start to finish. Definitely pay the extra to go up to the top, the views of Budapest are fantastic.

A True Treasure. What a magnificent cathedral! Without a doubt, one of the most beautiful places of worship I have ever visited. The cathedral is resplendent with icons, paintings, gold leaf and stunning lighting - all designed to glorify God. Don't miss this Budapest treasure.

A happening place. We took a Segway tour of the city and stopped by St. Stephens. People were spontaneously dancing outside. The square was filled with people. The basilica is a very beautiful building.
typical basilica, interesting history. Worth seeing with a walking tour to get history. And if you're walking around the city center you can't miss it.

Peaceful. This church is the largest in Budapest and was named in honor of Stephen, the first King of Hungary. Construction took 50 years and it was completed in 1904 in the Neo- Renaissance style. It holds 800 worship worshippers and it' s interior is laid out in a Greek cross. The acoustics in the church are quite good and concerts art held there. The church is beautiful both inside and out.

Beautiful Church, bad policy. Did not like having to pay to enter a church even if it was a "donation". They have a guard who makes sure you pay. This isn't really kosher. It is quite beautiful though and worth a visit.

incredible decorative ceiling. The Basilica is resplendent with the most ornate ceiling I have seen in a long time. We got in for free and just spent half an hour gazing at the beautiful frescoes and artwork on display.

Simply stunning.. One of the best European cathedrals I have visited.Both day and night it is stunning inside and outside.They had concerts here most evening and we spent the majority of our time in Budapest surrounding the basilica. You can pay a small fee to climb up the tower of the Basilica and the views are very very impressive! There is also a lift to get halfway to the top.We also paid the fee to go to the museum in the basilica, but didn't really find that worthwhile.Loved this church!
Gorgeous!. The inside of this cathedral is stunning, and when lit up at night is truly picturesque. It is easy to access from the walking areas.
serene. The most interesting and beautiful building. Can take pics and take your time walking round as there's so much to learn.

Absolutely beautiful. The interior of this Basilica is gorgeous. Don't miss it. They are replacing the cobble stones of the street in front of the basilica but they are moving fast and it will be finished soon.

A beautiful cathedral to visit and an excellent place to hear an organ recital.. This basilica has an ancient history and is an example of beautiful architecture, but in addition we attended one of the organ recitals offered, including a soprano singing Ave Maria and other selections. Recommend a visit here.

Views from St. Stephen's Bascilla. We visited the Bascilla inside and took the Sent some more pics to your Gmail Account. Good day here. Hope the girls have fun at recital tonight! It is midnight here! to the top for outstanding views. I think there was a small fee to go to top but definetely worth it.
Nice and impossible to miss. Its in a very central location, so you'll see it quite a few times walking around the city. Which is ok because it looks nice.

Stunning Cathedral. This church looks beautiful from the outside but the interior is even better.The dome and alter are stunning with all the gold leaf.You can go up stairs or take the elevators to see it close up.We visited twice as the first time was Sunday mass and access to visitors is restricted, but it did give you a true feeling of the building.It is also lit up at night which really highlights its architecture.The surrounding area around the square has cafes so you can take a drink whilst taking in the view.It is free to enter but most people give a donation

Pest main church. Situated in the heart of the Pest part of town this is I think the tallest structure in Budapest.Although beautiful from outside with it's Baroque facade, it is nothing compared to the inside marvelous decorations, very richly ornamented. Buy a ticket to visit the top, the views are great from above. Take the elevator to avoid steps (the price is the same!!).

Beautiful. This basilica is so beautiful and very different from many European churches. It is richly decorated with beautiful dark marble. We happened to visit during Mass. The organ music was breathtaking.

Christmas market of the basilica. We walked towards the basilica following a brightly lit street. At the end we found a Christmas time market and a skating ring just outside the basilica itself. There was all sorts of live entertainment and treats, like mulled wine. The whole scene was truly picturesque. The highlight of our visit to the square was the show featuring projected images on the basilica wall with some music.

Beautiful inside. Absolutely Massive Cathedral. You really can't miss it. Inside they ask for a donation to enter, but it is completely voluntary. To get to the top you can pay a small amount to climb the stairs, or take the elevator. Its about the same cost. Views from the top are gorgeous.

A beautiful building with a great view of the city.. Worth a visit on the Buda side of the river to see the Basilica as it over looks Pest and the Danube. Lovely street bars and cafe's en route with some of the local craft shops.
Stunning. Spellbound by the beauty and architecture and the sheer size of this beautiful basilica. Must visit.

Horrible chairs. The basilica itself is lovely. It's worth shelling out a bit of money for the elevators to the top of the dome. Walking around the circumference of the dome gives some great views of the city. We chose to go to a concert one evening of Purcell music. Gorgeous music in a perfect setting was ruined because of the horrible little chairs we had to sit on. After 90 minutes we had to stand up and listen to the rest of the concert at the entrance to the church. We just couldn't take any more. Those seats made economy airplane seats seem like Lazy Boy recliners! If you go to a concert be prepared to suffer...or bring a pillow!

Great Church. Unlike a lot of city churches, St Istvan's can actually be seen quite well from the street! It's a very imposing building, both inside and out, and well worth a visit. The walk around the dome gives fantastic views of the city, and has a handy elevator system for those who don't fancy the stairs! The treasury down below is also worth a visit, and if you are into architecture or ecclesiastical history I'd advise spending some time in the Basilica searching out all the nooks and crannies. Make sure you don't miss the mummified hand of St Istvan himself in the side chapel. My wife and I returned to the Basilica in the evening for a concert, which featured some very good musicians and a rather good soprano. We had to pay extra for this, but apparently the profit goes towards the upkeep of the Basilica, and the music was good.

Beautiful & grand. One of the most important church, St Stephen's Basilica is a prominent tourist destination. The chuch. The church is beautiful & grand from onsite with beautiful architecture. Many a times, there are concerts happening inside as well.The square in front is always lively with many restaurants and tourists roaming around.The church must also be seen in the nigth as it is all lit up and looks wonderful.
take some time there. the church is great but you really need time to explore it. We didn't have it. You don't pay for the entrance but everybody leaves some coins for renovations.

Beautiful but not extraordinary. This is a beautiful church with all the ornate and amazing religious art you would anticipate but if you have been to Rome it is not in the same league.....the building is actually best admired I think from a distance with the beautiful domes as an iconic part of the cities skyline.

A very beautiful Basilica. We had the good fortunate to be in Budapest on one of the nights the Basilica hosted an organ concert. This Basilica has one of the largest pipe organs in the world. We had the pleasure of hearing it masterfully played. I am not so much of a concert person but it was an experience one will never forget. If you have interest in this, I suggest you get on-line to see if a concert is available while you are in Budapest and buy your tickets prior to your visit. The recital is in the evening after the Basilica is closed to the public. Seeing the Basilica is wonderful in itself, but seeing it and having the opportunity to hear this magnificent organ makes the visit unforgettable.
stunning. went on a visit here and couldnt believe how stunning the church was, very ornate and as you would expect peaceful inside and well worth going to see

Magnificent! Improved only by attending a concert here.. This building duly demonstrates the difference between a cathedral and a basilica. By day, the energy is high and, unfortunately, is less than fully appreciated because of the very high number of visitors. By evening, when attending the concert, the magnificence could be truly absorbed. The concert, featuring organ, violin, trumpet, soprano and tenor and of predictable programme was excellent and moving. To appreciate the tenor's voice bouncing back from the lower sections of the dome was awesome. Wonderful experience with programmes so different from Vienna and Prague which featured in my tour. The concert completed my tour experience.

You have to visit if you're in Budapest.. It's beautiful from the outside, and lavish inside. There is lots to see, including a shrine for St Stephen's hand - which lights up when you put money in. There was also a little exhibition upstairs.
Nice Baroque church. It is not the best Baroqu Church in the world, but very nice. The shape isquite unusual. Worth to see in any acse.

Mass. We wre very fortunate that Mass was being celebrated whilst we were in the Basilica. It was packed and a lively service even if we could not understand it we knew what was going on. The Basilica is really beautiful and you must pop in to see it when in Budapest.

Inaccessible basilica. There was no disabled access to this beautiful building. it was only possible to enter it up a number of steps!! There were other doors which were all locked, with no one available or prepared to unlock them!!
Magnificent. Well worth the visit. No charge but donations appreciated. Make the effort and go to the outside top of the dome. The views are superb.

Nice to visit!. After walking around the city centre it was a very pleasant, peaceful and cool interlude, just to sit and absorb the peace and atmosphere in the church was lovely. Well worth the small entry donation and if you are shattered at that stage of your day as I was the fee for the lift to the top of the dome is a very small price to pay for the excellent views of the city below.

Gorgeous.. We attended a church service, but had to find a Friar who spoke English to tell us the time. Catholic service was entirely in Hungarian, but very pleased that we went. Allow some time to see the statuary and architecture.

Exceptional architecture, art, and history.. The Basilica is an amazing structure that dominates the skyline from several vantage points. It sits at one end of a large square. Truly a must-see. And a cool place to duck in on a hot summer day. The cyrpts below entomb many famous Hungarians - but getting in to see them might be difficult. Fortunately, we had hired a local guide, Andrea Takacs (takand1010@gmail.com) who was able to ask for special permission. With or without a guide, wander around the church admiting its beauty. And the gelato place... just off the square to the left - is amazing.

Magical night in December. I saw St. Stephen's Basilica in December at night with the Christmas market in the foreground with the Basilica all lit up. The laser light show started and loved it. It was magical and a great experience.

Lovely Church - Great City Views. This was a lovely church with interesting architecture. At the time we went, there was a youth concert of musicians and vocalists. You can also pay a nominal fee to go to the top tower where you will see spectacular view of Buda.

Outside good, inside disappointing. Too ostentatious, dripping with gold and red marble a reflection of the riches of religion. Made me feel very uncomfortable. Did not climb the tower. The external parts are very good architecture and nice photos.

Skip the Hand. In a separate door of the church you can enter to see the supposed mummified hand of St. Stephen. We went out of curiosity to see the setup as I had read about the fee. As we entered, someone had just put in a coin so that a light came on, and one could see the hand. Don't fall for this one. It is another money grab. You can barely see it as it is kept up high enough in a glass box with lots of interference to continue to deceive. Typical, just typical. I gave a "very good," because the church itself is just nice to see.

Nice church!. Went to the tower first, amazing view of the wonderful city of Budapest. Totally worth all the steps (and there's an elevator if you want to skip them :) ). Had a walk inside afterwards, and it's stunning. Very beautiful, and peaceful.If you have the chance to visit, you should :)
Pretty and great location. Make sure you buy a ticket to go up and see the dome that is inside a dome and also see the beautiful views of Budapest from the outside balcony.

Beautiful inside and out!. This is a stunning church with wonderful architecture and impressive interior, spacious and sublime. Take between 90 minutes and 2 hours to do justice to the lovely chapels and the many photogenic features. The interior of the great dome is very special.

Fabulous panoramic view. Visited on a Sunday during service but at the rear there was a loud speaker so you hear the service and choir. Really stunning interior, on the plus side there is a lift to take you up to the walkway round the Basilica for a small fee. Well worth a visit.
It's worth the fee. If you are into great architecture and very old cathedrals, etc. this one will not disappoint you.You are allowed to take photos and videos inside and out.

Spectacular Basilica. St Stephen's Basilica is well worth a visit - the interior is beautiful and the views from the top section are very good. There was a wedding taking place when we visited - an amazing place to have a wedding! There are often evening concerts in the Basilica, but it your visit doesn't coincide with an opportunity to go to one of these, a fabulous CD of one of the concerts is available for purchase - it will bring back lots of memories of your time in Budapest.
Amazing church. I visited the cathedral at a sunday morning and the sunday mass was taking place. the cathedral has a amazing architecture. One of the nicest cathedrals I have ever visited.
Great Inside. Architecture and design of the inside. Great accoustics too. Saw a organ concert in the evening. Enchanting.

Stunning. I love churches and castles. This is a must see when in Budapest. Absolutely stunning. The artwork on the ceiling is amazing. We spent a couple hours here. Free admision. A small fee to go to the top and see amazing views of Budapest.
wonderful Holiday. Beautiful old building well worth seeing. our guide was very knowing,and described the building very well

If you go, go up to the dome. The church was very beautiful but the really special memory for me is going up to the dome. I was amazed when there was no queue and perhaps 3 other people up there. It was a wonderful view to the square below and the rooftops of the city. They even have 2 lifts to get you most of the way up.

Why would you charge to enter?. Besides the fact that they charge people to enter a church I found it worth the money. It's full of history. Beautiful structure at a very central location. The management should really reconsider the payment process they've got on place as it questions people's motives while entering a religious establishment.

Beautiful - inside and outside!. Outside it's powerful, inside it's beautiful! The marble is breathtaking. I was there twice - first I looked it outside because there was a wedding, another day I went there to see it inside - there are some things you can see if you pay for it, put without fee you can see most part of the bazilica.

Concert on Tuesday night at 8pm. It is an outstanding feeling to listen to a concert at the Basilica. The program had 8 musical performance: organ, violin, trumpet, tenor and a soprano. There were individual and duets. We were not familiar with all the pieces, however it didn't matter. Noted pieces were Ave Maria and Halleluiah. This is our first concert in a church, no comparison at all to a concert hall. The acoustics combined with the beauty of the Basilica is on experience we will always remember. Don't be tempted to purchase the more expensive tickets. We bought the lowest priced tickets. Get there when the doors open at 7:30. Sit and enjoy the place until the concert starts. Amazing!!!
Can't believe they charge to go into a church. This is a beautiful church, but you won't see it unless you are willing to pay an entry fee of 1 euro. Not a lot of money, but it's the principle.
Stunning religous building. A large building beautifully decorated in typical catholic style.It is set in a large open space that displays its magnificence well.

Beautiful organ concert. I visited this beautiful church during the day and discovered that evening (Friday) they had an organ concert. I bought a ticket and returned later that night at 8pm. The program featured the Great Organ and a smaller one which I think were being played by a father and son, a trumpeter and a mezzo-soprano. The sound soared through the magnificent high ceilings of the basilica. The ticket cost 26 euros and the concerts are held on most Fridays from 4 April to 2 January. Tickets are available online or at the Basilica on Thursdays and Fridays.
Spectacular. St Stephen's is a most see place. It is absolutely magnificent inside and you can walk around the top of the dome
Well worth a visit. Beautiful, must-see site in Budapest, even if it does have a scary petrified hand of Saint Stephen. Very central and lots of interesting places nearby.
Very beautiful. Impressive construction, but inside there's not much to see. Outside is huge and a very beautiful temple.

Climb to the top, The View, Wow. Do not miss this Church it's worth the walk and by all means take the climb to the top the view of the city and the picture taking is excellent. the church bells or wonderful, A great little café on the corner looking at the church is a nice please to rest and take in the sights.
St. Stephen's Basilica. St. Stephen's Basilica is magnificent church. In some way the interior reminds me of St. Peter's Basilica in Vatican. The panorama from it's dome is fantastic.

Big but not that great. I don't know why this is such a top tourist site, unless it is for the importance that St. Stephen had in Hungarian history. The church is big and somewhat impressive, but I far prefer St. Mattias church. The amount of detail and decorations are overwhelming - and the stained glass windows are underwhelming.

Another wonderful church with its own character. This is a truly magnificent church as are many in Europe, but to avoid crowds go early or after lunch. It seems that tour groups mostly arrive in mid morning and overwhelm the space in and around the Basilica. Photos permitted and worthwhile.

Go in the afternoon. Go later in the day after the Cruise ships have finsihed packing the place. It will never be empty, but far more enjoyable later as the cruise ships all come at once. At a somewhat quieter time you can much better enjoy this magnificent church. Photos allowed and essential.
Breathtaking!. Such a beautiful church.So much detail I would highly recommend a visit. Didn't have time to go up to the dome...I wish we had!

Beautifull church and go up for the views!. A true masterpiece in Budapest. What a church with so much details and quality. Don't forget to go up the church also (staires!) But after the time and effort getting up there, the views are 360 around just excellent!! A must visit I would say!!
beautiful Cathedral. as most of the cathedrals beautiful ceilings. the square in front if also very impressive with nice marble tiles and patterns.

Beautiful and stunning. The church is one of the most famous and that is why I could see that it was crowded all along nevertheless the place is absolutely breathtaking both from its exteriors and interiors as well. The interiors have some of the most fascinating works I have ever seen. The place is also near to some amazing restaurants and shops so your visit to the place won’t be a total loss.
In the center. It’s in the center of Budapest so it’s really difficult to be missed. I didn’t been on the top but apparently its worth to see. Inside its really amazing. It’s huge. Go and see
Vist during Lent. One of the most beautiful cathedral I have ever seen. Very close to the underground station. They have a evening orchestra performed in the cathedral.

Climb to the top, its worth the hike. The only downside to this attraction was that on Saturday, when we visited, there seems to be a conveyor belt of weddings, so you can only do the dome and the side chapel and will not get to visit the tomb of Puskas
Not to be missed!. Dating back to 1851, this beautiful church is worth taking the time to visit, serene and beautiful and not off the beaten track!

Wonderful church w/ amazing interior.. We visited this church while a day trip in Budapest from Vienna. I could understand why this building has been voted as the most pictured by many of the travelers. The interior was really amazing especially with the sunrays came through the glass windows. I could stay there for long wondering the beauty and the history behind. It is a must see in Budapest, don't just stare it from the outside but go inside...

Hilton Budapest City. What a magnificent treat - a not to be missed addition to your trip to the castle district. Exterior is stunning but the interior is even more so with some hidden secrets you have to go in to see

Place to be!. St. Stephen's is not only a beautiful cathedral, but a gathering point! Crowds gather every day and sit on the steps and enjoy the local and visitor traffic. Great coffee houses and ice cream parlors in the area. Walk on down the street and get a glass of wine or a great meal. If possible, take in a concert. I did and do not regret it. I felt the concert price was a great value. Arrive early and if you have a back problem sit in a lawn chair on the inside rather than a bench.

St. Stephens Basilica. Up on castle hill must visit this church. You can walk around the area and visit shops, walk the ramparts including Fisherman's Bastion, see views of Pest and Buda, the chain bridge, Margrit Island, etc.

Concert Music Masterpiece!. So, if you like crowds, go see this first thing in the morning. However, if you are normal may I suggest waiting until mid afternoon? The bus crowds have left and just a few tourists mingle inside. Having been to other parts of Europe, this Basilica does have a place in 'top 10' and has an abundance of natural light for some very nice pics. Not sure I believe the story of the right hand of st. Stephen...but you be the judge.The real ambience is admiring the facade as the sun goes down. Grab a cold beverage and sit on the steps and watch the people go by, the bells ring and generally relax a little. We stayed here for a month and many fond memories of evenings like this exist. Tip: if you want to eat while you view this icon, try the belvarosi lugas restaurant in the back of the church across the street. Real hungarian fare here. Mondays and Fridays you can hear concert pieces play inside on the smooth organ! It will cost but the sounds resonate through your body. Enjoy! If you have a telescopic lens on your camera, head up the tower for some views...if not, skip it...your wasting your time.

Splendid Architectures and Beautiful Inside. The St. Stephen's Basilica is a wonderful site situated at the center of Budapest surrounded by beautiful square and scenes adding to this glorious and magnificent Church.The architecture is very impressive to commensurate with this most important historical religious place.Every corner inside the Basilica is beautifully designed in great harmony; the paintings, sculptures, stained glass windows, columns, the handmade covers, the organ, and above all the most beautifully painted and engraved Dome; the Photos can only show a fraction of this sensational place; it is a must visit.

The Beauty of its Own". Is not the most beautiful Basilica in Europe but of course every basilica have its own unique characters. Sitting down and enjoy the stunning decorations its a relaxing things to do.

My Happy Place. I lived in Budapest for three months, and I couldn't count how many times I sat out front of the Basilica, licking an ice cream cone or sipping a glass of wine from Di Vino, contemplating life. Such a beautiful building just to gaze at.

Amazing and Impressive. The building itself is seriously impressive but a visit to the inside is even more stunning.Everywhere you look there are ornate decorations, wall paintings, altars, chapels, gold gilding and sculpted stonework.I would, however, suggest visiting an evening concert in the basilica, as the lighting really brings the detailing and decor to life and, together with the organ music, addd significantly to the whole experience.

Maginificent Building, Spectacular View. This is a must see. The sheer magnitude of the building, coupled with the incredible architecture and carvings/engravings on the outside make it worth just strolling around and enjoying. We went in to the church and the atmospehere took our breath away. Neither of us are religious, but we greatly appreciated teh beauty, history, and love that the entire place exuded. Every statue, painting, mural, window, engraving is remarkable. There was an organist playing while we were there which added to the beuaty of the place. It was all very reverent.We decided to pay the 200HUF (~$1) to climb to the top. There is also an elevator available for those that choose not to take the stairs. I lost count of how many we climbed, but it just kept going. The next day my calves were even a bit sore, but it was all very worth it. The panoramic scene that is set out before you as you walk around the dome at the very top is spectacular. This is not to be missed.

Very impressive. This was a particularly beautiful and peaceful place to visit and there was no obligation to pay an enormous enty fee (which there was at the Synagogue). The stained glass windows, the dome, the altar - all of it was amazing. The hand was interesting and, if you stand and wait for a moment or two, someone is bound to pay to light it up for all the other tourists! Wouldn't have missed this sight.
Beautiful. The Basilica is beautiful inside and out, it's lit up during the night and a lot of wine bars and nightlife is right outside of the Basilica Square.

Very ornate.. This is the main church in Budapest. Outside is a very large square with steps leading into the basilica. Inside is very ornate with lots of gold leaf. Mosaics and paintings adorn the walls. A
Behind the main altar is a chapel containing the right hand of St Stephen.

What a view of Budapest. The cathedral is truly a work of art. The main chamber is gilded and awe-inspiring...with the stained glass dome and windows, statuary, fonts and lovely interior overall. Plus, the spectacular view from the top of the Basilica is a panorama worth viewing. If you are not up for the 302 steps, there is an elevator to take you up. Some nice artwork is available along the way (mind your step around the edge under the arches) to the last few steps that remain to the viewing walkway around the dome.

Go to the concert. Went to the evening concert here which was very good. To see it at night gave it a different feel. The outside is beautiful and if you ever get lost in Budapest, look for this building, it is like a beacon.

Grand and beautiful. Definitely recommend. For a small donation it's great to have a look around the Basilica. A massive and impressive structure and interior. A group of young americans were singing a the time. Great singing and amazing acoustics, was really nice to hear. Also well worth paying 500 Hungarian to go to the top of the Basilica. Amazing views and a good bit of excersise... ..or there's a lift most of the way.

magnificent cathedral. Went to Mass in this magnificent 20th century church,gleaming with gilt and marble.Lovely music and singing.Worth a trip up to the dome for the incredible view--don't forget to visit the relic chapel to see the Holy Right Hand of St Stephen,the symbol of Hungarian nationality.

Beautiful experience. This was one of our best experiences in Budapest. The Basilica itself was beautiful, but the experience was even better. After a few days of experiencing Budapest and the less positive aspects to traveling here, we thought our visit to St Stephen's was representative of our trip to Hungary. Getting our children ready for Mass, getting to the Keleti station in time only to find out that the train was not running that day-we took the city bus which wasn't going to our destination. One of the locals we met on the train got off with us and made sure we made it to church, on time. This person walked about a mile out of his way to make sure we were on the right path, right up to the church itself. I was very unimpressed with the local "help staff" that couldn't care less about tourists, but this random citizen went way above and beyond to help a few tourists. This man's generosity and kindness made us realize how beautiful Budapest could be, and we carried this sentiment into the Basilica. The organized help staff was anything but helpful or organized, but the average person on the street made it wonderful. I thought this was one of the most beautiful churches I've seen in Europe, but my daughters thought the amputated hand of St Steven added extra awesome-ness.

Excellent view. The view on top of the basilica is excellent. It is worth a visit if the weather is clear. Also it is beter to take the elevator otherwise you would need lots of water when you get on top!!
Beautiful Place. A wonderful place to visit, very historic and well kept. Try to get a tour guide to learn the history of the place, but highly recommend a visit here.
Beautiful, but not as nice as some you will see.. As European churches go St. Istvan's was about average. Certainly there are more impressive ! It was nice but I wouldn't go out of my way to see it.

A gem in the heart of Budapest. Entering the Basilica, you instantly realise that you are in a special place, and I felt privileged to be able to sit quietly for a while, and take in the majesty of the building. This doesn't come without some distractions however, as it is a very popular tourist spot, and some people aren't always as considerate as others.We loved the building so much that we decided to return for one of the evening classical concerts. This again was a wonderful experience, seeing the Basilica by night, beautifully lit. The musicians weren't necessarily the best I've ever heard, but it was still an enjoyable concert in a magnificent setting.Really wish we had made the trip to the top. Maybe next time.

A must see.... Beautiful Church with staggering size in the centre of Budapest. You can walk up to the top where you get an amazing view of the city... Nice restaurants and wine bars around...a good place to spend the evening as well.
Budapest cathedral. Superb cathedral, free entry, photographs freely allowed, worth the few pence to go to the top of the building.

Nice view over the city. If you have the condition to climb many, many stairs and you're willing to pay a couple of euros, the basilica offers a great view over the city.
The Basilica itself has no fee. It's impressive and interesting but the hand of Szt. Istvan is... well, see for yourself. Let's just say we expected something else. ;)

There is a Dead Hand in this building!!. So the basilica is as you would expect - lavish and golden with Saints and statues and everything the era and region promise from their cathedrals. Why this one is supposed to be special is that they have for some thousand years given home to a relic - the Right Hand of a holy saint. People this means they have a HAND ON DISPLAY! A Mumified, decayed, creepy dead hand. I'm sure to Catholics this is a holy sanctified item worth praying to, but if you are simply wandering through to admire the building respectfully note you're going to stumble onto a mummified hand and a big photo board on how its been restored (SKIN AND FINGERNAILS AND ALL!!!) and its really something you can't unsee!! I mean no disrespect, I was just so creeped out it warranted mention to the unexpecting of you!

Landmark in Budapest. Budapest main sightseing points are relatively close and when we were in doubt which side to go we always looked for the top of the church to locate ourselves. Also when we were at Buda side the towers are a landmark. The Church is a peaceful place and it is suggested a donation of 200 forints or 1€.

Beautiful. The inside of the Basilica is stunning, gold every where, it is a bit of a contrast with much of the city in its run down state. There are organ recitals but unfortunately we were not there at the right time, you can also, for a fee, climb the dome. We had already walked our legs off and just couldn't make it, never mind maybe next time

Beautiful inside and out.. A beautiful Basilica in the heart of Budapest. Its dome can be seen all over Budapest. Sits in the heart of a busy shopping district and benefits from Free entry. Well worth visiting.

Splendid!. Another fabulous building which has a lovely pedestrian street leading up to it from the river. There was a concert on when we visited so couldn't go inside, but it's fairly central so could have returned to look round.

Such a beautiful church!. It doesn't cost much to get in, a donation of around 1 EUR per person. The church is absolutely beautiful and worth a visit. You can pay a little bit extra and walk to the top which gives you a lovely view over the city. I would recommend going up!

Church. The biggest church in town. one of the best landmarks in the city of Budapest, is right at the city center ,with very nice area around the church, you can walk there and in front of the church thare is a beauyiful plaza with nice cafes and restaurants

Nice attraction. It's not the Vatican but it's well worth a visit. We went to the opera and it was brilliant. If your thinking of paying to go in during the day pay to see the opera or event and do the two at the same time
organ recital at 7.pm. waiting in queue from 6.35pm with pre-booked tickets, seating areas not defined and few staff to control crowding eventual start at 7.15pm

Sensational. This is one of the most beautiful churches I have ever visited, and I have travelled quite a lot. A quiet calm resides inside and you feel such atmosphere walking around. We took the lift to the dome and wow it was fab. A great photo opportunity here over all of Budapest. Take your time and soak up it lovely ambience another must see.

Pay the extra to go to the top. This is a must see if in Budapest. Entry is free to the Basilica (donation accepted) but pay the small fee to get to the top as you will be able to get some great photos of Budapest. It is the highest point in the city and is great for a birds eye view of this wonderful city.

Astonishing architecture and an amazing piece of history. St. Stephen's Basilica is just simply an awe inspiring place! The architecture is just phenomenal! Centrally located and easy to get to. To enter it costs only a donation of 200 HUF and then you can walk throughout the church (minus the cupola). You can walk around inside and out and it would take probably a good two hours to take everything in (stained glass, the organ, paintings/murals, statues, engravings, etc...). There were not too many tour groups when we were there and I was able to take a moment to reflect in silence without a problem. It is pretty amazing to be able to take a look at the Holy Right Hand of St. Stephen. He was one of, if not the most, influential person in Hungary's history. This is a must see!

Lovely. This Basilica was amazing! It is open between 9 am to 7 pm, but you should get there by 6:30 pm to walk around. The entrance fee is by donation, they recommend 200 Forints per person. For those who don't tour Basilicas, there is a strict dress code which is simple to follow. Everyone needs to cover their shoulders, and wear trousers or skirts to your knee or just before. There is a sign at the entrance warning people of this, yet individuals, with little respect, continued to view the inside. This makes it awkward the staff as they have to ask you to leave. The individuals who viewed whilst we were there, weren't asked to leave, but I have seen this at Basilicas in Rome. Most women used scarves, which are cheap to buy (1500 Forints at most Souvenir stores), to cover their shoulders. If you are planning to visit this Basilica or others be prepared to dress appropriately. I am not very religious, however it really irritates me when tourists don't respect the city customs they are visiting. If you don't like it, don't visit the Basilica!

Extremely nice cathedral, noisy tourguides. The Basilica is centrally located, definitely worth visiting - much nicer from the inside, with sunny skies extremely impressive. Just cover your ears to cut yourself off the voice of the tourguides, who don't respect the repeated signs of silence requested. The Budapest tourguides are totally disrespectful of the church and pease sought inside.
Another jewel of Hungary. This church is where the first king of Hungary was crowned. There is so much history here for the person whom enjoys learning

Worth seeing. We went here early in the morning. It was free to get in and we chose to pay 200HUFs for the relic of St Stephen to be illuminated. It is a majestic building and well worth a visit - you must decide if it reflects your view of religion or not.

Breathtaking. The Basilica was beautiful, and we were lucky enough to be there while there was a choir rehearsing, which was lovely. There were signs around asking for visits to be silent, so I found it frustrating that there was a tour guide (not from the Basilica) talking the whole time!

Breathtaking. The Basilica was beautiful, and we were lucky enough to be there while there was a choir rehearsing, which was lovely.
There were signs around asking for visits to be silent, so I found it frustrating that there was a tour guide (not from the Basilica) talking the whole time!
Beautiful. Very stunning to look at and worth a visit but it is extremely busy, the square in front as a lot of cafe/bars too. Seems to be the center to everything as well so easy to find.
Good.... Very nice basilica.I like it more from the outside.You should climb to the top,view is really great.And it's not too much expensive...

So good I went twice in one day! . This is a must see site which offers stupendous views and beautiful ornate architecture.
The right hand of St Stephen is also a curiosity worth seeing!
Great facade. Beautiful facade from outside. The inside was a little disappointing as it was dark and very Gothic in style but well worth a visit.

Interesting. Looks impressive from the outside but once you get inside the space looks much smaller because the weight of the dome is borne on massive pillars not the vaulted arches of northern cathedrals, Beautifully decorated.No charge to enter the basilica but there is a charge for the dome which can be access by stair or lift and offers great views across the city.

Another beautiful church. Named after the first king of Hungary, St. Stephen's is the largest church in Budapest. It is beautiful inside and outside. We attended an organ concert which was absolutely fabulous. The music filled our souls and we left wanting more.
St. Stephen's Basilica. Beautiful example of historical architecture. No matter what your beliefs, this is a gorgeous place to visit. Exquisite craftsmanship.

Beautiful Basilica. It is beautiful inside. Lovely stained glass windows, traditional decorations on the high ceilings and ornate little chapels around the edge of the main centre piece. Absolutely stunning from the outside too for photographs.
Impressive outside. Beautiful outside, not so impressive inside and the main attraction was closed due to a service. But at least it was free.

Don't miss the visit at the top on the roof!. The basilica is really amazing inside and it is definitely a "must-do" location in Budapest. Don't think twice about going upstairs to the roof because you will definitely enjoy it. The view from there is just amazing and you can the whole city and all directions.
Loved it!. Beautiful from the inside and outside! Don't forget to cimb to the top (there is a small fee for that, but it's absolutely worth it)!

Beautiful Cathedral. Go early so you do not have to wait in line or fight the crowd to see St. Stephen's relic. We were lucky. We arrived just as that portion was opening for the day. No wait, no crowd. By the time took photos and read the information and were coming out a swarm of tourist were coming in. I thought this was the most beautiful church, even topping the Notre Dame in Paris.

Check out their concert schedule. Of course, the inside of this basilica is so impressive that you'll want to take the time to experience it. And a great way to experience it in a meaningful way is to check out the performance schedule and go when there's a concert. Can't think of a better way to be part of the space but through listening to some wonderful music. And there's lots of space on the stairs and the square in front to just enjoy the exterior view.
Gorgeous inside and from the tower. Go to see the church for it's architecture and decoration - and feelings of grander. It won't disappoint.
Beautiful Church. We went to a Organ recital in the Evening there seemed to be several on offer it was really good and the surroundings made it magical!
A Stunning Interior. Some words of advice... visit this building! For approximately £2 you will be entertained with some of the most beautiful stained glass and blood-red marble you will ever see.

Magnificent. We were lucky enough to attend a concert of classical music in the basilica and were able to look around at the superb carvings wall paintings and stained glass windows. No minimalism here. We also paid to ascend the central dome with great views of the city ,even in the pouring rain.

Stunning. We were lucky in that there was a classical concert being held in the Basillica the night of the day we visited !! So we saw it in all its glory both night and dayBeautiful building with an amazing history and very clean and well maintained, Worth a visit.

Ornate, right by Andrassy St. Do St Stephens Basilica (and see the mummified hand!!), then walk up nearby Andrassy street, stop for something to east just before the Oktagon Junction, then carry on up to Heroes Square and City Park. A fair distance to walk so do it in the morning rather than the afternoon on weary feet!! The Basilica is so grand and the history is very interesting.

Very Beautiful. We went to the top of the Basilica and visited the inside. The fist of Saint Stephen is available for viewing. The view from the top is very nice (there is an elevator, but stairs are still between the elevator and the viewing platform). Pictures are allowed. To go upstair there is a fee, but a donation is all that is asked to visit the Basilica.
impressive. this is an impressive basilica!i recommend going, it wont take much of your time.it is "free" but you aree expected to pay 200 as donation..

Absolutely stunning!. What a wonderful experience - this basilica is absolutely beautiful. I would agree that it is an absolute must to visit. We did not go to the panorama level so cannot comment on this part but the church alone is just wonderful and there is no entrance fee for the church only (although they do ask that you donate a minimum of 1 euro for the upkeep)There are organ recitals held in the church on a regular basis - unfortunately we were not able to attend but I think it would sound amazing as the acoustics would be greatShould definitely be high on your list of places to visit in Budapest!

Jaw dropping. Incredible interior and absolute must to visit. Simply amazing architecture on a grand scale. Visitors following behind all had the same expression on their faces when they entered the great hall. A truly memorable experience.
Beautiful and dramatic.. Quiet enjoyment in a place of opulence. By chance, we attended a church service and the ceremonial pageantry was impressive.

Enormous beauty. Wonderful view from the top, surely worth the trip up. Going to the panorama part will cost you (about €1,65 each).Entrance to the church itself is free of charge, magnificent architecture inside and you are free to take pictures if you like.

Nice in an amazing surrounding. It is situated close to the river but not just next to it. Inside the land, between small streets, on a small square where you can easily admire Basilica, make a photo or eat lunch or dinner, because there are many very good restaurants around (following trip advisor) or grab some coffee or ice cream (TRY GELATO ROSA!!!!!!!!-you will see a huge queue outside).

A Beautiful Cathedral. Churches aren't made like this anymore. It is over the top beautiful. Entrance is free, although we dropped a few coins in the container. Photos are allowed, which surprised me. It is worth a stop.

Gorgeous Inside and Out. We went inside the church for the small donation- well worth it.We also then found out that there would be a violin concert that same evening in the church, right in front of the main alter.We bought tickets and went back in the evening to listen to the concert - it was a fabulous night, and the acoustics are fabulous.Even if you cannot get in to listen to a concert, the Basilica itself is worth a stroll around.

Used to go there several years ago when it used to be good!. Didn't like the fact that they charge you at the door and closed off most of the space for visitors on that day (like the relic room) - Unfriendly door staff and no informtion given to tourists- massive fail!

Beautiful place must see!. Beautiful architecture and design all around.
Definitely one of the more impressive sights in the city and it's free or only 200 huf donation that's really worth it...
Don't miss!

Beautiful church. Enjoyed an organ concert here one Monday eve. Tickets 3,000hft and said it would last an hour, but was actually 45 minutes. Very atmospheric and brought the place to life. Arrive early if you want a good seat.
Beautiful. as a lover of architecture this place is stunning,.the ceilings are so captivating and the detailing everywhere is faultless,.definetly worth taking the time for a look around

Beautiful. Due to a time crunch, I unfortunately did not get to spend very much time in the church. The little time I was able to spend inside was well worth it. When you consider all of the churches in Europe, I have not seen very many, but out of the ones I have seen this was one of the most beautiful. The architecture and artwork are highly impressive and simply gorgeous. Side note: You are expected to pay about 2 euros to get in, but it is not required. I did get to go up to the top of the viewing platform in the tower. Unlike other church towers I've done, taking the elevator up cost the same amount as walking up the stairs (500 HUF). The view from the top is amazing and I highly recommend doing it (be advised that even with taking the elevator, you do have to climb some more stairs to get to the viewing platform). St. Stephen's is definitely a must-see in Budapest.

Beautiful but not my favourite. Enjoyed looking around, a very majestic church, but not my favourite. I much preferred Matthias Church which took my breath away. It is very ornate and despite being busy, peaceful. Worth a visit but if you've only time to visit one, I'd pick the one up in Buda.

Beautiful church, recommend going up the tower. We had a few hours to kill on the last day before our transfer back so we decided to pay the (very cheap) fare to go up the tower for panoramic views of the city. 302 steps up, with a steady break in the middle to catch your breath. (You can get a lift up if you prefer). You get to see all the insides of tower which in a way is more exciting than the views you get from the top (but we are geeks!) Once at the top, a little breezy but the views are fantastic. Definitely worth a visit.

The most valuable 1e we paid. One of the most impressive churches we visited ever. As much as it looks big from the outside, as you enter in, immediately you feel the huge space, you can imagine the way it served people in the past. The rich wood decoration inside of the floor/walls /chairs and the stained glass windows are very impressive!

I recommend going for Organ Concerts there. An Amazing Church, A must visit if in Budapest.The Highlight of our visit is the Organ Concert we attended, where some of the most beautiful Organ music pieces were played and part with s Soprano!, it was breath taking.TIPTickets can be bought at the Church Entrance and Online, but I think at the Church its cheaper.Most recommended.

go up the stairs for a view. How could one rate "average" a cathedral like this in Europe? Just my preference - this is more baroque and I prefer the gothic. It was worth paying to walk up the 300 plus stairs for the view (if a little unnerving). Just a little info - you have to pay for everything in Hungary - entering an historic site, taking pictures, etc. They also do not recognize student status from outside of EU - eventhough in Czech republic and Austria they did.
Must see. Though you can't say much about a church, this in one of the nicest I've seen! the location in so good, it makes it look even bigger as you walk down the street towards it.

marvellous architecture. We have visited a few similar buildings and this one didn't disappoint, the architecture is quite outstanding. They ask for a donation of 200huf to look around. I went up to the top(500huf) while the wife stayed below. It was quite a windy day and definitely blew us about a bit. You can walk around the top to get splendid views of the city, well worth the effort

amazing building. The centre of inner city is dominated by this massive baroque like building. Well worth a visit to see the amazing golden guilded and painted interior as well as the relic of St Stephen. It is possible to ascend to the top of the dome for fantastic views across Budapest.
Wonderful.Must see. It is located in a delighful square, it's huge and beautiful..Especially when the "orga" is playing, it will be a feeling that you will never forget.

Big, fairly modern church. A large church with an opulently-decorated interior, such as you can find all over Europe. It certainly is big. It's not particularly historic in the context of churches, dating from the 19th century, and for that reason seems of less interest than many other European churches with centuries of history. If you love churches this is for you. Otherwise, just another big church. You can go in without paying which is good. If you want to visit one church in Budapest, the Matyas church is far more impressive.

Great panoramic of the city. This is a beautiful basilica and a great landmark to orientate yourself with in the city too. Pay the 500 florints to climb up to the top as it is the most beautiful view. Also worth a look inside - stunning.
Impressive. I was surprised by the approach to the basilica which was impressive in itself. Inside the painting and stained glass windows are lovely and the church is surprisingly light and airy.

Beautiful Church, Great Views of Budapest. The inside of this basilica was beautiful. The charge to get in was small and reasonable. The dome is definitely worth visiting.
