It gives you access to 360-degree views of Budapest on an exterior walkway. A series of elevators take you to the top, the charge for which (500 HUF, or about $2.50) is more than reasonable.

fascinating church. St Istvan basilica is huge and gorgeous. The most outstanding feature of the church is the mummified right hand of st. istvan that is exhibited in a chamber inside the church. Also, there is no instruction but there is a big burial site under the groud floor where the world famous hungarian ferenc puskas' tomb also lie. you can visit the tomb if you are interested by kindly asking to the clergy. there is no entrance fee but you may asked to make a donation about 1 euro at the entrance.

a church too far. this is an impressive catholic church from the outside with a completely repainted restored interior, which just didn't touch me like old european churches normally do, just too bright and new all the golden paintwork as if time never visited this space.

Don't miss the elevator to the top. We love touring these ancient cathedrals and St. Stephen's was just beautiful. We'd read about the stairs or elevator to the top, so found the ticket window (tucked in the right hand corner near the front). The view from the top was beautiful - a bird's eye view of Budapest.

Nice visit. A bit tacky having to put a coin into the box to light up St Stephen's hand - makes it less of a reverent experience and more one of humour where you almost expect the hand to give you a 'thumbs up' for the donation

St. Stephen's Bascillica you MUST NOT MISS!!. For us this was the most lasting memory of all the buildings we visited. There are 50 different types of marble used on the interior. It is simply Spectcularly ornate and beautiful. It is the type of place that if you visited a number of times you would see something different each time.The views over the city from around the dome are amazing.WONDERFUL!!

Really Beautiful. This church was very beautiful both inside and out. I also went up to the dome for the panoramic view of Budapest - worth it! I even went in the pouring rain and the city still looked beautiful on all sides.Plus, if mummified hands are your thing, well, you can check that out, too.
Beautiful. Beautiful place of prayer and well worth popping in to look around. Only a donation to enter. Lovely altar and St Stephen's hand to see in a side chapel.

Lovely view. We a cold February evening here listening to a string orchestra and then the next morning came back to look around the church and the tower. Worth the visit for the views and it was a lovely experience listening to the music. There is also a lovely chocolate shop/café which do the most amazing hot chocolates to warm your hands.
Beautiful. Beautiful church, inside and out. Worth the walk up the stairs to the dome to get a different perspective of the city.
Bit too costly. The church inside is magnificent .Worth going in Don't forget to check out the mini museum upstairs- I almost missed it

MAGNIFICENT!!!. The cathedral is another Budapest "must see"!!! I am a frequent visitor first and foremost for spiritual reasons, but all can appreciate this no-renaissance masterpiece. Start by walking around the building and looking up. Once inside take time examining each altar and statue, there are lots of hidden details that you miss if you rush through. It is site worth having a good guidebook or printout for. Be sure to walk slowly by the Holy Cross altar and watch as the perspective of the painting following you. At the back there is the chapel of the Holy Right Hand of St. Stephen, you have to look closely to see it and there is only proper illumination if you through in a few forints, but you don't get to see the partially preserved right fist of a thousand year old monarch everyday. Some tourists' behaviour can be a bit irritating, loud, men not taking their hats off, kids playing with the candles etc. and the cathedral staff try to maintain some peace during busy tourist times. Of course the full effect of the mosaics, statues, paintings is best when looked at calmly and meditatively. For those not afraid of heights you can go up and walk around the cupola, the view is more than worth the small charge. If you are stuck between a couple of tour groups it is best to sit down in one of the pews look up and wait for the crowd to pass. The guard at the entrance asks for donations so no fee is mandatory but they are very happy if you throw in some change. It location is perfect and missing this site is a sin.
Great church with panoramic balcony. Great church with panoramic balcony where you can view all Budapest and take nice photos. A must see site

Check out both the church and the view from the tower. The 500 HUF (about €1.50) you pay to climb up the Basilica's tower is probably among the best spent 500 during our trip. (For students it's actually only 400 HUF!) It was a cloudy day but we still had excellent views across Pest and over the Danube and Buda. Also great as you get more of a perspective of how big Budapest is!You have to climb hundreds of steps to get up the tower, but the staircases are quite wide and have banisters. There is also a lift for the last ~100 steps or so. (Although if you are mobile, you should be able to climb the full tower without any problems.)Once you are back on the ground, don't forget to go into the church itself though! It only costs a 200 HUF donation, and the interior is stunning (and very different from the tower and exterior!). Don't miss the chapel at the far left, which contains St Stephen's right hand (yes, really).
amazing. Lovely and amazing, as soon as you get in, you realize how unique and magnificent this Basilica is. No entrance fee either

Beautiful church. We went to an evening concert held in this church. Acoustics were sublime and although poorly attended the atmosphere was lovely. I would recommend similar events to musical events as the acoustics are supposed to be the best in the world

City center piece!. Wonderful placed in the heart of the city. Great wine bar just across entrance. Sit and enjoy tasting and sampling from a wonderful selection of local wines. Beautiful in the day, spectacular at night with lighting.

Beautiful interior. Nothing to dislike about this beautiful church. Take your camera and don't forget to lift your eyes to heaven to see the art work.
Bought a mug from the little shop, unfortunately it is not dishwasher safe so the transfer is no longer!

A must see from a historical perspective. St Stephen's is quite a stunning church. Amazing paintings and architecture. Also, one should pay the extra to walk to the steeple for a view of the city. I think it's 500 Florint now. But worth it to gain some perspective from the Pest side of the Danube.The church itself is a monument to a melded church and state. it's just part of the Hungarian fabric and culture, even down to the double cross that St Stephen is shown with in most statues in the town. This aspect, when carefully examined, makes you wonder, while walking through such a beautiful building.

Very Impressive Building. I was not expecting the fantastic detail of craftsmanship and artistry that I found in the church. Well worth a visit. You can pay 500Ft to walk up to the viewing parade near the top of the dome. Beware though it is 302 steps! There is a lift though after 100 steps.

A Must to See. The place is beautiful by itself. If you want to see something curious about this place, I would recommend you to go on the right side of the basilica and enter in the holy hand chapel. Is free of charge, and you can see the Saint Stephen conserved hand, that died in 1038.

One of the best Cathedral's. This is simply one of the most breathtaking Catholic cathedral's we have been to and trust me it's not just beautiful from the outside but many times more splendid from the inside as well.

Another beautiful church. This city is just full of amazing architecture. From the outside this building looks magnificent but step inside and it is a masterpeice. You can also go up to the viewing balconies on the top of the building for a great panorama of the city
Spectacular. One of many spectacular cathedrals in Europe, but even so, this will not disappoint. Suggested donation HUF 200 (50p). In the middle of Central Pest so easy to get to.

check out its roof terrace around the dome and forget about the church. It is a very boring church from the beginning of the 20th century, it is definitely not worth visiting. Ok, you can see the right hand of St. Steven the first Christian king of Hungary and that's it. But! go to the roof terrace and you will have the best view you get from the Pest side. (From the Buda side it is the Citadella which is an uninteresting fortress, but the view is great.)

Don't miss this amazing church. I had thought that the cathedral in Cordoba and the Aia Sophia in Istanbul could not be outdone but I was wrong. St Stephen's Basilica is incredible not only for it's phenomenal internal arts and crafts style decoration that covers every square centimeter of every wall and the entire ceiling but also its location with incredible views across the Danube to Pest, and its history and its sufferings and regeneration.

Beautiful. It is such a beautiful building we didn't climb it but went inside and it was nice. We didn't spend a lot of time here as there was a service on, but I would recommend it to anyone to visit it.
Beauty and great architecture. My favourite Church; abundant, elegant and beautiful. By a concert ticket and enjoy the sound & atmosphere; pure instruments and voices.
Great view. since this is one of the tallest buildings in Pest, the view is great. Go to the top of the Bazilika.

Yet another icon of this great city... St Stephens Basilica should not be, as one visitor to Westminster Abbey in London once proclaimed to her husband 'I'll do the inside if you do the outside'.The feast is definitely the interior ..An 1890s plethora of gilt and bronze ,mosaics and stained glass..The treasures also should be seen. The crowns and sceptres etc...At least once or twice a week there is a concert which is well worth the 20 Euros or so .The Basilica area is in the midst too of many coffee houses and restaurants....A 'not to be missed' experience ...You cannot say you have visited Budapest without the experience of the wonderful Ecclesiastical feast..

A fantastic view of Budapest. This cathedral is one of the most beautiful ones in Hungary. It is one of the tallest buildings in Budapest.You may walk around the basilica or listen to a fantastic choir or organ concert. If you want to have a 360°panoramic view of the centre of the capital of Hungary just walk upstairs 364 stairs to the dome or go by elevators. It is really worth visiting!You can read basic info about the building in Hungarian and English, as well.
Large and beautiful. We only went by this building by night, but it was beautiful with its majesty and the lights around it even then. It is truly big!

don't you dare to take the elevator!. It is a must see in Budapest. Walk around inside the Basilica and after that get to the top for a great view. The entrance to the basilica itself is free, but there is a box for donations, so you can drop some coins in it. To access the observation deck you have to pay something like 400 Ft if you are student, so don't forget to take your student id if you have one.If you have enough time you can come and listen to the organ concert in the evening. It costs about 3500 Ft. Personally I skipped the music and visited the Baths instead. But my friends went to the concert and told me it was marvelous.

Great views. A great view from the top. Take the stairs for some exercise but it is quite tight! The last bit goes into the dome and does feel a bit exposed, my wife couldn't do it as she has a fear of heights. I probably wouldn't want to take toddlers up.The walk outside around the dome is breathtaking and great of seeing the city.

classical sample of Cathedral. it is very classical sample of Cathedral with very rich interiors, which are very well preserved! there are many things to look-at and to see! please note that there are no entrance fee, but donation required!
Put this on your list. one word "beautiful". Archetecture beyond discription. An engineering marvel of it's time. Must visit.

Grand basilica, lots of history. In the fisherman Bastia district, close to hotel hilton towers this treasure dedicated to St. Stephan. It is said that if you toss your coins into the metal grates on the floor( probably the heating underneath), you will return to Budapest. And so we have many times! It's a magical, enchanting place. Surrounding on the square is an outdoor market, Hungarian souvenirs, but also some great paintings and drawings of Hungary. Great view of the Danube and the Parliament, all of the Pest side.
Beautiful!. This is a truly beautiful building. Worth spending a few pounds to go to the top for the breathtaking views across the city...you can take lifts all the way...unless you love stairs!!

Incredible building and views. The interior of the Basilica is very impressive but the best part is the views from the top. It is a bit of a climb but well worth it (and really interesting to see the actual structure of the Basilica dome. Entry to the Basilica is free but there is a reasonable fee for the dome.
Beautiful building. It is so beautiful, took 50 years to build and lots of money! Really enjoyed seeing it! I loved the architecture and the history!

Beautiful cathedral. This is a truly beautiful cathedral. When visiting take the opportunity to walk up the 300+ steps to the top for wonderful views. Those nit wanting to walk up can take a lift. It is well worth it even though you are only two thirds of the way to the top.
Beautiful. Incredible to look around very beautiful. I would recommend going up the tower to see a panorama view of the city. Only costs 400 Forints (Around £1.20)

Gorgeous. Gorgeous Basilica that is an active Catholic Church. We were able to attned mass during our visit. Beautiful gold filigre, details on ceiling, cherub statues, lovely alters, decor with a respectful, Holy feeling.
Great Basilica. Great square with a great view for late afternoon photos. Well lit at night and a very safe neighborhood.

Stunning Views Inside and Out. Spent just over an hour here looking inside the church, the treasures room and the roof top views. We had to pay a donation before being allowed into the church and the inside was spectacular to see with beautiful ceilings and architect. We had to pay a fee to go up to the roof top and also to the treasures room and once again it was worth every forint! We walked the 300 steps to nearly to the top and then had to get the lift to the roof as we couldn't see which way to go (better signage might be a good idea). The views from the top were spectacular and great to see the whole city and landmarks.We found the steps down and went to the bottom before getting the lift back to the treasure room, which is the only way to get there. The room was full of paintings and gold from the church and you are able to take photos of the exhibits but without a flash. We didn't mind paying the fee which wasn't much as we felt we were giving something to the up keep of this great church!
What a building!!!!!. Brill on the outside but fantastic on the inside. Never seen a more beautiful building inside than this one. Wow Wow Wow

Archetecture, Concert, View from tower - I'm 76. I found the visit to this Basilica wonderful. First the opulence of the architecture though amazing, for this Christian/Catholic was a bit over the top for a religion which concerns the poor. That is my personal view It is still amazing. People in robes are stationed at the doors and if you fail to deposit your "donation" they will stop you.The 300 steps to the tower were every bit worth it. The 5 pm organ concert was magnificent. The organ is a work of art and it rubles through the structure as it plays standard favorites.

Stunning, but poorly lit.. The architecture in this basilica is simply stunning! The colours are impressive and very distinctly "Hungarian" (it doesn't look like every other cathedral in Europe, so it should be impressive even to those who are "cathedraled-out"). Well worth a visit, the admission was a small donation (I think it came out to about two euro) that was completely worth it! I went at night, and it was quite dim inside. I would assume going during the day would have some more natural light, allowing you to fully appreciate the beauty of this place.

St. Stephen's Basilica - A very good attraction in Budapest. St. Stephen's Basilica (Szent Istvan Bazilika) is a large Roman Catholic church topped by a 96 metre tall dome, making the church visible from all over Budapest. Located on Szt. Istvan ter, this is one of the main attractions in the city that will probably make your list of must-see attractions. Visits are technically free but they request a 200ft donation to enter the basilica. This basilica was built between 1851-1905 and required three of Hungary's top architect to complete - Jozsef Hild, Jozsef Kauser and Hungry's finest architect, Miklos Ybl. The design is of the neo-classical style based on the old Greek cross plan and the basilica was named after the first King of Hungary (975-1038) and Patron Saint Stephen (Štefan Veľký). Within the church you can find some interesting things to see, most notably the relic, Holy Hand of St. Stephen, which is kept in the right hand chapel of the basilica. It is in a room just past the exit door. You'd be forgiven for accidentally missing the side chapel where this relic is kept so just pay attention and make sure to see this side chapel. There are some lovely Art Nouveau style glass-stained windows in this room as well. These are well worth seeing as part of your church visit. There are also some nice Leo Feszler frescos of the 12 apostles near the rear colonnade and a historic Portrait of the Black Madonna in the side chapel to the right of the main altar. The altar area is attractive, featuring a statue of St. Stephen. Unfortunately, this had been removed at the time of our last visit, likely for restorations. The nave of the basilica is lined with marble walls and tiled floor, and nice glass-stained windows can be seen throughout the main body of the church. However, the dominating feature is the inner dome, which is heavily decorated by mosaics of Neo-Renaissance style, designed by Miklos Ybl in 1867 yet painted by Karoly Lotz much later on, after the first dome actually collapsed during construction due to poor workmanship. It is worth having a look at the church exterior as well when visiting St. Stephen's Basilica. The carved main entrance door contains the heads of each of the 12 apostles and the Neo-Classical facade and its two bell towers are impressive to see during the day and at night when it is illuminated by floodlights. Overall, while less ornate and decorative then many Roman style basilicas that you might have visited elsewhere in Europe, St. Stephen's Basilica is a very good church visit in our opinion and is well worth visiting. We will gladly return during future trips to Budapest.
Beautiful church. Even if you're not a catholic you're sure to enjoy the serenity of this building. There are organ concerts on Monday and Friday evenings.

Magnificent Basilica. Saint Stephen's Basilica stands proud and tall. It's dome marks out its presence as it can be seen from many parts of the city. Amazing to think that the first dome collapsed due to poor construction techniques! Once inside, visitors can view the exquisite mosaics that decorate this huge dome. This beautiful, church houses the mummified hand of St Stephen, first King of Hungary. It is a must to visit. Climb to the top or take the lift to the viewing gallery and enjoy the view.

Tears of joy. St Stephens Basilica is absolutely beautiful. Visited a few days ago with my wife and friends. We entered and looked up at the ornately decorated dome. I looked round at my wife to see tears running down my wife's cheeks. She said the beauty of the place just filled her with emotion. Any building that can do this to a person must be well worth a visit.

Stunning. What a stunningly beautiful church. Its impressive on the outside, but wow on the inside. It said quiet please as you walked in, butt here were guided tours with microphones in there so not sure about how the quiet please worked!!!!If you like beautiful churches this is a must see.
Not to be missed. Very old and beautiful church with lots of history. Recommended to anyone visiting Budapest. Lots of decoration on walls and sits on a great location to get an overview of city.

Stunning for sightseers and very special for the faithful. Although being a Catholic was unfashionable (until our new Pope!) attending Mass is a part of our home routine and one we pursue in our travels. Thanks to the universal nature of the service we know when to sit, stand and kneel, even if we don't understand the language as happened in Budapest.The history and architecture of the Basilica make it a photo stop for many but for the faithful it is indeed special. The lighting and whole setting of the main altar is done with such attention to detail that it becomes almost a theatrical backdrop. We attended weekday Mass and at about 30 seconds before 6pm more feature lighting was turned on which gave a real sense of expectation and drama. While we couldn't understand a word, the service was delivered and received with great reverence. it was memorable.Here and elsewhere we observed that Hungarians are quite devout about their faith in a way we have not seen in Western World Catholics for decades. As a visitor and a Catholic it is enriching to visit a church that is not just another photo opportunity. Mass times available on their website and it currently also a venue for classical music concerts.
Beautiful basilica. Definitely a place to stop while visiting Budapest. Beautiful classic church very busy area and fun to walk around

Grand church. The inside of the Basilica was a little disappointing - much plainer than I expected. However, the trip up to the top of the building was well worth all the stair climbing to see much of the city from a different view point.
Good place for a walk. Saint Stefan Basilica, is a nice place for a walk around, nice plaza, the church is a very nice building..
Beautiful. This Basilica has everything you could imagine. From the Stain glass to the statues it is a must see.

Gorgeous!. Gorgeous cathedral! Beautiful exterior. Stunning and ornate interior with beautiful ceilings, tilework, and statuary. Worth the 200 HUF ($1 / 1 Euro) recommended donation. Could have been better if some areas hadn't been roped off.
go to the top. This is a mind blowing beautiful church and the view from the top if incredible - especially on a bright sunny day. worth a visit
Beautiful. We visited here in the day time and the night time. It look impressive both times and was worth seeing. It is also worth seeing from high above too.
Amazing!!!!. You look at the Church and think it doesn't look so big... Until you get up to it.. It is just beautiful!!!

Beautiful building and incredible views from the top. We went to visit a number of buildings whilst sightseeing around Budapest, this was one of my favourites...took my breath away...the beautiful interior, the amazingly vivid stained glass and the views from the dome! Contribution to go in and a fee to go up to the dome.
Great view. Went to the towers to see the view. It´s fantastic. But you have to pay both to enter the towers and the Basilika.

A must see. When in Budapest, the Basilica is not to be by-passed. While under some construction, the inside is remarkable. Pictures allowed. Be sure to stand directly under the dome for an unbelievable view.

Luxory and panoramic. Please go up to the dome, the sightseeing you have from there is breathtaking! Inside worth to see S. Stephen's relic (his mummified hand) and the history behind it. Inside gold and paint everywhere, baroccan style.

Impressive. Of the historical sites we visited in Budapest we found the Basilica to be the most impressive. The interior is breathtaking and the views from the top were excellent. Great photo opportunity as well. Considering how inexpensive the visit was as well we’d thoroughly recommend it.

Wonderful evening concert. This is how you should experience such a fabulous church. Listening to beautiful music played on the organ accompanied by trumpet, violin and glorious voices. Try and catch one of these fantastic evenings it is so worth it if you love music. Oh! and wrap up because it was very chilly inside!

Grand Basilica. It is one of the two tallest buildings in Budapest, and a great work of architecture.
I had the special opportunity to attend the midnight mass here. The huge gathering and resounding organ music amidst symbolic rituals made it a memorable experience.

Beautiful place. Not quite St Pauls but a lovely building all the same and worth a visit. It's not that big and you are expected to leave a small contribution towards the up keep, quite common these days, but happy to pay.

Splendor Beyond Expectation. Upon entering St. Stephens I was awestruck by the well maintained art and presence of the church's interior. It is majestic! There is an admission -- 200Ft, about US$1 -- but don't let that deter you. Also, outside the church and across St. Stephen Ter there is a charming bronze statue of a policeman from an earlier age, keeping an eye on things. All told, time well spent at St. Stephens.
Iconical church in the Downtown. Catholic church in the downtown, with fantastic art style and mood... We used to sit inside hours....

centre of attraction. St Stephen's Basilica is the centre of attraction of Budapest. You can see these huge building anywhere from Budapest. best time of visit is in the when you can enjoy your beer and supper after the visit of Basilica. Inside also very huge, full arts, which includes paintings and painted window glass. Do not miss this, when you are in Budapest.
A great Basilica. It's a wonderful piece of architecture. We visited several times as they had different concerts at night and other cultural events.
worth a visit. The building is quite imposing and once inside, reminded me of several of the churches in Italy with the grand marble columns and frescos.

St. Stephen's Basilica. It's my first time to Budapest, Hungary. I visited with Pilgrim group from Thailand. This is a great place of worship. We attended Mass among our Thai group. We were warmly welcome. For Those who like to learn about how the Royal Family contributed to Roman Catholic in the past, this is one of the great place.It's Spring and we got a little showering. The temperature is just fine for Asian like us.

Usual lovely interior. It was closed on the Monday for a concert so not sure if this is every week. It is free to enter but they like you to put a donation in the box.Much is written about the severed hand of the King. You have to give the lady a donation for her to light up the display and you cannot see much.
Soul stirring. We enjoyed a String ensemble concert in this awe inspiring building(i'm not in the least religious) it's truly magnificent

Stunning interior. A beautiful church. We attended an organ, flute and aria concert here one evening, and it was a beautiful setting for a different experience in Budapest. The concert was 70 minutes long, just long enough given the church was quite chilly - but what an atmosphere. If we had had longer, we would have gone to the top of the dome where we are told the views are spectacular

Great views. Definitely worth the 500HUF to go to the top and admire the views. There are the options of stairs or the elevator so everyone can enjoy it. Be warned it is high so if you're afraid of heights like I am take some deep breaths and take your time. It is worth it.

Magical At Christmas. We visited here when the Christmas market was open in front of the church. This is a beautiful old church not as grand as many in Europe but still worth the walk inside. If you are lucky enough to be here over the holidays take time to enjoy this magical area.
roof top city view platform is great!. very nice building! worth to visit, especially go to the top for miracle city view! is it windy there so be prepared.
Awesome Building. Very much reminded me of St Pauls Cathedral in London - along a narrow street then opens up into a massive square - very clean and well kept building
Worth a look. The Basilica itself is very impressive and well worth a walk around. You can also climb up to the top (a lift is available for some of the way) and the views from the top are stunning.
one you should not miss !!. There is impressive building on buda side and close to Buda Castle also interesting to take a walk around this area, many cafe and restaurants mostly very good.

Classic consert. Enjoy a concert in this magnificent church. It creates a nice stop in a "small" big city. Lovely acoustics and after that quick accsess to nice restaurnat and wine bars in the very city center.
very impressive. Another impressive building in the city of Budapest that one should not miss! Close to many restaurants and cafees, it is also interesting for a night walk around the area.

Well worth a visit and a climb to the top.. A magnificent Neo-Classical Basilica with a splendid dome fronted by two towers. Completed in 1905 after a build time of about 57 years. Superbly carved and decorated inside and out. The entrance fee is by a requested donation - beware, there are sometimes beggars who slip in and ask for personal donations too! The access to the tower is by a small fee and a lift if working will take you part of the way up. The rest is by steps- without the lift about three hundred in total. The view is outstanding so if the sun is out do the climb first in case it clouds over and you lose the chance to see it in the sunshine.
A must see. Beautiful decoration, just sit and look in all directions and you will wonder at the skill of man,there is a donation box on entering for continued restoration recommended 200ft
Tallest in Pest. You don't realize how big it is until you reach the square in front of the Basilica. From the outside it reminds a bit of St. Paul Cathedral in London.
Nice view. After visiting the wonderful basilica go up to the roof/terrace. You will get an amazing view on the city! :)

Amazing!! A definite must!. The Basilica itself is amazing, as I am sure you can gather. But I would also recommend taking the lift to the top (500 huf, 400 if you have a student card with you). This will be one of your most memorable experiences in Budapest! You can see the view of the entire city - absolutely wonderful!

Impressive structure. This is no doubt this is an impressive structure and it dominates the square and surrounding area it's on....and again upon entering you can't help but be overwhelmed by the size and opulence of the interior...it's ornate, it's rich and it leaves you in no doubt of the wealth of the church. But was I truly impressed...no I don't think so... I felt it was overly opulent and indeed soulless. I cant' see how it would ever bring you closer to your chosen god. I much preferred the Matyas Church by the Fisherman's Bastion.St Stephen's is a definite must as a sight of Budapest but I don't think it's the best church in Budapest.

Breathtaking amazing. Breathtaking amazing wonderful. You will just want to stop and soak in the magnificent building. At night it is lite and beautiful
Take the time and go to the top. Views are amazing

Stunning Basilica and christmas market behind. One of the most spectacular basilicas I have seen inside- opulent and awesome. At xmas there is a beautiful xmas market behind selling decs/spiced wines/ all the good you could want!

Traditonal on the outside, Classic and stunning within. The frescos and detailing in the interior are fabulous.
The walk up to the top of the towers is a little energetic, but the views are excellent. You do have to have a head for heights.

Fantastic building and square. Its a masterpiece of a building. It's really breath taking to see this fantastic building. It's so big. It's actually the highest building in Budapest 96 meters. And the square in front of the buidling is every night filled with people. This is a fantastic attraction. Just go there and buy a bottle of wine from the Di Vino wine bar and sit down with all of the other people and just feel the atmosphere, it's really amazing !! Our favorite spot !! LUPS

Nice view from the Dome. When you stand in front of the Basilica - it is really overwhelming! The basilica is gorgeous from outside and inside, where you'll enjoy a lot of beautiful statues, decorations and paintings. ... It is so beautiful! Nice view at the top of it

A good experience. I loved the building. It is the best basilica I've seen. You can take good pictures from the square. I had a good time. The entrance is free and inside everything is very beautiful. I felt like in a museum of art decorative.

Wow!. The basilica seems rather mediocre from the outside, but the inside blew me away. I have seldon visited a church with such overwelming decoration on the inside, especially the dome took my breath a way. Must visit when in Budapest.

overwhelming!. When you stand in front of the Basilika - it is really overwhelming! It is so beautiful! It is one of the highest building in the city - the second one is the parliament - nice view at the top of it

Another wonder of time gone by. Sight seeing in Budapest is nothing short of amazing. It is hard to take it all in. Being on a tour unfortunately doesn't leave much time to enable the full enormity of past ages, traditions and country

Beautiful St Stephen's Basilica. The basilica is gorgeous from outside and inside... and from the top.The view from outside is impressive. This is the first or second largest church in Hungary (arguable with Eger Basilica). It's massive architecture does not prevent it from having a certain elegance!Once inside the Basilica, you'll enjoy a lot of beautiful statues, decorations and paintings. Disappointing since recently, the church imposes a "donation fee" at the entrance for all visitors.The visit of the basilica top is worth the climb! it is beautiful and give you a great view on the rest of the city!!!
An amazing Church. This is one of the most amazing churches I have ever visited and in stands proude in the heard of Budapest a must to visit.
Wow. how pretty and even better if you 'tag' onto a guided tour ! Didn't go up to the top mind you had already walked for ever !

Beautiful - And Boring. I am not interested in churches -- and I spent Christmas in Rome! - so I am not the best person to review St. Istvan's. A beautiful church, yes, and if you pay to go to the top of the church the views are wonderful. The museum is not work a visit.

St. Stephen's Basilica. The basilica is fascinating, although it's relatively new. The most impressive is the interior. Do it on your way to or from the Chain Bridge, there is a street connecting them and the view from it is unforgettable
Heavy stuff. Worth a visit as it is the main church but it's rather overbearing and they have made some recent changes to lay out. Crown and orb now in Parliament.

Go to the top. An amazing place , so much more than meets the eye
Whether you take the stairs or the lift the view form the top is fantastic

OTT. Rather over ornate and polished baroque cathedral with a paucity of information about it. Best was the view from the dome gallery over the city and across to Castle Hill. I suppose as it is comparatively young, there isn`t much interesting history to tell.

Beautiful basilica. Like so many others in other European cities, this basilica is beautifully appointed and has rich history. And like a lot of others, the best part is the view from the top of the duomo! Definitely go up and see the view, even when it was spitting with rain it was an impressive view with parliament and the castle easily identifiable.
Nice inside , go earlier to climb to top. Better in daylight as cupola has windows and you can pay a little to climb up. Closes 7pm and near then a bit dark inside and you can't climb to top.

Excellent view with exercise. very nice Basilica, went on a sunny day and paid to go up to the roof which provided an excellent view. Then went round the Basilica itself. Usual insides of a church/basilica with the added bonus of being able to see a hand that is thousands of years old. free entry which seems unusual in Budapest but you did have to pay to go up to the roof. 315 stairs to the top or you can cheat and get the lift.
Fantastic. A great place to look around. Do pay the fee to climb to the top of the Dome the view is worth it, however take the lift if your legs cant walk that many steps.

Truly magnificent. There is a church warden at the door asking for a donation of €1 or 100 Forints which seemed strange but we were happy to pay. Certainly worth an entrance fee in any event as it is a truly remarkable building. Lots of fine art and don't forget to look up to the magnificent ceiling. The relic of St Stephen's forearm is housed in a casket. There are often organ recitals on a Monday evening. You cannot go to Budapest without going to the Basilica. There is a separate charge for a trip up the tower which is about 315ft high so you get a good view of the city.
stunning. A stunning church and also housed the fist of St Stephen. It is possible to go inside also when a service is been taken

Awesome building. Great architecture. Definitely worth a look and there are some nice places to have a coffee nearby. Amazing views from the viewing platform around the dome, just use the lift as its a long way up!
Didn't go in. So, I'm just not into paying to enter a house of worship. It's been just recently renovated - scaffolding finally removed. Let my people in!

A must see!. This was across the road from our hotel so we visited on our first day. Beautiful outside and in! Really has the wow factor when you walk in. We walked up the tower (small fee) to be faced with fantastic views of Budapest. It was a long way up and a lot of steps but so worth it!

Epically ornate. Never seen so much gold and ornate decoration in any church. The relic of the hand in the chapel was a tad macabre....however so worth a visit and even better when they periodically turn the lights on just for a few seconds, have your camera ready!
impressive. Not to be missed. A beautiful cathedral. The paintings on the ceiling and dome are magnificent. Free entry but they do ask for a donation of 200HUF which is well worth it
Basilica. Very imposing and grand building. Is beautful inside. Massive dome and lots of gold decorations.Can be seen from all over Budapest because of the dome.Stands on a big square.Easy to get to

Impressive. This is a dominating structure in the Budapest skyline. And sis is also breathtaking from the inside. Pay attention to the frescoes. They are not frescoes but mosaics...The panorama trip to the tower is also recommendable.Also, the entry-fee is a donation. This I felt was a nice feature other places could learn from.

A must see. There isn't much to say really other than if you are in Budapest this is a must see.
Nice walk from Pest and plenty of good restaurants nearby.
Worth visiting - not too Baroque. Imposing exterior and Interesting interior - with the 'holy right hand' relic of King Istvan chapel worth seeing.
excellent. Beautiful church easy to get to. outside is stunning. Do have to make compulsory donation too enter., also worth going up to the dome, lifts go all the way, 2 seperate ones.
Don't miss it. Very nice architecture and decoration. One of most beautiful and grand churches I have visited. Worth a visit.

Worth a visit. We visited the Basilica on a very wet day and it provided temporary relief from miserable weather. You have to provide a donation of 200 florins and at the entrance there are two priests standing at the donation boxes, so you can't avoid the 'donation'. Inside it's a typical interior, quite dark and fairly catholic in taste. St. Stephen's mummified hand is in small glass casket in another little room behind the main church part. However you can only really see the hand if you put some money in a box and it lightens up briefly. We did not have the coins to do this and so hung around hoping that some other tourist might want to see this ancient mummified hand. Alas, most other tourists were the same as us. Peered at the glass box but did not proffer any coins to light it up! Drat! We never got to see the hand, the whole reason for going into the Basilica. On the opposite side of the main church area there is another little area where you can find a religious depiction of the black Madonna. The outside of the Basilica is quite impressive.
Amazing architecture. Intricate decor. History clearly explained. Went in to avoid the rain in the first instance and was amazed by the interior. In some ways could rival Notre Dame!

The right hand of the first hungarian king. A lovely church in the centre of Budapest with a magnificent view from the top over Buda and Pest. The holy right hand of the first king of Hungaria is displayed in the reliquarium.
Excellent. This place is a must see in Budapest. It is located in the pest side of the city center. about a 10 minute walk from the parliament.

Impressive. Very cheap entrance fee (donation) compared to the exorbitant entry fee to the synagogue. Fabulous interior and superb building overall. Central location and within walking distance of all the central metro stations.
Lovely views from the top. Well worth paying to go to the top and see the city from birds eye view. However it's a long walk up the stairs. Also don't forget st. Stephens arm !!

Fabulous. A must see if you are visiting Budapest. Survived the war and cold war, intact. You can see the actual hand of the martyred St. Stephen in its glove. Do walk up the narrow, steep steps to the outside of the dome for a fabulous view of the city. I had the thrill of being up there at noon when all the bells and chimes played.
Wonderful church. We visited the church one afternoon and we were very impressed by the holy place and its meaning to the residents of Budapest

Just Fabulous. This is the most amazingly huge and beautiful church and is so worth a visit. Personally I feel it is on a par with St Pauls in London. Entrace is free but you are supposed to make a voluntary contribution of €1.00. Once you have finished looking around the church you can treat yourself to an ice-cream from a superb ice-cream shop about 50 metres to the left of the church entrace.
Gorgeous. Like a lot if the buildings in both Buda and Pest, St Stephens Basilica is gorgeous. I would certainly recommend viewing it when on a visit. The architecture is beautiful.
Stunning. The best way to approach is a couple of blocks down from the Sofitel by the Chain bridge. This beautiful cathedral reveals it self and dominates your walkEntrance is by donation

As beautiful as you would find anywhere in the world. My grandmother was married at the Basilica in the 1920s and so it was a must see for me on our visit to Budapest. The Basilica rivals anything you would see in Florence or Sienna. The ceiling frescoes are magnificent and the detail of the side naves are amazing. Unlike many of the major churches in Italy, entrance is still free and definitely worth a visit.
Beautiful church. Interesting piece of history. Beautiful ceilings and well kept building. Open all over Christmas and free to get in, a bonus.

One of the most beautiful buildings in Budapest. Completed in 1905 after 54 years of construction work, the neo-classical Szent Istvan Bazilika stands as testament to pre-1914 Western Christian civilisation.The most important church in Hungary, it contains a stunning interior and the incorruptible right hand of Saint Stephen I of Hungary, the first King of Hungary, which is housed in the reliquary. When I visited it cost 400 forint or €2 to enter and there is a lift or staircase which you can use to reach the dome from where you can experience some of the best views of the city from the Pest side.It is also very easy to reach being almost equidistant from the Deak Ferenc ter, Arany Janos utca, Opera and Bajcsy-Zsilinszky utca metro stations. Please be aware that the Bazilika host numerous church services and concerts so you may not be able to access all areas especially at weekends or of an evening.
Great concerts - shame about acoustics. Great string orchestra & soprano, but acoustics surprisingly poor - too much echo. Lovely cathedral to visit during the day as well.
Impressive. St Stephen's Basilica is grand and impressive. We didn't do the tour but enjoyed the view from afar!
Nice. Wonderful atmosphere in this big neo-renaissance church. Nice paintings and windows. There was a panorama lookout in the cupola!
best views. a wonderful place to go for a fabulous view of the city. Easy access by lift takes you up to the Dome.

Impressive and easy to achieve. Basilica is has very good location and it really beautiful from inside and outside too. It's kind of a "must" thing to see in Budapest. I wouldn't recommend the basic touristic concerts though, since my experience wasn't the best. The ticket was overcharged compared to the quality of the concert itself.
A View over budapest. For only €1,5 you can take a flight fo stairs to the top of the building. Here you will have an immence Panoramo over Pest.
Impressive!. Visit it, it is a must! Well refurbished and exposed. You can't visit Budapest without passing through Basilique St etienne

One of the most beautiful interiors in Budapest. Completed in 1905 after 54 years of construction work, the neo-classical Szent Istvan Bazilika stands as testament to pre-1914 Western Christian civilisation.The most important church in Hungary, it contains a stunning interior and the incorruptible right hand of Saint Stephen I of Hungary, the first King of Hungary, which is housed in the reliquary. When I visited it cost 400 forint or €2 to enter and there is a lift or staircase which you can use to reach the dome from where you can experience some of the best views of the city from the Pest side.It is also very easy to reach being almost equidistant from the Deak Ferenc ter, Arany Janos utca, Opera and Bajcsy-Zsilinszky utca metro stations. Please be aware that the Bazilika host numerous church services and concerts so you may not be able to access all areas especially at weekends or of an evening.
Amazing. Our first day in Budapest was a visit to the Basilica to enjoy an organ concertThoroughly enjoyed the concert ..the music was amazing in such a wonderful setting
Beautiful. Amazing architecture well worth a visit Inside. Donation of 200 huf is required.You can go up the tower for a great view.

Great city. A little undiscovered but well worth the trip. People extremely friendly and helpful even when stopped at random on the street needing directions! The Basilica is a must to visit as is the Holocaust museum.

A beautiful Basillica. We visited this beautiful church last week. It is a superb church and really well maintained.it is worth seeing the mumified hand at the rear.Another must do in this church is climb up the dome. There is a lift available anf the views from the top are stunning!. A must see when visiting Budapest

Breath taking. We saved this till our last day, and i have to say. Amazing! breath taking! loved every second of being in there. we also jumped in on some ones tour for 10 minutes and learned a lot. You have to visit this fantastic pillar of history.
Amazing. Very beautiful. Always lively. Should have gone up but didn't have enough time! There's also a cute restaurant across the street.

A must do. My first memory of St Stephens is off it lit up on the night we arrived. I was wondering whether we'd ever actually see inside the Basilica, but we made it our mission on the our last and it was well worth the effort. Just stunning@

Make your way to the rooftop terrace. We headed to the basilica and took a stroll inside. Of course there were many other tourists in and around the basilica, but that has to be expected. As others have already mentioned, the basilica is stunning and worth taking the time to wander around. After touring through the church and its chapels, we noticed the stairs to upper towers. We paid the additional fee and make our way up several hundred steps (there is also an elevator for those who cannot take the stairs).Make your way to the very top of the staircases; once you reach the top, you will be rewarded with a 365o view of Budapest. The terrace wraps around the roof and steeple giving you a breathtaking view of this gorgeous city.

Go inside!. Great breathtaking from the outside, but evzn more wtunning from the inside, u wont be long inside, so there s no reasonnot to go inside! Just give a tipwhen u enter, this great building needs funds to remaing as it is.

A Stunning Stroll in a National Landmark. St. Stephen's Basilica (Szent Istvan Bazilika) is a must-see attraction if you are visiting Budapest. Take your time to stroll through the cathedral or just sit in one of the pews and ponder the role that the Catholic church played in Hungary's history. The church is not ancient, and the cathedral in Eztergom might have more historical significance, but in Budapest St. Stephen's Basilica is an important cultural attraction. The church also hosts a variety of concerts & performances during the year. While you are in the neighborhood, you can also check out the offerings of the Central European University, which has its office right down the street. Free concerts are offered there occasionally too.

Impressive, beautiful and great. You can't be in Budapest without visiting the Bazilika, one of the most important sights of the city and history.About the entrance fee a TIP: when I realised we should pay, I asked the priest standing at the door if we could only look inside for a moment, and he told us to wait a bit (while other tourists went in... after paying...) and then he let us in for free. So try to get in when you are alone, e.g. without other tourists and if this doesn't work, ask only to look inside, it is so huge and beautiful that it worths even just a look.

Red and gold. A cavernous space, which was opulent in its beauty. The red marble and gold detail was striking. The alters were enormous, and it couldn't help noticing at there where few stained glass windows. The priest accepted our pound donation AT&T he door, with a friendly greeting. There is a smaller room as others have mentioned that contains the mummified hand - this was freaky for me. I did not enjoying this. On the way out there is information about the construction. I think it would be worth finding a guide for the visit, to gain more from the experience as there is not much information available in English. The visit up to the top is worth it for a birds eye view. It was raining the day we were there unfortunately, but you do get to see the wooden struts supporting the dome.
Lovely. Typical Basilica, amazing interior, If you like churches you'll love this. Free entry and dont forget to take you hat off.

Impressive Church. Church is beautiful and reading it's history and the troubles it faced during construction interesting. St. Stephen's right hand on full display. Small donation accepted at door, but you can go straight in.
Beautiful church. Great old world flavor- with stunning art throughout. You can spend as much time as you'd like taking it all in.

Stunning building. St Stephens would have to be, in my opinion, one of the most beautiful Basilicas I have seen in all my travels. The workmanships in this building is magnificent (although reading some of the history it is indicated that lack of this trait did cause some problems in its initial construction). Well worth having a look. And the view from the tower is superb, albeit with another small fee payable from the ticket box in the entrance.

the panorama is for warm sunny days. for 500huft you can enjoy the panorama from the top of the basilica. having spent quite several hours that day walking around Budapest I decided to take the lift to the top and not the stairs. it involved two lifts and a few stairs to get to the metal framework within the room that then leads you out onto the balcony at the top. the view is amazing from up there but in January it was very cold and the wind at that height was biting. it doesn't appear that there is access for anyone with limited mobility so unless your able to climb stairs once you reach the top then its a no go.
Nice place. A nice building, but it was nothing extraordinary. Although, I recommend everyone to visit it, but if you travelled enough you won't find it fascinating.

Best view in Budapest. This is the best view in Budapest without question, you can see everything in 360 up the top of the 96m basilica. I took the stairs but if you don't keep fit then take the lift or you'll run out of puff halfway up. Go inside the chapel too, it's only 200HUF (60pence in Sterling) and amazing and I am not deeply religious but like to respect those that are. I really think this is worth a visit but get there early in the morning or at dusk.

gotta see it, at least from the outside. 96 meter building, tallest in Budapest. Interesting contrast compared to nearby newer buildings. St. Stephen's charges nominal fees to see three different points of interest inside.

Definitely worth a stop.. Absolutely beautiful inside and very worth the 200 forint (about a dollar) "donation" to get in. Check out all the side altars, but make sure to sit down in the middle area for a few minutes and look up at the ceiling and walls - there are so many details you'll be finding new things the longer you sit. And, of course, don't miss the nearly 1000-year old mummified hand of St. Stephen, the king who Christianized Hungary, which is in the chapel to the left-rear of the basilica. Bring another 200 forint coin to drop in the machine that lights it up so you can see it. Kind of hard to make out since it's inside several boxes and a bit distant, but they have a display with pictures.Wish I'd gotten some sort of brief guided tour - it's a place with a lot of history but, like many things in Budapest, the English-language explanation of it is a bit lacking. Also, it is a bit dark inside - an older person with bad vision might miss some stuff, and photos with a cheaper camera (such as my smartphone) don't turn out well.

Beautiful interior with great views of Budapest. Such a stunning building. Take the lifts (bit scary) up to the viewing dome and take a look at the great views. Best on a sunny day.Inside try and get to the evening choir/music services. The sound is exceptional.Absolutely stunning inside, quite breathtaking.

Better from the outside. I must say the basilica seems grander on the outside than on the inside. It is beautiful, but lacks a certain aw...there is a priest at the entrance looking (and acting!) like he's collecting entrance fee - however it is only a donation! At the back of the Basilica you can check out the relik - st.Istvan's hand - the relik itself can be illuminated for a fee otherwise you can hardly see it. Not worth the hassle of standing in line.

Gorgeous old world basilica. This basilica is simply breathtaking! Elaborate gold candelabras and accents inside this gorgeous cathedral! Great history about the hand of St. James (which they have on display there). This basilica was finished during different periods by a total of three different renowned architects! A definite marvel for the Catholic church! Must see!
Jaw dropping. A wealth of workmanship, also offers orchestral performances at a hefty price, which was a shame. But the church was beautiful
suggested. very precious church! i live in Italy and i've seen lots of, but this one should really be visited. and the square in front of it is equally nice, especially in the christmas time
Beautiful and a real surprise inside. The outside of the building is impressive, but the real beauty of this building is inside. Very much worth a visit. Better than we thought.

I expected something more. It is a simple catholic church as many other thousand in Europe
I do not think that it is something special or a must to visit
There are other churches in Budapest much more beautiful to see

Must see of Pest!. I really liked this building, it has an amazing atmosphere and spirit you can feel. It has all the best of shops and cafes around, so its visit will be very fruitful, if you consider about half-day or more. Must visit for every visitor of Budapest.

Massive and Opulant Church. This large Church is not that old having been started in the mid-19th century. It is in a Neo-Renaissonce style with two towers and a central main church. It is an impressive site from the outside and remains tied for the highest building in Budapest with the Parliament Buildings. Inside the church is ornate and highly decorated. Worth seeing but not as interesting as the medieval cathedral in Buda.

more stunning outside than inside!. beautiful and thank God you only ask for a contribution and not an entrance fee to go in a church!!!! In most other churches in Hungary you have to pay! Unacceptable! Ok Budapest is beautiful, we all pay enough for our hotels and food and obligatory tipping which goes to the government and not the people, enough is enough with churches! They are places of worship NOT money making businesses!
Very cold.. Worth it to get a lift up to the top as there are some great views up there. The Basilica itself is a bit cold and uninspiring

The heart of Budapest!. Impressive church that you can visit and relax your mind. It would be best if you have the chance to see a religious rite take place. At the square outside the church, there was a Christmas Market during Christmas and New Year's Eve that flooded the place with people! Really warming atmosphere!

Views at the top are superb. Seeing Budapest from the top of the Basilica was worthwhile. The city is quite big and spreadout. As you may know it contains both the Buda and Pest sides separated by the Danube. We were able to get a great view of the older and newer parts of town. Highly recommend!
vauuuu. Well everything is there on Christmas-litlle houses and souveniere shops..it is so beautifull church that you just have to see it take pictures, seat somewhere worm and relax.
The heart of Pest. The Basilica is huge and beauteous. And the square front of the basilica is wonderful. In the little streets there are many restaurants which are very good.
A really big church. I was shocked when I saw the size of the basilica. the interior is very minimal but nevertheless grand. I was very impressed.

Visit the Dome!. Well worth paying to climb the dome for views of the City. The Basilica is stunning, although the "donation" to enter was collected by a monk standing over the collection basket with an eye to ensure that the suggested "donation" was received.

Looks almost brand new inside. Obviously the gilding has been redone recently and the whole interior looks incredible. By candlelight at an organ recital on Dec 30th it looked magical. Very well worth a visit and if you can attend an activity all the better.

Interesting and doesnt take too long. Like most of Budapest sites, everything just seems a little smaller and less busy than places like Paris or London. If youre like me and not too fussed about the sightseeing then all these things are just big and quick enough to enjoy.
Fantastic building. Wow what a building, we are not into architecture but decided as we were passing we would take a look in........... Wow are we glad we did. It's amazing.

Staggeringly beautiful. Notre Dame in Paris is amazing, but this place even more so. Art, architecture, light, acoustic effect, all just staggering. This is a must-see and must be one of the most beautiful cathedrals in the world.

Nice, a real landmark. With its tours and coupole, it dominates the Pest side of the town. It houses the right hand of the first Hungarian king, St. Stephen. Also the cathedral of the archibishop of Budapest.

Wonderful building. I first came here with a fellow backpacker to hang out in a near by bar for a few drinks in the summer and to take in the local crowd that had gathered. The basilica at night is a really special place and added to the atmosphere that night. I returned with some friends the next day to take a better look around and was even more impresses by what I saw. This really is a great structure and a highlight of the visit to the city.

Make sure you visit the top to see the stunning views. We visited this at sunset & although very cold at the top it was so worth it to see the stunning sunset & views.
The church itself is lovely, & well worth a slow walk around to take it all in.

Great Spot to View the City. Climbed up to here from the M2 metro stop on this side of the Danube. Only about a 15 minute walk. Didn't pay to go inside as couldn't find the place to pay and the attendent in the church was very rude. Picnic coffee shop opposite is a better place to escape the cold (blankets included).
amazing and beautiful. I love architecture, and one thing I certainly do is visit it. Its 19th century. The building is beautiful both inside out
Beautiful. Mid 19th Century. However there is an elegance about the Basilica and the fittings. To drop by on the way to Andrassy Utca. To go all the way just for the church, you will be dissapointed.

Amazing interior and curious relic. The neo-classical St. Stephen's Basilica, which is one of the dominating buildings in Pest, is gorgeous both from outside and inside, so it's definitely worth taking a look. It is lavishly decorated, with marble columns, amazing vitrals and a huge cupola. It also holds a very curious relic: the right hand of Stephen, first king of Hungary.
Absolutely awsome.. This is a must visit site while in Pest, We even had the opportunity to go up into the internal parts of the Dome and then go outside for a great view of the entire city .

Beautiful both inside and out. Churches are a typical tourist destination and to some extent this is true of St Stephen's. However, while in the Castle District, a visit is in order. The inside is very colorful with intricately painted surfaces. The roof, especially at night, glistens as the lights play off the array of beautiful, shiny tiles that cover the many surfaces and peaks on the building.
Best site in Castle hill. This is a beautifully restored church and is worth seeing. This is the best site to see in the Castle hill district.

Beatiful show. Me and my boyfriend visited budapest over christmas. We went from the hotel to the smal market outside the church. When we came, there was a lightshow starting. The light came from the other side of the square and lighted up the facade with an animations about love, realy greate. We were not inside the church beusause there was an orgelconcers going on.

A must for Christmas!. I didn't intend to climb all those stairs but the effort was rewarded with a spectacular panoramic view of Budapest at night. The traditional church with a Christmas market right in front in the square with music and light show really added to the holiday experience. What more could you want?
Eye catching Basillica. Donations at the door. Impressive both inside and outside. I wonder how many people donated the amount required to turn on the light to see St Stephen's hand.

Wonderful music in a beautiful setting. While on a stroll in Budapest we were given a flyer for a concert at St. Stephen's Basilica. It was classical music by Handel, Vivaldi, Mozart, and other classical composers. It was performed by a small symphony and featured a wonderful female operatic singer.Going to the basilica is a destination in itself, so the music made the trip extra special. We were in Budapest for the Christmas Markets and there was a wonderful one just outside the church. On the steps of the church were red votive candles in the shape of a large heart. You could stand in the middle of the heart and have your picture taken.

A beautiful basilica. Made famous by the mummified hand of Saint Stephen, this basilica is worth a visit for its beautiful interior design and artwork. Entrance is free but a small donation is kind of expected.Saint Stephen's Basilica is a must visit for Budapest.

Elegant beauty. Coming here the day after the Matyas church meant that the contrast between them couldn't have been more stark; both are very beautiful churches, but the basilica is far more elegant and refined. For the very reasonable 200Ft entry donation, the chance to look around the many stunning altars and the stone and gold leaf arches was a sight not to be missed. The Chapel of the Holy Right Hand of St. Stephen has several useful information boards about the man and the relics, although you have to pay a further 200Ft to see the hand itself, which we declined to do, given the sufficient pictures nearby. The Chapel itself is well-decorated enough to be worth a look.
Beautiful. I suppose most people might go to see the shriveled hand of St. Stephen. But the church itself is nicely restored. Make sure to look up at the gorgeous dome and frescoes.

St. Stephen's Basilica - Budapest, Hungary. Gorgeous!!! I wandered there independently and returned the next day with a tour guide. I think the tour guide really added a lot to the experience. Guide took us up to the cupola...I hate heights but I am glad I stuck it out....What a view even on a cloudy and dark December day. With the guide you get some history which helps explain the layout and why St. Stephens is important to Hungarians. Take a look at the placards outside as they will tell when a concert may be taking place so that you can hear the music.
Worth the climb to the Tower. We paid 500 HUF to walk up to the Tower - the views are great over to Buda Castle and the Parliament too.The church is stunning, and worth a look.

Magnificent!. Everything inside was soooo magnificent: great arts, colours, the form of this basilica and its atmosphere. You could also take photos there; the only thing, where using flash was forbidden, was at the holy right hand. The priests who were watching there could not unfortunately speak English or German, so without guiding you could not get so much.

1000 year mummified hand in a gorgeous church. Even on a cold, cloudy day this church is beautiful. For a 400 Forints you can climb 320 stairs (and finish with a short elevator ride) to the top for a panoramic view of the city. It felt a little mysterious being in the innards of the basilica dome and hearing the bell ring below. Another "200 Forint "donation" gets you into the church proper. Amazing red marble and gilded accents create an ornate but tasteful house of worship. There is a side chapel (inside left) where the hand of St. Stephen is kept in a fancy crypt. Drop in a 200 Forint coin and the case lights up for a better photo.

Stunning interior to beautiful building. Well worth a visit just to admire the beautiful interior with an abundance of gilt work and marble. Walk to the back to see the mummified hand of St Stephen, bit gruesome but had to see it !Entrance to the cathedral itself is free but a small donation can be given on entry if you wish.If the weather is clear, pay a few euros and climb to the top of the dome. Views are wonderful, especially over the river towards Buda hill. If it's cloudy, don't bother as you probably won't see much, there is a lift that takes you half way up, and stairs for the final ascent to the top. We decided to take the stairs all the way, 341 in all, one way of working off the large hotel breakfast !
Stunning. Don't miss looking inside this place no matter what your religion, it takes your breath away by it's beauty. Also a fantastic building.
Basilica. This is a beautiful building building both externally and internally. We attended a concert there and the acoustics were tremendous.

Beautiful. We were unable to visit all the Basillica as there was a rehearsal for a concert. The inside of the church is stunning. As others have stated the donation is monitored by a priest therefore it is not a donation. We paid a small amount to go the roof which you can either walk or take the lift. Brilliant views from the cupola.Do visit this beautiful building.

You have to go inside to really appreciate the full beauty. St. Stephen's Basilica (Szent Istvan Bazilika) has been the backdrop for many of our pictures in and around Budapest for the past week, even the pictures taken from the Christmas market in the courtyard in from of the Basilica. However, it wasn't until the wife and I actually managed to go inside that we truly realized the full beauty of this church. For a small fee (donation), the church will allow you in and they do allow limited photography (no flash in some areas). Make sure you explore all the way to the back of the Basilica to see the small chapel and reliquary that holds Saint Stephen's hand and another alcove that holds the Black Madonna.
Utterly amazing.. Breathtaking.Inside has to been seen to be believed. we were luck enough to be there when a service was being held. The sound was beautiful.

atmospheric. provided an excellent and beautiful backdrop to the Christmas market, and was also used for a brilliant light show on its façade, would have liked to attended an advent concert in the basilica, but unfortunately unable to

Very nice Basilica. I'm not really a Church addict but visiting that amazing basilica was fantastic. The inside is magnificent, huge, full of colors and quiet.We just have been disapointed by the view on the roof, it's maybe because the sky was cloudy and it was raining a bit.Negative point is that the explanation are sometimes only in Hungarian and German, not even in English.Entrance is free, it worth to have a look inside !

Beautiful. You can't come to Budapest and not spend 2€ on a walk around St Stephen's Basilica. Jaw dropping architecture, well worth a look around (if only to stand and ponder how on Earth they *did* build it back then).

Wonderful. A must-visit sight in Budapest! A beautiful restored Church standing proud in the city centre, just a few minutes walk from where the hop-on hop-off bus stops.Free admission allows you entry into the 3rd largest Church & its galleried dome.Depending on the time of your visit, enjoy Mass or an evening of organ music.A lovely place to visit especially in December with its small but very Christmassy market in the Church's square.

Picture-perfect!. A group of us walked from the hotel on Grand Avenue to the basilica, completely enjoyed it! There was a small Christmas market in front of the church including an ice skating rink for kids. The stalls were so quaint, selling chocolate, handmade Christmas decoration, mulled wine, breads and everything else!I picked up some chocolates, fridge magnet manger scene and some miniature figurines.As soon as the sun went down, the pretty lights came on and the entire place turned into a magical winter wonderland! Highly recommend a quick visit if you can.

well worth a visit. Do not miss this church for a short visit. the interior is fabulous. Sit down and lean back and let the detail of the frescos and decorated columns mezmerise you. we visited at xmas and there is a small Xmas market at the front which adds to the attraction.

St Stephen's Basilica. The Basilica is as phenomenal inside as it is outside. A group of eight of us just visited Budapest for a long weekend. My wife and I were fortunate enough to attend 12:00 Sunday mass where the priest's sermon on the Gospel was summarised in English by one of his deacon's, It was refreshing to attend abroad and not only follow the order of the mass.

The tower is a must!. After milling around the Christmas markets in front of the Bastillica we took a look inside, it was very grand and pretty to see. However the best part was the view from the tower. There is a small fee but it is definitely worth it. The views are amazing; you get a full view of the city and it is very beautiful. There is a lift to the top but a staircase of about 20steps from the lift to the top of the tower.

Christmas christmas. There was a christmas market in front of Basilica. And they run light and music show on the wall of it. Very nice.Decolation was beautifle. We went to a short classical concert in there, well known music were played and even my husbond who is not a big fan of this kind of musik enjoyed the concert. Not so long neighter. It was cold and lady's toilet was broken but it's not a big problem.I wanted to listen the organ concert as well but unfortunately coult not make it. There are many concerts there, just check on net and be there.

Beautiful. We visited this church and went up on the top panorama balcony, which gives a great view of the city. The interior of the church is amazing and is worth a visit, not matter your religion. We also attended a classical concert here, which was a unique experience.

Nice views from tower. Visit church when you are in Budapest and do not forget to go up! It costs little, but it is worth every cent. Take the stairs up to the dome and you get first nice views to staircase (spiral, but good steps). Up you have wouderful views to every direction. Safe and not too hard if you can walk about 200 steps.

St. Stephens Basilica. Its worth paying the extra 200 HUFS to see the mumified hand. This is not easily signposted once you are inside the main church/basilica, but head towards the back of the building through another set of doors. Also worth paying is the trip up to the dome for the views of the city below.Lifts (elevators) are available.

worth the "trip". St. Stephen's Basilica is in the middle of where you want to be, so it's certainly worth stopping into. You can see this gem from across the river on the Buda side. I'd recommend visiting at night - it's stunning.
Great visit. Loved the basilica with all of the painted roofs and Walls , we went at Christmas and enjoyed the light show at night . I would recommend a visit

It was beautiful!. My husband and I went inside to view the Basilica as it was adjacent to our hotel and it was great. Its about 200 huf to view which is really cheap and you get to view the church. Make sure you go before 1600 so you can see St. Stephen's hand! Loved it!

A mysterious beauty. A dark and beautiful Church. For a small donation you can see a genuinely moving piece of architecture that is better than a ya Sophia in Istanbul and notre dame in Paris well worth a visit.

1€ entrance. Pretty dark inside even on day light.
At Christmas time, they had a light show going on on the facade (bright colors) that wasn't really good looking.
And this "royal hand" relic is a bit weird for me.
Very grand church indeed. This dominates the skyline of Pest and is mightily impressive inside as well. Highly ornate, it is a fair,y impressive piece f reconstruction work. Shouldn't be missed.
Friday Night Concert. I got the impression it was a regular thing. Don't miss hearing the incredible pipe organ in person. Definitely worth the small price of admission.

a beautiful building - great atmosphere. Well worth a visit, this church is very well cared for and beautiful inside. Don't miss the dome (let's be honest its difficult to miss!) Entry is by donation though you can pay a set charge to go up the tower and visit the Treasury. Great atmosphere in the place. When we visited a visiting choir was giving a short impromptu concert which added something very special. You can even see the 'Holy right hand of St. Stephen' in one of the chapels.

Climb the tower!. The church is much of a muchness as far as these buildings go and you'd be hard pressed to remember it. However it is worth paying the small fee to climb up the tower. You get a fantastic view of all of Budapest from up there. You'll need to be lively on your feet though. There is a lift for 4 persons so in summer you may need to wait.

Marvelous pipe organ concert. To hear the Basilica come alive with sound, be sure to attend a pipe organ/vocal concert - which is the best value for money among the musical events that were performed there. I do wish the recitalists had said something about their musical selections, though, as many listeners could have appreciated the repertoire much more.
Beautiful building. This building is beautiful - both inside & out. I was prepared to have to pay to enter so was pleasantly surprised to find you need only leave a donation.
Wonderful view. Very impressive and a wonderful view from the tower. There is an elevator (buy a ticket) and there are stairs(free) as well. Can be very crowded in high season.
Enjoyed St. Stephen's. What a spectacular basilica to visit. We were impressed with the history and beauty of the building.

Fabulous view. Visited the basilica on a Monday morning & it was busy. Paid the small fee to the very uninterested young lady & went up the tower. It was well worth the walk up to see inside of the top of the dome & to walk around on the balcony outside the dome. The basilicas interior was beautiful and the holy relic was defiantly different!
Spectacular interior. This is an impressive basilica with great stonework and art inside. Even the bronze work on the exterior doors is amazing. Definitely worth a visit.
Wonderful. You certainly cant miss it. Huge, grand, stunning , go , it's well worth the visit. Entrance is a suggested donation of 200 Huf, which is nothing.
Nice Cathedral. The inside of the church was pretty. I saw the relic of King Stephen's hand. Don't remember which hand was mummified naturally.

Sightseeing tour. I passed by this important church in budapest. It is a good architecture piece. But I wasn't impressed as they told me because I saw some buildings in Turkey have the art of architecture more than this church. But you have not to miss it when you are there also you have to go to its top to see Budapest from a different angel.

bring a coin to see the creepy hand. The severed hand of St. Steven is hidden in the rear chapel, and you have to drop a coin in the box to light it up. The hand was returned by the allies, after saving it--along with the crown of St. Stephen--from the Nazis and Communists. the building itself is relatively new--the cupola collapsed during construction and the whole thing was only finished in 1905. But it's well worth the trip. Nearby is Starbucks--with clean bathrooms.

Amazing! Not to be missed. We went here twice, once during the day and again for an evening organ concert (not my cup of tea normally but it was quite awe inspiring).The building internally is absolutely out of this world and I would recommend anyone visiting to spend at least half an hour looking around.

Evening Concert. We looked around during the day and booked an evening concert, available 3/4 nights per week. Zoned free seating. Beware of ill mannered fellow guests with itchy feet and mobile phones but apart from that a very pleasant way to spend an evening.
Lovely view. The perfect place to see an amazing architecture. The building is impressive and the view it's really greate. Must see in Budapest!
