More interesting outside than inside. The outside is truly spectacular, especially lit up at night. But the inside is standard baroque and not very interesting.
My favorite place in Budapest. This was my favorite place. Beautiful and mighty church but also a relaxing square with coffee shops to relax. best ice cream in town.

Take the lift to the top!. I admit it, I love Hungary and in particular Budapest. On the Pest side, apart from Parliament Building, another impressive structure is the St. Istvan Bazilika. It is a superb building and apart from the interior which is on par with most other large or special churches, you can take the lift up to the top and walk around the outside of the dome. It is a spectacular view. I have taken a point off for the rudeness of the priest (or person asking for donations.) I actually saw someone get yelled at for not putting in money, I told him that I had just paid to go on the roof and I wasn't paying anymore than that. I'm not sure he understood, but I have been tricked before with Hungarians who can speak English!There are plenty of 3D photos of the Bazilika on 3D City Explorer, my app for iPad. If you are thinking of going and would like to see it in real 3D, get the app. It will twist your arm I'm sure.Regards, Ken.3dcityexplorer.com

Amazing architecture. An extremely large cathedral which is ornate and has tremendous architecture. Whilst it is free of charge, a donation is expected and a priest is standing by the entrance door with a calculator (which appeared somewhat strange) calculating how much the donations should be. Make sure you take loose change with you otherwise the donation if in bank note form may turn out to be sizable!

Large and impressive. .Just as our group of 33 pilgrims were entering the Basilica, a tall thin man waved angrily at us and uttered many words loudly. We knew we were not welcomed here because he thought we were tourists. We beat a retreat to the large courtyard outside.As we gathered round her,our pilgrimage leader informed us that she wouldn't be able to use our pilgrimage flag anymore; that we should all co-operate to keep close to one another once we enter. Even then, the cautious man was still muttering under his breath when we entered the building gingerly.Once inside, we were struck by its grandeur and size. This was indeed an impressive building with stunning stained-glass windows, sky-high ceiling with beautiful pictures. There were some giant-sized marble statues near the entrance. The whole atmosphere was one of deep reverence. Maybe this accounted for the 'cautious' man's earlier behaviour.Later, we were shown the Reliquary where we venerated St. Stephen's right hand. It was shrunken and grey, but a touching sight to behold.Really worth a visit here.

Stunning. Both stunning inside and outside. As you approach from the outside it os truly a magnificent building standing in the centre of the city. We went in and paid 200huf (70p) as a donation and it was well worth it.. The insode of the dome is wonderful. We stayed for approx 20 mins and it is a mist do whilst in Budapest. We returned on the evening when all lit up and that is alao a must!!

Definitely worth visiting for Organ Concert. We visited the Basilica specifically to listen to the organ and singing concert on a Monday. A truly beautiful experience to feel the music wash over you whilst your eyes are able to absorb the powerful and dramatic images in the church.The interior has a solemn calm beauty about it, with amazing pink marble in different shades depending where you look, gold leaf decorations without being over the top, and really lovely frescos. There is this great balance and contrast between the white and light of statues, ceiling and altar, offset by the darker columns and flooring.For me, this was the best way to absorb the basicilia. I've been to a number of churches where you you just go in, go 'yeah ok very nice' maybe read a pge or 2 of a leaflet, and walk out. With a concert, you have time to think and ponder on the images you are looking upon and give yourself time to appreciate where you are.I saw reviews saying how some people didn't want to pay the nominal donation to go and visit the church, or when they paid and saw it they weren't impressed, or there wasn't enough information inside - If those reviews are causing you concern and you fee like you want to do something to get your moneys worth and more I can definitely recommend this.There are concerts on various nights - we went on a Monday which has the shortest and cheapest (even less with a Budapest card!) concert of 45 minutes. The duration was perfect for us and the music selections were easy to listen to, you don't have to be a music aficionado (we certainly aren't!). Afterwards we walked about the church to explore and take some pictures too.
Just amazing. We went to Sunday Mass. The interior is as ornate as any cathedral we have ever seen.The sunlight came through the windows and added even more light and atmosphere.Do go.

Not worth the visit- very plain and empty onside. The Basilica is not worth the visit if you have already visited St Mathias Church in castle hill as it pales in comparison in terms of beauty and the interior is very plain. It is funny that you must pay to visit a normal parish church as it looks very ordinary and cannot be compared to those Churches in Vienna, Paris or London. If there is one church you will need to visit in Budapest, this is not the church- go to St Mathias church.
great churches. the history was fantastic, i loved the fact that i walking tour guides were so knowledgable and very helpful. The thing i didn't like was it became very repetitive after a while.
Interesting, superb views from the gallery. Wonderful Bascilica, but be prepared to pay your entrance fee, or be harassed by the priest on the door!

Beautiful place of worship. To enter the church go through the door to the right. You will be asked for a donation of 200 hug which is less than a pound. Sit and take in all the works of art and the dome itself. If you go to the back of the Church on the left hand side there is a doo through to the Chappell of the sacred right hand. A bit gruesome but you mat as well take a peek whilst you are here!

Excellent for concert, but ill-lit in daytime. Visited during the day and found very interesting, however a bit gloomy. We visited on a Saturday.On the way out we encountered a desk selling tickets for that evening's concert - so we bought!There was an organ performance (of some Bach) which was excellent, followed by Mozart's Requiem performed by full orchestra, choir and soloists - most enjoyable ... and the bonus of the Basilica being well-lit so we saw it as it's best.Recommended!!!NOTE: you need to find such concerts for yourself as the Tourist Advisory booth in town centre said that the only concerts in town were on Thursday evening. Other fellow travellers also found performances available at the Opera House!

Best christian place of worship i have seen. Not been to rome but been to many other churches and cathedrals. This is a place to beat them all. Amazing architecture both in and out. Equivalent of 60p entry so much better than st pauls. Better than the church on buda hill.

Gorgeous interior, go up the tower. We were able to visit the Church for free as a mass was currently in service. The interior is lavishly done, amazing architecture with marble everywhere. A really beautiful Basilica that sticks out from the many I have been to. I would recommend paying the minimal fee to go up to the tower! We visited around dusk and the views of Budapest and Buda were gorgeous!

Go to the roof!. The best part of this catholic church is the roof (you have to pay around 500 Huf) and the capela with the hand of St Stephens. Not so crowded as i expected especially during the afternoon

Short visit. I visited the Basilica in the evening because it was raining most of the day in Budapest. Maybe it would have looked more breathtaking during the day, because the rain made it look gloomy. The interior of the basilica was well constructed and decorated. Small fee needed for entrance. It is really quiet inside (like any other religious site) and the walk around the church would take only 20 minutes.

Major Budapest attraction. I wasn't tremendously impressed with the basilica, but of course you should see it as as one of the central Budapest landmarks. It is quite modern compared to many other European basilicas and cathedrals, and just does not have the same panache for me. The 200 florint 'donation' that you must pay before entering is very inexpensive and shouldn't deter you. There is part of St. Stevens mummified hand in a reliquary in a chapel at the back. I think I would have enjoyed a concert in the church very much and would like to try getting to one when we return. I skipped the tower this trip as it was very overcast and raining and I had a grumpy toddler in tow, but I would love some pictures of the view.

Try to visit it. The church is really beautiful and majestic and it provides an excellent view from the top over the city. It is very rich decorated and has a lot of wonderful details. You have to make a small donation, but it will pay off.
Wow!. This is a very impressive church with its massive red marble interior columns. Wandering around inside will amaze you.

An amazing experience. I was very lucky to hear a concert in the Basillica. The combination of the sights and the heavenly music gave me a real thrill. I was floating filling for a moment i am in heaven. I recommend it with all my heart.

A very beautiful building. The basilica is very beautiful and is free to get into(they ask for a donation on entry) you have to pay to climb the tower, via stairs or lift! However it is worth doing to get fantastic views of the city!

need to visit if in Budapest. This is a great Basilica with interesting relic! Charge is 200 HUF to go in the church, and to seethe relic properly you have to put in 200 HUF for a light to come on in the glass case for 2 minutes to see it. The interior of the place is very dark but beautiful with lots of gold decoration. it is very peaceful and an amazing view from the top.

A must see. A must see attraction in Budapest. Very grand with exquisite detail and grandeur. Very reasonable donation to be made too. Obviously, not as good as st peters in Vatican city but still you wouldn't want to miss it

Gorgeous Church; Amazing Relic Inside. When you travel through old Europe your eyes begin to glaze over when you go through too many churches. It's impossible to remember the details of each one. But this church, with its black and gold interior, intricate carvings and marble work, and the actual hand of St. Stephen preserved as a relic, is one you will remember. I went to Mass there one evening and although it's impossible to understand even a syllable of Hungarian, it was nice to sit through the Homily and just look around, feeling like I had a private ticket. Easy to get to and worth seeing.

Wonderful view on the top. I like Budapest, because there are plenty of places , from where you can have a wonderful city view. One of these places is the Basilica. You can walk to the top and look around. It is a wonderful church to with marvellous decoration.
Exquisite. One of the most beautiful churches I have ever seen. We climbed all the stairs in spite of the elevator that was available. The view from the tower is breathtaking.

A Must See. Just because you've seen several Basilica's already in Europe, don't think you can give St Stephen's a miss.Each one has it's unique story to share.While appreciating you can't have a guided tour at every venue, or have every language featured, it's a shame when you visit places like this, with such an obvious rich history, with each artwork telling a story, or statue sharing a meaning and not have an opportunity to understand it.Despite that, it's a feast for the eyes.

Wow. We have seen many cathedrals around the world, but this one has something special. We entered on a Sunday afternoon, and were fortunate to hear a choir recital. The atmosphere was one of peace and contentment. Other things may be happening in the world, but here one is glad to be alive. Afterwards we were lucky enough to witness an "impromptu" orchestral concert, where all the musicians appeared from out of the crowd, entertained us for 10 minutes and then dispersed.

Wow. The Bazilika is very beautiful. We gave 200 Ft to enter and then 400 (student fare) to get to the top ! It was totally worth it. It was our first day in Budapest and we got to see the city from above and it is really got as a starting point ! We also got to see the hand of the first King that is in one of the chapels! An impressing human piece preserved over 1000 years !

Most beautiful church I've seen, and I live in Europe. We decided to go and see this Basilica while waiting for our hop on bus and I am so glad we did. It was absolutely stunning and so lavish. I spent a good 45 minutes with my jaw dropped at the opulence of this place. Go see this. I live in Europe where I have seen my fair share of churches, cathedrals, and basilicas and this one blows them all out the water!
Many stairs. But there is an elevator, so don't worry even if you can't do stairs. It's worth going up for the view.
Fairytale. Looking at the Basillica our guide gave us the history. The building is beautiful. Plus it was a beautiful warm day the sun was shining, reflecting off some of the gold freezes, stunning.

Organ Recital. We were lucky to find out there was an organ performance one evening of tour of Budapest. It was wonderful! Of course, the Cathedral itself is beautiful, we went up to the dome one afternoon for a bird's eye view of the city, well worth the hike up.

Well worth a visit - go during a service. By accident, our first visit happened to be during an evening service and there was no entry fee/donation. The sanctuary was beautiful and nicely lit - we took a few photos (definitely without flash) and were glad we did as we visited the basilica on another day, with no service, and it was fairly dark inside and those pictures didn't come out very well. There was a small entry fee for our second visit, and also a small fee to take the elevator up the tower (the view from the top was well worth the minimal price). To appreciate the full beauty of the interior, go when something is going on and the sanctuary is lit.

Breathaking!!. Please enter by a small donation. If you can afford to visit this beautiful city, you certainly can afford a small donation used to care for this cathedral! It is beautiful and very ornate. I think it is worth the visit and the contemplative moments it affords.
Go to a concert here. We went to an organ concert in this beautiful basilica. The acoustics are amazing. I highly recommend it. You won't be sorry.

Lovely building. The donation to go in is very small in comparison to other great Cathedra, but well worth the visit. The main nave is very ornate, and very tall, and the little chapel to the left contains "St Stephen's hand" - a famous relic which is the subject of an annual festival.A trip up the tower (extra donation) is well worth it to see the panoramic view. I went up the stairs but there are two elevators to get you to the summit. A further donation is required to get you into the Treasury, but I did not feel that this was really worth seeing.

Beautiful. Entry by donation - and there is someone watching!very opulent, can pay extra to go up the towerphotography allowed.Don't forget to try the ice cream over the way, amazing visually and taste
Worth visiting. It has limited interest for the non-religious but still worth a visit. I always light a candle in big churches (and small ones).

Beautiful church.. Beautiful church. Elaborately decorated. Quite spiritual.Climb the stairs to the viewing area on the cupola (elevator also available). I climbed up for the exercise! :-)Great views over Budapest.Recommended.
WOW. I don't like church/religion etc but this place is just BEAUTIFUL. Well worth a walk round just watch out for a crick in your neck

Hard to Miss. St. Stephens Basilica is in the center of Budapest and easy to get to as it seems all streets seem to end up near there. It is almost overwhelming but really worth the visit . You can even walk to the top for an incredible view of the area. There is a small chapel in back on left side with a religious relic of St Stephen's right hand which is not something you see every day. (He was canonized in 1083)

Is there a concert?. While there are older, larger, and more interesting religious sites in Eastern Europe St. Stephen's has a very active music program. Stop and see if there is a concert or other musical event. They will be selling tickets and giving information in front of the Bazilika. It is well worth the time and effort. We enjoyed a beautiful organ recital with flute and voice. Something special. After the concert a short one block walk to Sas Utca street and many excellent restaurants. Enjoy!

Tallest Steeple. You can't miss seeing the steeples of St. Stephen. We lucked out getting in to walk around just before a wedding was to take place. We got to see the relic hand of St. Stephen and get to marvel at the beautiful dome and architecture.

Lots of steps. We initially were only interested in going up to the dome and that was spectacular. There were lots of steps! We decided not to take the lazy option of the lift! There is a small exhibition about 2/3 of the way up which was a nice relief. Just seeing the inside of the dome was pretty interesting but the view from outside was amazing! Well worth the climb.Inside was spectacular but I have issues with the amount of money that gets spent on these places so I will leave it at that!

Great place. This is a must to go and visit once you get in Budapest, it is located in the Pest area and it has a great architecture detail, you can a magnificent view of it at night when its lightened, definitely dont miss it if you´re in town

Wonderful concert. I viewed the church one day and returned the following evening for a concert.It is huge very ornate church which is a lovely setting for a concert. Good choice of music and performers particularly the organist.

Catch a musical performance. There was a string concert that we were able to attend. The setting and acoustics were wonderful. The Basilica was beautifully lighted and the entire experience was very uplifting.
Big and very pretty. Unfortunately I didn't have the chance to get inside due to some festive plans (the Pope was there), but from the outside you can see how beautiful it is.
Amazing. Wonderful place inside. Wasn't too busy which was a plus. Didn't go to the top but will try it when we revisit. Definetly worth a look.
Pretty amazing. Colorful Neo-Classical building on a very grand scale. reminded me a little of St Peters in the Vatican. Be sure to purchase a ticket to take the elevator to the top for a great view.
cathedral. Superb building. Magnificent architecture. Spent a couple of hours wandering around. The view from the top is fantasticbut the climb to get there can be a bit daunting.

Opulent Church. There was some construction on the outside when we visited but the interior of this church is breathtaking. On our trip to Budapest, we visited quite a few churches but this one should definitely be on your must-see list.

Take the time to climb it!. It is a beautiful basilica, and I did not perceive it as gloomy at all (unless you have an aversion to mummified relics). For a small fee it is fun to climb the stairs (322) and see the interior above the dome and the really spectacular view of the city from the porches outside.

Rather dark and gloomy. It wasn't the most interesting church that I have ever visited. The explanation of the difference between a cathedral and a basilica was interesting - not something I knew before. A basilica has to have holy relics. The local guide made a great deal about the heating system, but it didn't differ from similar systems all over the world!

I'm not into visiting churches but this one impressed. Travelling through Europe it is easy to get overloaded with too many churches. By the time I arrived at this church I had already seen enough but I must say I was very impressed with the building and the history it contained.
Beautiful but that mummified hand is creepy. Beautiful architecture, a bit dark, so adjust your eyes. Some places give zou the creeps... well this one has a mummified arm behind the main alter.

Impressive basilica with fine artwork. Visiting Saint Stephen's Basilica is priority #1 in Budapest. It is impressive and situated very centrally in Budapest. There are many shops and restaurants close to the basilica.

Beautiful Church, Not So Attitude. This is a beautiful church, but not exceptional by European standards. What is with the priest at the door collecting what is supposed to be a donation? We paid but really.........

Por fuera es bonita It is a very nice view. Es una construccion imponente, no demasiado grande pero muy trabajada.
It is a building in nice aspect, Your size is medium but it have a very hard work.

Basically a Beautiful Basilica. A wonderful and very grand building, with wonderful open piazza.
A beautiful backdrop on a warm sunny afternoon to Lunch in the bar NEGRO. Beautiful Goulash soup and a bottle of Hungarian wine in the sun just hit the spot!

Big ornate church with a mummified arm in a box. Very spectacular from outside. Lovely square with a very incongruous modern building up one side. Inside, enough gold and stuff that could do an awful lot of good to an awful lot of poor people. Contains the obligatory body part. Interesting tale of how the roof fell off. Original building not much older than the Queen Mother. A must see all the same.
Must see!. The enormous church... Great historical, and religious site. U HAVE TO SEE IT, if U're in town!And if U can donate some, well... U'll see... It's worth it :)

A Beautiful Place. St. Stephen's Basilica is worth the time and you certainly can't miss it! My husband was obsessed with the story of St. Stephen's hand, Hungary's most important relic. You can go "visit" it but it was hard to make out any features.

Well worth the donation. Our visit was very brief indeed. Comparable with other city centre Bassilicas. Beautifully painted dome, a lot of marble and gold leaf decorating the alter and all around the church.
Magnificent Church. A must see when in Budapest. Definitely up there in church visits with great art, architecture and history. Well worth the visit.

Beautiful Basilica in the heart of Budapest. I love this basilica. It is not as large or grand as some of the others in Europe, but it is a beautiful place that should definitely be seen by anyone travelling to Budapest. It has some rich history and some incredible artwork in the back rooms. Definitely worth it to spend part of your day here!

A Worthwhile Stop in Budapest. Budapest was a fabulous city, but after visiting numerous cathedrals, churches, etc. on a 2-week river cruise, we found that after all we saw, St. Stephen's was the most memorable and beautiful, so make time to see it when in Budapest…it's convenient to everything else you'll see!

Stunning!!. This beautiful basilica only asked for a donation of under a pound per person to visit and when we walked in I gasped at the lofty beauty of this stunning architecture. It was very light and bright and full of glistening gold - a true feast for the eyes.

It's Old and Dark, But It's Fabulous!. We visited as part of a Catholic pilgrimage, so I must confess a slight bias!This is the oldest church in Budapest and is dedicated to the man who brought Christianity to Hungary. The interior is uneven with some areas being fabulously beautiful while others are very ordinary, but the feeling of history and connection is unmistakable.
Wonderful Basilica. The venue is well worth a visit even if you are not religious. Spectacular place. A lot has gone into the creation of this sacred place to pray.
Budapest Basilica a must see for all. The Budapest Basilica has been newly restored and is one of the WORLD's delightful and gigantic homeages to The Lord Jesus Christ.

Lovely facade, beautiful Interior. If you are like most travelers, you will have pictures of dozens of grand churches in Europe and the Baroque basilicas will all merge into one memory. However, St. Stephen's is somewhat unique in that the city has protected the courtyard from intrusion of other buildings. From the Danube side, you can actually get far enough away from the building to photograph the whole thing (unlike it's counterpart in Vienna). It's worth a tour (a "donation" is required...) and the ubiquitous climb to the top of the lantern.

Beautiful cathedral. Gave it only 4 because they nickel and dime you. Pay to get in, pay to see the hand, pay to see the Treasury, pay to see the view from the tower... However, the cathedral itself is stunning.

Welcoming to all. This basilica is not only an architectural gem, for me it was a place of spiritual renewal. The magnificent organ can be heard during services as well as at concerts. Personnel, from priests to ushers, were welcoming and helpful.

On a clear day!. I've been to the Basilica two times and two times I have climbed to the top for the superlative views. I climbed all the stairs because I like to see the underpinnings of the structure itself. I have also seen the Sacred Right Hand--very dimly lit. The cathedral itself is dramatically ornate. For me, the best thing is the climb.

Beautiful Basilica. In addition to seeing the church and climbing to the top, we (totally by chance) also recd a tour of the crypts underground. I learned about St Leopold and the many famous footballers buried there. The church itself was truly beautiful as well as the chapel of his right hand.

Breathtaking 360 view from up top. For a minimal price you can do your daily exercise up those stairs (or take a lift) to see the city from the highest landmark in the city. Exceptional view! I would recommend going up the stairs because when you get close to the top you see the whole inner structure of the dome. Inside the Basilika is very nice as well. I wasn't asked to leave for wearing short shorts even though it's not recommended.

St Stephen's. If you're a church junkie make this a definite stop in Budapest. You won't need more than 45 mins. Although it was free a 1euro donation was suggested before you entered, all good to help!

Great views of city from the top.. Fantastic building and well worth the 500HUF to pay to go up to the top of the basilica. Great views. Not too crowded which was just as well as the viewing platform at the top is quite narrow. I suppose the charge keeps some away.

St. Stephen's Basilica. It has some beautiful details inside the church that are worth a look. Its in a location that easy to step in and look without taking up too much time. They ask for a donation to enter.

Amazing what you see inside and on the top.... ...and also what you do not see. You must know that the basilica was partially destroyed a couple of times, and rebuilt as it was - what you can't notice at first time. It's hard to calculate the cost, and how qualified the artists were who did such beautiful work in marble, iron, ceramics, and wood. Each detail should be appreciated for a long time, if you were not pressed by your tour's timetable. As a panorama lover, I strongly recommend going up to the top of the high tower (there's a lift, and some inevitable steps) from where you have a 360º view of the extended city. If this is your closing visit, you can identify the spots you visited before using one of the (convenient) sightseeing bus tours.

Fantastic building, great views from the top!. This building is beautiful from the inside and out. A small donation of 200HUF is asked for on entry. In a chapel on the side of the main building they have the preserved forearm of St. Stephen. Weird but worth a look.Definitely go up to the top of the tower. It costs about 500HUF and you can choose either to get the lift or climb the stairs. (we got the lift, much easier!) As the highest point of Budapest it offers great panoramic views of the city.

Great Architecture and History. If you like architecture, the basilica is very impressive inside and out. With effort can go to the top via a circular staircase where you will find a breathtaking view of the city. We attended a musical concert in the evening. The singers were so so, but the organ was amazing and you could feel the building vibrate from the tremendous sound.

Poor, for the people, not for the building. I had experienced one of the most unpleasant moments of my trip in this church. I do not care if there is a fee to entrance in a church, I pay it and that's all. But I really dislike the practice of saying "no fee" and when you try to enter they charge you with a "contribution". I tried to enter with my husband and son and a very rude man dressed like some kind of priest told me there is a "contribution" (not at all voluntary, the man did not let me pass if I did not pay) of 200 HUF. When I took the coins out of my pocket to look for the amount requested, HE ACTUALLY TOOK THE MONEY OFF MY HAND and put it in the moneybox, with a rude and very fast movement, without letting me say anything. When we tried to enter, he stop me and said it was 200 HUF each, not the three of us. Very much upset, I look for 400 HUF more and I have only a 500 HUF coin. He said he could not gave me the 100 Huf return because it was not a fee, it was a "contribution" (that word again). Meanwhile many people passed by without paying, because he was very occupied arguing with me. I did not want to argue anymore, so I turned around and went away. The church was very beautiful, with a stunning dome, as I could see in the photos took for my husband (he could enter with the first 200 HUF), but I repeat, I do not care paying a fee entrance if there is one, it seems reasonable for me, because I suppose that a very big church as this has a very expensive maintenance. What I can not stand is this kind of lie, and much less the unkindness in the way of treating people. As a catholic, I think this kind of behaviour makes a little favour to the way people see us, especially being a money issue.
Bigbigbig church. Beautiful, large church in a beautiful square. Indoors magnificent art, stained-glass windows etc. Definitely worth a visit.
Don't forget to look up. Huge Basilica in Central Budapest. Optional donation of 200HUF on entry. Not a huge fan of cathedrals but the cupola is wonderful. Worth looking at.

An amazing structure. St. Stephen's Basilica is a beautiful structure. It is well worth your while to go up to the very top of the dome to see the view of the city. This is not a place to visit if you have any difficulties walking or climbing stairs, as the elevator they do have is very small and it takes a long time to get up or down from the Dome, however in the end it was worth the effort.

Concert in the basilica.. I'm not very keen on these grand, over decorated churches /cathedrals, they all tend to look the same to me...but we enjoyed a concert there one evening. A chance to hear the massive and splendid organ at work, together with a violinist, trumpeter, soprano and tenor, in various combinations. A fairly light mixed programme of music, the organ had a tendency to overwhelm all but the soprano, who had a wonderfully warm rich tone. Musical purists will not like the acoustics, (an amazing echo) but it provided a very enjoyable interlude and the basilica lit at night, is probably at its best. It started at 8p.m. lasted about an hour and a half and cost us £30 approx, which rated against the Opera is quite expensive I think.

Sunday concert. It a very pleasant surprise to discover that on Sunday - 29.9.13 - there was an orgue and voice concert. The organ player was excelent and so were the different singers that participated in that concert. The church is very big, so the echo and reverberation are overwhelming. An event never to be forgotten !
Amazingly beautiful. For someone from the west US where our building that are 50 years old are old, this was quite impressive. The architecture was absolutely stunning.

Domed Basillica in tribute to Magyars. The Maygars settled in Hungary in 896. When designed, the dome was built 96 meters high...and it collapsed. Then they used the expertise of the Italians and rebuilt it. Lovely and many beautiful chapels within it. Top of list "Must See".

Lovely concert in beautiful church. We only visited the Basilica for a short organ concert one evening, but sitting in the dimly lit church with hundreds of other people listening to music being played beautifully by the young deputy organist (with a soprano singing in occasional pieces) was really superb. They offer several concerts and it's a different, and rather special way, to appreciate the beautiful building and its atmosphere. (I wasn't too keen to see the mummified hand of St Stephen anyway!).

Very Busy. Brilliant very good looking building for near and afar always a very large line up to get in a woman goes round collecting an entrance fee, the fee is only to be paid if you are viewing from the top no entrance fee if you are just going into the church its self.

Interesting church with optional visit to the dome. We visited the basilica and took the lift to the dome where we had good views of the city. There was a most interesting exhibition of "Work Fragments" by the artist Torok Peter with full descriptions in English.
Largest Cathedral in Hungary. Aside of the priest collecting your "donation" for entry very large and ornate. Good picture taking opportunity. Great pics of facade after dark.

Beautiful Cathedral. Beautiful interior to the Cathedral. If you can climb 302 steps I recommend the climb up to the Cathedral dome for a spectacular panoramic view of Budapest and beyond, cost 500 HUF/£1.50.
Worth the effort. This is a very grand church, it is very ornate with a great dome, well worth the visit. Looking back from The square outside give a real feel of the size of the place.
Marvellous!. What a beautiful Basilika. We visited during the day and at night, when it was dark. Quite different experiences. Absolutely stunning, not to be missed.
Great views from roof. You can take the lift to the top of the dome and get great views over the city. The basilica is lovely lit up at night.

Very beautiful. The basilica is a very attractive building. Inside, the amount of gold is amazing, the paintings are beautiful and the stained glass windows are stunning. The soaring architecture is also very impressive. Worth a short visit.

Nice basilica in historic surroundings. Located in the historic castle district, the Basilica is one of the most see sites in this area of Budapest. Once you find the cashier/admission booth, it is a short walk to the entrance. Nice views from the top. Worth the admission price and time

In a place like Budapest, would rank as just okay. The church is good, well-maintained, with some nice stained glass, paintings and gild work. But it's nothing special - there are many like this spread all over Europe. And in a place so special as Budapest, this church would rate just about average.

Another Christian Architectual Triumph. One could spend all of vacation time visiting churches in Europe. If you've only time for one in Hungary, this is it. St. Stephen's will floor you with its beauty. It is a superb example of Hungarian art and architecture. Lovely altars covered with cloths embroidered with flowers, impressive ceilings, and soaring windows. Well worth the time. Be careful, though; visitation is often closed off in the evenings to accommodate concerts so go in the morning or early afternoon.
Worth the climb to the top!. We climbed to the top of the tower, views are fantastic and worth the seemingly endless spiral stairs.

Great view from the top. The church is beautiful lots if gold leaf, and St Stephen is glowing at the altar! His mummified hand is available to view in the aptly named Chapel of the Holy Right Hand. Go up the tower for a panoramic view over Budapest. There is an elevator too if you are not up for a huge climb

A Must See. This Cathedral is very impressive. It has the most beautiful painted ceiling I have ever seen and there is so much gold. The relic of the first kings hand can be located in the church. Totally speechless a must see for all.

Has a "Positive" Aura!. Have seen many churches, cathedrals and other religious places, but not everywhere I could feel positive feelengs. This Cathedral is really impressive one. I liked it vey much. It is great and want to repeat it has a very "POSITIVE" aura!
Wonderful view from the top. Recommend to take few stairs up to see Budapest from the top! If you go there when bell are ringing, you will really enjoy !

Go for an organ concert!. Try to go for an organ concert at St. Istvan's Cathedral, it's reasonably priced and well worth the price. There were 2 organs (a small chamber organ and the great organ), one mezzo-soprano and one trumpet player. It was mesmerizing...the acoustics were amazing (given it's a church, not a dedicated music hall). You'll feel so close to God...
Must visit. Churches are everywhere over Europe, but this is really special for Hungarians. Is beautiful and a donation entry for about 1 euro.
Well worth visiting. The Basilica is impressive and well worth visiting, and also the outside view from the dome, if you can cope with heights!

Beautiful and Good Value for Money. Very pretty inside and impressive, a lot of gold and high ceilings.
Worth a trip to the top, amazing views and reasonably cheap.
Great history. A site of deep Hungarian history and outstanding architecture. The basilica has many pieces of the foundation of the religious background of this beautiful country.
Basilica With A View. Venture up to the top and snap some great pics of the city. Also gorgeous inside. Snapped many pictures of this experience. And to think we almost didn't check it out!

Gorgeous. This is one of the most beautiful basilicas I've ever seen. I was lucky to even catch a band concert on my way in. The detail is amazing to m - makes our American churches look so simple. It's easy to get to, and stands along on a big square. Don't miss it.
Fabulous. What a beautiful cathedral. Only wish we could have spent more time here. No matter how many churches you may see in Europe, and there are plenty, each one is worth a visit.

Heart of the City. Among the many "musts" in visiting Budapest, St. Stephen's is at the top of the list. This glorious basilica sits on a spacious square, which makes approaching it a majestic experience. It contains the relic of St Stephen's arm - a bit gruesome but a definite piece of history. It is just off Deak Square and a short walk from the Parliament where you can see the actual crown of Stephen. Combine the two visits for a moving experience. If you're ambitious you an climb to the dome. I believe there is also an elevator. I declined on my visit but I did climb the dome at Estergom, where Stephen was crowned.

Beautiful Building. the basillica is beautiful inside and the views from the dome are quite stunning, well worth a visit. Go to the ice cream shop to the left as you come out (2 doors away from the central hotel), their ice cream cones that look like flowers are out of this world
Beautiful church. Had a tour of this basilica and up to the tower for a fantastic view of the city. The inside of the church was beautiful as are most European churches.

One of the most impressive church.... ... all over the word!
Looks like even better than several churches, even in Vaticano.
Worth visiting!
And Budapest is absolutely outstanding!... enjoy!

20th August. This is his day and we happened to be in Budapest and visit the Basilica too and participate in a bit of the Eucharistic celebration as we were hard pressed for time. it is a grand Church a bit different from the rest and the painting on the dome to be admired. A must visit to this grand basilica

Concert - Acoustics Please?. Not the best place to hear a concert - acoustics are not the best and the chairs are so uncomfortable. Got the feeling its more about the experience of hearing an organ in a church, then actually enjoying the music.
Just worth a visit. Closed for a service when I visited so just got a peep but enjoyed climbing the tower - missed the saint's finger though!

Beautiful building, fabulous acoustics!. A beautiful and impressive building with a wonderful dome. Whilst we were staying in Budapest we were lucky enough to go to a free concert in the Basilica. The concert featured Woodside Priory School Choir from the USA. The young students sang beautifully for an hour without musical accompaniment. The acoustics in the Basilica were amazing and the sound of the voices carried on for several seconds after the students had finished their musical pieces.
Enjoyable. As we like to climb, we found this Basilica with its 300 and somthing stairs - fun! And of course you get to see the panorama up there, so it worth everything.

Beautiful and worth the tiny fee to visit. Absolutely stunning and worth the visit. The entrance fee/ suggestion donation of 200 forints is tiny and very well worth it for how stunning the cathedral is.

Simply stunning. This church is said to be the most important Catholic Church in all of Hungary. There is a lot to read and see with regard to the rich history of this church. Keep your eyes (and ears) open for the wonderful concerts conducted here from time to time. A truly unique experience.

Soooo Interesting...... It's so interesting to me to read other visitor's reviews of St. Stephen's Basillica. Yes, it is not Notra Dame, nor is it St. Patrick's in NYC, but it is truly unique and worth visiting. Unfortunately, St. Stephen's hand is so degraded since the first time I saw it as a 9 year old girl in 1972, it doesn't hardly even look like a hand anymore (as if you can even see it in the dark room and light protected enclosure in which it is kept), but that's beside the point. Although the church itself is overall very dimly lit and dark, the amount of green, red, brown, and white marble is truly astounding. I have never seen so much marble in one place in all my life. And then, what isn't marble in this church, seems to be gold! The lighting fixtures, the statues, the ornaments, etc, etc. And the organ is absolutely fantastic too. It is HUGE! I only wish I was able to visit long enough to attend a concert. Also, try to pay attention to each nave and it's according stained glass windows...they are all designated and tied to important Saints, Kings or Religious Figures that were very important in the history of Hungary. If you take the time to explore each and every corner of this religious monument (and it is truly almost hidden), you will find a beautiful, portrait of the Virgin Mary, crying tears of gold! But the absolute best part of St. Stephen's is when you take the elevator and go up into the basillica itself and then you get a 360 degree view of the city of Budapest. It is so fantastic to see, not only a different vantage point for all the tourist attractions, but an actual look down into and out over, the neighborhoods where regular people live and work everyday. Then you will truly know...Budapest is a thriving and growing metropolis! You can't keep good Hungarian people down.....

The Basilica. It was very ornate and we enjoyed the fact that no one made any advances to us as we walked around the church. Interesting to walk around the crypt? area where the hand of St. Stephen is kept. Recommend you go see it.

Entrance fee. A bit disappointing that this time around, entrance fee of 200 huf is requested before entering the Cathedral, which a few years ago did not exist. But maybe due to the economic problem in the country thus was probably one way to maintain the Cathedral. It was ok to pay, but did not like this feeling of having to pay to pray!

Nice, you'll see from anywhere in town. This is a nice cathedral, and worth the 10 minutes it takes to walk inside. There is nothing really special to see here, yet it is one of the most important landmarks of Budapest.

Stunning building. This is one of the highlights of Budapest. The interior is stunningly beautiful. The preserved arm of St Stephen, in the chapel to the back of the basilica is an "interesting" relic. Take the opportunity to go to the top of the dome (the lift is the easiest way) because the view from the exterior is really wonderful.

An impressive monument!. This is a stop to include on your visit. The basilica is one of the largest in Europe and is beautiful. It houses the relic of St. Steven (part of his hand) and is a central part of Budapest history. It is worth have a tour guide for the interesting tidbits about the site. We recommend you include this church for a stop on your visit.
Absolutely beautiful..... Such a beautiful cathedral. It is breath taking! We were lucky we got in to look around & say a few prayers as it was soon closing time. A must see while in Budapest. :)

Very impressive building. One of the largest basilica's we've ever seen, if the the largest altogether. It is supposed to be able to house 8000 people, but when we went inside we couldn't fathom where those people could be held. What we knew from large churches in France was that almost all of them have some small information leaflet in a number of different languages. This however was not the case in this basilica, if we wanted to have some information we were obliged to buy a book. Not doing this meant we didn't understand most of the sights in the church, so our visit was relatively short.The main attraction in the basilica was the chapel with St. Stephan's right hand. This right hand is best seen with the lights on, but you need to pay money for these lights. This is beside the money you need to pay to light a candle and the money they want upon entering the church. Keep in mind however you are not obliged to pay an entrance fee, entry is free!The basilica itself is, beside very large, also very beautiful. This shows even when we are not able to read the signs showing what is depicted. Also we would have liked to have had a tour in and around the basilica, but we didn't see any opportunity for this.

Old World Architectural at it's best.. We were lost in the beauty. As we travel through Europe, cathedrals are a high point in our itinerary. St. Stephen's did not disappoint. The organ is amazing and worth the visit. On our visit, we saw there was an organ concert that night. One of our group left the tour and stayed for the concert. He said it was the best he had ever heard.

Beautiful! Check Concert Dates. We checked and there was a concert while we were in town but we were not sure whether we would have a schedule conflict since the trip was a business trip. We were able to get over there in time for the concert. TIP: You can save money by buying concert tickets in advance. They sell tickets daily at the entrance to the catherdral. If you are going to the concert you do not have to pay the entrance "donation" for other visitors.
good place to visit. The church is located at the city centre and it is very convenient to visit. Can't imagine how people can built such a nice church. Worth going.

Beautiful. This place is indeed beautiful from the outside and also from the inside. You can see it from blocks away and also from the other side of the Danube River. It has special meaning to the Hungarians on August 20. A must to visit.
Beautiful Building with Gruesome Hand. Took a quick tour which included a peek at the severed mummified hand of St. Stephen himself. Beautiful square out front with wonderful photo opportunities

A pity if you miss this. This is smack on the square. if you intend to take photos, then do it on weekday because on weekend, there are lots of stalls set up around the area - view blockage. The church is a must visit!

Beautiful architecture and ambience. This church is awe inspiring and will totally engulf you. The beautiful architecture that has been painstakingly restored, the epic interior, the beautiful sculptures and religious relics will be a great experience.
Do light a candle when you are in there and sit in the pews for a few minutes of silent reflection. You will feel rejuvenated.

Beautiful church. The church is very central on the pest side of the city, the paintings and statues are amazing .the building is one the tallest in the city, and you can go up into one of the bell towers to see a excellent view of the city.
beautiful. didn't do tour as thought it was expensive but just paid 200 HUF to look around and it was beautiful inside
Great - plus check it out at night when lit up. Well worth a visit - we were close by so got to see it many times from different angles - always best at night with its lights on
St Stephen's. A MUST for all visitors to Budapest. The ceiling is breathtaking though the 1,000 year old hand is probably not worth a wait.
huge and imposing. the cathedral is beautiful inside, worth a look. be prepared to give an obligatory donation to enter the cathedral
Very impressive. Huge and impressive - definitely worth a visit! Cheap to get in and there is a lot to see. Lovely huge stained glass window and beautiful chapel
Beautiful Church. This is a spectacular church, I loved the location. The alter was so impressive as was everything in it.

Hungarian mass. The Basilica is impressive to visit, and, for a small charge, you can take an elevator part way to the top and then walk up a steep flight of stairs to get a view. I enjoyed going to Hungarian language mass (with brief organ music) on Sunday with the local worshipers. There's also is a Latin mass and there are evening organ recitals.

Amazing. A beautiful church, an amazing view of the City from the top and helpful and friendly staff. Part of the church was closed off because of a special children's choir concert. We were lucky enough to hear them practising which was incredibly moving. The acoustics helped but it really was like listening to a church full of angels. Worth every penny and far cheaper than the Great synagogue.
Must see. Nothing express the beauty of this Holly Basilic. Well built with an awesome design and architecture.
Beautiful interior. While the outside of St Stephen's is impressive......the inside is awesome.....absolutely reverent and beautiful and exciting all at the same time....if that is possible!
Panorama terrace. The church is really very nice, but as usual our family likes panoramas from the top. On this church it was perfect, maybe helps sunset during our visit

Take the elevator. It costs the same to climb the stairs as to take the elevator to the panorama. Weather permitting the view are wonderful. The interior of the church is frequently closed for services or weddings so all you may get to see is the panorama and the treasury.The treasury is just ok. You wouldn't miss out if you skipped it.
Beautiful. It is a beautiful Basilica from the inside and out. You can go up in the tower and get a great view over the city only we were there a little early and didn't get to go up

The Hand. This church is just as beautiful at night as in the day time. The outside is all lit up at night. The inside actually has the hand of St. Stephen so that that it can be viewed. A great restaurant is nearby in walking distance called Razekakas. The food was great!
Beautiful. went to see a Mozart concert, great...........The price and music was very good. Acoustics are not perfect but the setting made up for it.
St. Stephen's Basilica. This is a beautiful Church!!!!! Shouldn't miss it when visiting Budapest. Inside - it is very ornate but not gaudy at all.

Must watch it!. Impressive neo-classic church, that simply takes off breath. You can go to the top and see the city. It has the hand of the founder, St. Steban. There are lots of nice coffees around, to watch it for hours.
beautyfull. It was so different from some of the other Churches we had seen on our trip thru Europe. I loved the tile roofs and the great few of the City.
WOW. Probably the most stunning building I have ever been into. I almost didn't bother going in but I would definitely recommend going inside! Well worth it

Impressive. It is the fourth time we’ve visited this church but as always I find it very impressive. It is certainly a must see for everyone visiting Budapest. I would recommend everyone after visiting the Budapest Opera house to walk after that on the Andrassy Street towards the St. Stephen's Basilica.
Place not to be missed.... Amazing architecture, worth to visit it. It's walking distance from Vaci street. On top of it Subway & Starbucks are just meters away...

Beautiful. Definitely worth a visit. Cool on a hot afternoon. If you're not religious it will be 45 minis - 1 hour well spent.
P.s There is a ice cream parlour opposite (lavender by name or similar) has lovely ice creams and loos. After your visit take a seat across the square and enjoy the view.

worth a visit. Very nice building has a portrait of the Black Madonna in The black Madonna chapel. By the enterance you can pay and take the lift up to the Dome once there you have a panoramic view of Budapest.

Climb to the top of the dome. We climbed the 302 stairs to the top of the dome and were rewarded with a lovely view across the rooftops. Great to pick out other sights in the city.
Inside the basilica is breathtaking - marble, gold leaf and stained glass
Do pay it a visit.

Even an Atheist.. You dont have to believe in a God or Gods to visit this Basilica. Even an Atheist would love the building for simply its construction and artwork. Give it at least 30 minutes of your time.
Great view. View from the tower was well worth the hike up all the stairs although there is a lift - which we found afterwards!

Very interesting.. We had the luck of co-inciding with St.Stephen's day on the 20th August and attended the mass conducted on the square outside the Basilica. We visited the basilica on a later date and enjoyed the impressive interiors. Though we don't have to pay for visitng it, there is a priest at the entrance who kindly reminds us to pay about 200 florines for the care of the Basilica.

Stunning building. Small donation to get in, took the lift up to the roof and did the touristy stuff, the view would have been fantastic on a clear day, but it was January and it was a wee bit foggy, however, went back on the Sunday to take in the mass, an excellent service (non-parishioners sat at the back, which is fair enough) beautiful interior also.
Heavenly!. Regardless of our religious views or lack of them you will not fail to be impressed with this beautiful building. Second largest outside Rome. Breathtaking!

Wow....Stunning building.. This is a very impressive building. You can go inside for a small donation and see the fabulous interior. Nothing to say that hasnt already been said already. We went on Sunday and there was a service on so your were limited to where you were allowed to view. Take a walk all round the outside though its awesome

Awesome. Fantastic site, amazing size and beautiful inside. Not too difficult to see St Stephens right hand. Also a choir on the day we visited made it feel very atmospheric. Entrance via a small donation, we gave 500 HUF

Touristy but worth a visit. As ever when visiting places of worship it is so hard to get a feel for the space with a marauding mass of tourists and guides. As we were one of the hoards of Tourists we were as much to blame, but how nice it would be if one could have been lucky enough to visit on a more tranquil day. But Mid August was not the best time.A huge monument to the craftsmen who built it, do queue up and see the reliquery of the hand of St Stephen in a side chapel.

Beautiful Budapest Basilica. Our guide took us to this Basilica on a Sunday morning which made it a little difficult to wander around during the service! However, we saw enough to decide that this lovely church is well-worth a visit. We were particularly impressed with the wonderful red marble, the stone-work and the stained glass, and I would strongly recommend a visit if you are in Budapest. I can't be sure if there is a charge, but I suspect that a Sunday visit during a service is probably free, though a little restrictive!

Breathtaking. It's definitely the most beautiful church I've seen - every single piece there deserves to be called a masterpiece! The only drawback lies, unfortunately, in often really disrespectful behave of tourists who seem to forget that above all, it's a place of religious cult - they're taking photos and doing sightseeing during Holy Mass!

Go to a concert if you can.. They have weekly concerts in the church. When we were there we were treated to the organ, a trumpeter, violin, soprano, and tenor. And the cheap seats are even great. Good acoustics.
nice view from the top. I liked this basilica very much, it is big and very old. you can walk up on the top and have a wonderful view of Budapest.

Saw a concert there. We visited the Basilica the evening that we went to the concert with two organs playing along with a singer and and a trumpet player. It was about an hour long and very enjoyable.

Amazing Interior. The Basilica is situated walking distance from the Danube promenade and most hotels. Its beautiful interior shows the heritage of Hungary at its peak. There are many good restaurants around it as well so when you plan to go there plan enough time to have a meal in the area.

the centre of peace and beauty. Stunning expirience to observe such splendor: magnificent statues, stained glass with images of saints, paintings on the walls and ceilings; and above all the atmosphere of tranquility and peace.

Beautiful church. Awe inspiring church. It is very big and the surrounding area is so lovely. SIt and have a coffee at the starbucks right there or walk around the promenade. It is amust see in Budapest.

Beautiful basilica, the heart and soul of Budapest. Every bit as beautiful as guidebooks and other reviewers say. Sumptuous gold. One of the most unusual relics you're likely to come actoss ( a clenched right fist). If you're lucky enough to be in Budapest on August 20, St. Stephen's Day, you can see the relic paraded around in an outdoor procession, carried in an ornate box on a litter by members of the Hungarian Army, then watch fireworks over the Danube that night.
One of Europe's most impressive Churches. If at all possible, do try to attend one of the many evening concerts that are held here regularly. What an unforgettable experience!

Another beautiful church!. I have been here a view times. Its another beautiful church in the center of Budapest. This time we went on a saturday and it seemed that there was one wedding after another. Very busy place!

Amazing church.. This is a large, beautiful building. When we were there they had a wedding going on inside the church but they were still letting people in to see it. We had the opportunity to hear the large organ being played and view someone getting married in this grand church.

Beautiful. We had flown from the US and went out for a walk in the late afternoon, and we decided to stop in and see the church. It cost us a euro each to get in, but if that helps with the restoration of the church, it was a great investment. The interior was quite spectacular and beautifully restored.

Beautiful welcoming church, lovely views of Buda. St. Stephen's Basilica is a wonderful church where one feels peace and may get in touch with his or her inner self.. Despite being large, the atmosphere inside is warm and welcoming.. For lovely views over the Buda part of Budapest go up in the tower ;)

Must see!. This is the most important saint in Budapest - St. Stephen. This basilica is so beautiful. Be prepared to have at least 200 HUF as a "donation." There are postings in English, but it would be so much better to read beforehand about the history. We didn't take a tour, but we thoroughly enjoyed our visit. Take your time. We wished that we could be there for the special celebrations on August 20th, but we returned two days before.
very interesting. A beautiful building with a great atmosphere and lots of history. Very good area around the basilica, too.
Must-see if you have a cultural bone in your body.. Spectacular inside and out. One can't fail to be impressed. Take a trip up the tower for great views of the city.

Beautiful perfomance. Whilst the Basilica was impressive, we highly recommend attending the organ concert. Our program included 4 other soloists (a soprano, tenor, violinist, trumpeter), the acoustics and music was wonderful and of a very high standard.

Signature sight. The first Christian king of Budapest. Beautiful basilica. Didn't care for the mandatory "donation". Enforcer stood by the donation box making sure all who entered paid. Why not call it an entry fee? Something to do with it being a church? Well worth the visit. Small chapel in rear doesn't have to be seen.

Beautifull. Very nice, no fee, but you will be forced to give a small donation :), interesting relict a hand from a St, Stephen is unique, our kids loved it :) The paintings and all interior was a must see!!!
Stunning. One of the highlights of a trip to Budapest, this is a truly beautiful church. The basilica is huge and inside the frescos /artwork are stunning.
Great place to drop in. This church is unique in that St. Stephen has a prominent place on the alter while Jesus does not. Very intriguing to see.

Lovely place. Situated in a very nice area, the basilica is hudge and impressive. The plaza in front of it is lovely and perfect for some nice pictures. Inside, a great architectural building makes you stay in as long as you need.

Great view. - 360 view of Budapest, ideal for panoramic pics- 1000 huf per person- the elevator takes you to a certain point, the rest of the way you need to climb a circular small staircase (iron made and stable)- outside gift shop provides a wide range of artifacts to buy for your love ones

Climb to the top.. This church is gorgeous! The red marble inside is beautiful and all the other decorations are incredible. But probably the best part is the view from the top. It's relatively cheap to climb the stairs and worth every penny and step! The views are amazing and really give you a taste of how big Budapest is. Make sure you go!

Large and Grand Church. The basilica is easy walking distance from the Deak Ferenc ter. The entrance is on a plaza. On a Sunday afternoon the church was busy with tourists but still managed to maintain some semblance of quiet and dignity. Hungary loves statues and the basilica is proof of that with many placed in the church. I prefer to not use a flash while taking pictures in an active religious site. Not everyone feels that way and the constant flashes of light can be a distraction if your visit's purpose is prayer and contemplation rather than gawking at the splendor.There are relics in the church and if you are moved by the remains of those who have come before us then they are certainly worth a visit.
Beautiful inside. We were on a tour and drove by the basilica. We went back and were amazed at the inside-very ornate decorations. We also attended a Sunday Mass and wer able to hear the organ music.

Impressive gilt ceilings hoards of tourists. Whilst no official charge to enter a attendant at the entrance made it very obvious a "donation" was expected Fine understand costs of upkeep but he was very insistent the donation was not voluntary as initially presented Magnificent structure well worth a short visit we didn't visit the treasury or go up the tower so can't comment and whilst we were there the chapel housing St Stephens hand was off limits
More than a church.. It is a beautiful church with a tower offers a wonderful view of the city. I highly recommend this wonderful place!

Brilliant view of the city. Religious buildings really aren't my thing but we spent our time in Budapest wandering around and this was recommended in our guidebook. I'm very glad we went in, actually.The inside of the building is beautiful, and you can't really see the Holy Hand if I'm honest (so not worth seeing on a busy day!) but it's a nice kind of symbolism of the connection with St Stephen.There was an exhibition of paintings in the attic (ish?!) room you have to go through to get to the top, and although the paintings really were pretty awful, it's nice that there's something else to do besides just trek up some stairs!The best thing was the view at the top. Magnificent.

A Church with a View. This landmark is worth stopping off at. It is great to look at and admire from the ground level but if you are feeling energetic the walk up the 300 odd stairs to the gallery provides great 360 degree views over Pest and over the river to the beautiful Buda.
Impressive. Looks very impressive from the outside and lives up to the promise inside with exquisite decoration. A huge building that the crowds get lost inside. Well worth a look.
Great view from the top. You can tour through the church including going up to one of the highest points to view the city. Beautiful church with alot of history.
Huge. This is one of the most stunning Basilica's I have seen. A must see even if you are not into churches, so very rich in art and history. Can even see the hand of St Stephen.

An extraordinary church. I had not intended to spend any time in St. Stephen's. We were actually headed to another building, but I had some extra time so I donated the "requested" $2 and went into the Basilica. An hour later, I was so glad I took this detour. This Church is unbelievably beautiful inside. Even in late afternoon, there were crowds of people coming and going. It is a must stop for any visitor to Budapest. One nice note about this Basilica: Photos are allowed to be taken inside. That is very nice, considering the dome is fantastic from the inside, and there are many angles and much artwork to photograph.

Do not miss the chapel. For awhile, I thought church visits are short. Coming here, we followed a line on a small entrance inside and found ourselves viewing the severed hand of Szent Istvan in an ornate box on the altar.It was a totally remarkable experience for us to be able to view a relic.
Interesting interior. The interior, and exterior with coloured tiles, was interesting. Needing to pay to turn on a light to see St Stephens hand was a bit bizarre.

Magnificant outside and inside. The cathedral is in the middle of the city. It is an excellent piece of architecture. There is a big tuble organ inside and organ concerts are held on certain evenings in the week. Closeby is a good gelato shop selling excellent ice cream.

to drink a glass of wine. Basilica is a msut to see in the city, BUT !go there late afternoon, or in the evening, especially, friday os sat, and you will see crowds, staying with a glass of wine, at some good restaurants. Try is, It is FUN, DeVino is one of my favorites, but the others are good as well. Take a glass ( 600 HUF caution) and ask the stuff to recomment good hungarian wines, I recommend to taste St Andrea white wines, or a good risling .If oyu are done there, follow to Gozsdu udvar, Kiraly utca , great placees, not far from Basilica, 5 min walk. Go there ! FUN !
Dont leave it out. Even a service could be interesting (on sundays it is in Latin language partly). But the building is amazing. You cant see so much of these amusing places.

nice place to sit and have a drink. basilica was lovely and there are several bars in the square where it is nice to sit and have a drink and admire the basilica. also have an ice cream from the ice cream shop in the square - yummy

Gorgious Church. St Stephen's Basilica was wonderfully restored recently and definitely worths a visit. It is located in the heart of Budapest close to other landmarks - the Parliament is within walking distance from here. Very unusual in a Catholic church: it is a king, King St Stephen, who is in the main altar rather than Virgin Mary - this is to recognize his merits in extending christianity in Hungary a thousand or so years ago.
Excellent view. One of the must see in Budapest. Excellent view from the top. Cannot only walk, you can take the elevator as well.
SEEN TOO MANY CHURCHES. Whilst this is a beautiful building, by this time I had seen numerous cathedral's and this was one too much. Nice for those who love going to very cathedral in Europe

Beautiful!. What an immaculate church. The Hungarians LOVED St. Stephen. They have his mummified right hand here, well most it. They have literally cut parts off and given it to neighboring allies. The church itself is among one of the most beautiful I have ever seen.

Impressive and somptuous. The entrance is so impressive and dominates the whole square, and as you come along the main road your sight is captured by this building and you no longer pay attention to the surrounding buildings, one of them being the Four Season Hotel and its ArtNouveau style. The inside of the basilica takes your breath away, the columns, the marble, the sculptures and the impressive altar make you feel so small and you forget that your are a simple tourist and think about spirituality and religion. The reliques of St. Stephen are also vizible.

Beautiful Basilica. This basilica is very similar in some ways to St. Peter's in Rome. It is beautiful architecturally inside and out. You can take the elevators to the top dome and walk around looking at the city. It houses a famous relic, the right hand of St. Stephen, said to indicate his sainthood worthiness because it was found relatively (using the word loosely) unchanged after his body was dug up. The domes are magnificent. If you can, attend an organ concert which are offered frequently. During the Christmas season, there is an Advent Market on the square in front of the Basilica. It was one of the best Advent Markets we attended last year--even better than the ones in Vienna!

A MUST IN BUDAPEST. This church its a must while in Budapest. Its big , impressiveeven if you are not religious. the entrance its free , but a guy in the door asking donation for the church. for a few forint more you can take the elevator (on the left side just before the entrance) to the to floor for a nice view of Budapest.

Lovely inside and out. The church is beautiful and so big. It's worth it to go to the top for the views. but take the elevator. It's doesn't cost any more than taking the steps and those narrow spiral staircases with people going up and down on the same tiny stair are not my favorite things. This Basilica has a very strange relic but trust me you will have to see it.

Wish I went inside.... We past this church so many times while we were in Budapest, and not going inside is one of my biggest regrets of things we didn't have time to see while we were there. I advise you to see go and walk through, I hear it is beautiful- don't regret not seeing it like me!

Impressive. Truly a must do. Fabulous building and deservedly a landmark of Budapest. Not only are the interiors rich and imprssive but the square where it is situated is almost the heart of Budapest's tourist district

Architectural masterpiece. The entry to the basilica is paid, but it is more a collection for renovation costs (min. 200 HUF) and these have to be huge, as you realize as soon as you enter the basilica itself. I like to visit religious buildings, and this is one of the more beautiful I've seen. There is also the option to enter the dome (paid), but I didn't take it. Right next door (on the right stood facing the church) is the most famous ice cream shop in Budapest (Gelarto Rosa) with the best ice cream. After visiting the basilica I recommend to buy there an ice cream, sit down with them on the steps of the church and listen to the bells (only on the hour) :). You just have to ignore the disgusting, not fitting into place, socialist building on the right. ;)
St Stephen's Basilica. Free entry but recommend a donation. Take the trip, cost involved up the tower to look over the City, well worth the climb!
Interesting. Just in the center of the Pest part, with a nice place in front of the church and some street with a lot of bar to take a coffe or just relax.
A great place. This basilica is really a great place to visit. The ceilings are wonderful !! One of the top site of Budapest .

Basil. Yes it is worth the visit and it is lovely. The area also surrounding the Basilica is very nice too.
Regards Gary Saunders

A memorable mass. We attended mass at St Stephen's Basilica in early July and it was a lovely experience. Although I've never participated in a service with camera flashes going off behind me. The mass was in Hungarian and the congregants mostly locals, and it was an honor to share their beautiful church.
A holy place with a lot of history. It is worth following a Sunday mess in this church, you will really be impressed and feel the holy atmosphere of such a sacred place.
St Stephens Basillica. Very nice church, right smack in the middle of the city centre. Well worth a visit. A good place to cool off from the heat of the city.

All that glitters!. This church built in the latter part of 19th Century is a tribute to St Stephen, the King, Saint and Hungarian leader who died in 1038. His mummified right hand is on display in the side chapel that bears his name.Interior of basilica is of massive columns of red marble and much use is made of gold leaf. The ceiling is liberally adorned with frescoes, stucco work and paintings.Entry to Basilica is by way of a donation. ( There is no charge). Cameras are allowed and there is no charge for them. They do ask that no flash is used. The side chapel "of the right hand" is also free and worth a visit, and probably the best reason to make the visit. Interesting that the statue of St Stephen takes precedence behind the alter, and the cross is relegated to a side of the Basilica.
Views from above. Great views of the city from above! Definitely worth the climb upstairs (or take the elevator part way up).

Majestic Beauty in the heart of Budapest. We were lucky enough to have the opportunity to tour the Basilica during the daytime and then attend a magnificent concert that evening. The accoustics inside this majestic cathedral are incredible. The experience brought me to tears.

Really disappointing!. Not old and little there - very large but you can cover it in 15 minutes max. There is a charge for entering (tour books say there isn't). There is a charge to take photos and another for vids. There is a charge to go up to the doom. There is a charge for the museum that is lacking. There is a charge for the WC. There isn't (yet) a charge for breathing.

Majestic in all respects. A small entrance fee lets you into one of the most ornate and interesting basilicas you will encounter. The colored marble interior competes for your attention with the magnificent dome and the religious artwork. Don't leave without a visit to the room behind the altar that holds -- and exhibits -- the hand of St. Stephen.
Breath-taking Basilica. Sadly there was a wedding when we got inside and our access was limited to the side of the church, but the view from above and outside was amazing!

A must see in Budapest. It will take your breath away! The architecture, the interior ornamentation, the high dome above the main alter, the stained glass windows. The Basilica could have been in the Vatican!
St. Stephens Basiilica. Incredibly impressive church, the inside of it was spectacular. One of the many must see places in Budapest.

Amazing view. The Basilica itself was in the process of wedding several couples as we visited, so the tourists were relegated to only the side aisles. While the church is rather dark, it is quite interesting to visit. Nominal fee for entry. What makes it rather more worth it is to pay the fee to take an elevator up to above the dome. It brings you up to the braces of a building, then a set of stairs and you are up on the walkway at the level of the towers. Very beautiful.
a must see. This is one of the churches one must visit when in Budapest. It is beautiful and there are concerts advertised locally. Don't miss it.
Another European Cathedral. Nice but not much better than others. Worth a walk through to get out of the summer heat. Be careful of the crowds that assemble out front.
Beautiful. Gorgeous, regal building. The exterior is particularly lovely at sunset. As it is surrounded by cafes and restaurants, you can take a seat and enjoy the view.

A beautiful cathedral!. Since the is Hungary's main cathedral, the ~150 building is absolute beautiful inside. There wasn't a fee to go inside, but being Saturday, it was wedding day and tourists were allowed to look in from the back corner. It wasn't the best way to see the cathedral, but I respect that a wedding was taking place and the last thing anyone wants is loud tourists taking photos. I am glad I took the time to see this church.
Beautiful Dome. The interior is even more pretty than the exterior. Although there is a small 200huf compulsory fee.

Beautiful interior!. Pay the small donation to get inside because it is truly beautiful! The ceilings are so ornate and detailed. Definitely worth the visit. Also, in the back chapel is the "Holy Right Hand". Just check it out, creepy cool.
Beautiful. St. Stephen's Basilica was a short walk from our hotel. It is a wonderful piece of architecture. Entry is free but you need to pay extra to climb up to the cupola. We did not
Shiny. This is a large church with some great details. Make sure to look for the hand of St. Stephan in one of the chapels on the left side!
Sad Catholic. How sad to pay to enter a place of worship that was filled with picture snapping irreverant loud tourists. This is weong in so many ways.

Amazing Acoustics. We decided to go to one of the weekend evening concerts and were really glad we did. The inside of the building is spectacular but sitting listening to lovely music was an added bonus. Do go if you can!

WOW!. This church was absolutely beautiful! It is huge inside and the detail was phenomenal. It is "free" to go in although there was a priest asking for a $2 donation to put into the donation box. There is an extra charge to go up to the tower. I did not do that.

Breath taking. and I dont just mean the climb to the top of the tower, which is worth it. The Church treasury wasnt worth seeing for me, it's really small and all in Hungarian, but if you speak the language by all means! but the actual sanctuary itself is of course magnificent. and the square it leads out onto is bustling with activity.
Hijarna . Highly recommend point of interest and the cupola costs only 1,5 euro, excellent view on the city's rooftops, the Danube and Buda

Holy creepy hand!. It is indeed a great place and the top attractions are the dome's view and the holy hand! Well, you'll need to pay if want to see both! I'm not joking! The hand is inside a glass reliquary which is all dark and it is necessary to add 0,50 EUR to have 1 minute of light inside!

Stupendous. Wonderful piece of architecture and close to my hotel.
