We walked by it twice every day and enjoyed the basilica as well as the square around it - a beehive of activity with people milling around, musicians in the evenings, a wedding on Saturday, lots of open air restaurants - a great atmosphere
Magnificent Church. A must see. Right in the heart of Pest. Knowing that St. Stephens' finger is in a box and seeing pictures of it is a bit spooky.

Calm & Peaceful Church. We visited on a Saturday and a wedding was happening in the church and thus the main section of the Church was cordoned off. We could see from the Aisles only. The Church is a beautiful piece of architecture and history.The painted glasses are beautiful and so the all the are sculptures are gorgeous. The ceiling is also very very beautifully painted as well.

Just beautiful!. Coming from an Atheist who loves to visit the classical European churches, this is one not to be missed. What was even more amazing was that we unknowingly stopped by during mass and there were singing. It was pretty special.

A must see church. St. Stephen's is a must see attraction when visiting Budapest, and we wandered in here on the last day we were in town. As far as churches go, and we were in many on this trip, St. Stephen's is a little different from an architectural standpoint. Most churches have long aisles, this one is squarish. The ceiling ornamentation is beautiful and it's definitely worth a visit.

Beautiful interior. We went as a group and all agreed that the interior of the church was stunning!We went it just after mass in the morning as you cannot enter and look around until the service is over. You can take photo's and they come out really nice, but as most would know- nothing like the experience of being there.

Ignore Rick Steves on this one. An impressive church with a magnificent interior. The Rick Steves guidebook promised disappointment but we were delighted to disagree and were thought the Basilica was beautiful.
Stunning. For 1 euro you are able to go to the very top of the basilica and enjoy the panoramic views. An absolute definite with many bars and restaurants within meters.

Wonderful concert at this gorgeous church.. We attended the Friday evening classical music concert in this lovely basilica. It was majestic inside, the musicians were extremely talented, and it was so wonderful that it was an emotional experience. I would attend again if I was lucky enough to visit this beautiful city again in the future.

Fantastic views. A beautiful church, but the main attraction for me is the views from the observation area-you can see the whole city. It's quite a trek up there-2 lifts or a LOT of stairs, but well worth it
Beautiful ambience. The ambience is very beautiful. The square in front of the church is spectacular with manyu people who live there.

Beautiful, especially at night. St. Stephen's Basilica is definitely worth seeing while in Budapest. It is in the heart of many things to do in the city and it's construction is awe-striking. You may tour the inside of the Basilica for very cheap during the day hours. If you come to see the Basilica at night it is beautifully lit up.

Stunning Building with a 360° Views. Our apartment looked onto the Basilica which was a stunning view to wake up to every single morning (see pic). After days of looking onto this building and watching the crowds outside it and up the tower we decided we had to check it out. When we entered there seemed a lot of confusion about where people should go and the staff weren't very helpful. The woman at the Tower ticket booth ignored my requests for tickets three times in a row. Once we got our 500 HUF tickets to go up the tower we decided to take the lift rather than the 300+ stairs. The lift staff were very pleasant. Once we got out the lift there was again confusion and lack of sign posts to direct you to the tower balcony. We eventually found the 5 or so flights of spiral stairs you have to go up to get to the tower. Probably due to the lack of signs, there was a number of visitors coming back down the very thin stair cases as we were going up which made for some awkward moments. When you arrive at the top of the tower you are greeted by stunning panoramic views of Budapest that, for the small price, are very worth it.
Beautiful. The first word I think of is beautiful! It is an awe inspiring experience to be in this basilica. The intricate details in the art work and the building itself is amazing. Incredible!
Amazing architecture. A beautiful building that is worth a visit. We went to a night time concert here of classics which was definitely worth the money.

Fantastic church, not the greatest venue for vocal soloists.. Went to a classical concert here.4-5 individual performers.Great for trumpet, organ but due to the high ceilings voices (which were stunning) got lost. Not the right acoustics sadly.
remarkable church. words cant describe the experience. the inside of this basilica is just extraordinary. the opulence !!! well worth a visit, metro just nearby or hop-on off bus
Wow!. Most impressive cathedral. The alters the ceilings the paintings are something to behold. Walking up the steps and entering this cavernous cathedral was a wonderful experience.
Awesome Views. A little chaotic with pricing systems for each part of the basilica, but lovely views once you climb up (lift is available)

Glorious days of old. On entering this place, one is greeted with candles that lit up the place in yellow. The art works on the high ceilings were magnificent and this adds to the beauty of the place giving one a feeling that the whole place seems to be glittering with gold. It was explained that the beauty of such churches actually reflect the glory and riches of the country in those days.
Check out the concerts here, too. Visit this lovely church to visit and worth hearing organ, choir, and symphony concerts for a nice evening in the heart of Budapest

lovely church, chapel and a mummified hand. small donation to enter this beautiful site and an interesting story behind the mummified remains in the chapel. Did not witness the sound quality as could not re-attend for the visiting choir at night but bet it was good! Charity hawkers outside looking to sign up easy pickings. Just say no and they will head off.

Just beautiful. Its stunning both inside and out. You need to take the stairs to the top ( walk the 302 stairs if you can, else there is a lift that goes straight up).The view is incredible. Sit on the stirs at night and eat and ice cream or have a glass of wine from a restaurant right there.

Fabulous cathedral well worth a visit. Visited in June 2013. Speculator building, beautiful inside. Entrance wasn't free but was worth the charge. Was quite busy, so would suggest visiting early in the day. Lots of tour groups made it difficult to navigate around or take photos. Didn't pay the extra to climb to the top, wish I had now I am home!

Beautiful Basilica.. The incredibly ornate interior features about 50 different types of marble, elaborately decorated chapels, and many sculptures, including a bust of the basilica's patron saint, who was the first Christian king of Hungary. Special permission from the Pope had to be granted in order to place the statue on the altar.
Nice but crowded monument. A strong monument to visit while in Budapest. Go early in the day because it gets crowded very fast by tour groups. Entrance is not free.

Don't bother with the hand!. We went to the top which is worth while as there are amazing views of the whole city. We then went inside to look at the mummified hand but this was not worth it. You have to pay to have a light put on which shows up the hand but obviously it was busy and if you paid then everyone would get the benefit other than that you don't get to see the hand but the inside of the basilica without the hand is amazing.

Beautiful, worth the trip inside. For a small donation you can tour the inside of the basilica, which is beautiful, and take all the pictures you'd like. However, the viewing of St. Stephen's mumified hand was highly overrated. You really didn't see much but a lump in the display case, and if you wanted to turn on the light for photos, they wanted a donation. That was a bit touristy. But the architecture is worth the trip!

A site for the dedicated. If you are dedicated to seeing the art of cathedrals, then this is a good site. Otherwise, it is not overwhelmingly impressive. If you want to see the hand of St. Stephen, don't forget your 200Ft to light the lamp so you can get a good look.

Gothic architecture with Hungarian touch. It is definitely not just another gothic architecture basilica. The beautiful artwork and vibrant colours are a delight to the eyes. Don't miss the little museum before the exit.

Up a hieght. Beutiful Basiica. so ornate there was a service in progress wheh we were there so we couldnt walk around but was a lovely service. We went up to the base of the dome to photo the city views. So worth it. Not expensive and not mant steps involved as its done by taking 2 lifts most of the way. You can see for miles on a lovely clear day like we had. On our decent we took another lift to the Treasury. That was very interesting. It contains what is said to be the mummified hand of St. Stephen. The square in front of the Basilica is vast. On an evening at weekends it is full of people visiting the various resturants and bars. There is a great starbucks there if you just want to sit back and relax and people watch. We did.
Just fantastic. A very ornate and beautiful Cathedral. I believe it is one of the best places to visit in Budapest. It is beautiful and well worth a visit to see the glorious interior.
Its a Church. Beautiful example of 3 different architectual styles, as a non church type I cant comment on the iconography other than to say it is present and artistically well made and preserved.
well worth a visit when in Budapest. yes well worth a visit. The hop on off bus stops here...lots to see inside and out. The stained glass windows are beautiful.

Very impressive architecture, and well maintained. I've seen a lot of cathedrals in Europe so I'm no longer easily impressed, but this one stands out. Very impressive architecture and design. An easy-to-overlook highlight is the "black Madonna" chapel in the back right. There is no official admission fee as such (at least during non-concert times), but there was a man half-snoozing in the entryway who made sure i put Ft 200 in the "donation" box on my way in.
Fabulous!. must see in Budapest, wish we'd had time for the concerts, I'm sure they were fabulous! the church was well kept and entrance was free!

Worth Seeing.... I've been to this attraction every time I've been to Budapest. Recently they've started to charge to access certain parts of the Basilica (tad cheeky). The holy hand is kept in this little box that costs F500 to light up and well........It's basically a 1,000 year old hand in a box. Still the architecture is breath taking. I recommend visiting the top of the Basilica also (amazing views of the city). Overall definitely worth a gander.

beautiful Church. St. Stephen played a huge role in the history of Hungary and Christianity in the Region. The Basilica is beautiful and the square it's sits in is a great spot to eat, or have coffee and relax. Don't miss the FAMOUS Relic inside the church- well worth going in.

A bit modern though still has the "grandness" of European churches. Budapest has so many great buildings and structures and this is one of those. You'll see it when you go on the "overlooking" part of Budapest and even nicer to view up close. The inside is also amazing with more refined and church feel.

Fantastic.....well worth the 500HUF contribution. What can you say, Marble, Gold Leaf, the dome is spectacular...Take a camera you will regret it if you don't there is so much to see from the many altars and statues to the sheer architecture of the building.
Inspiring place to visit. The title says it all. It is a must to visit this Cathedral with it's wonderful decoration and incredible architecture. It is vast and the dome a must see rom the interior.

Among the Best Cathederals of this size. Add to your must do list. Stunning inside. Not large, but worth the viewBe sure to go to the top of the basilica. They don't tell you but there is a lift to the top if you exit the ticket office and go directly across the corridor. It will also take you to the treasury museum. Both the museum and the museum are extra. The top is definitely worth the money. Incredible views.
Beautiful!. A must see for all tourists, it only costs a small coin donation. It's amazing the architecture and detail inside
A beautiful church. I enjoyed visiting this church. The 1000 year old withered hand was a bit gruesome and it was hard to tell that it had been a hand.
Beautiful. This church is right in the middle of the old town so you really can't miss it. The church itself and the square in front are really beautiful and inside is stunning, especially the roof.

Climb those stairs. If you get there at 10.00 am you can be one of the first to climb to the top of the dome, and then you have a stunning view of the City without any tourists blocking the view. But be aware- it is a long way up (but worth it).

Beautiful Basilica - the paintings on the ceiling were amazing. This backs onto the cross roads at the bottom of Andrassy Street, we'd walked past it so many times without realising! There's some bars/cafes outside that are lovely for watching the world go by with a lovely view of the church

Take elevator. The view was great but not really worth the climb so I am glad we took the elevator. Seeing the steel structure under the wooden dome was interesting and the way the wood was put together to form the dome. The church was beautifully restored but we could not find where the hand that was supposed to be there was. My absolute favorite thing that made the visit to this worth it was the LEGO model in glass that I happened upon.
Piece of art. The design and architecture of the building is simply amazing. I can just look at it for hours and hours, and I'm not even an enthusiast! A must-go place to visit
Great place. Excellent tourist spot, it is worth visiting and going up to the dome. Great coffee shops all around too. And only a stone throw away from the Danube.
Iconic. This is not to be missed. Another iconic symbol of the city plus is is so much fun to say Szent Istvan.
main basilique. beautifull church with beautifull frescos and worth while seeing the interior. The center of the city. go on a weekend and hope to see a wedding

Wow. Impressive and nicely decorated basilica. Impressive the first time I visited it in 1995 and still very impressive. Now the surrounding streets have been renovated and cars are not longer allowed there the basilica becomes more part of the city center (Vaci utca)
Stunning. Beautiful and very impressive building by day and night. Commands a focal point on the skyline. Missed out on attending one of the classical concerts, but perhaps on another visit!

Most beautiful view of the city!. It's totally worth the 200 stair climb to the top! There is an elevator on the side that they don't really advertise but it will save you a few flights of stairs! Otherwise do make the climb, it's so lovely on the top and a great place to take pictures.

another must see!. you absolutely must visit, day and night! on our first night (tuesday) i had booked for the classical concert a little pricey at 30 euro but well worth it.The concert was an hour long and was the perfect way to hear the beautiful acoustics. Later in the week we returned to view the interior and it is absolutely stunning, we lit a candle for my friends Hungarian grandparents and then took the trip up the towers (500 HUF each) for stunning panoramas over Budapest.

Amazing day and night. This is a very impressive Basilica. While we did not have time to go in, we did see the square by day. Later, we visited after hours and were disappointed to miss the interior. However, the Square in front takes on an amazing liveliness with wine bars, restaurants, families and everything. As we walked away from the Basilica, we found several outdoor places and picked one with a view of the font of the Basilica. Don't miss this view at night!
Wonderfully rich. No entrance charge - just donation to the Priest on entering Interesting artifacts One of the stops for Hop on hop off bus routes

A must visit in Pest. St. Stephen's Basilica is the most important church in Budapest. It is one of the most popular tourist attractions.  It is beautiful, it houses Hungary's most sacred treasure, St Stephen's mummified right hand, the Szent Jobb (Holy Right Hand)You may take photos, but it a bit difficult since it’s in a box up on a pedestal.
Impressive. As this is in the main drag of things to see, it would be silly not to take a look. The interior is lofty and dark. The exterior more impressive.

amazing views. largest church in Europe, beautiful building, didn't expect to pay to enter church, but they class it as donations, glad we went in though as very beautiful and very peaceful. Also didn't realise you could climb the stairs (there are a lot) to almost the top of the building, you do have to pay to do this but it is worth it and you will miss out on some amazing views if you don't!!! There are some rather steep steps at the last climb but you can do this in a lift for the last part

Fabulous place with a holy relic. No queues to get in here! I went in May 2013. The chapel at the back contains the Holy relic of St Stephens hand..DO NO use your flash (double check this...my partner got some very stern looks when his flash went off). Allow half an hour just to breeze through, or, if you like art and architecture then 90 minutes is about right!

Another Beautiful Church, but with a GREAT View.... There are many beautiful churches all over Europe and this is just another one. What makes this special to me is the view from the Buda side of the river looking at the Pest side. It is quite spectacular.
Massive in size & scale. A beautiful, medieval European cathedral and very atmospheric. Don't forget to see the actual hand of St. Stephen.
Amazing tile roof. We were not close to St. Stephens but were able to take photographs from the Fishermans Bastion. The roof is amazing and with only a few buildings with tile roofs it is intriguing.
Beautiful architecture. The St. Stephen's Basilica is beautiful and a must-go experience. The architecture inside the church is really noteworthy.
Beautiful Church. Impressive building with amazing decoration inside. Also inside in the withered hand of St Stephen from around 1,000AD. Worth a visit

fantastic panoramic views. A must visit. Stunning views of the city! Avoid on windy days or if you are afraid of hights.
Great spot for photos.

Amazing place, concert not so amazing. The basilica is gorgeous, inside and out. Very majestic and grand. Well worth seeing.
The concert (typically organ + flute) that they sell to tourists is quite underwhelming. Better music to be found in Budapest that's not a tourist trap.

Pay a little and go up the dome. Lovely church, lost of marble. Take the time and the 1000 Forints £3 to go up the dome, a bit of a trek 300+ steps but the views over Budapest are well worth the effort

Speechless. I don't have the vocabulary to aptly describe St. Stephens Basilica. There is a saying about Ireland that goes "you don't know green until you've been to Ireland" and it is absolutely the truth. Books & pictures can't quite capture the beauty, architecture & grandness of the Basilica. It is a must see

go to the cupola, dome...panoramic. panoramic views down the vaci ut..and pest...across too buda and as far as gellert and citdella inc futher on a good day...for a reasonable price 600 forints...you can visit when open the main basilica and dont forget the treasury...the mattias statue and hand...

A lot of history. The day we were there, the church was full of childre as they were expecting the delivery of the remains of Don Bosco a saint who did a lot ffor kids.We saw the relic ( non decomposed) hand of a saint who died a thousand year ago., We chatted wiuth two nuns who gave us a bit of history about Hungary

Beautiful Basillica. Every city has its amazing Basillica/Cathedral and this is Budapest's. Entrance is just a donation and it has the prettiest pink and gold interior i have ever seen! Very dark so piccys a bit difficult and very busy on rainy days as we discovered! You can climb 312 steps to the walk way around the top of the dome! Amazing views of the city, especially the Parliament and the thundery rain filled coudy skies was amazing.On the way up there was an exhibition of and artist called Popov Peter's amazing and beautiful religious paintings...they were breath-takingly beautiful 3D pictures which had the most amazing eyes! Different styles of painting..lovely! You could take a lift down but it was worth the money to go up to the top,even in the pouring rain!

St Stephens is amazing. I am a Catholic but this church is impressive to anyone of any faith. I felt really overwhelmed by the beauty and decadence of this church. Whilst is it dark inside I think it adds to the atmosphere of the church.If you have a chance you really need to visit the church.

Added bonus? A Wedding!. The church is ornate and certainly well worth seeing. We approached from the side where several bridesmaids were helping the bride with last minute details, like her garter.The place where the wedding would be held was separate from the sanctuary open to the public. There were places where you could observe the wedding quietly. It was lovely to see the fresh-faced Hungarian bride and bridegroom and all of the happy wedding guests.

A beautiful church. If you have an hour to spare and don't mind paying HFL 200 (about 70p) to go in, this church is lovely and well worth a visit. If you want to go up to the top of the dome, it costs extra and it is about 300 steps or you can use the lift. It's not a must do, but its worth a visit.

for concert, for visit just excellent. St. Stephen is a jewel, it seems so big although inside it is not. You do not need to pay any entrance fee but to give a volontary contribution in the entrance. Inside is quite difficult to take good photos, is very dark.

Old-school event. Organ music is not a genre loved by the masses. Let's be fair: out of 20 tourists visiting Budapest, hardly one will devote an hour (70 minutes, to be fair - this is how long the concert lasts) to hear this funny old loud music. But the hall was 2/3 full.The organ pieces proper were sandwiched between vocal pieces - apparently for diversification of experience. In fact, there were two organs: the small one on stage - and the big one in the rear, opposite the altar wall. Of, I forgot to mention: this is a basilica, which is another word for a church, so you get two kinds of entertainment - listening to the music and seeing the interior, which is quite beautiful.Bottom line: worth a visit if you find churches and organ music attractive. Otherwise - there's a great number of bars and coffee houses right next door. Well, on the other hand, they will still be there when, after the concert, you come out for a breath of fresh air.

A must for Budapest visitor. Just spend 500 HUF and take 300+ steps to the tower - the cupola gallery in fact. After first batch of steps, elevator can be used. The view from the top is splendid!And the interior is the same, everything there is soo huge!
Great views from the top!. I always visit Basillica's when I travel and this one was lovely. It's well worth the 302 steps to the top to see the view over Buda and Pest.

Stunningly Beautiful. This was a beautiful Basilica and definitely worth seeing during your visit to Budapest. Stunningly beautiful gold leaf throughout. Each Basilica/church around the world is different and this is no exception.
Beautiful church in Pest. Live organ music helped frame the visit to this beautiful church. We climbed to the dome for great views of the city.

Awesome experience. Beautiful place, we went thrice..first to just see, then for an organ concert and finally for church service on sunday. It was awesome, the building is well maintained and the artwork is so beautiful. The music and acoustics during the organ concert were unbelievable..worth the cold evening walk I had after that. The sound from the grand organ there is just amazing and the musicians..organ, trumpet, singers were great. We attended the latin mass but irrespective of my not understanding what they were say I could follow since I am catholic. Only thing I would recommend is that during mass, visitors who just want to look at the building be prohibited out of respect for the mass ceremony.
Stunning Cathedral. This is a stunning cathedral right in the centre of the City. We enjoyed the beautiful architecture and reading some of the history of this historic building.

So Beautiful. I have visited many churches in Europe and this ranks right up there with St Peter's in Rome. A special service was being held, but the public was allowed to wander thru the church and view everything.

A must do. Views are amazing and relatively inexpensive. A must do in Budapest. Cost is minimal at 3-4 euros for the basilica and tower. Great 360deg views over the city.Inside the basilica was good including the mummified hand of the first king of Hungary. I was a little disappointed that once inside everything was chargeable including the light above the hand so you could actually see it being coin operated.Otherwise good

Stunning. Stunning cathedral, sat there for ages taking in all of the stunning details. Compulsory minimum donation required on entering the cathedral. Open until around 7pm and also open for concerts and other performances. Sadly, we arrived too late to see the 1000-year-old mummified hand of St.Stephen, first King of Hungary. It's well worth paying the small extra fee to go climb to the top of the cathedral, which is the highest viewpoint in Pest.
awe inspiring. We were lucky to enter whilst a mass was in progress. The details inside are beautiful. Well worth a visit. Charge is by donation.
Concert in St Stephens. We attended a classical musical concert here. Superb acoustics in a beautiful setting. It is a short walk from the Chain bridge & a must see / do whilst in Budapest.
Gorgeous. The interiors of this stunning church are not to be missed. Yes, you are asked for a small donation on the way in, but it's absolutely worth it to preserve such a gem!

Atmospheric. Just beautiful with a lovely atmosphere. The only thing I didn't like was that other people wait for you to put money in the light-up machine to view the Hand, and then take advantage of your money by pushing you out of the way to take their photographs. Rude!
A beautiful building. just beautiful buiding of an historical nature, There was a service going on when we arrived ,so we waited for five minutes to be allowed in. Well worth the wait
Attend Mass, Hear the Organ, and Get an Hour Long View. Awesome Cathedral! Must see! Importantly walk up to the cathedral front along the pedestrian mall for a great constant view.

amazing and enchanting. we arrived just as the church bells were pealing. Inside the mass was in Latin with a wonderful choir. It was packed, but tourists can stand in the back and take pictures without a flash. You are "encouraged" to donate to get in; highly recommended.

Closed, but still beautiful. We arrived just after closing time so unfortunately we weren't able to see the inside of this basilica. However, just walking around its exterior was stunning - I'm sure I missed out by not seeing it in its full glory!

Breathtaking. Absolutely stunning good leaf work but be prepared to be accosted by one of the clergy for a "donation" to their restoration fund (200 HFt each) but the central dome and altar are beautiful. You can also access the chapel where they keep the relic at no further cost.

Beautiful!. This church is really beautiful and certainly worth visiting. Take the time to go to the top. It is not too expensive and you can alternate some of the stair climbing with an elevator. The location of the church is great as it is close to many shops and restaurants.

Just breathtaking. A fabulous church.
Every where you turn your eyes, you fing a luxury of beautiful pieces of arts. It is a must.

impressive building,of great historical importance. A key building in the history of Budapest and well worth a visit. There are relics of Hungarian history that are worth seeking out.
The Basilica was very busy with tour groups so its not easy to get space if you want to treat your visit with a period of reflection.
An imposing cathedral. This is a must see on any trip to Budapest it is really beautiful one of the best. The history of the cathedral is extremely interesting
St Stephen's forearm is the relic here. This neoclassical basilica has abundant statues and paintings; the huge dome collapsed at one point a couple of centuries ago and had to be rebuilt.

breathtaking. This really is a must, not only from the outside but the inside too, it can be seen from many points in Budapest and is a good place to use as a visual marker for walking.
Could have spent the day in there so serene and peaceful

Beautiful. The first thing you notice about St Stephens is the size and the steps leading up to it, as you go through the entrace there is a statue that is light up which just draws you in. you can also see the hand of St Stephen that is kept at the church. We went to an evening concert at the Basilica, and although it wasnt cheap it was well worth it as the acoustics were excellent.There are often people standing on the steps singing and its lovely to go of an evening when the church is all light up and there a restaurants in the square and it has a really lovely atmosphere.

Beautiful Basilica. Walking in this basilica looking at the beautiful interior, I had a feeling of getting in touch with all the people who have been here before me - some of them praying, some of them mourning, some of them rejoicing, some of them grateful, some of them astonishing, some of them only looking. In the evening we went back to attend a consert. When the tones of silver filled the beautiful basilika I felt next to heaven.
Very beautiful. and very moving listen parts of the mass in singed in Latin I missed the museum and the view from the top :(

Make sure to see the Mummified Hand of St. Stephen!. This was a gorgeous church. I was in awe of how large it was. Beautiful sculptures and amazing art work. The best part for me was viewing the mummified hand of St. Stephen. I was astounded that they saved his hand in a glass container. There also is a board of photos and captions explaining how they did it. It was pretty cool. There was a "suggested donation" to view the hand but I didn't mind. I believe it was 2 euros or 200 ft. There is a gift shop on the way into the church that was selling postcards and little notebooks as well as rosaries.It only took my friend and I about 30 min to look at the whole church. I suggest going to this church. It was beautiful!

Beautiful Basilica with organ concerts & amazing views of Budapest from roof. We visited St Stephen's Basilica on 3 occasions in May 2013. It is a beautiful basilica and well worth the mandatory contribution of 200 forint. On our second visit we attended the Friday Organ Concert which lasted just over an hour and was superb. There are different prices but the cheaper seats in the middle of the basilica costing 4,500 forint (€15) are probably best placed to appreciate the music.We also took the 2 elevators to the roof of the basilica where we had lovely 360 degree views of Budapest. It costs 500 forint (about €1.50) which was great value

Very Impressive. We visited St Stephens twice during our four days in Budapest. It is very impressive from the outside and beautiful on the inside. We attended weekly Mass on Saturday at 5:00PM. The setaing left a lot to be desired, especially in such a beautiful Cathedral. On our second visit, we were lucky to arrive when a wedding was just leaving the church; it added to the visit. The main altar and the interior have such beautiful details and the architecture is spectacular.
Great downtown sight. It was probably a standard European cathedral like place, but it was stunning. Only open till 5 PM though.

spectacular. In the midst of a busy city it is always good to take time out and this building helps you do just that. Whether or not you visit it for religious reasons you must be impressed by the sheer craftsmanship of the place.

Mandatory "donation". We arrived to the Basilica around 4:00pm, and instead of letting us know that 90% of the basilica was closed due to a concert that night, we walked in to a small room where the priest was demanding a 10 euro donation per person when the sign on top of the donation box clearly ask for 1 or 2 euro donation. I was very disappointed by the aggressive behavior of the priest, but didn't want to argue with him, so gave him a couple of dollars and went in. Then we saw that only a small section of the basilica was open and we couldn't even walk to the main alter! The outside was very nice, but definitely no comparison to the great cathedrals of Italy and France.
Incredible inside. What a gem, decorated with rich stone/marble, wonderful stained glass windows and gold decor. A quiet haven and well worth a visit.

Amazing panorama from above. I visited the basilica two times: Dec 2012 and April 2013. I loved the view from the tower!
The basilica is HUGE inside.

I couldn't believe my eyes. This is a definite place to visit while in Budapest. The history of the Basilica show that history of Eastern Europe and the hundreds of years of influence from so many cultures. You will be amazed to see the beauty and architecture that this beautiful church has to offer. Make sure you have enough memory in your XD card for your Camera. I had to download to my Laptop so I could continue. Enjoy one of Hungary's great beauty's.....So Cal Traveler......Have a great time.

Beautiful church....a crowning glory in Budapest. Wonderful church which costs a 200 huf donation (about one euro) but is worth so much more.We were lucky to have a choir singing during our visit.A must-stop during a visit to Budapest.
Beautiful building. The Basilica is worth visiting, the streets surrounding it are full of people, alive, great wine bar just across the street and a starbuck on the other corner.
incredible. don't miss to visit the inside of the church, it is breathtaking, really worth the time and money, the colours are amazing
Hard way up but worth it.. It is worth climbing up the 302 stairs to the top to have a 360 degree view of Budapest. There are lifts if one does not want to do the exercise.

Awesome in the true sense of the word. Very worthwhile taking a tour of this fine building, if you can have a guide explain the various aspects and history even better. Entry is by donation ...about 200HUF is OkThe dome rises to 96 metres which I believe is in line with the Hungarian parliament buildings and no buildings are allowed to be higher.Try and make the concert in the Basilica on a Thursday evening to appreciate the acoustics

Beautiful church. The church is stunning inside with the colourful stained glass windows and dome. Be aware that there is a small charge to enter, 200huf. If you don't want to go inside and see the dome it is worth paying the small fee to go up the tower. There are over 300 spiral steps or you can take the lift. Once at the top you can see most of Pest and over to Buda.

Over the Top. The Basilica is a huge Roman Catholic cathedral just a few minutes walk from the Chain Bridge in Pest. Like many cathedrals around the world, it is difficult to fully describe it, but it is amazing with its marble, gold leaf, intricate wood carvings, statues, painting, and stained glass windows. There is usually a priest when you enter requesting a dollar or so donation. Supposedly, the hand of the church's namesake, St Stephen of Romania (circa 900 a.d.) is preserved in a box at the church. It is well worth a visit

The best area of town. We enjoyed the many shops and elite wine bars in the region.
The ambience was fantastic, and so was the service. Well-heeled
waitresses and friendly service

largest church in budapest- absolutely gorgeous. The Basilica is very central in a pedestrian area and is absolutely gorgeous - you can even go to a viewing gallery which has brilliant views over the city

see St Stephen's hand. The history of the church is fascinating, and the highlight is in the back of the church. You put a coin in the slot and a box lights up containing the shrivelled mummified hand of the Saint. Take time to visit the cupola.
Interesting building. You can take the lift up to the top and walk around the dome and get some great views of Budapest. Quite expensive entry fee and rather grumpy ticket seller.

Awesome. We stayed in a hotel overlooking the Basilica but left it till the last morning of our trip to go inside. It is one of the best cathedrals I have every been into, free entry although to go up to the top by elevator you have to pay 500huf per person (£1.50), but it is well worth it. The ceiling paintings are spectacular, you can go through into another Chapel to see the Hand of St Stephen which is encased in a bejewelled casket which lights up (200huf) but if you hang around someone else will put in the money and it lights up for 2 mins, rather a gruesome thought that a hand >1000 years old is encased but the RC like it
beautiful. loved all of it, so beautiful. The square was just a little way from the river and so you could combine this with visiting palace and parliament

Wonderful. If staying in Budapest, it is a must visit. A Wedding was taking place when visited which increased the atmosphere. Paid a small sum to go up in 2 lifts to the top of the Basilica The view from the top is well worth the fee.
breathtakingly beautiful. What a lovely basilica this is absolutely beautiful. You spent most of your time walking around looking up at the roof
Wonderful. The Bazilika, is very nice, even the square in front of it. The panorama terrace deserve to spend a little money, but it seems a bit abandoned.

must visit. totally love this church. it just one of the place that you cannot miss. they have great story about the renovation work as well. you can buy a ticket which combine with the Bastion opposite the church.

A must see!. The architecture and design of the building is breathtaking. This religious landmark is definitely a must see. The only disappointing thing was the pushy guy at the front entrance forcing everyone to give a donation of at least 2 euro. If it is compulsory to pay to enter then they should introduce an entrance fee and not mask it as a donation
Nice. Beautiful place, well worth a visit! Marvelleous art and design on the inside.We never tried the elevator to the top.
spectacular church. we went to mass there on the saturday night and although it was all in Hungarian, it was beautiful and lovely with great organ music

Great view. Wonderful view from the top of the Basilica. Take the stairts instead of elevator for authenthic experiance. There is an enterence fee to the panorama 500 forints, and if you want to enter the church additional 200 forints.

Impressive space worth seeing but. You’ll like it more if you like loads of gilding and indifferent art. There is very little of the detailing or curiosities you find in many cathedrals – unless of course dead hands turn you on.
Magnificant!. This Church is absolutely beautiful. Whether you are religious or not it is amazing inside. It is defintely worth a visit, very peaceful inside. The ceilings are incredible. Go!

A real must!!. Beautiful Basilica on a nice square. We saw the Holy Right Hand of King Istvan. Someone asked the guard to put on the light, then you can actually see it. Don't forget to take an ice cream at Gelarto Rosa, Szent Istvan ter 3, Budapest 1051, Hungary .

ONE OF THE MOST BEAUTIFULL CATHRDRALS. St. Stephen's Basilica is one of the most beautifull Cathedrals i have seen. Equal and better i dare to say , from the Esztergom Basilica.One of Budapest's attractions, that someone must visit.The church is located in a square , where you can find coffee-shops .

Amazing work of art. It’s the place in Hungary to come to if art and architecture beckons you. The Basilica not only houses the only public statue of St. Stephen holding the traditional Hungarian cross, now seen on the Slovakian Flag, after its separation from Hungary, but also houses, as a relic, its prized possession, the right hand of its patron saint, St. Steven himself. The acoustics in the Basilica are so famed that it regularly organizes concerts and organ symphonies that threaten to whisk the listener away into another realm of sanctity.
Beautiful church!. An amazing structure.. ended up going twice just to take more photos. Also the location is perfect to stop in on your way to shopping.

A spirtual experience. It goes without saying, but I'm doing just that, visiting churches is very much a spiritual experience. However some are more moving and easier on the eye than others. St Stephens, York Minster, Bath, St Pauls,rank in my top ten and are magnificent, the small local church on Jersey that the Germans used in WW2 is magic, as is the church just out of the Tower of London. But St Stephens blew me away and by pure chance a visiting American choir gave an impromptu recital that filled the Basilica with heavenly voices and lifted heart and soul to the skies. Breath-taking architecture, and a sacred mummified hand.

must see attraction. spent a lot of time here, must see attraction of Budapest. walked up - great panoramic view from the top with lots of picture opportunities. Also did the treasury tour - lots of old historic relics from the church. the outside steps are an excellent place to people watch and there are plenty of coffee shops to sit and enjoy the church view..
Wow!. St. Stephen's Basilica is the largest church in Budapest and can accommodate up to 8500 people. It's style is neo-classical and it is truly splendid and well worth a visit.

Spectacular basilica & great panorama view from its top. Memorable visit the cupola for a cheap HUF500 ticket. The cupola visit is not a great option for those with wheelchair and baby carriage as the elevator does not take you to the top but you will still need to climb a number of steps. Otherwise a great attraction. Guided tours for groups Mon-Fri.
Visit. Fabulous building and interior spectacular, you can climb to the top of the tower and see the city from aloft. There is an elevator if you need it.
Breathtaking. Dont miss the view from the top. Im a little afraid of heights and this climb was absolutely thrilling, if not just a little scary. Fantastic 360 degree view!

Dont miss this. Please dont miss this Basillica.It is free to enter with a request for 200 HUF each which is about 70 pence.It is beautiful and very much a highlight.There is a fab square on wich the basillica sits.

Beautiful Basilica in trendy area with great nightlife. This place is very impressive, with a public square in front, and ringed by bustling cute bars and restaurants. The impression is even better at night, when it comes to life, all lit up, and the scene of lively gatherings at the local hot spots. It is so quintessential European, you'll love it.
Best church visited. We have visited many churches throughout the world, for a small donation, it is well worth a visit. Absolutely magnificent.
Beautiful architecture. Lovely design, worth to climb up the tower for a fantastic view of the city... highly recommended. Go early in the morning to avoid the crowd.

You have to go there.... It is very good and you will enjoy it...It is located centraly therefore you can go afterwards for a coffee or beer in thw café that are there.As a building is really good and breath-taking therefore you shouldn't miss it.It is at the of Andrassy street therefore if you go shopping or whatever there, you will be close to go and see that!

great accoustics. for a very reasonable sum we spent some time listening to a choir practising in what is truely a peaceful and beautiful setting a nice break away from the busy square outside and so cool on a very hot day well worth the visit

Stunning, day & night. St Stephens Basilica is stunning day or night, whichever direction you approach it, walking up from Chain Bridge past the bronze policeman ( pat his tummy ) the basilica towers above with its huge dome, nominal fee for a view from its upper walkway, great views.At night although closed, the steps of the Basilica become a meeting place for young & old, have a glass of wine and sit and gaze at its beauty.

A Must See Attraction. The Basilica is a very special building with one of the largest unsupported domes in Europe. The art work is exceptional as is the history of how the church coped with the communist era. There is a relic of St Stephen located in a private chapel tat can be visited and for a small fee the relic is lit up to give the visitor a great opportunity to view. Go and take a look for yourself.

Great church. One of the biggest and most beautiful churches in Budapest. If you come from the direction of the Danube, you will walk along a nice pedestrian street from the Four Seasons Hotel to the square in front of the Basilica. On your way you will meet a policeman of old times made of bronze. After looking around inside, go up to the tower by lift becuase you will have a very nice view from a different angel than from the Buda side.

St Stephen's Basillica. A little dissapointed inside but the views from the balcony at the top are breathtaking. Wonderful at night as a spot where the locals of all ages meet in the square in front and enjoy chatting away to each other. Great for photos.

Amazing inside, and great views from the top.. The inside of St Stephens is amazing. There is no fee to go in, although they ask for a 200HUF donation (60p UK). When I went there was a wedding taking place, but visitors were allowed to watch and still explore the back of the Bassilica.Fod 500HUF (£1.50 UK) you can goto the main tower for stunning views across the whole of Buda and Pest. You can take the 302 stars, or take 2 lifts (i took the lifts !!)At the exit of the 1st lift is an art gallery, then the 2nd lift takes you to the main dome.Worth a visit, even from the outside it's incredible, but when you go inside it's breathtaking.

Amazing. you can't come to Budapest and not visit this. I was blown away by this building it is just beautiful inside and out. Free entry, they just ask for a donation as you enter. We paid 500huf (i think) to clime to the base of the dome too take in the view not needed you'll see just as much from the top of castle hill but a experience all the same.

Great view from top. Do walk up and have a view over the city. They also have concerts inside, but there's one very disturbing factor - you can hear subway (no other sound comes to my mind). So if you're thinking about attending an organ concert, attend the one in St. Michael's church.

Saint Stephen. you just can't miss the most important church in Budapest, named after the most known Saint Stephen (Szent Istvan). for the italians it's just another Baroque basilica (we've lots of these in italy), but it's imposing and magnificent and the square right in front of it is awsome - especially in a sunny day :)
Magnificent. The Basilica is situated on a fantastic square but when you enter the Basilica it is really beautifull and they have regular Classic Organ Concerts if you have the time do not miss

just gorgeous!. Make sure you have 200 Forintz ready for donation at the entrance or the security guy wont let you in. The inside is very beautiful, nicely decorated and you are allowed to take photos without flash. There was a long queue to the confession box. On the right section, you have to go thru a couple of doors, there is Black Madonna. I did not get the chance to walk around left section as it was closed. The right hand of the first king is housed here.  To get 360 degree view of Budapest, you will need to go up the tower. The cost is 500 Forintz and there are roughly 360 steps. We came here in the afternoon to avoid the crowd and again in the evening to take night shots of the building. It is one of the highest building in Budapest, same height as Parliament.
Newer than you'd expect. Only dates from the late 19th century. Very impresssive, and wonderful acoustics when we went to a tourist concert there.

Gorgeous church!. This beautiful church in Budapest is certainly worth a visit! The basilica is named after the first king of Hungary, St. Stephen, who was canonized as a saint by the Catholic Church. His mummified right hand is kept in a reliquary shrine at the basilica. This saint’s mummified hand is Hungary’s most revered and sacred treasure. You’ll find this holy relic in a separate chapel behind the main altar. This room is not easily noticed, so go to the left side of the altar, where you’ll find a door that leads out of the main church and into a separate chapel. Admission to the basilica is free, but a donation box is located at the entrance door.Take your time and stroll around the vast and beautiful interior. Study the paintings. Look up at the gorgeous cupola. Inspect the statues and architecture. Appreciate the quality of the gold gilding. Gaze up at the stained glass windows. The cupola is open for tourists between April 1st and October 31st, and if you make the climb, you’ll be rewarded with spectacular views of Budapest. Walk up the 364 steps or take the elevators up to the dome's observation deck. The cost to go up to the observation deck is 500 HUF or about $2.10.You can also take a guided tour of the Basilica. These are available Monday through Friday between 10 am and 3 pm, and cost 2,000 HUF or about $8.50. To get a truly wonderful experience, catch an organ concerts on Monday evenings at 5 pm year-round. Tickets can be purchased at the Basilica for 3000 HUF or about $12.75 US. Other, more expensive concerts are often held in the Basilica as well…check the Basilica website for dates, times, and prices.Just as go out the front doors, stop on the landing at the little tourist booth for some souvenirs. If you don’t speak Hungarian, and the lady in the booth doesn’t understand English, just point to the items you want to buy!

Well worth a visit. You are asked to make a donation as soon as you go inside the Bascilica to help with the restoration. This is minimal but you do feel at little pressured. Beautiful interior well worth a visit

Stunning. Walked up the tower and saw magnificent views. The Basillica itself is beautiful. Very impressive looking organ. Is worth going to an organ recital if you can. It's quite a n historic instrument.
Very inspiring. We were lucky enough to attend a concert in the Basilica one evenng. The accoustics were wonderful. The Basilica itself is a work of art and is inspiring.

Panaramic views from Dome. For 500 Fts about £1.50 you can travel up in two lifts to the Dome for panoramic views over Budapest, or you can climb the 302 steps....Inside is also worth the visit and only a small 50p donation is requested.
Nice. A bit gloomy inside but the ornate ceilings are very nice. You can see the relic of St. Stephen but have to put money in for it to light up!

Concert. Attended a classical concert one evening so got 2 in one as we got a walk around inside before the beginning and then had the concert. This was something we wouldn't normally do but it was cheap and something different in an amazing place.
The view from the spire.. Amazing view from the top but only do it if you are fit and can stand heights. I think it was 357 steps as the lift wasn't working. It only cost 1000 florints (£3).
amazing, big and beatiful. I like the architecture of this building, its location and great view from the top of it. Almost all Pest side is visible from there.
Amazing building and decor. Well worth the 200Ft (0.66p) entrance fee. It is a pity our Catherdrals cannot be more affordable to visit.
Great building. Full of history, fantastic building, recommend going up top. They have lifts which are not extra. Get tickets for the concert. Well worth it

Want to buy some drugs? Errm, I mean Puskas?. So we're wandering round this undeniably beautiful building and one one of our group approaches a priest asking where to find the burial place of Ferenc Puskas. The priest looks anxiously over each shoulder as though he might have been about to sell us some weed then beckons to us. He leads us to a door, checks left and right again then we follow him through the doorway down some stairs. It is another world down there. No drugs though.

Like a palace. This wonderful Catholic Church is like a palace. It is full of gold and marble. There are beautiful painting and statues everywhere. There is no entry charge but you are asked to make a donation of about £1.50, which is very reasonable considering what you see.

great church in a fantastic location. A very big church, very rich from inside, please spend some time to see all the minute lovely details and paintings every where. candle lights add to the great feeling and atmosphere inside this great church. Please go -day or night-, you will have a lot to see there.

Classiscal music concert. We enjoyed the concert in spite of the fact less than 200 people were in attendance and the music, especially from the guest soprano, tended to get lost in the echo of the Basilica. The first violinist performed difficult solo performances in at least 3 of the 13 pieces of music authored by Handel, Bach, Mozart, and others. The Basilica is a beautiful structure both inside and out.

Beautiful Church. The last time I saw a church as stunning as this one was in Rome. If you are interested in churches, architecture, history then this is a MUST SEE on any trip to Budapest. There is no entrance fee just a recommended token donation which we were only too happy to provide. The time you spend here will be dependant on how interested in churches you are but if possible I would allow yourself at least 45mins to have a good look around-enjoy.

Was told it was free, but it wasn't. all the guide books said this was free to tour the inside, but when we went through the red velvet curtain, there was a priest there collecting money as a "donation" to enter, and it didn't look like he would let you through unless you paid up! We didn't go, as we didn't have the cash at the time, so we never got to see the inside. The outside is beautiful. Kitty corner is a Starbucks, California Coffee if you need a quick snack before or after visiting. Hours are 10-5 when we were there in April.

wonderful. for a small charge comapred to a far less inspiring synagogue and a far greater charge we visited St Stephens. Depending on your own religious beliefs is how any chuch / holy place of worship makes you feel. This place however has wonderful feel to it most atmospheric , dark and insome ways gloomy and cold , lit by candles flickering , plenty of decorations being either art adorning walls and ceiling to the alter, etc. St Stephens by far was more impressive than many of Romes greater churches / cathedrals and the upkeep from a tighter purse.St Stephens actual hand being a prized relic and securely displayed in a side chapel just annoyingly the option in having to pay extra for a 30second flicker of light to see it....we declined.This should be a definate visit if your in Budapest

Great dome. it's the main church of Pest, you can see it from everywhere and you mustn't miss it. Gold painted inside with a side chapel dedicated to Black Mary, but what is astonishing to me is the hand of St Istvan as perfect as it would be a live one, but remember: if you want to see it, you must put a 100hf coin so it lits up. Go to the right and you will take gorgeous photos
instead of museum. we recommend, for families, short walk from the city center and for those who don't like going to museums but would like to visit nice places

Awe-inspiring. This is a beautiful building - one can only stand and marvel at the craftsmanship which must have gone into it. I always feel one shouldn't have to pay to go into a 'House of God', and St Stephen's sensibly asks for donations instead of an exorbitant fee.

Lovely Dome. This basilica was recently renovated and finished with a large paved square in front where there was previously a bus terminal. It is truly lovely even though the real marble only reaches about 8 feet from the ground and the rest is painted...it looks so real. The dome is lovely and it also has a a v. pretty rose window.
Awesome. Just simply a stunnung piece of architecture. Well worth paying for admission to the tower to enjoy the stunning views of the city

Into old churches and saints?. This church in central Pest just across Chain Bridge from Buda is now surrounded by evidence of the modern world yet still imposes over California Coffee, Starbucks and others. It is worth taking the full walk around the outside before going in. Remember it is a church and be respectful, yet enjoy it like a museum.

Take to tower tour!. We visited on our first day in Budapest as this Basilica must represent one of the 'must see's' in the City. The Basilica is impressive indeed! Despite the temperature hovering around freezing it was still well worth while ascending the tower dome. The views are amazing all over the city but in particular towards the Danube and beyond. Very worthwhile visit.

Wonderful building. Worth the visit and the tour and also very close to other areas to shop and to eat.Go in to have a look around, very cheap and quite a lot to see with regard to culture and history.

The music and views were amazing. We stopped at St. Stephen's on Easter Monday, not sure if they would even be admitting tourists on that day. They not only were letting us in, but a Mass was in progress. I was glad to see that other visitors were respectful - possibly as awestruck as I was. The real treat was when the organ and choir performed Handel's Hallelujah Chorus at the end of the Mass. It brought tears to my eyes. Consider how much upkeep is involved in a building of this magnitude and please make a donation if you possibly can.Following that experience, we paid the 500 HUF to hike up to the "Panorama" at the bottom of the dome. There is an elevator but we chose to use the stairs on some sort of principle. Definitely worth the climb!

The music and views were amazing. We stopped at St. Stephen's on Easter Monday, not sure if they would even be admitting tourists on that day. They not only were letting us in, but a Mass was in progress. I was glad to see that other visitors were respectful - possibly as awestruck as I was. The real treat was when the organ and choir performed Handel's Hallelujah Chorus at the end of the Mass. It brought tears to my eyes. Consider how much upkeep is involved in a building of this magnitude and please make a donation if you possibly can.Following that experience, we paid the 500 HUF to hike up to the "Panorama" at the bottom of the dome. There is an elevator but we chose to use the stairs on some sort of principle. Definitely worth the climb!
State of the art!. Incredibly great building!! like the any other building in budapest the view is great during the night!
Pretty!. The church is beautiful on the outside, on both sides. Costs money to go in, which is a turnoff, but overall was pretty for a short visit
Make sure you climb up to the viewpoint at the dome. View at the city from the dome is exceptional, i was not too impressed with the interior of the building, though

Free, so why not check it out!. Give a donation if you can. The priests were all so kind and clearly cared very much for the Basilica. There are three different styles of architecture on the outside because there were three different architects because it took so long to build. It was weird seeing someone other than Jesus at the head of the alter, but interesting. Don't forget to see St. Stephen's mummified hand!

unexpected delight. entered and paid thinking we were going into the basilica, until we realised after a few steps we were heading up to the top of the dome! hard work, but breathtaking views, even in the wind and rain - only 5 other people up there.

Gorgeous inside. The Hungarians don't mess about when designing and furnishing their places of worship. This place is beautiful on the outside and even more breathtaking on the inside. Take a tour if you can, to learn more about the statues that abound. A fascinating place to visit.

Impressive. This church is amazing both inside and out. The main altar is really quite stunning although sadly we could not see the marble statue as it was before Easter Sunday. However, the rear chapel was open and we were able to see their most famous relic - his arm, kept in the most amazing "church" presentation box. You don't go in the main door but you should check it out as you exit (on your left) for all the apostles are carved into the door.
Easter Mass. Beautiful church. We also went to Easter Sunday mass there. They held the same traditions that I remembered as a child.
Worth the walk to the top..... A beautiful building and definately worth climbing to the top to see the spectacular views of Budapest.

Don't Miss the Dome. St Stephen's Basilica towers over most of the skyline on the Pest side of the Danube. There's a beautiful granite pattern in the walkway as you approach the stairs of the basilica. When you are inside, look up at the fantastic dome. On your way out, you can see diagrams of the original concept of the basilica which is quite interesting.

St. Stephen's Basilica - Breathtaking. This basilica is a mix of various baroque styles but is still stunning. As you approach the building (one of the tallest in the city) you are overwhelmed by the size of it and the surrounding square. The inside is just beautiful, as you would expect a basilica to be. The mummified right hand of St. Stephen (the first king of Hungary) is on display in a small chapel to the left of the main altar. Be sure to go up to the top of the dome. You can either climb the staris or their are elevators. The 360° views overlooking Budapest are really spectacular.

Superb Interior Decoration. From the outside this is without doubt an impressive building but the inside decoration is breath taking with spectacular stained glass windows and extensive use of marble superstructure with extravagant use of gold leaf/lacquer adornments. It's possible to go up numerous steps(there is a charge) to the tower from where you get superb views over the city but I prefer the views from the Fisherman's Bastion on the Pest Side on Castle Hill.

Great views from the Dome. Well over-the-top Baroque (if you like that sort of thing) but impressive for all that.The cleric beside the 'donation' box on entry won't take less than 200 forints to let you in, but worth it.Best part was the view from the top of the Dome (extra fee) and good lifts to save your legs. Better to wait for a clear day however.

very beautiful place inside and outside of the church. Amazing building with the very good architecture. St,stephans's hand is on this church and you can pray. Building is very nice inside and the outside the view is very amazing too

Great views. We were very excited about going to St Stephens Basilica, because of what we had read and heard. As the building came into our view, what struck us was the sheer scale of it. There was a charge to go to the top of the dome, which was totally worth it. Although, it was a tiring ascent and the inside the staircase made you feel claustrophobic, the views from the top were absolutely extraordinary - great spot for a photograph. We went back down the staircase and decided to have a look inside the church. Before we entered, there was a "request" for a "donation", with a hawk-eyed priest positioned by the entrance, who was very keen to enforce this "donation". The church had some beautiful stained glass windows. The "headline act" of the church was the right hand of St Stephen. You have to go into the inner chapel to see it, or so we read. We were unable to see the right hand of St Stephen, but we later found out that there was a fee to get it illuminated! This small disappointment did not spoil a great visit. Would highly recommend.

Beautiful. After seeing St. Stephen's Basilica tower over Pest from our Castle Hill view, we were thrilled to see it in person. Beautiful architecture and a beautiful view of all of Budapest from the top. There is a small fee to get to the top, but well worth it. For fun exercise, try taking the stairs but know that an elevator is available.Hungarians give great respect to their treasured relic - the right hand of St. Stephen. Available for viewing at no charge, the hand is encased in a glass shrine. Information about the hand is available in many languages.

Amazing - go to top, don't go to museum, check about concerts.. This is a must see on Budapest. Lot's to see in and out. Very beautiful inside. You can find there the hand of St Stephen, the first king of Hungary, among many other things. You should pay and have the elevator to the top, very good view from the city there. And I don't think you should pay to see the "Treasure", a special show inside ( what I thought was not so special after all, spent maybe 4 minutes there ). Before you go take a look on the concerts agenda - always having something interesting there ( http://www.bazilika.biz/kincstar ) .

An amazing place to visit. This is a beautiful building from the outside but inside is even better. The climb to the top of the dome is worth the views, there is an extra charge but worth it to see the other sites from the basilica. You get to see the hand of st Stephen but you do have to pay to illuminate it. I would highly record this visit.

breathtaking. we came across this beautiful building whist looking for somewhere to eat, it was dark and cold but this took my breath away, we also found a lovely italian restaurant where we could take in the view of St.Stephens as we ate-----AMAZING!!

Dark, peaceful church. It's not the most beautiful church that you'll ever see, but has a holy, peaceful atmosphere (once you've been relieved of your 200HUF 'donation' by the cleric at the entrance). It is surprisingly plain and has a dark and gloomy interior.

Very beautiful cathedral with lots to see. Exceptionally beautiful building decorated with intrhcate sculptures e.g. the tympanum just above the entrance, detailing the Virgin Mary flanked on either side by followers, among them St Stephen.Inside you can enter the main church for a small donation. The main alter and side alters are again well decorated and the ceilings are covered with beautiful paintings.The basilica houses the Holy Right, the mummified right hand of St Stephen which is very special, a small donation of 100ft will light up the chamber and give a clearer view of the hand.You can then go up to the top of basilica to get a view of the city for 500ft also if you want to take a snap.The basilica is also the burial site of Ferenc Puskas but dont think its open to public.

Stunningly beautiful basilica. This beautiful church is located in central Budapest, and is well worth a visit. Grand and awe-inspiring, Budapest's largest church features an amazingly beautiful exterior and interior, which must be seen to be believed. Dedicated to Hungary's first king, Saint Stephen, it also houses Hungary's most sacred religious treasure - his mummified right hand. Admission is free, but donations are welcomed. It's well worth a visit!
Very impressive inside and out. The sheer size decorations inside were very impressive. Awe inspiring. Also very nice to sit in the sun in the square outside and people watch

stunning architecture. An absolutely stunning piece of architecture you just marvel about the craftmenship that went into the building of this church,you never look at the floor from the moment you enter till you come out.and all they ask is for a small donation to enter.

Quite attractive. The Basilica has a massive and gorgeous structure.The interior is also beautiful.We couldnt attend the mass but still felt very good to be inside.They have kept some images and historical information of the basilica for everyone to read.

Take the elevator to the top. The viewpoint is just spectacular. I attended mass and service and it was nicely done. The porters and guards make sure that the tourist understand that mass is in service. It was nicely done and attractive.

Go to the TOP!. Just pay and go to the top its totally worth it! (theres even a student price) Amazing view of Budapest from up there! When I went the elevator wasn't working but I like a nice climb up stairs in order to see an incredible view. Makes you feel pretty accomplished :)
Center of town. The Basilica has a very Eastern European feel to it. Very Pretty! Sometimes, they have concerts there, but we didn't go. Starbucks is just around the corner too.

Basiica great but dont go to a concert there. The Basilica is impressive and shouldn't be missed. Concerts are offered some evenings, but they are more of a tourist attraction than a real concert and not really worth the entrance ticket (apx 23 euros each)

Impressive inside and outside. This is on the top 10 of things to visit, and does not disappoint. I didn't go up to the top, because the weather was awful and I would not have seen very much, but people who have done it on a good day say it is worthwhile.

A must see!. The Basilica is amazing, the interiors are definitely worth sitting and absorbing for a while. If you climb to the top of the Basilica, you get some beautiful views of the city. A must see!

Must see!. We weren't too sure but the Basilica is just amazing, paying 200fts entry (80p?) for a look round such a stunning church is a bargain. You won't be disappointed the sculptures, art work, and celings are incredible, the rooftop view is amazing too and well worth the 500fts price, steps are a little scary (there is a lift too) and personally I struggled with the balcony as it felt so flippin' high but my wife said it was great!
Massive exterior - Stunning interior. From the outside the Basilica is massive, brooding and impressive. The interior is incredibly ornate, and jaw droppingly beautiful. Well worth a visit!

Nice for a short visit. They ask for 200 HF voluntary donation which I didn't mind paying but there wasn't much ' voluntary' about it. Spoiled a bit by all the large parties of guided tours and the loud voices, it's a place of worship! You could pay an extra 500 HF to go up the top but we didn't.
So much gold!. A very beautiful church from the outside, and is very impressive inside. Being the most important church in Budapest, it's definitely worth a quick visit.
Beautiful. Nice atmosphere, the church is free, but you have to pay to go up in the gallery. Worth a visit. We saw all we wanted in about 20 minutes.
impressive church and square. Great view from the top and a very helpful lift service. A fine example of baroque architecture in a manageable size.

Great panoramic views from up high!. For me, the best part was being able to look out over lovely Budapest on a beautiful, clear day. The climb to the tower (I took the stairs)was worth it! Definitely a bargain and seeing Saint Stephen's hand (?) makes you feel a small part of Hungarian history.
Great Basilica. Lovely sights of Pest área from the coupule. It deserves to climb the staircase although if you decide the lift you still have to climb a Little bit to reise the top.

Nice. A very nice basilica, but average by European standards. If you visit Budapest I would recommend seeing this. However, if you have previously traveled throughout Europe, this may seem like "more of the same".

Beautiful. The whole building is in incredible condition and is so ornate. Make sure you go into the chapel to see St Stephen's hand which is over 1000 years old. Also the climb up the tower is worthwhile for the 360 degree views from the top. Spectacular

Beautiful. Our apparent has a view to the Basilica so we see it every day. Yet I can't stop admiring it's beauty.
The view from the top is worth checking. If you are in good shape and can climb the many stairs to the top you can save the fee for the elevator.

beautiful church. as with many and most basilicas in old Europe, this one is richly decorated with frescoes, stained glass, gold and gilt and decorations all over. it is beautiful to go inside and gaze around at all the things people do to make such a place of worship so glorious. While I am not of this religion, I can appreciate the beauty of the church.
Great church. Best building we visited, really fantastic decor, plus no rip off price to go in. Worth a visit for sure

Concert in a Church. But what a Church! Wonderfully painted ceilings and statues, magnificent soaring pillars and very ornate domes provided a backdrop to a concert by some local string artists held one evening.Wrap up well if going to a concert in the winter.

Very ornate interior. We knew to pay the 200 HUF 'donation' on arrival here so had no problems with anyone stopping us for payment. At less than £1 it is a bargain. The inside of the Basilica is very ornate with beautiful ceilings and has a very calm and peaceful feel.We were intrigued by the mummified hand of St Stephen that is kept here and did wonder what happened to the rest of his body! You have to pay to have the casket lit up to see the hand properly.

Great views from the dome. We found The Basillica to be slightly gloomy inside, probably due to the lighting. The climb to the balcony around the dome is well worth the 500 HUF though. The views of the City are spectacular.

Simply breathtaking. A beautiful cathedral both inside and out. I think we paid a token gesture to enter, and were free to stay as long as we wanted, and to take photos freely. You can take a lift upstairs then a winding narrow staircase to the top to get excellent views over the city. Definitely one of the key highlights of our visit to this amazing city and on the "must do" list.

Stunning. This Church is simply stunning, even my husband who isn't particularly fussed about Churches (I am) commented on how beautiful it was. There is a small donation requested of 200HUF which is less than a £1 and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this.

Beautiful Building.. Free to get in to the church though you can give a donation if you wish. It was fairly peaceful though obviously there are lots of tourists. Everything was dripping in gold and art which made for interesting viewing. We saw the mummified right hand of St Stephen which was interesting, you have to pay to light it up however and it's still so small it's hard to see properly. We paid to go up to see the views which were spectacular and well worth doing.

Beautiful. St. Stephen's Basilica is a beautiful building on the outside and the inside. You do not have to be religious to appreciate the design, decoration and the sheer size of this building. Worth a visit as you can spend a little time, or a long time in the basilica and still be in awe of it.

Beautiful church. A very ornate church, with lots of paintings. You even get to see the mummified right fist of St. Stephen! The history with this church and St Stephen makes it very interesting to visit. They do "request" a small donation (more like a required donation, but just needs to be a few coins).
St Stephen's Basilica. Amazing architecture, though it costs to get inside, however can still take some amazing pictures from the outside! definitely recommend a visit!

The Unfriendliest Church In Budapest. Donation in this church means that guards are standing in the door and if you are not ready to give them 200 HUF or 1 EUR, they grab you and throw you out of their church.It would be a great building, but this unfriendly and aggressive attitude makes the whole visit bitter and believe me - unforgettable. I would never recommend it to anyone.

Stunning. Even if you are not religious St Stephen's Basilica is a must. It is very ornate and beyond clean. Everything is gleaming and I couldn't help but wonder how they got it all so sparkling. It is free to go in. The outside is impressive, the inside is impressive what's not to like.
Beautiful. A stunning visit and so very cheap - at only 200huf donation, which is less than a £1 thats a real bargain

Worth a look. Please be careful on entry, entry is by donation and you wont be given any change (a common theme in Budapest). Once inside the ceilings and dome are very impressive and it is worth a look
Go to the top!. The highlight of a visit to this basilica is a visit to the top where you can see the inside of the dome and then look out over the city.

opulence on a grand scale. wow factor hits you as soon as you see the outside , for the sheer size of it . then there's a panorama of marble and gilt etc on the inside , with an option to climb to the top of the dome ...do it! and see the gruesome mummified hand of st stephen for the princely sum of 200 forints ( about 65p) Time your visit well and you can take in a concert too

Cannot miss!. St. Stephen's basilica is dedicated to Hungary's first king, St. Stephen. It is one of the most popular attractions in Budapest. it houses Hungary's most sacred treasure, St Stephen's mummified right hand. The basilica is free for visitors, however they have to donate something at the entrance.

Stunning Basilica, climb to the top for incredible views and have a private tour of the crypt!. St Stephen's Basilica is huge! It has incredibly detailed religious artwork inside. You can also pay a small amount to climb the 300+ steps up to the top of the basilica and walk around the dome for a 360 degree view of the entire city! You can also visit the small chapel and see a relic. On our way out we also asked for a peak into the crypt and one of the church staff took us down to the basement and explained the different areas of the crypt and showed us the memorials for some of Hungary's rich and famous! Very interesting and a very nice day. There are also some nice restaurants/coffee shops nearby for a warming cup of tea afterwards. The basilica is free to enter but obviously you should make a donation.

Beautiful Building. Lovely architecture and internal paintings. A very humbling feeling when you're in the building and read the information about how it was built and survived 2 world wars and soviet rule.
Beautiful but not free. Absoutely beautiful church but you have to pay to get in. Its a very small donation though so don't let that scare you away if you're on a student budget like me.

Breathtaking Fairy Tale Experieince. This was the highlight of Budapest for me. The Basilica itselft is fabulous with a steep multicolored roof. The surrounding edifices and the statue of St. Stephen was otherworldly. The castles complex made me think one of these towers must have been where Rapunzel would let down her long flowing hair for her prince. This is a mesmerizing compound. Also has a fabolous restaurant there Halaszbastya. Make reservations for this.
