Exquisite. we attended mass on a sunday, and it was in Hungarian but was so sacred.. organ in the background, really an experience
Enormous. We never did get time to go up the tower but saw this building by day and by night, spectacular. We were disappointed the doors were not open so we could see what it was like inside.

Truly Amazing Basilica. This is the most amazing Basilica (church)! The area it is located in is in a beautiful square on the Pest side of the city. The square itself is something to see, which a beautiful tiled street/square leading up to the Basilica. The Basilica is a sight to behold and such a magnificant, HUGE building. People look soooo small when standing near this structure. The interior is beautiful, with many statues, paintings, and intricacies, it is just hard to fully describe. Definitely go check it out. The area itself is really nice. A more upscale part of the city, with restaurants, shops, etc. in the nearby area. Take a walk around.

Surprise view!. I went to the top where they had the Panorama View.. Was able to walk around the outside of the tallest building in Budapest! Photo ops galore! Missed the Treasury, as they unexpectedly closed early for a special mass while I was doing the Panoramic View. BUT was able to go inside the Basilica on a tour, which was another surprise to my visit there. The Basilica is a must see!
st istvan. if you are in Budapest, you must see it.it is one of the top three monuments in Budapest.there was a little fair instead, wine, sausages, music...

Imposing architecture. The church was a few minutes walk from our hotel. We used it as a landmark for figuring out which direction to take. It is a beautiful basilica. Outside it is imposing. Very grand structure and worth a visit.

Impressive. Very impressive church! Very beautiful inside and outside.
If you are there, pay the entrance to the panoramic view on the top of the Church, you can go by lift or stairs. Once you're up there, you'll have a beautiful view from the historic center of the city.

Great!!!!. It's a big and beautiful Basilica that is really worth visiting it while in Budapest!
It's nera the center of town and you can easily walk there from the main shopping street!

Amazing Sights. You don't want to miss St. Stephens Basilica. I've been to my fair share of churches, cathedrals and basilicas so the thought of going to another wasn't too thrilling. Boy, did I stand corrected. It is beautiful inside and outside. Definitely worth the 200HUF to get into the church -it's breath taking. Equally as breath taking is the panoramic view up top (both stairs and elevator) this as well is worth the price 500HUF. It was an amazing view of the city You could also see "behind the scenes" as you make your way to the top, it was fun.
Stunning views!. Walk up (or take lift but) do go to the tower. The views are amazing and quite different to many cities as lack of construction work taking place.

Magnificent without being brash.. St Stephen's is most definitely a place of worship first and foremost, rather than just being part of the tourist trail as some churches seem to be. I has a tremendous sense of history, being linked to the earliest kings of Hungary and it is quite humbling to take one's place in this beautifully proportioned basilica.

Classical concert in St. Stephen´s Basilica. The Basilica i grandious, outside and inside. We went to a classical concert. Very few people went to the concert, so we got to sit close in the front. It was a very nice experience although it was a bit cold in the church. (Propably expensive to heat up, since there are 96 m to the top).The tickets were a bit expensive, but we found it worth it.

Very beautiful church. If you like visiting churches this one will not disappoint. It is very pretty and worth seeing. there is a small charge and it is quite central with a lovely square outside. Lots of smaller chapels within and the relic of st Stefans hand!!!

A wonderful building. Having passed by several times during our visit we decided to enter making payment of a small fee. It is a truly marvellous sight inside and is pristine in presentation. Whilst I explored and viewed the relic (right hand of St Stephen) my wife sat on a pew absorbing the serene atmosphere of the Baslica

stunning panoramic view of budapest. Don't miss! climb the basilica's dome 500 Ft. for adult,view from the top is awesome. :D From here you can see the parliament,Royal palace,Statue of liberty,Mathias church and Fisherman's Baston. Worth for climbing 65 tower meters ;)
Beautiful. This has got to be one of the most beautiful churches in the world. Mass was wonderful and even though did not understand the language was able to follow.
See St Stephan's hand. Beautiful basilica, the highlight is the mummified hand of St. Stephen. There is a suggested donation of 200ft (<1 euro). Nice photos to take from the square outside.

Stunning inside & from the roof, dont just observe from outside. The inside of this amazing building is STUNNING! Amazing detail. Well worth a look. Also would recommend paying the approx £1.50 per person to go up to the roof. A lot of stairs or you can take the lift. Great views over Budapest, including the Danuba and the chain bridge.
St. Stephen's Basilica. The entrance cost 200 HUF / 1 euro (optional) but it's worth to see the interior of the church. The chapel of the relics of St. Stephen's is open from 1 pm.
Impressive!. Fantastic building with very ornate interior. Go to the chapel at the back to see the mummified hand of St Stephen.

beautiful architecture. amazing church!!!! very beautiful to the slightest details...
building outside is amazing too, definitely take lots of pictures, during the day and at night

Beautiful!. Take a few peaceful moments. For a couple of pounds you can enter and take in the beautiful interior and go an see the famous relic! I would say a definite must if you are visiting the city. In December there is a Christmas Market out front, have a few mulled wines or Hot Apple Cider with a shot of Rum in a lovely setting.

Stop in. Yes, there is a suggested donation of about $1 per person to enter. It is worth it! The inside reminded me of a miniature St.Peters! Very beautiful and calming. Be sure to have 200 FT on hand to light up the mummified hand. Follow the signs to the chapel of the right hand which is in the front to the left.
Beautiful. We didn't go in the Basilica as we were due to leave a few hours later, but from the outside the building is beautiful, especially in the snow

Beautiful Church. Centrally located, very beautiful interior with only a small donation required for entry. We also paid approx £1.50 to go up the lift to the top with really fantastic views. would recommend a visit when in Budapest

Beautifull marble church. The Szent Istvan Bazilika is located in the city center on a big square. Admission is free, only a 'gift' of 200 HUF (0.66 euro) is expected. The inside is a huge and impressive church, with lots of red marble. Sometimes classical concerts are also held in the church. It's also an 'operational church', when we visited the locals gathered for the start of an office.Worth the visit even if you are not a churches fan, just for the interior of the building

Indescribable beauty. Firstly, they ask for a 200 forint donation which is about 70p. Some people would think that they were asking for your right arm or something!! I would give a lot more to see this beautiful church again. 70p is not exactly "making a business" out of it as some would suggest! The interior is so very beautiful and ornate. The silence is amazing too, to walk in from a busy city into a silent peaceful place is nice. We also paid the bank busting sum of 500f (around £1.50) each to climb the tower (sarcasm is so my style!) and what a beautiful view you get. The lift was working while we were there unlike some other reviewers. It took us around an hour to do it all but you could definitely spend more time there if you wished. I recommend you spend the 220f towards the upkeep of this place so it's there the next time you wish to visit or even your children/grandchildren.
Most beautiful basilica. This was worth the effort of visiting Budapest as it was absolutely beautiful inside and o much to take in......

Great building, lack of soul. The place is well conserved, clean, almost aseptic. On aesthetics grounds, it is a jewel, definitely worth the 200 HUF "donation" fee, enforced by unpaid staff. The St Istvan arm reliquary is an interesting item to see. Altogether, the massive building is best enjoyed from the outside.

The marble work is amazing. This basilica is magnificent. So grand and architecturally captivating. The marble work is very unique - the colours are quite rare for a building like this - dark yet rich looking. There is no cost to enter, though donation boxes are at the entry way. You can also see the hand of St.Stephen here - don't miss it as it is tucked away through another internal entryway on the left hand side of the building.

Gorgeous place, lively square. This is a can't miss square. Day or night it is packed with lively tourists and locals. During holiday time they hold festivals in the square and project shows on the side of the Basilica.

Well preserved yet.... ...when I see signs saying "tourists no" left, right and center, I feel unwelcome. I understand this is a place of worship, yet, other cities have found a workaround for tourists, which is specific time slots for visits (e.g. Krakow). Worth seeing the chapel of the Dark Madonna.

Organ concert + observation deck. Fortunately arrived just in time for a 5pm organ concert - stunning classical pieces - excellent organist and mezze soprano. 45mins flew by. Great way to absorb the atmosphere and let your eyes wander around the beautiful interior.Also climb the stairs to the observatory deck (MUCH more adventurous and exciting than the lift!) for great panoramic views of the city.

Astonishing structure.. Took 50 years to build this place. Not surprising when you see the handworks at the stained glasses, drawings and sculptures. It is nearly as good as the ones at Italy and France. You can spend a wonderful hour inside. Highly recommended.

Even better than basilic in Venice!. This magnificent sacral building had a great impact on me. I must say that breadth of this building may be overwhelming. Golden ceilings, altars and marble collumns - everything is really woth seeing. It is a good idea to go here on Sundays mass.

Another of Your Budapest Must Do's. Don't miss seeing this beautiful building a small donation should be left for entering.
Additionally you can walk up or take the elevator to the top of the cupola for some great 360 degree views of Budapest
A visit is recommended on a clear day if possible

WOW!. I was so taken aback when I walked into the basilica! It leaves you speechless! The church is beautiful, decorated in gold. The dome is breathtaking. I was overcome by a sense of spirituality and inner peace while exploring the church and taking in the architecture and detail. A definite MUST SEE in Budapest! Yes, there is a minimal donation to enter.

One of the more impressive churches of Europe. We visited here on a Sunday morning during a service and found it very impressive. Beautiful architecture and an impressive organ (both visually and audibly) make it definitely worth a visit. The entrance is only a 200 forint donation (less than $1) and I'd say there's no reason to not do it.The building was designed by Miklos Ybl, who also designed the Hungarian State Opera House and several other prominent buildings in Budapest. There are many similarities between the Opera House and the Basilica, so if you don't have the chance to go to the Opera House, the Basilica is a good alternative that costs almost nothing.

MUST!!!. This is one of the most beautiful Basillica's in Europe (after Rome). One of the reviewers wrote that you have to pay to get in and that is not true! One of the priest asked for donation 2000Ft. Which my group gave since it will go into keeping this beautiful and breathtaking monument! If we do not donate to historical monuments they will all be gone in 20 years. Besides that this Basilica is a MUST SEE! You won't regret it especially if you are into art, architecture and similar things.

St. Stephen's Basilica. A beautiful church. We walked up the 300 steps to balcony at the base of the dome. Well worth it. Only problem was that being January there was ice outside and nobody had bothered to grit it or remove it. It was very precarious walking around up there. Don't miss visiting this church.

Magnificent city views from the Dome. Beautiful interior although there was a concert being held that evening and much of the Basilica was cordoned off. We were not allowed to visit the Holy Right Hand Chapel. This area was not roped off but, when we ventured in, we were thrown out!!! However, we were pleased that the Dome viewing platform was open. (my guide book had said it was closed in the Winter). We paid 500 HUF each to get in but then we were told the lift was out of order and we would need to climb the 300 + steps. This was OK for us but not good if you have any sort of disability as we were not told at the time of purchase. Well worth the climb though. The views over the city were amazing.

small donation for up keep is worth it. This is one of the most beautiful churches with gorgeous art pieces and a marvelous dome. The church in Hungary receives no state support to maintain these wonderful cultural sites.
You have to pay to get in. I never had to pay to get in to a catholic church in my life, shame to make business with the house of the lord!

Come on...it's a mummified hand!!. The Basilica is impressive and seems to be almost covered in gold, but the real reason other than another European beautiful church, is "the Holy Right". The mummified hand of St.Stephen is in the back in another small part of the Basilica. We were there in a non-tourist time, but it was empty. I was rather disappointed in the display until I deposited a Euro or so, and "AAAAGGGHHHH" the light shown on and my husband and son looked in awe like boys would at a mummified hand. Just one of those off the beaten track things to see if you are into that sort of thing.

Beautiful place!. Very beautiful place, except there was a priest at the door asking for donation of 200 ft and when we gave him 200, he asked for another 200 because apparently it is per person. I found this quite inappropriate as it seemed more like an entry fee rather than a donation.

A divine view. This is a really beautiful and peaceful place to come. I am not religious but I love visiting churches and cathedrals and was really taken back by this one. Central location, easy to find.A donation is asked for on entrance but this small fee for the view within and certainly if you take the time to head up to the top of what is one of the tallest points of the City

Impressive cathedral. Only saw it from the outside - unfortunately no time to go inside. But it would be well worth a visit, probably one of the highlights of Budapest. Beautiful city, if you like Prague, you'll certainly enjoy Budapest.

The most photographed sight in the city. Understandably so, it is absolutely beautiful! On the day we were there there was a play of the Nativity Scene, preparing for Christmas Day which was precious. Such a beautiful basilica! One of the most beautiful churches I have seen in Europe!

Worth a visit. The Basilica is impressive with a beautiful calm atmosphere. The mummified hand of St.Peter is in another part of the Basilica and not that easy to see as lots of people visit there and it is in a cabinet.

Magnificent temple. This temple is so astonishing from the outside as well as from the inside! We visited on a sunny day and the rays of light were making the red and golden coulouring look magnificently vivid! We were absolutely impressed! In the entrance, there was a priest asking for donation, claiming that it is appropriate since there is no entrance fee (which would be unacceptable because a temple is considered to be a holy place where someone could go in order to pray!) Although the way were asked to donate was a bit awkward, we didn't mind leaving some forints. I strongly recommend visiting when in Budapest!

Check for events before visiting.... ...or you shall visit in vain. Although the church is impressive, the overall rating is bad due to the fact that for starters the entrance isn't free as stated - yes, they call it "a donation", but it can hardly be defined as voluntary with the priest standing right next to you reminding you that you should drop a euro into the "donation box", otherwise you can not get in. All fair, the sight is worth a lot more, but then there should be tickets... and a check, of course.Ok, so we "donated" the money and upon entering the building realized that (due to the upcoming concert) our movement area was limited to a small part in the corner of the church. To make it worse, after a couple of minutes we were forced out by a couple of extremely nervous priests and without any explanation. We assumed it had something to do with the concert, but then again - maybe that euro only buys that much. Again, wouldn't grunge about it if we were told at the entrance that this is what our experience of Basilica would be.Hope you have better luck and manage to enjoy the Basilica fully, from what we managed to see, it looks like a masterpiece.
well worth a visit. St. Stephen's is located in Budda on a bluff overlooking the city. The inside is currently undergoing much construction, but is a worthwhile site to visit.
Amazing. This church is worth your time. The church houses a mummified hand of the first king of Hungary and the architecture is breathtaking.

It's really great - big and beautiful!!!. The place for compulsory visit!!! You'll spend 1 hour (maybe more;))) admiring very nice interiors of Basilica and overviewing Budapest from 65-m-height tower)). Breathtaking!;))

Christmas Eve. The Basilica looked like a palace from outside, but when we devided to visit it for Christmas Eve (it started at midnight of 24th December) the whole picture got another value. The nice architecture with gold and marble everywhere, under the sound of the Organ and the Chorus, singing for Christmas, cannot be easily described. If you have the chance to visit Budapest during Christmas, make sure to go to St.Stepen's Basilica on the 24/12 midnight.
beautiful basillica. this is a beauty in itself ,situated on the hill top .undergoing some repairs.Buses are avaiable to reach the place.A walk uphill is good as well .
Beautiful. We enjoyed the christmas market and the church to equal measure...sad part we cudnt climb up the stairs....closed....

Took my breath away!. An amazing place and defiantly worth the visit. It reminded me of St Peters in Rome and it was absolutely beautiful. Went to the top and the views were amazing. Worth the climb up all those stairs!

Gorgeous edifice, and don't miss seeing St. Stephen's hand!. During our visit to Budapest last spring, we couldn't miss visiting St. Stephen's Basilica. It is quite beautiful as you would expect. We enjoyed seeing St. Stephen's hand in a chapel to the rear of the church. It's a bit cheesy, but if you put a coin in the slot to the right of the display, it lights up. There is an attendant near the display who will encourage you to pay up. We were laughing seeing him trying to get some young ladies to do it, and all were happy to see it when the lights went on. We got a better view of the mummified hand, and got a better photo as well.
A beautiful church - worth going inside as well.. Truly magnificent! Worth walking around the church from the outside and seeing the opulence from the inside...
beautiful. The basilica was beautiful, the architecture is amazing and the square in front is lovely.A great meeting place to see the city and to people watch.
A concert in the evening. Wow it was a great concert in the St Stephen´s Basilica. We enjoyed it very much and we recommend you to go there. A little bit cold in the Basilica though.

Worth the visit. For a small fee you can either walk up or get the lift to the top of the Basilica for amazing 360 degree view of the two cities. As a photographer I was in my element, and we were lucky enough to have lovely weather too. Definately worth a trip

Beautiful building. Unfortunately I didn't get a chance to get inside it, but it is amazing from the outside as well. We was there during the New Year's and they had an evening light show, where the entire front of the Bazilika was lit up. There was a lot of small stands, an ice rink and a christmas tree when we were there.
St Stephens Basilica. The most wonderful building have ever seen Well worth a visit and close to restaurants etc In the centre of town. All within walking distance of attractions

absolutely beautiful. Although we did not go into the Basilica, this was one of our highlights in Budapest, with the Christmas Market in the square and the Basilica towering over us while we enjoyed all the stalls. Stunning building and not to be missed!
Beautiful interior. The interior is beautiful, and you are able to climb to the top for some breath taking views of Budapest. Definitely recommend it
Atmospheric church.. Happened upon a youth choir rehearsing in it and the sound was brilliant. Nice outside at night! Shrine to Cardinal Mindsentzy (hope spelling ok) a reminder of darker days!

wonderful church. Absolutely wonderful church! Outside is beautiful, but inside... WOW!!! Words can't describe the feelings that you have sitting in front of the right hand of St. Stephen... A must in this lovely city!

Awe inspiring. We've been to a few Basilica's/Cathedrals around the world. St Stephen's is one of the finest I've seen to date. The Fresco work on the inside of the dome is really outstanding, with some amazing scene's painted. We caught the end of a ceremony when we visited, and once the lights went up, the Goldwork on all of the alcoves seems to radiate warmth, definitely worth a visit.
St. Stephen's Basilica. Striking, beautiful, rivaling anything Rome or Florence has to offer albeit on a smaller scale. The alter is an amazing example of Hungarian art

Climb to the top for great views. Very beautiful basilica. Make sure you climb to the top for some great views of the city. If you are hungry, there are plenty of restaurants in the area that are very good.

Walk to the top was outstanding. We visited the church at dusk..View from top of Christmas market was great! The inside of the church was also good, but a bit dark. Better to schedule that visit during day light hours.

Views from the Dome are a highlight. An impressive building to visit, although based on our experience much of the Basilica is closed to visitors for some parts of the day. The trip up the tower to the dome is worthwhile - it is very cheap and there are either stairs or a lift/elevator. There are good views over Pest, and view over the Danube to Buda.

Great views if you can stomach the steps!. We walked up to the tower of the Basililca on a reasonably clear day - all 302 steps (!) up some quite rickety spiral iron staircases... our lungs were really feeling the effort by the top, but we were rewarded with the most amazing views. Definitely worth the burn if you want the most perfect panoramic shots - or simply want to watch the world go by from a height! There are lifts if you don't fancy the 302 steps too.
Wow!!. Most Amazing place! Took 50years to build. More marble than you can believe. Saw a classical concert there on Sunday night it was incredable!!
Stunning church. We were lucky enough to experience during our visit a children choir that was performing xmas songs that really made a difference to the whole ambience. Grandeur at its best!
Beautiful. The basilica is breathtaking and well worth a look. It's also fronted by a square where there was a gorgeous mini Christmas market and ice-skating rink. Lovely!

Beautiful, Peaceful. This is a really beautiful and peaceful place to come. I am not religious but I love visiting churches and cathedrals as well a other attractions and was really taken back by this one. Central location, easy to find (being the joint tallest building in Budapest!), charming christmas market outside. Small donation asked for on entrance, small fee for the view point. Just didn't have time to go up to see the view point.

spectacular views of the city from the tower. Elevator to the tower brings you second elevator and then only a few stairs and the views are great . You can walk all around for east, west, north, south photos and see your sites from above.

Not the nicest church I've ever seen. Fortunately you don't have to pay to enter this gloomy and heavily visited basilica. We went up to the dome. The view was nice but not really extraordinary (I would sooner recommend the views from Castle Hill).
Brilliant. We went to St Stephen's Basilica and listened to a organ concert which was really fun, the acoustics along with the architecture are stunning and well worth spending some time there.
Very impressive . This church is at the heart of the city and its a must see. You can get up in the main tower to get a spectacular view of the city.
Very nice Basilica. The Basilica is very nice to look at - it is beautifully decorated. The entrance fee is, if I am not mistaken, HUF 200 per person (about €0.80) and the entrance fee is worth it!
A must see. Yesterday another stunning piece of architecture hidden away in one of the side streets. A beautiful church inside and out.

Beautiful inside. The outside of the basilica is nice to watch but nothing spectacular compared to other basilicas. During christmas season a nice market is in front of it with a lot of market stalls and an ice rink.
The inside is just amazing. A lot of colorful windows and an unbelievable ceiling with paitings and ornaments.

Holiday spirit. I have visited basilia during New Year. Small wooden houses with food and drinks in front are special for own spirit.
Basilica has 8500 seats, it is high 96m.
Worth a visit. Its a beautiful basilica, but make sure you go up the top. Its a long way up but the view is amazing.

the best £1.95 I've ever spent!. We visited the basilica after a very busy day sightseeing and it was absolutely one of the most beautiful churches I have ever visited. In response to some of the negative reviews on here, would say that £1.95 is a verysmall amount to pay to the maintenance and heating of this amazing building. When we visited it was very busy and so it seemed necessary to have somebody 'manning' the donation box so that there was some order on entering the building. We paid 200ft to enter the church plus 500fteach to go to the tower. The views here are incredible and cannot be seen from any other point in the city. A must see.

Beautiful church and great view up top. This is a beautiful church, really stunning particularly inside. It costs a donation to go in, which is some negligible amount and is well worth more. For a small extra charge you can climb the main tower (despite hastily hand-written signs saying you do this at your own risk!). There is a lift part of the way, but I wouldnt go so far as to call it 100% accessible. Well worth it for the views though. The xmas market outside is also very nice, with a small skating rink and the usual stalls. Please watch out for pickpockets though!!!! My wife caught someone with their hand in her bag and though she scurried off empty handed, we later saw the same woman lingering among the crowds going into the church (we didn't spot any security or police in the area until later). Certainly made us more on our guard and I'd advise others to be.

Concert with the Duna Strings at St. Stephens.. Quite by chance I picked up a leaflet near the castle advertising a classical concert to be played in St Stephens. I ended up in the vicinity of St. Stephens later in the afternoon, and picked up a couple of tickets.First, the venue. St Stephens is every bit as enchanting as many more famous churches, despite its relative youth. It is breathtakingly beautiful, and worth viewing at any time.The Duna strings orchestra were a treat to listen to, guest violinist Gabora Gyula was superb. If you get the chance to see them, I recommend you attend. Low priced tickets are fine, but if you get the slightly higher priced ones, you sit directly beneath the dome.

Stunning Basilica, stunning views. This huge imposing building boasts incredible views of the city provided you're not scared of heights. Access to the observation level is by 300+ steps or a combination of lift and steps. When up top the views are amazing and access to this is around 400 Huf pp (01/13).The inside of the basilica is as beautiful as the views from the top, highly ornate, very imposing and you have the option of taking in a choral performance at around 7500 Huf pp.
Astonishing Basilica. Every inch is worth seeing. Don´t forget to visit the Chapel with St. Stephen's hand: really incredible!
Golden light in the Basilica. The golden late afternoon light coming in through the windows made the beautiful ceilings shine brightly and made the church come alive for us.

Just glorious. This is such a imposung building it is dominating yet serene and we loved the area around it which was so Christmassy and such beautiful attention to detail with the lovely floor tiles and nativity scene ....there was a skating rink and a christmas tree on the square outside and many food stalls which frankly were far too tempting........wow and wow again

Midnight Mass. We went to Midnight Mass on Christmas Eve. Although we couldn't fully appreciate all the beauty of the Church because it was so crowded, it was a truly special experience. The inside is stunningly beautiful and the pipe organ sounded amazing!

Worth the view. Loved being able to get up above the city for some lovely views. Worth paying the money to go to the top. It was good to be able to roam freely outside to take the pictures. Church is lovely inside (though there was a wedding on whilst we were there so our access was limited to allow the wedding party privacy)
Gorgeous. Beautiful both inside and out. Particularly worth visiting at Christmas for the market outside and the lights. Trip up to the 'panorama' is essential (and cheap!).

Overlooking and blessing the city of Budapest. Another of the sites which are lit at night, we wandered around this basillica during both day and night. It is overwhelming in its presence and provides a centerpiece to Castle Hill
Worth the visit. Like: Much history in its architectural design, stained glass windows and the how a building such as this was able to withstand its turbulent past.

Most breathtaking I've been too. Been to a lot of theses attractions in Rome,Paris,Berlin,Oslo,Florence and this stand out for me. Very rarely you see so much red marble. Breathtaking. Plus the Xmas market was outside it when we were there

Very beautiful for HDR photography. Was searching for the cathedral, it was surrounded by buildings. There was a small Christmas market in front of the cathedral. The size of the cathedral is huge, The entry is free, and very good for HDR photography, can use tripods inside the cathedral. Normally we can visit top of the cathedral with an entry fee, but it was snowing so was closed.
Beautiful. Beautiful church in the center of Budapest. Also beautiful from inside, you can get into without ticket. It worths

Impressive. One of the most beautiful churches I've visited in Europe. The interior is gorgeously appointed. St. Stephen's hand is kept in a small box in a chapel off the side of the altar, but it's nearly impossible to see it. Pay the extra fee to climb the tower (or take the elevator) for an incredible view of the city.

Heart of the city. The way St. Stephen's Basilica imposes over Budapest is impressive. Make the effort of climbing the stairs to the observation deck, from which you can see the city stretching below to all directions. As opposed to the perhaps more imposing St. Stephen's Basilica in Vienna, this church is also beautifully decorated inside. The ceilings and columns are true works of art. Plus the square surrounding the church is home to some nice bistros and restaurants as well as a small, cozy Christmas market.
breathtaking. A stunning building, a must see for any trip to Budapest. Especially in winter with the lovely market at the entrance.

Beautiful inside and out. Inside is worth a look, lovely grand design and also the hand of St. Stephen can be viewed.
Unfortunately did not get to go up the tower.

Top place to visit in Budapest. St. Stephen's Basilica is a must visit while in Budapest. It is one of the most lovely church buildings in Europe. We visited the Christmas market which just behind it as well and were delighted to find a good offering of local food and products. In all this is a nice site, easy to get to on the Metro as well.

Short visit but nice. We enjoyed the basilica, only brief visit. We paid to go to the top and see the view, which was lovely and covered with snow! Made it a little hard to see but very pretty! We also paid again to visit the tower room which showcases St. Stephen's crown and mummified hand - the kids got a big kick out of that!
Impressive Basilic. The priest wasn't obliging us to pay, the church is great with wonderful environment. The contribution was optional
Awesome place!. We went there at Sunday, that was one of the most impressive things i have seen in Budapest! Even if you are not catholic, i can highly recommend it to visit!

Commercial but beautiful.. It's sad how they commercialised this beautiful church, bringing this materialistic atmosphere onto it. As already mentioned by others, a priest is OBLIGING to 'donate' 200 forint - not much at all, but in religious and all other views this must come voluntary and from the heart, not forced - and if you want to see the hand you also need to put money. It's sad, because apart from that the church is wonderful, with lots of gold and beautiful paintings. The atmosphere of materialism spoiled it a bit for me, but for the resg I was impressed by its beauty!

Disappointing. This Basilica is plastered all over touristy paraphernalia. It is something you are supposed to see. So WHY would it close at 2 PM on a Saturday? In addition to the early and unexpected closure of the Basilica, more than half of it was covered in scaffolding. The best pictures we got were from the opposite side of the river from a distance. It was something we were really looking forward to and felt really let down because we did not get to experience it. We only had 1 day in Budapest so there was no opportunity to go back.
serene. We visited on day one as our hotel was at the steps at 9.00am. The basilica was peaceful and very beautiful. The hand of St istavan strange but fascinating.

Beautiful Picture location. We didn't get a chance to visit the inside of this basilica however, In our last night in Budapest, my husband and I walked over to photograph this Basilica from the outside. It's such a beautiful church from the outside and it photographs well!
nice. very nice Basilica, it was under renowation when we visit. Go to the Roseworm coffee place (just across the Basilica) for great hot chocolate and caces

Impressive and conforting. If you are religious or not, pay a visit to this impressive church, it's part of Budapests history and you can regain your serenity after some moments of peace while admiring the basilicas treasures and arhitecture.

Wrong location, trip advisor! . Just because there's a church on a street called St Stephen's doesn't mean the Church is also St Stephen's!
Trip Advisor was 8km off! Thank goodness for Google Maps instead.
Imposing. A magnificent cathedral in a continent of magnificent cathedrals. No doubt impressive. Just not a Chartres. Well worth a visit, though, including the square in front of it.

Very impresive church. The church was amazing with the entire building dripping in gold leaf. Lovely to look at but I just wondered whether Jesus Christ really wanted this amount of indulgence and wealth in a church. Having said that some lovely photos though

Superb views. Make sure you head to the viewing platform at the very top! Views over Budapest are sublime. You can take the stairs, or the lift, if you're not fit enough! From memory it was £2/3 per person, so very cheap. A must see in my opinion.
dont miss. This is a place you must not miss.The beauty inside and out is exquisite.The fact that most of the time there is some kind of concert going on is strictly a bonus.

beautiful and quite reasonable in price. Amazing and spectacular on the inside. Beautiful art and architecture. Entry was 200 hungarian or 1 euro (as a donation) so quite reasonable. You could also climb to the top to get a nice view of Budapest

Beautiful outside and inside, if only about 100 years old.. It has a light and airy feel, with beautiful paintings on the ceilings and not at all gaudy like some religious buildings. Although seeing the right hand of St Istvan, who lent his name to the basilica, was rather strange. It is mummified in a box on display in a rear chapel and if you pay 200 florints, you can get it to light up.

Inspiring church. Typical of the European cathedrals this is lovely and inspiring. Be sure to see St. Stephen's hand in the chapel at the back - a preserved relic. Take a few coins wth you, as the little house the hand is in won't light up for you to see the hand unless you give the attendnt some money! Worth it tho - especially if you want to take a photo

Christmas market just outside. The basillica is beautiful but I just wanted to leave a tip for anyone going around Xmas. There is a great little Xmas market just outside the Basillica which has a range of stalls - some of which are better than the main markets at Vorosmarty square.
Very grand. A most interesting cathedral. A great place for a little peace and contemplation in a busy city. Don't miss the hand of St. Stephen
Beautiful Basilica. The Basilica is beautiful and definitely worth visiting. If you can, attend a concert there. What a magical, musical evening.

Great views from the top!!. The Basilica is beautiful inside and well worth a visit. While there they were rehearsing for the Christmas concert so we got a free listen to a beautiful voices opera singer. I imagine a concert in there would be incredible.The interior ceiling is really beautiful. We went in to see the hand which was a little disappointing. You can't get very close so it is hard to see and you have to pay to light the box it is in.Visiting the dome is well worth it. There is a lift partway up but the stairs aren't too tiring.The views across the city are fabulous, especially if you visit near sunset.

Beautiful in the morning, evening and even in the rain!. Amazing building! It is definitely worth it to go inside and have walk around. I was there short before Christmas, and just in front of Basilica is the best Christmas market i saw! A lot of music, good wine and you can get there very unique presents for small amount of money. Atmosphere is really special. There is a fee to enter the basilica, but it was around 200 HUF. They also very nice concerts.
Great view from the top. Great view from the top. Beware - the lift only goes up 3 floors and then you have to walk the rest - not too far (maybe 100 steps?) but its a winding, iron staircase.
Basilica. This is a lovely basilica and from the tower you have a beautiful view over the city. I would say it is well worth visiting this.
Very pretty. Very pretty church. Not as old as you would think. Has the hand of Saint Stephen in it! You can climb to the top but we didn't.

Beautiful. No visit to Budapest is complete without seeing St. Stephen's Basilica. At this time of year it is something else! Xmas market stalls all around, lovely modern Xmas tree, ice skating rink. Beautiful church both inside and out - worth a walk to the top - great views over the city.

St. Stephen's Sizzles. Named after the Hungarian king, not the first Christian martyr, St. Stephen's is a fascinating place both day and night. Beautiful on the inside as well as the exterior, it has a huge square in front of it with several restaurants for enjoying the view, and regular (very inexpensive) concerts are given in the church throughout the year.

Extra special at Xmas.. No visit to Budapest is complete without seeing St. Stephen's Basilica. At this time of year it is something else! Xmas market stalls all around, lovely modern Xmas tree, ice skating rink, not to mention mulled wine and food. There is also an amazing light show of the nativity lasting just a few minutes every half hour I think. Our favourite place in the evening in Budapest.

Lovely interior, well worth a visit. I had the chance to go to a concert one evening. While the acoustics were not great, and the chamber group was just ok, it was worth the price of the ticket to sit there just to enjoy seeing the lovely interior.

ruined by greed. I was there with my friends, we were shocked by a priest standing at the entrance next to a 'donation' box. The way he was standing there is like demanding for money and one of my friends said she didnt have enough coins as she grab all her money from her pocket and open her palm to have a look, the priest said its ok and he simply took those coins and said "for photos", of course there was no sign prohibiting taking photos anywhere. We went inside, enjoyed the church atmosphere which is beautiful and continued to see the 'holy hand'. We got into the room only to see the hand in the display box WITHOUT the lights on, next to the display is a security lady and a sign saying for using flash we must pay. Me and my friends were laughing because we felt like it has become a business, we made photos of that sign instead of the hand and made it obvious to the security lady that we see it as a joke. May be we werent 'faithful' enough

Excellent. We had our Christmas there and the sense was very beautiful. It worth the time to visit it. You can also visit the open market outside the church and have a delicious meal or "gluwein" (hot wine with cinnamon and honey) with a great view of the church. It was totaly a great sense of Christmas..

Same as Parliament. See my review of Parliament. This, too, was okay. But nothing like what I expected. And they are currently doing lots of renovations-can't see everything. And they still charge full price.

Bedazzled. Wow, I've been to a lot of basilicas and cathedrals over the years, but this one was certainly spectacular. Bedazzling. Free admission. Maybe not the most conducive to quiet religious reflection (guilt from gilt?) but a wonderful historical site.

Loks great in front of Christmas Market. Is a great place to visit and with the Christmas market just in front of it - its a great backdrop. They even projected a light show onto the Church which was very impressive.

Unmissable. This is such a stunning basilica and the interior is gorgeous. The preserved hand of the saint is a bit grisly, but adds to the gothic feel of Budapest generally! Loved the smell of incense and the candles. Perfect
Amazing View. St. Stephen's is a beautifully ornate building and the view of the city at the top is breathtaking. This is one of the best ways to get a birds eye view of Budapest.

The church of church's. Very big very impressive, on entering they ask for 200fl (just under a Ozzie dollar) and do not take a tour, walk there as you need time to take it all in. It is really beautiful, the statues & painting and just the size. It is truly massive.
Beautifully kept basilica. Stunning! Really beautiful, quite bright, amazing frescos and gold leaf edging. Silence respected by tourists keeps a prayerful ambience.

Breathtaking. Even for a non catholic this building is the most impressive church i have ever seen. It is stunning and opulent and very thought provocing this is a must even if only to admire the architecture.

Stunning city view! . The Basilica is definately worth a visit... it is a brilliant example of the beautiful architecture that litters Budapest. The inside is lavishly decorated, although you have no idea what it is you are viewing as there seemed to be no information available (or certainly not in English anyway). The real attraction here is the tower, which may be climbed for around 500HUF (less for students, children etc.). I would strongly suggest doing so if you can conquer the stairs, as the reward is a 360° view of the city from its (joint) tallest building. A must-do in my opinion!

Cheapest Cathedral you'll possibly ever visit. Get in there. Not (quite) as flash at St Paul's in London - but not 20quid either. In fact, entry is yours for only 200 HUF (that's about 1 USD) and it's not actually a ticket (cos then it could be taxed) it's a "donation". Beautiful peaceful place, warm, great windows. Go after dark and enjoy the awesome sound/light projections on the Basilica from the Christmas market side (on the half hour)
My second favorite sight in Budapest!. This is another beautiful basilica in Europe and worth a trip. There is beauty both and on the outside and inside of the church.

A true Hungarian Landmark. Now is the time to visit this historic landmark..........we were there 14 years ago and it was surrounded by scaffolding for renovations, cleaning and repair.Today, all of that is gone and it is in all of its splendor!!!!!!!!!!
Viewed from the Danube. Again, it was a damp day when we saw this from the Pest side but its stunning. When we did get closer to it, it's huge. Unfortunately we didnt get to stay long here.
Impressive. Well worth a quick visit, if you are in the area you should definitely pop in and admire the basilica (free of charge).

Really beautiful , worth the time. It's a beautiful Church, you get to see the the right hand of King Steven of Hunagy (Istvan Kiraly).Take the elevator, to get to the top of the building , and have a bird's view look at the Danube and Mt. Gellert.You a look at the Dome from from what it look from the "inner outside".

room with a view. great view from above, panorama of Budapest is awesome.only go up if you've a head for heights and you don't mind the thought of 300 or so steps to get there plus the 500HUF to view from above

Beautiful. The Basilica is beautiful and well-maintained. Definitely a must-go in Budapest. The view from the top is well-worth the ticket price but I would skip the Treasury which is quite small and forgettable.

Nice BUT NOT FREE!. Trip advisor has this place listed under "Budapest for free" but it's really not as stated. Go with a couple of coins (Forints of course) as the priest manning will demand you drop your 200Forints before you go in. I wander what will happen if I was coming to pray (hmmmm). Anyway, it's a small fee to pay. It's breathtaking on the inside, with all the great architecture and glamor you will expect to see from a big church. Remember to walk around before you head for the roof top to get the panoramic view of the city. The hand of St. Stephen still lays in the church and with another 200Forints you can get it to light up to take amazing pics for yourself (and other tourists around). The dome is closed at 4pm so be sure to go before then if you want to get that view. It's a beautiful place to visit.

Crowning glory. A trip to St Stephens Basilaca would not be complete without a trip to the top of the dome where you have a wonderful view day or night. We were lucky enough to be here on a Monday when there is a short but fabulous organ recital, including a soloist to sing ave maria [made the hair on your neck stand on end].
Not IN but UP!. Go up the cupola, there's a lift and it's quite cheap, you'll get a great view of the city from a different prospective :)

Very Impressive. A very grand building, neo-renaissance style. It is ornately decorated has many stained glass windows and contains paintings by famous artists. There are guided tours and concerts. You can also take the stairs or lift to the domes observation area. The hop on hop off buses take you nearby. There are restaurants and coffee bars in the area.

On par with St Peters. Huge domed basilica beautiful and ornate - lots of gilt and spectacular paintings. We attended an organ recital with outstanding mezzo soprano - almost moved to tears. Go to a concert if you can.

Must see in Budapest. We went to the St. Stephens's Basilica on a hop on and hop of tour which can be highly recomended. The tickets for the tour last 48 hours and the audio information you get is very good and the voice in the audio set is very easy understandable with very clear pronaunciation. The information is also avaiable on - I think 15 other languagesIn the Basilica we had a guided tour and we enjoyed it
Grrr!. As usual you have to pay to enter a church, even if your Catholic and actually want to go in to pray your expected to give a "donation". Ridiculous!!
Beautiful church. Beautifully restored, lovely paintings, stained glass and gold leaf. Interesting to visit on a Sunday morning during a service. Wonderful acoustics.

Great views. I went to st Stephens church and climbed up the tower for 500 forints I think and it was so worth it, lots of stairs, some of stone then on to spiral metal stairs but it takes you right to the top, I could have spent ages looking over a sunny pest
Really nice views.. The church itself is ok nothing to really shout all that much about especially if you have been to Rome but the view from the tower is worth the extra few pounds to see.

Fairytale Architecture. What a beautiful building with fairytale like turrets you could imagine you where a princess. Shame about the very modern Hilton Hotel which really does spoil the elegance. Definately worth a visit.
Church and view point. Worth the small fee to take the lift up to the gallery around the dome, to see the views of the city, and also the internal structure of the building

Concert in the Basilica. Visited in the daytime and got some fantastic pictures of the building in the sunshine. Were given a flyer for a concert and decided to go, was a fantastic concert in a beautiful setting.

One of the most spectaculaire basilicas of Europe. The Basilica is a very nice building outside and inside. It was renovated only some years ago, the place, where you can find the Basilica is also very nice, on the other side of the place there are restuarants, coffeshops.

So beautiful. A rival for the Basilica on St. Marks Square in Venice.
The inside is every bit as wonderful as the outside, and it looks awesome lit up at night.
a great piece of art. a great view to explore from Buda no matter day time and night time because it was highlighted by its great dome wherever you are in the city.

Wonderful.... The Basilica is wonderful! As soon as you step inside your breath will be taken away by its beauties from top to bottom. There's a small chapel dedicated to the Black Madonna and an Holy Relic for you to see. Just amazing. Stained glass windows are gorgeous all around.At the entrance you're advised to pay a fee like if it was a donation to the church. You can pay whatever you wish to but it's advised to pay something around £1,5/€2 to help maintaining the church which is quite cheap for the purpose it serves and for what you can see inside.You can also watch concerts there for reasonably low prices. What a find! A must see in Budapest!

Gorgeous Church. This was one of the most beautiful churches I have been in. Not too old (1905) but a lot of history. There wasn't much guidance as to what we were looking at, no brochures that I could find. and the relic of St. Stephan was impossible to see.
Beautiful. Beautiful Cathedral, although the optional entry donation isn't optional as there is someone on the entrance making sure you put your 'optional' fee in the box
Beautiful. This you have to see. It is magnificent. The ceiling is superb and it is interesting to hear the history. They have the hand of a saint within a glass box.

the view is breathtaking. the view from the top is breathtaking, made my feet tremble...but i'm kinda afraid of heights, so no wonder.
beautiful sacral architecture, and the view from above make it one of the places to see.
Wonderful architectural church. Set on a lovely square with a few cafes and shops nearby, the huge church has great detail and would recommend a visit.
Large and impressive. Loved the sacred atmosphere and the richness of the decorations. The cupola was intensely decorative and the statuary was exquisite, too.
Excellent View!. St Stephen Basilica is the biggest catholic church in Budapest. Yoy can go upthe stairs (there is also an elevator) and you can admire the breathtaking view of Buda!
Imposing but impressive Church!. Lovely to walk around and can be seen from most places in the city. Very ornate.Lovely building design. Courtyards all around with many restaurants.
Great site. It's one of the most visited attractions in Budapest and it's impressive both outside and inside.Great view from the top. Worth stopping by.

unsurpassed beauty. we had been around europe for 2 months and where on our way home when we visited.It is the most beautiful religious building i have ever seen.From the outside it is impressive and nicely situated in a quiet square near Andrassy avenue and pedestrian streets.When you get inside the marble, stain glass windows create a bright beautiful place so different to the grey dark interiors of most cathedrals. It dose get busy so try to find a quiet corner and take it all in.Definitely a house of God.

Fantastic view and interior. We visited this on our first day in Budapest and it gave as a lovely birds eye view from the Buda side of town. The panoramic view is fantastic, we were lucky to get a clear autumn day, but I'm sure whatever the weather the view would be simply breathtaking!

Sit and take it all in. Around 200huf donation to enter the Basilica. It's an absolutely stunning building - we found a pew and sat down for an hour just taking it all in. Don't miss out if you're in the city, it's well worth having a look
To the top. Toured the church as part of a tour group. Lovely church. Went back twice. Once during the day to take elevator to top. Incredible views. Once at night to see church lit up.

lovely at night time. didnt visit in the day time..but night time it looked incredible
so much history in this wonderful city its hard to see it all!!
Yet another very nice church. If you are one of the people who think there just can't be too many fancy churches, this one (too) is for you. Remember to see the mummified hand in the box.

Impressive. The outside of the Basilica was impressive. The inside was still beautiful but more modern. The hand of St. Stephen was also interesting. St. Stephen's Basilica is a must visit if you are in Budapest.

Dizzy but worth it!. Wandered here one day to fill an afternoon after the morning was miserable! Paid a small fee to head up to the tower... and saw the option of a lift or stairs....so we went stairs! There are over 300 and you just go round and round and round! Seriously dizzy at places, so stopped to turn the other way round, but when we got to the top, it was well worth it! The skyline is beautiful, and to have the 360 degree view of it, on top of this beautiful building, just finishes it off. The weather had cleared up by this time, so you could see right to the horizon! The castle, the parliament building, the Danube, Chain Bridge, Squares... the full lot. The typical buildings with the courtyards in the middle of them. You really got to see Budapest in another way.We then went back down the stairs (dizzy again) and went into the main building.... breathtaking. The artwork, the decor, the way it's been maintained. All so beautiful. While we were in there, some local men started singing what sounded like a hymn/prayer with amazing harmonies. They stood in the middle of the place, and it echoed throughout beautifully. Even without that.... this is definitely a place to visit! But if you're slightly older.... take the lift! ;-)
The hand is cool but creepy. Beautiful church. Skipped the dome, nothing will compare to the Vatican in Rome. Make sure you view St stephen's hand
Loved it. We went to the top of the dome and enjoyed the views across Budapest and beyond. Inside the church is also very lovely, peaceful and beautifully maintained.

Slightly disappointed!. Had been told that this was fantastic - whole place was cold, no guide books or anything else on offer to tell you what to look out for. Very dark, know that they have to keep it like this to preserve things but...........
Very beautiful. The basilica is beautiful inside and out. Also we particularly enjoyed taking the lift up to the top of the dome to see the view from there. It is windy so hold on to your hats.

Beautiful!. Located in the heart of Pest, this cathedral is Hungary's largest church and the second highest in ecclesiastical ranking. I was fascinated by the beautiful lighting inside. The presence of warm colours like golden-yellow, orange and red make the atmosphere inside so welcoming and so peaceful. This site is a must-see in Budapest. There is no entrance fee.

pessoal. Fifty years in the making, the Basilica of St Stephen is Hungary's largest church and the second highest in ecclesiastical ranking. Technically, it isn't really a basilica but the sheer size of the structure has led it to be referred to in this manor.Located in the city center, its a nice place to walk by day or night. There´s lot of restaurants and bars
Huge. This church is huge and takes about 25 minutes to see it all. The dome is particularly spectacular. No entrances during services.

A must see!. This basilica has the wow factor. We went to a musical performance one evening - the accustics were amazing. Had to go back the next day to take the building in and be fascinated by the mummified hand of St Stephen - only 200 HUF to have the light on - not worth seeing if you don't do this as you wont see anything!

Lovely church. This is a nice church which has been obviously well kept and looked after. With the compulsory donation of 200 HUF though then I would expect to see the church to be well kept. We saw the mummified hand of St Stephen without having to pay for extra charges however we did not go up the tower as the weather was not good. Worth a trip to this lovely church. Expect lots of people taking pictures with flash though.

Beautiful!. I was in awe the moment I stepped into the Basilica! Beautiful details inside the church and when you do get in, make sure to see the hand - St. Stephen's very own hand. Don't forget to climb up the tower too! There's a fee to climb up but The climb is worth it - breathtaking view of Budapest
St. Stephen's Basilica. This is a lovely church and the setting is beautiful. Taking a tour is good but just wandering around it and the area is also gret. Not to miss.

make sure you have your own key before entering the tower!!!!. we paid to go up the basilica tower looking forward to the views overlooking budapest from the top. we visited 30 minutes before closing time and were told it was fine to go up and had plenty of time. half way up we couldn't go any higher and found ourselves in darkness and couldn't go any higher so went to turn back on approaching a door to take us to the main staircase we found we had been locked in and couldn't go down the stairs. we found a lift which had a sign saying 'd'on't touch as dangerous' and as a last resort had to exit on this... unfortunately the cashier had already left when we got to the bottom (with our entrance fee for something we didn't see) but in hindsight it's probabally just as well she had! the church itself was amazing but after the tower experience i'd probabally avoid it like the plague.

Do not miss the towers. The Basilica is beautiful with its marbles and paintings. Entry to the Basilica is free however there is a fee to climb up to the towers. The climb is worth the fee. You have a commanding view of the Pest and the Buda side of the river.
Nice church -100 years old. Since we saw lots of European churches – this one did not impressed us too much. However is worth a visit.
breathtaking. The Pantheon in Rome is fantastic, but this is better!!! Really amazingly beautiful!!! Majestic and pomous :)
Very Pretty. Pretty inside, although some places were closed off. Couldn't get much of a story from my solo tour. Could do it thoroughly in 20 mins.
Glory to God. Very impressive building you were only asked for 1 euro or equivalent on entry. The interior did feel very peaceful. Lots of gold leaf like most RC cathedrals

Wow. We almost went on a rainy day, and decided to come back later. So glad we did because we would have been annoying everyone with squeaking on the floor. If you want to go into the Basilica it's a few Euros or Forints. It's worth it. It is also worth it to spend some Forints to go up to the top of the Basilica and look at the view from there. We spent the money to go the elevator way rather than the stairs way, and that was the best way to go. The view above is spectacular and breathtaking. We also went to see St Stephen's mummified hand and if you want to see it lit up, then you had to pay for that. We chose not to see it lit up, but if you come back August 20th they parade it around the city for free. Totally worth it.
magnificent. a magnificent building that presents tourist concerts several times a week. Best to look for notices on the doors, which are more up to date than what you find on the Internet.

The Main Church in Budapest. This is a relatively new church (started in the mid-1800's and finished in 1905). It is quite impressive but lacks that sort of historical weight that you usually find in grand European churches. The view from the dome is very good. Always seems to rank in the top 10 of Budapest attractions in the guide books.

Attend on one of Hungary's holy days. We visited Szent Istvan on All Hallows Day when there was a service taking place. This allows you to enjoy the music and feel the spiritual nature of Budapest's most glorious basillicas.
19th century pseudo baroque. It's enormous and in a very fine square, but it just looks like a pregnant version of the Karlskirche in Vienna without the beautiful interior.
Worth a visit. Beautiful building, beautiful surroundings.. You can go up to the top for a better view, really worth it, however if you're scared of heights, maybe not :)

Visit October 2012. there was a priest placed by the entrance seemingly to ensure all visitors contributed their voluntary 200HUF to enter. The frescos on the dome were impressive, and the withered hand of St Stephen was interesting to see. The climb up the dome is well worth the price for the panorama of Buda and Pest
A significant building in Budapest. This is an important building in Budapest, containing the mummified hand of St Stephen. You can also get up on to the dome by a seriesof lifts - worth doing
A must see. We walked past this large and imposing building on many occasions whilst in the city. When I finally ventured inside, I was amazed at the beauty and decoration inside. Recommended.
impressive. If you have been to other large basilica in the world, you will appreciate this as this is just as grand.

Concert in St Peter's Basillica. We bought the VIP seat option - well worthwhile as the seats at the back were a good distance away probably 40 metres. Music was very good if a little short. The whole programme lasted only about an hour
Well worth a visit. In awe at the wonderful ceilings and detail of the artwork. Truly beautiful Basilica and free to enter.
Beautiful Sight. A stunning church on the inside and the outside. A highlight of our trip. You must walk up the tower to experience the beautiful city of Budapest

One of the most beautiful churches in Europe. I've been to a lot of churches all over the world, and this is one of the most beautiful yet. I didn't find St. Stephen's arm, but the decor was incredible. The gilt glistened; it didn't look faded, old or crumbly. The marble was clean and beautiful. Worth paying the 200 FT = $1 USD entrance fee. I didn't pay to go up the tower, but the view is supposed to be good from there.

Incredible interior. To pay to go inside a church surely is not quite common, but the interior of this church is worth every Forint! (It´s only about 3 Euros) Open until 5 pm; if you are around take the chance and take a look - you will never forget this!

well worth a visit. we took a look around the Basilica. It is a very ornate building, a small fee has to be paid to go in. We paid to visit the panorama viewing platform, i can't remember the price but it wasn't too much. A lift takes you a bit of the way but you have to climb the spiral staircases to reach the top. The views are fantastic. Even on a cloudy day like it was when we visited you could see for miles and had good views of the castle and parliament buildings
Beautiful!. Absolutely gorgeous and beautiful St.Stephan's Basilica, there are also classic music concerts for those who like it.

Beautiful. It's a beautiful building but the interesting thing is the Szent Istvan hand inside. I recomend you to read about it before visiting, it's a huge mistery and will certainly make you curious.
An amazing church and worth the 300 steps to the top!!. Amazing at night, the church is simply stunning inside and out and you can take the steps or lift to the top and the views are amazing

A beautiful place for an Organ Concert. We are visiting Budapest on our way back from a cruise down the Danube to home. We are extraordinarily lucky and honored to have tripped over this organ concert ( The last of a long run for this series) not so much because of the fine location and the fine organist and flutist, but because of the extraordinary bass Kolos Kovats who graced us with his unerring understanding of the acoustics of St Stephen's Basilica and his powerful bass voice. I only wish more of the program was dedicated to him. He presents himself very simply and even humbly on stage. You might even consider him to be the organ repairman, or similar until you see him, but more importantly hear him in the full presence of his singing ability. Then you wonder if it can be coming out of him alone. More on him later.You can and should find the tired details of the Basilica on every website known to Hungary! It was built in blah blah, and destroyed and rebuilt in blah - all dull words totally belying the amazing splendor of actually being in the Basilica. It was more amazing because of the lighting effects. Before the concert the Basilica was dimly lit. Some statues stood out but everything was basically in shadows. Five minutes before the concert started all the appropriate lighting came on and the place sparkled. It was an amazing transformation. In the day time it doesn't look quite as magnificent as it did when moving from shadow to fully lit.After viewing both Parliament and the Basilica, I had to ask myself why would anyone exhaust the coffers of a kingdom to build things of stone when their people are starving in the streets.The only thing that came to mind to our party was that people even in times of dire need, need signs and symbols to look to and to look up to that raise the spirit and their hopes. The beauty and workmanship of both the Basilica and Parliament do this admirably - although I cant help but think that some people might have enjoyed a chicken stew better - :-)I do enjoy the way many European cultures use their churches to further artistic events. The Basilica, and St Michael's both have ongoing and frequent concert series.There is no charge to see the Basilica,there may be a charge for quided tours including the right hand, and going up to the top of the tower.There are reasonable charges for the organ concerts - which are aimed at tourists ( 70 minutes no intermission ). You don't have to buy first tier seats ( 40-60 euro) unless you want to see the organist's feet fly across the pedals, and like sitting in pews.You may still be able to find the details of the concert and series ( which can be tied into a dinner cruise too if you like) at:http://www.budapest.com/things_to_do/budapest_events/concerts/oran_concert_in_st_stephens_basilica.en.htmlThis series was devised by Miklos Teleki one of the master organists of Hungary, and who played that evening. The original flutist was not available and a reasonable substitute was brought in.The acoustics of the Basilica were extremely bright and various of the pieces caused almost cacophonous reverb especially Ferenc Liszt (1811-1886): Fantasy and Fugue on the theme B-A-C-H, and Johann Sebastian Bach: Menuett, Badinerie from B minor suite wherein the flute took on spooky reverberations.The real star in my opinion was Kolos Kovats. He played his voice as much as he played the acoustics of the Basilica, rendering a superb albeit far too short performance. At one point in the Ludwig van Beethoven (1770 - 1827): The Glory of God, you could hear surreal harmonics as if angels chose to sing with him.
The outside.... ... was beautifully shone upon in the evening. Whilst looking for a restaurant ithe church suddenly rose up in front of us. Wat a beautiful sight! We did not go in.
Fine acoustics, impressive art. We went to one of the regular organ concerts here, which also featured an impressive baritone and a gifted flautist.
what a sight. One of my favourite buildings in Budapest,stunning view,easy climb.ha,ha.over 300 steps,enjoy this jewell,truly a breathtaking site and don t forget to turn around for the panorama

Best views from the top!. What an impressive building, both inside and out! Make sure you visit the viewing point at the top of the dome, most amazing views of the city from there. Also pay 200 forint to the man stood next to the hand so you can have a good view and get some pictures.

Thursday Evening organ concert. You can get tickets right before the concert, which is at 8PM. As mentioned in previous reviews, just buy the cheapest tickets, as you are only going for the acoustics. Once you are inside, you really can sit anywhere. It was a bit long in our opinion (about an hour?), and surrounding people seemed to be falling asleep or uncomfortable in their seats. The seats are not comfortable and are creeky and they keep the lights pretty bright during the concert. The highlight for us was when the singer or flute player played with the organ.

302 steps to heaven..... Worth the 500ft to visit top of tower.we were not prepared for the breathtaking panoramic views!lifts available for those not wishing to climb 302 steps.church equally as breath taking, with at Stephens mummified hand on display!

The Chapel of the Right Hand. If you can manage to enter the reliquary to see the right hand of St. Stephen, consider yourself fortunate. I went to the basilica several times but was only once able to slip into the Chapel of the Right Hand during the opening hours (between blinks the “open” sign turned over to “closed” as I approached…very mysterious!). Nevertheless, this basilica has all that one looks for in the most important building in Budapest. It’s big, it’s chock full of beautiful art and it’s tastefully boastful of all the architectural talents of Hungary. For a real treat attend one of the evening concerts. It’s a thing of joy to sit and listen to talented artists, singers and instrumentalists alike. And to hear the great organ? Well, that’s almost enough to make a believer out of anyone!
Beautiful church and interesting location. Such beauty in the church and such a soaring magnificent building, it amazes that it was built with such dexterity.

A must see. I didnt know the difference between a Basilica and cathedral (its the roof) The interior is breathtaking - I hope people would be more mindful of the no flash request - not so when we were there. Most places dont allow cameras at all - the Basilica does - so please NO FLASH!!!
A different take on a church. Under restoration while we visited, so it was not all visible. The architecture and stencil decor was different than anything I have seen throughout churches in europr
Unusual altar. Beautiful basilica, altar with St Stephan instead of Jeus. Small chapel in back with a lovely majolica altar on the way. Would not miss.

Location, location, location. Approaching this church reminded me of the Invalides in Paris. It is just so massive and looming. Inside, the church was magnificent, bright and open. We went up to the treasury and saw the beautiful religious artifacts. Behind the church there is a gorgeous statue of the king receiving his crown from the saint. That in itself, was worth the trip and then the Danube, beyond. It was just wonderful.

Amazing. This is only minutes from both vaci Utca and vorosmarty square. This is absolutely amazing and a must to see whilst you are here. The inside is wonderful and so pretty. We booked to see the pipe organ concert on the Monday and the flute and singer event on Thursday. Both were very good but the pipe organ was I felt better as I love hearing the pipe organ played in a church. People are a little dressed up too so it gave me a good excuse :)

Nothing Special. Not average, but also not very good!!! Something in the middle! The view from outside is really impresive! The fact that the "donation" in order to enter to the church is obligatory and an elderly man was there to yell to people if they didn't domate.... is a really bad impression!!!

Reminded me of Rome. This is a 'must do' on a visit to Budapest. The church is extremely ornate and reminded me of many chapels in Rome. It is a short walk from the City Centre.Be sure and see the Church lit up after dark - see photographs.

Go up to the roof. Very beautiful building,with so much gold on view internally. Loved the art but found interior slightly dark. Cathedral free but gave a donation but paid 500 forints to visit the walk way round the dome. You go up by lift and once at the top the views are superb..

Beautiful church, but makes business.... I liked the church but didn't like the business built around it - as soon as you enter the church, the priest (or anybody dressed like priest) meets you and EXPECTS your donation of 200 HUF... Also, one of the attractions is the mumified hand of St Istvan. It is kind of dark and you cannot see it unless... you pay another 100 or 200 HUF for the light to switch on... Very creative. But not much fun for me, I guess.

St Stephen Basilica. beautiful church on Pest side of the river. Coffee shops and bars right outside for refreshment. Large square in front of the church. Easy to find. Free tourist maps available in Budapest for all tourist attractions.
Great concert. We attend a concert on our last night in Budapest. The church is magnificent and well worth the visit. The concert was mostly aimed at pleasing the tourists, but very well done.

Golden. The amount of detail and gold inside the beautiful basilica is amazing. I was floored by the detail of the marble and golden arches throughout the entire basilica. It is a must see sight in Budapest.
St Stephen's Basilica in Budapest. Well worth a visit - it was a very special church which is not overdone. Recommend visitors taking the lift to the dome for an excellent view of Budapest.

Beautiful, but dark inside.. The interior is beautiful. I loved the red marble columns and the golden crown molding. It's very dim inside, so you might need to give your eyes a few minutes to adjust. But because it's so dim, they use really nice lighting for certain parts of the church. Beautifully exhibited.From the chain bridge, just continue East and you can't miss it. Costs 200HUF to go in. 400HUF to go up I think, but I didn't go.
Lovely. Lovely interior,worth the visit, especially when the sun came out to shine through the windows.A good alternative if Parliment is suddenly closed.

Stunning!. Beautiful building, especially lit up at night! Inside is ornate and breathtaking. We went around 1845-1900 and caught the end of mass, which was very interesting. We watched quietly from the back. 200HUF suggested donation. Recommend!

Memorable. Visited this church which was only a block away from the hotel where we stayed. It is impossible to describe the beauty of the architecture, both inside the outside. Don't miss taking the time to visit this structure when you are in Budapest. It has a great historical background.

Beautiful views from the dome. We took the lift to the top and walked all around outside - the views from there are spectacular. The inside of the cathedral is also very pretty, especially the stained glass windows
majestic cathedral. a superb cathedral not faded and very elaborate, with magnificent dome and statue of St Stephen.... a must see.
wow!. stunning stunning building. We didnt go inside sadly as it was closed and we were going home the next day, but my goodness its a beautiful building, especially at dusk.

A Grand Cathedral. Szent Istvan Bazilika probably serves more as a national shrine than as a cathedral. It houses the hand of Hungary's founding King Stephen I and attracts thousands annually to pay homage to the man who pulled Hungary together as a Kingdom.The architecture is impressive both inside and out and you can enjoy great views out over the city from the top of the Dome on a clear day.A not to be missed attraction!
Very beautiful. A place absolutely worth visiting. I have been several times, and enjoyed it very much. If you come around Christmas times this church, as well as the area around, is really nice!

Beautiful Basilica worth seeing. The building inside and out is outstanding. I find this with many of Europe's finest cathedrals and basilica's. I was a little annoyed that I got there with my family 45 minutes before close and 30 minutes before close they turned out all the lights and ushered us out. I went back the next morning as it was opened, and was greeted by a gentleman strongly encouraging me to pay as I enter. I guess I have a problem with being forced to pay for me to enter a sacred place to pray.
Amazing views. Went to the top today by the stairs lovely sunny day and amazing views well worth the climb. Well worth when in budapest
The church needs your monies too!. For 200 HUF ( there's a priest at the door to check) you can enter the Basillica and enjoy its relics, including King Stephen's clenched fist!

Climb to the top of the tower! The view is worth it!. The church itself is free to enter (with a small voluntary donation). The walls and ceilings are coated in gold leaf and is spectacular to see. We were unable to see the relic, because that part of the church closes during the lunch hour. The best part of the cathedral was the view from the tower. It costs only 100 forint per adult. If you are afraid of the climb, there is an elevator that takes you half way up. The view from the tower is breath taking. Spend some time walking around the tower - you get to see the entire city! We went during the noon hour and were lucky enough to hear the bells go off.
Amazing Cathedral. The Heart and Soul of ancient Hungary. We were spellbound by the majesty of this place and the serenity inside. the views from the top of the Dome are breathtaking!
