Beautiful church with nice panoramic view from the top. It's a beautiful piece of architecture with nice paintings and sculptures inside. Must climb to the top for a nice panoramic view. They ask for $200 forint donation per person to enter the church and $500 forint each to go to the top of the dome which is a must for a beautiful panoramic view of Budapest. They have have night concert inside this church on certain days which is a nice experience.
On saturdays open till 13.00. For some weird reasons a lot of churches opened only till 13.00 on saturdays, so we eneded up to see it oly in the evening from outside. Good lightening at night.
Just do it. The church is worth a visit on its own. If you can time your visit for a Saturday afternoon during wedding season then you can witness a special and social Hungarian experience.

Not the best. Its greatest virtue is its central location; easy to find, popular but nothing special compared with dozens of other churches. Can easily go shopping or patisserie - hopping from here, or onto the Metro.

Took some finding but worth it!. This is where the Hop on Hop off bus starts from. It did take some finding but once we found it it was well worth it, there is a lot of shops and cafe's near by one been the Hard Rock cafe. Also some unusual litlle shops arround.

WOW!!!. During our short break in Budapest we visited St. Stephen's Basilica, amongst other things. The exterior is impressive; seeing the dome and the two towers reaching out in the blue sky is a great experience.Once we entered the basilica we were dazed, astonished; what an interior. The floors, the walls and also the ceilings are very richly decorated. You simply don't know were to look; no matter where you look, there is always a new WOW or ah.We have been in a lot of churches, cathedrals and basilica's in various places in Europe, including St. Peter in Rome, but the interior of St. Stephen's Basilica simply beats everything. One simply has to experience it themselves.
Historical place. In general, there is nothing to dislike in a church or even in a historical place. It is a neat well organized church

Overwhelming. I have seen many cathedrals in Europe. This is one of e prettier and impressive ones. The history behind it is worth knowing too. And the preserved hand of St Stephen the King is interesting.
Stunning Cathedral. Most see basilica in Budapest. Stunning inside-out! Don't miss the reliquary where you can find King Stephen's right hand! (King Stephen was the first King of Hungary)

A sight to see. This church is one of the greats. Stunning interior with beautiful statues and a magnificent altar piece. We paid to see the panoramic view- so worth it! Climb the stairs if you can. There is an art gallery about half way up which is neat. Great views from the top!! We returned at night to hear a concert for World Music Day where they played the organ which has over 8,000 pipes! Then the Budapest choir sang. Very peaceful. If there is a performance make sure to see it!
Wedding at St Stephens. We saw a beautiful wedding taking place at St Stevens...what a beautiful place to have a wedding. The style reminded us of St Peters in Rome

Great views. We paid to go up to the top and it really is worth it as the view of the city is great. Bit of a climb on scary stairs though so if you're a bit wobbly with heights take the lifts up each level.
Just another church. Pretty building and ornate inside but nothing special. The exterior with the square is the best bit.

Beautiful. Well worth a visit and the views from the top are fantastic - though be prepared for lots of steps to get there.
We also attended a concert on the Sunday evening of our trip to listen to a string orchestra - absolutely brilliant - especially in such superb surroundings.

Wonderful church. We came right at the opening at 9am and the was a Gold idea. The church is not yet crouded and you can enjoy the atmosphere of the church. Also consider visiting the Panorama tower, you have a wonderful view of the city from up there.
Marvel!. St. Stephen's rivals any great cathedral, anywhere in the world. It was the highlight of our city tour. That we were freely allowed to take photographs of the interior was an added bonus.

Stunning!. A great Basilica. Make sure you go up onto the dome area as the views are spectacular. The cost is 500 fl. there is an option to go up by lift but if you can manage the stairs it's part of the experience.Entry into the hutch is free. That said a 'volunteer' stood guardedly at the donation box and there was certainly a clear expectation of a donation even before you enter the Basilica. Once inside you are greet with great opulence. The fresco's are beautiful and the gold leaf is quite over-whelming. Make sure you visit the smaller chapel on the side of the church. The enshrined and preserved hand of St Steven can be seen for a small fee.A visit at least once will suffice.

Beautiful structure and interesting visit. The Basilica is very beautiful, and the plaza in the front is very nice especially in the afternoon sun, if you like Italian pizza - a very nice Italian Place "TG Italiano" is just opposite of the plaza.
You should see it. It is really impressive, we did not have too much time while visit it but definitely it is worth to be seen. Do not forgot to take pics :)!

Very, very nice!. We saw loads of beautiful churches during this trip. St. Stephens was the nicest basilica by far. On Mondays they hold a one-hour pipe organ and choir concert (it was fairly expensive) which was amazing! I'd highly recommend doing that.
Lovely. Lovely church, had a nice quiet reflection there. a donation was requested for entry. everything was beautiful inside
Part of history. When visiting Budapest, it is a must. Worth to walk around and look in. The building itself is really nice, and it is located in the neighborhood of other historical places.
" intersting building". inexpensive to enter & the veiws from the top worth the climb, part of the way is accesible by a lift.
Magnificent.. A treasure house of the past glory of the Catholic church. I was fascinated by the story of St Stephen's holy hand.

Love this place and the hand!. I am a history buff, so it was very interesting for me to visit this basilica and imagine all of the history that has happened here in Budapest. The square surrounding the church has several coffeehouses, where we sat and listened to the Sunday morning choir drifting out of the windows, and the tolling of the bells. We decided to go in for the next mass and it was beautiful. The choir and the organ were absolutely lovely. Don't forget to light a candle for a loved one, and don't miss seeing the holy relic!
brilliant. just a fantastic place to see the inside is very beautiful and it is free to enter they only ask for a donation

Beautiful building. You can not fail to be bowled over by this incredible building! Definitely worth a visit! Worth seeing at night as well, when it's lit up. Lots of little cafe's close by to grab a nice warming cup of coffee
Nice view. As expected from the top of a church, you've a good view. Stairs up aren't very taxing so you can probably take your grandmother up.
Beautiful. Beautiful! Quite stunning. There is some renovation underway at the moment on the inside, but well worth a visit.
A must. We went to the Basillica, it did not dissapoint. Inside the paintings are amazing. It is a very beautiful cathedral.

beautiful church from the outside and inside. A photo opportunity in a city full of beautiful buildings and churches. They ask for a small donation to enter the church. Visiting the interior of St Stephen's Basilica is worth it more than the Mattias church whose interior is being renovated.

Worth a visit. Went to a concert at the Basilica so did not get the opportunity to look around. (The lights were dimmed afterwards !) Solely based on this type of visit I would recommend going. It does demonstrate the inequality between the rich inside and the poor outside
a beautiful building. Well worth a visit inside as the interior is spectacular and the inside is beautifully maintained. The ceilings and stain glass are breath taking

Beautiful cathedral and something extra. Excellent cathedral that marks the center of Carholic history in Budapest. In the back of the cathedral, be sure to visit the room that holds the preserved right hand of St. Stephen. Interesting and not spooky at all. Check out the various midday and evening organ concerts on one of the largest organs in the country with vendors in front of the cathedral.
Symphony. Unique experience that you should attend. It was under an hour and a half, felt it was just long enough.

I am the way the truth and the life. So it says on the front of this Cathedral in gold lettering in latin. They say a ton of gold has been used on the ornamentation within, and I certainly wouldn't challenge that. Absolutely beautiful. We watched a wedding going on when there, and everybody seemed so friendly about the whole experience, not hung/strung up like in England.
Szent Istvan cathedral. A nice cathedral which has been renovated. Not to tourist friendly as there are no guides in the church.
Beautiful!. Really beautiful church, both inside and out. The Basilica looks amazing when lit up at night. Definitely worth seeing.
A magnificent church. I visited the church for the third year in a row in 2012. I almost skipped it, having seen it twice already. I'm glad I didn't because I always forget just how beautiful it is.
Wonderful. Went to a concert in the Basilica which was absolutely wonderful.The beautiful surroundings only added to the magic.
Stunning. Incredible old building with amazing surrounding bars - well worth a trip. Tonnes of bars and restaurants that will not disappoint

Totally renovated.. One of the biggest Basilica of Hungary. After cca. 25 years it is totally renovated. Marble, gold, wonderful chandeliers makes it beautiful. Sometimes you can hear the organ, when somebody is practicing. If you want, you can go to the top with elevator or by foot. Amazing view of Budapest. Lot of good restaurants and cafes around. Christmas market in December. Must see.

Bring your climbing shoes. You'll enjoy the view. This Basilica is incredibly beautiful inside and out. The key though is taking the (extra fee) journey up the LONG spiral staircase (300+ steps) to view Budapest from atop the dome. Not for the feint of heart though. It's a hike.

Panoramic views . Price admission 500HUF pp to the panoramic tower is well worth it. Best view of Budapest. There are quite a lot of stairs which was quite fun for myself and my fit boyfriend however would not be recommended for young children and those who have eaten too many pies. There were a few wheezing fatties on the way up the spiral staircase and this slowed everyone's movement due to their slow pace and width. There are lifts and there is no shame in using them if you need to.The views at the top of the tower were breath taking. Don't forget your camera! The only minor disappointment was the poor view of the mummified holy hand which is in a glass case and if you are under 6ft2 is quite difficult to see. Inside the church is utterly stunning and well cared for. Make an effort to visit this attraction!

Night Show is Fantastic. Ate round the corner from this hidden gem and just as we came out of the restaurant we were greeted with a melody of bells from this highly illuminated building. It seems to happen on the hour, so time your night-time visit.VERY atmospheric!
horse carriages!. The area around the cathedral was polluted by horse excretions, and the aroma seeped into the cathedral itself. Recommended for religiously or aesthetically inclined horse lovers.

must see. One of the most beautiful places in Budapest. it's a 3 euro cost to go to the top of the church and see great view of the city. It also has a relic from St. Stephen, inside of the chapel. The place has an amazing organ, and there was a show the day I went.
Impressive cathedral. It is absolutely gorgeous , inside and outside! A great place to visit!I liked everything, from the beautiful coyer , to the ceremony stage, and beautiful paintings!

Organ Concert. Enough cannot be said about the beauty of the Basilica, and when you match that up with an organ concert (with soprano, tenor, violin, and trumpet soloists) the effect is amazing. Go if you have a chance. With the less expensive seats toward the back, you get to view the entire Basilica.
Budapest Landmark. Why go to Budapest and not visit this landmark? If you can go to the top of the Cupola and see a gorgeous panorama of the city.

very ornate. in very good condition - but then it should be a sit is not very old. Lots of marble and gold decoration - beautiful domes and great views from the top -donations only except for the panorama
Nice church. This is a wonderful sight to see in the center of the city. I liked the visit during the night. Take the time to view everything. I did not have the chance to go inside.

Concert in the Basilica. quite enjoyable and not too big an investment of time or money. It lasted about an hour and we got the cheapest tickets (about $20 each) which were fine. It was lovely to sit in the cathedral, enjoy its decorations and listen to the music. The organist, vocalist and flautist were all very good.

Beautiful building, great concert. I was there with my friend a few days ago, we bought tickets for the organ concert. Bach, Liszt, Albinoni... it all sounded great amongst these walls... which almost felt shaking when the D-minor toccata was played... we got the goosebumps...

Very nice. It was a very nice place, for people that like the photography very important the time of the day and the weather, with clear day and closer to dawn has amazing colours.Outside is quite important place of budapest that you can see from lots of places since is quite tall, and inside was just an average cathedral, but it was free entrance (you can give some donation). I would say that inside is average but outside is really very nice and very worth to see.

Sumptuous interior. This is the epitome of interior decorating of Roman Catholic cathedrals with gilt, statues, immense pipe organ. I went to an organ concert one evening in the Basilica-wonderful sound with resonance throughout. Very uncomfortable unpadded wooden seats though, but tolerable with the wonderful music.

Shocks you. Walking down the street, we were shocked when we looked to the right and out of seemingly nowhere, a gigantic church arose. This Basilica is a must stop on your travels through Budapest. And if the outside is not enough, with its beautiful architecture, step inside and look around the amazingly ornate church.
Spectacular. Great basilica, beautiful and spectacular. It is very well lighted on nights. Many cafes, shops and restaurants around here.

Wonderful, don't miss the Panorama Tower.. Walked past on Saturday and saw many wedding processions congregating on the steps and square. Decided to visit properly on the Sunday. Firstly we went for the Panorama tower walk to the top dome of the basilica. The cost for entry was 500 Ft per adult although there are cheaper tickets for concessions. After a long climb of the stairs (there are just over 300, but a lift is available) we reached the halfway point and were lead into a very plain looking large room which could make an excellent museum! A few more flights of steps through the magnificent dome and we reached the summit. The view was amazing and you were able to walk around the whole thing, allowing for a 360 degree view of Budapest.We also went around the church itself which was magnificent. There is no cost for entry into the church but donations are recommended. The organ and the murals were stunning. Make sure not to miss 'The Chapel of the Right Hand' which has a display box containing the right hand of St Stephen himself. Although somewhat macabre, it made for interesting viewing!
Say a prayer. Very big. Absolutely beautiful inside with some lovely stained glass windows. Be warned Saturday can be back to back with weddings and then large sections of the church are closed off.
don't miss it!. You definitly have to go on top to see a magnific view of Budapest! You can either go up the stairs or go by elevator.

Impressive. Impressive building with magnificent finishes, details etc. We were somewhat spoiled by having visited St Peters in Rome earlier in the year (now that is a real "wow"). Didn't get to see the hand of St Stephen as that part was closed. Whole church closed on Friday afternoon for a wedding, but I guess it is a working place of worship.
Enjoy the views!. Go up the 300 odd steps ( or take the lift) for some great panoramic views of the city - worth the fee.

Beautiful St. Stephen's Basilica. Amazing church but different then any other church I have been in. On the main altar is a massive marble statue of St. Stephen not Jesus made by Alajos Strobl and behind the status is St. Stephens life depicted in paintings. St. Stephen is King Stephen, the first crowned king of Hungary who accepted Christianity for the people and who also laid out the basis of the modern Hungarian state. In another chapel is the Chapel Of The Holy Right Hand. There sits in a case the mummifed forearm of King Stephen. I found this chruch beautiful with massive in size and filled with beautiful paintings.
the church was closed. We were disappointed that the church was closed at 8 am on a Wednesday morning, and thus we left Budapest without seeing this very important sight.
breath taking. a stunning building was in awe of it to be honest. so detailed and interesting. tours are available and you can go walk around the bottom of the dome area outside.
Nice night view. Not allowed in at night but it's worth just to see the enlightened view of the basilica and linger around among the youth enjoying their glasses of wine from the outside wine bar.

historical place in the city. your guide will tell the many stories of this great structure, including the collapse of the original dome and the history of the beloved St.Stephen whose 'hand' is on display [Australia has much of his body].Doog

Go to a concert. It is beautiful inside and out. Go to an evening organ concert, the pipe organ is outstanding. Afterwards stroll on the square out front. It is a eventing gathering place for all ages.
Beautiful. A truly beautiful church. Entrance to the church is free, but you do have to pay to go up to the Panorama viewing platform. Views from the top are stunning.

Amazing and moving. I have traveled to Budapest for years and I never visited until this year. It is magnificent. I was there for the St. Stephen's Day celebration and it was beautiful. The true feelings for the country as a nation were pulsing. The basilica is beautiful and very ornate. I attended mass while there. It was a moving expereince. Check the daily mass scheudle and go if you can. It is a very holy experience.

Simply breathtaking!. The interior took my breath away! I was here for a great organ concert (highly recommended, just get the cheapest tickets since the acoustics in the church is great) and I was just in awe of the design, paintings, and the great beauty of this basilica. I would rate this #1 in the attractions I went to in Budapest.

Beautiful Basilica. While this Basilica is beautiful in it's own right during the day they also have concerts some evenings and I would really recommend you attend one. We went and it was one of the most memorable experiences of the trip. The concert is about an hour in length and the acoustics are unbelievable in this Basilica. We went to see the Rajko musicians and they were unbelievable. It was a stunning performance. Go if you can as you will not regret the money you pay.

An oasis of calm and religiousity. St Stephen's Basilica is a place of calm and serenity in the heart of Budapest. Regardless of ones belief the Basilica radiates peace, serenity and marvel. One has to admire the architecture and the sense of history too.

Impressive artwork on the inside. What a gem of a place. The gold leaf on the walls and dome glitters in the light. Never seen anything quite like this one. shame we could not attend one of the many concerts held from Thurs to Saturday.

Worth a visit :). The St Stephen's Basilica is definitely worth a visit during your stay in Budapest. It is conveniently situated around the city centre, somewhere in middle of the Vorosmarty Square and the Parliament building, making it easy to navigate to. The architecture of the Church is Neo-Classical style. We'd recommend for you to ascend right up to the top for an aerial view of the city as the Church is one of the tallest buildings in Budapest!

Nice. Brilliant, in the centre of the city, very easily accessible from our hotel, walking distance, we were fortunate to be part a congregation on the day. Some people were getting married as well good architecture

Doesn't open until like 10am. Beautiful building with lots of cafes and what not near by. Worth a visit, definately. The staff at the hostel said it, along with Parlaiment, are the two highest buildings in Budapest, but I can't confirm that. The only problem is it doesn't open until like 10am, so I didn't get to go in. It would be an awesome place to stop for lunch or finish up your day...that way you can stop at one of the awesome restaurants nearby.

dazzling hights. A monumental building. Surprisingly light inside and great views over hte town when you climb the many stairs to the top. Make sure to visit the chapel with St Stephen's hand and read about the rather strange history surrounding it.

August 2012. We went on a night walk round the heart of Budapest with a tour guide. The Basilica was lit up and it took your breath away. The tour guide was very informative and was more that willing to answer any questions we had.

St Stephen's Basilica. A beautifully reconstructed neo-renessaince basilica. One central place of the catholic religion in Hungary. The whole place is somehow organized around our apostolic king Stephen and his holly right hand that is kept as a relic in one of the chapels.

Amazing Basilica - strange "reliquia'. The decoration inside the basilica is just gorgeous. The dome is spectacular! A must see in Budapest.In one of the chambers, you can see a mumified hand of a king ( I personally thought it was gross, but once there, one has to see it, right?)

One of Europe's Best. Having been to many churches, cathedrals, and the likes across Europe, this is by far one of the best. There is no entrance fee to enter the church, so its worth even just a quick peak inside. The tower, which does have an entrance fee, is a great option for those looking for great panoramic views of Budapest.

Gorgeous view !. Don't miss this one ! Apart of its beautiful inside, this basilica offers you the chance to see whole Budapest from the top of its tower. The ticket it's only a few euro and the elevator brings you up there, from where you will have to take the stairs to the top. You will spend at least 30 minutes there, to take pictures of a lot of interesting objectives that Budapest offers you...
Impressive cathedral. Not much to say except that it is a 'must see' in Budapest. The main dome is magnificent, and the majesty of the cathedral is breathtaking.

Beautiful. Stunning building inside and out and free to get in. Pay if you want to go up the tower. In picturesque square with nice restaurants. Had Lovely evening meal listening to the classical music on the steps of the basilica

Cool, but only so much to see. Very beautiful of course. The highlight is definitely St. Stephen's supposed hand in the back. There are also some really stunning stained glass windows, but other than it's one of the main tourist places, it wasn't one of the most memorable experiences of our stay.

Not to be missed. Sure, visiting churches is great....BUT what I like about St Stephen's in particular is how absolutely well executed every detail is - which is quite rare.Also, our children really liked visiting the "yucky hand" which I suppose is a bit direspectful considering we are talking about the most holy relic in Hungary! But you do what you can to get your children engaged with art and history........... And - the climb up to and walk around the dome gives you the most amazing views of Budapest.... So really it is a MUST DO!

Beautiful Basilica. Like all basilicas it is ornate and beautiful. Take the trip up to the top for the Panorama view, its great. But mind your step on the way back down, the floor is uneven (health and safety alert for us UK residents! :))

Beautiful, worth a visit inside. The outside facade and square are lovely to visit but don't miss the inside. We went late in the day while a service was taking place and were able to pay by donation, as opposed to a set admission fee (not sure how strict they are during the day or when a mass is not going on). You can take photos inside of the amazing marble decor!

Picturesque. Beautiful Basilica from the outside and surrounding area is well cater for an enjoyable afternoon. Best done in a walking tour in my opinon as there are a lot of facts which we found interesting which you wouldn't know otherwise.
Do I really need to pay?. I hate when they ask money to enter a church - this was the case, but they called it a donation! Outside it's a beautiful building with a great square surrounding it.
Stunning!. Beautiful building inside and out. The climb to the tower is worth it (there is a lift for some of the way) for the stunning views!

Amazing view during sunset hour. The architecture is amazing. I visit this basilica during sunset and the blue sky contributes more amazing view. There is a big square in front of the basilica where we can take picture with the basilica as the background.
very pretty. There is what appears to be a mandatory "donation," but even if you don't go in the outside is spectacular, particularly at night. Lots of nice cafes and wine bars surround it.

Well worth the money!. Beautiful building with some interesting museum artefacts. There is currently some restoration work being undertaken but worth the visit, especially as it is so close to the Fishermen's Bastion.

Beautiful but didn't get to see St Stephens hand. What an impressive church, but there was a service going on while we were there and we couldn't see St. Stephens hand. We were really looking forward to that. It is free but you make a donation to see it light up I believe that is what the sign said.

Went up the tower. I’ve probably seen over 100 churches/cathedrals, so they really don’t interest me anymore.Instead of going inside we went up the tower (500huf) or about £1.50 (at current price and exchange rate). The view is great of castle hill and we could see our hostel etc and not many people seemed to be going up the tower, so it was quiet.It was defiantly worth it and we went over to castle hill in the afternoon, so we could see where we where stood on the Basilica earlier.

Soul in heavens.. We arrived in Budapest to celebrate the anniversary of our wedding. This truly luxurious and beautiful city shakes for its magnificent architecture. Our hotel was not far from the beautiful St. Stephen's Basilica.The building in the neoclassicism style impresses its greatness and splendor of interior design. This is perhaps one of the most richly decorated cathedrals that I've seen. The walls and pillars of the temple is richly decorated with marble and ornate gilding, and the ceiling is decorated with colorful mosaics. Definitely it is beautiful! From the top of the Basilica offers a panoramic view of the city. We visited the St. Stephen's Basilica during the day but in the evening returned again to enjoy a wonderful concert of organ music. It was great! In the cathedral dimmed the lights and we enjoyed the sounds of a delightful, charming organ music. Music overflowed of the magnificent St. Stephen's Basilica, carrying our souls to heaven. Wonderful!

Beautiful. Excellent panoramic views and beautiful inside - must see if in the area! Although marked as free - it does cost 250Huf (<1euro) for the tower visit and the same "Donation" for inside the cathedral. Not expensive at all!!

a cathedral to see. Only a euro or 300 forint to enter. Typical in its large interior, but unique in its relic. Head to a smaller nave to see the mummified hand of the namesake's saint. It is definitely worth a visit!

Beautiful. Very impresive church, that has a variety of marbel inside that has been kept up through the ages. Located in the middle of a wonderful city that is beautifying it's buildings and keeping it's streets clean.

Beautiful. The basilic is beautiful but if you intend to go there, you need to be quiet and respectful. The dome is all painted and you can see a statue of St. Stephen's who was the first King of Hungary. Besides, this church is the third largest one in the country as far as I know.

Compulsory donation. Disappointed with this venue. I'm not a skinflint and usually do make a donation to any church or site I visit, but was made to feel that I should make a compulsory "donation" by an attendant tapping the donations box at the door. In my view this felt like an entry fee and not a voluntary donation.

Amazing building.... The building will have you going "wow" Quite spectular, as is the square at the entrance to the Bazilika. It is the largest Church in Budpest, started in 1851 by Jozsef Hild and finished by Mikos Ybl in 1905. I read that by the time it was finished, it's original neo-Classical design had been changed into Eclectic. Doesn't matter what you call it or who designed/built it, it is quite amazing and grand.
very ornate church. The relic hand of St. King Stephen is enshrined in this wonderful church. Enough reason for me to check it out.
Add to or your list. Another place worth a visit. Lots of character a must on your tour of Budapest. Spent time just sitting and watching the world go by
A must visit. walk the 330 steps to the dome views are worth every step the interior is fabulousthereis nothing to dislike

Amazing Architecture. From both, the inside and out, this Basilica is stunning! Inside is very cool all year-around (VERY convenient during the hot summer days). There is a tower up top where the view is, supposedly, amazing but I never went up there. Admittance is nothing (200 forint I think) but it's usually very crowded so make sure to have the patience and factor the waiting time into your trip schedule.
Giant Cathedral. An important church in Budapest and in Hungarian history with great architecture and rich interior right in the town center. A lot of beautiful details worth to be seen.
Amazing architecture. Visit for a donation of 200Florint although stairs or lift to tower for city view is extra charge. Fantastic internal architecture. View St Stephens severed right hand!!
Well worth a visit. A great way to spend half an hour. The church is mightily impressive - and is so cool on a hot day in Budapest.

Stunning!!. I recommend everyone who visits Budapest should take a look at this cathedral. Just looking at it from outside is magnificent. I also went to the top to see the view over the city. There was an elevator up but was a huge queue so I took the stairs. It was a long way up but was in no rush donut was fine. Only thing that was a little disheartening was when you finally think you've made it to the tip there's then more sets of stairs!!I'm terrified of heights so didn't hang over the edge so see the full view but standing back and looking from against the wall was still spectacular. There's a lot of room and the walls are high so all feels very safe. Well worth the 500huf.Inside the cathedral itself is absolutely beautiful, a lot of the reviews complain about paying to get in, but come on, it was 200huf. That's less than £1. Well and truly worth it to look round such detailed stunning architecture.

One of the biggest. Nice Cathedral (funny story how it was renamed to basilica :) ), I definitely recommend to visit the tower and take some pictures. View is excellent. (you can take a lift in case you have problems with stairs)

Awesome. besides the sheer size of the basilica which is breathtaking from the outside, the inside has one of the most amazing interiors i've ever seen with the marble columns and gold and painted ceilings!
Amazing!. Beautiful church, full of wonderful artwork. Largest church in Budapset. You can climb up to the dome for fantastic views.

Beautiful church. This Basilica is well worth the time and nominal admission fee. We attended a organ recital that was well done and enjoyable. The approach to the church from the river is a nice walk as the street frames the church.
Glad we visited..... A trip to the Basilica is a must and the views from the tower around the City are amazing. I don't normally visit religious sites, but am really glad I had this on the list.

Magnificent!. This is a beautiful church both inside and out! Quite impressive architecture and artwork. Highly recommend taking the panorama trip up to the top as well for great views of Buda and Pest! The price to enter and visit seemed very fair considering how much so many of the tourist attractions cost.

One of my favorites in Pest. This is beautiful. Go to the top for a great 360 view. It isn't much, maybe $3-$4. There is a lift if you need it, but the climb up isn't bad. The area around the cathedral is great for restaurants and cafes, seems to be a lot happening.
Gorgeous building. The interior is fantastic and you only have to give a donation to enter. A real treat for tourists - fantastic artwork and stained glass domes.

So beautiful but mind the "optional" donation. It's very beautiful both on the inside and the outside, but at the entrance is a sign saying donations, but consider it a fixed a entrance fee as there is a man controlling that you are paying enough.
Calling it donations is an insult when not even the amount given (per person) is optional.

Impressive. THe building is well kept and quite impressive to view. They have organ concerts inside and they say that St. Stephen's mumified hand is in there as well. When we went in , it was too dark to see the hand.
Beautiful Church. Very beautiful church. Most certainly worth visiting. Both a daytime, and at night, when it is illuminated.
Excellent views from the roof. It's free to enter the main part of the basilica and a small charge to ride in the lift to the roof where you have an excellent view of Budapest.

romantic church. i am so impressed of this beautiful church, only that we were not able to go in as it was under renovation and apparently mostly part of the church are boarded up.But i will put it in my list on my next visit.

Stunning!. A stunning place to visit. The architecture inside and out is truly inspiring. It always amazes me how such buildings managed to survive the communist period given that the regime itself would discourage such religious activity. Well worth a visit, if only to observe the architecture from outside. For those interested in relics, the hand of Stephen, the first King of Hungary is housed in the church!
Amazing...Must See. This is a beautiful church with a lot of history. This is a must see. We recommend that you budget at least 2 hours.
Beautiful inside. Very ornate and impressive dome ceiling with fresco. Lots of altars but parts closed off to tourists which was a shame.

The holy hand of St Stephen isn't a Python film...... Well worth popping in to check out the interior - there's an honesty box, so it's not too expensive. Although there is an extra charge for the light to go on so you can see St Stephen's mummified hand (this involves a battle o f wills with whoever else is in the room to see who crack first to stump up the loose change this requires).

Huge, beautiful and worth the time. This basilica is huge and beautiful. Inside and out. It doesn't cost anything to enter but they have a guy out front trying to guilt u into making a small donation. Central to most of the sites in budapest and really worth the time.

Serene!. Went on a Sunday morning, and caught the end of the most beautiful service, parts of which are translated into English, for those who are religious. The building is amazing and make you relax as soon as you walk in. There is great architecture, detail and overall fantastic and serene atmosphere!
Stunning. Beautiful and steeped in history .Budapest isna stunning city and this is an exceptionally beautiful site

Beautiful Church. Well worth a look. While you are there, go up to the very top, it's worth the money. Great way to see the whole city and take amazing pictures. Budapest is such a beautiful city. Also check out the surrounding area, lots to see and do, there is a shopping street close by as well.
Cld spend hours here. Spent an hour there and could have spent some more time there but had to leave since a wedding was going to take place. Do not miss this.

In the heart of the city. The basilica is located in district V. It was fully renovated recently, as well as, the sorrounding area. It is a beautiful building inside and outside. You can go up to the tower, where there is fantastic view of the city.

Worth a visit, great view!. Got the lift to the top (cost 500HUF / less than â¬2). Worth it in my view as I'm not a fan of climbing hundreds of steps and you have to pay to walk up anyway.There is another lift which takes you to the Treasury (400HUF) and if you want to enter the church you must pay an additional 500HUF.I only got the lift to the top and I wasn't disappointed. Fabulous viewing point. We were short on time the day we visited, so didn't bother with the rest :)
Good experience. Make sure you visit the Basilica and you get a ticket to go up to the top of the church. There is an amazing view of Budapest from there. Well worth it!

Very impressive. Stood up on the end of a huge square. İts goergous and you feel yourself very tiny in front of it. We visited it during the day and the night time. Both was wonderful. The area in front of the cathedral is lively and full of good cafes&restaurants.

Szent Istvan Bazilika. The building is gorgeous inside-out, so is the neighborhood. Of course we visited the shrine of Szent Istvan's mummified right hand and climbed the tower for great views. Then we sat down at the corner of the square at a pleasant wine bar with wi-fi and a great selection of Hungarian wines by the glass, while my kids enjoyed ice cream from the store next door (The ice cream was mounted on the cone in the shape of a rose, petal by petal, and what great flavors as well! I could highly recommend the lemon-basil one...)

St Stephens Basillica - Lift to dome - fantastic view of the city. We didnt realise until we got to St Stephens that they have a lift up to the dome. It was no more than £2.00 each and well worth it for the view of the city. The inside of the church was beautiful - well worth a visit.
From Buda to Pest--or vice-versa. Stand in the middle and imagine all the countries this great river flows through on it's journey to the sea --seperate lanes for bikes!
Beautiful inside. Worth a quick stop. The inside is absolutely beautiful.

Nice views. Going up the tower is well worth it, but not for the faint hearted
!
Beautiful. Very worth a visit. There was a wedding taking place, but we still got enough of a view.

St. Stephen's Basilica is great. Aside from the beauty of this church, we went to an organ concert in the evening there. The acoustics were wonderful and the classical music by Bach and Vivaldi was great.

Outside is beautiful. I couldn't find a way inside the church when I was there. I'm not sure if I was too early or if it wasn't open. It looked really magnificent, but I'd have to see inside to truely know. Definitely a good place to walk around.
Must visit!. Beauty & spirit. Amazing! Comfortable to get there on foot from hotel. Peace amid hundreds of others. I highly recommend.

too commerсialized. You know, this place is too commerсialized. They persist to make a donation, but they do not sell tickets. I am not sure if they are paying takes but they insist you to make the donation in the amount of 200 HUF or 1 EUR even the official exchange rate 1 EUR=280 HUF! There is a special person standing at the entrance who watch that everyone donated. It is not a problem to pay the entrance fee, but I would like to be sure that this is the official way, but not some black money.Basilica itself looks nice but it is too modern at my taste. Come to St.-Petersburg, Russia and visit St. Isaacs Cathedral - this is the place!
Just beautiful. Visited on a Saturday which seemed to be the day most people were getting married. We were, however, still allowed to get in. SOOOOO much gold inside - simply amazing.
Amazing Bacillica. Had concert with Seattle Chamber Chorus, amazing sound, gracious hosts. Just a perfect venue as well as wonderful church.
gorgeous. Of all the church-like sights I visited in Prague, Bratislava and Budapest, this was the most understatedly beautiful.

Really wonderful. The basilica is located just few steps from one of the "culinary moles" in Pest. It really worth to visit: once you get in you are really impressed by this masterpiece. The entry is free of charge (donation are well accepted). I highly reccomend to pay about 5 € to get the top of the dom: from there you can enjoy a wonderful 360 degree view of the city.
Stunning basilica and buzzing square. A stunning square and a beautiful church not to be missed, and a good spot for wifi, some gelato rosa and people watching.
Go to the top!. Well worth the 500huf to go to the top! Stunning panoramic views of Budapest, great for photos!
wonderful church. beautiful paintings and ceilings, worth visiting. Ashame that there was no possibility to light a candle only ten possibilities to donate money to the church... very typical

Beautiful old church. This is one of my favorite places in all of Budapest...take the elevator (or if you are feeling adventurous the stairs) to the top of the Basilical. Amazing views of the city can be had from there. Both times I have visited have been on Saturday and there have been weddings which make the main chapel off limits but there is still much to admire on the outside and the areas of the church that are still open to visitors during private ceremonies

An interesting church in downtown Budapest. Whether or not you think the church is excellent or poor (or somewhere in between) will probably be determined by your interest in cathedrals. Some travelers tire of cathedrals (seen one, seen them all), while others are fascinated. We are people of faith, and I have studied church history, so note that the reviewer here is a cathedral nerd. The interior is impressive. We didn't hunt for it, but supposedly, one can see St. Stephen's hand in one of the side chapels. There is also an observation deck but we didn't climb it because it was hot and we had already seen panoramic views from Castle Hill.

Gorgeous church -- and the hand of Saint Steven!. As churches in Europe go, this is one of my favorites. If you have been to the Cathedral in Seville, for instance -- you know how much fun the architects and designers had with ornamentation - it is mind boggling -- your eye never knows when to stop looking -- and in 5-10 minutes you feel completely overwhelmed by the interior of the Church -- it's so vast. St. Steven's is a quiet church, scaled very nicely, uses beautiful materials (marble, gold leaf, stained glass, etc) but is more restrained -- not overdone at all. It's nice to sit for a few moments in quiet contemplation. I forgot to go to the top of the steeple -- which is supposed to be a gorgeous view.In the back of the church in a very ornate container is the hand of St. Steven -- I didn't see the hand, but saw the container. I am not big about religious relics but I am glad that if his hand had to reside anywhere aside from the remains of his body that it resided in a church, in Budapest, that is named for him.
Stunning. Make sure to visit it. The interior is gorgeous too.

Beautiful church in a great area. This place really worth to visit and not only because the Basilica itself is gorgeous but because of the surrounding as well. The square where this historical building sits is beautiful and full of little coffees and other restaurants.
Magestic,. Beautifull church/ We atended an organ concert there an enjoied it immensly!
Basilica. Inside was awesome. The detail of the interior was really beautiful
St. Stephen's Basilica. We were here at Christmas time and came into church and heard the choir singing. Outside there was a giant tree and Christmas mart. It was magical to see!
Nice but very busy.. Busy and expensive to get in. It has a nice atmosphere, but we did not want to get in.

Absolutely amazing. We popped in as we were going past. Unfortunately St Stephen's hand was not able to be viewed. My favourite part was the climb to the dome for the Panoramic view. The view is amazing but there is a surprise museum half way up - many, many stories of the amazing priests who stayed active, endured terrible things and were even executed at the hands of the soviets. It definitely makes you think. It is well worth the 500FT fee.

Great architecture both inside and outside. The Basilica is located in the main tourist district (no 5). It has great architecture both inside and outside. The carvings and work is very intricate. Once can go up to the top of the basilica for views of the city, but we decided to skip it for spending more time at the church interiors, and we are glad we did.
Impressive. Bring a wide angle lens for your camera. Bin there with the entire family and all were impressed with the dimentions of this building.
Gorgeous.. A beautiful building and in the square in front of it are some fabulous restaurants you can sit in and take in the view of the Basilica. I'm yet to go inside but will do.
Fascinating architecture. We spent a lot of time looking at this site. I don't know exactly what to say except that we loved the experience and think you will too.
viewing gallery. view from top of dome was amazing take the lift to the top

St. Stephen's Basilica. First of all, the admission was to be free but when we got there we found a very angry monk demanding 2 Euro for admission. Its not that I minded paying but the attitude was less than desirable. Secondly, St. Stephen hand was not on display as it said at 9 AM. Went back to the angry monk and inquired about it. He said the hand would not be on display until 12 PM. So much for that!

St, Stephen's Basilica, Budapest. As many other people will testify, this is a beautiful building. It's worth taking the time to visit.For me, one of the best things was being able to take the lift to the top of the church. There is a small charge but if you don't mind heights it's well worth it. Unlike many other visits to tall buildings, the views here are really worth the effort! Make sure you take a camera. Allow yourself two hours to get the most out of your trip.
Gorgeous outside architecture. only to be blown away with the inside treasures. Beautiful church and easy to visit.
Very long queque to get in. Once again we queued but it was far too hot the building outside is magificant photos taken fee to get in about £8.00 each more with a tour guide.
St. Stephen's. Beautiful old church. If you like old historical religious sites, you must make this a stop in 'Budapest

Sunday Evening Concert at St. Stephen's Basilica - Glad that I did it!. Just attended a St. Stephen's Basilica concert just an hour or so ago. I'm glad that I paid the money to watch it. I enjoyed it very well. I wanted to watch the one in St. Michael's located in the Vaci Ute street but timing just didn't work out. St. Michael's is a lot smaller than the basilica.We bought the cheapest seats considering I thought that the venue wouldn't be big enough. Each ticket was 27 Euro or 6500 forints. My 11-year old was charged 3000 forints. I always prefer to seat at the best seats at plays, but I thought since I'm here for the music, it didn't matter as long as I can hear it clearly. So my seats turned out great. By the way, I bought the tickets right there at the basilica just a few minutes before the show. As usual, we were running late. There were plenty of seats left.I was worried that we were not adequately attired, but my husband and son's shorts with nice collared shirts were just fine. I didn't see anybody in tank tops, but casual clothes seem to be appropriate.As an added bonus, by buying tickets, we were entitled to half price tickets for the concert going to happen at St. Michael's. I probably would do it, unfortunately, we'll be heading to Krakow in the evening.So glad we did it!. (I was in Vienna a long time ago -- of all the things that I can still remember is attending a classical concert there. I think this is one of those that will remain in your memories.)
Architectural highlight. One of the most beautiful churches in Budapest, with grandeur and splendor. It is free of charge to visit.

A place of prayer, peace and petition. People must have loved God and built Him a place like this, such inspiring beauty, height of devotion and history.Didn't like looking at the hand of St Stephen's in the back room but certainly added to the mystery of the Basilica.

Under wraps. With great taste and care, the building is being restored, but this means that the interior is under sheeting when we visited in June 2012. We have been before and will go again. The roof is astonishing.
Saint Stephen left its right hand there. Walk through the Piazza and reach the Basilica. Pay Euro 1 to enter it and enjoy a peaceful moment, although it is very popular among tourists.

Great view from the top. For only 500 HUF you can get the best view in Budapest! The climb to the top is a little scary - spiral staircase, but Christian tourism has yet again proved lucrative. There is a toilet and a lift to the top after a 5min climb.
A Beautiful Basillica. St. Stephen's is truly beautiful and if you enjoy looking at the grandeur of old churches in Europe - you will most definitely enjoy St. Stephen's.
As good as St. Paul's in London, but 'free'!. Beautiful church; massive high domed ceiling and houses the relic (right hand) of St. Stephen of Hungary.
A really nice church in the city center. The church has a great location in the city and it is nice to checkout the panorama view at the top of the Basilica
Amazing. Go till the end to see the original mummified hand of St. Stephens a holic relic in Hungary, bring a 50 forint coin to get the lights on at the display
Breathtaking interior. I step inside and the place almost made me cry. So beautiful!

Go during Mass to hear the organ. 100 huf entrance fee is worth the price. This church is beautifully maintained. While limited access to the spaces inside you can still see most everything. The organ is magnificent. If you visit during Mass, you can hear it played.
disappoointed by the exploitation. Ok it's a church with a part of St Stephen's hand mummified. And why do I have to insert coins to light the lights for 2 minutes to see it?
what a church. veiws from towers well worth the climb, architexture is as good as any other church I have visited.

Worth a visit. For a nominal fee (I was having trouble finding the correct coins, and the attendant just waved my daughter and I in for a small sum) you can see a magnificent church. The church is in the heart of the city and surrounded by a lovely plaza with restaurants. My husband and two other kids decided to climb the stairs to the top and took in a great view. While not as famous as St. Peter's or Duomo in Florence, it is well worth a visit.
must to see. just pay a few euros and go to the top of the basilica, very ncie 360 degrees view!
Beautiful. Nice walk and beautiful inside for only a small donation.
Superb example of Gothic Revival. Beautifully restored example of a Roman Catholic cathedral. Integral chapel for the shrine of the Holy right arm.

The Basilica. Outside the Basilica looks stunning, its like a smaller version of Saint Pauls. The area around the basilica is very nice and lots of restaurants and bars there too. The area around the Basilica is a nice area to visit too.Then I went inside the basilica and although the guide books says its free, its not! You have to pay 400 florintsto enter. The priest there makes you donate 400 florints. Well, they say its free entry but then tells you to donate 400 florints or you cant enter! Inside the basilica, its very small, half of the inside is fenced off and there is literally a short hallway and an observation area where you can see the main room. Inside its dark but looks great, its like a mini St Pauls. So well worth entering because its really well decorated like a palace.

A calm yet grand interior. We were fortunate to have attended a wedding in St. Stephen's. The wedding was lovely and the setting was, of course, magnificent. This isn't an old church--it was completed in the early 20th century--but it is stately and grand. The back chapel with the reliquary that contains St. Stephen's hand is dignified and quite thought provoking.
Another church. Of course it is beautiful and you need to see it!!!

Another Perspective. The attraction within the basilica is the relic of St. Stephan's right hand, otherwise there's not a lot to photograph. A visit to the cupola (entrance fee) gives good views over the Pest part of Budapest, and of course you can look up to Buda castle, etc.

Nice architecture, but disappointed at the Entrance. I was looking forward to see the beautiful dome and the interior. Most importantly, I wanted to pay respects in the House of God. But when we entered, there was a man cloaked in black standing next to a big donation box with a sign stating something to the effect of "Donation 1 EUR..." or the equivalent to the HUR. There was a big tour group ahead of us who had money on hand and they were dropping coins in the box. The man clad in black man was looking at each of them as they dropped their coins. We were standing on the side and was fishing for HUR coins as we did not have any. The man clad in black stood there kind of frowning at us. We were going to leave, but he irritatedly waived us in. I have visited many houses of prayer in all my travels, I have yet to see someone cloaked or uncloaked standing next to a donation box ensuring visitors "donate"! I Now, I have and I am appaled by it! I am a Catholic and this is not how it is in Catholic Churches. Thus, my fellow tourists, don't misjudge the other Catholic churches. I would gladly donate, if I'm asked to donate. But do not force me to donate and don't frown if I cannot satisfy your greed.
Fantastic panorama. Well worth going up in the lifts for a 360 degree panorama of Budapest. Beautiful church.
Historical delight. Nothing left to say all good, although having to pay to photograph St Stephen's hand seemed excessive

Dont miss aa visit. This dome has the interior and decorations you will not be ecpecting to see anywhere else. Fantastic! Dont miss the chance to walk up the 302 stairs to the top for à spectacular view over the city. A must when you visit Budapest.

Waw!. Very beautiful! Huge and the contract is very big at the square. The history behind it very interesting. We were told that it is not really a basilica but because when the Pope came to visit he said What a beautiful basilica! So since then its called a basilica.
high light. not to be missed go to a concert they are only one hour and you can get a ticket on the day of concert

Amazing. Make this a part of your visit - well worth seeing, absolutely amazing
Definitely walk up the tower, views are well worth it
breathless!. Get a guided tour,so much to admire both interior and exterior.....a very brerathtaking experience and amust visit stop in budapest
Beautiful. We quickly went into the Basilica, as mass was ongoing when we were there. It's just one Euro to get in, so definitely worth the fee. It's beautiful and in a stunning part of the city.
Impressive. Impressive, highly decorated interior. Try to have low value notes with you as there is a "suggested donation" of 200HUF enforced by blokes in black cloaks!

Beautiful. The older man who operates the lift for the treasury room is so nice. He gave us a guided tour using his broken english and was very funny, polite and honest!
The church itself is exquisite and night photos outside are a must!

Magnifient cathedral. This cathedral trumphed my expectations. One of the most beautiful neoclassistic churches I have seen. Both exterior and inside simply georgious. Stunning view from the top. Close to the top: Interesting exhibition about communists pursuing catholic priests after World war II.

One of the essential visits in Budapest. It is not easy to miss the Basilica standing at a height of 96m, the same as that of the parliament, and was built from 1851-1905 and I visited at about 10am. I did pay a very small entry fee and although I see from other comments that entry is free I do not object to a paying a minimal charge amounting to the equivalent of a few pence to see such a marvellous building. Not long after entering, the Great Organ began to play followed by solos from a soprano and tenor standing high above by the organ pipes. This was quite unexpected and made me wish to to return for a concert.I returned a few days later and took the lift, which takes two stages to reach the top to see the wonderful views. I went to a Friday evening concert, costing HUF4000, with two organists, a soloist and trumpeteer playing 13 major works and was well worth hearing.

One star? Play nice, Michelin!. This hugh basilica surpassed my expectations, considering the Michelin Guides grants it just one star. The facade is simple, but the interior surprises with its colossal dimensions. The mosaic cupola and the main altar are beautiful. The Sacred Hand Chapel is very much publicized, but only for the relic significance, for it has no architectural value.
Good views!. Great experience with some lovely views of the city. There are lifts for the less mobile but there can be queues (particularly if there is a school trip like when I was there).

Breathtaking. The Basilica is breathtaking, so beautifully decorated with stunning stained glass windows. It is worth paying the very small amount to go up to the dome, the views across Budapest are fantastic.

Beautiful basilica, the entrance is free!. The architecture in St. Stephen's Basilica is amazing, inside you can find the hand of Saint Stephen and the entrance is free. If you want to go at the treasury or on the top of the basilica, you must pay a few hundreds of forints.

Beautiful. We sat outside a lovely cafe bar admiring this building and were lucky enough to witness a concert there, we walked around this building and there is so much to see if you love architecture and beautiful buildings.
Do not pay...its free. Amazing architecture, and it's free you do not have to pay despite what the priests at the door say.
Beautiful building. We were not able to enter the church because they were preparing for a concert in the evening. We were sorry that we missed it.

Good Church worth a visit. Only time I have been up a dome of a church in Europe via a lift, so anyone can get to see the view. Amazing gilt ornate church indside which is worth spending time in to contemplate!

Very ornate - and underneath a great art show. The Cathedral has one of the most ornamented interiors I've seen. Every surface is decorated. And lots of visitors - after all its one of Budapests top 10 attractions.Most visitors miss the undercroft however. Entry is vai a further outsdie door. Currently there is a (free) show of contemporary religious art in various formats. Well worth a look, upstairs and down.
Stunning.. We attended Sunday high mass and it was an amazing experience, the choir and music outstanding.Another must see for Budapest!
Great place. to be out side it is very nice , but when you get closer you will be surprised

Entering the psyche of Hungary. A must for any visitor to Budapest is St Stephens Basillica, the largest church in the country, named for the first King and Saint of Hungary. It is a relatively new building dating from the late 19th century and contains the relic of the King, i.e. his mumified right hand. Visiting in June, the Basilica was full of tourists, which makes it a little less easy to enjoy, and many of these are clumped together in groups listening to the various guiding options for the venue.

Didn't get to see the hand. I've seen one too many cathedrals. So, they don't usually make too much impact on me, but I did want to see the hand. It is nice inside and maybe another time I would go to the top to see the view (the cathedral and parliament are the highest buildings in Pest at 96m). But this visit was disappointing. We were shuffled in and were told it was open, so we paid the entrance only to find that most of the cathedral was roped off (including the mummified hand of St. Stephen), so we didn't get to see much. If you go make sure that you are able to walk around otherwise it's not so great.

Impressive - go and see the hand. I've visited a lot of churches and cathedrals so I wouldn't normally have gone out of my way to visit them but I wanted to check out St Stephen's mummified hand in the chapel at the back.This church is actually worth popping into even if you've visited a million churches before - I was still pretty impressed.The hand at the back was actually quite underwhelming - just looked like a rotted piece of wood in a gold and glass box. Good story though.

A sumptuous interior. St. Stephen's is not very big compared to other European Cathedral's, but it's interior decor & artwork beat many of those same cathedrals by a mile...truly sumptuous. I don't think I've seen more gold gilding anywhere else.

Stunning decor and excellent views from the top. Well worth a look around, paying to go up the tower is a must. The views are stunning from the top - there is a lift if you need it... it is quite a walk to the top, although it is in 2 stages so there is resting time and an exhibition halfway up.
St. Stephen's Basilica. Very, very beautiful - worth visiting. Remember to go to the chapel and the viewing platform
Hokey. How bizarre to enter a cathedral and find that if you pay extra you can see the mummified hand of a saint!
Beautiful Basillica. If you want a panoramic view then there is a lift to the top of this famous church
Gorgeous. donations taken to enter, free concert at night. Nice square around it. A must see.
Under Rennovation. This place I am sure is really nice but 80% of it is under rennovation. I am not sure its worth going in now but you should go to The Fisherman's Basin.
Beautiful. Worth checking out, both inside and out. Bonus: Starbucks nearby.
great view. be sure to go to the top - a bit of a climb. A nice panoramic view of the city
Interesting. Very ornate. Worth a visit and a short walk from Lord Apartments where I stayed.
Fabulous church. We had a guide who added a lot of info such as the background on the mummified hand of St Stepehn (not as morbid as it sounds). Even without that, the interior is fantastic.

Beautiful. Pennies to get in, interior is AMAZING. Looked to be freshly restored. I was there on a weekend and while there were plenty of other people, it's a big enough place where you won't feel crowded.

Dead Man's Hand. The Basilica of Szent Istvan, the first king of Christian Hungary, is a beautiful neo-Classical building whose dome is one of Budapest's most famous architectural landmarks. The Basilica dominates the square in which it sits, and is full of fascinating details, from frescoes to altars to the mummified right hand of Szent Istvan himself. In the spring and fall visitors are also permitted to climb the dome. Orchestral and organ concerts are often held here. It's a peaceful and relaxing experience to attend one of these events. The details are often advertised outside the church almost any time.
Amazing. What a beautiful church. We were lucky enough to hear operatic singers practising which made it all the more worthwhile.
Beautiful place. great for people watching, good wine place around (Divino).
Impressive. Beautiful Basilica with an impressive dome... A have to visit when in Budapest.

Visit the terrace around the dome. A very beautiful church to visit but you must visit the terrace at the top for magnificent views over the city of Budapest in all directions. It costs 500 Florints to visit the terrace and it's truly worth it. We took the lift rather than climb the 300 plus stairs (even with the lift there are some stairs to climb though so may not be suitable for disabled people.) Inside the church there is creepy relic on display - the mummified hand of Hungary's first king. We didn't have the coins to operate the light which illuminates the hand so didn't see it very clearly - we weren't too disappointed at that though!
Walk the 308 steps to the top for a great view. Good to see the roof tops of Budapest , only cost 200 Forints, need to be fit to go up the steps!
Enjoyed the concert. The evening organ concert with violinist, trumpet, plus a tenor and soprano performing classical music's "greatest hits" was very enjoyable and relaxing.
Amazing construction. The place is huge and is a jewel of architecture. The details are amazing and the square in front of it is also very beautiful.

The holy right -- King Istvan's mummified hand. Its central draw is a bizarre artifact. Hungary's first king's mummified hand has been on display again since it was returned from the US. Unfortunately there is not much useful historical background and you have to feed the light to be able to see it clearly. It is, however, still worthwhile and interesting.
go up the tower. got there just as it closed, but want to see it in more detail if i go back. have been told the lift up the tower is worth doing

Listen to the birds singing.... Can you belive that you actually can hear the birds sing, when you sit at the stair on this Basilica. Just on the other side you have all the noicy traffic. This is a place to relax at. Go inside and find out more. It´s absolutely wort every forint. If there is a wedding taking place, stop and listen to the big organ playing.

Excellent views across Budapest. For 500 Forints I walked to the top of this Basilica where you can take in a full 360 degree view of Budapest. As one of the tallest buildings, and in the centre of the city, you can look over the whole city from the top after climbing the 300 or so spiral stairs. There are some lifts but some stair climbing is still required.
Amazing. Great, amazing - religious relic on public display. Great view from the top too!
you must visit inside. Amazing church.The panoramic view of Budapest from the top is fantastic.Must go inside is excellent.

Must go inside. Initially said "shall we bother going in? All Cathedrals end up looking the same once you've seen a few" After giving it a go felt really ignorant as was amazed at the beauty of it. Just wished we had managed to attend one of the musical performances which they put on some evenings as I would imagine it would be really special in such a setting.

The "Holy Right Hand" is a key attraction here. Once my husband read about St. Stephen's mummified hand in the small chapel here, we had to go. The church itself is incredibly ornate and beautiful, but the small chapel to the left of the altar holds the "Holy Right," as it's called. It's in a special bejewelled miniature cathedral on a platform for viewing. 200 HUF turns on the light for 2 minutes so you can see it. Wait for a tour guide to pay, as one will surely come along during your visit.
Must do: Sit at a cafe in view of St Stephens basilica. Make sure you go at sunset, the Basilica starts to be illuminated gradually by a soft hue of blue/purple and looks amazing on a still night.
A marble masterpiece. The church is amazing, and we had the extra treat of visiting when there was a concert performance by a choir of young people.
Must see attraction. Lovely view from the rooftop, try to get there early as gets busy later in the day

Beautiful. If you want to know where the collection plate money went, look no further... ;) The interior of the Basilica is opulent. The panoramic view of Budapest from the top is fantastic and it even has an elevator if you don't feel like hoofing it up the stairs. They were having a wedding when we went so we unfortunately didn't get to see Stephen's mummified hand... Oh well, c'est la vie...
Really lovely building, like London's St Pauls Cathedral. Go in and donate only 200 fts, you can take photos, awesome interior, go see at night too when it is lit up outside.

Amazing!. Climb to the viewing platform of the Basilica for amazng views over Budapest, then take a well-earned break in one of the many pavement bar/restaurants and indulge in some 'people watching'. Beautiful during the day and absolutely stunning at night, when the whole building is lit up.
Beautiful interior. We were very lucky and an actual ceremony was taking place so we had the chance to hear the organ.

Fab weddings!. Couldn't go in because there were two weddings - one after the other but lovely to sit in a cafe and watch the procedings and all the family photos being taken. We will go back and see the Basilica.
Beautiful. Especialy as they have cleaned the building truly beautiful
Wow!. It is the most beautiful church/basilica i have eaver seen and i have seen some! Rome blah blah but this is lovely and the square next to it has some great cafes/restaurants

Beautiful. This church is stunning! Small fee to enter; and we also paid extra to take the elevator to the top (and then of course another set of stairs). The view was excellent. Worth the time and money.

One of the most beautiful churches I've seen. It really is gorgeous, inside and out.
Try to go to one of the frequent evening concerts - I believe they are on several times a week. It's a great experience and not expensive.
Yet another amazing building !!. I promise you, you will be spoiled for choice in this fantastic friendly city, make the most of it, one visit is just not enough.
nice, well maintained. Very pretty, we actually didn't plan to go there, just walked by and got in, but its a nice church and beautifully decorated.

on of the most rich decorated one's we saw. Perhaps it is because it is the largest and most important Christian house in Hungary, theinside is lots of gold, Marble et cetera.Costs for entrance are only 200 ft p/p when we were there(we read something else in other reports/guides). You even can co up to the top of the domeand walk around the dome and have a perfect view of the city, only that's very busy and we didn't do that. On the square in front of the basilica you'll meet some beggars and cripple asking for money.

Spectacular views from top. Be prepared to give a donation - 200 forints - on entry but well worth the money. Trip up to top well worth the money. Apart from the views there is an exhibition of martyred priests from German and Communist occupation
A wonderful church. This was worth the visit the Hungarians were very wealthy
I still hear the organ concert!. Impressive Basilica dominating the promenade to the Danube. It came to life when I entered in time for an organ concert.
Awesome. This church literally inspires awe. It is a beautiful historical site that you must see in Budapest.
beautiful. pay 200 HUF to go inside and you'll see a beautiful church. we went to a concert of classical and religious music (6500 HUF each) and it was a touching experience
a don't miss in Budapest. The interior is magnificent and don't miss the view of the city up from the balcony

Very Impressive Church. Well worth a short visit. This large Basilica Church is very impressive, elegant, and well worth a short visit. I am happy to give donations to house of worship, but felt it was a bit insulting to have a rep. of the 'staff' watching to make sure we gave our 'donation'.
But the edifice is quite impressive.
great view - a must. make sure you go up to the top the view is stunning

Impressive, beautiful interior but not ideal acoustics for concerts. St Stephen's Basilica is easily reached in downtown Pest with lots of restaurants, cafes and bars nearby. The square in front is usually busy and is quite lively at night. The interior of the Basilica is ornately decorated and, with the large dome, impressive. It is well worth visiting in its own right and usually only a small donation is requested. It is also used as a concert venue and here visitors should be aware that acoustically it is not ideal (the acoustics in St Michael's Church are better) though the grandeur of the venue itself does compensate to a degree. Concert tickets can cost up to 48 Euros each (at time of writing) though we found that they were half price if you had already booked a (cheaper) concert at St Michael's. Concerts in these series tend to be well enough played, but aimed firmly at tourists and short, typically 70 minutes.

Beautiful church and surrounding area. We paid to go inside the church, only to discover it was undergoing an extensive renovation. We were not disappointed, however, in what we did see. Would love to see it when it's done.
Very big!. Lovely to cool down if the heat outside is high! They push you for donation as you enter, impressive. But not my taste.
Nice. This was a nice church in the center area of Pest. In a small square.

A museum-quality cathedral. Those who like posh style will not be disappointed with its rare materials and rich decorations. One of the highlights of the trip, but come in a daylight for more lighting.

Impressive. Like so much else in Budapest, this church dates to the end of the 1800's. Style is thus predictable, but lavishly executed. I don't know if we just got lucky, but there was a large children's orchestra and choir practicing during our visit. If you go and can time your visit to coincide with some kind of musical performance, you will enjoy it doubly.
A commanding Basilica - worth a quick visit. We found the inside of great interest, particilarly the nave. The publicity talked about views from the dome, but these did not seem to be available
Fantastic views. The views from the walls were fantastic and the Basilica itself was beautiful
being rebuilt. being reconstructed everything covered in plastic sheets

Impressive!. Very commanding basilica in "downtown" Budapest. Interesting because it doesn't actually face the street but a large courtyard in the back. Definitely check out the wine bar that is just outside the church. This place spills out on the courtyard on a nice weekend evening.

worth the climb. A beautiful church! We did have to pay a small "donation" to enter but these giant churches need to get revenue somehow. We climbed to the top and watched the sunset. Beautiful views! Interesting history in this place.Took over 50 yrs to build, dome collapsed and they started over, 3 architects were required as they died off due to the length of the project. Church was used to house important artworks and documents during WWII as it was considered very sturdy. Was heavily damaged by war bombings and has just recently been restored (delay due to soviet occupation).

Worth a visit. A beautiful place with fantastic architecture. Worth a look inside (free, although there's a donations box for upkeep).Arrive before 5pm so you can go up for a walk around the top (there is a fee for this) to take in the views.Also have a look at it from Castle Hill as you don't appreciate quiet how big it is from up close.

must visit. You have to visit St. Stephen's Basilica is one of the most impressing buildings in Budapest. I recomend to access the dome by elevators or by climbing 364 stairs for a 360° view overlooking Budapest. It's perfect
Definitely go to the top. Affordable and worth it. (Elevator available.) The 360 view is the best!
Rokoko. Barock churches are a genre in themselves.... You need to be open-minded when you're accustomed to Gothic churches. Very rich.

Very good concert, just not what advertised. We booked a concert at this church thru Classictic.com. Actually we booked several concerts thru them. We really enjoyed the concert, excellent string ensemble. Take a coat, it is cold in the church. My only negative is with Classictic.com. The picture on their website and ticket shows a 16 piece orchestra called Duna String Orchestra. That is the name of the orchestra who played the concert, but it has only 7 members. Not certain why they would advertise an orchestra over 100% larger than it is.

Have to pay to enter. very nice church but you are requiered to give a "donation" of at least 1€. inside you can see the hand of St Stephen´s (mumified). But to see it properly or take a photo with ligth you also have to pay...
Amazing. Beautifully amazing building full of religious history and iconography
nice and impressive. Nice and impressive interior, great view if you can handle the heights....
Beautiful!. This is a lovely church with stunning ceilings. I would recommend skipping the tower if it's cloudy out, though. We paid the money and walked up the stairs, but could barely see anything.
St Stephen's. Huge and beautiful. Luckily there is a lift to the top to enjoy the view.

Overwhelmingly decorated.. You have to donate a bit of money before you can enter the church. Once you get inside, there are so many tourists swarming the place. If you just look at the architecture alone, this is such a lovely place. Ignore the people and just sit on the benches and observe your surroundings. Really beautiful architecture. The only disappointing thing is that it has become too touristy inside. Some people have no common sense at all and behaved as if they were in a fish market. Even though I'm not religious or anything, I think it's basic and common courtesy to behave yourself a bit in a place where it's deemed so. Definitely check it out! They hold organ concerts here once in a while, if you're lucky AND interested of course, you should see if you can attend one!

Monumental. Well, exception from usually smaller Budapest architectonic treasures. Monumental basilica with nice interior. I recommend to buy tickets into small treasury room. There is friendly old man, who tries to guide you. His english isnt perfect, but with help of hands, russian and german we managed to fill blank english words :) And he is really willing to show you everything and explain everything.
a beautiful church. this church was lovely. i had heard it would be and was not dissappointed!
oppulent. it always stuns me how the glory of the churches and the expense of them. When traveling in eastern Europe/or should that be in Europe--the churches are amazing in their grandeur
impressive. i've been to a lot of churches and this one still impressed me.
Stunning!. Beautiful and well-worth the visit inside, this basilica in the heart of Budapest is breathtaking
what can you say. We were able to attend a mass. It is so beautiful!!!!

We went to mass here. Just don't make noise in the Church during service, the priest got a little hot under the collar! people sightseeing should respect that this is a church and some people want to be able to pray.
